review_body: We had a lovely room with sea view from balcony plenty of room Very clean lovely location pool area lovely sun beds not most comfortable Reception staff extremely helpful thank you Christina Breakfast was varied
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back after spending a week here with friends. We were greeted by a really nice guy Alex who checked us in very quickly. He took us to our room and showed us everything in it. We stayed in a Delux studio with whirlpool. Fab room with loads of room for the 3 of us. The following morning we went for breakfast and met the daytime receptionist called Christina, what a fantastic person she is, nothing was too much for her to do. Anything she was asked about she could answer. Total credit to the hotel. We left as friends not customers. In the dining room there was a lady called Katrina and she was just so lovely. Will be back one day. Thanks to all of you for making our holiday memorable.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, small with very friendly staff. Must mention the 2 lovely ladies that kept our room looking clean. All on reception are very helpful and friendly, can't wait to visit again. Hotel is across the road from the beach with plenty of taverns and restaurants within a 10 minute walk.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a weeks holiday, we were met by Alex around 10.30pm, he was extremely polite and helpfull, showed us to our room which, although basic, had tv, a fridge and aircon. The king sized bed was very comfortable, and the room was very clean and fresh. We were greeted by Christina at breakfast next morning who was equally helpfull and very cheerfull every day, nothing was too much of a problem and gave us very good advice regarding day trips etc.The pool area was well looked after and the bar area was clean with great staff, the menu was small but always freshly made, the bar closed at 10.30pm which added to the tranquility of the hotel. If we have one niggle, it is that the loungers were wooden and could probably do with replacing, still thats a small thing. The pool towels were free and the beach was directly across the road with free loungers for hotel guests, all in all a nice and peaceful hotel.The location of this hotel was excellent, out of the hotel turn right and 10-15 mins there are restaurants and bars, also the local bus stop, turn left 10-15 mins more bars and restaurants leading to Perissa which was more busy. Take care on the roads though as there are no pavements and flows both ways past the hotel, however, around 15 mins towards Perissa they have a pedestrianised area from 2pm where the majority of the restaurants and bars are.There are water sports available, jet ski, diving etc. As well as on beach facilities for food and drink from the bars and restaurants. We particularly enjoyed a small cafe called Chocolat, they did great food ans amazing crepes, huge crepes made fresh to order, I strongly recommend this place. When you get to the main road through Perissa call in to Dorians bar, excellent food and the drinks are more reasonable here than almost anywhere else, plays good music too.We visited Fira and Oia which although picturesque, were realy crouded with cruise ship tourists, glad we never stayed there as way too busy but equally glad we visited both places, be prepared for rude bus drivers and ticket collectors rushing you on and off the buses, and a very disorganised bus station. The air port is small and equally hap hazard.So to summarise, hotel was brilliant for whar we wanted, a nice quiet chill out holiday, located almost perfectly not to close or too far from anything you need, will definitely be returning agian.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room we had, although clean on the surface smelt fusty and old. We think this was coming from under the sink. The bathroom was poorly finished, with holes in the ceiling cracked tiles. The outdoor jacuzzi was nice, however again poorly finished - there was dirt around the edges of the tiles which was a little unsightly. Overall we were disappointed with the the standard of the room after the reception and pool area was so lovely. We had a lovely week though, didn't spend much time in the room. The staff were friendly and welcoming. I would return but would not expect to pay as much.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right on the beach , great swimming pool , the beach is a little bit rocky . Situated at about 5-10 minutes walking distance to the bus stop . The services at the reception desk is excellent , the room has a balcony . My air conditionning doesnt work properly , and the bathroom is outdated with a tiny old shower . The breakfast is very so-so.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I travelled to Atlantis Beach Villa with TUI on 18th September 2018 for two weeks. We have had several holidays recently with TUI and have always been pleased with their care and organisation. This hotel is in a great location and our room on the 2nd floor was very nicely decorated. Sadly the water storage is heated by solar panels (20) of them for 44 rooms and just could not cope with the demand. During the whole two weeks we were there we had no more than luke warm water. Surprisingly there was a kettle in our room - no mugs, coffee or tea bags - and that was the only way I was able to obtain some hot water to wash. Very difficult to shower. The mechanic was called to our room and managed to obtain some hot water in the middle of the day! We had been advised by the Receptionist to run the tap for at least 10 or 15 mins. This was not acceptable and not successful. Our rep was not terribly interested and just told me she had no water at all where she was staying. (Not very helpful). The staff at this hotel are very helpful and friendly and its a pity that the hotel management cannot address this problem. The Island of Santorini is good to explore and if you can cope with the chaos at the bus terminus, the public buses are useful and a cheap way of travelling. The Greeks are such friendly happy people and despite their economic problems, rely on tourism and olive oil production to survive.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm easy welcome, lovely clean room with outdoor area beautiful flowers. All amenities nice hot shower. Room cleaned every day. Lovely friendly staff. Central to everything. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was nice. So easy and chilled the whole week was very relaxed and romantic. Going back next year
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for my partner and I due to its location mainly, a 5-10 minute walk each way to various bars and restaurants etc and directly overlooking the beach. It didn’t disappoint in these regards- a stones throw from the beach and in a prime location to explore what else was around.The hotel itself was small but pretty ( I would say one of the more attractive looking hotels we had seen around the area) and it was very clean.The room was definitely very basic on the inside- it had everything you needed and nothing you didn’t. I initially felt a little disappointed with the amount I’d spent on the hotel to what we were actually getting for our money however, I think it is generally overpriced in Santorini, not just our hotel. The bed was not very comfortable at all but the rest of the room was fine- I understand from previous reviews what people meant about the shower/ shower curtain sticking to you but it wasn’t really a problem once you figured out how best to stand and the shower pressure was good.The pool was beautiful but we only swam in it once. This was probably my biggest issue with the hotel- people hogging sunbeds!! In the morning people seemed to get up early and put their towels on the beds to ‘reserve’ them for when they were ready to use them. By breakfast time, they were all taken but mainly by towels, not people. (And we never saw more than 2 people maximum in the pool at one time so that wasn’t why!)This happened everyday we were there and was never stopped by the hotel which was disappointing. I feel measures should definitely be in place to prevent people doing this as it really does affect your overall experience. Breakfast was again tasty but basic. Each day, the same food served. This would have been nice to have been altered slightly each day or every other day and I personally would have liked to see more fresh fruit options. I expected to eat breakfast at the seating area pictured on their website however it is not there, you eat in a small shaded table area at the entrance to the hotel so no beach view etc for this.Again, I feel it would have been nice to have the option to eat breakfast at the otherwise unoccupied bar area during that time so you could enjoy the view/have a bit more room.The beach area was lovely. With the hotel we had free use of their beach sunbeds which was great as otherwise there is a cost to use these in other areas along the beach. The beach area in front of the hotel was well maintained and the bar staff were attentive in checking if you wanted any drinks brought to you etc. The staff were friendly and helpful. The receptionist organised us two taxis to the winery which was very useful as apparently taxis in the area are extremely rare/hard to organise yourself. The maids were lovely, always smiling and did a great job and the bar staff were also pleasant.One final mention was the spa treatments we had there. The massuese was fantastic!! She was so knowledge in her field and had wonderful pressure. We had a back massage each and felt relaxed but also worked on with our tension areas. Highly recommend booking a massage there.Overall a good stay, definitely not the best hotel I’ve ever stayed at by any means but, probably one of the better hotels you can stay at in Santorini and if I ever stayed in Santorini again, I would likely book this hotel again due to the positives outweighing the negatives overall.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from our one week holiday Atlantis Beach Villa. First impressions was a very pretty, well maintained hotel with lovely grounds, pool and bar area. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I requested an upper floor, some months ago on booking. Our first disappointment was when we were shown to our room it was at the back of the hotel on the lower level basement. We were in the corner, no view and no sun. (may suit some when its hot) Most of all, we had a small high window with mesh and when open we could see people in the car park above who could equally see in if the light was on. We were only there for a week so we did'nt want to cause a fuss by asking to be moved. The room was dingy, however there were door windows but not ideal when taking a nap or getting changed so we had the curtains partially closed. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms cleaned everyday. The towels, i'm sorry to say were awful, although changed regularly they had a horrid smell. I am aware that biological powders cant be used. I used my own swimming towel to shower. The sunbed's!!.. I booked the hotel mainly for the lovely pool. We used it just once at 6pm! Everyday people got up early put their towels on the beds and went for breakfast!! or lunch. This was so irritating. It was definitely not just the Germans it was the British as well. Our friends at another hotel said people trying to do that at their hotel couldn't because the hotel did not allow it. I really think this problem should be stopped and i don't know why people are so selfish, we all pay to use the pool. The beach sunbed's were very comfortable and barely anyone using them. Free by the way with the hotel pass and beautiful and relaxing. We could'nt go in the sea as we are not strong swimmers and it shelved quite quickly. The location was ideal and easy to get around the island by bus. It was very quiet regards holiday makers in Parissa but places on the caldera were extremely busy with the cruise ships! Lovely food lovely weather. Sadly for us the things we did'nt like took the edge off of what could have been an amazing holiday.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just come back from a 2 week stay. Great hotel, just enough out of the heart of Perissa but close enough just a short 5 minute walk to restaurants. Hotel staff were so friendly especially at the So Good but So Food restaurant. Very clean and comfortable. However the shower was the tiniest shower I’ve ever come across with a shower curtain that clings to you throughout your shower. When we got there the shower was merely a trickle but after day 2 though the shower head was changed (thank you) making it great, despite the shower curtain still clinging to you. Would definitely stay here again despite the minuscule shower! Pop along to Sea La Vie bar (turn left out of the hotel) such a great little bar with funny, welcoming hosts.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Atlantis Beach Villa is a perfect destination for someone who want to relax and spend a great time. The first thing that made me impressed is the behavior of the staff, from the recepsionists to the bar and the cleaners! Each one of them were smiling and ready to help every customer. Especially i really liked Mrs. Christina (she was the morning recepsionist) Secondly, the beach is in front of the hotel (which has also a swimming pool). Rooms were very clean and modern. In conclusion, this hotel was one of the best, if not the best, choice for my holidays this year. I'm looking forward to be there again. It is important to mention that Perivolos is a quiet area, if we compare it with Fira or Oia, which combines also great night life with lots of restaurants and bars.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Α perfect destination for someone who wants to relax and enjoy a great holiday. The rooms are really clean and the staff really kind and helpful. Remarkable is that it's near the sea so you have the choice between the sea and the pool. These holidays will stay forever in my mind. Αt the end I highly recommend it!
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful clean accommodation in a really well placed area for both Perivolos and Perissa. Plenty of restaurants, watersports, beautiful scenery and cleab clear water for swimming and snorkelling. You do have to go out fairly deep to be able to see sealife.The staff were really helpful and polite and remember your drinks the next day which shows excellent customer service. The rooms were very clean and were cleaned everyday without fail, a little on the small side, but you don't spend much time in the room. I would totally recommend staying here.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This smallish hotel is perfect .. it's placed in the middle of all the restaurants and bars .Rooms as said in previous reviews are basic but for us it was ideal and most importantly it was spotless and cleaned everyday .The pool is amazing and plenty of sunbeds to go round .Breakfast is really good enough there to set you up for the day .Food from the bar is excellent and cooked by a woman called Larysa she also works on the bar for a few hours .Bar prices I think are ok I read reviews before I arrived and were expecting really high prices but most prices for beer is roughly the same .I personally would like to thank the guys who work the bar they work extremely hard and always have time to answer any questions you might have , these guys work the beach , bar and pool and never seem to stop ... so to George , Mike , mario and George ( Sorry about spelling ) you guys made my holiday and sent us to some good places to take pictures .Ivan who greeted us when we arrived and the lady who works on reception in the daytime thank you for making us feel welcome .So all in all the hotel is small friendly amazing pool rooms spotless and the staff are the best that I have ever encountered on a holiday and for that reason I will be back in May 2019 .Thank you all the staff for an amazing holiday
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok so the rooms are pretty basic and some might say indeed of modernizing. I couldn't fault them, after all I just shower,change and sleep in there. This said the only reason it doesn't get 5* is purely down to the fact it has shower curtains and the shower was tiny,so the blooming thing constantly stuck to you. In the end we didn't use it,but then the floor got soaked ( first world problems hey)The pool area is lovely and the staff are so polite, helpful and welcoming. I would definitely stop here again as you are bang in the middle of all the shops and restaurants.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned after a nice week at this hotel. On arrival and being shown the room, the first impression was it needed a revamp as it was looking tired but it was clean and tidy so was ok. The room had a free safe, kettle and hairdryer and tv that was really unwatchable due to the poor reception and air con which worked well. Plenty of sunbeds around the pool which were taken early but beach sunbeds were available through the the day. Prices at the hotel are very expensive as is the theme throughout the island although if you go to the main road the prices are a little cheaper. Hotel staff are really nice and helpful and the ladies who cleaned are lovely.Getting around is simple as all buses go to Thira and from there you can change buses to wherever you want to go.We enjoyed our stay as it is a beautiful island but won't return as there are lots of other palaces to visit.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent a week here. Hotel and surrounding pool area are very clean. Our room had a small balcony, but good size twin beds, there is a fridge and kettle provided as well as Air con and safe (free of charge). Our bathroom had the usual flappy curtain, but the lip to the shower just about caught the water so it didn't flood the floor too much, always plenty of hot water with good pressure. The room was cleaned every day.Breakfast was very tasty and lots of choice but the buffet area is quite small and you can get in one anothers way. Pool area had comfy sunloungers and the pool itself was lovely and clean but a bit cold. There was a small amount of towel reserving the beds but we used the beach too which belongs to the Hotel. A pool towel is provided but you need to use your own for the beach.As been reported it is black sand so Hot, sea clean but freezing ! Plenty of good choice or Tavernas nearby and bars that sell large beer for 2 Euro, Hotel it was 4 Euro.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like a lot of Greek hotels, first impression is of an attractive building in need of a little money to be spent on it. By day three the charm of the smiling staff has overtaken any concerns. These are not smiles for the tourists, they are sincere and honest.The pool needs better access, the sunbeds are a bit creaky, our bathroom had no room to swing a cat but we awoke to a view of the sea before spending a lazy day relaxing by the pool or on the beach where Georgios, Mario, another Georgos or Mikealis (, sorry for the spelling), would serve drinks and snacks where you lay. Christina and Alex also need a big thanks for their hospitality.Try the Greek cider, it really is quite good.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very cozy motel. The rooms are spacious and the one we stayed in had a private balcony overlooking the pool and with a view of the beach. The breakfast is very good with eggs, meats, fruit, and cereal. The black beach is across the street. Wifi on the beach is convenient for listening to music and surfing the Internet. The motel has beds and umbrellas for guests. The black sand gets very hot in the Summer. Stay on the white wooden paths. Also, water shoes provide protection from the hot sand and the rocky ocean. There are archaeological sites on the island and the museums are not to be missed.Get up early and watch the sunrise. In the evening go to the other side of the island and watch the sunset. I have been to Santorini several times. I find it is the most relaxing place I have been to so far.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The wife and I booked a week self catering, and at the end of the week wished we had booked for ever. The atmosphere at the apartments and in fact the whole resort was so relaxed that you really did feel that you had been on holiday.The entire staff were fantastic and so friendly. We purchased breakfast every morning and we were set up for the day. It wasn't too busy and there was always plenty of sun beds. The masseuse was likewise fantastic.Absolutely loved the accommodation and the resort and would recommend it to anyone. In fact I already have done several times.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks, and after reading some of the good reviews was really looking forward to the stay. We arrived late but checking in was relatively quick and the lovely staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice, quite small and basic but had a lovely balcony/terrace area with deck chairs. We had booked our stay to include breakfast, so not sure if this was the reason why, but our room didn't have a kitchen area (just a fridge) and for a 2 week stay we weren't too happy with this so we asked to swap rooms. This was no problem, and once again the staff were extremely helpful and gave us a choice of 2 other rooms. Sadly they were both in the annex, which was a small building set away from the main hotel - however the rooms were so much bigger. It also wasn't as 'pretty' as the main hotel, nevertheless we opted for a lovely top floor room with an upstairs bedroom and large sitting/kitchen room and corner balcony downstairs. We were much happier staying here, and in the end it didn't matter so much that we weren't in the main hotel, it was much quieter too. During our stay we had a lovely time here. Location was great - bus stop a walkable distance away, and bars/restaurants a short walk in either direction. Also being located right beside the beach it was great to chose between the pool or the sea. The hotel provides towels for the pool which is great, and sun beds on the beach were free for hotel users! Inside reception there was also a load of books that guests could borrow/swap - I read 3! Finally breakfast - this was ok. There was quite a fair bit of choice, although mainly cold options and quite sugary. It's a self service 'buffet' style, but the room it is set up in is quite small, with everything situated in one corner of the room so it does get very busy/crowded, and it can take a while to get everything you want..especially waiting for the toaster! All in all we very much enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return. Lovely hotel, great location and wonderful staff!
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely small hotel with wonderful people working in it. From the moment we got there, the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. We had a fabulous stay and enjoyed every moment. We learnt a few Greek words to get around not that we needed to since everyone spoke perfect English. We were right on the beach just were you want to be on holiday.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the most incredible holiday we have had as a big family and credit to that has to be given to this hotel! The staff were amazing and went out of their way to accommodate us! From the front of house staff to the restaurant/bar staff and the cleaners! Will 100% be back!
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our recent stay here was nothing short of perfection. The location is perfect with just a road separating you from the beach which has plenty of comfy beach beds free to guests. The pool is lovely and again no need to secure it with a towel at sunrise!!The rooms are simple but spotlessly cleaned and towels changed every day. As with most hotels the buffet breakfast could be a tad chaotic but the food was adequate and plentiful. What sets the bar is the staff. They are all friendly, happy and so helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. I totally recommend this hotel and hopefully we will be back!
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel just on the outskirts of Perivolos on the Perissa side. The pool is beautiful and immaculately kept. There's a great bar where you can get reasonably priced drinks and snacks. Music plays all day but softly in the background. Great cocktails too :) The breakfast area is a bit small and got busy but the food was great and there was lots of it. Fresh bread every day, cheese and meat, yogurt, fruit, pastries and a coffee machine. The ladies who kept it stocked up were super friendly. Our room was disappointing - No. 41. It's kind of underground so like a tunnel with no windows, just in the door. We had to keep the curtains on the door closed if we were changing as otherwise people could see in. It looked nothing like the photos in the Thomson website. There were a couple of cracks in the tiles in the bathroom and a rusty toilet holder but these were minor problems. I just felt it fair to mention as we feel we overpaid through Thomson. See the photos of the room. The beds were made every day and I think clean pillow cases provided. Outside the room was swept daily as well. Ask for one of the higher up rooms. We did have a Jacuzzi outside the room which was good but cold water only (lovely on a really hot day) but it did have ingrained dirt around the edge which was off putting. The hotel was full so we couldn't get moved. There aren't enough loungers by the pool and people were out early claiming theirs with towels and often just leaving them there most of the day. However, the beach is literally across the road and has free loungers and umbrellas. The beach shelves quite a bit but lovely and warm and so clear. If you head out of the hotel and turn right, lots of lovely bars and restaurants. The beach also seems to not shelve as much down that end. Perissa also has loads of fantastic bars and restaurants. So much choice. Despite the disappointment with the room the hotel is great and we would go back again but ask for a different room. Santorini is stunning. We loved every minute of our stay there.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned from a 2 week stay at this excellent hotel. The staff are all lovely nothing is too much trouble, Kristina and Alex on reception are very helpful and informative. Katerina and Angela made sure we had lovely clean rooms and an excellent breakfast with plenty of choice and freshly baked cakes and croissants daily. Mario on the bar was very friendly and helpful and most of all Kristina who served drinks at the pool bar was so lovely and friendly and always had time for a chat with us about where to go and what to see on the island - she is an absolute asset to this hotel as many of the other guests commented.The pool is lovely and no trouble getting a sun bed even in August! The beach is right across the road and turn left or right out of the hotel to find many bars and tavernas. Bus stop more or less outside with buses to Thira and the sunset at Oia. Try Gods Garden taverna its up a side road off the beach but worth a visit as it is very reasonable and a nice family taverna. Also highly recommend the Greek night at Apollon with Greek singing and dancing a great evening! We will definitely return to this excellent little hotel.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would not normally return to a resort twice, but this is actually our 4th stay here. It is one of the nicest, friendliest, best located hotels. Very relaxed atmosphere, no need to get up at sunrise to put your towels out. The rooms are adequate, nice balconies some with sea view, some with a jacuzzi. Very clean and comfortable. Nice buffet breakfast with a range to to suit all. The pool is very clean and not busy or across the road is the beach. A good snack bar too. More deserving praise should be to the location, a short stroll you are into Perissa or turn right you have an abundance of good restaurants.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just returned from an amazing week at this wonderful small and friendly hotel all expectations were exceeded for my husband son and his girlfriend.The rooms are simple, clean with fresh towels everyday. All the staff including cleaning staff make staying at this hotel an absolute delight with their friendly and welcoming way from the moment you sign in at reception and nothing is too much trouble for them to make your stay here enjoyable and relaxing especially Alex and Christina. The pool and sun beds are fab and never too busy throughout the day and the beach is literally across from the hotel. Roula the masseuse is simply wonderful she is very friendly, professional and does the most amazing massages and beauty therapies that restores you in both body and spirit. A must for all which adds to this fantastic experience. Highly recommended and we will definitely be returning next year.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Value for money!!!Close to the beach my balcony was front and every night with some candles, we enjoyed under the stars this fantastic view.During the day you could share your time between sea, wich is a breath from hotel area, and pool.Housekeeper is very professional and we had cleaning perfection.Breakfast fresh and delicious.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As lots of other reviews have stated this hotel is excellent. My girlfriend and I have just returned from a week in Santorini staying at the Atlantis Beach Villa and the whole experience was perfect. The staff were friendly and attentive. The room (we stayed in the deluxe studio with whirlpool) was clean, tidy, spacious and comfortable. The pool area was beautiful and we could always get two sun beds. Even in August there were rarely more than two people in the pool and maybe five or six couples on the sun beds. The location was perfect being right on the beach and very close to a good selection of bars and restaurants. Despite being so close to everything the hotel was quiet and relaxed.All in all a perfect stay in a lovely hotel. Highly recommended and we will definitely be returning in the future.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice location next to the beach with friendly and helpful stuff. The rooms were clean and fresh. The hotel offered us the transfer to and from the airport due to the reservation procedures we followed. They also provided us with a tasty bottle of local white wine because of our honeymoon. The beach next to the hotel was nice and not crowded and the swimming pool was clean. The breakfast could have been better as there was not so much variety for what was offered.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked our trip through Thomson as I was getting married in Santorini and needed somewhere which was reasonably priced and in a location which had something for everyone. Having visited Santorini last year we decided to pick this hotel having had a look around the rooms prior to booking. The staff in particular Alex and Christina were absolutely lovely. They were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. We had a jacuzzi room and in all honesty if I was to go again I would not pay the extra money for this. Yes, it was nice to have our own little courtyard but it really wasn't needed as the pool and beach we perfect for relaxing and we didn't spend anytime in the jacuzzi. The rooms are pleasant but very basic and in all honesty could do with a bit of a revamp. Our room had a handheld shower which wasn't great but on the plus side there was always hot water whatever time you chose to shower. Other rooms did have rain showers which were much better than ours. The rooms were cleaned every day by the cleaners who were again all lovely.My only negative comment about this hotel would be the additional block which 8 of our guests were put in. We assumed that we would all be together in the main hotel, however this was not the case and next to the hotel is an additional building with further rooms. From the road it looks like this building is derelict as it stands alone behind a fence and locked gate. The grass is all dead and it is not pretty as the rest of the hotel is. 6 of the 8 guests staying there were really disappointed, in particular the two couples in the single rooms. They complained about the shower being full of mould with no shower curtain and no tiles on the wall. They felt disappointed that their rooms had cost them the same price as the others who were staying in the main hotel. I think this is something that Thomson need to advertise in their brochure as we did not know this building was part of the hotel until our guests were put there. Having said that we all had a lovely time, I would definitely return but I know others wouldn't.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as part of a large wedding party. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were just what we were after, clean, simple and air conditioned. We had a fridge which was perfect for cooling the water as the weather had been the hottest there for 10 years. The position of the hotel is ideal, it's a 5 minute walk to the restaurants, but far enough away for a perfect nights sleep. The 2 swimming pools are great for kids and adults. A swallow pool for the kids, and a swallow end leading to a deep enough pool for proper adult swimming. The breakfast was basic but was absolutely fine for me and it did change slightly from day to day. I would very happily stay at this hotel again, we intend returning to Santorini in the future and will definitely look at this lovely hotel and hope to return.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did not stay here but had a massage here as we were staying at the Meltemi Suites. The massages were very relaxing and Roula the massust picked us up from our hotel. She was very friendly, welcoming and provided a great service. I would highly recommend. Thanks for a great massage.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These villas are pleasant, clean and functional but a bit removed from the more scenic parts of Oia - about a 20-min walk. There is no restaurant although a breakfast of their choice is served on a tray.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Santorini for our family holiday and stayed at Atlantis Beach Villa.It's right on the sea with its own private beds. The pool is lovely and clean with a pool bar/restaurant offering good food.The one thing that stands out is the staff, they were all so brilliant! So friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Room was simple but adequate for our needs. Lovely 2 weeks enjoyed by us all
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel and it turned out perfect for us :-) We had a terrace garden room, it was so lovely, a pergola strewn with bourgainvillea and a table and chairs where we sat with a glass of wine in an evening. Our room was nice, clean and with an area to make a cuppa. The bathroom wasn't perfect but fine for our needs, just depends on how picky you want to be. Our room was serviced everyday. We had free towels for the poolside and were given free loungers and sun brolly on the beach. The staff are so friendly and so willing to help, just ask them anything and they do their utmost to help and with a smile. One small criticism is the breakfast, it is limited and the same everyday, a little variety would of made all the difference. The beach is literally over the road, its black volcanic tiny pebble sand but the sea was warm and clear for swimming in. Either side of the hotel you have all the amenities you could wish for, water sports, restaurants, shops, local bus stop. We had a fantastic time on Santorini and its so beautiful, if you visit please go to The Santos Winery...the most beautiful place you will ever sit and have a glass of wine :-) Enjoy
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from a two week stay at the Atlantis Beach and I am missing it and the great staff. We had room 1 in the annexe and it was great, it was clean, the bed changed every day, sea view and although the bathroom could do with updating, it was sufficient.Air conditioning good and very welcome ! The pool area is gorgeous, the sun beds plentiful and bar service friendly and efficient.Kristina on reception is very friendly and cannot do enough for you. The Spa was absolutely fabulous and Roula is the most friendly and lovely person who certainly knows her stuff. Breakfast was great with plenty of choice and the breakfast staff (who are also the cleaners) are great especially Katarina who was so bright and cheerful. The restaurants and shops are close by and we tried most of them ! The Acropolis was a favourite with great food and service at a good price. It was a fanatastic holiday with temperatures of 25/26 every day and we wouldn't hesitate to go back in the future.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Read the reviews saw the pics on Thomson website, our room was disappointing to say the least. Our room was in a separate block completely separate from the complex, the bathroom was basically a cupboard! My partner is 6ft 2 and very broad and travelled with a broken elbow, the 'shower' had no wall bracket he couldn't lift his arm above his head, we went to reception they offered another room which was at the back of the complex in a basement, we refused it. Christina was excellent got maintenance to drill a bracket to fix shower to wall but overall bathroom was completely unsuitable, everywhere flooded, it smelt damp, the shower curtain was gross. The spiral stairs again completely unsuitable for a man my partners size, they felt unstable and I can't remember how many times I kicked the settee at the bottom. And he head butted the lamp shade in the bedroom.The view however was stunning, sea view and pool and the only saving grace of this room. All employees were so friendly, pool area lovely beach stunning and santorini is beautiful. Loved my holiday just hated that bathroom and stairs!!! You don't see this on the website so if you get villa 1-7 be wary!! You are outcast from the complex and the building is not in context with the main building, the whole area needs work, garden overgrown and in need of desperate work.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a holiday at Atlantis beach hotel this is a very pleasant hotel in a very good location . The staff are all very friendly and helpful . The rooms are clean and tidy as the maid comes in every day . We asked reception for a kettle in our room and when we came back later that day is was there along with cups and spoons . The pool area is very nice with plenty of sunbeds the Hotel also will supply towels for around the pool which you have to sign for . They also have a lot of sunbeds with umbrellas which are free to hotel guests just get a tag from the bar next to the pool . Breakfast is a buffet and has a good selection of food along with Tea and Coffee and fruit juices all in all a very nice holiday in a great location
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived here with my partner and our daughter and loved the place as soon as we drove along the beach road. The hotel complex is so pretty and we were welcomed by Alex on reception with a drink of sweet wine. - a nice touch.I must admit that first impressions of the room were that it was small and basic but we soon settled and became quite attached to our little beach-hut feel home.Couldn't fault the cleanliness. Clean towels daily and sheets seemed to be changed almost every other day too. The maids were friendly and always smiled and said hello.Kristina and Alex on reception were both excellent. Always a friendly greeting and happy to provide us with info for our stay.Pool area and views were stunning. Also nice to have the beach so close. Never a problem getting a psunbed.Pleasant walks either to Perivilos or Perissa. Favourite restaurant was Poseidon. Friendly family run place with good food at reasonable prices. The owner even gave us a bottle of their own wine as a gift on our last night.Would love to return to Santorini again soon and would stay at at the Atlantis Beach again.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While my husband and I were on our honeymoon touring Europe we stayed at Atlantis Beach Villa for 4 nights while in Santorini. The service was outstanding, and we loved the pool area. The room however, was a complete let down, nothing like we expected from the pictures.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic 2 week honeymoon stay here - Kristina and her team were fantastic and couldn't have been more helpful. Lovely pool and bar area, direct access to your own sun beds (run superbly by George and Alex) - all perfect
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay at the Atlantis Beach Villas complex. We were given a very warm welcome by Katarina the main hotel receptionist. This lady is a real asset to the organisation. She was so helpful and explained everything to us. She organised a free taxi to the local supermarket for us and sorted out car hire for us too. The pool area was lovely, breakfast was basic but very adequate and the accommodation was simple but very clean.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful resort, really friendly staff, they would arrange anything for you if you asked. My only let down was that we paid extra for a jacuzzi room to celebrate our honeymoon and it turned out to be a small, dark room with no windows and no view. We had a small outside space, which in my opinion felt quite boxed in because you're surrounded by high white walls. The jacuzzi was cold and because the walls blocked out the sun for most of the day it was too cold to enjoy. They did give us a little bottle of wine though, which was thoughtful. Perissa was lovely, really nice and chilled. The pool space and beach area was fab so we spent most of our time out of the room anyway. I would just advise not to pay for the jacuzzi room if you're going as a couple. The jaccuzi rooms for families were more like what we saw on google images and they cannot give those rooms to two people.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I met some friends here for our two week holiday.I must say first impressions were very good from the road side the Atlantis beach villas look very attractive with a pleasant looking restaurant and pool area and even the road down to reception all very lovely.Reception its self was very pretty and on the outside flowers flowing down the building all very tidy, then we were taken to our room !! well we did think we were being taken to a different hotel, I take they have taken on the building next door with nothing more than a concrete footpath leading to a small studio block, the gardens were awful and nothing to look at there was a rusty gate down by the road, that was always lost and the exterior paint was a different colour to the main building so they didn't even look part of the same complex.The room was just that really and it was tiny and we couldn't use our balcony because it was so small and the table was broken, the kitchen area was fine but wow in all the years going to Greece this was really the most basic very much so below par. The bathroom was very ugly with its red towel rail, toilet roll holder, mirror and shelf and I must say the worst shower ever not only was it not much more than a trickle it didn't even hang on the wall there was no bracket to hang it. The towels were changed daily but they were very rough.The pool area was lovely with comfy sunbeds our first week was a struggle for beds because it seemed people was getting up at around six to put the towels out week two was fine and there were plenty of beds, After travelling to the Greek islands for years and knowing that they can be very basic I just expected a little more after reading so many positive reviews and sadly the Atlantis didn't really deliver I think being in the naughty building spoilt things more than anything for me.I will point out at no point in the two weeks could we fault any of the staff they were all fantastic every one of them,While we would go back to Santorini we sadly would not return to the Atlantis unless we knew we could stay in the main apartments,
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff, the food, and room were wonderful. Enjoyed a great massage. Lots of places to eat with in walking distance. Great bus service to anywhere on the island. Pool was very clean. Would recomend this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My hubby and I have just returned from a wonderful week relaxing at this lovely hotel. I really cannot praise this hotel enough. The location is superb, nice and quiet with only a 5 minute walk in either direction to the many bars and restaurants. The hotel pool area is beautiful and there is a bar serving food and drinks from early morning until late at night. The spa facility was a lovely bonus and both my hubby and myself enjoyed a relaxing massage during our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We had a superior double room with a beautiful balcony. The rooms are furnished in a typically Greek fashion but it was spotlessly clean and the towels were changed daily. They even provided towels for the pool. The staff were amazing and really couldn't do enough for you. We had a fantastic holiday and felt really sad when it was time to leave. We will definitely be planning a return trip at sometime in the future.
hotelName:
0    Atlantis Beach Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying at this lovely small and friendly hotel at the end of May/beginning of June. We had an upgrade to a superior room with a gorgeous bougainvillea covered balcony, double bed an small kitchenette. The included buffet breakfast had plenty of choice with hot and cold drinks, cereals, bread, croissants (fresh and warm), cheese, ham, eggs, tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, honey, jams, Greek yoghurt, and fruit. The hotel is just across the road from the beach where you are able to use the sun loungers free of charge. There is a beautiful pool area with palm trees and also a Jacuzzi. A free bus, which they will order for you at reception, will take you to the supermarket, wait for you to do your shopping and take you back. The hotel makes an ideal base from which to explore the island. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance, some of which provide live music or "traditional Greek nights". You can catch a water taxi at the end of the beach in Perissa over to the resort of Kamari, or you can take a hike up the hill to visit Ancient Thira with magnificent views over Kamari and Perissa (check the opening times if you want to visit the archaeological site itself). The local buses take you to Fira but if you want to be able to make the most of your visit, it's best to hire a car which is relatively inexpensive, and parking at the hotel is free. There are plenty of local car rental shops. We had a convertible Smart Car which was loads of fun (and easy to park and negotiate the sometimes quite narrow streets). Fira and Oia are definitely worth visiting - every bit as gorgeous as the photos you see of them. It's also worth going on a couple of boat trips too, visiting some of the other islands (Nea Kameni and Thirassia) and the sunset cruise. Some of the sunsets on Santorini are spectacular and if you get up early enough, you can be treated to a fabulous sunrise in front of the hotel! Kristina, Alex and the rest of the staff are very welcoming and helpful and the room was cleaned every day with towels being replaced regularly. They provide towels for the pool area (you pay a deposit which you get back when you return them) although they ask you don't take them on the beach. A warning about the sea - it does shelve steeply and you are soon out of your depth. That suited us but for non-swimmers or children, you'd need to be careful. Fairly good for snorkelling, though, and there are plenty of water-sports on offer nearby.

review_body: Absolutely love this place , we visited in 2014 for our wedding and are going back this year, the staff are really helpful and polite, food is nice and the massage lady is amazing!!! i hope she still works there this time :)oh and the rooms with the outdoor Jacuzzi looked amazing, hope we get one of those this time :)

review_body: Santorini is simply an amazing island and the hotel was a great place to stay. Next to the beach, very quiet and relaxing. Staff was very friendly and the sunbeds at the beach are very cosy and relaxing! We got upgraded to a Jacuzzi room, which was very nice but the jacuzzi is next to the sidewalk and not very private. The breakfast was okay and the food from the poolbar, which you can order at the beach as well was very good. The only small minus was that the rooms and terrace could be cleaned a little bit more thoroughly.

review_body: Didn't stay at the hotel but visited the spa, had an amazing massage by Roula, who really sorted out a problem that I'd had with my back. We've had massage & spa treatments all over the world & this was second to none. We are visiting Santorini next week & will visit this lovely spa again.

review_body: Fabulous hotel with great staff . Had a pool facing room with pretty flowers growing over the balcony.The staff left my husband a bottle of wine in the room for his birthday.It was a lovely surprise.The staff are amazing.The mainance man helped us when our plug wouldn't work. The cleaners always made us smile and kept the room looking lovely and clean. Bar staff and reception staff were the friendliest people we had ever met.Will definitely be going back. The island is stunning and easy to get round .

review_body: My daughter and I initially were only booked to stay here one night, then we saw how spectacjular the property is and added another night.. We had been staying 2 nights at a time at various properties around island to get the best experience of all the islands.. I hate to even leave here to go to Oia, this is magical, peaceful, beautiful, calm.. and the service, the staff, absolutely exceptional! Isabel and Eugenia are my favorites! The young lady, working in the restaurant is lovely, and delightful. Mr. Spyros, absolutely fantastic! Cannot wait to visit again! it is definelty nice to be away from the chaos of Fira and Firostefani!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I returned from 8 nights on Santorini staying at the Apanemo Hotel eager to tell all friends and family without hesitation where to stay on this magnificant Greek island. It is one of the most beautiful islands and hotels we've ever visited and that includes several resorts in Hawaii where I'm from. First its location at the quiet southern end of the island fit our style: we could journey to the tourist areas of Fira and Oia during the day, but return to the quiet side at night. Also I can imagine that the prices are more reasonable, we certainly found the Apanemo reasonable for June-July time of year. Second, the hotel is as beautiful as the photos show: our room had a breath-taking patio where we could sit in late evening, watch the sun go down, the lights of Fira and Oia sparkle as the night darkened and watch the boats in and out of the harbor, the caldera. Third, the people are so friendly, everything is taken care of, the breakfast and breakfast room (all important to me!) including their coffee, freshly-squeezed orange juice, are all 5 Stars. They drop off a bottle of rose one night, a bottle of white another. Room service: their kitchen serves wonderful food up to 10:30 at night, brings it right to our patio as we watch the night darken. The room is one-of-a-kind: not a Marriott or Sheraton, but spacious, windows to the sea, large shower for two built into the hillside. Overall: this is a Let's Return hotel on a beautiful island.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Apanemo for our 30th anniversary trip to Greece. Located in Akrotiri instead of busy Fira or Oia was perfect for us. It is in a nice, quiet area yet it was easy to get around (I recommend having a car even though the staff was wonderful about driving you to close by places for free). Our room was a bit different as the bed is upstairs in the loft and was only accessible by ladder. We overlooked the sea and the caldera, and we loved the gorgeous views! The pool is a highlight (even though the water was chilly). It overlooks the caldera and is very nice. The included breakfast was good and offered both hot and cold options. They will even make you custom coffees. The bathroom sink was clogged at first, but the staff did fix that right away. The staff is very kind and friendly. I would recommend a stay at Apanemo when visiting Santorini!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night only, as I wanted to see the view from here as well. In the same trip, we also stayed 2 nights in Firostefani, and 1 night in Kamari. We'd also hiked to Oia, so I have a pretty good reference to compare with.In hindsight, I wish we'd spent 1 night in Kamari and 3 in Apanemo. Firostefani was great, but just too expensive (500/night). For others, I'd recommend staying here in Apanemo, and taking a bus to Fira, or staying 1 night in Fira if you really insist.Hotel Apanemo was great - it's located on the southern part of the horseshoe that is the island, where it's much less busy. The view from the hotel is amazing - better than from Fira, Firostefani, Oia, or anywhere we'd been. The staff was very friendly and arranged a 4 AM airport pickup for us, and a breakfast bag, even though the time between our check-in and check-out was only 12 hours. They even offer complimentary pick-up and drop-off in the Aktoriri area, which is awesome, as it lets you get around to restaurants and sights without having to walk or call a taxi. We used this to get to and from the restaurant they recommended and it was really nice to have.The hotel also offers a complementary cell phone with unlimited international calls to many destinations (most countries in Europe and the US were included), with google maps, a browser, and other apps on it. Again, really nice!The only negative I have is that the mattress wasn't super comfortable. It's a box spring, and you can feel where the springs are. We still slept well - it wasn't bad by any stretch, but replacing the mattresses with more expensive ones is something management should consider.Also, we found the water in the hotel to be somewhat irritating to your eyes when you shower. I know it's desalinated, but it was more pleasant in Firostefani.Location: 9/10 (calm and quiet)Service: 10/10Room: 8/10Value: 10/10Overall: 9.5/10
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has got to be the most beautiful hotel we have visited in Europe, the scenery is amazing especially the pool area as you have the view of Fira and Oia and you can watch the cruise ships coming in each morning it’s so beautiful.The staff here are so helpful and are happy to drive you to restaurants around Akrotiri and also book any restaurants and boat trips for you.They will also drop you to the local bus stop so We decided to head to Fira then to Oia one morning (you need to get two buses) I would recommend heading to Oia early as it gets really busy after lunch but it’s worth the journey as we preferred it to Fira which seems to always be manic ! I booked in advance a couple of restaurants in Fira for the sunset view which is a must but it was so nice coming back to our peaceful hotel. I would recommend doing the Santo winery, Akro beach is beautiful for dinner, the boat trip which the hotel will book for you and the local town is really pretty we went there a few times in the day for lunch.All in all we have had a great holiday and if your thinking of visiting Santorini this hotel has everything and it’s in the perfect spot
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is so beautiful and everyone here is so kind! I love it here! Isabel is my favorite server she made us all laugh and talked to us all so sweet! She was very quick with everything and made sure we were all well taken care of the whole time!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oh well, if you are going to visit Santorini, we highly recommend to choose to stay in this beautiful hotel. It's far from the tourist crowd, maybe you have to rent a car during your stay here, but it is really worth it. (Fira and Oia is maximum an hour by car from Akrotiri, but two days are enough to visit them).Apanemo offers you the loveliest vibe to chill, and relax with a fantastic view to the caldera, an "instagramic" pool, rich breakfast and really helpful staff. They drive you to restaurants in Aktoriri if you want (our favorite was the Good Heart), and to the red beach as well, which is a must see around this place. If we come back to Santorini next time, we will choose Apanemo again! <3
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Apanemo for 6 nights during our honeymoon trip. We LOVED everything about the hotel and it’s staff. The view of the caldera is incredible, the rooms are spacious and always clean, and we were removed from the busyness of the rest of the island. By far the best part about our stay was the staff. Spiros and his team are incredible and are willing to provide whatever is needed to make your stay more enjoyable. During our time, the staff helped us with a rental car arrangement, catamaran booking, transport to the airport, countless shuttles around Akrotiri, all with an smile and a friendly disposition. They even prepared a bagged breakfast on our last morning as we had to leave the island very early. Isabel and Nikos were two of the many staff members that were incredibly helpful during our trip. I did a lot of research to ensure that I picked the best place for my wife and I’s special week, and I hit the jackpot with Hotel Apanemo. I would highly recommend anyone that visits Santorini stay at this hotel. Would rate it more than 5 stars if I could!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hello, I’d like to make a review of my stay there. It was perfect. We loved everything. The breakfast was delicious with many options and cooked with heart. The bed clothes and the towels smell very good. It looks like my mother has washed them. Espetacular! Isabel is also a great attendant, she is always smiling and saying hello. She was nice on giving us the tips for Santorini and Spiros too. We could be back there many times in life. Thks a lot!Perfect place!!!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most amazing place I’ve ever visited. I am in love with Santorini and when we go back we’ll be staying at Apanemo again. Traditional and clean rooms with all you need, stunning views from the balcony, beautiful pool and seating areas, fantastic breakfast. Couldn’t have asked for more from this trip.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have used TA for years but never written a review until now when I feel compelled to.I booked this boutique type hotel for my wife's 50th birthday with 3 other couples and wow is all that I can really say! The hotel is a great setting with the perfect view of the island and caldera with ships occasionally sailing by (I would never ever tire of that special view). The hotel rooms are spacious, spotless and all views from the terrace are pretty darn good. The pool area is classy with nice beds and refreshing pools with breathtaking view again. So the basics over, the real difference here is simply the people and their attitude towards you. They cannot do enough to try to make your stay a stress free experience from arranging a champagne birthday breakfast in a private area, to moving tables into the sunshine with free-flowing beer and wine, to arranging taxis all over the island, to arranging a late dinner after a sunset cruise - nothing was too much trouble (even the occasional lively/loud outbursts )!Thanks especially to Isabel and Natalia who smiled and laughed with us and Spiros for making it all happen (as well as all other unsung staff).Brilliant place brilliant staff - can't recommended highly enough!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing place to stay! We stayed from May 1st until the 6th, and the service, staff and overall experience was great! Each room has a private balcony and we had a beautiful view of the caldera. The location can't be beat. The breakfast choices were wonderful, and we both fell in love with the "tomato balls"! Everyone was very friendly and helpful, to say the least. We liked the size of the establishment, because we were able to visit with the people working there. Where else would you get a ride to a local restaurant, and volunteer to pick us up when we were done? We would highly recommend the Apanemo to anyone interested.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located at a height and hence you get unrestricted views of the sea and you can calmly enjoy beautiful views across the property.The staff was really good and supportive. They also have free pick-up and drop facility to the nearby bus stop.If you want to enjoy a silent and peaceful stay away from the hustle of Oia or Thira then Apanemo is the perfect place for it.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an awesome stay in the superior room which had great views and was kept in pristine condition! The staff were all very helpful with a special mention to Spiros for being a great host, Isabel who kept us entertained and well attended to and the two boys who drove all customers everywhere they wanted in Akrotiri free of charge! This was a great service. Views from the pool area were spectacular and we will definitely be coming back!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very fortunate to stay in this friendly hotel in a superb room overlooking the entire island. From our balcony terrace we could see all the croissant shape island from our peaceful spot in Akrotiri. We had decided to not hire a car as we wanted to relax whilst there, which wasn't a problem at all as the hotel offered to drive us anywhere local if we wanted which we did. We had a smart phone also given to us during our stay to use to call reception for room service or from the pool, or to be collected from local beaches or restaurants. Very beautiful setting and the hotel was also beautiful. I would highly recommend staying here
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had booked and prepaid for a reservation at the Apanemo hotel for June 2019. Then, we just found out in May that my mother was dying, so I contacted the hotel and explained my situation. They were very accommodating. We received a full refund. We were so grateful to Apanemo for being so kind during this very painful time of our lives. We are going to try to go to Santorini next year. Apanemo will be the hotel we choose.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First what I said when looked at the view from my balcony is "WOW".I was so impressed that I couldn't stop taking pictures of everything at this hotel:) On top of that staff were very kind and extremely helpful. I would like to say Thank you to everyone who works for this hotel for our amazing stay. You are the best!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The welcome, family-feel, accommodation and breakfast were all excellent. The views are spectacular, and the staff are all genuine, friendly and polite. Isabel has a stand out personality and really made a fuss of us on our honeymoon. Thanks to everyone there, and especially our amazing breakfast and cocktail-making friend Isabel xx
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apanemo is an excellent place to stay if you plan to visit Santorini. The location, view and service is excellent here. Staff is very co-operative and pleasing. From the reception to the restaurant to the house keeping they make sure that the guests are comfortable. The hotel is slightly far from the main areas of Santorini but they provide free shuttle to the nearest bus stop. The only thing I would like to point out here is that if they provide free shuttle for pick up and drop for guests on check-in and check-out it will be great. We checked out of the hotel early morning but there was nobody to take out our luggage, I wonder in case of any emergency how would anybody contact them. Rest was great and beautiful. Thanks team Apanemo.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was sublime, we had the best suite & the view was breathtaking. The owners and staff are fantastic & do everything to make sure your stay is memorable. They will take us to the village of Akrotiri and restaurants in the area & also collect, an unbelievable service. We will definitely be back
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do I even begin! The staff are amazing and are extremely accommodating to guests- I was trying to plan a friends trip for 8, but a month before, half of our group could no longer come due to family issues. Free cancellation came in very handy. We chose an Executive Traditional suite and a Superior Suite between four people and we’re absolutelh blown away by how clean, new, and aesthetically pleasing the rooms were! Added bonus the amazing balconies both rooms had. The towels and linens smelled like lavender and were super fresh and clean, which is a huge plus for me.  Free breakfast bar was so delicious and more than we could ask for to start the day. We were present for Greek easter and had the opportunity to try some of their sweets like the donuts and honey cake- so yummy! Greek coffee was the perfect accompaniment and an excellent way to start the day. The restaurant at the hotel did have good food, but they also recommended and offered free rides to local places to enjoy nice dinners, how many places do that ?! Super convenient and useful.The pool and outdoor spaces here are absolutely breathtaking and are cared for very well. The pool was amazing to sit by and relax while the staff bring over cold drinks. The view from the pool area is overlooking the whole Caldera and definitely a good place to take pictures.The reception staff, Zenny and Nikos, were so helpful in planning out activities for us that included hotel pickups AND even helped us rent a car! This allowed us to see every bit of Santorini at our leisure and was so much more reasonable than taking cabs everywhere (unless you go out drinking- they will call a cab for you and recommend fun clubs to go to!)At the end of our adventure, we had to leave at 6am to catch our flight back to Athens. We had bags of breakfast and snacks for what seemed like the whole day delivered to our rooms the night before. They really did think of everything!I 100% recommend this place to anyone visiting Santorini. Akrotiri is the gem on the island of Santorini (Oia and Fira are way too crowded and expensive - day trips were a bit stressful here) and Apanemo will help you enjoy the entire island while staying in the most peaceful part. You’ll really feel that Greek family hospitality while you stay here.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this place after a quick online search and it is one of the few places I’ve visited that the venue matches the photos. The staff are superb and very helpful and our room was immaculate and cleaned daily. The views are to die for and where it’s situated, on top of the hill in Akrotiri, it’s close enough to the village but very quiet as well. The service and the breakfasts are all you could ask for. I would highly recommend this place and look forward to coming back
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No words can adequately express how enjoyable, relaxing, welcoming, and stunning this stay was. Yes the views are breathtaking, the infinity pool beautiful, the hotel clean, and the staff professional... but you can anticipate that from the reviews and hotel website. What you cannot anticipate is the heart and soul of the people here. They offer rides to the Red Rock beach and other local attractions/restaurants, making the need for taxi’s less of a burden. The staff, particularly Isabelle made the stay full of laughs and love. It was a remarkable way to spend my parents 45th anniversary, they even supplied a complimentary bottle of Santorini Rosè to greet them in their room upon arrival! I rarely write reviews but I absolutely had to in this case. The affordable price is what drew is to the hotel, the experience made us feel as if we were at the best hotel on Santorini. Wish I could keep this gem a secret but they deserve all the good fortune possible ♥️ Thank You Apanemo and Isabelle ♥️
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its a very nice place The breakfast is very good the rooms are beautifull with a nice view and special isabel and spiros and jenny there were so friendly!! I Will defenitly recommand u this place you Will not regret it
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apanemo has been the best choice of this trip!From the beginning the personal had made us feel really welcome. They contacted us before our arrival to offer us a transport service (extra cost) to go to the hotel, once there they explained us the best places to go, the most beautiful beaches and the cheapest local restaurant of the area (while we enjoyed of a free glass of wine).The hotel is in Akrotiri, so probably you will need a car to visit the island. Even if it’s not really closed to Fira and Oía, it’s completely worth it. The views at the volcano are wonderful, you can enjoy it from the swimming pool and your room! It looks like paradise! It was impressive to look the sunrise from our bed!Also, the breakfast is so good, you have a lot of different choices of local products and the people that work there are so friendly, respectful and nice. I recommend it 100%.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a Wonderfull experience. Apanemo Hotel is a very well located hotel, just as we wanted. Excellent views, nice and clean rooms, away from the busy Oia and Fira. We were looking for a quiet holidays to rest and relax, and of course to have this breathtaking views of the Caldera and the Volcano. Apanemo was our small paradise in the busy Santorini. Easy to park, excellent food nearby (including the hotel’s restaurant), close to the beaches of the South part of the island. Definitely the best choice if you are looking for this. You will not regret it.The hosts and the staff makes also a big difference from other hotels we visited so far.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked in Apanemo Hotel last summer. We did a lot of research, and this was coming with high recommendations!! Well there are no words to describe the experience of this stay. Excellent service from the moment we called to book directly, to the warm welcome from Jenny in the reception, to tasty breakfast and the lovely Isabel. Everything was so nice and easy for Apanemo staff which make you really to relax and enjoy your stay. The room was excellent, very clean and the view was outstanding! The infinity pool is of course one of the most beautiful we ever seen!! We just saw the pictures from our holidays and we decide to re-book again, so Apanemo here we come again!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel in August 2018 for our honeymoon and we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The staff are friendly and welcoming, the hotel is impeccably clean and the views are truly amazing. It was a lovely, quiet place to relax in the day and the hotel's free taxi service was a brilliant added extra. We felt that we got excellent value for money at this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone-we honestly can't fault anything about it! Amazing! Thank you for a wonderful start to our honeymoon!:)
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I and my family have the most incredible vacations on August of 2018 in Santorini. The island is perfect and the persons too. We had a roomin Spyros hotel and we need to thank him for all he has done for us. He is very good guy. His beautiful wife & Isabella prepared on a daily basis a home made breakfast..I recommend this hotel to all. It was PERFECT...
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a second honeymoon in the last week of the season.A brilliant small hotel with the most amazing views over the Caldera. Large rooms and a peaceful atmosphere.Spiros and his team were amazing. So warm and genuinely friendly throughout. They sorted out airport transfers before we arrived, always provided genuine recommendations on the best places to see and eat, provided lifts to anywhere in the local area or restaurants on an evening, and let us check out at 5pm on our last day due to it being the very last day of the season.Beautiful breakfasts too with lovely homemade cakes.We visited Dubai for our first honeymoon, but this stay was far better due to the genuine warmth and friendliness of the place. Santorini is beautiful.If you are planning to visit Santorini then you simply must stay here.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in Apanemo Hotel was the highlight of our holidays. We stay the last 5 nights of our holidays in Greece here, and from the day we book until the day we left we realise what Greek hospitality is!!! Spiros and his team can’t do much to help you and serve and advice you, and all this with big smile. Jenny at the front desk had every day something new to suggest, Isabel always making us the daily breakfast, and rest of the team was also great. The hotel is very clean, and in a great location overlooking the entire island. We booked a nice Superior room and the view was to die for!!! Thank you!!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've seen the hotel furnish and location at the trip advisory,mostly of comments are excellent and basis for their experience, When I saw the advisory eager to vacation on this place with my family,As a seafarer I need unwind also even once in my life ,I am sure this place is excellent vacation specially together with my family due to my work onboard a vessel is far from my family,I like to cope up the moments that I lose them when I'm working onboard..This place is the exact and excellent for my family DREAM VACATION!!!!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is highly recommended and clean hotel. As far as I looked forward the view it is very pleasant and very accomodating..I love the entire place. I hope someday I can go and travel this place together with my family.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came from England to visit beautiful Greece and I choosed this beautiful hotel that had everything.I like the service I also liked the fact that I had to wake to this beautifully view the rooms where beautfull and nice views and that made me so happy that I already booked and holiday again for next year..
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is Highly Recommended clean/ organised /perfect personnel/ amazing view . Fantastic Bedrooms, rich breakfast and lunches ! Surely i ll visit again !!! !!! My daughter loved this place and we will try to come again. Thank you so.much
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and cozy hotel with amazing caldera view. The breakfast was good. The staff was very polite and helpful. The hotel is high on the hill a bit far from the city, but they have they on drivers, who are drives out and pick you up for free and when you want (just in Akrotiri area). one minus - the pool was not heated- veeerrryyy cold water... we were in October
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had awesome 4 days .Rooms are five star traditional/clean, breakfast was great and no words do describe the view !!!Spiros and his crew were 24/7 there for us!There is no chance to make a mistake if you choose this hotel .
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left service was 5 star. Nothing was too much for Spiros and the other staff. Beds were huge and the spotlessly clean rooms. Pool and view was amazing. Thank you for the amazing 4 nights. We will recommend to our friends and hopefully be back one day.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
