review_body: I’ve just returned from a 3 night stay here after going to a friends wedding on the island. I was travelling alone but was made to feel very welcome and comfortable from the moment I arrived by the hotel staff. The hotel is breathtaking from the views to the amazing rooms. The hotel offers a car service and were on hand to drive me to bars and restuarants in the local area free of charge and would even come and pick me up if I called them. All in all a very pleasant and relaxing stay would 100% recommend this hotel
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had the extreme pleasure to stay at Apanemo Hotel in Akrotiri. From the day we got there to the day we left everything was perfect. Spiro goes out of his way to make sure your happy ( can’t say enough about him). Rooms are immaculate. Isabel is wonderful, she makes the best breakfast and lunches. Isabel also makes great Greek donuts. Isabel Next time we are there I will show you how to make Zeppole. HahaI would recommend to EVERYONE if you want the perfect vacation stay at Apanemo. You won’t be disappointed
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent check in process. Friendly, helpful, and informative staff. Beautiful layout and fancy outer appearance. A little humid and damp in the room causing dampness in our pillows and sheets. Staff changed the bedding upon our request only to return to our room with the same feeling. Excellent views of the caldera.Beautiful infinity pool. Suggestion, please consider an automatic heater for the pool to keep the water at a certain temperature since the pool is a big attraction to your hotel. In short, we couldn't enjoy the awesome pool because the water was too cold. Breakfast had a huge variety, however, some of the food wasn't kept hot, or even warm, the eggs and pancakes cooled off. Why isn't there a warmer underneath? This doesn't make sense to go through all that effort, making all that great food, only to serve it cold. Nothing on tv, is there no cable in Greece since none of our 4 hotels had anything besides basic channels? Staff offers free rides to close by beaches and towns. Thank you for the warm welcome and hospitality.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on a cruise around the Aegean whose itinerary included an over night stay in Santorini and so we decided to book this hotel for the night. We arrived around mid day and had access to our room immediately. The room which was really an apartment was clean, spacious, well equipped and with the most wonderful view of the caldera. The infinity swimming pool is designed to cover three different levels and was superb.We had room service for lunch which was reasonably priced, efficient and delicious. The hotel provides a free transport service within the Akrotiri area and gave us a tour of several tavernas and left it up to us to decide which one we wanted to dine in! Needless to say that free transport was provided for our return. Truly amazing hospitality! Breakfast the following day provided a wide choice of delicious food in a dining room and terrace which offered stunning views. We were given a complimentary late check out which gave us more time in and around the magnificent pool area. We were sorry that our stay had been so brief but we will definitely return. We have traveled extensively and can honestly say that this is the best hotel stay which we have experienced. Many thanks to the owners and staff for their kind hospitality.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights here recently. Our room was described as having a sea/garden view, which we discovered was on the opposite side not facing the Caldera. At first, we thought that was a bad thing but it turned out to be for the best! It was very windy when we were there so the pool (unheated) was unusable however our patio was completely sheltered from the wind and in the morning/early afternoon was a sun trap.Breakfast every morning was delicious and we were greeted warmly by Isabel who was friendly, always smiling abd extremely professional. The free car transfers within the area was an excellent feature.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at Apenemo at start of October and just loved it. Where do I start?1. Rooms were stunning and very clean / spotless2. Big comfy beds - the view from our bed was incredible3.Great views over the Caldera from every direction4.Great communication before arrival and during stay - thank you Spirrou5. Lovely grounds and awesome infinity pool6.A transport service within the Akrotiri area - complimentary and very handy7.Big beautiful breakfast served on a stunning sun deck 8. Best staff and customer service, you really do feel like family9. Helpful and honest service when booking cars / tours10. Special thanks to Isabel in the kitchen who makes the best tomatoballs EVER!!!! She is also a great lady! Great asset to the team.Thank you Sirrou for all your help. You run a wonderful tourism business and we look forward to returning one day!Emma from Australia
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this property when in Greece in late August. Spiro and the staff were so helpful, the rooms were very clean, and the views were stunning. Having never been to Santorini, we were worried about booking in the South, but consider it! They offered a shuttle to red beach and other places around the region, and it was great to be away from the congestion of Oia or Thera. Hire a driver and visit the rest of the island to see those classic Santorini views, then return to the Apanemo and hang in the pool and enjoy! No crowds! This hotel was great and we recommend it without hesitation.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Apanemo hotel for our last night in Santorini in August 2018. We were given the most amazing room with fantastic breathtaking views over the caldera. The quality of the rooms is superb and the same for the breakfast. The best I had had during our visit to the island. Everything about this hotel is class, from the room to the pool but what makes it extra special and stands apart from other hotels is the amazing hospitality. In particular Isabel who is warm, friendly and accommodating. In fact all the staff were so professional and nice. We enjoyed a bottle of prosecco on the terrace whilst watching the sun go down and had breakfast and lunch the following day. The food is excellent and they have a very varied drinks menu. whilst spending the day by the pool we were waited on hand and foot and towels are provided for the sunbeds. I cannot praise this hotel enough and in fact we loved it so much that we have already booked to return next August. Can't wait!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent our honeymoon here just last week. It was absolutely beautiful. We we're looking to stay in a quiet and relaxing resort and it was perfect. We did rent a car to be able to travel to the sites and towns throughout the island but they offered travel services if we wanted it. They also offered to pick us up from the airport. They answered emails quickly which was very much appreciated. It was great to come back every night to a quiet and picturesque location. The morning sunrise that we woke up to every morning was beautiful and we were able to enjoy the views from our private balcony. It was also nice to sun bathe next to and swim in the pool.The hotel is also very close to some great traditional restaurants (which are better and much cheaper than the fancy restaurants), one of the ports, the Akrotiri archaelogical site, a sunset perfect lighthouse, and the red beach.Also, on a personal note, the staff was very friendly, offered help with whatever we needed, and had great recommendations on restaurants and sites to visit.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first time I have written a review but felt it necessary as this hotel really deserves a mention and certainly lives up to its 5 star rating. We stayed 10 nights for our daughters wedding during which we were made to feel so welcome. Isabelle's breakfast starts the day off the right way and her home made cake is amazing. Alex bought coffee to our table every morning without being asked. The rooms are kept fresh and clean and serviced daily by a lovely young girl who was polite and friendly. We had a room with a stunning view of The Caldera but even the garden rooms have a beautiful outlook. The car service was excellent and you never waited more than a few minutes to be dropped off or picked up by Nikos, Alex or his brother. Even Spiros dropped what he was doing to take us into the village. The service on the front desk was helpful too. Thank you to everyone for making our holiday memorable. Spiros and his team really do go that extra mile.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sadly due to a rare phenomena in the Mediterranean Sea the weather conditions didn't allow us to get the ferryboat to Santorini on time for our reservation, and we had to cancel the booking. Spiros and the all the staff at Apanemo have been wonderful and really accommodating giving us all the informations and advice needed to make the best of our trip dispite the unpredictable weather. Not only we will try to come come back another time in the near future and stay at Apanemo but we are now really looking forward to meeting them as they are very special people who will cater for all your need and do everything they can to make your trip a success.
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for a perfect stay, we have had the most wonderful holiday. Apanemo is one of the most picturesque hotels we have ever stayed in with incredible views. Rooms were clean and fresh, we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast especially Isabelle's home made cake. We have been made to feel extremely welcome by all the staff, a big mention to Isabelle who let us in after loosing our key at 3am after my sisters wedding, she did get her own back though :-)
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most hotels on Santorini have a great view of the superb caldera and the Apanemo has one of the best. The hotel’s location in Akrotiri at the southern end of this extraordinary island has the advantage of putting it outside the maelstrom of tourists who converge every day on Fira, many of them from the enormous cruise-ships that threaten to despoil the bay below, or on Oia in the north for the daily sunset. Being in Akrotiri gives the Apanemo more peace and seclusion. There are several very good restaurants within easy walking distance -- and, best of all, the hotel’s every willing drivers will take you there and back, and elsewhere around the southern headland, for free and at the drop of a phone-call. This splendid hotel has the friendliest staff imaginable, always ready with a smile and a greeting and help or advice, and a free pick-up to bring you back to base. The infinity pool area offers views that you’ll never forget. There’s a copious breakfast to start you on your day and snacks provided throughout the day. The rooms are cool and spotlessly clean, each with a little terrace of its own. All at rates that are significantly less than many other establishments with less to offer. It couldn’t be better!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel and rooms were well appointed. Views of the Calderra from rooms and infinity pool were spectacular. Service was courteous, efficient, and very friendly. Buffet breakfast (included) provided a lot of choice and was very good. We enjoyed Isabel's dry sense of humour and service during breakfast.Not sure if all the rooms are the same, but ours was not friendly to people with accessibility requirements. Indeed the hotel as a whole was not but we found this to be the rule rather than the exception in most of the hotels we stayed at during our 16 day vacation to the islands and Athens. At the Apanemo, our bedroom was in a loft accessed by fairly steep stairs with only one bathroom located on the main floor. No shortage of exercise!All in all a great experience and one we would repeat and recommend highly. Thanks to Spiros and staff for making our stay so enjoyable. Your hotel was our favourite of our trip!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apanemo is an incredible gem-like hotel away from the busy and bustling scene of Oia and Fira. It is a quieter part of Santorini and owns a 5-star view from the hotel infiniti pool and many vantage point of the hotel. You do need to travel 25 minutes from Fira to get here but the journey across the local villages is part of the unique Santorini experience.We stayed here for 3 nights and the staff took care of us well. The manager was always tentative to our questions and staff like Isbel and Ivan(?) helped us with day-to-day traveling needs. I like to drink tea in the morning and they always filled my thermo bottle with warm water so I can have that. The breakfast is fresh and healthy with all the local jam, olives and tasty cold cuts. Everything you see on the site is what you will get from the hotel, or even better as real experience is always better. I miss the place already, so book your stay with plenty of time to savor the view there and everything else : )
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coming to Apanemo has been one of the most incredible experiences we have ever had. We arrived off an early flight before picking up our rental car the gentleman asked us where we would be staying and we mentioned Apanemo. His immediate response was Apanemo is a beautiful hotel with the most amazing views. we were even more excited, at check in and were welcomed in kindly by Isabella. It was around 6am and she offered us coffee and made us feel more than welcome. Mind you it was the BEST columbaian coffee! Our stay kept getting better being British comes at a cost of being a hard tea drinker. We asked for a kettle and it was delieverd immediately to our room. We had also forgotten our mobile car charges and Spiros ( the man who never says no) gave us his own. Nothing was overlooked. We felt at home right from the start. he also allowed us to take a range of herbal teas from breakfast! the highlights of our trip were breakfast which was cooked by Isabella. The most delicious breakfast we have EVER tasted. In particular the vanilla pots which we woke up EXTRA early to get our hands on. isabella is an amazing cook she has been our mother away from home. the room was beautifully renovated, clean modern and extremely comfortable. a large fridge was also provided which we found useful. we stayed in number 3 highly reccomended garden view and sea view! Unfortunately we were only able to book a three day stay at Apanemo due to it being sold out! (because it is FANTASTIC) we are writing after staying at another hotel and it was incomparable to Apanemo. Our last day in Santorini we were craving such a good breakfast we asked Spiros if we could come back. He jumped up with excitement and told us we were welcome to come back have breakfast and use the pool whenever we wanted to. he was not joking because on our last day we actually took his offer up after having an appalling breakfast at our other hotel. we missed isabella’s fresh homemade breakfast!We believe this hotel is Santorinis hidden gem in Akrotiri. a home away from home. The most outstanding views. we have taken pictures on our dslr and drone which we will upload shortly. thank you Spiros and team for the most amazing stay in Santorini you have given us the best experience! please do not believe any negative reviews!We tried to think of cons to make this review balanced and realistic but there were NONE!!
hotelName:
1    Apanemo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a relaxing long stay at Smaragdi. The pool is immaculate and in a pretty courtyard with a small bar. The staff anticipated every question and need, helping us make reservations for a fabulous catamaran tour and suggesting restaurants. Our room was spacious and clean and had a nice jacuzzi, a refrigerator, a small balcony, and a television. The property is a very short walk to the beach. Breakfast, lunch, and snacks are available.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve stayed here for seven nights. It was marvellous. The place is perfect for a relaxing and quiet time off busy life. Friendly and helpful staff, you feel they genuinely are interested in helping you. Breakfast is sufficient enough with varieties, it has a bat menus and snacks. It takes five minutes walks to the beach and to the nearest supermarket... we felt so much at home at this place, we celebrated my birthday and even got engaged. We would love to stay here again if in Santorini.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is really nice and attentive. They try to help you in everything they can. The hotel is really cozy and beautiful. It is really close to Perivolos beach by walking. It is close to Akrotiri and the Red Beach by car, so if you hire a taxi, it is not expensive. The breakfast is good and not expensive (10€ per person). The center of the town (Fira) is far bus there is a bus station 5 minutes away from walking from the hotel that takes you to Fira.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m currently at the hotel sat by the pool drinking my ice cold beer writing this. I love this place they treat you like one of the family. Everyone who works here goes out of there way for you. I’ve stayed in 5 star hotels where I’ve not received the treatment I’m getting here. From the driver collecting me from airport and giving me a tour as we drove to hotel to the check in it was smooth sailing. The 2 young staff behind the bar are the best! The reason I come back from the beach in the afternoon to have my banter with them. Rooms are big, breakfast is great, there’s also room by the pool it’s just the perfect size. You have ocean views from the pool. As mentioned, supermarket only 5 mins away but it’s only 3 euro for ice cold beer by the pool which is great. Sooo many restaurants on the beach all with happy hrs and cheap good food. The bus to fira is at the shop (5 mins) it takes about 30/40 mins and cost 2.4 euro. I’m glad I didn’t stay in fira or oia as it’s full of tourist. Here I can walk on the 4km of beach and pick any lounger for free in most places! Awesome place.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is stunning. It's gorgeous, the rooms are spacious, the pool clean and the whole hotel complex is just amazingly beautiful and the staff!!! The staff is like family within a day. We stayed here for a week and did not want to leave. We felt like home. We had a car and the parking was right next to the hotel. We went to breakfast every morning barefoot. You can walk to the beach in minutes. You can eat at many restaurants within a 2 minute walk. There is a supermarket within 5 minutes walk and a laundromat and a bank. In comparison to busy Fira and Oia this place is quiet and feels homy and we will be back. We loved it :-)
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was amazing, from the day we arrived and the day we checked out. We were taken care of wonderfully!Accommodations: They have an excellent customer service, arrived at the hotel for an early check in, forgot to tell them that we were coming in super early since our flight from Athens to Santorini was booked separately. It was literally 7 am in the morning and check in was 3 pm (i think) and he was so gracious to not give us any problem but instead he had the cleaning service made our room priority to have it ready. Informed us that breakfast will be served in an hour if we wanted to join. They have one of the best cappuccino freddo, by the way. They made us feel really welcomed and they have 6:00 pm meeting our first day ti give you tips on what to do and what not to thing kinda thing. Location: 2 mints away from the black sand beach.Everything is accessible by bus just ask the reception for Bus stop schedule. Close enough to the tourist spots in Santorini but far enough from the busy area or from the scrambling tourist. Gives you that vacation relaxed felling by the beach after a long day, looking for that perfect picture spot in Oia or in Fira. Good Restaurant is around the area too. Just plan your day and transportation accordingly or ahead of time.Overall, the hotel did not disappoint! I would come back here and highly recommend it to family and friends.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned from a great 1 week stay at the Smaragdi hotel.There was a large party of us some of whom had stayed here previously and I can Definitely see why. The moment we arrived we were treat like old friends and throughout our stay nothing was too much trouble. All the staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were basic but very comfortable and had little touches such as free WiFi, safe and aircon which are becoming more often then not chargeable extras elsewhere around the world. We didn’t have too much to eat or drink at the hotel as we preferred to eat out but what we did have was always tasty and good value. The location is great just two minutes walk to lovely Perivolos beach which is lined with upmarket bars and restaurants. Perissa main resort centre is about another 10-15 mins further walk away. Had a great time at the Smaragdi hotel and in beautiful Santorini itself. Defiently hope to return next year all fingers crossed
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is fantastic: located 3 minutes away from the beachThe staff is amazingly welcoming, friendly, helpful, lovely.A perfect place to rest, chill and enjoy the sun. Our bedroom was big, clean. Beds were very comfortable.We will definitely go back there if we travel again to Santorini.Good value for money compared to Fira
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is friendly and always willing to assist you. The room was clean and it has everything that you need. you have the option to add breakfast to your reservation if it is not already included. It is close to restaurants and to the bus station. you can also rent a car and they helped me to do that. It has a nice pool and good amenities but the best is definitely the staff at the hotel.Thank you for everything.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has been quite relaxing and a pleasant start in the fine summers time especially in this seasonal period so far. The staff were quite friendly when greeting us upon arrival. The scenery is quite spacious.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay in Smaragdi Santorini. Great hotel and good located in the popular beach of Perissa Perivolos. Maria and her team are very friendly and welcoming. We would highly recommend to attend Maria´s “Welcome Meeting” every afternoon. She provides all the hints you need for Santorini. Our room was beautiful, clean, well equipped and modern. The pool area is a relaxing oasis. The breakfast is delicious with many choices and reasonable priced. Many restaurants and bars are within short walk from the hotel. We had a truly memorable experience in Smaragdi and we are looking forward to return soon!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel and transfer independently. We arrived mid afternoon and were welcomed immediately by Maria and other members of staff. The hotel is based in Perivolous which is the southern end of Perissa. It is not your standard hotel block but an eclectic mix of rooms on ground or first floor level. We had booked a deluxe room and we were very happy with it. There was plenty of room for 2 people. We overlooked the ‘mountain’ which is Santorini’s highest point, north facing.The bed was comfortable,there was a sink with some basic utensils, crockery and glasses a small fridge, pull out table(never needed) as we spent time outside.The housekeeping was excellent it was kept immaculately clean. The bathroom was modern and had twin shower heads in a tiled cubicle. The whole hotel grounds is immaculate and tastefully done. We had breakfast €8 each day if paid for up front. It was fine and a good way to start the day.Maria offered a welcome meeting and provided all you need to know about Santorini. No doubt you will travel to Thira and Oia and if you do not have a car catch the bus from Euromarket, turn right from reception to the end of the road then turn left and you can’t miss it the bus will take you back to Perissa via the main road before it sets off to Thira, all buses start and end in Thira. €2.40 then €1.80 to Oia. They do get busy and can be quite entertaining.On the way back ask for the stop you want the conductor will remember the stop you want and shout so you won’t forget. We also got the bus to Akrotiri you will have to change but it works and they’ll tell you where to get the other bus. There are many places on the beach for sunbeds etc. Some are free but the taverns,cafe, restaurant will offer you the menu. The hotel will recommend a restaurant around the corner, they’re free but I thought the drinks to be on the expensive side 6€ for a large beer. 2.5€ the other way. Most restaurants shops and bars are on the beach road but not exclusively so check the main road and some of the roads that connect the main and beach roads. Would I go back to this hotel....you bet!.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for a few nights in September and the staff (Maria and the others) gave a truly memorable experience. They gave a great service at all times and provided good information about nearby places to visit. Moreover, the staff was really helpful as they helped us to order food from different restaurants. The hotel itself was beautiful. The room provided to us was very clean and the beds were decent. The view from the balcony was picturesque. The cleaner was great and gave excellent service. Highly recommend anyone to visit this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this wonderful place to wind down from a hectic traveling schedule. Perfect sums up our experience there.Never in all my years of travel have I gotten a more hospitable welcome from staff. They even did a small orientation with us on the first day. Explaining the lay of the land, modes of transport around the island, and all the things they could assist with - which was everything!They assisted making reservations, booking tours and calling taxi’s for us (even if pick up was not at the hotel).This gem is away from the touristy & commercialized main towns at the black beach.You don’t stay directly on the beach, but in a very small walk down the road to the ocean.The hotel is set up like small villas/chalets on the property rather than generic hotel blocks.We stayed in in a standard room, which is more than enough space for 2 people.Rooms were spacious and very clean.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is the most amazing hotel it is family owned so you feel like your at momma house. The staff cannot do enough for you. Anything you want you will have. The staff is so nice and friendly. Maria, ria , George , joe , lefty, costas are an amazing staff .we will stay her again. Thank for an amazing holiday.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have chosen this lovely hotel for us and the guests for our wedding in Santorini. First of all we cannot thank all the staff enough for being so helpful and so patient with all our requirements. They helped us a lot with so many things like booking transfer cars, finding the best florists etc. The breakfast has lots of choices and everything was fresh for a reasonable price. The terrace,the pool and the bar is great. Everyone is very welcoming and friendly and did their best for us to have an amazing time. We will come back here for sure without doubts.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week and didn’t want to leave when the time came!! We wished we had booked for 2 weeks. When we arrived at the airport we were met by the hotels driver who was very informative and he pointed out places of interest on the way back to the hotel. There are 2 restaurants on the beach front that offer a 5% discount for staying at Smaragdi, we didn’t eat at either of them as there were so many lovely tavernas/restaurants along the beach front. Had very lovely food out all week. You can choose to turn left or right at the beach and you won’t be disappointed where you dine.The room was basic but spotlessly clean. Had a fridge, safe and air con in the room all at no extra cost. Room was cleaned every day an clean towels provided every day too. Fab shower which was great after a hot day lounging by the pool! Staff all very friendly and definitely worth going to the welcome meeting, very informative. We hired a car for a few days through Easy car rental and also booked a romantic sunset cruise (with dinner on board and nearby pick up and drop off) through them too. Excellent value for money for both and thoroughly enjoyed the sunset cruise. We drove up to Oia and wow what a lovely place, bright white buildings and fantastic places to shop and eat. The views were stunning. All in all a very relaxing enjoyable stay and would definitely recommend Smaragdi
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was super nice and joyfull. The hotel is really clean and we liked our rooms. Even the bar food was great. Couple min walk to a bus stop to go to Fira/Thira directly and just a couple mon from Perissa and the side walk along the beach were all the restaurant are. I recommend this place as it was nice and practical. I would stay there again if i go back as we prefered being near the beach then near the city. The staff also picked us up at the airport and arrange a taxi back to the port!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When my boyfriend and I first arrived, we pulled up in our taxi and at first we were a little nervous. It was on a desolate dirt road. However, if you walk half a block passed the hotel, you are directly on the black beach, with the views and wonderful and cute restaurants. The staff was very friendly and tried to make our stay and accommodating as possible. The economy rooms were ok. Nothing special, but they were clean and had AC. The bathrooms were nice. The pool area was nice and the breakfast was really good! One of the best we had from a hotel in Greece. There were so many food options. The black beach is one of the nicest beaches in Santorini and it was really cool to be right there on it. There are buses within walking distance, however, it is kind of a pain and a long trip to go up to Oia from there.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with friends and enjoyed the pool and the proximity to the beach. The rooms are spacious and clean (although a tad dated). The free library near the reception area was great and the staff were very friendly.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is very close to the beach and you can really enjoy this property having beautiful pool and very nice rooms. Its a quite place and staff is very helpful and friendly. However it is a bit far from Fira Town. To reach this hotel, you can take a public bus as there is frequent service to the Perissa Beach and you can get off at Euro market stop which is one stop before Perissa beach. From there hotel is at 5 minutes walk.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at Smargadi hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. It is close to perissa beach but beware it is not near Fira and way away from Oia. If you're looking to be close to the caldera view, I would not recommend because the taxis are quite expensive in Santorini. However, the hotels in Fira and Oia are quite expensive so use your best judgement. Otherwise a nice stay for a reasonable price....
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a family for a week for a wedding on the island. Santorini is an expensive island, but compared to others I checked this gave good value for money. The staff are delightful and very friendly, and the rooms are large and spacious. Its is extremely clean- beds and towels changed very day, gardens cleaned constantly . A good location if you are visiting Perissa- tucked away a few yards from the sea but very close to restaurants and bars. Didn't eat the breakfast as it is the usual cornflakes, toast etc which isn't what I like. Overall a great place to stay if you are in Perissa.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From day one, our experience has been amazing, we have never had the welcome that Maria and the team gave us the first night,beginning with free transfer from the airport. Then a very confortable room. They helped us with the rental of the motorbike as well. The atmosphere at the pool was very nice and quiet and the staff was always willing to help and make the stay really worth it. Perivolos and Perisaa have nice beaches not even 2min away from the hotel door. If we go back to Santorini, we will then repeat at Smaragdi. Thanks!Juan Anton
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel from 7th - 14 July 2018. The hotel is in a great location, all restaurants and bars are within 10 mins walk. The hotel is situated on a quieter side of the island which was perfect for us. Hotel was very clean, our room was cleaned every day ( we stayed in a deluxe room) and fresh linen and towels changed daily too. The hotel provided a free pool towel which you could keep for your entire stay. However, the food is very limited as is more geared up towards a comfortable stay, this wasn't a problem as all other amenities were close by. We caught a local bus into Fira and onto Oia which was very entertaining and a good way to see the island too. For both bus journeys there and back we spent around less than 10 euros so is very cheap. We also arranged via the hotel a catamaran cruise - which wasn't cheap but well worth it, we had a lovely afternoon and evening and got to meet so really nice people, and ended the day watching the sunset which is magical, so I would highly recommend this trip. The only thing to watch out for is they serve food only once, so make sure you eat properly when they excursion people bring the food out, but the drinks were in their plentiful. Maria at the hotel provided a really good welcome meeting - giving us an insight to what is what - so recommend you attend that too. The hotel is linked up to a couple of restaurants, so if you want to visit the black sand beach which is literally two mins away, they provide the sunbeds and parasols for free, so make sure you use that facility. Our holiday was amazing, and we will definitely be back at some point, and I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a total relaxed holiday. Tranquilo bar serves an amazing jug of sangria!! if you come out of the hotel and walk to the bottom of the road if you turn left or right the selection of bars and restaurants are all within walking distance. The hotel also provides you with a welcome bottle of wine and water and the aircon and safe are both free of charge. The hotel also sell bottles of water which you can keep in your room which we found really convenient. Overall, Maria and her staff were amazing.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from a week at Smaragdi Hotel with my sister and cannot praise it enough. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly. We stayed in one of the cheaper rooms and it was spotless with a great bathroom with rainshower plus handheld shower, both with strong pressure. The room was not very big but very comfortable. We asked to change our pillows for softer ones on the first night and this was done immediately. The outside areas were constantly being cleaned and the pool was always sparkling. Only a minute from the beaches of Perivolos and Perissa with many tavernas to choose from. An added bonus was no charge for majority of sunbeds on the beach if you simply bought a drink from the relevant bar/restaurant they belonged to. For a relaxing break i thoroughly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here before and after a sailing trip with G-Adventures. Clean, quiet, close to the beach and to good restaurants, good air conditioning, great pool, and a shower to die for (after being on a boat for 10 days). Staff was great, and all of our needs were met. Very accommodating.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is special.Apart from the excellent layout of this hotel which sees improvement every year, the staff do so much to make you feel so vey welcome. Reception and the fabulous cleaning staff work so hard to ensure that you will enjoy your holiday in Santorini.We have visited Smaragdi many times over the years and are already looking forward to another visit in 2019.Many thanks to everyone for making our trip once again so special.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were so welcoming and helpful. They made arrangements for us to do many activities. They helped with directions bus schedules and recommended the best things to do and see. They were multi lingual. Their driver met us at the airport which was very nice after a long journey from Canada. The rooms were very clean. Bathroom was gorgeous. The pool was wonderful. The grounds were well kept. The breakfast was very good with lots of options in the buffet. I would definitely go back and stay here. Thank you for the great memories!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel coordinated transportation to/from airport and fun activities. The staff were extremely friendly and professional. Breakfast buffet is good and ends promptly so don't be late. In general the bar food and drinks at the pool were a highlight. The property itself was well managed, but the rooms could use some TLC. The beds were hard as rocks. Altought the hotel is a short 5min walk to the beach and restaurants it is located on a road w/limited lighting which made us a bit weary while walking at night. However, Santorini is a rather safe place to vacation.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Smaragdi Hotel has everything you need with a family feel. Our room (#29) was really a suite on the ground floor with a great shower and a small table and seating area separated from the bedroom. Our room was casual but clean and included a porch with seating shared with the next room, but the lovely pool area was our main gathering spot. The staff was super-friendly and they are able to arrange excursion trips that pick up from the hotel. We rented a car at a reasonable price and I preferred exploring on our own, but we did take advantage of a boat trip that we set up through the hotel. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel, but there are plenty of other options along the beach.Smaragdi is 1/2 block from a 2-mile long black sand beach. With a few breaks, the entire beach is serviced by restaurants and bars with umbrellas and lounge chairs (or king-sized beds in a few locations). It is a delightful beach experience with service while you relax. Whether you prefer casual or fine dining you won't go hungry here and the full moon drew us to the sea every night we were there!Perissa / Perivolos is a great spot to spend a few days. On the eastern side of the island (away from the caldera) it is much quieter than Oia or Fira. Yet the island is small enough that you can reach any part of it within an hour by car. Tip: Go to Greek Night, dance a smash some plates. Opah!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a superb weeks stay at the Smaragdi Hotel in Santorini with friends staying in adjacent rooms. We all arrived as guests but felt we left as friends, all of the staff were so friendly and only too pleased to help us out with anything we wanted to get the best from our stay on the island, we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Our rooms were very comfortable and cleaned everyday. The grounds and pool area were well maintained and very relaxing. The island itself is absolutely stunning and staying at this hotel we felt we had the best of both worlds, it was close to the beach and a short bus ride away from the bustling towns of Fira and Oia. Can't wait to go back!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Smaragdi hotel offers everything that you need for an amazing stay in Santorini. It is in a wonderful location right on the best beach in Santorini. The hotel is immaculately clean, well-maintained, comfortable and so peaceful with a lovely pool area. Maria and her team are so warm and friendly that you feel part of the family. I would not hesitate to stay at Smaragdi again. The only slight downside are the pool chairs as they are not the most comfortable and also the breakfast is lacking. However, you are not obliged to have breakfast at the hotel and there are numerous choices along the beach.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our one-week stay at Smaragdi Hotel for many reasons:-wonderful room, completely refurbished in a very stylish way, accessible from outside with a delicious small balcony equipped with a table and chairs, plus a small terrace nearby with an outside sofa-wonderful swimming pool and jacuzzi, nicely illuminated at night-very convenient location, 3 mn from the beach with a wide variety of fine bars and restaurants that give access to their private beaches if you consume there-2 bus stops within 5 mn to go to the gorgeous cities of Fira and then Oia-close to Akrotiri and the delicious port and beach of Vlychada-and last but not least, the staff’s extreme kindness, always available, friendly and helpful. A warm thank you to Maria and her ladies :-)
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay here for 3 days.1. Location: close to the beach,2. Staff, family owned hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Maria and her staff introduce the hotel and area, where to go and where to park in Fira.3. Room: clean, spacious. 4. The pool was of a decent size 5. Breakfast, 8 euro per person, one of the best in Greece6. Parking free7. Highly recommmended
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let me start by saying I'm not one to write sycophantic reviews and it takes a lot to impress me, but Smaragdi is really in a class of it's own in Perissa!I've stayed there twice over the last few years and will be going back twice this year.The staff are very warm and welcoming (which to me is one of the most important things).The rooms are excellent (the Economy rooms are absolutely fine with the standard rooms having a bit more room and amazing bathrooms).The rooms are kept spotlessly clean and the pool bar and other outside areas are beautifully kept.The location is pretty much perfect, about 100 metres from the beach and not on a busy road so really nice and quiet.Not the cheapest but then again you get what you pay for!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an awesome 3-nights stay here! Rooms are comfy and well equipped, pool is nice, beach is at 200 meters only. We had some slight issues (small water leak on the jacuzzi, broken doorknob) but every time Maria and the Smaragdi staff were very helpful and found solutions quickly, for instance we got another room where we could use the jacuzzi or even sleep (we kept both keys at the same time), free cocktails, they helped us even late in the evening... Wonderful experience and very kind staff! Definitely good memories here :)
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife have visited Smaragdi on September. We have stayed in a Deluxe room. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was bigger than we were excpected. Wifi had a good signal all over the place and the staff is very friendly and helpful. When we arrived the check in was quick. We highly recommend you to attend the welcome meeting of Maria: a lovely lady with a very good knowlegde of Santorini offered us a map and in only 15 minutes we knew exactly how to spend our time in Santorini and where to go. Overall it was an unforgettable experience and we plan already to visit Smaragdi Hotel again soon.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Smaragdi is a good place to stay when you are in Santorini. We chose to stay there for our vacation this summer and we had a pleasant stay. Its employees were professional and well-organized, always ready to help you and inform you about everything you need, our room was clean and spacious and the facilities the hotel offers were satisfying. Plus the pool area was well preserved and the wifi coverage was great.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5 of us stayed in one of the duplex units for 2 nights. This is a clean, charming hotel, and the staff is very helpful. It is just a few minutes walk to the Perivolos beaches, where many rows of lounge chairs line the long stretch of black sand beach.It's quite a distance from Fira and Oia, but the bus stop is not far away; with all the stops in between, it could take up to an hour to get into Fira. But for the quality of the accommodation and the very reasonable rate, (for us) it was worth the extra travel time into town. Overall, a lovely enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived early from Crete and were greeted by our driver at the ferry terminal who was extremely helpful with luggage. The free transfers were a bonus to start our Santorini holiday with. We arrived and our room was ready so we were able to check into our room straight away at 10:30am again another bonus of the hotel. Location is only 50 meters from the black beach so our kids could choose where they wanted to swim. The hotel reminded me of a small boutique hotel that made it feel cozy and warm. The rain showers were great after swimming. We had booked a family room so we slept upstairs while the kids slept down. When we checked out we did not realize that we had left our mobile phone behind and the hotel staff especially Aliki went to great lengths to contact me and return it to us in Athens where we were finishing our holiday. I can not thank Aliki enough for the effort she went to return my phone. I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 10 nights Sep last year. The hotel was excellent, staff attentive and had a lovely pool/bar area. Plenty of restaurants on the beach strip which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We stayed in a petite budget room which was great for the price. Will definitely be returning
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Key Highlight what I think are:-Very Close to beach, beautiful property.Nice pool and decent Jacuzzi(not hot obviously)Brilliant Breakfast - Worth every penny/centHelpful staff and good Guidance and support for renting car and recommendation on things to doEvening Induction kind of session with Juice next to pool with maps etcLot and Lot of reasonable price restaurants and bars on Pressia and Perivelos beachVery comfortable rooms with patio area (atleast the one we stayed in)Clean ToiletsLows:-Its not a low for hotel - Its about location. If you are not renting car or a Scooter - do not stay at Perivlos /Perissa - Bus service is okay, but with limited time in hand (2-3 days) would have been better to stay in Fira for accessibility. All in all Great stay
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have travelled quite a lot, but we have never received such a warm welcome and continuous customer support as we did from the lovely Maria and her team. We had an authentic large airey room with a mountain view. We used the beach where there are lots of sun beds to choose from. The highlight of our trip was the sunset catamaran cruise where you snorkel, bathe in the hot springs, then watch the sunset dining on fresh BBQ foods prepared onboard. Be careful in the hot springs as the water will colour your swimwear, so avoid whites and also remove your jewellery beforehand unless it's real gold. He best way to see the island is to hire a quad bike. You can catch the bus, but this is manic and lots of crowds fighting to get on. Perissa has lots of restaurants an bars, we liked Pergola. Santorini is magical. Enjoy!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found this place courtesy of TripAdvisor and was absolutely NOT disappointed! The hotel is beautiful, located away from super touristy Oia, Fira and Perissa & instead in the more low key Perivolos. First off, the staff is wonderful. They are kind, cheerful & helpful. Upon arrival you have a welcome meeting where you're given a map and tour suggestions. The staff is happy to take care of any bookings. And the bartenders are my favorite! Such fun people. The pool area is beautiful & relaxing, but the beach is just at the end of the street (5 min walk) where you can spend the day on free lounge chairs at two restaurants the hotel has a relationship with. The restaurant "Kouzina" was especially delicious! Overall this was a great experience & I cannot WAIT to come back to Smaragdi :) thanks again!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Property includes bungalow-like rooms with a nice pool area, though it’s within easy walking distance, maybe a block (less than 100m) to the long black-sand beach at Perivolos. If you follow the road to the beach and turn right you’ll find many tavernas, restaurants, and few mini-marts along the beach road. Single room was small but reasonable sized for two. Furnishings were basic but in good condition and working order. This included a double bed, sink, refrigerator and complimentary large bottled water (more available for purchase from the bar), plates/glasses/coffee cup/hot-pot, dresser closet with in-room safe, wall-mounted TV, duct-less AC, and folding chair. Bathroom was small in size but clean and in good working order. There’s a sitting area with small table and chair right outside the room. Pool area is good sized with lounge chairs and shaded sitting areas scattered around the pool. A bar opens from the lobby to pool, and small tables are clustered under the lobby deck where most sit for breakfast. Complimentary computer use is available from the lobby though Wi-Fi is free and worked from the room. Breakfast is a simple buffet and costs extra so you might be better off just heading to the beach and grabbing something from the spots scattered along the beach road. Besides proximity to the beach, probably the best part of the stay were the staff, all of whom where cheerfully welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout. Enjoyed the relaxing, easy-going stay at Smaragdi Hotel and time spent along Perivolos beach.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff and the hotel is clean and rooms good. The majority of bars and restaurants are 10 mins walk away towards Perissa but we enjoyed the walk! The bus stop is 5 mins away and via Thira you can travel to most destinations for about 2 euros each in an air conditioned modern coach. Family run hotel and they care about the guests holiday experience.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel in August 2017, together with various family members attending our wedding, and we have to say we couldn't have asked for a better hotel.The service was superb, the reception and bar/pool staff couldn't do enough for you, so attentive and friendly.The hotel pool is clean and well maintained, as are the other parts of the hotel.Breakfast was varied and fresh, absolutely no issues, and the poolside snacks were lovely.Thank you so much for playing your part in making our wedding as special as it was!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location, the nearby restaurants, the room, the pool, the bar and most importantly the staff are aspects that will make your stay in Santorini an unforgettable experience. Santorini is not beautiful just cos of its geographical location but also cos of the friendly people who treat you like family.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Smaragdi hotel for a week at the end of July and had a brilliant time. The hotel staff are all very helpful and friendly and we can't praise them enough. On our second night we found our room air conditioning was not quite working properly so we reported this to the manager and she immediately supplied us with a mega blaster fan which worked a treat and for the inconvenience we were given a 30 euro voucher to use on food or drink within the hotel, and then the air con was fixed the following day so all was good. We really appreciated the speed in which it was rectified and the kind gesture of the voucher. Our room was large and clean, and the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom shower was lovely. The pool and bar area is pretty and very well maintained. The long black sand beach is a very short walk and the area has some reasonably priced restaurants. We used the local bus service (cheap and regular service) to get to Fira and Oia and we would also recommend taking the local bus to Santo winery. Everywhere you turn there are spectacular views. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends and would love to return again in the future.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Smaragdi Hotel and would not hesitate to stay again or recommend it to others! The pool area is very pretty and our room was very clean. The beach is a very short walk away, as is the bus stop if you want to go to Fira or Oia. The clerks are very helpful with directions and maps of the area. We appreciated that the hotel will have a person waiting to pick you up at the airport, and if you arrive before check-in time you are welcome to use the pool area and an available shower and bathroom.
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Smaragdi Hotel in July with my wife and a friend of ours for 3 nights. Upon arrival we were swiftly checked in and whisked away to our rooms where we had gotten a quick and complete run down on how the utilities etc worked. The room was very modern, spacious, and best of all clean! The beds were comfortable and the rim had all the amenities needed. Staff were incredibly helpful (booked quads, brought anything we asked for to our room, organized transfers for us, etc. The pool and bar were also very clean and convenient. Upon checking out we had advised were headed up to Imerovigli for two more nights and were told that if for whatever reason we were back to the south of the island to stop in and feel welcome to use the pool and facilities. The staff and service here were 1st class and I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting Santorini. Thank you Smaragdi for and incredible stay!!
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and clean hotel, close to the beach and a nice pool/bar. Service is great, helpful staff! Perissa is nice if you want to stay close to the beach. Fira and Oia are just 20 and 40 minutes bus rides away (2.40€ per person)
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were solid. Good place for booking tours or rentals through the hotel. Beds leave something to be desired. Close to beach and general store. Nice perk was the little library to spend some down time in! Breakfast was so/so..
hotelName:
2    Smaragdi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Endless blue. You have the feeling that you fly to the clouds and then dive into the blue sea. Excellent hospitality, big smile and all our shorts to solve all the questions in order to facilitate our staygreat breakfast !!! cheese do not let go, egg for champions !!!thank you #blue_dolphins_hotel_santorini
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had just a few days in Santorini and we decided to stay to the Blue Dolphins due ti the comments we read...Amazing view staff was so kind and what more can I say for the breakfast with that view? It was honestly a great choice
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Cave Room. We had 5 people. There is one double bed in a secluded area with its private full bathroom. Then in the main area where there is a table/chairs, there were 2 twin sized beds and a cot for the 5th person. That area also has its own full bath. There was plenty of room of the 5 of us and the wifi worked fine (had some concerns since it is a cave!). The room was extremely clean! The cave room had 2 private outside sitting areas - one on the same level as the room entrance and a 2nd upper private balcony with 2 chaise loungers and a table. We could pick out our breakfast items the day before and the next morning our breakfast would be waiting for us on trays on our balcony. There were many selections and was a great Greek breakfast. What was the BEST was the view from the hotel. The sitting area (table / chairs / sun cover) for all guests was immediately adjacent to the cave room's upper balcony (this might be a problem for some people, but we didn't care) - but the view was MAGNIFICENT. Really one of the best views around. Just be forewarned that there are maybe 50 steps down to the hotel (which is not unusual) from the parking lot. We used Blue Dolphins transportation for the 5 of us in one vehicle; the only issue was the driver on the return trip to the airport was excessively fast (dangerously so) and it was a jerky ride while we had plenty of time to get to the airport. Blue Dolphins was a great location; very close walk to Fira (15-20 min) and 2.5 hour walk to Oia via the pathway. It is maybe a 15 minute walk to the area of Skaros Rock for fabulous sunset views. Or, you could just watch the sunset from the hotel! Very happy we stayed in Firostefani which was way less congested and much less touristy than Oia.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family can’t stop raving about our stay at Blue Dolphins. We stayed in the hideaway cave house and the canava cave house. Not only were the rooms big and spacious but definitely could fit more than the two people we had in each. The hideaway cave house is about a 10 min walk from the resort but they offered free shuttling back and forth for breakfast. The staff WAS AMAZING. They took care of getting us last minute ATV’s before our dinner, shuttling us to and from port even when our ferry was delayed till midnight, carrying our heavy luggage up and down the stairs. They were unbelievably accommodating! The breakfast was top notch we’re all still talking about the fresh orange juice and the incredible views. We always came back from our excursions with clean rooms. It is so close to shopping and great restaurants but far enough away from the cruise crowds. We can not recommend this place enough!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pickup at the airport was friendly and on time with helpful delivery to our room. We had a two bedroom suite which included 2 bathrooms with showers. The main bathroom was very open and the door to the toilet wouldn't shut. But the room was very clean and bed was very comfortable! Air conditioning worked well - wifi did not. Breakfast was not included so we walked to Fira (about 20 minutes) every morning, which was good exercise. Great location. View from our balcony was beautiful although partially blocked by the bar patio directly in front of our room. Staff was very helpful with any assistance we asked for. Good clean accomodation in great location.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travelled with my then 2 year old, Blue Dolphins was one only a handful of properties on the caldera side that allowed children. It was absolutely safe, albeit many stairs, a toddlers dream! Theodora and Dennis were very accommodating as my booking was last minute, I was able to secure the Honeymoon Jacuzzi suite which worked perfectly, and was great to wind down after a busy day out and a great opportunity for my little one to splash around and cool down from the Santorini sun! It was especially beautiful in the evening to sit and relax and watch the Fira lights sparkling and lighting up the night sky. This suite would be perfect for honeymooners, the views are to die for! The suite was spacious, I appreciate the big bathroom, the shower was great, huge balcony, the bed is a little on the uncomfortable side but I found this to be the case across Greece in general. I appreciated the simple but fresh breakfast, it’s no means a buffet, but fresh yoghurt, breads and pasteries, jams and honey’s and fresh fruit, fresh orange juice, all the makings for a great start to the day! The views from breakfast are incredible and one of my most memorable from my stay in Greece. I paid extra for a transfer, and the gentleman was fantastic, carried my bags and pram down all the many stairs. We arrived very early in the morning around 7;30am, they were very accommodating, had placed us in one of the downstairs rooms, so I could freshen up my son and set our belongings down until our room was ready. In the meantime I took a walk and hired a car and by the time we came back out room was ready and the boys working in the apartments were fantastic, transferred all our bags to the upper room and with a happy smile. I remember when we arrived and walked down the stairs to the property and I remember being gobsmacked when faced with the caldera view, it’s honestly unlike anything I’ve ever seen before. I highly recommend Blue Dolphins, it’s very clean, has some of the best views of the caldera and back into Fira. It’s a good location, within 10min walking distance to Fira, and a good location if you have a car, everything is easily accessible, if travelling with a stroller, I would use the back road sidewalk, as the rocky pathway that leads from Imerovigli to Fira is rocky all the way and not easy to travel down with a stroller. I used the sidewalk on the main road and cut into one of the side alleys in Fira closest to where I was going to be dining or visiting.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was a last minute booking and I am so happy I with them.We booked a romantic suite- it was worth the price to get a private balcony with breathtaking view..  Dennis  at the reception was helpful organizing for us the catamaran sail and getting a rented car at a lower price than my google searchI had already paid the continental breakfast k was lucky to order to plates from the extra list..as they have a new chef..I had the protein..  super bowl with yogurt & the salmon plate… super..Then my husband ordered the Eggs benedict and the sweet pies. really fresh +homemade !The next day I got the Kayana..greek  specialty.Xaris organized the taxi services and transfers with the hotel’s van & also arranged my visits to the black beach and the ancient ruins.He offered us free glasses of  white wine in the afternoon..The hotel is 5 minutes walking distance from the city center... There are also nice restaurants very close.. to go for dinner or lunch.The cleaning ladies are happy & keep the room clean. We had an espresso machine + free espresso coffees  & special tea with ginger & peppermint flavours in our room
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancé and I stayed in separate rooms the night before our wedding. We really enjoyed this hotel and glad we booked it! The rooms we spacious and had everything we needed. The staff was friendly and helpful. And the breakfast was sooooo good! I didn’t even know we were getting breakfast and they put together is amazing spread of different foods which was a great start to the day. If you are looking to explore the island and don’t need a lot of amenities, this is the place for you!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were comfortable and beautifully decorated. Private balconies provided the most amazing views! Close to restaurants and shopping but in a little quieter location. Absolutely best place to stay! Breakfast included, very tasty!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If any one looking out for great and mesmerizing views all day long from your room balcony as well as great service and hospitality, then this is the hotel one should count on.I stayed here from 3 - 6 April 2019 and loved every thing about this place Property 5 starService 5 star Staff very friendly Location super star ,
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Without doubt it was the most pleasant staying ever! Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the staff and everything was totally organized. Dennis deserves a special thanks because he was very friendly and helpful as it was our first time in Santorini. The atmosphere was so special that it really felt like home to us. All respect for the staff and Dennis as they do a great job there! A true sample of excellence and hospitality! I totally recommend it and I will definetely visit it again! Best regards guys , I look forward to visiting your island again xxx
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Blue Dolphin for 5 days. We booked our airport pick up and drop through the hotel also. Staff was at the airport to give us warm welcome. The entrance to the hotel is through stairs going down. You get treated to the speculation view of Santorini from the hotel terrace. Our room was spacious and had everything one could need in a hotel room. The staff at the reception desk were always available special thanks to Dennis and Harry. They really looked after us and helpful. The breakfast was complimentary and their housekeeping staff is also very pleasant and hospitable. The hotel is ideally situated in Firastefani which is walking distance to the main town Thira. Santorini is extremely picturesque. You can turn right from the hotel entrance either take the small alley which has number of hotels, restaurants and incredible views or take the main road towards Thira which has everything one can expect from a holiday resort town. Definitely worth staying in Blue Dolphin to enjoy the beautiful island.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a gem of a hotel! My room was immaculately clean, and the view from the hotel is incredible. The staff are very friendly, too. When I arrived, I was really early for checking in, so I asked if I could just sit around and wait. I was given tea and cake, and was very content just to sit and stare at the view until my room was ready! :)
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a Romantic Suite with Balcony and we were not disappointed. The view is simply mesmerizing! Unfortunately, sunset was obstructed by another unit. The room itself was charming and functional at the same time. The balcony however can also be accessible by another unit which shares the same stairs up. However, I understand this unit has its own balcony so there is no reason to use ours. Location is good, near Fira and Imerovigli. Whatever the case, no issue as if one drives as Santorini is a small island. There are available carpark off the main road. It is quite a few steps down to access the hotel, so do take note if physically challenged. Continental breakfast served.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is absolutely gorgeous. Clean, comfortable and the breakfast Is great. Staff is kind and the check in process was easy and fast. There are stairs to climb, but trust is to make your view even better. I can’t wait to go back.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is very inspiring and see the sunset from the area is really on of the unforgettable things forever. The room was super big and clean. My room has a beautiful terrace.Would recommend this hotel always..
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breathtaking views! You could sit there all day and take in the scenery. We had a fabulous stay at the Blue Dolphin! We chose to stay in the cave room. It was huge! Much bigger than we anticipated, clean, more than we could ask for. Breakfast was served to us each day. Eggs, local breads, cheese, ham, yogurt, jam and honey.Within walking distance are a couple of grocery stores, restaurants and tourist shops. The walk down into town isn’t too far and well worth the trip. We rented a car for the day to see other parts of the island. Definitely a great trip! Would highly recommend a visit to Santorini and the Blue Dolphin.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I stayed in the Blue Dolphins villa, and we could not have had a better experience. Hotel staff were extremely welcoming and helpful, and they were always on-call for any concerns that we may have had. The villa was very clean and charming with a hot tub overlooking the sea. The Blue Dolphins also helped us book the best boat cruise, where we sailed by gorgeous beaches, swam in hot springs, and enjoyed a delicious lunch and wine onboard. I miss this place already!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked 2 nights to stay at this hotel and had purchased a non-refundable fare. Unfortunately I had to cancel my trip to Europe because of a sick child. The hotel manager was amazing. He gave me multiple options, which included a cancellation with full refund. I was not so lucky with other hotels in Europe. My goal is to get out there next year, and I will definitely be staying here. Because of their generosity, I will plan to spend a bigger part of my vacation with them.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took the sole honeymoon suite they have, and boy they offer a splendid view. Although we had an outdoor jacuzzi, which looked good, we couldn't use it due to the cold weather. The bathroom was really spacious, but the heating is limited to the ones from the heater plates, so you might feel cold during the non-summer times. The room is small, but cozy and the window offers a direct view of the Caldera. The reception is a bit hard to reach out physically, due to the several up and down staircases you have to take. The breakfast didn't offer too many choices and was limited to English breakfast primarily. The location is couple of kms outside the main Fira area and was mostly deserted in March, so keep that in mind.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good location 7 min from FIRA centre. Partial view of caldera (can't see right side). Great breakfast. Reception hours are short however. No water supply on one morning. Had to use the common toilet which had a trickle of water at 9 am after this was reported at 6 am. Otherwise good and clean and quite spacious room.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small but very nice hotel located between Fira and Firostefani. Splendid view over the caldera, among my top 5 hotels with the best view ever. Nice and helpful staff. Delicious greek breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideal place for holidays. Magnificent skyline with enchanting sunset. Excellent hospitality at the Blue Dolphin Apartment and suites. Memorable stay with fine weather. The porter was extremely helpful. He carried many luggages at the same time without asking for tips. The room is very clean. We are very pleased with all the amenities. Thanks.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very quiet, small hotel which I love. Personal welcome, very friendly and helpfull staff. Beautifull room and big for an economy room! The bed was amazing. Also the (rain) shower was amazing. View from balcony was amazing as well! Super stay I had!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Denis and Theodora, you both really made our stay so perfect. And the wonderful staff, the drivers, everyone went beyond the call of duty. The room....spectacular just like I dreamed of when I look at your site so many months ago. To have it all come true was the best, thank you thank you! I have so many great photographs from the room balcony. xxx Nancy Moon and Steve Gordon
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed at these apartments and all i can say is "Wow".... we were overwhelmed by its position and postcard views. It didn't end there the staff are fantastic nothing was a problem and the food was as good add the views... service couldn't be faulted either. If your looking for some where special look no further
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is amazing, best location, breathtaking views, excellent and very friendly staff. We were offered a free upgrade to the suite, which was an amazing complex of room, yard and terrace with caldera views. Best experience, will definitely visit again and recommend as the best value for money place to stay in Santorini.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at Blue Dolphins! The hotel staff was tremendously helpful and more specifically, Dora was terrific! Not only was she extremely helpful and courteous in answering questions via email prior to the trip, but she also was immensely attentive and caring. During the trip we had a medical issue to deal with and Dora did her best to accommodate with helpful guidance and swift help. ***As a side note, despite the fact that the hotel doesn't have its own on-premise pool, they have a sister hotel, Grand View, which does. Blue Dophins offers a free shuttle service there and it's totally worth the 15 minute ride! Beautiful pool, with an amazing view!***
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment of our arrival to the blue dolphin hotel we had exceptional service. Dennis and his staff were awesome so accommodating. Our room was clean and the perfect size for our 5 person 3 night stay it ihad 2 bathrooms and a large living area with private outdoor eating area and our own terrace with two lounge chairs to take in the breathtaking view. The morning breakfast the hotel provided at the common outside terrace overlooking the Water was fresh with generous options. Dennis arranged our van transportation for all of us to and from ta sister hotel with a gorgeous pool one day and then a beach on other side of island with drinks and food service for our second day. Our transportation driver Edison was so wonderful along with Aldo who walked up and down numerous steps with all of our luggage upon arrival and departure . Blue dolphin is a 10 one of the best places I have stayed.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The people at the reception were very nice. They upgraded us to a cave room. It’s a little dark, but I love the uniqueness of it and has a porch with great view. Every morning I enjoyed relaxing in the porch. There are nice restaurants nearby, and walking distance to Fira. It’s convenient but nice and quiet area. The breakfast was plentiful and tasty. We asked about renting an ATV, they arranged ATV to be dropped off for us to the hotel next morning. We had an amazing time in Santorini and highly recommend this hotel!!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent six nights at the beautiful Blue Dolphins apartments in Santorini. What a perfect stay. Upon our arrival we were informed we shall be staying in the beautiful Canava cave house and as well as the suite with the private balcony for the last night, so this was a nice surprise. Both rooms were unreal and the pictures speak for themselves really. The cleanliness was top notch. Breakfast was continental with a good variety to choose from. And what a beautiful view! Whether it is from the private balcony of either of the two rooms we stayed in, or from the terrace where breakfast is served, the view of the Caldera is just breathtaking. You can easily sit there for hours just admiring the view. The location is also quite perfect. Only about 15mins walk from the centre of Fira. The hotel is also conveniently located a few minutes walking distance from many restaurants, souvenier shops and convenience stores, as well as a bus stop where you can take a bus to the centre of Fira when it is too hot to walk around.
