A final and most important thing: the staff. Everyone was so friendly and extremely helpful in making our stay as comfortable and convenient as possible. Thank you to all of you for making our stay so memorable! We really had nothing to complain about. 100% recommended! ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Helpful friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms, upgraded to Cave Room with private loungers overlooking view. Other rooms open up onto breakfast patio with spectacular views.Walking distance into village with good selection restaurants all with views.Hired scooters and Quad bikes to explore island.Was disappointed that there was no pool as the pictures of the hotel are a bit misleading as it looks like there is a pool/ jacuzzi on site but this is at the sister hotel.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Blue Dolphins. The staff was fantastic and helped with all of our questions/inquiries. The room was very clean and the breakfast was delicious. We highly recommend this for stay in Santorini.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay was pleasant in every way. You get the best view of the caldera from the hotel (no exaggeration), the staff was nice, and the room was so nice. Staying at the hotel made our stay in Santorini even better and ungorgettable, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends or family travelling to Santorini.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first time in Santorini and we absolutely loved this hotel! It was perfectly located as it was a lovey 15-20min walk to Fira, probably quicker than that if you didn’t keep stopping to take in the views. It was notas bustling as Fira, just how we like it, but enough restaurants and shops around for convenience. We hired an ATV, highly recommended, and travelled around the island on this, Oia was just about 20mins away on the ATV. There was always parking for us at the hotel.WiFi was fine I could even video call. We felt the hotel had the best views! And very private unlike the hotels in Oia and Imergovili that we walked by. We could see a great sunset from our romantic suite and also walked to a square in Imergovili to see the sunset on one night. The staff were super friendly and informative especially Theo who did everything to make our stay comfortable and special ! She was very prompt at responding to my emails and even better in person ! She made our trip extremely special with recommendations, booking us tours and even making dinner reservations. Very professional and helpful :)There’s no communal pool at the hotel but who needs to sit in a pool when you have a beautiful island to explore !? The breakfast was simple yet adequate, with fresh fruit and juice and even a daily omelette.We would stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Blue Dolphin has an amazing view of the caldera and the famous blue white Santorini domes from the shared balcony. A delicious breakfast spread with a Caldera view in this patio is a great way to start your day. The rooms we stayed in also had the caldera view although just from the window . Rooms were clean and spacious . The location is at a walking distance from Fira and the bus station there and has many good restaurants nearby . Special mention to the Blue Dolphin staff Dora who was very helpful in explaining the details of the when/ where to go and also for booking and following up on our wine tasting. First taste of Greek coffee( which was later enjoined through the Greece trip) was what she made for us.. They also have a nice pamphlet giving details of the places near( restaurants , transportation etc) which came in very handy. Overall a very nice place to stay and definitely recommenced for Santorini.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First we have to say that we were very well welcomed upon our arrival. Both the views from our room and from the breakfast spot over Firostefani were wonderful. Nice breakfast with fresh natural orange juice. - The room was very cute and its views to the caldera were simply some of the best we saw in the island. You can see the famous Santorini sunset in one of its best spots here; - The staff was very helpful and friendly:- Room and facilities were very clean;- Drinks on the fridge were free;- Free Wifi;We enjoyed very much our stay in the Blue Dolphins and would definitely recommend this property for an wonderful stay in Santorini. Oh, did i already mention the awesome views ?!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, incredible views and unbelievably good staff. Dennis and Dora made us feel like family and Marcos drove us around all of Santorini with a smile and informative nature! Love it!! Would stay here again and again!!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hello, I had booked this hotel on 20th of May-22nd of May. But last minute due to unforeseen circumstances, had to cancel my visit. Although my stay wasn’t refundable at that time, the hotel manager was very kind to let me use the credit for future bookings. I really appreciate that and I cant wait to visit Greece and this hotel since the views from here seem fantastic! Thank you again for all the help.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Please note guest should not need give second thoughts to booking a room at Blue Dolphins with good delicious breakfast with a Caldera view.Theodora at reception was ever so kind and full of hospitality helped all through out the stay.Aldi was also so helpful with luggage to and from hotelDennis helped before and during my stay and organise my transfers from and to Thira port with cheerful blue dolphin drivers.I really felt welcome and got all the help I could ever ask for This included best advise on services and excursions available on the island with easy hotel pick transportation transfer options.If it’s swimming you need as part of the experience please book the sister hotel Grand View ....I’ll stay here againMany thanks Blue Dolphins team for making my stay amazing
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our suite "Sifnos" was splendid.It has a magnificent view to the volcano and the view to the city is awesome,especially at night.The jacuzzi is perfect.We had an excellent breakfast at the balcony.Thank you Dennis!!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at Blue Dolphins recently - service, accommodations, and views were all spectacular. We worked with Dennis prior to our visit, he was able to coordinate airport transfers, rental car, and restaurant recommendations to make our visit easy and enjoyable. The apartments are in a good location if you want to explore the island, easy drive to Oia, walk to Thira, and drive south or get to the airport. The view from the room was fantastic, we could see all of Thira and the caldera. There was a full breakfast each morning, served on a lower deck, that also overlooked the caldera.Overall, we had a great visit and would recommend Blue Dolphins to those looking for accommodations in Firostefani area.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay at Blue Dolphin. Dennis and staff did a great job for our group of 7 to include pick-up, a room upgrade, and advice on activities to do. The view of the caldera from breakfast patio was spectacular. One could sit there all day and watch the changing view throughout the day. And price was very reasonable during off season. Great trip for our family! Thanks Dennis.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel with incredible view !!! I feel like I was flying when I have breakfast, top service with kind and happy faces, Give us positive vibes for our holidays in a magical #santorini island. Thank you for your support and your efforts to spend our moments magical in your small dream lovely BLUE hotel
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After seeking amongst other places to stay, we came to Blue Dolphins and we were so glad to stay in this wonderful hotel! The view to the Caldera and is absolutely stunning, staff is very kind and willing to assist to make your stay unforgettable! If you ever stay there and there is availability, ask for Kallisti suite, with amazing jacuzzi, for a night to remember!Highly recommended!!!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fabulous place to stay in Santorini and incredible value for the money. Can't beat the view, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the rooms are fantastic. Staying here was one of the highlights of my Santorini trip. I had stayed at another hotel in Fira for a few nights then moved to the Blue Dolphin for my last two nights and it was the icing on the cake of an amazing Santorini trip. Mind blowing views with very nice porches/ balconies outside the rooms. People on the walkway above/ behind the hotel consistently walk down the steps to take pictures looking out on the sea, the caldera and the white buildings on the slopes of Fira from right next to the property. Great breakfast also!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the best little gem we could have hoped for in Santorini. Let me get the cons out of the way so I can tell you about all the great stuff! Cons: 1) limited parking shared with another hotel (Hotel Ira). blue dolphin is just behind this one - which makes it a little difficult to find if using GPS. 2) So. Many. Stairs. To get to the reception area and breakfast area, you have to descend what seems like a mountain of stairs, then go up some more stairs until you get to where you need to be. No bueno, but I guess it can’t be helped. 3) If you get a room on the main floor, you will hear every single thing. I heard people talking, closing doors, and even urinating in the rooms above. Rooms on this floor also don’t have the best views and are a little less private ( people walking by your room all the time). Fortunately, we had booked two separate reservations so the next night we moved to the honeymoon suite which allows me to leave the BEST list of pros!!!.....PROS:1) If you can get a suite, DO IT! We had a private balcony with a private hot tub and sun deck overlooking the caldera and santorini rooftops. It was magically glorious. Our room was huge with a morning view of the Aegean Sea and the biggest shower I’ve ever had in my life. The products they provide smell so good and are just sublime. It made this trip so relaxing. Bonus= less stairs to get to our room!!!!! 2) Morning Breakfast included everyday ( it’s the same breakfast, but you can ask to have more or less of something that you really liked).3) Friendly staff! So very nice and accommodating and willing to answer any questions you have about the island and even about the products they have! 4) This could be a pro or con for you depending on whether or not you love cats BUT we had breakfast every morning with a torty colored kitty that we named Fira. I think she’s a local cat that just hangs out on the property, but she’s there every morning ( and sometimes evening) waiting for some handouts. ( I bought some dry cat food from the local supermarket so that she could have a full meal and could leave me my ham!) I miss her already.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are a ton of hotels and apartments in Santorini and it is hard to pick a place. We traveled late in the season and lots of places were already closed, but we were glad that this place stayed open late in the season. The views are amazing, the breakfast was delicious. Our shuttle from the port to the hotel was well worth the cost and our driver even took our luggage to the reception area, which I might add had lots of stairs up and down and would have been a tremendous workout. I think of hotels on the scale of would I go there again and while I would try a different spot on my next trip, I wouldn't mind staying here again. Consider having the hotel call to get you a quad to rent, they made the renting process easy and you can't beat getting picked up by the company to get your rental.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel! They served a delicious breakfast every morning either on the patio or in your room if the weather wasn't the best. We were also able to schedule a pick up from the airport. The staff is super friendly and helpful with local tips. Oh and the view is to die for!!!!! Everyday our rooms were cleaned and we had fresh sheets and towels. Loved how personal it was! Great place and experience thank you Blue Dolphin!!!!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We finished our trip with 5 days in Santorini.Since our arrival at the harbour until the end of holiday, the personal were very kind and helpful. They were always present to answer at our questions, they proposed us many activities to discover Santorini and they gave us tips about restaurants. The breakfast was varied with a lot of choices (eggs, cereals, a variety of bread, fruit, juices,..) and the view was more beautiful than on the pictures of the site. But at a certain hour, there was not enough place for everybody, it was very annoying. Our room was very clean (by the way, the cleaning ladies were nice), it was spacious like on pictures, the bathroom was modern, the bed was comfortable. We had a balcony with a beautiful view and it was very pleasant. With the heat, having a little swimming pool would have been great.The hotel is situated near by the center of Fira, in average 10 minutes by foot via quiet ways, not with cars. In Fira, there are many shops and restaurants. It’s the animated place.There are also good restaurants next to the hotel.In the end, the staff picked us up to the airport. The members of the personal were nice.
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! What incredible views this place has. We stayed in a romantic suite and in my opinion it has one of the best views as it is just round from Fira so not only do you get sea views you get the amazing Caldera. We got some amazing photos on our balcony. Friendly service and very clean. We love the picturesque walk into Fira it takes us about 20minutes. Would definitely stay again and recommend to my friends and family. A+++
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is beautiful and the room was spacious! The bed and pillows were very comfortable. And we had our own balcony. The room is a bit pricier, but the view from your balcony or from.this.hotel. Of fira is.amazing!!! Highly recommend this place if ur willing to splurge a bit. The staff were nice as well. Overall, amazing stay here and would come back and recommend. It's close enough to the action but quiet enough as well which is what we liked. Thank you!!! :)
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't have a view from our room but it didn't matter. We stepped out of our room and had a view of the whole caldera, it was amazing. The staff was friendly and upbeat. The guy who checked us in was honest ( he told us not to do the 3 hr walk to Oia-it said the views are all the same). The nice lady that checked us out was able to pack us a light breakfast since we had to leave very early. How nice!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great find! This place offers incredible value for the price. Valseles (sp?) was so friendly as we arrived at 7am before the town was awake but he was here starting to clean up for the day and gave my wife and I a room to nap in until breakfast was served and we could speak to a receptionist. Keep in mind this is a small town feel more like an inn or bnb but that’s what makes the experience. He then invited us for breakfast even though we were not checked in which was nice. Shen they were ready Dennis checked us in way early as a room was opened up early. The best part was that they wanted to get us in a room early so they put us in an upgraded room (standard to cave) but the best part was that they said they would put us in a private villa house on our last night. OMG. What a great deal and kind staff. Definitely recommended unless you’re expecting a pretentious luxury type of hotel. Hope this review helps!
hotelName:
3    Blue Dolphins Apartments & Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location within the heart of Fira. You can easily walk to many restaurants and pubs and won’t need to take a taxi, which was wonderful.The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. My friend and I both had rolling suitcases and were worried about negotiating the many steps, but the staff were so kind and helpful and carried our bags all the way down to our room for us. The staff at the front desk were so helpful in providing information on the island, restaurants to visit, etc. They also helped us arrange a taxi on our last morning to take us to the airport.The room we had was a cave style and was really unique. Clean and comfortable, we had no complaints. Breakfast was included and was very good as well! On our last morning, we had to leave very early, but the staff went above and beyond by leaving breakfast in our fridge for us the night before. The best part about this hotel was the view! Situated cliffside, you have an amazing view of the caldera.Highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Fira!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property was great all around. It has an amazing sunset/city view, a fantastic pool, and very friendly/helpful staff who go above and beyond to help travelers (esp. the owner, bartender, and office staff) The rooms were nice and clean. Beach/rustic as described previously. The location is a bit of a hike to town (10-15 minutes walking + steep hills), however one could take a car, motorcycle, or the hotel shuttle (not free) into town as well. Would recommend/stay again!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent three nights in this nice hotel on the edge of the caldera. Location is on the very center of the Fira, and it was only couple of minutes walk to the main street and the the restaurants, bars etc. We had a room with balcony with caldera view, and the sunset was just spectacular. Hotel rooms and facilities are not new, but clean and hotel has nice style which we loved. Oh, and there was a small pool/jacuzzi also, not suitable for swimming but it was nice to relax there for a while. Breakfast was served on terrace, also with caldera view. Staff was friendly and helpful, thank you!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of many hotels built into the hillside (cliffs). The view from our room and the many available terraces were stunning. We were met by Lorenzo who guided us through the throngs of people to get us to the hotel. Dimitri at checkin was courteous, polite and very helpful. Our room was at the top of the hotel and had awe inspiring views. A small bottle of wine was provided on our arrival. Our main reason for visiting Santorini was to (hopefully) catch a sunset. We were not disappointed. We got some stunning photographs and will cherish the memories forever.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect, views stunning, staff so lovely - especially Dina, Dimitri and Hassan, our family loved our stay here, however I cant rate this any higher as we were deeply concerned about the suffering of the hotel pets. Im sure the owner means well but does not understand how to best care for these poor creatures. We expressed our concern several times but were dismissed. I promised myself and our children that I would at least share these photos in a public review in the hope that something might change.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place has THE BEST VIEWS!!!! And THE BEST STAFF!!! The cave rooms are charming, we had room 12 with our two teen daughters which had two separated living areas and a private court yard with beautiful flora and fauna looking out over the caldera!!! The staff were all so hard working and super kind. They never seemed to leave the hotel-and always were smiling-unbelievable. This is not a hotel for people who have mobility concerns, or who desire a modern posh decor. This is a romantic, quirky place with breathtaking views (I think the best on the island after exploring most of it). As a traveler to 29 countries, this has been one of the best places we have ever stayed. We highly recommend early to mid April to avoid the crowds, and to enjoy a peaceful sunset on your own terrace!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were warmly welcome by Dimitris , with all the information we needed to explore the island, eg :places to go, restaurants, busses timings , and everything else we need. He is very friendly and genuinely nice. Secondly, The view of the hotel is amazing ! Continental breakfast is good , with the view of volcano , with selection of bread, fruits, hot beverages and fresh juices ! However, we were in room 30 and the WiFi does not work at all ,also the bathroom cleanliness can be improved :)
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hello,The staff were wonderful, the view even better, the breakfast hearty. The room pretty ok, bathroom less so (tiny, dark).My main concern is with the lack of safety on one set of wide, sloping outside steps when wet that resulted in serious injury for me. The management had posted a sign about hazardous when wet, so I knew it, and was purposefully stepping carefully, with my R hand on the railing; wearing flat walking shoes. Despite all this, after a rain, my ankle torqued on the step, and that was all it took. I came home to find I had not a sprained ankle, but one in which many bones were broken, necessitating major surgery and months of recuperation, not to mention money! Now, could some of the breakage be due to poor bone health? Possibly. But who wants to incur even a sprained ankle on vacation? (And, someone older than myself might have pitched down the stairs when their ankle torqued, resulting in worse injury.)I have written the hotel management twice recommending that the design and construction of these steps be improved on. No response back, thus this reluctant review, b/c I feel people need to know. The steps I fell on have this problem: they are painted (so surface more slippery); they are slightly cratered, so grip not as sure; and, they tilt somewhat downward. All this combines to make them very hazardous when wet. I loved the hotel personnel, so don't want to put their jobs at risk. But, after no reply from the owner, I feel I need to warn folks. If you go, be VERY, VERY careful on those steps when wet.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our time staying at the Hotel Kavalari. We stayed in room 14. A very small room but an awesome view from our balcony. We spent a lot of time enjoying our view. The front desk staff was awesome and was very helpful. Only drawback was the bellhop we nicknamed Lurch. I think he was trying to impress us with how strong he was when taking our bags to the room. He didn't like us much from the moment he came to get our bags. No eye contact, grunted and pointed when we asked questions. It was comical and we took it in stride because everything else there was perfect. I recommend this hotel highly even if Lurch was cranky.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Loved it! Location is perfect, 1 block from bus station ( good service and 1.50 Eu), on the main tourist street. Views are super nice, full breakfast was good ( Yogurt, cold meats, juice, croissants, etc) Staff was friendly and informative, Dina was very sweet and helpful. Don't expect a 4 star hotel based on the american standarts but it is clean and rates are very good. There are lots of stairs if you get a room on the lower levels and may be painful if you have knee problems. I recommend this hotel 100%
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The management was more than accommodating, helping us with many details, such as arranging transportation when requested, carrying luggage to and from our room, etc. The location is very central and convenient to shopping and restaurants, but be warned, there are many, many stairs (there were 80 to our room!). I am sure this is not unusual, as there are many other hotels built on the cliffs, but those with health issues should just be warned. The views are amazing! The rooms are a bit quirky, like having to turn on a boiler 15 minutes before using the shower and not being able to flush toilet paper. But this is a small island with limited resources, so patience should be considered. WiFi is limited, we could only get it outside.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sitting on the patios or the dipping pool at any time of day is magnificent. This hotel is truly terrific value as others have said, and well located for easy access to buses, day trips, might life and all the rest. If my partner and I found Thira itself to be a bit too commercially intense, we found Kavalari the perfect refuge. Helpful staff, lovely rooms, great location. You’ll feel like royalty.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Kavalari is a gorgeous heritage style hotel. The view from our room was amazing looking directly out at the cruise shops in the caldera. The room was lovely with separate sitting area and had French doors that led onto the balcony. The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful in organizing our tour with a great tour company. It is located in one of the best spots with all restaurants and bars a few steps away. The sunset view was gorgeous and one of the best places to watch it from our balcony. Breakfast is lovely served on the terrace and includes fresh pastries, meats, cheeses, fruits and jams. We loved this hotel and recommend it as one of the most affordable and best places to stay.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are so many expensive and luxury hotels in Fira and generally on Santorini, but if you want to experience Old world charm , traditional Greece and Greek hospitality I warmly recommend this hotel - real jewel in the heart of Fira. I am not just talking about position and hospitality , but also about the breathtaking view of Caldera , excellent breakfast with best coffee and staff who is always ready to help and make your holiday unforgettable. Sometimes it seems they can read your thoughts and fulfill your wishes like the magicians If you want to avoid too many stairs as well as moldy room and if you are someone who likes to enjoy at your own balcony I strongly recommend Superior room with Caldera view. It is really worth to pay little bit more to completely enjoy in this wonderful hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family was excited to spend the night at the Kavalari. This hotel was featured on a Rudy Maxa travel DVD, and the reviews on TripAdvisor were just as complimentary. Upon our arrival, the hotel was very accommodating in holding our luggage until checkin - much appreciated. The room had an amazing view of the Caldera and Santorini. During the day, we enjoyed the hotel very much. It was quiet with exceptional views and access to all the shops/dining in Fira. But at night, all that tranquility was replaced with loud disco music. We couldn't sleep. And the AC, more like a dehumidifier, was inadequate. Our room, especially the bathroom, had visible black mold and smelled along with the smell of sewage. What a shame! A lovely spot for the day, but do not spend the night if you plan on sleeping. You won't get any rest!!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at this location for 5 nights in early August. The staff at front desk were fantastic. I can't remember the gentlemen's name at front desk but he was great and went above and beyond to provide great service and support. We felt at home at this hotel.Breakfast is great with a stunning view. The gentlemen that served breakfast was great and went out of his way to provide excellent service. Nothing beets a great view while you are enjoying a wonderful greek breakfast. Don't miss the sunset views as they are great from hotel. We enjoyed the rather small hot tub daily after being out exploring the island. Sunset as I said is amazing. Location of the hotel is fantastic. We would recommend this hotel to all.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly, you pay for the view - and only the view. Friendly staff are another bonus, but you will not get: quiet (near clubs and busy balconies with guests moving around at all hours), toilet where paper can be flushed, water pressure, or easy access as there are a lot of steps. Breakfast service will take more than 30 minutes, just to get the attention of someone. Think twice...Will you sit on the balcony and enjoy the view for hours or could you do that at a nice restaurant?And, consider having a pool...
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really great hotel with smiley/friendly staff In such a perfect and easy location - up the stairs from the lobby takes you to one of the Main Streets (picture 1) with clear, open views of the sun, sunset, sea, caldera, Thirasia and part of Oia too. Very beautiful views from all angles of the hotel too; especially from our superior double room with caldera views (pictures 6-10)Every time we opened our room door we said ‘wow’, and every time we came down the steps (5th picture) from the lobby to our balcony we were in awe of the views. Really couldn’t get enough of the views!We sat at our balcony every single morning/afternoon and evening. Whenever we were back at the hotel we were sitting there.Much preferred our views here than we did in Oia.Our room was white, clean and more spacious than it appears from the the pictures the hotel provides. Unfortunately I never took any pictures of the room. But it opened into a wide open bedroom/sitting area. Straight in front of the door were the beds next to each other both with mini tables either side and spotlights behind the beds. To the right alongside the wall is a wardrobe. And behind that is a door leading to the bathroom. The bathroom was fairly small in comparison but enough to do what you needed to use it for. The shower is a little basic and requires waiting for hot water before using it but the temperature of the water we had was more than ideal considering the very hot weather outside Back in the main room, to the very left of the room door is a corner sofa/sofa bed with a tv on a cupboard containing a fridge. Soft drinks and water were provided in the fridge (at a small price) but better to have them to hand than not at all. We did have some and it was very cheap anyway. Next to the sofa there was a vanity table with plates/mugs and kettle too. The room has Air conditioning as well as a fan/light on the ceiling in the middle of the room.The hotel is approximately a 5 minutes walk to the main bus stop in Fira as well as the local taxi rank for easy travel. The hotel staff are also more than happy to arrange your travel for you if you prefer. They provide you with a map and a hotel leaflet as soon as you check in. The leaflet provides information on top excursions and the staff are more than happy to give you their recommendations of tips. We didn’t get to try out the excursions due to pre planned days out but if we had more time we definitely would have.Despite the location, it isn’t noisy or uncomfortably loud. There was a bar/restaurant to the above/to the left of our room/balcony which you could sometimes hear the music if you were sitting at the balcony but it wasn’t overbearing or annoying at allThe hotel restaurant for breakfast (from 8am) was 2 levels below us, if we peered over our balcony we could see the tables set out overlooking the sea/caldera. We never got round to trying breakfast there unfortunately as we were always up and out early morning.Only downside was that WiFi/signal could be very temperamental at the hotel. At times it worked fine and offers we couldn’t use anything, especially in the room itself. The WiFi was better on the balcony as the hotel assures you anyway. But considering you don’t spend a great deal of time in the room as you explore Santorini it wasn’t a deal breaker. Just needs improving (that was our only reason for 4/5 stars)We would definitely return to this hotel/location if we were to visit Santorini again.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 days there and were very satisfied with our choice. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice. Location was spot on as far as being on the caldera and near anything you needed. Less than 10 minutes walk to bus depot. So you can go anywhere you desire. Also right across from hotel were several restaurants, 1 which I will review. And a great cocktail bar 30 yards from hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel last week, it is right in the center of Fira with amazing caldera views. There is nothing like watching the sunset from your balcony at this hotel. The people were all very kind and helpful, and breakfast was great in the morning!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nts in May/June 2018 and we absolutely loved it. It was the perfect location. Our room was situated nicely for 3 guests. The staff were excellent and were there for any of your needs. I loved the breakfast on the terrace every morning along with with watching the sunsets every night. We will definitely be back and plan on staying here again.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my wife to Santorini for a surprise bday, found this great hotel with amazing views, enjoyable breakfast and met gracious / beautiful people working at the hotel. Konstantina is a wonderful host, assisted me with booking a restaurant after my initial choice did not have a table to watch the sunset. Her knowledge of santorini, places to visit made our experience so much more enjoyable. Dimistrios helped us get around the island with assistance with transportation and knowledge of the island. They are wonderful and so friendly, we would have liked to stay longer. Rooms were very comfortable, breakfast - especially the Greek yogurt, fruit and morning pastries, with coffee gives you the time to enjoy the morning view. Highly recommend the location of this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed staying in Hotel Cavalari. The view is great and the spaces are clean and neat. I recommend it for anyone who wants to visit Santorini. Its not very expensive like other hotels i looked.so its possible for anyone to book a room.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In all the world, there is no place like the Caldera View...this is a must. You get this view for breakfast, then sunset - which is really the best place to watch it from your own terrace. This hotel is very unique, multiple terraces, most are shared, but you can a quite spot if you want. We felt the value was the best in all of Greece. Amazing staff, clean rooms, delicious breakfast - endless food!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Kavalari is in a great location in Fira, on the caldera. From the hotel entrance you are within easy walking distance to shops, restaurants, and the bus station.There are a lot of stairs to get down to your room, but this is average for the caldera hotels and worth it for the views. Speaking of views, you don't need to bother getting a room with a private balcony here. The multi-level patio/balcony/terrace of the hotel is amazing. There are different levels and seat groupings, so if you want to sit and enjoy a glass of wine at sunset, you can find a spot with relative privacy.My room was spacious and included a closet, iron, ironing board, vanity, and a built in couch. The air conditioning and lights are controlled by your key card (as with many hotels in Greece). This can be inconvenient if it's extremely hot since you will come back to a warm room. But we found that it cooled down quickly.Breakfast is served on the terrace. It was a great meal - meat and cheese plate, yogurt, fresh cut fruit, fresh juice, and a basket of breads and spanakopita.I would definitely stay here again if I return to Santorini.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located on the cliffs overlooking the Aegean Sea, Hotel Kavalari is situated the middle of the all the action in the town of Fira. However, just a few steps down to the hotel rooms and terraces gives you an oasis from all the hubbub of the shops and tourists. The rooms are comfortable and clean, with great views. There are a considerable number of steps going down to some of the rooms, but the views are well worth it! A wonderful breakfast is served out on the terrace every morning. The breakfast included pastries, cheese, cold cuts, fruit, fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee and the best Greek yogurt we've ever had. The staff was warm and friendly and an endless source of information for places to visit, restaurants and great tips about navigating the island.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Hotel Kavalari was amazing. Right from the start, when I booked our 3 rooms, their Customer Service was outstanding. My many emails were answered within 24 hours. The Hotel Kavalari arranged our transfers from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the port. Because the hotel is in an non-accessible vehicle location, the hotel had a staff person meet us at the end of the street and take our luggage to the hotel. He then carried our luggage to our hotel room which was located many steps down from the main street. Our room, #14, was wonderful. It overlooked the sea which a patio balcony. We had twin beds, which we requested, and the room was spotless. We had a cave room and the experience was very memorable. Breakfast, located on the patio overlooking the sea, was included and it was delicious. Service was wonderful. The Hotel Kavalari is in a perfect location; walking distance to all of the shopping, restaurants, cable car, donkey rides, etc. The Hotel does not have a pool only a small spa pool. It was such a fabulous way to experience Santorini. My family and I would definitely stay at the Hotel Kavalari again. Thank you, Hotel Kavalari, for a wonderful vacation!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location and view from this hotel make it absolutely excellent! Yes, the rooms are a bit dated (even in the Executive rooms), and the beds are a bit hard. However, the staff and views make up for these small shortcomings. Also, if you rent a quad/buggy, there is a close parking lot down near the hotel Atlantis which is a very short walk!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although our room was small we had a fantastic view and positioned close to entrance and breakfast terrace.....what a fantastic way to start the day having breakfast with that superb view! Dimetrious and Maria helped to make our stay very special with their genuine friendliness and knowledge of the island .I recommend using Wifi in Reception area .
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: £180 pounds for a smelly cave without the promised view. One has to pre plan the heating for the shower, the bed was small and uncomfortable. What a terrible hotel. The management attitude was no can do ("read the small print, although all the pictures show a sea view from the room be happy to walk out to a shared terrace and see it from there"). Will not be returning and would recommend. R
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well iooked after by Maria Demitri Alex & Eric who made our stay most enjoyable.Rooms were a good size with plenty of storage space.Great view from our room and very close to the centre of town. Thanks again.11out of 10
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for something a bit different, this is it! Great location with rooms carved out of the side of the cliff. Lots of steps so be prepared for your daily workout climbing the hillside but very comfortable rooms, great terraces to sit out in for breakfast or take in the sun with spectacular views including the famous Santorini sunset. Maria was very helpful on reception and Alexander picked up both of our 24kg bags together and carried them up and down the steps without breaking stride. We loved this hotel!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Kavalari is nice hotel, with amazing ocean view, in the best possible location in Fira - Santorini. Truly beautiful view and friendly staff. Close to clubs, restaurants and shopping area. Loved it!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a solo traveller I am always looking for somewhere that feels like home. Hotel Kavalari is just that. The staff are warm, exceptionally helpful and genuinely hospitable. The view is staggering. The location is perfect as it is central to everything. This isn't one of the high end hotels but it is incredibly well priced for the service and facilities. Maria, in particular, felt like a sister to me and I looked forward to our morning chat every day before each adventure. Such a sweet hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel with my wife, we loved the hotel, is perfect for couples. The cantera view is fantastic, the rooms are spacious and are built and decorated in the traditional greek style. Personnel in this hotel is very friendly and is always willing to help and to answer questions. The hotel is located downtown Fira.Breakfast is delicious. Be prepared to climb up and down, which is part of the Santorini experience.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has amazing view, one can see that even from the room. The location is great as in it is near to bus stand and car/taxi can also come till hotel atlantis, which just 2 minutes from the hotel. from there the hotel guy come for pickup. For any other hotel which is in between fira and imerovigli one may needs to walk alot and that is on slop. Also the super markets and other souvenir shops are nearby. The hotel do not have kitchen so you cant get anything other than breakfast. I think most of the hotel there do not have kitchen as there are so many nice restaurants around.The staff is very helpful - (Dimitris, Marina). They have kettle in room but they do not refill tea/coffee.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for four nights, great view and location, friendly and helpful staff, generous breakfast, clean room,but very basic, fridge very noisy,limited TV channels, wifi works best outside the room! It's the "View" what makes the hotel special and rectifies the price!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night at hotel kavalari. The staff were very helpful and the view spectacular. The bathroom was fairly basic and the rooms small. The amenities were a little dated...you are paying for the fantastic view.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It doesn't get much better than being able to sit on a terrace and enjoy an amazing view of Santorini's caldera with a glass of complimentary wine in your hand. Or I suppose it does get better when your room is bright and comfortable, your bathroom has a cool cave-like look, the staff is all friendly and helpful, and the breakfast tasty, filling, and served on a terrace with that great view. And to top it all off, the price is completely reasonable for what you get.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location,spectacular view, great service and very nice hotel. The staff was amazing and helpful. Santorini is a magical place. The stay was a great experience. I love Fira. It's a beautiful hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Kavalari is easy to get to, just a short walk from the public bus depot in Fira. The view is spectacular over the volcano and cliffs of Santorini, and breakfast is served on one of the terraces. The staff were great and helped us with maps, advice and also sorted out a couple of problems for us.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a really nice place to stay. The hotel is clean and staff is really nice and welcoming. The surprice was all the stairclimbing we had to endure. But our luggage was an easypeasy task for the bellboy (size "He-Man"), he ran up and down the 70 or so steps. The view was spectacular and I had breakfast with a live talkative parrot. Hahaha Hope to revisit them on a later occation.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first person most of us meet when staying at a hotel is the reception clerk. Maria checked me in and she is the reason my rating is 4 stars rather than 3 or 3.5 stars. Personable and helpful, Maria is an asset to the hotel.The hotel is located on "Gold Street" and overlooks the water. The positive is that the guest has a fantastic view of the sea. The negative is that the guest has to negotiate steep stairs, the kind that can cause heart attacks.My room was, at first glance, a disappointment; in fact I compared it in my mind to monks' chambers. But after I saw the bathroom, I fell in love.While breakfast is not buffet style, it is both tasty and more than adequate. However it is unchanging which leads to ennui.Several things which, if they had been provided, would have improved the quality of my stay: 1- a laundry bag, 2- facial tissues 3- a washcloth
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just came back from Greece we had an amazing time amazing view and incredible place to relax and enjoy our vocation and the people were friendly Can't stop talking about this amazing hotel really clean and comfortable
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I just got back from Greece! We were originally booked to stay at a different hotel and at the last minute we were switched to Hotel Kavalari! Best thing that happened to us in Santorini. The view alone from this hotel was worth the trip to Greece. The rooms were adorable and the staff was absolutely great. The location is perfect for shopping, eating and exploring on your own.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Beautiful and well kept patio with a great view. Even though it's right downtown, was quiet and private. Staff was so nice and helpful. Kristos, a member of the staff, was the BEST. Great wifi. Comfortable bed. Shower was cold, though. If that's a deal breaker.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in Fira, easy to find and on the edge of the caldera. I had the single room which was great value, clean and on a terrace with caldera views. Breakfast with a view every morning included!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you can handle a few stairs (quite a few in all honesty), this hotel has character and is in a great location, plus breakfast was yummy. My room was near the bottom (so more stairs) and had a charming bathroom (cliff wall partially exposed.) My two traveling companions were less lucky as one had a room with a loft but no real window and the other was right next to the breakfast kitchen. But my room was great and clean and we all loved sitting on the terraces drinking our wine and watching the sun set.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is at one of the best locations in Fira, looking out on Nea Kameni island. Situated in the caldera, the views are magnificent. The rooms are spacious, mostly with private balconies or terraces. An excellent breakfast is served on the common terrace. The bus station is a short walk away, as are the local shops.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After having visited Santorini many times and always promising myself a stay at the Kavalari …finally made it! Possible the best views on the Island , beautifully maintained property in traditional Cycladic architecture. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the Cave Apartments which really did make our stay better than anticipated. Huge living space , enough for a family of four , seating area , dining area, separate sleeping area and a wonderful shower. Couldn ‘t have asked for more. The terraces were wonderfully maintained , and the views are spectacular from every part of the hotel no matter which terrace you stay at .Owing to the nature of the place itself , would not recommend for anyone who is not so mobile/fit, or is scared of heights as there are many steps around the property. The steps however are wide and clearly marked so its not a big problem. This review would not be complete with a well deserved praise for the breakfast – absolutely stunning setting and beautifully presented with fresh greek yoghurt and freshly squeezed juice every morning, along with pastries , cold cuts and tea and coffee. I would def stay there again for sure , the staff especially Maria were wonderful and welcoming and very helpful in every way.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So we came to Santorini via the 9:00 am Highspeed 7 Ferry from Heraklion. I had informed the hotel in advance that I'll be arriving before the official check-in time of 2 pm. When we reached the hotel, it was around 12:40 +/- 10 mins. We requested for a early check-in. The receptionist, named Maria, refused. We had a pickup for our Sailing Trip at 1:35, and we needed to freshen up, having started our day early, so we requested again and she refused us rudely. Its understandable if the room is not ready at 12:45 .. all we wanted was that we have access to the bathroom, and they can cleanup later, but her attitude was stone cold and haughty. She didnt allow us to check out the room she would be giving us either.Anyway, we come back from our sailing trip around 7 pm and guess what : she gave us a TWIN BED ROOM. WHO GIVES A COUPLE ON A HONEYMOON A TWIN BED ROOM. This really put us off. Luckily she wasnt around, there was another receptionist and he was good enough and he changed the room. Never mind that the room had no balcony, as promised, the fan creaked throughout the night (it was switched off) for reasons we couldnt fathom, but this receptionist was helpful overall and we felt he did the best he could.Finally we check out after 2 days, and at 11:55 am we get a call from the horrible receptionist asking us our checkout time. We said we want 20 minutes, and her reply was "You should know the rules. If you stay any extra, it would be chargeable". IS SHE WORKING IN A HOTEL OR THE GOVERNMENT ? We were not ready, and honestly pissed off, but thought its best to leave quitely and asap.I could clearly see that other guests were not treated the same way. People were checking out at 12:30, 1 etc., and being Asian, I know what this means. They should clearly say people of so-and-so countries are not welcome.All other hotels in Greece treated us superbly I must say. We got free room upgrades, complementary wine as we were on our honeymoon from all of them. It not that we expected this from this hotel, or we should have expected, but a basic decency and courtesy goes a long way. Its a hygiene factor. The experience here left a better taste in our mouth.Apart from the receptionist. things were good at the hotel. The bell-boy and the breakfast waiter were excellent and kind. The hotel has nice interiors and its priced ok. One minor negative was that the room had no ventilation and had a musty smell about it.Final word: IF YOU ARE ASIAN, AVOID THIS !
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Kavalari was absolutely beautiful in every way. The location was central, views from the cliff are breathtaking. The staff are warm and welcoming, the breakfast was suberb! Comfortable rooms. Nothing bad to say.Would stay here again and again! Was very sad to leave!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel offered warm and friendly service but it's most advantageous attraction is its location. It is perched way above the uniquely tiered undulating clifftops of Santorini. It is wow factor material indeed! The staff were fantastic and saw to our every need. However, the rooms are very dated, including the bathrooms, which were very old and pokey. The door to the mini bar fell off when we tried to open it. If they updated this very tired property, it would be magnificent. From that perspective, I didn't think it was value for money. Whilst I accept this is a fantastic, bucket-list destination, I do think it is a slight rip off to charge top rates for a property that doesn't deliver. If it were not for the staff, I would have been very disappointed. My recommendation? Upgrade your rooms and I'll return!!!!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If your after a place to stay in santorini Fira with amazing views, friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms and in a great location... This is the hotel for you :) I can not say anything bad about this hotel. The view from this hotel is breathtaking, right on the cliff face. The staff are absolutely amazing, speak great English and are very very helpful. Location is amazing, surrounded by all the shops and resturants and bars. Breakfast was great & again service at breakfast was great. We will definitely be back to santorini and will 100% book at hotel Kavalari again and again.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Kavalari
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated between Oil and Fira which is just great! The location of the hotel offers breathtaking views! The hotel offered us peace and tranquility. It was a refreshing place to stay after spending time in the more crowded areas in the island. Their daily breakfast was also a nice treat to wake up to each morning. The only reason for not providing an overall rating of 5 stars was just on the format of the room given that it is a 5 star rated hotel. It was a bit odd having a bed that was adjacent to the wall and having to jump over to get out of the bed to use the restroom, it felt a bit confining. That was the only minor feedback, we had an amazing time there and would recommend staying at the hotel! The staff really makes you feel at home and welcomed! They really try their best to make sure their guests are having a great time.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Santorini is a very fascinating part of the world...we have been there 4 times!!! This was our second time at the Santorini Princess. We were so amazed from our first experience that we decided to go back with some friends. Expectations were really high... and they have all been more than satisfied, we had a great and unforgettable experience!!! Santorini is full of great places where to stay but the Santorini Princess has something unique: the atmosphere and the amazing staff. From the reception, to the restaurant, to the General Manager, to the cleaners, a genuine sense of hospitality, they make you feel at home. Its location is also special: close enough to Oia, Imerovigli town, Fira, but away from the crowd and tourists passing by and looking into your patio. Special thanks to Giorgia, she is always there when you need her and she makes your holiday something really special.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before writing about the property, where to stay in Santorini was a challenging task. Oia has all iconic picture postcard pics but even in good resorts there is no privacy, Fira is vibrant with cafes but similar problem of tourists all around your hotel. Hence I chose Imerovigli. Coming to Santorni princess, I have reviewed over 40 hotels all across the globe but never had this strange feeling of belongingness as in this property. The moment you step in you are treated as a family member. We reached 3 hrs before check in time, we were taken to their restaurant served juices, wine, cut fruit. I stayed in quadruple room , room has a huge living room, 2 bed rooms, 2 washrooms, a sit out with beautiful view of sea & Caldera. Safe deposit box has conventional key, the electronic system has been disconnected. Perfect housekeeping, restaurant has nice view, I had requested for gluten free bread & there it was. In room dining was good so was the dinner. Transfer service to Fira, Oia is provided by hotel at reasonable charge. That's a huge plus point in Santorini, you give a call & there the hotel van will be there. It's cheaper than any taxi. Manager greets and inquires about your requirements. But the central point is Georgia, a bundle of energy who takes care of everything. What's bad in Santorini Princess, well it's saying good bye. This feeling I never had in any hotel all across the globe.If you are visiting Santorni, don't search too much , just grab the available room.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent a week at the Princess Spa with a friend and we will definitely be going back. Not because of the location - which was amazing. Not because of the peace and quiet - which was heavenly. Not because of the hotel facilities - which were faultless. Not because of the food - which was delicious. But the friendly, nothing too much trouble, incredible attention to detail of the team just blew us away. We felt like we were with friends and that is how we were treated.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the Santorini Princess 2 years ago and again a few weeks ago.We don’t often visit the same place twice but we could not wait to return to our favourite destination.I don’t even know where to start!!I am a travel agent and have been lucky enough to travel to lots of beautiful places but the Santorini Princess is my favourite hotel by far.It has all been said before...The stunning location cannot be beaten,the views,the sunsets the food the spa but most of all the staff and customer service are what makes this hotel in a league of its own.From the reception staff to the cleaning staff,the bar/restaurant staff to the drivers each and every one deserve a mention.However Mr Vaios the manager & Georgia the assistant manager went above and beyond to ensure our stay was just perfect!!They greet you like close friends and treat you like family and I cannot thank them enough for what they did for us throughout our stay.I can wholeheartedly say we will be returning to the Santorini Princess in the near future.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Santorini, Greece was even better than we imagined. The sights, the architecture, the weather, the food, the music, but mostly the people. 100% incredibly nice people. From those in the hospitality industry to people we met on the street. Really awesome people. And this particular property was absolutely amazing. Clean. Comfortable. Stunning views from every inch of the hotel. But mostly the management and staff made you feel like you were dignitaries staying in their own home. They anticipated your every desire and need and proactively took care of you. Georgia provided numerous recommendations for dining and things to do and always checked in on us to make sure we were simply happy. Sachis the driver was extremely reliable and a whole. Inch of fun. You can not go wrong staying here! We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I never write reviews, but the Santorini Princess Hotel exceeded our expectations so much that it seemed necessary. The views from the hotel were absolutely amazing. We ventured to Fira, Imerovigli, and Oia, but the best views (especially sunset) were from the hotel. Every staff member goes above and beyond. With delicious beverages, and daily sweet surprises/souvenirs in our room, they truly go the extra mile. On the last day of our stay, at the pool, a very strong wind gust came in briefly and whisked my sarong high into the air and far away. Everyone watched as the wind carried it away and I was devastated to lose one of my favorite items of clothing. I accepted it was gone, but then 4-5 of the staff members grouped together to try and find it, and one of them climbed down a very steep hill to retrieve it!!! I had not even asked them to, as I knew it would be very difficult to get to. They worked so hard to get it for me, and even took extra time after to make sure it was clean and folded it up to give back to me. This is just one example of their next level service and care. Thank you so much Santorini Princess Hotel!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Congratulations to the Santorini Princess Spa Hotel for completing the management team with Mr. Yiannis Chousiadis, an exceptional restaurant manager who can always represent, for any top hotel, a guarantee of quality service. His professional qualities proven in Thassos remain for us unforgettable memories. We regret that we did not know in advance the resort where we can find him to plan our holiday at your hotel. We wish you a great success and we promise you that, as soon as we have the opportunity, we will visit you with great pleasure.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow - where do I start with this fantastic destination. Prior to our arrival Amy and I were given a free upgrade to the Presidential Suites in Akrotiri which if you get the chance to go it’s a must. The accommodation is a private villa with its own pool and hot tub along with unbelievable views across the Caldera. Corinna who is the manager and all her staff were absolutely first class and we wanted for nothing. They are all very attentive and nothing is too much trouble. The service we had whilst there (3 nights) was just great. The villa itself was spotless and included a gym and lounge area. Our food which was served in our villa was very good and our breakfast (which was pre ordered the night before) was brought to us at our time of choice by the staff.We did have a slight accounting issue between the Presidential Suites and the hotel but this was more than made up for by the offer of free drinks and massages.We were then transferred free of charge to the hotel which is situated in the North of the island close to Imerovigli. Again on our arrival at the hotel the staff were amazing and we were given a tour of the place and also a gree glass of wine and chocolate, which I thought was a very nice gesture.Whilst at the hotel we ate in the restaurant and the food was excellent with lots of choice. The staff were very knowledgable and were really proud of promoting local food and wine. We are twice in the restaurant and couldn’t fault anything - again we were offered free bottles of wine.The staff also recommended other places to eat and see. The hotel has 3 shuttle vehicles and for a small fee they will take you anywhere on the island. We visited Oia which is very busy with narrow streets - if you do go there avoid the days when the cruise ships dock as it does get extremely crowded. It is a must visit though. Take the steps down to Amoudi bay where you can get some amazing fish dishes at the restaurants.We walked the costal route back to our hotel which is well worth it as the views across the Caldera are stunning. It is about 6 miles so take plenty of water if you do decide to do this.On the recommendation of the hotel we ate at other restaurants (Lefkes in Finikia which was on the walk back from Oia) fantastic food and also Aegean in Imerovigli which had views across the Caldera with a stunning sunset.We also did the sunset Catamaran boat trip which was a tad expensive but again our crew made the trip for us as they we very knowledgeable. The food they served as well was fabulous. Again we saw a fantastic sunset anchored out at sea.I would like to give a special mention to Corrina who is the manager at the Presidential Suites and to Mr Vious, the manager at the Spa hotel along with Georgia who we’re unbelievably kind to us whilst we were there.It is a place we will definitely return to and can’t recommend it highly enough. Everyone who works there are a credit to the the hotel.A massive thank you from Amy and myself and hope to see you in the near future.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and wife researched for 6 months for a destination/hotel for our honeymoon. We finally settled on one of two hotels on Santorini over 10 days. We choose the Santorini Princess based on reviews and didn't make the wrong decision. We had to pay for it though! Santorini is very expensive...but worth it.. I am a fussy traveller and tend to write negative reviews of hotels. I have nothing to be negative about here. The Santorini Princess is excellent! We stayed for 6 nights in the honeymoon suite. We were welcomed by a driver from the hotel who was really friendly (recommend a pickup rather than taxi) starting the honeymoon on a positive note as we were very tired. On arrival we were met with amazing views across the caldera. The reception staff were very welcoming, friendly and provided welcome cool drinks. This was followed by a tour, Kir Royale's and chocolate pudding. Our bags were taken to our room and we had roses waiting for us. The Honey Moon suite was spotless, cleaning excellent. Nice towels and products provided. The suite Hot Tub/Jacuzzi wasn't really powerful and I dint use it much but was nice enough. View was great though the general 'public' can walk past underneath the room on the main road and see the room its not 'overlooked'. 4 poster bed was comfortable as were pillows. The room was cleaned throughout the day....cleaning staff were very attentive. The Hotel is located a 15 minute walk up hill to the nearest 'town' where there is plenty of restaurants. We also walked to Oia from the hotel (recommend the hike but take plenty of water)...you need to be fairly fit to do all the walking in the sun, in my opinion. We did a catamaran boat trip from the hotel for 135 Euro's each which is a complete rip off but again Santorini is expensive and its a once in a life time for us. I am glad we did it but it was nothing outstanding. The staff were all amazing throughout, polite, professional and went beyond required. The little things made the difference here, some free crisps or a glass of wine after a trip late at night. The free 'tat' provided to us each day was actually a nice touch and some of it was really nice. e.g. Santorini apron/fridge magnet. The staff really were 'on it' the whole time, no let up. Credit to them. We ate most days at the on site restaurant for breakfast/lunch/dinner. I am vegetarian and was well catered for. It was reasonably priced, similar to most restaurants in Santorini which is generally really expensive. I wouldn't pay the prices establishments in Santorini charge at home! Service was excellent most days, however sometimes they seemed less attentive than other days....being picky here though. We used room service a few times which was nice. We were hoping to get a cheeky free drink on our last night but didn't :P Seems like you may need to be speaking to the right person at the right time. The pool was warm and heated...really nice. The Spa area we had a 30 minute free session. The Spa itself is pretty average. Standard Sauna and small hot tub. Didn't have a massage as cost to much. There were plenty of sunbeds and little private areas to sunbathe, staff bring towels (a nice touch) and free drinks now and again. If I could change anything? Maybe full reclining sunbeds in the room balcony's, soft closing toilet seats and better jets in the hot tub. Breakfast on the balcony with a room order card would be a nice touch...I am really digging for things here though... Summing up....I have never had the level of service in any hotel across the world that I had at Santorini Princess. The other hotel we stayed at was nice but not as nice as the Princess due to the service received from staff. My Wife and I will always have the Santorini Princess in our minds as a bench mark to beat. Well done, amazing!!! James and Katie - Honeymoon Suite 3rd June 2019.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just concluded a seven night stay at this hotel with 10 girlfriends, all of whom traveled from around the US to Greece to celebrate one of our 50th birthdays. The stay was pretty flawless from beginning to end. A few highlights:1) Location, location, location. IMO, the location was ideal and I would definitely stay here if I return to Santorini. The views from everywhere - the room, the pool, the restaurant - are spectacular. You have the feeling of floating in the clouds as you look out upon endless blue, framed by breathtaking cliffs dotted with white and blue buildings. The hotel, in Imerovigli, is centrally located between the various other towns. Moreover, we went into various towns (Fira, Oia) and found them absolutely loaded with cruisers and tourists, and at the end of each day came back to this oasis of calm, peacefulness, and serenity. You could practically hear a pin drop laying by the pool or sitting on our porches at night.2) Service. I have stayed in many five-star hotels and this hotel delivers on what you would expect from such a property. However, beyond the efficiency, promptness, and accuracy in responding to every request of our group of 11 throughout our stay, the service was strikingly warm, gracious, and very personal. Roses in our room when we came home each night. Gifts on our pillows. Special drinks poolside with ice encrusted towels. Do I have to go home? We had the feeling of celebrating the birthday week with extended family. The staff even took the initiative to prepare a cake, and to gather with balloons, and champagne for a surprise rendition of happy birthday in English and in Greek for our friend. While everyone went above and beyond, we must call out special praise for Georgia, our concierge, who was simply exceptional. Wow. A very memorable person. She choreographed the week with impeccable taste in each reservation and suggestion, always with a smile.3) Property- The hotel itself is well maintained, well laid-out, and very comfortable. The rooms are all very nice. The restaurant, pool, spa, and grounds are all lovely. Breakfast buffet is great.Overall this was a 5* experience from check-in to check-out. I wholeheartedly recommend this place. It has provided me, and our entire group, with precious memories of a first-rate experience for a milestone birthday. I am personally very grateful - thank you, Santorini Princess to you and your entire staff who made our visit to Greece perfection.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible! The service was out of this world! We've stayed at some great hotels (Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, St. Regis, and some great boutique hotels) - but this was the best. And Romina! She is the star. Whoever is the owner should pay her double, at least! Rooms are clean, beautiful, quiet. The hotel is not in one of the towns - but both Oia and Fira are easy to get to. It was nice to go visit - but better to come back! Views were unspoiled and private. Again - service was incredible!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of spending three nights at the Santorini Princess on May 24. I have to say I wish it had been a month! This was the most fabulous stay we have ever had anywhere in the world. The customer service level is so superior to anything I have ever experienced. Vaios , Georgia, Sophia, Yanos, and Romina all made it a fantastic experience. The pool was beautiful, the restaurant was excellent, and the location was perfect. We were completely away from the mass of humanity in Fira and Oia. If we wanted to go there we could at the drop of a hat. There was always a car waiting to take us anywhere we wanted to go. Oh, the sunsets were the best, too!You will not be disappointed at the Santorini Princess! Thanks for the great stay!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hope I can convey how wonderful this hotel is. The views of the caldera are unmatched, our room with its balcony and its breathtaking views was beautiful and comfortable, the staff was absolutely amazing in how attentive, professional and personable they were and the food in their restaurant was delicious and it also had stunning views. This boutique hotel located right on the edge of the caldera is beautiful but the staff added equally to the fantastic experience we had at this hotel. It was their pleasure to do whatever they could to make our vacation the best experience. Our flight went out very early the morning we left and they arranged a wonderful breakfast to be delivered to our room that morning before we left. A beautiful hotel matters but all the little details add up to an exceptional experience. Special thank-you to Georgia. You made such a difference. We have stayed at many five-star accommodations over the years but the Santorini Princess Hotel is a special one we will always remember.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beauty about this hotel is the staff, location and views. The moment you step down you are greeted warmly and are made to feel special and most welcome. Georgina was amazing, so was the food and beverage manager Yanni who was hands on, most attentive and most caring. Vayo the general manager was also warm and hospitable We stayed at villa number 22 which consisted of two bedrooms, 2 separate closets, 2 bathrooms and living/dining room which gives you enough space, total privacy and independence. The architecture is old style, with 2 small narrow windows, (imagine if this was a large glass French door instead in line with modern architecture to reveal the beautiful scenery outside). Nevertheless, the room has a great scenic location, terrace offers a breathtaking view of the sea, sunrise and sunset. The staff pamper you the moment you check in. We were treated very special, like royalty from beginning to end. As soon as we checked into our room, we were treated to a delicious slice of chocolate cake, along with other small treats regularly and on daily basis throughout your stay. Our daily activities, restaurant bookings and recommendations were properly organised for us by the Georgina and the food and beverage manager Yanni. The location of this hotel is most convenient because it has easy accessibility to all the trekking/hiking sites. The breakfast was good, although Greek specialties could have been tastier, healthier and more appetising. We brought this to the attention of Yanni who immediately took on board all our points, to ensure improvement. On the other hand, Sophie the maître D’ fulfilled my requests on daily basis, ensured that I get my mixed salad and bowl of fresh berries for breakfast on daily basis. The staff bent backwards and forwards to please us. Yanni, the food and beverage manager generously offered us free of charge very tasty Greek nibbles by the pool. On our last day of checking out, a special surprise lunch was prepared for us by Yanni which consisted of delicious fresh red mullet, sea bass, including other specialties of the house. Our stay at this hotel was a memorable experience, not be missed. We used the spa twice, excellent professional massage. Highly recommended hotel. It’s a must. It certainly deserves its certificate of excellence.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel not only has a spectacular view but also has a fantastic staff how will take care of you 24-7. Our conscious Was sweet Gorge-a and she made sure we were always took cared off. Make sure to eat at the restaurant in the hotel which has a 5 star food with a very Talented , wise and nice Chef named “Ioannis Chousiadis “.Don’t forget to use the spa whichever has a fantastic massage deals and I recommend my masseuse Maria. I hope you get the chance to go visit and enjoy this place;)
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 5 nights at Santorini Princess and loved every bit of our stay. I had pre-booked through American Express, and found Santorini Princess to be well priced compared to some of the surrounding properties. While they were far more reasonably priced, Santorini Princess did not skimp on service. Georgia, Viaos, and the entire team at Santorini Princess go out of their way to attend to the guests and make you feel welcome. From suggestions on what to do, where to eat, to simply asking if they can get you anything, you will feel appreciated. Every night when we returned to our room there was a small gift waiting for us.
