I have only experienced this level of attention at one other property out of thousands I have visited.The rooms are spacious and comfortable as well. Our balcony was not as private as others, as we were right next to the pool. That being said the noise from the pool area was never a problem, and it was still relaxing sitting out and drinking a cup of coffee. (If you want more privacy, rooms 12 and 14 face the pool so request different rooms).The location of the property is perfect for watching the sunset over Oia. It is about a 25 minute walk into Thira where there are plenty of restaurants as well.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just spent a night at this beautiful hotel! We were picked up promptly at the port by the hotels transfer services who were much more reasonable compared to the regular taxis. Upon our arrival, we were immediately greeted by the friendly staff and taken on a small tour of the hotel. Our room was very cute and clean, and the view from our balcony was amazing! Shortly after getting to our room, a staff member brought us some chocolate cake garnished with crushed pistachio and it was simply out of this world! We especially enjoyed the heated pool and regret not using the spa services as we were short on time, but the prices were very reasonable. Breakfast did not disappoint either, many great food options to choose from. We also used the transfer services to venture out in Fira at night and it was great - more reasonable than a local taxi. Aside from the property, the best part was the exceptional staff. Id like to specifically mention Maria, Romina and Georgia for their friendly helpfullness. They went above and beyond to make sure everything was to our liking and even gave us some great recommendations. Georigia really went out of her way to help us plan some activities and made some great suggestions for us. In the short time we spent together her she really left a great impression and it felt as if we had known eachother for so long. Unfortunately, we only stayed at this hotel for one short night then went elsewhere to join our family. If we could do it all over again we would stay at Santorini Princess with our family for the entire duration because the personable treatment we received by them was unmatched anywhere else! All in all, this is the perfect place to stay while visiting Santorini as it is quiet and tucked away from the busy touristy areas of Oia or Fira. You will not regret choosing Santorini Princess and their top-notch staff!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel were really wonderful and did everything they could to make our short stay a memorable one. We arrived early the first day and were welcomed warmly and offered breakfast at no extra charge, before we set out on a catamaran trip. The people working at the restaurant were pleasant and helpful, and the views extraordinary. When we returned to the hotel in the afternoon, we were delighted by an unexpected upgrade to the honeymoon suite with its own jacuzzi overlooking the caldera. We were offered complementary drinks and cake delivered to our room. Having traveled overnight to get to Santorini, we couldn’t have hoped for better treatment and a more relaxing experience.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I just spent a week in Santorini, and after starting our week at the sister property Princess Presidential Suites (fabulous), we then stayed at the Princess Hotel in Imerovigli, and the service was perfect.The location, the rooms with private balconies, and the views were all great, but what made this place perfect was the service. The manager Vaios and his assistant manager Georgia provided the best service you could ask for. Upon arriving, my wife felt dizzy from the car ride across the island, and the staff immediately found a place for her to relax, took us to a pharmacy, and everything was immediately better.Over the next couple days, Vaios, Georgia, and their team provided the best hotel service we have ever experienced. It felt like visiting your best friends. They were very personable, and always looking for ways to provide us a perfect stay including drinks, food, room service, local area recommendations, and a genuine interest in us.We also enjoyed the location, as it is in a perfect place for taking an amazing hike to both Oia and Fira with stunning views along the way. Many thanks to the staff! You guys are amazing
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't generally write reviews but when I do, it's either because you suck or you're amazing. In this instance, I have to say, Santorini Princes Hotel has been amazing. The staffs are super friendly, approachable, and very helpful. I have to admit though .. I didn't have high expectations after a reservation snafu, however the reservation department offered a one night stay in Fira at a penthouse (same management). The pictures looked amazing but the check in process was torturous - everyone just waited in the beaming sun. I also felt so bad for the luggage carrier carrying all those luggages down those steps in the heat (i sincerely hope the other individuals tipped him well). Luckily our room was ready for early check in so we suffered slightly less but nonetheless not a good impression. Not to mention the transfer shuttle was over packed! There was a group that didn't even have a seat and literally had to squeeze so yeah... Didn't start off great. I didn't love the penthouse that much but did love the rooftop deck with the hot tub and sun bathing area. At Santorini Princess, the staffs right away started assisting us and making sure we actually felt like we're on vacation (basically anything that makes our lives easier). While the staffs are friendly, I was a little uneasy at how friendly they are... They're like over the top happy and friendly, which if you're like me, from nyc, yeah, it's a little much. The rooms are very clean and they even give you welcome drinks and dessert (loved the chocolate cake). I almost forgot but they even give you a little Santorini souvenir at the end of your stay. While the room is generally not my style, I think the top notch service overrides everything. The heated pool is also great especially if you came when it was a little chilly and and windy. The only gripe I had is the huge step you need to take when you leave your bed. I use the bathroom quite a bit at night and that step always scares me because you don't realize how high it is. On another note, bed is very comfy and toiletries are nice.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an experience! This hotel’s service is unbelievable - they are friendly, helpful, and attentive. You can watch the sunsets right from the comfort of your balcony. The pool is heated which was great in May. All of their recommendations for activities and restaurants were excellent. Their car service is readily available to bring you anywhere you’d like on the island. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to family and friends.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited in early May for 3 nights before moving onto the sister hotel in Akrotiri. From the moment we left our transport, we were made to feel wanted and special by some of the best people working in the hospitality sector. Nothing was too much trouble and Georgia and her team were a credit to the Santorini Princess. Whilst I have gushed about the service, the hotel, amenities and food also matched up to our expectations of a small Greek boutique hotel. Excellent and will come back in the future.Nick & Annie
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a week staying here. Really gorgeous little hotel - 19 rooms I think. Great location outside of Imerovigli, but easy to walk in for lunch/ dinner. Fantastic views out over the Caldera - sunsets are spectacular from the dining room.Buffet style breakfast, with excellent choices. Lunch & dinner menus good too.Nice swimming pool which was VERY warm . Rooms all simply decorated, but very comfy. We had a little balcony & stunning views.All the staff very friendly & helpful - couldn’t not mention the wonderful Georgia - she looks after all the guests so well. Great local knowledge & really helpful in recommending restaurants, making travel arrangements & just making sure you are having a good time.We had a great holiday & would very highly recommend staying here if you are thinking of visiting the lovely island of Santorini
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is very welcoming and made my mother's birthday beyond worth it! everyone was very nice polite and the room and heated pool were amazing. The views are incredible and top quality food as well. I have nothing negative to say at all by far superb in every way! I can't wait to visit again......also the television had amazing (free) movie choices. The hotel was so good I didn't even want to leave! I travel all the time and there isn't a better hotel
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I rarely write reviews but this time I felt compelled to share our experience. We travel extensively and always stay in 5*+ hotels but this hotel is a step above. Upon our arrival we were greeted by the charming manager Mr Viaos, the guest relations concierge extraordinaire, Georgia and the front desk staff who all come out to the car. From there it just kept getting better and better. The ladies in the spa are wonderful and totally pamper you. It is a private spa for either a single or couples. The Maitre’D Yiannis is welcoming, charming and professional. There is no request that they will not accommodate. The food is delicious and served beautifully. The rooms are lovely and the location is amazing. It sits right on the caldera, easy walking distance to the village of Imigliovera and hiking distance along a hiking path to Oia and Fira. The staff truly cares about its guests and that translates to a wonderful vacation.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in April for a babymoon and had an amazing time! We chose the hotel for the heated pool (one of the few hotels on the island that has one) as we were so early in the season and we were not disappointed! The pool was overlooking the bay at a comfortable 30 degrees Celsius which meant that we could use the pool despite the outside temperature being under 20 degrees. The hotel is set out for pampering, the spa treatments were great and reasonably priced (they even do pregnancy massages!), the breakfast was out of this world (omelette station, fresh pancakes, different types of cake daily, you name it!) and also the restaurant was really good with an unbeatable view (especially recommend the Iberican pork). I know it is a bit of a cliché, but the staff really were exceptional! They remembered every guest, had great advice on things to do; we really felt we made the most of our time there and will definitely come again.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Both me & my wife are travel professionals with over 25 years in the Industry. This was a personal trip. After being cautious after a minor incident with the booking process we were pleasantly surprised at the warmth and sheer genuine care that every one right from the GM to the check-in personal, to the ladies mopping the floors and most of all to the lady heading the operations at the property. We were cared for every each moment we needed it. The amenities were absolutely first class and everything was immaculately clean. The View is just Stunning from every room. The breakfast was a excellent with many choices. Great food and wine at the restaurant. All in all you felt special and taken care off. Please disregard any negative reviews because the people taking care of you in this place are really hardworking and genuinely care about your experience.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The levels the staff go to to make your stay enjoyable is impressive. They are genuine in their friendliness and concern for your happiness with not only Princess - as the local taxis call it - but your stay on Santorini.There is no doubt why this resort is so highly ranked on Booking.com and TripAdvisor - it earns it from the dedication of it's staff which was evident from the top down.International standards of the highest level were on display mixed with a local flavor and investment from the owners. There seemed to be too many staff on at all times. The restaurant staff, the hosts, the cleaners and the drivers were all beautiful people. We couldn't praise them highly enough.If you want to be away from the noise of Oia and Fira - this is the ideal location. Both are in walking distance if you want to rid some of those calories.Access is an issue for the island itself but we found the "Princess" to be in an excellent location.Lastly - you don't really need to go elsewhere for sunsets - the pool or balcony do just fine.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at SP. The entire staff was outstanding. Georgia was incredible. I don't know when she sleeps.Pros:Staff helpful, cheerful and accommodating.Breakfast was excellent.Views to die for.Rooms all have private balcony with incredible sunset.Heated pool (we were there in April and needed it to swim)Shuttle service to anywhere on island with acceptable rates.Cons:Location is somewhat remote and therefore required shuttle to get to any restaurant in evening.The staff at this hotel provided probably the best staff experience I have ever encountered. Stay here, you will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Santorini has always been on my bucket list. We chose Santorini Princess for our honeymoon and was not disappointed.The first thing that impressed us were the views and sunsets . They are spectacular at Imerovigli and I personally believe they are better than Oia . We loved Imerovigli because it was a quite so you can relax in peace. There is a lovely walking track that takes you to their local village which has lots of supermarkets ,restaurants and a pharmacyThe other thing that impressed us was the staff especially Georgia,Sophia and Dora who are genuine and gorgeous , they made our holiday at SP very special.We had room 21 which was the honeymoon suite with SPA . It was lovely and romantic! The only downside to our stay was when when I got out of the SPA I slipped on the slate. The SP staff took me to the hospital and helped translate . The radio therapist at the hospital said falls are quite common in Santorini due to the smooth slate tiles. While the staff were amazing I believe this could of been prevented if the hotel had put up warning signs eg : “slippery when wet” Unfortunately my injury effected the rest of our honeymoon !
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here a few years ago and were really looking forward to returning. The hotel is situated right on the rim of the caldara, with those spectacular views! A walking track in front runs along the edge of the caldara, linking Fira (about 4km/50-60mins south of the hotel), through nearby Imerovigli (about 20-25mins), and continues to Oia (about 6km/1hr& 45mins north of the hotel). If you don't feel like hiking there and back a (rather unpredictable) bus service stops on the entrance road behind the hotel and can help out one way. We appreciated being situated a little distance from the tourist hoards that invade Fira regularly during the day from the many large cruise ships in the harbour. Our room was beautiful - large and very comfortable, with a small private balcony, table and umbrella. This was a perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine while watching the sunset. As other reviewers have mentioned, the staff are amazing. They all made us feel at home from the start, remembered our names and responding promptly and courteously to every request. A very minor negative was that we were not able to get much information about traveling independently by bus to a couple of the less frequented tourist spots, such as Pyrgos and the nearby wineries. It seemed to be assumed that most hotel guests would simply use the more expensive private hotel transfer vehicle for local touring. Breakfast was wonderful and we particularly appreciated the lady who made coffee any way we liked! We had dinner several times at the hotel, as we couldn't be bothered traveling too far afield, and this was also excellent. However the quality and variety did seem a little better on our previous stay and it would have been nice if the menu could have changed a bit from day to day for repeat diners. The pool area was very relaxing with adequate sun lounges and the water was pleasantly warm (heated from early October). I also enjoyed a complementary massage, which was unexpected and much appreciated. All in all a really enjoyable stay once more.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't think I can add much to the already plentiful and superlative comments here. They're all TRUE! We've traveled a fair bit and have never encountered such sincere and comprehensive assistance from pretty much every one of the staff. I mean, really, FIVE stars? And over 1,000 reviews? It goes without saying that the tireless and enthusiastic Georgia is truly a treasure. From the moment we arrived until we left she remembered us and, on a daily basis or more, greeted us with a cheerful smile and relevant comments. Well, the staff at the restaurant mirrored her enthusiasm...Yannis, Dimitri, Nadia...everyone was so warm and genuine. How do you train that into people?The breakfasts were wonderful, with some items consistently there every day as well as special pastries and other dishes. The omelets and other eggs made to order were fresh and delicious. Any kind of coffee you like was there for the asking. We had dinner there once and room service another time - all very good.Prior to our visit, I had read about Room 24 with the stairs and was a little anxious about it if we happened to be assigned to it. As a previous guest had also stated, we're seniors and we were worried about maneuvering the stairs from the bedroom in the middle of the night. Yes, we were offered a choice between 24 and another room. Looking at both, my husband commented on #24 - it's so charming. And it was. There's a very sturdy handrail and leaving the bathroom light on with the door closed provided plenty of light since there's a "porthole" in the door. I don't know how the balcony compares with others but it was well enough above the path to be pretty private, had a lovely view and was so comfortable.We were there in October and, with the windows and doors open, there was no need for air conditioning. Except on a Saturday night when there was a wedding somewhere nearby and it got a little noisy. So, close the windows, turn on the AC, no problem.The lovely walk to Imerovigli was about 15-20 minutes on a path that was either cobble stone or concrete. Going the other direction to Oia, the path soon turns to dirt and eventually narrows. When we traveled to Oia, we saw that the path leads onto the road at the outskirts to Oia. It's a narrow shoulder with busy trucks, buses and scooters. We decided to opt out of that walk.The hotel provides "transfers" that are very convenient and will take you wherever you want for little more than a taxi and much easier. We did take the bus a couple of times. The stop is just up from the hotel on the main road between Oia and Fira plus other destinations. Apparently the stops are less frequent after summer and the sign with the schedules did not reflect that. We waited a little over an hour for the bus to Fira and saw 2 buses going the other way, to Oia, during that time. They're called "Local Bus" and are large but frequently crowded. Coming back we could only find one from Fira to Imerovigli which we took and then walked back easily.Besides the beauty of the setting, another notable thing is the quiet. Most nights we had our bedroom windows open so that we had a wonderful breeze plus...no noise. Just wonderful. And looking out to the lights of Oia or Imerovigli and sometimes a ship....priceless.I can't imagine staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This beautiful property is tremendously enhanced by the service staff. I cannot say enough about all the people who worked so hard to accommodate us. When we left we felt like we were saying good bye to wonderful friends. I especially want to give thanks to Georgia in the front office who made it seem like we were the only people she had to attend to. Also, the view from the dining room was amazing. The wait staff were so accommodating to our large party for my nephews wedding especially Nadia, Akis, Dimtri, Vannis, Sofia and Sofia Jr. This property has some spectacular views of the Caldera. As we travelled the island, we felt like we has the best hotel.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warning. If you stay at this hotel you may be ruined for life. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The restaurant is very good and there is no extra charges for room service. The daily free breakfasts are wonderful with a crepe and omelet chef along with many other delightful tasty treats. Here is just one example of how wonderful the staff is. We went for a sailing/snorkeling trip, arranged by the staff. As with most activities on the island the company will pick you up and drop you off in a van with other people on the excursion. On the way back it started raining quite hard, as people were dropped off they ran for cover. When we reached our hotel there was a staff member waiting for the van with two umbrella's for use to use for the short walk to our room. We felt so special.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a fabulous few days away to celebrate my 50th Birthday. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so special with an amazing welcome from Georgia and the team. It’s the little personal touches and the genuine friendliness of everyone working here that mean so much and make this hotel stand out from everywhere we have ever stayed before. The views from the hotel are amazing and I loved being that bit further out from the hustle and bustle. The coastal walks are breathtaking and if you don’t want to walk the buses are frequent or the hotel has its own driver who will shuttle you for a small fee. We found this invaluable when trying out a recommended restaurant nearer to Oia. I don’t think I can add anything more to the previous reviews that can tell you how fabulous this place is, just book it and go see for yourself!! Would we come back? Yes in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't fault the Santorini Princess at all. The position of the hotel gives you the most amazing views across the Caldera and provides awesome sunsets. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the main towns, but they are in walking distance (if you like stunning coastal walks - be sure to take a pair of trainers/hiking boots) or just a quick drive away. The staff were very attentive, making sure we had everything we needed and going out of their way to give us tips and advice on the island/restaurants/excursions.Heated pool was definitely a bonus in October! The food was great too.This hotel was recommended to us by friends and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone else.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved our 8 days at this wonderful boutique hotel. The accommodations were lovely but the staff were even more spectacular than the view. Their attention to detail and the friendliness and warmth of everyone working there far exceeded any experience we have had in other hotels. My sincerest accolades to the General Manager, Viaos, for putting together a staff that cared soooo much for their guests. I have so many stories of things they did that made our experience "over the top"...just kn ok...i w that if you choose to go there (And, you should)...they will do everything within their power to make sure your stay exceeds your expectations.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left- we were made so very welcome. The staff: Romina, Georgia and Vicky were outstanding. The breakfast, pool and drinks by the pool was just so good. Georgia seemed to be working 24/7 - she recommended restaurants, trips etc; and they all turned out fantastic. We paid a little bit more as we had the honeymoon suite (the only one with the Jacuzzi). We were welcomed with glasses of wine and on leaving Georgia came running to our taxi to hand us a souvenir!! We had a fantastic time and recommend this hotel HIGHLY
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow. I really dont know where to start. What an incredible experience at this boutique hotel. I read through many of the reviews posted here and thought, goodness...they summed up my/ our thoughts exactly! What makes this hotel so special is it’s staff. They are all 5 star people. I could list the names of every single person but I would risk forgetting some. They are SO dedicated! They work EVERY SINGLE DAY. They have a smile on their face, they are cheery, they are attentive....not sure how they do it from March-November. I felt like I was with family-literally hugged each one that I saw before we left and had tears in my eyes. It is a beautiful, immaculate hotel. Food was great, rooms beautiful (we had the honeymoon suite. Yes, after 30 years we are still honeymooners!) the view—insanely gorgeous. The only downside is that it is not close to Fira or Oia. They provided transportation (and nothing in Santorini is cheap!) but we found it the best thing to do as those drivers are nutty! The manager of the property was on site and we had an opportunity to tell him about our experience. My hope is that every member returns when we come back! I’m a bit worried that all of these glowing reports will cause them to be booked when we plan our next visit  To the staff- we love and adore you all!!! Thank you for the trip of a life time! Fondly,Chris and Eddie
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our honeymoon and although we knew the hotel was going to be lovely based on previous reviews, the hotel surpassed ALL expectations! Yes the hotel is spotless, views incredible and location perfect, it was the staff that made the hotel exceptional. Without exception, every staff member was wonderful, couldn’t be more helpful and had already answered all our questions before we’d asked them! The staff really do want you to have the most amazing time and we definitely did. The manager made our honeymoon extra special and we will never forget our holiday. Georgia was a fantastic host and her recommendations for dinner and activities were spot on! We could tell the staff loved working here as much as we loved staying there, if only trip advisor allowed ten star reviews!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Entire Staff very accommodating. the ferries did not run for 2 days from Crete to Santorini because of weather conditions. Unfortunately we missed our first night at this fabulous hotel but the manager credited us for the first night which was so generous. Staff treated everyone like family. View is gorgeous and hotel is very low key and relaxing. beautiful accommodations. Spectacular views
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Santorini Princess for 5 days, 4 nights as part of our honeymoon and had such an amazing experience. Everyday we were warmly greeted by all the hotel staff including the owner. The reception team helped us to plan each day of our stay including helping with restaurant reservations, getting a car rental and making recommendations on where to go. I travel often for business and leisure. Based on past experiences, I can confidently say Santorini Princess (SP) surpassed all our expectations. The team at SP really truly want to give their guests an amazing experience and will go out of their way to accommodate their guest (within reason of course).If traveling to Santorini, please do look up this hotel. You won't be disappointed. To the Santorini Princess team, thank you all so much for the wonderful hospitality, the amazing view from our suite and for making this an unforgettable honeymoon in Santorini. We hope to visit you again one day and will recommend you to our friends and family. Nancy Chou and Jordan Williams.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You will not be disappointed! absolutely beautiful location on the caldera .. a staff that went above and beyond to make us feel at home and cared for.. fantastic food and drink.. and The WONDERFUL Georgia to ensure all was perfect during our stay!! .
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had the best service we have ever experienced in a hotel. Except very friendly and feeling like you’re in their family, they always saw the small things and needs, which makes the whole experience that little extra in terms of service. The location was of course also very beautiful on the cliff edge towards the sunsets.Absolutely 10 out of 10:)
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just finished a 5 night stay. If you've done your research, you know it's a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location with beautiful views. Wanted to mention a few things. 1.The staff are outstanding 11/10. 2.We divided our dining choices between other restaurants and the hotel. The hotel won easily. Whoever is chef - needs a pay rise. 3.They have very comfy pillows. If we ever come back, would definitely stay here.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited this hotel mid September 2018, we were 4 adults and 2 rooms. Upon arrival we were met with such friendly staff that provided us with a tour of the facilities. Our check in was at 3pm and we arrived in the morning, so they accommodated us in a room where they brought our luggage which allowed us to get our bathing suits and spend the day by the pool until our rooms were ready. Our rooms were nice, but I wouldn’t call them luxurious. They were well equipped and very spacious and clean. The bed was comfy which is always very important when travelling. The breakfast buffet was included in our room price which made it very convenient in starting our day. The food was good and there was a good variety. Again I must stress that the staff was outstanding and really made our stay so much more amazing. They welcomed us back to the hotel every time we arrived after a day away and were always willing to help and offer assistance. The view is spectacular and the area was the best place to stay. Thira was super busy and crowded and offered no solace or quiet escape, Oia, although beautiful and so picturesque in every lane way again it was always busy, noisy and crowded. Imerovigli was perfect away from all the commotion and a great location to have a glass of wine and watch the sunset in peace. I would highly recommend this hotel mainly for its location, spectacular views, outstanding staff and service.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It offers wonderful views, friendly staff, great food, lovely rooms, exceptional service so overall one of the top hotels we've been to. It helped that we got breakfast buffet included and free welcome drinks as well as dessert.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is absolutely breathtaking. But most hotels on this island are. What really sets this place apart from the rest is the absolutely incredible staff. So friendly, welcoming, and really appear to enjoy their jobs. They will truly take care of anything you need, as far as booking excursions, making reservations, directions and best places to go. The food served was incredible, and for no extra charge, you can have room service. Almost (if not all) rooms have a balcony. It is the most magical way to view the sunset with a nice bottle of wine. The facilities are incredibly clean as well.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited for 2nd time in August for 10 nights. We first stayed 5 yrs ago on our honeymoon and it was so wonderful we vowed to return for our anniversary. Wow we were not disappointed. In fact even better than our honeymoon. The one thing that makes it absolutely outstanding besides the view and everything else is the wonderful service. Every member of staff gives excellent service. But, Georgia deserves a special mention. Nothing is too much trouble for her. If she recommends a restaurant or a place to go then go with it. She knows what she is talking about. Thank you for making our holiday very special. We got a complimentary upgrade the last 2 nts of our holiday to their other property Santorini Villas. Our own 3 bedroomed villa with private pool and stunning location. That's another review though as don't want to take anything away from the Santorini Princess. Simply the best!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Santorini Princess Spa was out of this world! From the time we arrived, 3 girls on a trip away, we were treated like queens. Georgia was amazing, she greeted us with a smile everyday. The breakfast was awesome, room was clean and spacious. The view from the pool was stunning. We were sad to leave today, but we will be back and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be spoilt.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for honeymoon 2 weeks ago. The locations is beautiful not in Oia or Fira kind of in-between which makes travelling to each one a nice morning or night out. For our honeymoon it was amazing I have never received service like this. The hotel has a nice pool with Jacuzzi and the rooms are very romantic and spacious. We would recommend a trip to Ammoudi Bay which is near/in Oia. Certainley go to Oia to watch the sunset (we did find the hotel was as good as the views in Oia and our balcony was probably the best place for it (try to get room 20 it has an amazing view) Ammoundi Bay goes down a but hill to a little romatic cover of restaurants which is picture postcardesque. Overall if your looking for a romatic - peaceful break with sun - this is for you. P.S I looked at lots of hotels in Oia and Fira before I booked this as a surprise for my partner - upon viewing these hotels (some more expensive) whilst we were there, I was so happy to have picked this one!thanks to georgina and all the staff who made our honeymoon so special !
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t even know where to start with this review! Location 10/10Facilities 10/10Service 10/10My husband and I travelled with our 2 children aged 10 and 11. From the second we arrived to the very last minute we had to leave we felt like we were family. The staff are the most incredible I have come across world wide. Always smiling and always making sure we were ok. The buffet breakfast was amazing with the staff remembering our coffee preferences after one day. The breakfast was amazing with the usual food but also Greek specialities. Our son is anaphylactic to nuts and they were so mindful of this. Nothing was a problem. We made use of the hotels shuttle service to get us to Oia or Thira (fee applicable) We were able to go out for some walks and the kids were never bored! There were honeymooners and many couple but the facilities meant we never felt we were intruding on anyone elses holiday.We had to leave with a sad heart but hugs all around as we left feeling like we were family.
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Santorini Princess was by far my favorite hotel to stay at! The staff is very friendly and welcoming from the beginning!! They are very helpful and addressed all our needs in a timely manner! Their recommendations to see places and to eat as well was spectacular!! Their massage services was one of the best that I have had!! Last, it is located in a quiet area far from crowd and noise with beautiful sunset views! I would highly recommend this place to anyone when visiting Santorini!
hotelName:
5    Santorini Princess
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The management bends over backwards for you. They are super friendly offering complimentary drink on arrival and coffee in the morning. The rooms and bathrooms are clean with little balconies and cloths drying racks. There is a small beautiful pool. The hotel is located 5 mins walk from the center of town. The desk is manned 24 hours per day and they are ready to answer your questions and help you out.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very near to bus station,important as fira is the stop to go everywhere in the island.clean and superb service from the staff.they have swimming pool,though small,free coffee/tea,shuttle which cost euro 5 to go to the port or airport in a very clean bus.located near to all taverna (Chinese food too for Asians)Cons:somehow the WiFi connection was very bad in the room,u have to go to reception lobby to get a better connection.i would stay here again if given a choice
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been here on december22 2018. Its in the perfect location for the airport . The hospitality is very good and the management helped us in planning our trips. Though the building looks old but the rooms are quiet good and I would like to stay at this place if I come back to Santorini
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location...within walking distance of bars, restaurants, cafes, shopping areas...Kosmas is the perfect host...you get a jug of local wine in your fridge...a great cup of coffee in the morning...service with a smile at all times...so accommodating!Rooms are nothing fancy...in fact bedding is really basic...pillows could be fluffier...Towels are rough (probably dried outside in the hot sun), only squeeze soap in bathroom (one product for body wash, shampoo, conditioner)...Room is equipped with kitchenette...safe...Balcony and small pool...welcome additions..What this place lacks in frills, it makes up in friendly hospitality!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location according to airport. Good service with transport very cheap to the airport. Good value for money. I wish better quality of the sheets in the bed. Quiet. Close to main bus station and taxi station.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late in the night, the hotel kindly picked us up from the airport at only €5 each which is a bargain as taxi’s can charge €20+. Staff were extremely helpful from the beginning, always ensuring we were comfortable. Hotel has a central location in Fira with a pool. Room is perfect, comfortable, clean, comes with kettle and air con. We stayed for 2 nights then went island hopping for 2 weeks after. On arrival back into Santorini the hotel let us keep our cases with them whilst we wandered before our flight. They then dropped us back at the airport for €5 each again! Couldn’t recommended enough, fantastic service!!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: best place to stay close to all and owners and cleaners are amazing. they gave us plenty of wine and the room was clean and the balcony is the best size. so easy to put washing out with heaps of room.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Antonia apartments for two nights. It was a nice experience. Small but cosy pool area (good enough for a tan or a quick splash), you can get coffee or tea or wine at the reception anytime, Spacious apartment. The internet went on and off but mostly good. The staff were very polite! And the most important part: the location! 2mins walk to the town centre !
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were picked up from the ferry at Santorini for a very reasonable price and then given an informative overview of Santorini and the tours from the hotel.We booked a full island tour for the next day( 10 hours).It was one of the best tours we have done and a lot cheaper than outside.We had a 1 bedroom apartment in the complex, it was clean, well appointed and central.Perfect stay in Santorini.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I loved our stay at Antonia Apartments. First of all, the location is awesome as all the highlights of Fira are a short walk away. Although the apartment itself is quite basic, the very helpful, friendly and hospitable staff (and the excellent location) make up for that. The staff is happy to pour you a coffee, tea or even a glass of wine and can arrange a airport or harbour pickup and/or drop off. The only real downside are the thin walls and ceiling which makes that noise from outside and from the other apartments can be quite bothersome. Sleeping in was almost impossible because of this for a light sleeper likemyself, which wasn’t a disaster but it’s not ideal either when on vacation.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel, more than met expectations! The staff are all fantastic, friendly and always available.The room was fine, a good size and clean and comfortable. Interesting "window" panels on the door that opened inwards to help with the heat, although there was aircon too.The hotel has 2 outdoor pools, and parking is available in a lot just down the hill. Thee hotel doesn't offer breakfast, but coffee is always freely available in the reception/kitchen area, and you're welcome to bring your food and eat it at the tables there!Enjoyable stay! Well worth it in all respects.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were surprised by the quality of the accommodation at Antonia for the price- what a great find in Santorini! We rented two small apartments and both had some views of the sea. The kind owner arranged a pick-up at the ferry and the driver was waiting for us on time. The a/c worked great and the two cute pools were perfect for a quick dip at the end of the day. The location is truly charming - in a quiet residential area just 1 block off the main square and 2 blocks to the caldera. We would definitely stay at Antonia again. Loved it!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Antonia Apartments for two nights in July. The apartment was spacious and clean, with beautiful pools just outside the room to cool down in. The staff at the hotel were amazing, always welcoming us and helping out with anything we needed. The location is good as well - only a short walk to town and as bigger selection of restaurants and bars as you could ask for. Would recommend staying here on your next visit to Santorini!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were picked up from the airport and sent off by the hotel. the staff there are very friendly. gave us an introduction to the island upon arrival and recommended few restaurants. We actually went to one of them and the food was great and we got 10% off as promised. The small hotel was clean and comfortable enough and the price was great too.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a lovely short stay in Fira - the third hotel in this city of our trip. Antonia was by far the best value of the three. The rooms are basic but they are both comfortable and clean. The location is also nice - you're close to the old town and caldera but far enough away that it's quiet at night.There are two little pools on property for a short dip, and some of the rooms have balconies. Staff are really nice - they offer you coffee and water and wine when you arrive, plus shuttles to the airport are 5 Euro. Really great stay!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked two rooms for an overnight stay on Santorini recently. Antonia apartments met us at the airport and were professional and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The location was ideal for the centre of Fira and the price very competitive I would not hesitate to recommend Antonia Apartments for anyone staying in Fira.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Antonio Apartments are a great option for travellers who want to experience the beauty of Santorini without paying the kind of astronomical prices many hotels on the island charge. The room was basic but cleaned daily and with an excellent WiFi connection. The location is great for central Thira and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. There is no caldera view but it's only a 5 minute walk to the cliff tops. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and the hotel provided me with a free airport transfer on arrival plus complimentary wine, bottled water, tea and coffee.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We agree with the other reviews recommending this placeWe had a large apartment with a balcony - it was clean - good wi fi- nice view of the street & the water - lovely pool ( there were 2 pools) close to our apartment - very friendly & helpful owner ,Lefteros who vCollected us from the ferry , arranged car hire & gave us good suggestions about things to do on the island
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights in September, and it was one of the most memorable experiences. It's very close to the main attractions in Fira, as well as the bus stop which takes you to all other places on the island. Also many bike rentals available nearby, or via the hotel too. The rooms were basic but comfortable and clean. And the free shuttles from the port or the airport are much appreciated. Although the best part would be the treatment received from the owners and staff. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and help you plan your days on the island. We were offered coffee / wine on arrival, and our host (hate myself for forgetting his name) proactively explained every necessary detail to help us plan our two days. This was done individually for all guests on arrival. Maybe other places in Santorini do this, but I've never experienced this in any other hotel in the world. It might not be a caldera facing 5 star resort, but at the price, we'd definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in a standard room. Our booking was with Apartments Antonio, but it would appear that the hotel is also named as Hotel Antonio. We were picked up from the airport and dropped off at the Ferry Port. We were welcomed and given an overview of what we could do on the Island, plus a carafe of white wine, which was replenished each day. The owners and staff were always very helpful and friendly during our stay. The people at the reception desk were always and friendly. The room was a quite large, having an area similar to that for a normal double bed room, plus an area of the same size with a lounge suite against the wall. The room was well maintained, and had individually controlled air-conditioning, a refrigerator, an electric kettle and a hair dryer. It was a very pleasant room. Wi fi was strong. The bathroom was a good size. The water pressure was good with hot water when required. The hotel was very quiet and was clean and well maintained. We were on the ground floor and had a small table and two chairs outside. We also used the small swimming pool which was clean and refreshing in the warm weather. Breakfast was not provided, but we were invited to go to the local bakery and bring food back to eat at tables in the bar area. Tea and coffee was freely provided. The hotel was well located in the middle of Fira, close to the bus station and all the local sights and shops. Oia and Akrotiri can be readily reached by public buses.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel in July 2016 as a couple for about 86 Euros a night. We booked it knowing that it's not a 4 star hotel but the location is fantastic and the reviews were great.The hotel provided roundtrip airport transportation and it doesn't matter what time you arrive or depart, they are willing to pick you up/drop you off. We arrived early and left early so we were super happy that they did that.We arrived at the hotel with a warm welcome. The owner sat us down and gave us a brief introduction of santorini, telling us where to go and what to see. He also helped us rented an ATV and was able to take care of all the extensions for us. The rooms are obviously not 4 or 5 star hotel rooms but they do the job. We really only needed a hotel room to sleep at night so it was good. They kept the rooms EXTREMELY clean. Once I came back to the room during the day and saw house keepign scrubbing the kitchen. We didn't even use the kitchen. So I was pretty impressed they were so thorough.The only problem is the Wifi, like another reviewer said. We stayed in 2 different rooms during our stay, 1 room's wifi was very spotty, and the second room straight up didn't connect to wifi unless we are standing by our room's door. Given there's not much on TV, we couldn't even use wifi to watch Netflix - wish the owner would fix this issue as in this day and age, people need the internet.The location of the hotel is nice. You are literally steps away from all the shops in Fira and 10 minutes hike to Fira to see the amazing scenery. Although we are away from the crowds, the rooms are not too sound proof and sometimes you can hear kids screaming outside. But overall it wasn't too big of a deal and didn't affect my vacation one bit.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location on a quiet street, wonderful staff. Lefteris was very welcoming and helpful. The room was large and had a nice balcony. The bathroom was medium size and had a nice shower cabin with a rain shower head. A carafe of white wine was provided daily, which was a nice touch. There were 2 small pools (space is at a premium in Fira) that were spotless clean. The hotel is a good value for the money.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Antonia apartment on June 9 - 11,2016. We took the ferry blue star from Athens to reach Santorini island. The hotel representative took us to the hotel in a mini bus from the ferry station. The hotel is on top of the hill. It took us 40 mins to reach the hotel. Our suite was very comfortable with big kitchen and bathroom. This hotel is very close to local bus stand. The hotel provided free Wi-Fi, free tea/coffee and paid guided tours. They have a small swimming pool, but we didn't find time to use it. We took the local bus for our excursion as it was cheaper. The bus timetable is available at the hotel. We enjoyed eating the falafel from a nearby falafel shop. All kinds of provisions, food and other items are available near the hotel. We were Indian eggtarian women visiting this hotel, we had no trouble finding food as per our preferences.I would definitely recommend this hotel to all.Santorini is a must visit place as it offers panoramic views and pristine beaches. I have included photos of hotel and bus stop
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Based in the heart of Fira, you can't get more reasonable accommodation than Antonia Apartments - great value for money. The apartment was clean and had air-con, the staff are so warm and friendly - they give you a map and explain where everything is and things to do on the island - we even booked a boat trip with them. we had free coffee and wine nearly every day. And they will transfer you to and from the airport/ferry. Really enjoyable stay! Also - at the top of the road is a shop called 'self-service' and its run by the nicest guy in the world - we went in every day to buy water and wine and he will open bottles for you to try for free as well as give you samples of cheese, etc. Altogether 10/10 - loved it!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In early April 2016 I stayed in an apartment with a kitchenette at Antonia Apartments for a few nights - I am a mature, solo traveller --Lefteris and staff very helpful with maps, travel advice, dropped me off at the port and suggested where to stay at my next island ie Naxos --Pension Sofi --great suggestion-see my review on Naxos forumAntonia Apartments very clean rooms, hot showers, internet worked well and coffee and tea available at all times and felt very much at homeWill return there on next visit to Santorini
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owner picked us up from the port which was very convenient and we also got dopped off at the airport when we left. The rooms and the bathroom are dated with pipes sticking out in the bathroom but for the little price we paid i cant complain at all. The staff was very nice and its convenient as they can also sell you tickets for bus or boat trips. Our room was right next to the pool. The pool made some noise sometimes but it was no problem as it stopped again. The wifi was spotty sonetimes but its not what you go on vacation for. If you want to save money and can live with a not super nice bathroom but good staff and location, this is ideal for you.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was excellent. we were fetched and dropped off at the airport for free. When we arrived, George told us about all the tourist places in Santorini and advised us regarding the best ones. He also suggested good spots for eating, and identified the bus stop in the town. Before we went to our room, we were treated to a pitcher of wine.Perhaps due to it being offseason, our room was upgraded for free. It had kitchenware as well as dishwashing liquid + sponge. There were coathangers as well as a safe. The bathroom was clean, and had lots of space to put toiletry items. I would overall recommend this hotel. It was great. Fair price, excellent staff, above average room.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With a courtesy pick up from the airport it was a great start to our stay at Antonia Apartments. As my friend and I were on a budget staying in Fira was an excellent option compared to the overpriced Santorini just a skip down the island. The staff welcomed us with tea and coffee upon arrival, and also had many options for us to do while on our vacation. All recommendations were fabulous and I trust their opinions fully. They sorted us out motorbikes and a rental car as well. Room was great for the price. It was clean and tidy, the bathroom was fine. Hot water was good. Would definitely recommend staying here.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were picked up and dropped off at the airport. Coffee and wine were offered whenever you wanted. Lefteris offered great advice on what to do and see while in Santorini and even put us in touch with a friendly car rental service. It is a family run hotel with no catering (apart from the coffee) but with plenty of eateries nearby. The wi-fi was excellent.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible stay in Santorini! Antonia Apartments is a family-run business and the members of the family give the guests a warm welcome and make them feel at home. Mr. Lefteris, the owner, together with his team, gave us detailed information about tours and how to make the most of the visit to this magic island. We enjoyed a lot our stay there and hope to come back one day!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So thankful for all the trip adviser folks who lead us to this place. It was so nice to have ferry transfer (pick up and deliver back to the port at 12:30 AM), clean rooms that were very spacious, friendly family to advise us on what to do on the island and provide great suggestions for restaurants, and free coffee, wine, and/or tea was just wonderful. After coming back from a long day your, nothing better than having wine awaiting you in the room. Highly recommend and we would definitely stay here again if we come back. They might not have the view, but they have created the best and friendlies atmosphere to relax in and meet new friends.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time at Antonia and we can see why they have good reviews. Our host and hotel manager Lefteris made the stay with his warm and inviting personality. He picked us and some other guests up from the port with his young son to help carry bags, haha. When we arrived he offered us drinks and sat down with new arrivals individually to explain where to go on the island. Everywhere he recommended was great! We told him we wanted to go to Santo Winery so when he showed us to our room he gave us a complimentary carafe of wine to drink by the pool! When we asked directions to Santo the next day he offered to drop is off as it was on his way. Lefteris arranged quad bikes, tours or whatever we needed on the spot. The rooms were very cute and clean with excellent air conditioning, and wifi was included and pretty quick. Best location, best hospitality, we would (and hopefully one day will) come again and recommend this place to other travellers.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located a very short walk away from the main square of Fira. Clean and tidy, the rooms are ample size for a couple. A small balcony had great views to the east of the island. The staff are really good. Helpful and welcoming. Near all ammenities and althoug h there ar eplaces with better views the value here cannot be denied.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife spent there 7 days in July. The apartment was very big, clean and with all comfort (also kitchen and tools helpful to cook). The stucture is very close to the center of fira (5 min on foot), from the Caldera view, and from bus station. The staff is great! They are very friendly and kind and always ready to help you and to suggest nice places to visot or good restourants or to book for you car or excursions (without extra charge). They offer always wine, coffee, cappuccino and they are always available 24 h to support you for every need. The best staff ever!Very giod the service A/R from the airport free of charge. One of the best structure I have ever been!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I had the loveliest stay here! The staff was extremely kind and accommodating! We were picked up at the port when we arrived and we were also dropped off at the airport for our departure (at 3 am)!! The location is perfect as well--it's in the center of Fira. My sister and I will definitely stay here again when we return. :)
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lefteris and all his employees were most helpful. The apartments are on the "other" side of the hotel, but were wonderful. Small, but so what. Shower, refrigerator, free wine, pool, in-room safe, outdoor laundry rack, wifi good, great location. Two blocks from the main street in Fira (although uphill), but 2 straight blocks from the meeting place if you are taking day tours from the tour companies. There is a hot pot in the room, but bring your own coffee, or you are more than welcome to the free coffee in the reception are. They do not serve breakfast, but you are welcome to bring your breakfast to the reception area if you'd like. I read reviews of the hard beds, and yes, by American standards, but we found our mattresses were pretty consistent throughout our Greece holiday. We thought this was a great value, and would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located but is near the nosiest and busiest part of Fira and has no view of the water. The bed was hard and uncomfortable and there was a horrible smell right outside my balcony doors so had to keep them shut. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, Very unsatisfied.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed there in March. Thankfully the hotel included pick up from the ferry landing because we were greeted with a thunder storm. The owners were extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Once we got to the hotel, they offered tea (or coffee), and gave us a half liter of wine to enjoy in our room. Their grounds are very interesting, not a traditional hotel, you have to walk down the stairs from their "lobby" to get to your room, and then there are other stairs leading off to various rooms. The grounds are open, very nice, and well kept. There is not an elevator, but our hosts always offered to help with our luggage if needed. Our room included a little kitchenette which we were surprised by. It included all the basics to cook a simple meal in the room if needed. It even had a little patio area, but it was too cold for us to enjoy. The room itself was of decent size; comfortable enough to spread out a bit. The hotel is very close to the center of Fira, less than 5 minute walk. Overall, I would be willing to stay here again or recommend it to my friends and family.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Since it wasn't the greatest time of the year to visit Santorini, we were stuck in our hotel a lot more than expected. I think Anontia would be great in the summertime when you're out and about on the island and would just really use it as a resting place, but in the winter it is not suitable. A few things that rubbed us the wrong way: The hotel claims to have Wifi but it did not work at all in our room, it only worked in Reception which closes at 8PM. It was really frustrating that during the day the teenage daughter was only there running the hotel and while (bless her heart) she tried her best, they kept claiming that it was a problem with our devices and not their Wifi. Usually this wouldn't be so important to me, but I needed to connect with my husband back home. They offered to move us rooms but we quickly realized that every other customer at Antonia was having the same problem. Next, the rooms were freezing. We had a heater in the room but it didn't seem to do the trick and we were quite cold. The rooms are also very minimal so if you are stuck inside due to bad weather there is really nothing to do (very few channels, no DVD, no Wifi) and everything on the island was closed. What really got us was one evening, my friend and I were sitting in Reception, and another customer came to tell the hotel manager that he and his wife needed extra blankets to which the manager responded "We don't have the housekeeping isn't here", and then the man told him that they accidentally broke glass and needed it cleaned, to which he responded "You'll have to wait until the morning the housekeeping is gone." The customer told him if he just gave him a broom he would clean it himself and the manager said again "I don't know where a broom is the housekeeping is gone." I'm sorry, but if you are running a hotel you SHOULD know where everything is and how to help your guests. Having broken glass is a safety hazard. The overall feeling for the hotel was not positive and we ended up changing our flights to leave earlier than we were suppose to. The owner seemed annoyed with us complaining about the Wifi and we became uncomfortable staying there. Having travelled all over the world, this is probably the worst place I have stayed. I have received better service from a Thai guest house for 20 Euros a night than this place. But like I said before, I'm sure it's fine in the summer when they have more guests and up their services during tourist season. Just don't come in the winter, ever.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have 4 Amazing days , we love it me and my friend and I love to go back again they are just kind people and Clean apartment close to everything's totally recommended aha free coffee and wine just go there with out thinking twice abut it
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights - Loved Santorini and loved Antonia. The hosts/staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for us (including a airport pickup/drop off - bonus). The rooms were clean, location was perfect (close to everything) and the pool was ideal after a long day out. We will be back one day!
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in fira for two nights and had exactly the experience I was looking for. The rates were reasonable, the staff was helpful and friendly, the room was nice/ clean and the location was perfect. If you're looking for a hotel with a view this isn't the place but if your like me a hotel is just a place to rest.  For all the reasons above I'd highly recommend Antonia apartments.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was such a beautiful place to stay, very spacious, comfortable with all amenities, endless supply of free coffee, tea and wine and walking distance to all amenities.The block is a couple of minutes walk to the bus terminus from where you can catch a bus to various attractions like the Red and Black beach, Sunset at Oia etc.Its also just a few minutes walk from shopping, great restaurants and the cable car/ferry terminus to go to the volcano.The hotel provides free airport pick and drop.The owners are very friendly and helpful and we would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Santorini, it is difficult to find good value for your money and a great location. And you also have to decide whether you want to stay in the middle of the island (Fira) the north end (Oia) or the very rural but scenic south end (Akrotiri). You can find good value at a nice, simple hotel like the Antonia. The staff at Antonia was very friendly. On our arrival, we were offered coffee and a carafe of wine. The owner was very helpful and asked several questions about our visit to help with our plans. He even arranged for a car rental which is the best way to see most of the island and for dinner plans in Oia. The rooms are a decent size with an A/C and mini-fridge. The bathroom was large although the curtain made it difficult to use the shower. The Wi-Fi worked although it did go out sometimes. The center of Fira is a 4 minute walk and the free airport/ferry shuttle is a nice benefit. There is no breakfast or restaurant but there are several spots very close by especially the Corner House, We enjoyed our stay at Antonia and would visit again. We also would look for a more luxurious hotel next time if we can find one close to the same price. Or you can pay twice as much for the views in Oia.
hotelName:
6    Antonia Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice small room with a balcony and sea view and free WiFi. There was no breakfast included but that was not a problem for us. If you have a rental car the hotel is a little difficult to reach. It is at the bottom of a really steep hill on a partially unpaved one lane road. We had an under-powered Fiat and it was actually really questionable that we would be able to get back up the hill. Also the only parking area is several blocks away at the top of the hill and there is no guarantee that there will be an empty space. The traffic in Fira is terrible and there are hundreds of people walking in the streets but we were able to drive to interesting places all over Santorini.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only 10’ walk from the main square of Fira. A very nice and simple hotel with comfortable rooms. Prices very normal for Santorini. The owners were very helpful in everything we asked. Pool was good!Highly recommend!!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay, the bed was very comfy! Aircon was great. We had a lovely twin terrace on the front of the building which is very pretty. The roof jaccuzzi was lovely, one tip I would give the staff would be to inform customers of it's location when they arrive as it can be missedas it's not part of the same building, it's down the road. It really is a lovely place to chill. The staff are really lovely and always smiling
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went here with my boyfriend for a night in May. It's very out of the way, quite hidden, takes about 10 minutes to get there from the bus station. But when you get there, the staff is very nice. The room we had is cozy, came with a(n empty) mini fridge, a hair dryer, and iron. There's also a small private pool, which we didn't use because we didn't have the time. It could use some (more?) maintenance, I think.Before we left, the staff suggested we stay a bit while they checked out the room. They found a jacket that we almost forgot in the closet, so that was fantastic.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great option for budget travellers. Hidden away down Santorini's windy streets.Would hire a buggy/quad bike if staying here as hard to walk to places.Room was very small but clean.Would stay here again!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a studio and discovered that it was a standard room when I went in when I asked them about it the reception said he is new and does not know how and why it happen except that he will give me a refund. A refund and apology should have been given immediately on check in. Room was small and stuffy. Shower curtains felt like it was about to drop off and shower head cannot sit on the holder. Towels were off white. My sister got the studio which was spacious but if you are big you will not be able to fit into the bathroom you may need to bath in the pool. It’s a cheap hotel so I guess you get what you pay, poor maintainence and tiny tiny bathrooms even though room size is about 300 sq ft due to bad design. Service is friendly and helpful generally.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located only 10 mts from the beautiful city centre, we enjoyed our stay here. The disclaimer is that the rooms are of varying types and dimensions; so I cannot speak for other rooms. We stayed in a small studio apartment with a small lounge, kitchenette and a small balcony with beautiful view in addition to the bed room. The kitchenette had induction cooker, fridge, microwave oven and kettle. One of the three nights was quite warm and we had to switch on the aircon, which was a bit noisy. There is a really small swimming pool, which my son really enjoyed. The reception staff were helpful. They had arranged airport pick up and drop off for us. The email communication can be a bit patchy though. Overall it was an enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They cancell my reservation 2 days after my arriving,they said can't use my debit card.I send them a several mails asking don't do that because I was paying there cash.They are not serius didn't respect my reservation.I don't recomend them
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a cosy little place with lovely views from the rooms on the first floor. The rooms were clean, but quite small, specially if you are travelling with kids- this would feel a little cramped. But it is cheaper then a few other properties and the staff is helpful.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice apatrments/ villas. Helpful staff. Rooms cleaned every day. Really loved our stay.We had ground floor apartments 9 & 10 right next to the pool so could use the pool at any time and sit out all day either in the shade or by the pool. We hired beach buggy and saw the whole of the island in 6 hours.....Great.Lovely island but be prepared....it's expensive but never had a bad meal out.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A relatively cheap room for Santorini and good central location in Firá with friendly staff. The rooms were clean but a bit small and we couldn’t shower without flooding the bathroom. Overall our experience was fine.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great value, super clean. owner and staff friendly and helpful. Beautiful views on all sides. Would go back in a heartbeat. The pool feels great at the end of a day:-) Small hotel so we met other travelers from all corners of the globe and made some new friends!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night in room with balcony. The room was ok, but the bed was uncomfortable (really hard). Staff were really friendly. The price corresponds to the quality well. Would recommend for stay if you don't need pool/sea views that much.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for 2 weeks with our 11 year old son. We stayed in room 10 which was perfect as it was in direct view of the pool. We found most people stayed here for 1-2 nights, so pretty much had the pool to ourselves for most of the holiday which was great because it is small with only 4 beds. We found the room to be great, there was a small kitchenette with bowls, plates, glasses, mugs a toaster, coffee maker, kettle and a toaster maker. Anything else we needed (a bread knife) was just asked for from reception and was given right away. The cleaner is such a lovely hardworking lady, she keeps everything spotless and the bedding and towels were changed everyday. The room had air con, it did the trick for when we stayed, no issues with it being noisy. The bathroom was small, and the shower was small but it did what it needed to do, hot showers at all times of the day which is a bonus! There was a roof terrace with a small tub with more beds on the other part of the villas. There is a steep incline to get to the main road but there are steps to the side, or, you can walk under the bridge which rings you to the road and is less steep. Take a torch for if you walk back from town at night, the steetlighting isn’t the best and the road surface is quite uneven in places. There are 2 little supermarkets within a 10 minute walk, one is very close and sells fresh pastries, pies and bread. Very good prices and friendly staff. Anna’s supermarket was further away, but opened later and was also brilliantly stocked. The reception has a small fridge selling water, beer and soft drinks at a reasonable price, and the staff are brilliant and very friendly. I have a bad back and found the bed not to be comfortable, but my husband who has no issues found it to be fine. Our son had a sofa bed which was fine for him. Nice touch of shampoo, shower gel and soap left in the bathroom. The pool was small and quite nippy, think you would struggle to get more than 2 people in, but most people dont come to Santorini for a pool holiday I suppose. The location was good, in a nice quiet place away from the town, but not too far, very manageable to walk to and from town, it’s about 10-15 minuets away depending on your walking speed. The WiFi was brilliant, We had coverage everywhere we went in the villas. We would certainly return to this hotel if we were to go back to Santorini, it was very good value for money, clean and the staff were very friendly! Thanks for a lovely stay
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great family ran hotel on the outskirts of town. The rooms are basic but thoroughly cleaned and have bedding and towel changes every day. The kitchenette has a kettle, toaster or sandwich maker and a good sized fridge and the showers are hot all the time with great pressure at all times of day. The pool area is quite small as the photos suggest, with a few good quality sun loungers to use. We stopped here with our 11 year old son for 2 weeks, which seems to go against the norm as most guests were travellers, and we were completely happy with the hotel. The lad loved the pool but if you are after a poolside holiday then please look at the pictures provided by the hotel for some overviews. There is also a sun terrace with a small jakuzi style pool, and more loungers. The staff were very helpful to us and arranged our transfers from and to the airport with ease, and the maid is fantastic working hard 7 days a week to keep the place clean and tidy. On the whole I would say it was great value for money and is in a good location to town, being only 10 mins walk away. There is a bit of hill to the main road which is 20m long with steps to one side, you can also walk under the road to access the street which is less steep. If you are just an average Joe normal bodied person it isn't even worth mentioning. The wifi is great and free, and has good range and there is a mini bar in reception for cold beverages. Overall a great little hotel.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice place to stay at a good price. We stayed there a couple years ago. A bit of an uphill walk to get to down town. Close to bus station and local market store. Service was good. I have no complaints. I would recommend to those travelling to Fira.
hotelName:
