7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back having stayed here for 4 nights for my first wedding anniversary, and i must say what you pay for, is what you get..Hotel is situated in a decent location, roughly a 10 minute walk from the main Fira town strip. Not too close or far. It is however located down a steep hill and can be a bit of a climb on your way out. Even if you are going down, be careful. However i hired a scooter so this wasn’t an issue during my stay. Scooter was parked for free just by the main entrance of the hotel. Upon arrival we were welcomed by a friendly receptionist, who took us up to our room which was room 6. Room was clean to a decent standard and was cleaned daily. The sheets were also changed daily. The bathroom however had a horrible smell which I couldn’t get rid of. There was no fan or window that could open in there and I dreaded going in there whenever i had to. Maybe a window that actually opens would help? Also you could hear water running through the pipes in the middle of the night which was very annoying. The wifi was really good on the other hand. Checkout was at midday and we weren’t being picked up until 9pm later that evening. We asked for late checkout prior to arrival but this was declined unfortunately. However staff were nice enough for us to leave our bags in the reception until 7pm when the reception shuts. We waited a further 2 hours before our pickup at the top of the hill (near main road) as our transfer bus wasn’t able to go down close to the entrance when we were dropped off due to how steep the hill was. After we could no longer leave our bags in reception after 7pm we simply walked to the main strip to kill 2 hours with dinner before heading back and waiting for our transfer by the steep hill. All in all a decent stay, Probably wont stay here again if i go back. Santorini however is a beautiful island!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: * Firstly, apologies for lateness in posting review! *For our arrival, we pre-booked with the hotel a 'private' pick-up transfer (€10 per person) from Athinios Port. I'd read lots of stories about the long slow trip from the Port to Fira. The trip is approximately 10km, but the first 4km is a very steep climb up a narrow single lane road, with 7 or more tight hairpin bends. There is no opportunity to pass, so after a ferry has arrived, the traffic is like a long slow procession of ants crawling up the sheer cliff-face. To get a jump on the traffic, we made sure we were among the first passengers off the ferry. We found our driver holding a sign with our name, and thought we would be on our way. No - that's when we discovered our 'private' transfer wasn't private at all. We waited for 5 more passengers off the same ferry, and then 2 more passengers off the next ferry. After 45 minutes (or more) we were finally on our way. By now the traffic was horrendous! Each passenger paid €10 per person - so €90 for the mini-van to travel a 10km trip - an absolute rip-off and misrepresentation of the service we were sold! In addition to this, we were not dropped at the door of the hotel. Instead we were dropped off roadside at the top of a steep hill and left to navigate the decline with our luggage. The hotel was nearby (down the hill and around the corner), but no staff member came to meet us and assist with our luggage. Not exactly a warm welcome!At check-out we experienced more transfer problems - this time going to the Airport (€10 per person - distance 5.5km). We had a 6:40 am flight (to Athens), so had to be at the Airport at 5:40 am. When we pre-booked the transfer with the Hotel, we were told we'd be picked up out the front of the Hotel at 5:00 am. By the time we got our luggage to the front gate it was 5:03 am. We waited 5 minutes or so and nobody arrived. The Hotel reception opens at 8:00 am so there were no staff available. We wondered if there had been a mix-up with instructions, so decided to head to the roadside (where we had been dropped off when we arrived). I waited roadside with the luggage, while my husband went back to the Hotel to see if he could locate a member of staff. The streets were deserted and I was beginning to think we were stranded and had no way of getting to the Airport. After some 10 minutes my husband came back - he was unable to find any Hotel staff. Finally I saw a minivan driving towards us. I flagged it down and amazingly it was our pre-booked transfer - running 30 minutes late! We caught our flight in time, but it was a very stressful experience - particularly at that time of morning where there are no alternative options available.As for the Hotel itself, we enjoyed our stay (4 nights). The room was comfortable (apart from getting access to the bathroom - you had to side-step past the bed, and even then it was a tight squeeze!) and very clean. My goodness, the housekeeping lady works tirelessly! Single-handedly she cleans all 10 rooms daily, as well as ironing (as I noticed on the surveillance monitor in reception). She literally runs from room to room, carrying heavy bags of dirty laundry, and buckets with cleaning products, mops and brooms. By the end of the day the poor woman must be exhausted - particularly in the summer heat! The pool is very small, but inviting - it's both enjoyable and refreshing to take a quick plunge at the end of a long hot day of exploring the island. The pool closes quite early, and whilst this seem a little odd, I guess given guest rooms are immediately beside the pool, it's to ensure guests have maximum quite and privacy. The garden area (surrounding the pool) has a nice ambiance. Our room had a kitchenette, although cooking hot food is not permitted. A few pieces of crockery and some utensils are provided - suffice for preparing breakfasts (cereal, toast and tea & coffee - but no bacon & eggs; hard-boiled, scrambled, poached or fried), and cold meats and salads for lunch or dinner. The was a small fridge with freezer - perfect for cold drinks (you can't drink Santorini's tap water!) and keeping supplies from the supermarket fresh. The Hotel's location is great - just 500 metres or so to the vibrant heart of Fira. Everywhere you go in Santorini, its steps, steps and more steps. Whilst the hotels that cascade down the caldera's edge appear very romantic, and they offer magnificent views - can you imagine having to carry your luggage in and out! Considering this, the hill you have to navigate to reach the Hotel is a breeze, in comparison! The Hotel recommended us some inexpensive restaurants (Taverna style) serving hearty Greek food. Getting around the island by local bus in easy (regular services to the most popular destinations) and cheap. Think twice about hiring a scooter - no rental company will offer you comprehensive insurance. Yes, you get third party insurance, so if you crash into somebody else that cost will be covered, however crash the bike with nobody else involved and you're paying the repair costs yourself! A good way to destroy a fun holiday, unless you're carefree and don't care about such things! Yes, we enjoyed our stay, despite the problems with both transfers. Considering the price of other Hotels in Santorini, this was definitely value for money.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a one day visit of Santorini. Hotel was close to the airport. There is a walk down a steep hill (it is a volcanic island) to the hotel. Hotel was quiet and clean. Bed was comfortable. Staff friendly. Bathroom was tiny and shower floods it, but manageable. Walk uphill to town, you don’t have to be on the main road and easily see the outskirts of town. I found the location ideal and a bargain price. Breakfast not included.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room we had was ground level which we were happy about so we didn't have to carry luggage up and down stairs. Friendly staff.Clean room.not too far to walk into town although up hill.good walk home
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed for 4 nights, very happily. The pictures on booking.com made the pool look MUCH bigger than it is, but we really weren't fussed by it and didn't even use the pool much in the end. The location is great, 10 minute walk into town and then an even shorter one back from town because it's all down hill! There is a steep hill just as you exit/enter the street for the villa. Be careful, there are stairs to the side that are less slippery. The studio room was lovely, with an incredible bed and lots of space. Everything was very clean. I found it strange that even though a coffee maker was on the bench of the kitchenette, there was no coffee provided. The staff were lovely, helping us with our large suitcases up and down the flight of stairs to our room, even putting the bags in our room whilst we checked in. They often sat outside reception drinking coffee and always said hello as we passed. We had a very pleasant stay, but were woken a few mornings by a rooster. Frustrating at the time, but funny to look back on. We were quite happy here and would definitely recommend it
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We paid for a transfer from the port to the hotel offered to us by staff. The transfer left us at the top of a steep incline to walk approximately 500 metres to the hotel. Since we are travelling for 3 months and have heavy suitcases this was less than ideal, my friend fell over wheeling her suitcase down the hill. It would have been nice if the transfer had dropped us out front or alternately for someone to meet and help us with luggage, and also to help us take it back up the stairs of the hotel when departing!Upon arrival we were met by a young man who was friendly and showed us to our room. We asked him a few questions about the town and where to go for dinner and he said he didn't know and didn't really want to book a table for us when we chose somewhere to go. On departure we asked another staff member to book a taxi for us and he made it seem like it was big inconvenience to do so. Additionally, we were not informed the tap water is not drinkable in Santorini which resulted in a funny tummy after a few glasses of water until we were informed elsewhere. We only stayed for one night (pre-arranged) and were glad it worked out this way. Despite the service, the rooms were adequate and clean. The hotel is located on the outskirts of Fira, about a 10 minute walk to the main square.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there at August 2017 and everything was fine. The people at the reception are really kind and the room was clean. The location is perfect. The only thing we didn't like was the fact that the room was small and the curtain at the bath.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Galatia Villias in June 2017. Beautiful hotel, rooms clean and comfortable, good AC and staff were very pleasant! Hotel owners were very accommodating to our ATV's allowing us to park out the front! Only thing I would mention is the walk to Fira is uphill and takes roughly 10mins, however still close for the price! Would recommend staying here again!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mum and I have just spent a week at Galatia Villas and we had an amazing time. This is a very small hotel (15 rooms) and it is very similar to a boutique hotel. The grounds are lovely with beautiful colorful flowers and plants.We had a studio which consisited of a double bed and a sofa/ bed and a little kitchenette that had a kettle/ toaster/ fridge. You couldn't cook hot meals but it was just big enough to make a cold breakfast/ lunch and obviously to store cold beers/ wine!The room was kept spotless and I have to praise Mimosa, the cleaner, for being so hard working especially in the 44 degree heat! She doesn't speak a lot of english but she was always polite and try and have a chat with us. The owners of the hotel couldn't do enough for you. The wi-fi worked brilliantly and was free of charge. The hotel arranged for the airport transfers which cost 10 euros/ pp. There is a small pool and 4 sunbeds and we found that they were always free because a lot of the tourists were out and about visiting the island during the day. There is also a hot tub and some more sunbeds upstairs next to a couple of the rooms. The location of the hotel is brilliant as it is a 10 minute walk to the centre of Fira where there are plenty of bars/ restaurants and clubs. The bus station is also within 10/15 minutes walk which is easy to use to be able to explore the rest of the island. There is a small shop that is a 2 minute walk from the hotel which was very convenient to stock up on things and it was open till very late. We throughly enjoyed our stay in Fira and Galatia Villas. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay at Galatia Villas each time we travel to Ios, we have stayed in many of their rooms, which are always well equipped, to a great standard and the staff are always very helpful, it is a little holly so wouldn't suit anyone who doesn't like a bit of a walk but we think it's worth it.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the studio for 3 persons. The hotel helped arrange an airport shuttle for us for 10eur per person. The driver had to wait for all passengers which was a bit of a downer because there were flights that was delayed. When we reached the hotel, there was someone to greet us even though is was already past midnight.The room was decently sized but the shower was tiny. There was air con which is defitnitely good. The hotel is 15 mins walk to town which is okay and not too bad.Overall, this was a great value for money no-frills kind of hotel. I would recommend it to anyone else travelling on a budget!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cute hotel with helpful staff and close to the town. The rooms are very small though! But if you are going to Santorini, I imagine you are going to be out most of the day and night, so this shouldn't be a problem!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although Galatia is close to the center of town, it is mostly uphill getting there. Make sure to bring a small flashlight if you are planning to walk back to the hotel at night. Our apartment unit was in a different building from the hotel. For the excellent pricing, we had a comfortable one bedroom apartment. We would probably not stay here again because of the uphill walk into town. Instead, we might splurge for a caldera view hotel in another town on Santorini.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice place to stay with kind and accommodating staff. Our apartment was very clean and a well cared for property with beautiful flowers at the entrance. The hotel owner gave us a detailed map and clear instructions on how to navigate the town and where to go. I would definitely recommend this cute and pleasant place to stay!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place to sleep 2-4 nights. Not very fancy. Strange covers on beds without a duvet cover. Clogged sink was also not an advantage. Old towels.If you have an opportunity try not to stay in Fira, as the city is dirty, chaotic and nothing to do. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast saying that there are a lot of places outside, but the food in Fira is mostly bad or average, so it is difficult to find really good food for breakfast.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just spent one week at Galatia Villas with my daughter. The owner and his two sons take great pride in their hotel and so they should. It was impeccably clean (the sheets and towels are changed every day)and not even a speck of dust under the bed!! The bedroom was standard size for a three star hotel, the bathroom a little small but everything worked well, especially the shower. The owner and his sons were very helpful, the hotel is very conveniently situated (quiet). There is a walk up the hill to the town but I am in my late sixties and it was absolutely no problem to me - and it is downhill all the way back! I highly recommend Galatia Villas for your stay in Santorini.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were lucky enough to find out we had been given a free upgrade on arrival. The room was massive, we were very comfortable in our stay. Clean room, Comfortable beds, great water pressure in the shower, spacious room and a kitchenette to prepare small stuff if wanted. The reception staff were more than helpful in assisting us with everything - bags, maps, things to do, port transfers, bike hire. The only thing we found difficult was the location, as one of our family members had bad knees and there was a large hill to get down to get to the room, and then several steps up. Pool was shaded and a lovely afternoon swim. Would definitely recommend staying here. Thank you.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in Santorini many times and stayed in several places. This time we only stayed one night on our way to another island. Galatias is fairly well located on the outskirts of Fira and it's a good alternative if you absolutely want to stay in the capital and you are on a budget. The room was small and very warm, but the house in itself is quite cosy. The beds were rock hard and the shower small. It's a steep walk up to the centre of Fira, but, on the other hand, you'll get home in no time. Galatias is good value for money and the personnel very helpful.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in August for 4 nights. Our travel agent had chosen this place for us, and we did check reviews on trip advisor also which were mixed but mostly good. Next time I'd personally stay in Oia. Upon our arrival, we were very happy. Young man at front desk was very friendly and helpful. Our room was the smallest I'd ever seen but to be honest I wasn't too concerned about this as we don't really stay in the room much when on holidays but it was small! The bed was rock hard- very uncomfortable. Pillows also very uncomfortable. Our toilet didn't flush well, and our sink leaked for a day all over our bathroom floor. We told the man at the front who came and fixed it, very helpful! There was a TV in the room with one English Chanel, air con worked well. Galatia Is about 25 ish minutes away by car from Oia and about a 5 minute drive away from the main town in Thira. We hired an ATV and got around the entire island with this. Highly recommended. We parked it right outside our room. Average stay overall.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely accommodation ran by friendly, approachable and helpful staff. Perfect location not too far from the centre of Fira, close enough to walk, far enough away for peace. Room cleaned everyday, peaceful and friendly atmosphere. Can't think of one negative.....just go!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Based on the nice reviews and photos my friend and I saw on trip advisor we made a booking. On arrival, after managing to navigate the slippery and dangerous downhill slope with heavy cases in the heat we were very happy to find that our hotel looked just as good as the photos we had seen, so made up for the very early ferry ride, the horrendous hill and being over heated from exerting ourselves on said hill with heavy cases. We were greeted on arrival by what appeared to be very friendly helpful staff. We were a little early for our 1pm checkin, so we were told to go for a walk and lunch and to come back after 2.15pm, which being in holiday mode we were both ok with that. On our return we were escorted half way back up horrendous hill to a very boxy unattractive building that was our accommodation! We were told that we were right next to the jacuzzi, then our 'friendly hotelier' raced away quickly. We were still in shock at where we had ended up with, so we didn't unpack and decided to check out the jacuzzi. Then finding that it was not much bigger than a spa bath and overcrowded and literally no room for us, we high tailed back up to reception where we were told that unfortunately they could not do anything that afternoon but would move us the next morning at 10am. The next morning it was a different story with another staff member refusing to move us, telling us the hotel is exactly as the photos and that trip advisor had been there recently and taken more photos, he was getting rather aggressive and it was most unpleasant. After long 'heated discussion' we were moved to a studio next to the pool. It was very nice and more in line with what we were originally lead to believe we were getting. None of the photos we had seen on the Internet showed photos of the building where we had to stay on the first night, and with only 2 precious nights and 2 years in the planning it is very very disappointing. If we had of known what kind of room we were going to be allocated we would never have booked this hotel. It looks lovely in the photos ....but beware also have a look on wotif at the reviews as well and you will see reviews like mine...not getting what you were lead to believe you had booked based on the website.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is a nice clean hotel with lovely staff, located in a quiet area 10 minutes walk from the center of the city where you can find the bus stop. The value for money is incredible, they have a nice small pool but there is no sea view.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was hit or miss, depending what time of day. The location was down a steep hill, and it was difficult to get up and down with luggage from the shuttle (but once you are on the main road, the walk to town isn't terribly offensive). The decorating was beautiful. Also, this was the first place I stayed in Europe where I actually had space in the room (except the shower - still no luck there).
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Galatia Villas is a clean hotel run by nice people and represents a good deal for the money. It is conveniently located close enough to town to walk in for the evening. We were budget minded travelers and we felt like we got what we paid for during our stay. The beds were rock hard and the bathroom was tiny, but that is very typical of accommodations on the island. The hotel was far enough from the bustle to be peaceful an we enjoyed our time there.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived about one in the morning and although in theory the reception was closed the owner was there to welcome us and direct us to the car park (since we had informed them of our late arrival). This was a nice touch and he provided us with a map of the island and a calendar as a gift when we left. Staff were friendly.The outside of the villas is beautifully whitewashed and fresh. We had room 10 near the tiny pool. It was clean but rather dated. It was supposed to be a studio and I had booked it so we had a kitchen. However, there was no means to cook anything as there was no hob, microwave or cooker. This was a disappointment, as was the bathroom - it was so small you could not even turn around in it. Also, the shower had no wall attachment so you had to hold it all the time - not ideal. The TV had limited channels and did not include the BBC - normally this would not concern me but with the wifi really slow it meant keeping up with the UK post referendum news was rather a challenge. The hotel location was ok, no view and its about 10-15mins uphill walk into Fira town. It's best to walk rather than take the car as you have to drive up a very steep single track road (praying nothing is coming the other way) to join the main road and then around a long one way system to get to the town centre, then it is almost impossible to park. Galatia Villas was OK but I wouldn't stay there again.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely quiet complex. Staff very helpful and rooms very clean, sheets changed every day. 10 minute walk to Fira town centre, which was ideal for us. Although a lot of traffic, but keep to the sides. Our room was very nice. Bathroom was a tad small for 3 people and more storage space for 3 people would have been nice. If you get the mini bus, be prepared to walk down a steep hill. It was ok for us as we welcomed the exercise but can be quite hard going in the hot climate. Again if you don't mind the walking in to Fira, this is a lovely complex. Air conditioning superb and you have a fridge, kettle and toaster for your use and complimentary water on arrival. Fira itself has loads to offer as the main town. Best beach to visit is in Perissa which you can get the bus to at 2.40 euros each way. Bus station can be a bit manic, but hey your on holiday. I could go on but know others have covered the main things. Lovely island. If you love wine do, do the wine tasting at Pelican Kipos Cafe Wine Restuarant. Maria is your host and is lovely and passionate about the wines and the island. The food here is also amazing, you may wait a while but note, everything is made from scratch. I could go on but other visitors to the island will share their experience and you need to discover some for yourselves. Lovely volcanic island that will not be forgotten.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had such an enjoyable time in Santorini - ending in a marriage proposal! This hotel was ideal for us as a couple in our 20's who like to get out and explore and like some comfort to come back to at the end of the night. Light airy room (3) with single beds and small bathroom with shower, fridge, kettle and tv (no English channels). Although small - we never really crossed path with other guests which was nice. The pool is lovely and gets enough sun and shade to sit by all day on quieter days. The roof top jacuzzi is away from the hotel overlooking the neighbouring hotel but also lovely and has gorgeous views to the beach side of the island. Air con and safe in room were free!!Lovely approachable staff!The villas are just the right distance from Fira centre - an easy 10 min walk into the lively town - yes the road is busy but the hotel is set away from it - only the donkeys come by in a morning and evening!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for an affordable holiday to Santorini then this place is perfect for you. Although the villas are a 10 min walk away from main Fira this is not an issue at all. It is very easy to navigate. The room was lovely, not very big but was modern and extremely clean. We were however self catered and there was only a kettle and fridge provided which was fine for us as we love dining out on holiday but I don't think the villas provide any type of restaurant. If you want a place with a decent pool then look elsewhere as both pools/sun-lounging areas have around 3-4 loungers and 2 very small pools with not much sun (1 is a hot tub) but to be honest Santorini would be wasted on you if you were to just sit by the pool all day!! I would definitely stay here again, staff are lovely and it is such good value for money!!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's only a few minutes (5-10) walk from the main part of Fira, also the main bus stop, which is good. The staff was friendly and had good recommendations for food and activities. I'm not exactly sure what it was but this hotel just wasn't quite as nice as the others we stayed at during our trip to the Greek islands. Maybe it was the room or the fact they didn't pick us up from the port when we got in like the other hotels. But overall it was still a nice stay.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a friend at the end of April and I am so glad we chose this hotel. The value for money is incredible, the hotel is clean, modern, and the staff are extremely helpful. As soon as we arrived we were greeted from the road and led into reception and helped with our bags. We were told of the best restaurants to go to, and given a map and bus timetable. Nothing was too much trouble for them!Our room was very spacious and had everything we needed, it was also cleaned everyday which is a rarity at most hotels! We also used the rooftop area which had sunloungers and a "hot" tub (it wasn't hot!)The only negative if I had to say one would be the location as it is at the bottom of a steep hill and to get to the centre of Fira, you either have to walk along the main road with no footpaths or through the back streets, which aren't great at night! But then if the hotel wasn't in this location then it wouldn't be at the amazing value for money that it is.I definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay somewhere that won't put you out of pocket but is still close enough to everything!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The villa is beautiful, slightly tucked away you don't hear any of the noise from the main road but you're just a 5 minute walk from the centre of Fira. As a self-catered studio you lack a hob but with gyro's only 3 euros this isn't a problem. Also the swimming pool is rather small and doesn't get a lot of sun, but to make up for this they have access to a rooftop with sun loungers and a small hot tub! All in all, a great little place to stay!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top place , amazing rooms and staff very close to town with a price tag attached that won't leave you needing to remortgage the house...... I have been all over Greece and I'd stay here again in a heart beat......literally 5 mins walk from town......10/10
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well kept Hotel, clean and has good rooms. We stayed as a couple for a week in a standard room which had a fridge, en suite bathroom and balcony. It was cleaned every day.Pool area is only small but very nice, we spent a lot of time on the terrace with the jacuzzi (this is only heated by the sun and can be cold), but the terrace area is very nice with comfy sun loungers.It's not far into Fira centre, maybe ten mins on foot but would think twice about staying if you have mobility issues as the hill is somewhat steep - you do get used to it though.The people who work in the hotel couldn't be more of a help and were all lovely.Only thing I would say is the shower takes some getting used to as you have to hold it whilst you wash but can make do for a week.Would stay again, especially considering price its a lovely hotel.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room we stayed in was fairly good, it had good air conditioning and a mini fridge which came in handy. It is located about a 10 minute walk down from Fira which is quite steep so you would need to hire an atv or a scooter to get around. The fridge came in handy to put breakfast items in (there are no eateries near the villa although they do breakfast if you ask the day before) and bottled water as the water from the tap is not drinkable. The room itself was quite clean and comfortable with a homely feel to it. The general area was lovely, you really felt like a local staying there. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The one downside was the shower, the pressure of the water was terrible most of the time and the temperature of the water was very inconsistent, hot cold hot cold non stop.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and spacious apartment. It was a very good value, decent place at a decent price. It is in a good location, but do note it is down a steep hill. The manager George is very friendly as well. The only downside was the shower just had a hand sprayer with no wall mount which was difficult to manage. Galtia Villas is highly recommended from me!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week in June in a studio apartment. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived to find such a clean, spacious and well-equipped apartment. We had an open plan kitchen and living area (hobs/hot plates and saucepans, cooking utensils, kettle, toaster, coffee maker, fridge and freezer, microwave, lots of cutlery, glasses and crockery, table and chairs, sofa and tv, as well as a lovely balcony with a sea view) and spacious bedroom and small bathroom. It was cleaned and we had fresh towels every day. The air con worked very well. It is very well located in that it is quiet but still an easy walk into Fira. The owners were absolutely great on our last day when our flight wasn't until 9pm - we checked out in the morning and spent the day on a beach, but they let us leave our luggage in reception and then use their shower facilities in the evening (even gave us fresh towels then too). Free parking just down the road too. Outstanding value for money, thank you for a great week.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a week here in a double studio ....... So clean, tastefully decorated. So close to Fira about a 10 minute walk ...... So quiet day and night and felt exceptionally safe ....... The family that run it are extremely helpful,If I came back I'd definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owners and staffs are very friendly. When the first day we arrived at the hotel has been a little late, fortunately the boss's son is waiting for us, he also briefed us about the Landmarks of Santorini and the main street of Fira town with a map.We just need to walk around 10mins into the Fira town.The room was clean and the price is affordable, absolutely we will recommend this hotel to our friends.
hotelName:
7    Galatia Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 6 nights at Reverie and was an excellent stay all around. For starters, the airport transfer is cheap and convenient, right on time there and back, which is big considering taxis are super expensive in Santorini. Once we got to the hotel, we were greeted by Elias who was extremely nice and helpful. The whole hotel is family-run and they really show pride in their work. Our bags were taken care of and we were shown around the property after being served a complimentary homemade drink which was delicious.The hotel itself is very nice and quaint. We asked for a crib and was taken care of no problem. Room was clean, showers are nice and the hotel is very quiet. Kitchen area is small, but functional. The pool is great but not heated, which I don't think is a problem later in the season, but was a bit chilly at times at the beginning of June. Breakfast was great and very convenient also. The location of the hotel is very central, close to walk to Fira and the bus station, but not so crazy busy if you were actually staying in Oia or Fira. But the best part of the entire hotel is the balcony with an amazing view of the Caldera. It was great sitting up there every night and meeting other guests and enjoying the sunset.All in all, it was a great experience. The entire family treated us as if we were part of it, especially our infant son who they all were so nice to. Great stay!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the center of Firostefani and has everything you need within walking distance, such as the main town Fira and the old port for some tours. The highlight was the host, Elias, who from the moment we arrived gave us loads of information about the island and different activities available. Walked us around the hotel and made sure we were happy with our room plus a in-house brewed welcome drink (with a small bottle in our room). The rooftop area has an amazing view of the sunset so you don’t need to go to Oia. There were a number of little things that just added to the experience such as lit tea light candles around the common areas, organizing activities through reception, supplied swimming towels, local recommendations and checked how everything was each time he saw us.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, small family run hotel who appear to go out of their way to help you in whatever way they can. The hotel has a roof terrace which any hotel guest is free to use which offers some fantastic views of the sunsets over the caldera. The hotel has restaurants and shops aplenty upon its doorstep and is only a 10 minute walk away from Thira where the port is. Would highly recommend and would willingly stop here again if we revisit
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Santorini 3 times, each time I have picked hotels with killer views(that I didn’t really use) and killer price tags. This time my knees could not cope which is why I picked this place. The entrance is on the road below which is just 2 flights of stairs, the back entrance is on the walking track, perfect. It is a family run business by a lovely family, the daughter runs the front desk and she will go out of her way to assist. The nephew, Ilias went out of his way to assist, as we were traveling with mother who just had a knee replacement, he could not find a taxi to take us 1 km, they were asking for big bux, he found a way. It has a great pool, very clean and you are in the heart of Firostefani.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 5 night stay at the Hotel Reverie was amazing! Nikolina and family/staff were friendly, wonderful and very helpful with planning my stay and organizing some tours. Rooms were very clean, breakfasts were great. Everyone was very accomodating and eager to help. Reverie is a perfect place to stay,excellent location and very close to Fira and yet a quiet retreat! I would definitely stay again when I return! Many thanks!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from an 8 night stay at the family run Reverie Hotel and we would rate it highly. The family were friendly, informative and really helpful. They will answer every query you can think of! Room was spacious and cleaned every day. Beach towels are free to use. Any request we had was fulfilled! Pool is small but very refreshing! We used the roof terrace was every eve, fantastic views and great for a beer and a chat whilst waiting for the sunset. Nice restaurants along the front (various price ranges) and Two Brothers bar was our favourite by far! We booked the Boat trip through the Hotel which was good value and fun! (although be prepared for walk to top of volcano!) The main bus station is a 20 min walk, just before the large supermarket. Bus station on left / Supermarket on the right. There is also a great small shop as you come out the front of the Hotel (First one as you walk to the right) really friendly!! The buses are pretty easy to navigate. We went to Kamari and Perissi beach. Kamari was our favourite and it is nearer (Try the King's restaurant at the end of the promanard. Great food and service) the sunbeds are free when you have a drink or food. We walked to Oia (Be prepared for a hike!) 2.5 hrs long, but worth it (get the bus back) Fira is only 10 mins walk. Which has lots of lanes with lovely shops. You can also get the cable car down to the port or walk down the many steps! The Hotel is in a great position for everything we needed and was good value for money. Can't recommend the Hotel or the staff enough. Santorini overall is beautiful, but be prepared for some high costs in some restaurants/ bars!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welcoming and attentive staff; we felt as though we had come to visit our Greek cousins.Excellent location and views from our balcony.Very clean and well kept facility that is very nicely located a short walk from Fira -nice to be close to the shopping and port but not where it is so crowded.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a family group staying together and couldn’t have had a better time. The place is small but lovely, breakky delish and the service wonderful. Couldn’t fault the place, location, rooftop views and the little plunge pool was great.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When searching for a hotel in Santorini it was a bit difficult to choose since there are no "name brands" and I wasn't sure which part of the island to choose. However, I'm so pleased I ended up at the Reverie based both on TripAdvisor reviews and one in a guide book. First of all the location is excellent - while it is on a foot path that leads to Fira in 10 minutes and Oia in 3 hours (a long but fun hike!), it is a little out of the crowded centre so was a bit quieter. However, we were still steps away from great restaurants (in fact we made one reservation by shouting from our balcony). Based on other reviews we chose the suite which meant we had a balcony that overlooked the sunset as well as a second level window which gave us an even better view. I also can't say enough about the service - from the minute we were picked up at the airport until the minute we were dropped off, the owners were attentive and friendly. Nikolina checked us in, Elias gave us the tour and helped us find activities. I believe it was the dad who picked us up at the airport and a sister who prepared an excellent breakfast. I would recommend paying the extra for the breakfast - it was home made and deliciousand I doubt you could do much better for the same price elsewhere. Only two small comments on the suite - one is that the bed is on the second level while the bathroom is on the first. It was a bit inconvenient if you needed the bathroom in the night, but not terrible. Also the ceiling on the second floor is quite low - we're not tall but still found ourselves banging our heads occasionally. It would be problematic for really tall people.That aside, I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would recommend Reverie to anyone visiting Santorini. The owner Nikolina and her sister, mom and dad, and Elias were just wonderful. They made us feel like family. Being in a different country, we were so comfortable knowing they were there to help us with anything. So happy to help out a family owned business. James Erl and Janine Bachta
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot commend this hotel enough - outstanding hospitality, spotless rooms, wonderful facilities, and a wonderful location. I'd choose to stay here vs in Fira or Oia towns - it's quiet and everything is conveniently near i.e. minimart, reasonably priced restaurants, bus stop, and Fira town is a good 10-15 min walk away. Nikolina, Elias and their father are always smiling and ready to assist - what a lovely family run establishment! They even assisted my husband with a surprise! Happy to come back when there's a chance! xx Kristine and Mykelle
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Reverie was truly a pleasure to stay at! Upon check in the host Elias gave us a rundown and map of where we were and some tips on the area including excursions and where to eat. He wasn’t pushy and explained the different options for where to eat and what the area offers. He gave us a tour of the property including the rooftop terrace (which is a must for watching the beautiful sunsets!). We were very happy with the excellent, attentive customer service. The area is much better and more quiet than the capital of Thira/Fira. I wouldn’t recommend staying in Fira or Oia as the streets are packed with tourists from the cruise ships and the prices are a lot higher. This hotel has access to both the main road and the walking street facing the caldera with restaurants and shops etc. We were picked up for our tours directly from the hotel which other hotels aren’t able to offer as they don’t have access to the main road. The hotel also arranged a rental Atv for us which was very helpful as we read some bad reviews about some places being unreliable or scamming you. We were able to park directly outside the hotel which was great! The rooms were spacious and clean with kitchenettes that included basic utensils etc. Beds were comfortable and each room has a free safe. Pool area was small but welcoming. ***Long story short: amazing, quiet location, with exceptional service and excellent accommodations.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Great service! Great deal! Great breakfast! Great view from the top terrace! We realky enjoyed our stay here in Santorini. They also propose tours and service booking.Thank you to all the team of this family hotel!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here last week for 3 nights. Perfect location, very clean and a really good service from Elias. Always there to give information and help with any questions. Roof top terrace is a real bonus. The prices to eat and drink in the area are high because of the views but here you can take your drinks onto the terrace and enjoy the views without the silly prices. So pleased we have been to Santorini and experienced it all and would highly recommend anyone to stay here if staying in this area.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My overall stay was wonderful. Great location- wonderful sunset view from the terrace. Nice rooms- rooms are spacious and clean and has got fridge in it. Owner and staff were amazing- Nikolina and Elais were very helpful and friendly. They greeted us with home made drink which was great. Overall great experience :)
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel & lovely people easy to get everywhere & good starting point for walk to Oia. The people make this hotel stand out. Just book it....................................... why does trip advisor ask for at least 200 hundred characters before you can leave a review !!!!Thanks
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed 3 years before and we returned to celebrate our wedding anniversary.This time we booked a Suite and we loved it.It's worth the extra money.The Suite wasvery spacious, located on the highest point of the hotel with great views.We liked very much the decoration,the white furniture,the modern shower..it was the best option for our anniversary.Two days we enjoyed Reverie breakfast as well.it is very reasonabe and believe me,you eat a lot.Reverie family welcomed us again very warmly and offered us a bottle of wine for our special occasion.We felt that we were back to our Santorini home!We love this place and for sure we will stay there again and again and again...
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I stayed for eleven days in October at this lovely hotel. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so welcome,Our studio apartment was spacious and very clean with basic cooking facilities Just out the gate and you were on the caldera walkway. A mini market and plenty of restaurants very close by. Short walk in to Fira takes about 10 minutes with fabulous views.It is a family run small hotel and nothing is too much trouble.A special memory for me was being invited to join the extended family for lunch on our final day.Something I will never forget.I can't wait to return
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic room! For a studio, my room was big. Decor was unique and exclusive to Santorini. Bonus was the spiral staircase that leads to another loft queen size bedroom like in a fairytale princess story. Well-quipped with a kitchenette and facilities. Location - Easy accessibility within walking distance to everywhere - Mini market and rows of fine dining and shops just at the backgate of hotel. Fira Town with many quaint shops and cafes 10minutes walk. Can see sunset sea view from the rooftop garden even better than photos. Simple and healthy breakfast. Provide massage mani pedi services and tours desk. Space for events too. Reverie family and staff are hospitable and friendly. Will come back to stay here. Highly recommended to family and friends.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely experience you gave us two Australian couples who stayed for four nights late September 2018. Thanks to you all for your amazing local Greek hospitality - just what we were after and you all delivered in spades. We will definitely be recommending your place to others - the best we have come across in the Greek Islands. Also especially want to thank George for the fun transfer to the ferry when leaving - what an experience which we can laugh about now. Local ferries had been cancelled for the two days prior due to a Medicane near Athens - a three-hour traffic jam winding down to the ferry - a trip that usually takes 15 minutes ! Made it by the skin of our teeth - great memories. So highly recommend this place - two minutes walk to the lovely picturesque Caldera view
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here three nights. The hotel is well situated with easy access from the main street in front and the pedestrian walkway in rear. We had one of the suites (more costly) which have a private balcony with view; but the rooftop common area is just as good, so you could probably skip the suite and save some money.Breakfast was a good value.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You’re made to feel very welcome here, airport transfers are quick and efficient. Room was nice/clean with a small kitchenette including hotplate and fridge - perfect if, like us, you only eat a small breakfast. Location is excellent for walking into Fira and easy parking opposite front entrance if you hire a car. When you’ve spent a few days in Santorini, you’ll realise that it’s a very expensive place compared to most other mediterranean countries/islands. That makes the Reverie excellent value when you consider the room rates. Recommended.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were attending a wedding on Santorini and one of the recommended hotels by the bride and groom was the Reverie. It was my first choice and now I have no doubt I made the BEST CHOICE. The location is outstanding. And, while it is not directly hanging off the cliff, the hotel has a rooftop patio for guests to have a fantastic cliffside view, and, by the way, the other side of the island, too! It is a great place to enjoy an early morning cup of coffee, a late afternoon beer or a sunset glass of wine! The accommodations are an excellent value for the money with updated rooms and baths. The hotel has a small bar and the breakfast is the best value on the island and a great way to start your day. Having said all this what really makes the Reverie special is the staff. In all my travels, and I have traveled a good bit, I have never experienced a more professional or kind staff. They go out of their way, to the person, to make you feel welcome, to orient you to the island, to help you plan activities, to assist in anyway possible to make your stay comfortable, relaxing and memorable. I think they actually become friends! From the time a very friendly gentlemen picked us up at the airport until the time he took us back to the airport, the Reverie was a home away from home...and, in some ways better! What an incredibly beautiful island and what an excellent choice of a base from which to enjoy it. If you're staying in Fira, then, you will have chosen wisely if the Reverie is where you plan to stay.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel is clean and well taken care of. We especially enjoyed the convenience of a reasonably priced breakfast to start our day. We were greeted with a 20 minute introduction to Santorini and the hotel by Elias, the hotel staff. He was exceptionally helpful and informative with booking excursions, general information about the island, and helping to clean up a broken glass that went all over our room. While it's not directly on the Caldera, we did enjoy the rooftop patio and enjoyed some wonderful sunsets up there. It's very close to shopping and dining. I would definitely go back here again.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were welcomed to the hotel with a drink and an excellent explanation of where we were, how to get to town (not far to walk), the local restaurants (expensive and bargain) the best place to take photos and finally we were led past the pool to the rooftop seating area where you can sip a drink, watch the sunset and catch up with fellow travellers. The breakfast was big and filling with 3 choices from 3 segments eg toast/cereal/eggs from the menu. Our room was well set up with a balcony fronting on to the road and a comfy bed. The balcony was perfect to catch the sunrise and a great place to eat breakfast. Traffic noise is not a problem because of the double glazed doors. We cooked some nights on the hotplate because we had meat and salad but we also tried the local recommended restaurants and they were all good. The hotel backs on to the lane that takes you along the crater ridge line past restaurants, mini marts and tourist outlets. We also booked a tour through the front desk and if you hire a car there is parking across the road. The only drawback was that the pool looked so inviting but the water was a bit chilly - just like the Mediterranean so probably not an issue for others.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All perfect. We like special and friendly welcome. The location in Firostefani is strategic to visit Santorini and the service is maximum efficiency. Terrace to see the sunset and a little swimming pool are two gifts for all the guests. Thank you Nicolina.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just reviewing based off the breakfast. I had friends that stayed here. Even though you’re not staying here you can enjoy a great breakfast for a very low price. If I recall it’s a 3-4 course breakfast for less than 8 Euros!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were two couples and a child on our visit to Santorini and stayed at the Reverie for 4 days. We could not ask for more. Friendly staff, excellent location, clean rooms and their recommendations,(where to go, what to do etc) never failed. They also booked the restaurants and car hire for us in advance and the restaurants chosen exceeded our expectations. Highly recomanded.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would like to say how impressed we are with this lovely hotel its family run. They are all so very nice. Our room is spotless large and very comfortable our breakfast has been lovely and the pool a nice relief after a hot day sightseeing. Perfect location to everything except the beach you need transport for that. But like anything else you need help with they are more than happy to help you. With beautiful smiles. The sunset from the rooftop terrace is just amazing. We have loved our stay here and I would highly recommend.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The people were lovely and always happy to help, we rented a car through the hotel costing under 40 euros! We did a volcano trip too. The Hotel was in a fantastic location in the beautiful village of Firostefani. 10 min walk from Fira the capital, 30 min bus journey from Oia, which is worth a visit, although busy. It was great to sit on the roof terrace and watch the sunset daily and get a tan! Rooms were cleaned daily and for the price it was great. Definitely recommend and we will be returning.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t fault this place; straight out the back gate and you are next to the shops and restaurants. The hotel is lovely and clean and the staff are fabulous. Nothing is a problem. It’s like staying with family. I’m so pleased we booked here and definitely would love to return. Santorini is just beautiful and the people equally so. Sweet kind and always pleasant. Sounds like I’m exaggerating but I’m not. Just gorgeous.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Santorini in early July and stoped at the reverie to attend a friends wedding. A great value hotel, with lovely fiendly staff. It is extremely clean and the daily maid service of the rooms very food. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Views from the roof terrace are amazing and Santorini is a beautiful island well worth a visit.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an excelent 6 night stay at the Reverie Hotel. The room was big, sunny, and impeccably clean. It was a studio with a well equipped kitchen and its own terrace. The breakfast was delicious. Sadly I was on a work conference so I did not get to enjoy the pool or the tours they offered. They picked me up from the airport and received me with a welcome drink and lots of information about moving around the island. The location is perfect if you want to visit Fira, and there are lots of restaurants, mini markets, and ATMs very nearby.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 9 nights in early June, couldn’t have asked for more. Lovely suite room with gorgeous views from window and balcony. All the staff are really helpful and friendly, the rooms exceptionally clean, breakfasts are filling and tasty and they kindly catered for my gluten-free diet. Would highly recommend as you have everything you need in a a very good location. Santorini is beautiful and you can see the most gorgeous sunsets and right across the whole island from the roof terrace.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very very friendly and professional staffs. Reverie may be a little off from the Fira. We enjoyed the sunset from the rooftop. Very reasonable and nice breakfast. I and my wife were happy for 4 days staying at this lovely hotel.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Reverie in Firostefani for five days as a surprise birthday for the mrs and she (we) did enjoy the surprise and the location of this beautiful family run hotel who are brilliant at what they do for their guests. Our flight arrived very early in the morning but our request for airport pick up was accommodated and were picked up by George, the dad who was very welcoming and upon arrival at the hotel he gave us a welcoming drink of their homemade liquor made by the mom mrs Vana (who also makes fabulous chocolate treats which you can have at breakfast). When we were shown to our room there was a bottle of wine and birthday greetings from the family and staff for the mrs ❤️ ( a lovely touch, THANK YOU) The studio room was big and lovely and beautifully done up with the pool just across. The bed was very comfortable and also has a day bed/sofa in the room. The room had a hot plate cooker, kettle, pots/pans, crockery and most importantly for us a fridge to keep beverages chilled to enjoy later watching the sunset from their rooftop sitting area (the views are fantastic of the sunset and the caldera!!! ) Bathroom done to a high standard with toiletries provided. Room cleaned daily to high standard. Front entrance to the hotel is on the main road and the back entrance to the property leads right onto the Fira/Oia walkway with so many restaurants and cafes and a mini mart and the most spectacular caldera view that every visitor to Santorini would love to see to one side and the other side leading to Oia which is around two and a half hours walk but is also such a fabulous place with restaurants, bars and shops of all sorts. Nikolina and Kelly were so helpful with information and tips about the best places to visit and helping us book a sunset catamaran cruise, a whole day bus tour covering nearly everything to see along with wine tasting and a wonderfully relaxing and refreshing massage. Breakfast was another fabulous service which is very reasonably priced and cooked to perfection. I wanted to surprise my mrs with a beautiful location, fabulous accommodation and excellent service where you feel so at home, and what I got was exactly that and more. The satisfaction and happiness I saw in her was proof that Reverie as a family had provided everything and more that they could to make our stay as memorable as it was. Based on our experience with the satisfaction of overall service we would highly recommend Reverie to anyone who wants quality accommodation, quality service, excellent location and all at a great price. Thank you Reverie family and staff for the most memorable of all our holidays. Thank you, God bless.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely impressed with their service and hospitality.And totally loving its location to good food. Thank you for the amazing experience so far. You guys are doing an amazing job of making my 1st trip to Santorini such a memorable one.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Glad we decided to stay with Reverie. From the moment we were picked up at the airport to the time we left everything was smooth and easy. The room was spotless, comfortable and had everything we could want or need. Location was fantastic and worked as a great central base for exploring. Staff was very helpful, they helped us arrange the hire car to be delivered and also gave plenty tips on where to eat. If we are ever in Santorini again this is absolutely where we will stay.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The airport transfer was handled, personally and professionally, by the patriarch of the family! Many thanks to Nikolina and Elias for the prompt services rendered, including the late check-out at 2200hrs at a very nominal rate. Would I stay at Reverie again - hell, YES!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights at this clean, centrally located hotel and enjoyed our time there. We booked late so we didn't have many good options. Thankfully, there was one room, I believe, available. And we took it.You can walk most everywhere from the hotel but that is also a negative. There is no intimacy. No place to sit and quietly take in the sites. The obstructed view at the top is noisy because of restaurants and activities below as well as the loud road that fronts the hotel. (the dbl glazed windows, however, do a wonderful job muting the loud road noise inside the room - sleeping was not a problem.)I wouldn't stay here again, though, and that's not the hotel's fault. Service and cleanliness met or exceeded our expectations. It's just that we want that view more than we thought and the privacy. The Manos Small World Hotel, a short walk south along the back path, looked very nice and was only marginally more expensive, It, however, was sold out, when we tried to book a few months back.Reverie is a fine hotel. If you're going to stay here, be prepared for its shortcomings and accept them, and you'll have no regrets.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the Reverie based on reviews I read, location, photos on their website, and price point. The wonderful hotel did not disappoint! Excellent location both due to the Caldera Being right outside the back entrance and Fira (the bustling capital) being a ten minute walk. Very clean room and comfy bed. I had a single and though room and bathroom were small, there was not a thing I needed. It was perfect for one! I was greeted by Elias who gave me a wonderful rundown on local things to see and also poured me a shot of house made liquor. A warm welcome indeed and a nice way to begin my trip.I checked in with Nicolina every morning who helped me plan my day. She made what I wanted to see realistic sonthat I would not feel like I was running around too much. I followed her advice and each of my sightseeing days were wonderful. The Reverie has excellent booking for day trips such a a winery tour and sunset sail. I actually cancelled a catamaran tour I booked before I checked in and instead scheduled Nicolina’s suggested one. Half the price and absolutely wonderful. Excellent meal, lots of room on the boat, and a solo saxophonist who played right at sunset. The winery tour was also excellent.Great personalized service and lovely accommodations at a very reasonable price. Sunset views each night within a three minute walk.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You cannot beat this hotel for location, service, cleanliness and price. The lovely family who run it are extremely friendly and helpful - each and every site, mode of transportation and restaurant that they recommended turned out to be excellent. The room is spacious and spotless, and the roof terrace overlooking the Caldera is breathtaking. The breakfast is very good and a bargain at 8 Euro. We told the owners that we are celebrating our 30th anniversary and when we arrived, a bottle of wine and a note of congratulations were waiting for us as a gift! Highly recommended, great value for the price.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Reverie was nothing short of wonderful.The hotel is perfectly situated in Firostefani, just moments away from a superb view of the caldera. There are lots of restaurants nearby to choose from, so you’ll never be short of options.Our room was spacious, well equipped, clean and comfortable. The pool – just what was needed after a busy day exploring the beautiful island. And the view from the rooftop was fantastic.But the real stars of the Reverie are the people (particularly Nikolina, Elias, Kelly and Mr George). They were brilliant! Extending the warmest of welcomes, as if we were old friends. They couldn’t have been more helpful, providing great information about what to see, restaurants, buses, car rental and more. We can’t say thank you enough to them for helping to make our holiday so memorable.We would highly recommend staying at the Reverie, and would definitely stay again if (when!) we return to Santorini.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are three main areas of Santorini. Fira, the busiest place, Oia, the prettiest hill town, and Firastefani, which is so close to Fira it's almost an extension of it. Firastefani is the best place to stay because it is close to all, yet quieter than Fira.The Reverie is right on the caldera walk, but not on the ocean side. However, our room was very large and had its own large patio, and a clear view of the ocean on the other side of Santorini. Our room was on the road side, but with the door to the patio closed, it was very quiet.The front desk staff are extremely helpful. They arranged for a rental car from a trustworthy company, who met us at the hotel and brought the car to us, parked directly across the street.You could stay on Santorini and spend hundreds of dollars a night, and if it's your honeymoon then do so. But if you want a reasonably priced hotel, large beautiful rooms and great service, stay here!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we were collected by the hotel transport we new we had booked the right hotel. On arrival we were met by the welcoming family staff with a complimentary drink who explained everything about the hotel, the area restaurants and tours The rooms are immaculate and tastefully decorated. A decent breakfast at a far better cost than the surrounding restaurants is freshly made. Nothing is to much trouble for the staff and to stay in this hotel is an absolute must. You will not be disappointed. THANK YOU to all the staff at Reverie Hotel, you made a stay to this beautiful island even more enjoyable.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got married in Santorini July 2017, and booked a block of rooms for us and our guests at this wonderful hotel. It was a fantastic decision, and everyone loved it!!! The hotel itself is absolutely lovely, and so is the family who runs it!! It was a perfect location and infact alot of my guests even thanked me for booking here instead of one of the hotels down the cliff, as The Reverie is very convenient for parking (right across the road from it) and right on the walkways going through Santorini, with Steps literally less then a minute away taking you down the cliffside if you should you desire. We also got the shuttle service they offered which was perfect and so stress free! I cannot thank Nikolina enough for all her help with everything, and when we return to Santorini we will definitely be going back to the Reverie, Truly a perfect hotel with greek charm that I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reverie hotel is situated on a very convenient location next to caldera cliffs. It is a very clean place with quiet and nicely decorated rooms with plenty of amenities. The bed was really amazing and we enjoyed sleeping there. Wi-Fi was excellent. The friendly hotel staff provided us with much information and that is why we managed to see and explore the whole island easily. Do not miss their suggestion for sailing which is a great experience cause of the great views it offers. There is no doubt that we will be back again to spend some more time at Reverie Hotel!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 days. Happy with the room, which is clean and comes with rain shower. Hotel location is a 15min walk to the main area, Fira and bua stop is just a few steps from the hotel. Staff is friendly and able to assist in our requests, such as printing our boarding pass and helping us rent car. Recommended!
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't arrive at Santorini airport until almost 2200. But what a relief it was to see our friendly driver holding a "Reverie Hotel" sign as we cleared the baggage claim area. He took our bags to our room as Kelly gave us the orientation in the reception area with a complimentary drink waiting for us. Great, clean, spacious room, beautiful private terrace, and so conveniently located for any activity on the island. We loved the place. And a gorgeous rooftop terrace to watch sunset.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so torn on where to stay during our time on the island and even second guessed our decision a couple times prior to our vacation but I am so grateful we decided to stick with Reverie. It truly was what everyone says.. perfect. From the moment we were picked up at the airport by their prearranged shuttle everything was smooth and easy. The room was spotless, comfortable and had everything we could want or need. Location was fantastic and worked as a great central hub for exploring. If we are ever in Santorini again this is absolutely where we will stay.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a quick note, we travelled as a family of 3, with our 6 month old infant. The Good- The location is great. Below the hotel, is the main road. Above the hotel is the main pedestrian pathway through Firostefani through Fira It's located a 5 minute walk from a beautiful square, which is great for watching the sunset over the caldera. Close to a number of great restaurants. Public bus stop is maybe 200-300 meters away. - Staff were friendly and quite helpful.- Were able to provide a crib for our infant.- Room was a good size. - Rooftop Balcony was a great stop to watch the sunset or people watch in the evenings. The Bad- The rooms and pool were a bit underwhelming. The photos made them look a little nicer than they actually were.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was incredible. The location was perfect with access to Fira and Oia within easy reach. It is clean, comfortable, and convenient. The people that operate it do everything they can to make your stay easy and enjoyable. A small market is nearby and the Da Vinci restaurant, which is incredible, is a two minute walk away.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel every year and have been to 5 star resorts in the Caribbean as well as in Italy, Spain, France and Greece. For the most part the people were friendly. However no place comes close to the Reverie Santorini Hotel. If you visit Santorini you would be a fool if you did not stay at the Reverie Hotel. Nicoletta and Kelly are the nicest , most accommodating, helpful people I have ever had the pleasure of interacting with. They are honest, the rooms are very well kept ( I rented 2 rooms - the suite is amazing ). Super employees and owners - Super location You Must Stay here.
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so beautiful, well located, roof top view takes your breath away... Lots of shops to ponder through.. Restaurants.. Buses close by... Transvers to and from airport reasonable and reliable regardless of time ...pool... Room just so BEAUTIFUL.. Very clean... Breakfast yummy... Staff are wonderful, they sit with you and map out the whole island on arrival, nothing is too much trouble... Highly recommended... Kathy and Peter Taylor.. Australia
hotelName:
8    Reverie Santorini Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfect if you are in santorini as a couple. The staff is top notch from check in to check out ensuring that you have a great time and all your needs are met. We even switched rooms halfway through our stay for an upgrade, and when we got back to our hotel everything was moved into our new room without us having to deal with any of it. The pool area is beautiful and comfortable. One of the best spots away from the crowds to watch a sunset. We made some great friends there as well! The location is quiet and the little village Megalochori is a short walk away, perfect for a nice romantic dinner that is much more reasonably priced then Oia or Fira. The drinks and food at the hotel are also delicious if you are looking to stay in.If you de use to stay here and would like to check out the rest of the island I highly would recommend renting an atv. You can park at the the hotel and easily get anywhere on island without having to deal with the ridiculously priced cabs or less than reliable buses. If you do need a cab the front desk will set them up for you. We loved our stay at Grand View and hope to return one day soon.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights. Room was plenty big for the four of us. The name did not mislead; it was definitely a grand view! Stayed at hotel the first night watched sunset had drinks and dinner and drinks and drinks. Great setting, good food and great wine. Only downside was there was no beach access. Beaches were 10-15 minutes away by car.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was there between 11th & 19th June and it was superb. Location is well away from the madding crowd but near enough if you want to be part of it. The facilities were excellent and the response from Andreas to any issues was instantaneous. Well run.No need to go to Oia for the sunset, you get it all from here.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're travelling to Santorini and want to get away from the crowds, do yourself a favour and stay at the Grand View. The hotel sits on the edge of the caldera and has the same awesome sunset view you'll find at Oia - without the crowds, and you can see it very night without travelling. The view also comes with cocktails if you wish. The staff are incredibly friendly, and we cannot tell hotel management how lucky they are to have the wonderful Nickki as their ambassador. Nickki made our group of 6 very welcome and was a credit to the hotel in terms of service and friendliness. Cudos also to Chef who went out of his way to make me a wonderful soup to counteract my seasickness - I can't thank you enough! The rooms are spacious, well maintained and very clean. If I had one suggestion, it would be that the beds could be a tad softer. Also, Megalochori is a wonderful little township and well worth the walk up the road to have a look and perhaps dinner. That said, the food at the Grand View is very good and well worth trying. Getting to Fira or Oia from the hotel is also incredibly easy via the local bus - the bus stop is a short walk up the road. We will definitely be back and will be recommending this hotel to all our travelling friends.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't think I will add too much more to other reviews already on TripAdvisor.The hotel's name says it all. The view is amazing and the 4 days we stayed at hotel, we never stopped pinching ourselves how lucky we were. If you want to stay away from hussle and bustle of the main towns Fira and Oia then this hotel is for you. The hotel is private, out of the way and not on top of other hotels with no privacy.
