Which my husband and I enjoyed. To get around though, you do need transport unless you want to catch bus and risk walking around the roads. Food and drinks are reasonably priced for a hotel. There are some quaint restaurants within walking distance in the old town. Rooms are clean, good size and very quaint. We had a pool room with pool and ocean views. Room was amazing. Breakfast was standard. Staff are very helpful and welcoming. We didn't have kettle in room for making tea ( which I like to have when I wake up) and next day cups and kettle put in our rooms. Would highly recommend hotel.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The views from the rooms were incredible, we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The service was great, staff were very kind and helpful. Would reccomend to anyone looking for a comfortable stay in Santorini! Looking forward to going back :)
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there in May 2019 and had a wonderful week. The view is amazing and there is no need to go to other overcrowded locations to see the sunset. On our own or with other guest with a beer or a cocktail from the excellent pool staff on the hotel pool terrace it is a great view by day and even perfect during sunset. Our room was small but included everything we needed. The very friendly hotel staff was competent and helpful during our stay. The menu card is short but the food is fresh and delicious – we really liked it. Also the village (10 minutes walk) is nice with some local taverns. Bus transportation was very easy with local busses and a bus stop nearby.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful little gem. The view is absolutely stunning. Its truly one of the best I have seen. This is not a super fancy hotel, but its just a lovely spot with wonderful staff who will do whatever it takes to make you happy. From checking inn to Dora and Kostas by the pool, and the Chef that makes AMAZING and reasonably priced food, makes this a terrific experience. A short walk to the bus stop takes you to Fira and then on to Oia.. its all perfect. The room is nice but not big. its super clean and well maintained and again the VIEW is perfect. We walked into town (10 minutes) where you can find good dinning and charming plaza. everything here is perfect because you can avoid the big cruise crowds that can be found in Fira.. Anyway.. loved it all
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Grand View. The sights from the swimming pool and the rooms are breathtaking. The sunset from here is amazing. It is a unique place where you can renovate your soul in a relaxing atmosphere. The service at the hotel was also warm and always helpful, especially in the restaurant at the swimming pool.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to small cities and villages, you can discover here and nearby the true Santorini and the true Greece. The place is quiet and authentic, romantic and special. The view from the cliff is amazing and you can admire the sunset from the terrace near the pool. The stuff is also amazing, from reception, bar, cook and so on. The food is very good, from breakfast to supper. I really recommend it, and even I visited the entire Santorini this is the place where I will come back. The combination of the above is perfect for me. Really recommend.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love our stay at Grand view! The hotel is very beautiful,just renovated. We stayed for three days in April in standard double room. The room has a common terrace that offers an amazing view to the caldera! What we liked was the area of Megalochori, is quite compare to Oia and Fira that is crowed and always busy and Is also very close to black and red beach. We had dinner also at the hotel and the food is amazing. Tasty breakfast and friendly stuff which gave us plenty recommendation about where to go and activities.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely, smaller resort off the beaten path, with many local restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk. The staff is more than professional and accommodating and the views of the sea are breathtaking. I give this more than a 5 Star rating!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ι booked the grand view hotel because I was thrilled by the great photos of the sunset and I read on the website that the whole hotel was renovated. The standard double was awesome.. everything new and the bathrooms  elegantly styled.  However- next time I will book the superior double to get a private balcony.The buffet breakfast was full of Greek delicacies and homemade jams, cake, delicious yogurt and honey from Olympia.. plus  local products. The pool has new sunbeds- comfortable and big- stay there to enjoy the sunset!! Having drinks &  cocktails..!. The food from the new kitchen is very tasty and  cheaper than the nearby restaurants. I enjoyed pasta, salads and  original Greek souvlaki... The shrimp pasta is a must. I got very good advice from the reception about how to go around. I rented a car and drove all over the island. I also enjoyed the catamaran volcano sail and got a better price from the hotel for this- this sail is also a must (a bit expensive ..but worth it) The hotel has a large parking place. .and almost no steps.. which is not easy to  find  in Santorini. Don’t forget to go to perivolos beach and enjoy the black sand beaches!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the good things you’ve read about this place are true: the position, the view, the poolside food, the people, the service. Also the location in Megalochori is perfect if you don’t want to stay in the hotspots around Fira. You really are a few minutes’ walk from the centre of this lovely village, with three inexpensive tavernas. The buses are cheap and fairly reliable. You are also around an hour’s walk from Pyrgos, Emporio and Akrotiri. That said, in the autumn at least the scenery is a bit drab away from the caldera edge. Beware: the position 600 feet up the caldera does leave the hotel fairly exposed to the winds. In the summer that is probably a bonus; in October it is fine when the sun shines but it can be chilly in the shade. We splashed out on a jacuzzi suite. For October, when the main pool is only for the hardy, the warm jacuzzi water is a great advantage. We had Room 2, which is on the top level and must have the best view (see the terrace image on the hotel’s TripAdvisor page). It has a generous barrel vaulted ceiling and lots of space. It also overlooks the jacuzzi in the room below, which is probably not such a good bet. That said, you pay a lot for a jacuzzi suite but this is still definitely a three star hotel. The room is large but fairly empty, with a smallish wardrobe and no drawers. The polished concrete shower room is basic and cramped. The comments in other reviews about “tired” decor are probably right (take a look at the Athermi Suites next door to see what can be done). The jets in our jacuzzi worked only intermittently (but we didn’t bother to report them during our stay; I told Andreas about them when we left and I have no doubt that he will have sorted it straight away). One other thing: watch out for the online reservation system. It will take a couple of days to confirm your booking - this left us rather in limbo with our flights. And the charge to my credit card was a lot more than the sterling price on the website. It seems this was because the system charged me in euros not pounds. The hotel was very understanding (as with everything else) and reimbursed me the difference. All told: a great hotel, and it gets five stars from me because of all the positives. But if you pay for a top room then you are paying a five star price for what is still a three star hotel.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good stuff:Great views, superior location away from the craziness of Fira, just outside the charming village of Megalochori with is charming little shops, restaurants,wineries and the wonderful Santorini Horse Riding stable in the town.The breakfasts were absolutely the best we had in Greece, thanks to the lovely lady who does the cooking, clean up and keeps all the patters well stocked and attractive. The maids were discrete and accommodating.The buses to Fira, Akrotiri and the rest of theisland were handy, inexpensive and frequent.The stuff you should know:The winds are strong at times due to the cliff-top location and windows ad doors slam all the time and very loudly. The pool is lovely but unheated and hence in October unusable. The sheets are so starched they are like plastic and spoiler alert, you don't flush the toilet paper (actually any paper) but put it in a sealed can. Delicate sewage systems exist on several of the Greek islands.The things to avoid:Apparently rooms 13 and 14 are the "loss leaders" with the lowest rates. Do not stay in room 13, which is next to the very active laundry room and in the pathway to the pool and the pool bar, i.e., lots of noise. Room 14 was probably the better of the two. We got moved to another room with persistence (and without paying the requested "up charge")and they were fine.Please note, we are really not very hard to please and overall the hotel was very enjoyable, especially the sunsets and the breakfasts.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I could make this hotel be my home, I'd never travel anywhere else! Our room was perfect - clean, comfortable beds, wonderful balcony with jacuzzi. The staff was attentive, so accommodating and friendly. You would be hard pressed to find a better location to view that beautiful Santorini sunset!! We could easily walk into Megalochori or to the bus stop for a ride to other towns. I can't wait to return!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in August with a group of friends and had a truly enjoyable time. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is great - away from the worst of the crowds but still easy to get anywhere on the island. The pool area is a great place to relax and unwind (and enjoy a drink). The food at the restaurant was tasty. And the staff were amazing. Andreas is a wonderful host - friendly, helpful and incredibly thoughtful. It was my partner's birthday while we were there and not only did he help us choose a fabulous restaurant, he surprised us by not only ordering a birthday cake, but picking it up from the bakery and delivering it to the restaurant himself. And, last but not least, the view truly is Grand!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place to stay we only 3 nights here but loved our room with the balcony with views of the Caldera...nice and modern great style very relaxing. I picked this location away from Fira and Oia as I wanted something quieter and this is it with great views. They have a chef who does the BEST souvlaki...the chicken skewers with the pita bread and dips that go with it are yummmmo...my favourite. The village of Megalochori is a 5 minute walk from hotel it has a roof top bar and restaurant and small shops around. Location wise to Fira and Oia is about 20 mins...bus or hire a car. Staff here are all fantastic and I thank them for making it a memorable stay on the Island of Santorini...highly recommend.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for quiet and away from the noisy night life this is your place. It has also scenic view that facing some of its island. No need to go to Oia to have a sunset photo. The place is clean and I enjoy sitting on the porch where I had my beer and the awe inspiring view of the pool and the ocean as well as islands. Most especially the sunset..We also enjoy the excellent breakfast they serve. But there is the cons on it for those people who loves to walk leisurely and take local bus like me this is not a place for you. But if you have a rental vehicle it will be perfect. The bus stop is half a kilometer away bringing your luggage with you is a discomfort not only the distance but also the chances that you will be hit by a running vehicle while walking along the 2 way narrow main road and that is without a walkway going to the hotel is very hazardous and unsafe especially at night. I had to take my chances because I love to explore the local community where I want to try also the local taverna and to visit the nearby mini mart which is a kilometer away from the hotel. We need to change our plan of using local bus going back to the airport and ended up hiring there car services instead.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grand View is quite simply one of the most amazing hotels I have ever stayed in! Two couples stayed in the Private Pool Villa which I couldn't recommend more! You have all the perks of a hotel, plus the privacy & luxury of your own space. The food is AMAZING and the chef Vaggelis will step to any challenge...even a simple dish like salad he transforms into something so delicious! Vassiliki is a great bartender & waitress and all her service is given with a smile, she is such a friendly lady! Thanks to Alex, our stay was a smooth process. He arranged all our transfers, spoke to us in detail about the island and no query was too much for him. Overall, the staff, view and high standard of the accommodation make Grand View a really special place to stay. My only negative was that the breakfast is very basic, a bit more choice and more of a cooked option would be great! Thank you Grand View for the most amazing holiday!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff very polite and ready to help. Excellent service. Will come back again. Great view from my suite. Incredible sunsets, did not need totravel any place else.Wished I had stayed longer.Use the amenities, the spa.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Grand view Hotel is a quiet, clean, and well maintained hotel with beautiful views.The Property is a bit old but the owners have modernized while maintaining the nostalgia of Santorini. Ensure you have an international license when you travel to Greece but even without it the staff was able to help us find local transportation. The short walk from the hotel to Megalochori was such a wonderful trek through the local island lifestyle.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice people working at this small hotel in quiet Megalochori. The people at check in, morning breakfast and the bar could not be any nicer. The rooms are normal Greek small, but very clean and comfortable. The price is great. They have shuttles to and from the airport for 20 €. The pool bar is great, with a beautiful view of the ocean and volcano. Food by the pool is fabulous. Sister and I had shrimp pasta to die for. Great other food too. Breakfast was included. Very nice, all put together by a lovely lady. If you are looking for quaint, stay here. If you are looking for more elaborate, try The Inn Of the Gods, up the road, also 3 X more. If you want more lively, try Fira.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having been home for a few weeks now, we can look back at an amazing trip to Santorini and especially our stay at Grand View Hotel.We had the pleasure of staying there for 10 days and enjoying their great hospitality and service. Even before we arrived to the hotel, the staff was very informative and helped us making reservations at various restaurants across the Island. Upon arrivel we had a transfer to the hotel, securing a smooth 10 minute drive from the airport. Arriving 11.30 pm we didn't have to check in immediately, but had our luggage brought our room and after a good night sleep and an good local breakfast, served ind the hotel restaurant, we checked in. We had the pleasure of staying in room no. 15 - a superior double room with balcony. The room was situated on the ground level of the hotel just next to pool and with and breath taking view over the caldera ocean with an amazing sunset every night. Even though the room/balcony was next to the pool, we never felt that our privacy was invated in any way. The hotel is fairly small (16 rooms) and intimate and very well kept. The pool area holds place to 16 sunbeds and a few dining tables. We had plenty of relaxing time by the pool and was only interrupted a few times by a some noisy kids having a blast in the pool :) The staff is amazing and outmost friendly, helping us with all of our enquiries, questions and requests. No request was never too big! Due to the small number of staff, you get to know the quite easily and that makes it very homely to stay there. In terms of food and drinks, the hotel has a good breakfast restaurant with everyhing you need. The buffet is kept clean and organized and was never overcrowded in its opening time from 8.30-10.30. Snacks, lunch and drinks was served by the pool side by the relatively small kitchen and bar. That being said, all things served was fresh, yummy and delicious by an truely friendly and funny poolboy/bartender/cook and a likely friendly waitress. Housekeeping was an uncomplicated affair and the room was very clean and inviting after every cleaning. I can highly reccomend this hotel. It is not inexpensive, but if you want to give yourself a treat, go to this place and have a great experience. If we're going back to Santorini, we're staying at Grand View Hotel again. Best Regards Lars and Nathalie.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect. We're a family of 4 - (2 adults, 2 kids aged 10 & 14 yrs). Our stay in Santorini would not have been anywhere near as enjoyable had we stayed elsewhere. We travelled in peak season and Santorini was complete madness! This hotel was an oasis of calm and tranquility in the storm of tourist frenzy. It's a small hotel so is never crowded. The pool area is just magnificent and so comfortable. Views from the pool area are to-die-for. Breakfasts were scrumptious and the dinner we had here by the pool, overlooking the amazing view was delicious, generous servings and very reasonably priced considering it has one of the best views on the island - certainly WAY cheaper and more enjoyable than fighting for a spot in Oia. Fagellis (I'm sorry if the name is wrong!!) - the pool bar manager & chef was hilarious, super friendly and really lovely to all guests - he also took the best family photos of us we've ever had! All the staff were brilliant. I was a bit disappointed in Santorini itself - especially Oia which really felt like a fake tourist town - like a Hollywood set of how we perceive a greek island should look. BUT it was worth going - just to stay at this amazing hotel / resort. Don't miss the sunsets from the hotel - why jostle for a space in Oia when you could stay here in the calm of your own resort sipping on a wine / cocktail / beer looking at the same spectacular sunset?! The nearby little villages (walking distance) are also really cute and a more authentic greek island experience. Highly recommend this hotel. Would love to go back again & again & again.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a small hotel with only 16 rooms but it is the most amazing place for relaxation, stunning views of the sunset and absolutely fabulous staff who do everything to make your stay special. This was our third visit to Santorini and Grand View Hotel and every time we go back it is special. The island itself is getting busier with tourists, but due to the location and size of the hotel it has not been affected. If you don’t feel like leaving the hotel then the pool bar food and drinks are amazing and reasonably priced. There are several tavernas within walking distance of the hotel if you fancy venturing out and lots of things on offer to do if you speak to the hotel manager who was very helpful. All in all an amazing place that I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here based on fantastic reviews and it is much more than a 3 star, at least a 4 star. We had a very nice warm welcome which was much better than other expensive hotels we have stayed at in Santorini. We also had a knock on our room door 10 minutes after arrival with free wine which was lovely! Reception staff were very helpful in making sure we knew where to visit, what to do etc. The bar man is really funny! Makes you feel like a friend, very knowledgable about the island and fantastic his job!!! Bar staff made us a complimentary anniversary drink which was nice, He was very helpful when I fell in the hotel (as I’m clumsy) and cut my leg, and made sure I was ok the following day, then another member of staff asked if I was ok and needed medical attention. Great view, great staff, food is delicious too! Highly recommend! Nothing to complain about! I would definitely return to this hotel! �
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The views from here is amazing. You can watch the sunset from your balcony everyday away from all the tourist of Santorini. Our room had a private Jacuzzi which was great for an afternoon wind down and watching of the sunset. The rooms were clean. Nothing fancy but had everything you needed. We hired a car to get around the island cause Oia is a bit of a distance from here. It is very close to the Port , black sand beach, red sand beach and light house. Lots of wine tasting around as well
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first stop in Greece. We just left the hotel and I had to write a review about how great this place was. Vagellis and Alexandros were so nice. They welcomed you like family and made you feel like their friends. The location is away from the madness in Oia and Fira. The pool is wonderful and Vagellis cooks amazing food, though he could use a helper. The rooms are simple, but have everything you need. If we make it back to Santorini one day, we will stay here for sure. Oh, and the woman that does the breakfast each morning is just lovely and the food is delicious.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful week here in early June. Very friendly, pristine hotel, in a great quiet location. Well away from the overcrowded main towns, but easy walking distance from two gorgeous traditional villages with excellent restaurants. Already planning to return!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful relaxing spot. All the poolside comforts with a great sunset view. A little bar with some foods and cold drinks and a friendly very loquacious bartender!!The only downside is the distance from Oia and Fira and the 25 E charge!! The bus is doable with some effort for 1.80E per person walking the roads is tricky!! Fast drivers narrow roads and hot sun!But it’s much quieter here and very relaxing We decided to rent a car today!!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the location outside the main area. Could walk to the little village and enjoy local food. Enjoyed Gavaltas Winery and Venetsantos winery-both were walkable. Absolutely stunning views from the hotel. We were in a small room with little sitting area over the back parking lot.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went with my wife for our anniversary and this hotel exceeded expectations. Amazing view, nice rooms with view as well, the pool, the location retired from the busy Fira in a great village... and the best? The staff, extremely helpful and friendly. Thank you very much Andreas and Alexandros for everything.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I were planning a trip to Santorini and I knew I wanted to propose on the trip. I was looking for a place where I could do the proposal at our hotel but it still allow us enough space and plenty of privacy. That is when I came across the Grand View Hotel. From pictures online, I could tell it offered the breathtaking views I was looking for to do a proposal. The hotel offers the best location to take in the sunset. Before my arrival, I had reached out to the Grand View hotel, informing them I was going to be proposing. They were absolutely wonderful to work with and went along with our "act" to keep my now fiance from suspecting a proposal was coming. I worked with "Santorini My Tour" to help prepare the private villa for the proposal. Grand View was extremely accommodating and worked very well to help them set up the villa while we went to the local winery for a drink to kill time. When we came back everything was set up perfectly for an amazing night. The Grand View team even allowed the company to set off fireworks.After the night of the proposal we had 3 more days of staying at the Grand View. Every morning started with quick breakfast where the cook is one of the nicest and most charismatic individuals you will meet. He also is the one who cooks the food by the pool or for your room service. This was some of the best food we had in Greece. I liked one of the dishes so much I ordered it for lunch and dinner on our final night. In addition, we were looking to do some day activities that the hotel staff (Andreas and Alex) generously set up for us. We ended up renting an ATV for 24 hours and doing a sunset trip on a catamaran, both which I would highly recommend. The ATV allowed us to ride around the island and see all of the different areas. Andreas and Alex took any of the stress of booking those excursion away by calling and setting everything up to exactly when we wanted. The hotel is located in Megalochori part of Santorini. Not having any experience in Santorini, this was a great location for us. It was much less busy and more relaxed than you would get in Oia. This allowed us to truly enjoy ourselves and our privacy. We were able to venture over to Oia on the ATV and it is a great place to check out but extremely busy with buses full of people constantly being shuttled in and out for the day. Our stay at Grand View was truly an amazing time. By the time we were leaving it felt as if Andreas, Alex and the rest of the staff were friends with how nice they were and how much they went above and beyond for us. Anyone I know that will be going to Santorini, I will be recommending them to stay at the Grand View because I enjoyed it so much. They even emailed us to make sure we made it back home safely. I just hope that one day we will be able to come back to the Grand View and see our friends again.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow. Speechless............................................................................................. The food in hotel is 5 stars and made with the heart. The staff ( chef and Andreas ) are wonderful people. The hotel and the pool is very clean and quite. The sunset...ohh the sunset is better the Oia
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful room! It was comfortable and cozy. The view of the volcano was awesome! Breakfast was very good with plenty of tastes. Great staff! Vangelis with unbielevable sense of humor and helpful! See you soon!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As this hotel is located a little bit far from the capital town in Santorini - Fira, assuming that not so many tourists have stayed there. However, this area - Megalochori - attracted a lot of interest. Firstly, there are an old traditional town and also three(3) excellent wineries within walking distance. We could enjoy good wine tastings there. Secondly, this hotel have been managed and run by a few staff-members who are very friendly to us. Lastly, we really enjoyed good luch and dinner at its sun terrace restaurant with the magnificient view of sea in Santorini.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent three nights there, because I just wanted to take some photos of this amazing island. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, everything you could ever want for breakfast thanks to Vangelis (Paoki) excellent cooking. The pool area is fantastic, the views are incredible from every location on the property. Sunset wonderful and the view of the volcano outstanding. The pool bar café, open every afternoon/evening, not only for drinks but with chef Vangelis we had an excellent dinner. We can't wait to return!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the best experience while My sister and I stayed at Greece！nice and quiet location. Just like the name says, it has a grand unbeatable view!! There are buses going to town centre since we did not rent a car. We stayed at hotel for sunset instead of going to Oia fighting with crowd. It was a wise decision thanks to Vagelish- a super friendly and fun staff at Grand View. Vagelish made truly the best Greek food for us which is a fact we found out after We tried out quite a few restaurants in Athens and Santorini. He and Andreas took very good care of clients, which makes my Greek experience unforgettable. Excellent service! Awesome views! Highly recommended!!!!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to save a momentum for your lifetime you must be here. Excellent location very close to heaven !!! Perfect hospitality as your grandmothers house !!! Value for money !! Thank you is very small for the moments in your hotel
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm Santorini dreaming on a snowy day, and finally getting around to writing a review of our stay at the Grand View last July. We stayed in the private Pool Villa for 3 nights. The view from the villa is absolutely stunning. In fact, I loved everything about the villa, the decor, the layout, the infinity pool, etc. I would have been very happy to spend the entire 3 days in that gorgeous spot, just relaxing, dipping in the pool, and enjoying the most magnificent sunset views (without any crowds!). But that would have been a shame, because Thanos is a wonderful host, and full of great suggestions on what to visit and where to eat on the island. It was like having a good friend on the island who was going to make sure wherever we went was memorable. Having spent the first part of our trip fighting the crowds in Oia, I also really enjoyed being on the quieter side of Santorini. Megalochori is a picturesque village where you can wander and even find some solitude in the winding lanes -- and dinner under the stars at one of the tavernas in the village square is a charming experience.Rarely have I felt so welcome at a hotel, and the view is one you will never forget, so I highly recommend a stay at the Grand View.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ooooo I love Santorini and I would highly recommend this beautiful Grand View. It's 10 minutes from the Port and centrally located so you can easily visit the South and the popular North, Oia. I am so glad we didn't stay in Fira which is the capital because it's too busy and loud for an island. Grand View is in a quiet area of the island so it was very relaxing. We enjoyed the food very much, very simple but delicious. We toured Fira and Oia but glad to come back to our Suite to rest and enjoy the breath taking view. Thanos and his team are very accommodating! They'll drive you places for $10 USD or take the local bus for a couple of dollars. The buses are nice and run frequently. I loved everything about Grand View!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stunning sunset views, Thanos and his team go the extra mile and give fabulous customer service, the cleaners were excellent, pool bar food is delicious never needed to go elsewhere for lunch and the rooms are lovely especially Jacuzzi suite.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 2 nights here in room 15 and could not have been happier! Thanos and his team were super friendly and accommodating. As this was on very tail end of a 4 week trip, I had not planned it very well. I emailed at 7pm about 2 hours before my arrival to ask about an airport shuttle and received a prompt email within about 10 minutes from Evangelos to confirm my pickup. He then greeted me upon arrival at the facilities and gave me a brief tour and led me to my room. I had room 15 which overlooked the volcano and was clean, tasteful, and beautiful. The food there was amazing too! I ordered the chicken skewers one night and finished everything on my plate. Thanos was also very helpful in providing tips on navigating the bus system and finding my way around Megalocholori and let me stay and use the facilities after the 12pm check out since my flight was later in the evening. It's not centrally located to Fira or Oia, but bus stops aren't very far away and the ride to Fira was about 25 min. I would definitely return here and recommend this place to anybody!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do we begin?!? Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel manager. His energy was infectious. He was so warm and welcoming. He was very informative about the island and its many excursions. We also had the pleasure of dining at the hotel (multiple times). This is because the chef is literally world class. Every dish (and we tried many) felt personalized and was so delicious. I can't say enough about this hotel. My husband would is a photographer raved over the views and the sunset (hence the title). When we visit Santorini again, there's no question where we will stay. The Grand view where the view is GRAND owes us nothing!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Grand View for 3 nights and had the best time there. All the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We got a lot of insider tips from the hotel manager, he helped us whenever we needed something. Rooms are beautiful and clean and the breakfast was very good, too. If we ever come back to Santorini, we will for sure stay at Grand View!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grand View is the perfect place to stay on Santorini! Everything from the views, to the location, to the rooms, the pool, the staff, the food... truly outstanding. Santorini is a small island and the entire island is easily accessible by car, ATV, scooter, etc. My daughter and I stayed at the Grand View for 4 nights, and during our stay we saw the ENTIRE island by ATV and on foot. After experiencing the other areas of the island, and after enjoying the EXCELLENT customer service we experienced with Thanos and his team, we will only stay at the Grand View when we return. Location: Grand View is near the small town of Megalochori, which is a beautiful, quiet, authentic town near the south end of the island. It is near 2 wineries (winery tours are a MUST DO here -- so interesting to learn how they grow grapes in the volcanic soil.) The hotel sits right on the edge of the Caldera with AMAZING sunset views. (The sunrise is amazing as well.) It is the perfect oasis away from the touristy, crowded towns, but close enough that you can easily and quickly reach any destination on the island.Our room: We stayed in room 15 -- the perfect room for 2 in our opinion. Just off the pool area with a small private patio and uninterrupted views of the sea, volcano and sunset. The hotel: Beautifully maintained rooms and grounds. Pristine. The pool area is outstanding. Because of the small size of the hotel (I would consider this a boutique hotel), even when fully booked, the pool area does not feel crowded. The views are incredible from every location on the property. Thanos and his staff: 1 word -- EXCELLENT. Even before our arrival, we were contacted via email to arrange a shuttle to pick us up at the port (WORTH IT!) I highly recommend you take Thanos up on his offer to discuss activity options on the island during your stay (and listen to what he tells you!) Based on your interests, he recommends places to go, things to do on the island, and how to get there. Truly invaluable information. Plus, he will book anything for you that you need. He had an ATV delivered to the hotel for us, then picked up when we were finished -- TWICE because we didn't need it one day in between (Thanos's suggestion, saving us money). We had booked a sailing tour on our own before our arrival to take place on arrival day (Tip: I HIGHLY recommend Caldera Yachting). The day we arrived it was VERY windy. Thanos called the yacht company and re scheduled for us. Just ask and he will take care of anything you need.The entire staff was friendly and hospitality is outstanding. The food: Wow. The breakfast (included with your stay) far exceeded our expectations. So many options to choose from and all fresh and tasty. Not your typical hotel breakfast by any means. The pool bar café is open every afternoon/evening. We ate there every night of our stay for 2 reasons -- 1: we LOVED the food -- Chef Evangelos is not only a great chef, he is also fun and funny. 2. we had front row sunset views from the pool area for dinner every night without having to fight any crowds. Tip: try the fava!!Overall, we could not have asked for a more perfect stay. We felt pampered and so well taken care of. We can't wait to return!Must do winery: Estate Argyros near Kamari. Beautiful grounds and facility. The tour is so informative -- you actually step in the vineyard to see the vines and baskets, then tour their new state-of-the art facility. Wine is excellent, and cost is reasonable. Not crowded or touristy. Perfect.Sailing: We chose Caldera Yachting for a sunset catamaran cruise. it was FABULOUS. We chose the Gold cruise (max of 16 people, but there were only 10 on our boat and there was PLENTY of room). The crew was outstanding and we had so much fun.Hiking: If you like to hike like we do, we highly recommend the hike from Fira to Oia. Beautiful. We also hiked from Pyrgos to the monastery at the highest point in Santorini. Amazing views.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Grandview has Amazing caldera views. This is a perfect location for an relaxing authentic mediterranean experience away from the tourist crowd but only ten minute drive from Fira. Thanos and his team go out of their way to make every guest feel at home. I can't recommend this hotel enough. Room: We stayed in room 7. It had a private balcony overlooking the pool and caldera. The room was beautifully and tranquilly decorated. The room had a bar fridge. Breakfast: Was generous and delicious! A selection of cereals, fruit, Greek specialities (olives/cheese/meat/ yoghurt, pastries and cakes), breads and eggs. The home made jams were delicious! There is plenty of parking.The Grandview is central located within a few minutes of Fira and many attractions. Thanos generously gave of his time by providing us an orientation of the island, maps and restaurant recommendations. Everyone of his recommendations was outstanding and definitely added to our experience. Some general recommendations:Rent a car. I used Romani Rent A CarVisit the Megalochori cave house. Our favourite winery was Santos. Visit in the morning before the tour busses arrive. Make reservations at least three days in advance for restaurants. Favourite restaurants: everything on Thanos's list in particular a little place called Brusca for their Greek platter and Metaxi mas for their amazing views.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located on the southern side of the island, with an amazing caldera view. We liked the local because it was quiet. Thanos and Evangelos, and the rest of the staff went above and beyond to make our stay very special. Their friendly drivers took us to the beach across the island and to nearby Fira. Otherwise a taxi was easy to come by. Santos winery and serval others were close by. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a stay at this hotel and had to write a review as it was so enjoyable. We were met at the port by a lovely man who dropped us off at the door of Grand view. Thannos the manager greeted us like old friends, he is such a lovely person as can be said for all the staff. We were delighted to be upgraded to the most beautifully decorated room with an amazing sea view. They have a small pool side bar which does the most lovely food and cocktails, served again from the most friendly staff. The sun set from the hotel is stunning and certainly is a Grand view. The breakfast is delicious and has a wide variety of dishes again served with a smile. We can not recommend this small hotel highly enough. This was our 4th visit and certainly will not be out last.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After amazing recommendations from our friends who stayed here a year prior, we booked this hotel a year in advance (very keen!).When we arrived in June this year, we were told we were the very first booking for the year having booked so early in advance. We were able to stay in the recommended room 12 suite, which has its own spa on the balcony and the perfect view out to the ocean / sunset! The room was VERY spacious, clean and had everything we needed. The hotel food was great, my husband won't stop going on about the 'burgers' we had there. The location of the hotel is great, as it's not in the busy area and has such a cute little town near by for dinner. Which, I'm very happy to say we dined at a restaurant one night and I had the best dinner of our whole honeymoon there!! Which is quite a statement as we had just come from Paris and Naples! I can find out the name again if you are interested just ask :)I think what made our stay was the lovely owner and staff of the hotel. Thanos was a legend, who not only made us feel welcome straight away but sat down and planned out time in Santorini perfectly as we only had a few days. Definitely listen to his advice!! Also, he was able to talk basketball with my husband Josh which I think after 4 weeks with me he was dying to talk to someone else! Honestly, we couldn't thank him enough for a perfect end to our honeymoon!And we will be back very soon :)
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't know where to begin.Do I start by praising Thanos and his fantastic team for making our stay so wonderful? Doing everything they could too make sure we were relaxed and happy all 7 days day or night? And being a wealth or information and help with things to do in Santorini?(Please take his experience and take him up on some of his suggestions, you won't regret it).Do I praise Vagellis (apologies if not spelt correctly) and Andrea for their incredible food, service, hospitality and laughs at the Poolside bar/diner.Do I praise the lovely breakfasts The wonderfully spacious and extremely clean rooms?The fact the hotel is so peaceful and tranquil?The fact you'll awake to some of the best views on the Island of the Caldera?Or maybe mention the incredible, breathtaking sunsets and cocktails .I simply don't know.What I do know is that we can't wait to return and see a team that went out of their way to show the best of Greek hospitality.I can't thank you enough guys.Adie & Kath
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was the best decision to book a room in this lovely hotel, than in the crowded and very touristic Fira. At Grand View everything looks exactly as on the pictures. They have the best sunset view with relaxing music. Couldn't be more perfect! I've spent here a wonderful week with my husband. As we also work in hospitality, we know the best what it really means a good customer service and to work months long without any days off. We really appreciate all their help and effort. Many thanks to Thanos, the manager, who is helping to plan your vacation by your taste. Many thanks to Evangelos ,who organized a very late dinner booking on the day we arrived 23:30 . And many thanks to all the Grand View team, that they made our stay so wonderful. They are all amazing and you leave with a strong willing to go back very soon. I definitely recommend this place if you want to have a special holiday!
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 2nights to celebrate my hubby's birthday and our anniversary. Room type was standard balcony -room no.7. We requested for higher floor and Thanos the hotel manager kindly arranged for us. We really appreciate it and the room is just above the pool and had an awesome view of the sunset. This hotel though located away for Oia and Fira, we actually prefer this area as it's less crowded. In fact we spent both evenings back in our hotel balcony to watch the sunset, away from the crowd. Oia was really busy! We were at Oia on the second day and people started to stream in to secure a good spot for the sunset as early as 5pm( sunset was about 745pm!!!)Room is very modern in fact I think it's newly renovated. Clean sheets which is very important for me. And absolutely comfy bed and duvet. The shampoo and body foam provided is very nice smelling too. Food served at the bar was very delicious (I did not expect it to be so yummy) that we kept ordering. The chicken salad and pesto pasta and the must order octopus was really good !Service wise I have to thank Thanos for giving us a wonderful experience in Santorini. We travelled to Athens and Santorini this trip and Thanos is the only nice person we met. He gave us early check in as the room is already available. And on the last day as we wanted to visit Fira, we requested for late check out and Thanos gave us an extra 2hr which we were grateful for. We asked Thanos to arrange transport for us to Thira port for €20. Everything about the stay was good. I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
9    Grand View Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the best stay in Santorini and even Greece. Clean pool, clean room. Sisi and Angelo are the best hosts. Close to the beach, markets and bus stop. Its kind for familys whit Kids. Good food and drinks.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed at Roula Villa for 14 nights. We chose the hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a family run business, by Sissy and her Brother Aggelos. They and the staff are so friendly that they make you feel like you are part of their family. The hotel is designed like a village with each room facing or next to another situated around the pool area. It encourages a village-like friendly atmosphere amongst the guests, who are from all corners of the globe. Americans, Canadians, Aregentinians, Italians, Spanish, Aussies, English, Germans etc etc. The rooms are clean and have everything required for a self catering holiday. We had a really nice time here and made a lot of friends. I must give a special thankyou to Anggelos who ran the bar and is very friendly and helpful! We had a wonderful stay and will definitely be back.Thankou again Sissy and Anggelos for such a lovely time!Neil, Julie and Rachel.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best ! Must see this wonderful place! I stayed there for four evenings was amazed how welcoming the staff is! A true relaxing holiday! Very clean, maintained and well designed rooms with convinient inside kitchen space. Hotel Staff is super friendly and always helpful of any questions regarding the activities in the island and area around. The swimming pool and bar pool areas are fantastic, cocktails are great!!!! Sissy and Angelo ,together with their family has made my stay unforgetable! Definite Yes ! I am looking foward to my next visit at Roula Villa Efharisto !
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From we arrived until we left the whole experience was 100%. Sissy and family could not do enough. Roula Villa staff / house keepers work very hard to make you feel at home and nothing is too much trouble. I highly recommend a visit to Perissa and to stay at Roula Villa. location is perfect with only short walk to the beach with many places to eat and relax on the loungers. Tours and excursions can be organised through Roula Villa which we did. loved it and will be back to this beautiful island again x
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Roula Visita for 4 nights at the beginning of August and we booked ourselves a room with a spa pool on the balcony.We had a lovely stay the owners are so welcoming and very willing to share information on their beautiful island so you can get the most out of your stay.It was very hot so the air conditioning was a welcome relief at night time in the bedroom.Loved this little gem, wished we stayed longer but we’re always busy and went to Santorini specifically for our friends .Will definitely go back to Santorini but maybe when they’ve made improvements to the airport which is a bit small for the amount of people visiting.A great trip and must recommend
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If ever in Santorini, Roula Villa is highly recommended for accommodation. The owners and staff are absolutely amazing, helpful, welcoming and friendly and you really leave having made great friends. The location is close to the beach and restaurants. If you want to experience traditional Greek music, dancing and food, speak to the owner about his band that plays every Saturday night. The rooms are perfect, clean and all you need.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Roula Villa is quite cute in a low budget way. The outdoor area and pool is small but if you are sociable or with a group of friends and family it can be a real nice way to spend some time together. It would be like having your own private villa if you did.Really close to town and has a bar in the evening. The food is expensive for what you get eg size/standard but we quickly realised that that is throughout the island! The staff are lovely and the cleaners deep clean/change your bed everyday.The staff are really friendly and help with whatever you ask. The guy also plays some traditional songs from behind the bar which is actually quite nice in the evenings.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked to stay at Roula Villa on Expedia by clicking the link on TripAdvisor. On Tripadvisor, it even said that I was going to be staying at Roula Villa! However, once I arrived to my hotel, it was not Roula Villa, but Villa Voula Perissa. I spoke with the owner of Villa Voula and I indeed had a reservation with them and not Roula Villa. IF YOU STAY HERE, BOOK THROUGH THEM. NOT EXPEDIA. Also, I called Expedia about this and it was a nightmare.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be honest when we first pulled up and saw how many people were crowded around the pool and Bar (obviously a huge group for a wedding!) we thought this was going to be a disaster for us, wanting a quiet night or two of rest with elderly parents. However, It was totally fine, the rooms had pretty good sound proofing, and the view we had was pretty good too! the rooms are cute and cosy, a frosted glass wall (and a blind) for the bathroom/toilet was an interesting idea! We didnt get to try the pool, it was always full, but the walk to the waterfront and the restaurants is very close and there is a short cut (be sure to ask!) we really enjoyed our stay here, and it is a great hotel for those with large groups.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Initially the reception was acceptable (we visited the first week in September)then after a few days much more friendly and always ready to help with a smile. The owner is a hoot and puts the "cherry on top". The rest of the staff were discrete, always busy yet smiling. A minor problem with a drain in the bathroom was quickly resolved.The location is just far enough from the busy beachfront to not be disturbed by the hustle and bustle of a seaside Town. Close enough to everything for everyday needs.The pool was wonderful to be enjoyed at all times during the day and until late evening.All in all a positive stay, if not for one or two tiny niggles, our bathroom needed a shelf or two for ones creams lotions and potions; the hand basin area being very limited. A window to air the bathroom would also be idealTo make things almost perfect Villa Roula could offer guests beach towels even for hire at a small daily or weekly rate. Changing the bath towels everyday was not necessary every second day would suffice.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here with all my family for my cousins wedding. Quite a big group of us and the staff were more than helpful with all our needs! The pool is lovely aswell are the rooms. 5 minute walk to the beach and just a short walk to the base of a mountain for a hike if you fancy it. Thank-you for making sure everyone in our family were having a good time!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At first it was a bit difficult to find. Google maps has it all wrong. The hotel is very well located, near the popular perissa beach, one of the most beautiful beaches in santorini, with a lot of restaurant, stores, markets around. The room was a bit dark, but the rest of the hotel is really nice, specially the pool.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: amazing stay at the hotel, nice rooms , clean bathrooms, rooms are like fairy tale types very cute, big swimming pool, and jetted bath pool with the superior room, view is good, hotel bar cocktails are not too expensive
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Roula Villa is perfect for a stay in Santorini. 5 minute walk to the beach and cafés/restaurants. Taxis easily available to visit all of the island. Local black beach is very clean and safe. The staff especially Katerina and Xrisa were very helpful for helping us plan our visits and Alketa and Penka kept the rooms beautifully clean.Thank you to you all.The poolside bar was a bonus and although no food is available there is a great bakery for breakfast 2 minutes from hotel which does every sweet thing in the world you could wish to try plus savouries. Wifi very efficient even in the bedrooms and very welcome air-conditioning..Santorini hotels are generally quite expensive but this is exceptional value for money and although it is in the slightly less chic part of Santorini it is perfect for the beach, has a wide choice of eating places and is less frantic than Fira.Just be aware that you need to provide your own pool towels.Would definitely recommend Roula Villa to Santorini visitors and would stay there again.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a stones throw from the beach , this peacefully quaint place had a nice pool rooms very clean, and the bus is down the Rd to explore the island, nice drinks at the pool and the staff were very friendly .
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. Beach and vibey parts within walking distance but nice and quiet. Amazing bakery close by. Staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and bathrooms are gorgeous. Beautiful pool but freezing! Only negatives: no option of food really and would have loved a heated pool. Otherwise definitely worth recommending!!!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We sleep here 3 nights in family room. Room is nice, big and spacious, but little bit dark. Our teracce was on the way to other rooms, so we can't drink coffe peaceful. Every time when somebody walk here we must get up from chairs. Stuff is nice and helpful.Housekeeping is daily.The pool is too small for so many rooms and so many people. In the afternoon we always come for half an hour, but I can't swimm. To crowded. But you can be inside. In the part of pool is Jacuzzi. We have car, so location was ok. Walking distance on the sun to the beach is min 10 minutes.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Roula Villa for 7 nights in June 2017 and enjoyed every minute of it. Nothing was a problem for them. We had a hydromassage pool in our room which overlooked the pool, well worth the extra money. Our room was cleaned every day and we were given fresh towels. The water from the taps is very salty but it wasn't a problem for us. The kitchen was equipped with everything required for making small meals. It is very close to the hike to Ancient Thiera and a 5 minute walk from the beach where there are numerous restaurants and pubs. Most places offered free sun loungers along the beach so long as you bought something in their restaurant and you can stay for the day. We would highly recommend Roula Villa for couples, families or friends. The rest of the island is also very accessible from Perissa. We visited Oia which is the place with the lovely sunset, it is a bit more expensive but worth a visit. We also did the day tour which takes you by bus to the islands, hot springs, volcano and on to Oia for the sunset, we got the tour nearby the hotel for €25 each!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome place! Very clean and comfortable rooms. Nice pool and atmosphere. Best frappe in Greece served at the pool bar. We had an extremely relaxing and pleasant time. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff! Walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants and bars. I would highly reccomend!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a beautiful little villa from the outside & courtyard. I don't think it would take much for it to be a boutique hotel but it's not there yet. Our room was on the back side so quiet but kind of dark & dingy. The toilet slowly leaked all over the bathroom floor. It was clean tank water but still gross. The towels were stiff until the last day. I guess they got some new ones. I joked they could go up a star for that. No little soaps, shampoo or anything. Maybe I'm shallow but you need that level of service to get higher reviews. Better linens, & toiletries & this hotel could bring it up a notch. The little kitchenette was good for us to make breakfast & lunch. The walk to the beach is not far but not super close either. The pool was very nice & clear but after the first day we spent most of our time @ the beach. By the way, there are nicer beaches in Greece but you really must see the sunsets in Santorini. Find the 24h bakery. It has good sandwiches and pita. Pack it to go if you visit the red beach. Staff was nice & they booked us a good Shuttle back to the airport. They could probably arrange that to pick you up if you called. The bus system on the island is quite good but it did require one transfer. Would I return? I think I would try another place first but there were no major issues here.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 4th holiday spent at Roula Villa in Perissa. Why I keep coming back? The hotel itself is so beautiful, greek style in blue and white. A wonderful clean pool surrounded by the buildings, and in one end a nice poolbar serving all you need and want, all day. Cleaningstaff excellent and smiling. Roula Villa is owned by a sweet family and their son Angelo is the best. No problem too big to fix, everything done for the guests. Katarina so smiling and serviceminded, not to forget the new girl this season, so sweet:)Located near the black beach, bus stop, senter of Perissa and all shops and tavernas you need to have the most splendid holiday. We have made several friends from all over Europe at Roula Villa. Like me and my dauther the keep coming back to Roula Villa, Perissa, Santorini.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel exactly matches it's description on booking.com. the hotel is so cosy and has a very nice layout. The rooms are convenient and spacious with a small stove top to prepare practical meals and a kettle. The bathroom however is not exactly what I've wished for in terms of cleanliness. I mean it sure is old with some grime I had to clean it thoroughly before I felt comfortable using it especially that I had my 5 year old with me. It is not that dirty it's just old, but you could manage with. The rooms are right on the pool and it is very kid friendly so is the staff. Perissa black sand beach is just a short walk away. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent 10 nights at this apartment hotel in June 2016. It is in a quiet area of the village away from the main road with free parking but only a few minutes walk to a 24 hour bakery, the shops, restaurants and the beach. The rooms although basic are what we were expecting and kept very clean, with towels being changed daily (although a little hard - good for exfoliating). The air conditioning works well, the water was always hot for the shower both morning and evening. The kitchenette was basic and consisted of a kettle, a two ring hob which worked well, a sink with cupboards underneath and above and a fridge with a small freezer section. The crockery consisted of two plates, four bowls, two cups and four glasses. The cutlery was two of each knives, forks, dessert spoons and tea spoons. There was not a sharp knife, a bread knife or a bottle opener which would have been useful. There was also one small non stick saucepan, a large casserole dish, a colander and a grater.The pool has a small Jacuzzi in the corner and the pool itself and the area around it was kept very clean with a bar serving drinks all day. Angelo and Katerina were very friendly and helpful and gave us some goods tips for places to go whilst touring the island. All in all we had a very enjoyable time at this hotel and hopefully will visit again.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small, well run hotel with friendly english speaking staff. Swell pool and bar. Walk to beach with many restaurants and lovely beach. Very quiet. We stayed a week, met some wonderful people and felt like family by the time we left. A big plus was Angelo who is a professional Lyre player and played it beautifully at the bar. Great value, great stay!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this from Booking.com and all I can say is it is s real little gem. The place is exactly as you see it on the website, all white washed and dark blue trims. It is a 10 min walk to the beach but that is a pleasant walk and as mentioned by others a fab little bakery 5 mins walk awayThe Roula has a great pool and lovely pool bar as well.The lady that runs the place is extremely helpful. Would def recommend this place to friends
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've been going to Santorini for 12 years now and the last 7 years we stayed at Roula Villa. The family and staff are kind, polite and very friendly. We had always felt at home here in Perissa. The beach is close by and shopping and restaurants are also accessible within a few minutes walk. We will keep returning to this quaint village style hotel. We only have complements to the staff and this wonderful family.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say this place is well located. Nice, clean well established. Lovely people running the place. 5 min walk to the beach, load of bars and taverns nearby, lovely view of the mountains. If ever back in Perissa would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a urgent problem with my booking in the HOTELS.COM website. Something no one would expect to happen. Roulla Villa hotel service was impeccable. They answerd us right way, helped in everything they could and we solved it for the best. I have only compliments for them and I will stay in Roula Villa everytime I am in Santorini.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was taking pictures of the building because it was so beautiful even before I realized that it was our hotel. I couldn't believe it! Its so classy with blue and white and the pool comes with jets and is just a perfect relaxing time, especially away from the too-busy thira and Oia. Buses come all the time and the staff is nice. For couples it is extremely romantic and we definitely loved our stay.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments are cozy and well furnished. The swimming pool area is amazing, with comfortable sun beds and a pool bar. Staff is very friendly. It is a bit far away from the really amazing spots though, you will need a car.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Roula Villa Apartments were everything we were expecting after reading recent reviews.Our room was "typically Greek" self catering with just about adequate cutlery and crockery etc.You wouldn't want to try and cook a meal, but then we never even contemplate eating anything other than breakfast in our apartment.A toaster would have been nice but hardly a deal breaker! The small pool was lovely, although you might need to get up early to get a lounger.The poolside bar is open all day;normally until midnight and the prices are surpringly reasonable. Although there seemed to be quite a high turnover of guests (there seemed to be a lot of island hoppers) there was never any late night noise-it really was very peaceful. Our room was cleaned daily and all the staff were really friendly. Tip:Before we left the UK we contacted the owners to arrange for a taxi to pick us up from the airport.This worked out cheaper and more convenient than just hailing a cab when we arrived.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found it fine. The hospitality wasn't quite as good as we were led to believe on these reviews but the owner was perfectly nice.The pool was lovely, although we only used it once. Rooms are very basic and bathrooms are small but they are cleaned daily. Location is great, good bakery just down the road with lovely treats and a mini market a few steps away. However, many of these reviews are about VILLA VOULA which is just down the road and not ROULA VILLA so do not get them confused!!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Roula villa to relax a couple of days, what an experience! I have never been to a hotel where I have felt part of a family. The island vibes are one thing, But add a lovely loving family to this island vibe and it takes your trip to a whole new level. This is a hotel that will always try and help you. Get you into the whole greek village feel. Well done! This was much better experience than any 5 star out there! :D
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are here now...when we are here we Feel like in our home... Lovely rooms fantastic pool.. The owner are sweet and really kindle guys. Absolutely recommend!!! (especially family and couple) right base for touring the island
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in early September, we drove from the port and it did take us a few spins around Perissa to find it but when we did it was well worth it - we booked a room with a balcony jacuzzi - WOW!! Our apt was lovely - decorated in blue and white - with double doors from our bedroom out onto our roof top terrace with our jacuzzi - bought some beers from the bar and relaxed for the whole 1st afternoon here!!the owners were absolutely lovely and we thouroughly enjoyed our stay and would love to come back - the complex is compact but beautiful!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted not with even a smile or a welcome. Taken straight to our room and a query about the closest food shop forced a response of 'down the road'. The bathroom revealed a stained shower curtain and a rubber hose and plastic shower head attached to a mixer tap with no way of attaching it to the wall. The stench from the drains didn't help! Day by day a little bit more of the villa fell apart, a slat from one of the beds, a handle and shelf from the bathroom cupboard. The very loud air conditioning unit was effective upstairs in one bedroom but did nothing for the room below and the fridge hummed continuously.We paid for a jacouzzi. Don't bother, complete waste of money . Water heated by daytime sunshine, so not a hot tub as such, I did not see anyone clean it for us during the ten days we were there and would question whether the filters were working, the frames were already broken and fragments left on one of the ledges. Every 30 seconds or so it would switch off and have to be restarted. Any idea of enjoying a relaxing experience with a glass of wine - absolutely not. We didn't feel confident to use it after the first couple of days for reasons of cleanliness.Positives- nicely positioned room, hot water and quiet.We had a fabulous holiday, despite our stay at this villa, the beach was fantastic but please if you are booking a beach holiday here remember there is 7+ kms of sand and a lot of villas to choose from.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all - Lady Voula is super nice and friendly lady. The family was always around and having nice words or something complementary for our little one. Villa is very clean, the cleaning lady is doing her best and you can feel it! Location is good, 5 min.walking from the beach. There is lot of nice villas and hotels closer to the beach or right on the beach, but this makes from villa Voula quiet place to stay. Rooms are super spacious and nice. If you are searching for studio to cook, be aware, there is not much kitchen equipment. Glasses and cups seems to be every single one from a different opera, so better not count with that kitchen that much. Pool is nice, clean, but you rather not stay there in a hot daily time as it`s incredibly hot. Of course, you are in sunny Greece! You can use umbrellas, but something "green", some nature, would make the pool more stayable place during the steaming hot day.If you need wireless, don`t count on it. In the lobby area it`s working good, but not in rooms. You`ll have to find wifi in the bar nearby. I`ll recommend for families, couples searching for quiet place and for everyone who is searching a reasonable price. Voula made our holidays pleasure!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancé and I stayed here for a few days in may, and we enjoyed our time here. Voula and her son were extremely nice and helpful. We were in santorini for a pre wedding photo shoot and it was really touching seeing voulas reaction to me in my wedding dress and her kind words. Would highly recommend for a great value.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OK this is a very small hotel and some of the 12 rooms are very small. We had room 5 which is very small as we booked late and no availability however we did get upgraded to a bigger room at no extra cost for last 2 days....was very much better. Greek plumbing is never great so don't expect a power shower far from it...These were our only negatives. We were given free transfers both to and from the port...The property is kept exceptionally clean and Mrs Voula is a lovely host and very welcoming. Santorini is a chill holiday and this place is a perfect base.I wouldn't change a thing Villa Voula is what it is and we loved it....sorry just one other thing worth mentioning the pool is quite small and the shallow end is very limited and still about a metre deep....would be a bit of a problem with small kids....more a romantic couples place. Easy walk to beach...great bakery on doorstep and be sure to try Bob's Bar cheapest cocktails around and good staff. Need to get around the island a quad is great but get one with a decent size engine....We went 80 cc and struggled. All in all we will be back.....Thank You Mrs Voula we had a great stay.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow. I am not sure who is writing these reviews, but they might want to see what else Santorini has to offer. My friends and I stayed in this hotel after being evicted from vacation rental in Oia after it was repossessed by bank (seriously). We were in a pinch and booked online after seeing the photos (mostly of pool area) and reading the glowing reviews. We payed 500€ per night, which was non-refundable upon booking, and were sorely disappointed upon arrival. The room, which advertised as a four person villa, was two tiny rooms stacked on top of each other connected by a rickety staircase. The even tinier bathroom had a clogged sink and stunk to high heavens. To top it off, the air conditioner was busted, and the wifi wasn't working unless you were sitting at the pool bar...practically on the bartenders lap. The price on the door listed 120€ for peak season...so make sure you dont pay a penny more. Needless to say, we didnt stay a second night and found other, beautiful accomodations at a resort in Kamari for a fifth of the price. Shop around, folks!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hospitable environment! Mrs Voula is awesome! We had a great stay! It's only ten steps from the sea and you have easy access to many places! If you visit Perissa this is the best place to stay! It's also quite cheap in comparison to the rest accommodation nearby! We will definitely come back!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a pleasant and comfortable stay here in July 2013- great value for money esp if your on a budget . The rooms are clean and well kept. The hotel is close to the beach front and local tavernas. More so there is a delightful bakery about 2 minutes away from the hotel and their miniature ice creams will be your weakness ! I spotted my first shooting star here, it truly is a magical island!!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Villa Voula mid sept and from the pick up to drop off at the port we had a great time the villa is in a quiet road just off the main road with amazing views restaurants and ,the accommodation was spotless and we had room 5 which was i think the best room as two balconies and a spacious room kitchenette with plenty of utensils if you need them , room cleaned daily and fresh towels every day so could not fault in any way , voula was always on hand so any questions she was always there which was i feel is superb and shows she really does care about her guests. the pool area was again spotless and to have a good size pool was amazing as looking at other villas near by this one was far the best. we visited a few bars and restaurants, lazy lizard nice place for a beer and a chat , la taverna restaurant superb value as was hellas restaurant , also the italian was good value, perissa is a quiet relaxed place great beaches and a great stay. if ever go back will stay at the Villa Voula .Also the bakery just round the corner ideal for breakfast bread/ croissant also for a food shopping go the the carrefour a bit of a walk out of town or the co-op shop( fira direction ) a lot cheaper than the shop round the corner from the villa and also the cold store near to hellas restaurant does excellent wine from the barrel 3 euros for 1.5 litres !!!!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Villa Voula for 13 nights mid September and have had one of the best holidays ever. Just two of us but we booked an apartment that had 2 rooms and could sleep 4 as the prices were so good. The reviews were good so we were expecting it to be nice, but it's surpassed that. Great location, and great accommodation, with a warm, friendly and lovely owner. Immaculately clean, simple but more than adequate. Pool lovely, spent many a lazy day beside the pool on a lounger. Never a problem getting our fav ones. Saw many guests coming and going but never felt busy, in fact at time was like out own private villa and pool. Voula comes out with little treats and drinks but never overbearing. Breakfast and snacks if you want or use of your own fridge and cooking facilities. Santorini is an amazing place, everything easy to get to. Car hire, walking, or just chilling it has it all. Will be back and will stay with Voula in Perissa. Thank you so much for so e lovely holiday memories.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Villa Voula in mid May 2013. I location was close to the beach. Jackie was very helpful. It was great having a kitchenette and being able to make our own meals. Close to the bakeries as well as a convenience store. Thank you for a wonderful stay Jackie!!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved Roula Villa, and will in fact go back again and again!The guys that run it are all very nice and very professional. But I loved the fact they were also down to Earth. They would bend over back to help you, and then chat to you for hours about food and music. One of the staff also plays in a Greek band, so you regularly got awesome music played live to you for free!The location is perfect. It is a 5 minute walk from the beach (once you find the shortcut which is obvious once you see it!) and close to all the best eats in Perissa. When we arrived at the airport they had arranged a taxi to pick us up - and I got my name on a card in arrival. I felt important, and that really started the holiday off well! We were early in check in, but again they bent over backwards to accommodate and get the room ready.The pool was good, the beer was cold and cheap. I don't think you could ask any more of them!
