Rooms are cleaned daily.The place is big enough to be busy, small enough to be homely. Well done to you all for this awesome hotel!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I didn't we would enjoy our stay so much! When we left, we were very sorry to go.Our room wasn't very big, but evry thing was fine with it. The swimming pool, very clean and usually peaceful. The staff, efficient, responsible, kind. In particular, Sotiris was GREAT!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Villa Voula. It is such great value. The pool is stunning and well maintained, staff are so friendly and happy to help with anything. There were power shortages all over Santorini, so to have the pool and beach so accessible was a real bonus. Thanks Voula and staff for your hospitality.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we found this villa at the end of our santorini trip and are sad we only stayed for 2 nights. roula villa is well located 5min walk to the beach. rooms are well appointed, spottless and comfortable. the pool is lovely and has sun beds to lazy the day away. but the best thing about roula villa is the lovely staff who are welcoming and super helpfull! i would be happy to reccomend this place and stay again next time im in santorini.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lush people and friendly place with a small, clean pool and very typically Greek. Lots of bars and restaurant within walking distance. We had two rooms right next to the reception with a big patio area in front which we used as our lounge and dining area! Plenty of sun beds and umbrellas available and lots of nice little areas to sit in. Our rooms had everything we needed and if not, Roula Villa were more than happy to help us get whatever we needed - even a hair dresser who came to the room! We stayed for 2 weeks as my sister got married in Santorini. I would recommend this accommodation if you like somewhere 'local' and quiet. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a great week in Perissa. Villa Voula was our base and is an ideal location for Perissa main street and the beach.Very clean apartments, little extra's thought about providing pegs, washing lines and bottle openers. We were made very welcome and enjoyed our stay, would recommend for anyone who wants a good clean base in Perissa.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a 4 person room for 2 adults & 2 children. We received rm 8 that had two floors. On the second floor we had a private balcony overlooking the ocean, it also came with a private jacuzzi, bonus!! This made all the difference. The room was large and clean. The staff was helpful. The hotel was 200 meters from the beach which was really long and wide. Water was clear and clean. There was many markets and Restos all over Perissa. Good prices and large portions.The hotel had a nice size pool that we used daily. It was cleaned daily and was large enough to cool off after a hot day at the beach. Compared to other places on the island, Perissa is less expensive and quiet,suited for families.
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed at villa voula 17yh to 27th june great weather windy the first few day but warm wind so no prob , voula was lovely made us very welcome really lovely lady ,apartment great balcony overlooking pool . very clean and maid did a great job , we where just a few minuits from everything so great location , fab bakery a stones throw away , beach great check out the beach bar we where looked after very well there , hired a car for 3 day loved oia stunning also fira and more or less saw the whole island ,would go back again we had a fantastic holiday
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for 1 week 17-24th June. We booked after reading the good reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. Our transport from the airport was arranged via the hotel. Nikos was our driver who was fabulous, spoke perfect English and was lovely and chatty and very knowledgeable about Santorini. When we arrived at Villa Voula we were greeted by Voula, she is a lovely Greek lady who owns the hotel, very friendly and warm, she lives there during the summer months so is always on hand if you need her. Her English is not great, but it’s enough for you to get by. Voula showed us to our room. We were on the ground floor so had a lovely terrace with table/chairs and a washing line. The room was great, basic, but all that we needed, hairdryer, fridge, shower, towels were provided, TV (didn’t use it), and most importantly air conditioning! Voula will make you breakfast for 5 euro if you let her know the day before, we didn’t use this so I can’t comment. The rooms were cleaned every day, we didn’t have any reason to complain, we were well looked after. Fresh towels daily and the bedding was changed twice while we were staying (1 week).The small pool is lovely, nice peaceful alternative to a day at the beach. We used this one day, the beds around it are comfy, there is also a small pool bar serving cold drinks and snacks. The views of the walk up to ancient Thira are great, and you can clearly see the cute little church ½ way up the rock that is lit up at night. The location of Villa Voula couldn’t be better!!! You are around 2mins walk (if that) from the beach front, which is full of lovely restaurants. There is a mini market around the corner and a 24hr bakery around the other corner!! PERFECT LOCATION! One day we hired a car from a place around the corner called Dimitris, recommend using this as great service and value compared to some of the others around (there are LOTS to choose from). Worth hiring a car, visit Firs and Oia for the day! They are both lovely places, but we preferred the charm and chilled out atmosphere of Perissa!!June is also the PERFECT time to visit Santorini, the weather is boiling, however it is not as busy as July/Aug (every local we chatted to told us how ‘mad’ it is then), and the prices are a lot cheaper during June! We had an absolutely amazing holiday staying at Villa Voula, would recommend a visit and would return ourselves if every back in Santorini!
hotelName:
10    Roula Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in late, the lady looked tired bit was friendly. The room was excellent and with a fantastic view of Kamari, perfect at Sunrise! The breakfast was fantastic, apologies for all the superlatives, but its deserved. The cleaning team were very friendly as was the barman and breakfast guy. All the staff were friendly and were happy to offer recommendations for food etc. The pools were clean and sparkling, the hotel was continually cleaned throughout the day. There is a little steep hill but its no bother, it has a playroom and a spacious reception with lots to do. WIFI in rooms and reception is good, not that you would want it often in one of the most beautiful and picturesque places I have ever seen. Enjoy the island and don't get caught up in pettiness. My tip, go down the side streets and back streets for food as well as the front!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a relaxing holiday at the Epavlis Hotel, great location for exploring, beautiful views, clean & spacious room, our holiday enhanced by a very polite, charming & funny bar tender Demitra, we look forward to returning to this hotel very soon Zuzana & Peter
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the Epavlis hotel at 2300 on a Saturday evening to be greeted by a very unfriendly lady. There was no greeting or any conversation what so ever. We got our room key and got told breakfast time and where the lift was. We were thirsty so asked if we could buy water, we got a abruptly told the pool bar was open until 11. We quickly put our bags in the room and rushed to the pool bar as we had been told it shut at 2300 and it was now 2305. As we expected the bar was shut. My husband and I went back to the lady at reception, we felt that we were a huge inconvenience. Throughout our holiday the lady and younger guy with long hair were just so rude and just made us feel so uncomfortable. To the point their unfriendly attitude was actually scary. It got to the stage that we would make jokes about whether they would actually say hello or thank you to them as we had to hand in our key to reception. It says that there is a 24 hour reception. As the hotel does not provide an evening restaurant we went out for food and drinks every night. Some nights we were late in returning to the hotel. Some nights we returned to the hotel to wait a while to get our key and on one of the last nights were told to take our key with us in future (when it clearly states in the hotel to not take any hotel property out-with the hotel). We were in Santorini for a wedding so we really needed an iron. Again it’s advertise on the Epavlis website under room services and hotel services that they can provide an iron. We asked the long haired guy at reception for the iron and he told us they didn’t have one. I challenge the fact that it was advertised that the hotel could provide an iron, he reluctantly said he would check. We did, in the end, come back that day to find an iron on the room!!! The advertised WiFi does not work in the rooms. The taps in the room are so tight and difficult to use and at times we had to run the taps for about 20 minutes to get hot water to come through. The hotel location is great. As it’s on the hill it gives a great view. The pool area is very nice and peaceful. Dimitri in the pool bar was the nicest person we met. There is a simple pool menu and he works hard to serve customers and provide what we asked for. He also made conversation and didn’t make us feel that we were an inconvenience.We had breakfast once. There is a nice range to choose from.The hotel is very clean and could have been such a great place to stay for the week if the staff were friendly and inviting.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prior to our arrival in Santorini, I had booked a private transfer with the hotel from the ferry port to the hotel. On arrival there was no sign of a driver from the hotel or a sign with my name. After 20 minutes I rang the hotel. I was told to “look for a black van with a young man driving it”. (To give context tens of vehicles pass through the port, it’s very busy and a large majority are black vans). This made it impossible to find the driver. After another 40 minutes I rang the hotel again. This time the staff member said “I don’t know what else to tell you”. I asked the staff member to please ring the driver and get him to meet us outside one of the ferry offices. After another 10-15 minutes the driver found us...we received no apology for the mistake and were informed we would receive €5 off our transfer. On arrival to the hotel, the staff member that I dealt with over the phone was at reception. He didn’t apologise for the hour long wait in mid day heat either. We received absolutely no information on the hotel facilities, breakfast times etc. When we checked into our room we realised that there was no phone service or WiFi in the room which meant we had to sit out at the pool day or night if we wished to use our phones at all. There was no batteries in our safe or in the air conditioning remote so we had to request these the next day.The pool facilities are nice and the breakfast was plentiful and had a wide choice which was good. There is a bar at the hotel which serves a small selection of food which we didn’t try. In terms of location it’s situated very near Kamari beach which was very nice, especially at night for going out to eat at the beach restaurants. The customer service leaves a lot to be desired. We found the staff generally uninterested, unhelpful and unfriendly. When we were checking out, the hotel tried to charge us €200 more than the agreed price and I had to show my confirmation email to prove the agreed price- which again we received no apology for. Overall, the facilities are good except for the lack of WiFi and phone reception in the room, great location in Kamari. However, given the bad service we won’t be staying again.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely smashing place. Mrs C and I felt really well looked after. I’ve no idea where some of the people are coming from with the negative reviews. Exaggerating at best. Seriously. How unkind! The staff are really helpful, polite and there if needed. They give you space but you know they’ll be there at the drop of a hat. I love the comments about one lady being grumpy. I think it’s fair to say she is a morning person but wow does she keep a tight ship. Responsible for pretty much all the housekeeping and catering, she and her team work tirelessly to keep the place clean, tidy and welcoming. The facilities are excellent and the location is spot on. Near enough and far enough. And forget about the Sunset of the North, the Sun rise in the south here is gorgeous. Lastly, a shout for Dimitri. Thoroughly attentive, helpful and hardworking, this charming chap could not do any more to make you stay a special one. An absolute legend!Been here nearly two weeks and already planning our return. Thank you all for our wonderful stay - Will & Trudie xo
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel could be OK but the photos on the internet will not show the surroundings: there is construction work going on all around the place; dirt roads around and huge piles of garbage just about 50 meters under the hotel. Located at the very end of the village up a dark road not sure if its very safe at night walking all by yourself.Hot water will only come once you let the water run for at least 20-30 minutes.The password for the wifi did not seem to work but the owner did not seem to care. The kitchen did not look and smell very clean. Owner is an old woman, rude and low class with no communication skills at all. One of those locals who managed to rake in money to burn due to endless tourism in Santorini but no manners at all and she thinks she can treat people like crap.All in all there are countless much nicer hotels at far better locations along the beach. If I were you I would not stay in Kamari at all because it's a low level tourist trap compared to other parts of the island and it also lacks character; the beaches and the atmosphere are much nicer in Perivolos and Perissa as well as the beach bars and restaurants / food is in a much bigger variation and more authentic elsewhere. But if you have to stay in Kamari then go down the beach and choose one of those nice hotels just 5-10 meters from the beach.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did not find the people in the hotel as friendly as other creek hotels we've stayed in, yes it was very clean and housekeeping visited daily but found the other staff to be less welcoming. It is a steep hill to the hotel and yes there are a lot of steps once in there a life that will take you to the first floor, we ended up in a room that of course the lift didn't reach, despite us being twice as old as the others that were checking in at the same time. The rooms are adequate in size, you need to request a kettle from reception and there is an extra 3 euro tourist tax a day to pay. Breakfast is a miss mash of things, fried eggs, cooked meats, pizza, pastries and fruit. We received a call on the last night asking what time we was leaving as check out was 11.30, then on the day were were leaving the others waiting for the bus said they had not had a call and reception had told them they could have stayed in room till bus came. Whilst we were there we also watched the staff start to put thins away for the end of season even though there were people still arriving. Also be careful when sing hot tub, my 2 silver necklaces and when oxidised ( really black), the lady in next apartment advised me her bracelet was ruined by the minerals etc in the hot tub,
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from a week staying at Epavlis Hotel. Lovely, clean room with daily housekeeping. Beautiful pool and sea views from the balcony. Great variety of choice for the breakfast buffet. The hotel is at the top of quite a big hill & our room was right at the top of a few flights of stairs but the views when you get to the top make it worth it. The pool bar was good - we had lunch there a couple of times and drinks. The barman (not sure of his name) was fab! Would definately recommend.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel. There were glitches. For example,when we arrived, the hotel had no room for us for our first night. However the receptionist was fantastic (really friendly, cooperative and funny) - as she was all week - and we were accommodated for the night in a new apartment block 200 yards down the road. Really, really comfortable so no problem - and had the side benefit of getting our cases transported to our room on the top floor for us, so - happy days!!Room was superb. Spotlessly clean, well furnished, very comfortable The daily climb up the steps was well worth the facilities and the view from the balcony.Breakfast offered an unusual selection but there was always something for us and it was delicious. Staff were excellent.We are not pool people but had lunch there twice. Dimitri was superb - he prepared the best Greek salad of several we had during the week. A genuinely good guy.As a pair of normal 60 year olds, we were not disadvantaged in the slightest by the walk up the hill and cannot speak highly enough of our week.So, overall, can't relate to some of the moans about the receptionist, no lift, steep hill etc. Just enjoy a great experience with lovely hosts.. Thank you all. Get a car to explore the island.Definitely eat at Navy's - the best of its type we have ever used on any Greek island
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel and staff. Overlooking the sea. Kamari beach is best o the island. Would recommend Danas and Almethia for food. Pool and sunbeds great I also booked a fantastic massage. Plenty of choice at breakfast
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was stunning the views from our balcony were beautiful the sun rise in the morning was some experience Kristina on reception was always very helpful as was all the staff place was spotless Dimitri at the pool bar was a character for 2 weeks will definitely be back
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife, 15 year old son and I stayed here at the end of July and into August. When we arrived we were warmly welcomed by reception staff and taken to our room on the second floor. Our room was spacious, clean and the furniture seemed relatively new. From the balcony we had a fantastic view of the sea (see photo), the air con worked well it was good that the room had both a small fridge and safe.There was a very relaxed atmosphere at the hotel and whilst I have noted some of the other experiences we found the staff on reception to be very polite and helpful. When we were looking at visiting other parts of the island they would advise us on the best places to visit and how to get there, they couldn't have been more helpful. The cleaning staff were always polite and did a great job of keeping our room and parts of the hotel spotless.Dimitri the barman runs the bar and pool area in a professional manner and works very hard. We didn't spend every day by the pool but when there he got very busy with orders at Lunch and probably could have done with some help. Wherever we go we always try a Mojito cocktail and we have to say that Dimitri's are the best we have ever had! The breakfast was generally very good, we didn't see any chips but there was pizza on a couple of occasions. There is however a wide range of choice and we never had what I'd describe as a bad breakfast. The lady organising the food at breakfast also worked very hard.The hotel is on a hill and whilst it can feel like a bit of a drag walking back when it's hot you soon get used to it, on the flip side once at the hotel the views are great.Overall we had a great stay here and would go back again, it was a bit too quiet for my 15 year old son but the 'banter' with Dimitri kept him entertained when we were at the pool!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just about 3 star we were put in a room under the pool area which was meant to be an upgrade.More like staying in someone’s garage with a view of a crumbling building in front.The owner is very rude and aggressive when you question things about the hotel. This seems to be a common problem if you read other reviews.Breakfast is very average and strange as some mornings chips and pizza were on offer.Santorini is a very beautiful island but unfortunately our stay was spoiled by staying here.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little hotel in a good location set back from Kamari. Staff friendly, rooms clean and comfortable with modern air con and fresh linen every day. Yes there’s a hill, yes it’s relatively steep and will get you out of breath. But surely that’s a good way to work off the delicious Greek cuisine?! The hill could be challenging for anyone with fitness issues, but worth it for the view.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a wonderful location, being away from the main shopping/eating areas of Kamari, therefore quiet. It's only a few minutes walk to the beach and all the restaurants. Yes there is a hill, which did get tiring by the end of the holiday, and inside the hotel there are a lot of steps, but the views more than make up for this slight inconvenience. The hotel is spotlessly clean, lovely toiletries in the room and clean towels are provided every day. Breakfast was full of choices, some a little weird to the UK palate, but always something nice to eat. A special mention must go to Dimitri the pool barman who works tirelessly on his long shift to make sure everyone is happy and served promptly. As another reviewer commented, he must be exhausted at the end of his day! The pool is very nice with extremely comfortable sunbeds and a profusion of towels. There is also a gym, sauna and jacuzzi which doesn't seem to be very well advertised. The staff in this hotel are super helpful and unfailingly polite. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first impression of the hotel was that it’s a pleasant, traditional looking Greek family run hotel. Yes there’s a steep incline up to the entrance from the beachfront, however being 30 and relatively fit this didn’t bother us. However definitely something to consider if you’re elderly, disabled or unfit. There was confusion on check in as we were told our room wasn’t available. This did annoy me, however we were given a temporary room for the first night and then upgraded to a very nice superior sea view room for the remainder of our holiday. This room was fantastic, however we did have to carry our own luggage up 3 flights of stairs as there is no elevator and/or assistance from staff.Despite other reviews, I found the ladies on the front desk to be pleasant and very helpful. They answered our questions daily and even helped sort out transportation to and from a restaurant we wanted to visit. Whenever I’ve visited Greece I’ve always found the people to be friendly and this was no different.The pool area is really good and adequate. It’s very small but there are enough sun beds to go around and even at full capacity there is enough room in the pool. This area gets sun all throughout the day so perfect if you’re a serial sunbather.There is a pool bar that offers drinks and food, however this is staffed by one man who does all the cooking, cleaning and serving. He did a fantastic job but he must be shattered by the end of the day!Breakfast was typical continental style with the addition of daily Greek delicacies. I really enjoyed it, however after a week it did get slightly repetitive and samey.The location was perfect as it’s just off the main drag but close enough to walk to. I was very surprised at how nice and modern Kamari was and the beachfront restaurants and bars really do stand out from most other resorts i’ve been to.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned home after lovely stay at this hotel. staff were pleasant and very helpful special mention to demitri the barman. Stayed in room 101 was next to the pool overlooking the sea. Would definetly return.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could not fault the hotel , only thing that let it down was the poor breakfast,, the barman who’s name I can’t remember is a credit to the hotel !!! , he is a friendly always happy kind of guy , would definitely go back
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. Yes the hotel sits on a hill as stated when we booked. You get use to it. Wouldn't be ideal for pushchairs or people who struggle to walk but I managed to do it with a broken foot.We stayed in room 103. Amazing view across kamari. Room was cleaned daily with fresh towels provided. Free air conditioning and free safety deposit box. Bed was comfortable. All in all the room was fit for purpose. Only had breakfast once. It's continental style with the usual eggs, cheese, fruit, bread etc. Can sit inside or on a little terrace overlooking the sea. Nice way to start your day.Pool - on not one occasion did we ever find we couldn't get a sun lounger. No getting up at 6am to put towels down. Many days we would go out in the morning and come in around lunch and still get a bed. The barman around the pool works his little socks off. Cooking, serving and cleaning. All food near the pool was of an excellent standard.All other staff we encountered were very pleasant and polite. We found the lady on reception very helpful, sorted us taxis to get us to fira and oia. Nothing was too much trouble. A very lovely lady. We will not hesitate in booking this hotel again and would definitely recommend to others.Some reviews have mentioned the building work but we hardly noticed it. Occasional noise but nothing to worry about.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Epavlis Hotel is a beautiful resort with views of the ocean from many of the rooms and the pool. The breakfast is good. The pool area is nice and the bartender/waiter is outstanding. But the bartender is the only member of the hotel staff who is customer friendly. The ladies running the front desk are not warm and welcoming. It feels like you are imposing on them if you ask a question. This is my biggest complaint. This hotel would be a challenge for anyone who has difficulty climbing steps or walking on an incline. The hotel is on multiple levels with an elevator that only goes up one floor so be prepared to haul your luggage if you have a room upstairs. If you book on the lobby level or one floor up you should be fine. You do have to climb a flight of stairs to get to the lobby area. The Epavlis sits on a hill, giving you that great view. In order to get to the beach or into the town you will need to walk down the hill. The return walk up the hill is tough if you are not in shape or if it is very hot outside. It was also about a 10-15 minute walk to get into the center of town. We were fine with this in early June, but it might be tough in July or August!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. The location is great, with views over Kamari beach and out to the ocean. I've seen others complain about the walk up the hill to the hotel but it's really not all that bad and a small price to pay to be off the strip but within striking distance of everything you might need. The staff where approachable and attentive, the facilities were brilliant and the rooms were spotless. The buffet breakfast was decent, plentiful and varied each day. When we come back to Santorini we will definitely be staying here again. No other hotel can offer the same level of quality for such a good price.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in May on arrival at the airport our transfer booked via the Hotel never turned up. We managed a taxi and were told 20 euro's to Kalmari another couple joined us and were also charged 20 common practice! Arriving in the evening the room seemed okay as we unpacked and went out for something to eat. Having booked a sea view room with outdoor hot tub imagine our disappointment arriving back to open the door and find out that we were opposite a construction site. A sister Hotel is being built opposite the rooms at the right hand side of the Hotel (as you walk up to it). Rooms 109 & 111 are affected by this as are others. Obviously this was unsatisfactory and we were not happy requesting a change of room in the morning alongside others. The staff did their very best in difficult circumstances and later that day we were relocated into a much better room. As it is a sister Hotel being built the owners have full knowledge of possible distress and discomfort that could be caused by this development. When it is near full capacity in July and August there will be little or no capacity to change rooms therefore it may be advisable to check which room you are being allocated before you arrive.Our second room was very spacious, sea view, good outdoor jacuzzi , clean and comfortable. There are good facilities at the Hotel decent pool, good bar, games room and library. The staff were helpful, friendly and courteous throughout breakfast was okay.It is well located at the edge of Kamari although on a hill not suitable if you have difficulty walking . Kamari has a good vibrant feel about it good choice of bars and eateries with a regular bus service to Fira (Thira). Bus stop a couple of minutes down the hill also the best part of the beach is below the Hotel. There is good walking to be had up the ancient Thera descending to Perissa. You can either walk back from Perissa, catch the water taxi or donkeys. Whilst the rest of our stay was good it was unfortunately blighted by the loss of a day if we had been advised in advance we could have made different arrangements.Note the construction work is due to finish September.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great View everything else poor. No toiletries in WC. Pigeon hole sized rooms. Had to pull luggage down myself from top floor. Poor choice for vegetarian food in breakfast. No dinner in hotel have to go out to eat. No kettle in room.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time to Epavlis (have booked again for next year) and had a truly fabulous stay.Maria, Christina, Mado and cleaning staff made us really welcome.Ample sun beds around a cool pool and bar were really comfortable with free fresh towels available daily.Rooms and all areas SPOTLESSLY cleaned daily with bed linen and towels changed dailyMado in the bar was always courteous and full of local knowledge and made excellent snacks and cocktails all reasonably pricedMaria the owner and Christina in reception were fantastic. Halfway into our stay we heard of a family tragedy and they went out of their way to help us try and arrange flights home with local services.The walk to and from the hotel into Kamari was short and after a few days you get used to the return walkGood library and games room plus an indoor poolLooking forward to next year
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my wife spent the last week of the season at the hotel so it was quiet with probably not more than 7 or 8 rooms occupied out of 45. We had delux room 126 which was great - nice very comfortable 4 poster bed, fridge and safe(no charge). Clean towels every day. Very large terrace with 2 sun beds and a hot tub jacuzzi (yes, it was hot!) with a superb sea view. As it was the last week of the season in Kamari, a lot of bars and restaurant were closing but there were still some very good restaurants nearby. The walk back to the hotel is up a bit of an incline but you get used to it over the week! Overall, a very enjoyable stay and we would recommend this lovely hotel.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 days in Epavlis Hotel. We choose a room with sea view and private jacuzzi on the terrasse. ROOM : beautiful room, very clean, we had a very good bed. JACUZZI: be very careful !!! It's not hot tube !!! The water was so cold we didn't even spend 5 min in it. We complain at the reception but it didn't change anything... this was so disappointing. FOOD : Hôtel breakfast is good with a lot of choices. Restaurants around are very touristic so not very good except for one : Pinakio restaurant 5/10 mn by food). You really should reserved a table because it's full every evening and it's the best ratio price/quality we found. CRUISE : we did a very good trip on a beautiful boat (replica from pirate boat of XIX century). We booked it with the hotel and it was perfect (volcano hiking + swim in hot springs + dinner with white wine + Oia sunset with sax player. ACTIViTIES : everything in the hotel is for money, even the billard... too bad !! You pay a cold jacuzzi on ur terrasse and u have to pay again if u want the warn one inside.... it's a shame ! TRANSPORT : we rent a quad for 2 days to visit Pyrgos and to go on red beach, black beach... it really worth it. But be careful, at the Harbor some taxi companies try to make u pay 15€/person, u can find 10€/person. We took a transport by the hotel to the harbor when we left and the charge is 12,5€/person. I was surprised and disappointed, I thought hotel transport will be the same price but it's more expensive so... don't trust so much the hotel even if the staff was nice... at the beginning I wanted to put 5* but with the jacuzzi and transport problem I put only 3*... too bad !
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was clean and room comfortable but the manager is vile. We arrived to be told our room wasn't ready and that we would have to stay in another hotel and that they would pick us up first thing in the morning to bring us back. We had to get in the managers husbands very beat up filthy old car to be taken to a grim hotel. We were up first thing to be collected but unfortunately no show from anyone. We had to get the hotel to keep phoning to get us picked up. Eventually we were picked up just after lunch. As we were there for only 5 days this really ate into our time there. Breakfast was not nice and very basic. Apart from this we had an amazing time in Santorini. Hotel is ok location, yes a 10 min walk from restaurants, beach etc but to be honest all the other hotels are right on the strip. Easy to hire a quad bike and ride up to Oia and Fira. Highly recommend you do this and only an hour easy drive.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an attractive, clean, stylish hotel with great sea views. It's at one end on the town and is quiet and convenient. Breakfast is good, and the coffee was excellent. They serve lunches at the bar but we didn't partake. Pool area is small - ish but there always seemed to be sunbeds (comfortable by the way) available. Water was cold.There are lots of steps and the hotel is on a slight hill so not comfortable in the heat or if you have any difficulties (or aversion to) walking.The room maids and breakfast staff were friendly and unobtrusive.However, the main issue we had with this hotel was that we never really felt welcome from the moment we were checked in by an unsmiling staff member. We don't expect hotel staff to be our new best friends but there was a lack of warmth in the welcome and in the attitude of some of the staff which was distinctly off - putting. Maybe some training required.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights and had a pleasant stay. Our room downstairs was very spacious, bathroom was clean (but needs some updating)with more than enough toiletries. Although we don't have the ocean view like the upstairs rooms, the downstairs room gave us easier access to the beach & stairs for our luggages (no elevators). WiFi is spotty downstairs but good in the lobby & pool area. We love the pool and the beach accessibility. The front desk took care of our shuttle needs which was very reasonably priced (and referred me to a doctor in Oia 'coz I was sick). Breakfast in the morning was very good!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week and loved it. We had a sea view room which was gorgeous!!! The room was clean and the maid came in everyday. The breakfasts were very good, continental style buffet, always plenty there. Pool is sufficient for cooling off. Staff were all excellent. The hotel is on an incline but after day 3 we were used to it. People moaning about this hotel are obviously used to much larger hotels!! The guy that runs the bar is your man for all useful information :). We hired a quad bike from the hotel and it was the best way to get around and very fun! The local buses are very good and cheap!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a 3 star max hotel, very dated, small pool, limited sun beds and a miserable hotel manager, there is no denying that the hill to the hotel is a nightmare, there are so many hotels on the beach front which would be more convenient. Not many people have mentioned this, but the hotel is self catering, however, if are not allowed to take and if you're own food or drink around the pool area, they demand you to buy their over priced drinks and poor quality food from their bar everyday. Safe to say I would never return to this hotel, but will definitely be returning to kamari
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as a group of 4 in June 2017. Hotel was clean, staff were friendly and check-in was a breeze.Epavlis is quite a quiet hotel, the location is good, with a short walk to most of Kamari!Rooms - fairly standard, beds comfy although a little noisy. Air con works well and the bathroom has everything you need, although some rooms may have an awkwardly placed showerhead holder (stayed in 2 different rooms there). Sea view is a must, balcony makes a difference!Food/drink - bar is well stocked, barman friendly and happy to help. Had food from there which was average, salad was good, burger ok, and sandwich not great. Breakfast is also just ok, lots of selection but not sure all the cooked items were fresh.Amenities - 2 pools to the hotel, one small indoor pool which is great for cooling off in the quiet away from the sun, outdoor pool is also good, very clean and a good size. Small games room at the hotel, table tennis is free but the pool table is charged for. Conclusion - nice hotel tucked away from the main crowd of Kamari, fairly priced and with everything required.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my new husband have just returned from our honeymoon where we spent an amazing 2 weeks in Santorini and stayed at The Epavlis.The nit picking in the earlier reviews is really unfair so if you want a true to form review continue reading.Yes the hotel is on a slight hill, if your an elderly old lady then this hotel isn't for you but it really isn't a massive problem it's not like it's Mt Everest. We liked it being away from the hustle and bustle of the main strip where a lot of the other hotels are situated. The walk down to the bars, restaurants is just a few minutes away. On arrival we were greeted by Cristina whom by the end of the 2 weeks we had struck up a lovely friendship with. We would go and see her most mornings and she would advise on how to get to the places we wanted to visit, bus routes etc.She even jumped on the back of a scooter and came down to the bus stop we were waiting at for a boat trip, which turned out to be the wrong one! She didn't have to do it but she did and booked us a taxi to enable us to still make it to the port in time.The rest of the staff work like trojans. The cleaning maid is always smiling and says hello, rooms were always spotlessly clean and fresh towels everyday. The breakfasts were lovely and typically Greek with yoghurt, fresh fruits, pastries, eggs but no English breakfast which was fine by us, your in Greece, embrace the food! The barman was always fun, joking around and served us lovely pizzas and sandwiches at lunch time.All in all this hotel works amazingly well for a small team of about 6 people that keep it running from day to day. To top it off we were upgraded on our last night to a seaview room with a jacuzzi, something we never expected but were very happy to accept.Oh and Maria whom people refer to as miserable is a very lovely lady if you take the time to speak to her and not moan about petty little things! Her English is not the greatest so I think she's just very misunderstood.We will definitely return here again for many anniversaries to come!!!!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Solid Good Hotel. No amnesty is missing at all. Staff are superb. Best I ever met in my life , and I have met a lot. They go way out of their way to help you. Listen to their tips on tours. The owners , husband and wife , are extremely courteous. Place is clean. Very clean. Stay here and avoid over-priced hotels of Fira and Oia. There is a home-feeling to this place that is Rarely seen anywhere else.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing time on our 6 day trip to Santorini. We stayed at Epavlis without knowing anything about the Santorini area and we were pleasantly surprised!Cristina at the front desk was extremely helpful and welcoming. The two bar staff guys were also so nice and helpful always. Epavlis was clean, really beautiful, and it was by far the best location. It is walking distance to the center of Kamari which is filled with great shops and restaurants. It's nice and calm and not busy like Fira and Oia. I will definitely stay here again and I highly recommend if you are looking for a calm and quiet place to stay.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everytime I visit Santorini,I always stay at Epavlis HTL.Best hotel ever,wondeful Staff and very serviceminded.The breakfast is just wondeful.The rooms are nice and everything like always just worked fine.THANK YOU EPAVLIS TEAM
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located in city Kamari, not difficult to find by car. Has free parking and wi fi in public areas. Internet worked very bed even near swimming pool. And crowd of people that are trying to use it near reception prevents you from making calls as everyone will listen. Difficult with bags, a lot of steps, no real elevator, nobody wanted to help us with it. TV had few English channels. Bedroom is of good size, but double beds were just awfully small. Pillows were not comfortable that I had huge headaches next days. We had nice patio with jacuzzi with sea views. Breakfast was tasty, big variety.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a week at the Epavlis. It's a really great base for exploring Santorini and close to everything you need in Kamari.We got a great welcome. We stayed in a double sea-view room on the first floor. There were great views and a sunny balcony for most of the day. Rooms are very clean and the bed was very comfortable . The bathroom a good size and the bath also doubled as a whirlpool bath.We had expected tea and coffee making facilities but arrived to find there were none. We asked for a kettle and cups and they were provided. We took our own tea and bought milk from the local shop. So worth asking and going prepared.The room has a good size safe and a fridge.It's very close to all the bars and restaurants which are all very reasonably priced.We hired a car for a week and there was parking just in front of the hotel.We're already looking to return next year.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: May 2017 we've just returned from a week stay in this beautiful stylish hotel. It is extremely comfortable spacious and has lots of little extras. staff are all really friendly helpful and on hand, they all speak good English too. Maddo pool barman very pleasant and helpful. the rooms are really clean and cleaned everyday, bedding changed every two days.breakfast is included and is very good plenty of variety and again the guy here is helpful & friendly. there is a hot tub by most rooms and various balcony areas. room 106 view was varied good view in one direction to sea and town but also some waste land/building plotWi-Fi is good by the pool, reception and is reasonable in some rooms in others it may be limited.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely ten night stay at this hotel. The positives far outweigh the negatives to the point that we are looking to book and stay again! It has a lovely sea view from the pool and most of the rooms. Unfortunately, as I was travelling in a three, we had a larger room, situated at the back of the building. This resulted in no view and the room smelt slightly foisty after a few days as we had no real chance to let fresh air in unless we left our balcony door open. This didn't put us off at all though as we were hardly in it. The staff were lovely, particularly the bar man, Mado, who is a credit to the hotel. He was very helpful and was able to recommend the best places to eat and things to see. He also makes a wonderful cup of tea! :)The beach, shops and restaurants are all very close to the hotel, all that stands between you is a slight hill. Being rather unfit this was a killer to start with, but as the holiday went by I started to power up it.Overall a fantastic holiday and hotel, but one to definitely do in flat shoes!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week in May 2017.Room 109 was perfect, patio area and a hot tub with sea views one way and the mountain view behind.Rooms are basic and the bathroom could be updated however the price paid was terrific value for money and the rooms and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Madu, the barman was fabulous and made amazing cocktails. He was so friendly and treated guests like family.Maria and Christina were lovely too and were willing to help especially as we had a 24hr delay and re-checked in at 4am. They went out of their way to help and let us keep the room on a little longer before our trip (2nd flight attempt!) Back to the UK. Breakfast is buffet style and served downstairs with sea views. Its typical Greece so don't go expecting full English breakfasts! Thats part of the charm of this lovely little hotel - its personal, quirky and charming.Kamari is a 5 min walk downhill (uphill on way back ) and there are lots of steps at the hotel....perfect for walking off those holiday ice creams and cocktails!Its a great hotel and we would definitely recommend and return.Thank you to all the staff for making our holiday a great one.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a wonderful family owned gem at the edge of Kamari. Set just off the main beach front, it offers spectacular views of the ocean as well as a tranquility which is so richly appreciated. This is not our first time staying here and we were greeted back by Maria, the owner, and Christina on reception. We had emailed in advance and were able to get the same room we had last time, Room 112. A lovely spacious room with a balcony which overlooks the pool and ocean beyond but still offers an element of privacy.Granted, this hotel has a number of steps but don't let that put you off. Meadow (apologies if I've spelt that wrong) welcomed us back too and was on hand to help with our luggage. The pool area is charming with plenty of beds and umbrellas as well as a bar which Meadow runs making all manner of delicious drinks including the best Pina Colada I've had in a long time!Walking to the beachfront is a short 5 minute stroll and then there is a whole host of bars and restaurants to choose from.Breakfast each morning is a variety of pastries, cold meats, cheeses, eggs, toast etc which can be enjoyed either inside or outside on the terrace.If walking up & down the hill to the beachfront isn't quite enough exercise, Epavlis also has an indoor gym offering a treadmill, bike, stepper and a selection of weight machines. It also has a games room and a selection of books for swapping.Our week went by so quickly that we have already booked to return later in the season for a further 10 days.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A week was not long enough so going back soon for two weeks and can't waitHotel has the best views over the town and of the sea Kept spotlessly clean everywhere the staff were helpful and friendly Lift available to upper floorsBeds comfy linen changed dailyBedroom cleaned every dayAir conditioning in room efficient and quietReception/lounge area very spacious with comfy furniture and a well stocked "library"Pool area very clean with plenty of sun loungers and umbrellasPlenty of choices for breakfast all fresh daily and tastyFresh squeezed orange available from pool barLocal beers and hot snacks available from pool barWalk to beech about 10 minutesWalk back invigorating especially after a big meal
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, friendly staff and amazing views. Excellent with our child and staff couldn't of been more helpful, good breakfast as well. Swimming pool was lovely and the bar serves great beer and food and even provides you with a towel for the pool.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We was there at last August it is a wonderful place to visit so quite if you looking for peace. Very helpful stuff nice service so clean always change sheets every day .The pool area was very nice view with enough sunbeds for everyone and a very nice cocktail from the barman mado. Very pleasant breakfast .really it very nice place to visit
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend our holiday in August at room 140 with a wonderful sunrise and sunset. The pool area was nice managed by lovely barman mado and great reception with miss Maria always smilling and help in whatever we want and when ever we want. It is very quite hotel for holiday
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very bad service,aggressive behaviour,fail in Tourism hospitaliry.The location is medioum,the rooms are clean but smells the toilets.We couldn find a better room to stay but i trust the advirtsment etc.I think that they care only for the money and no for the morning of hospitality..Never again in that Hotel.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our Situation We wanted a few days in warm Santorini in October for our Anniversary. We booked this holiday months in advance and paid next to nothing for flights and accommodation, 2nd week of October is the end of the high season – many establishments were closing for the end of season and this is likely to have contributed to the low cost of this trip. We travel quite often and generally stay in 4 Star plus hotels, this hotel is definitely not one! I am glad that we had booked a second hotel in Oia for our actual Anniversary celebration. Pros Very Close to Kamari beach Lots of ATV/Car hire options nearby You can book excursions via the Reception Desk Rooms were clean (bathrooms – see cons) Pool/sunbed area is nice enough Great coffee made by Mado at the bar We visited in low season so it was all quite slow and relaxed – could be both a pro and a con There is so much to see and do in Santorini, that we literally used the hotel to sleep and showerCons Rooms are old fashioned Pillows are cheap and not fluffy, 2 per person are definitely required Bathrooms – the seal around the tub is old and permanently stained, I have to be honest I hated using the bathroom, it was clean but it was so dark and dingy with permanent stains, not at all modern, the shower is a stand in the bath shower The hotel manager has RBF (resting b face) so don’t expect any smiles are gratitude at your choice to stay at Hotel Epavlis from her. She does not smile, I even smiled at her but still no smiles although she did get me two glasses one day when I asked her for some late at night. Regarding her attitude, I am not sure if this is just the Greek way though, I noticed this attitude with many people across Santorini, they don’t smile for the sake of smiling – perhaps I am just to accustomed to Western Customer Service. Breakfast leaves much to be desired, there are stray cats hanging about the place as you eatGeneral RecommendationsDo the Volcano excursion, it is truly remarkableGo to Ancient Thira, it is incredibleDefinitely do the sunset trip to Oia Hire a car or an ATV as the views while driving around are something else If you visit in October, be sure to take sweaters and long pants for the evening because the wind is no joke!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everywhere was spotless. Breakfasts are buffet style with plenty of choices. Sunbeds have deep mattresses, very comfortable Please be aware. The hotel is built on many levels, so it's all steps, then there is a steep incline to get to the hotel. Some of the private outdoor water facilities are not private. The receptionist was rude, very unpleasant. All other staff were very nice. We found the resort expensive.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited the hotel with my boyfriend. it's amazing to wake up in such a lovely place with such a lovely view! Excellent location and breakfast , very clean hotel and friendly staff. We had such a great time!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like Charlotte E, I was also asked on arrival if I would be willing to go and stay at another hotel, for reasons that the lady on reception couldn't give me. (Later I was told there was a problem with the plumbing in my room). I was moved just down the road to the Crown Suites, which was lovely, although more of an upmarket slightly characterless boutique hotel, whereas what I wanted was something that felt a bit more Greek, which the Epavlis is. I stayed at the Crown Suites for three nights before moving back to the Epvalis, and then wished I'd dug my heels in on arrival, as the view from my room was gorgeous, and that, I realised too late, was the thing that I'd really paid for when I booked weeks earlier. The hotel gave me a complimentary bottle of wine to say thanks. I'd definitely rather have just stayed at the Epvalis throughout, had that view, and not had the inconvenience of having to pack and move hotels mid-holiday.I am surprised to read the comments about grumpy staff on here, that was not my experience at all. I found the staff really helpful whenever I needed info on local sights or taxis ordering. The rooms are fairly basic but spacious and well serviced. It's well worth paying the little bit extra for the sea view. Breakfast is decent, better than I've found in many Greek hotels.The hotel is slightly set back from the promenade of shops and restaurants along the front, but I liked that, it felt a little quieter, and it was only a 5 minute walk to shops, restaurants and the beach. There are lots of ok, fairly indistinguishable Greek tavernas near the hotel. I didn't have a bad meal all week. The best meals I had were at Meli & Thymari, Almira and Black Stone (which looks like a pub but the food was a really pleasant surprise).Kamari is a very sweet little seaside town. It's very easy to get a bus to Fira, from where you can connect to other parts of the island. The best activity I did was walk from Fira up to Oia. Quite long (12km I think), hilly and gravelly in parts, so don't attempt it in sandals. But spectacular views along the way. The Ancient Thira site, on the hill directly behind the Epavlis, is also very worth a visit.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is by far the worst hotel we have ever been to , we were put in a triple room not the deluxe room we paid £1800 for yes it had a outdoor jacuzzi but it wasn't private it was on a stairwell that anyone could come up to so far from private as for the other balcony being a seaview you could see tiny bits of sea,the room stank of smoke but apparently Maria thinks this is down to preference, our bath leaked and apparently we didn't know how to use it, no baths in the uk? It's a absolute joke, if you want a nice holiday santorini is lovely but stay away from this hotel it's like fawlty towers, and if you don't know what that is Maria have a look on you tube you may just laugh.By the way I've tapped 1 circle to rate shame there's no minus !!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to Santorini for 5 days and stayed here, it's a lovely hotel although a few things its on a hill....so in the heat be prepared for the crawl up! The location was perfect a short walk down to the Kamari strip with loads of lovely restaurants and bars. Mado at the bar was extremely friendly and was able to recommend many places to go and see! Was a perfect trip. The rooms were clean and spacious and the bed we had was comfy. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a half board package at this hotel from the 20/9 for 7 nights. At our check in when we asked what time dinner was served we were told to come down later and the system would be explained. The system for anyone on a half board package is that you are given a voucher to go to one of two local tavernas every evening for your meal. The receptionist told us that we could have anything at all at the restaurants and would only need to pay for our drinks. In fact it turned out that at both of the restaurants you were given a separate menu to choose from. One of th e restaurants we found very poor with a limited choice but the other one is excellent with a good choice of both starters and mains. At no time when we booked had we been told that our evening meals would be away from the hotel. As seen in other reviews the hotel is at the top of a fairly steep hill which for us even being 60 somethings was o.k. but then once you get to the hotel there are 20 steps to get into the reception. We had booked a superior room which was on the top floor so altogether to get to the room we had to climb 80 steps the last 30 of which are extremely steep. The room had a beautiful view of the bay and the sunrise and being at the top was very quiet but we would recommend that anyone with mobility problems should avoid this hotel even if you are in a low level room as there are lots of small flights of stairs all over the hotel. The hotel is exceptionally clean but breakfast was very mediocre and hot things weren't hot . We went to the bar one evening, and asked for coffee and the barman was very off hand and said the coffee machine had been closed down for the day so we would have to wait for him to boil a kettle. Very few people used the bar in the evenings it seemed to us and with this attitude you can understand why. We had a leak from under the bath everytime we used the shower and although we reported it it wasn't repaired for the whole week so we insisted that towels were put down as the amount of water leaking made it dangerous and I must say that the cleaners did do this daily. The manager did offer us another room but we declined as we thought it would get repaired and we liked being in the room where we were. Santorini is beautiful and we would go again but think twice about this hotel if you do have any mobility problems and I agree with other reviewers that it is probably more a 3 star than a 4.
hotelName:
11    Epavlis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying at villa rose at the moment and what an absolute little gem it is.spotless accomodation. rooms cleaned every day. Fridge restocked every day with essentials. Lovely outside pool area. And most of all the staff are super friendly and accommodating. We have no hesitation in recommending villa rose.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent three nights in Villa Rose. I enjoyed the swimming pool, they give you towels for the pool, you can also have sunscreen for free. In the room all perfectly clean and de fridge full of nice things for breakfast. You will find a nice present too!!The staff is very kind anf they help you with any request you have. I recommend it 100%
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 2 nights, it is in a fantastic location within walking distance to the bus station, restaurants, bars and shops. Maria was so friendly and gave us lots of recommendations for things to do and places to eat- we walked along the coast to Oia (around 7 Miles) one morning and also visited Santo Wines winery which we loved! The room was cleaned daily and had all the necessities- Maria left juice, yoghurts and croissants in the fridge as well as coffee pods for the Nespresso machine and on our last night, a bottle of wine and a cake- what a lovely touch. The pool area is stunning too! Highly recommend
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here early April and were delighted with our room. Lovely Greek style room with small kitchenette and shower room. It was so clean and the bed very comfortable. Breakfast items provided in the fridge, like yogurt, croissants, orange juice etc. This was plenty adequate for our needs. Fira is within a ten minute walk where you will find lots of restaurants, bars and supermarkets. We hired a car and the owners arranged everything for us. The only thing they couldn't arrange was the weather which was a bit hit and miss for early April. Highly recommend and would definitely stay there again. Thank you to Maria and her family and staff for a wonderful, memorable stay.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: travelled to Villa Rose Oct 2018 the service and standard was excellent travelled from a 5 star hotel in imprevolgli were rooms were easily 3 times the price and the service was on par if not above. Yes there is no view and it is a little noisy but at the end of the day it is a studio/appartment complex and have to say the service is one of the best ive received great base for exploring, friendly warm welcome from both kiri and Maria loads of information on what to do where to eat etc free breakfast of juice croissants expresso pods in the morning. In the evening bars of choc left as a treat and a bottle of wine another evening. swimming pool small but if your looking for somewhere close to the action (10 mins walk to fira center) at a reasonable price for Santorini this is the place
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay here was extremely comfortable. The mother-daughter duo of Maria and Kiki were very kind and helpful. They not only helped us in planning our local sightseeing but also helped in arranging taxi. The apartment rooms were spacious and well maintained. Wifi was very good. The location is central and all amenities such as supermarket and bus station is nearby.Overall, it was an excellent stay and the accomodation is much better than a 4 star hotel. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 2night stay at this boutique villa. The host Kiki is very knowledgeable and was able to provide us with all the information we needed for our stay. The villa was comfortable al5hough the bed was quite firm. The staff are very friendly and the service here cannot be faulted. They are all lovely, special touches we were sitting by the pool and one of the staff came out with home baked cake for us what a treat you don’t get that sort of hospitality everywhere and it was a first for us. Keep up the great hospitality Villa Rose we enjoyed our stay thank you Lianne and Tony Sydney Australia
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice small hotel close to Thira. It is spotlessly clean. Love the idea that the fridge is filled with all you need for breakfast. Small but lovely pool area with complimentary towels and sunscreen.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so cute! It is so beautifully decorated & very very clean! You have your own terrace/balcony that we spent most of our nights just sitting back enjoying a bottle of wine. Right now the street there are other options that we took advantage for late evening coffee &/or snacks. It is walking distance to the main area of Fira to get to all the shopping & restaurants. Above all the staff at this hotel went over & beyond! They set up a winery tour for us & also set up an ATV that we used to explore the island. Our flight was early in the morning & the taxi was set up for us with no issues. Since we left so early they even made sure to return the ATV keys to the company. I've never had such great service & they do it with a genuine smile. I can definitely tell they truly love making sure their guests have a great stay! Definitely don't hesitate to book this hotel if staying in Fira!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Villa Rose as part of a wedding party. Villa Rose is run by mother and daughter Maria and Kiki. Before arriving I had several email exchanges with them asking various questions which were always answered very promptly. Transfers were arranged for us to and from the airport. In addition a lift was also arranged for me and some of the other guests on the day of the wedding to the wedding meeting point. The accommodation was fairly basic but extremely adequate and comfortable. It was cleaned meticulously every day as were all of the outdoor areas. Slippers were provided as were large towels that were changed every day. The toiletries provided are olive oil based and very nice. The room was well stocked with cutlery, pans, plates, glasses etc. The fridge was stocked with basic provisions such as croissants, butter, orange juice, milk, water, crackers, a small carafe of wine. There was a coffee machine and coffee pods provided. All of theses provisions were replenished on a daily basis,The outdoor area although quite small was quite sufficient. There is a small pool and a Jacuzzi pool. There are several extremely comfortable sun loungers, a comfortable cushioned seating area as well as stand alone seats around tables in a shaded area. Towels are provided for use outdoors and there is a basket of sun creams.Villa Rose is situated about 10 minutes walk out of town, about 5 minutes walk from the supermarket and about 3 minutes walk from the most fantastic 24 hour bakery. The bus station is a few minutes walk away. There is "The Coffee Lab" close by which was frequented by some of our party and received the accolade of being one of the best coffee shops visited. If you turn right out of Villa Rose, heading away from town, there are several eateries. On the opposite side of the road a few minute away are a couple of tavernas which serve delicious Greek food and are very reasonable compared to in the town. In the town there are two very nice places to eat. One called Da Costa which overlooks the sea and is a great place to watch the beautiful sunset from. The other is an Italian restaurant in the heart of town called Convivium where the food is delicious. Villa Rose does not have a view but that is made up 100 fold by Maria, Kiki and the staff. I can honestly say that I have never, in my many years of travel, felt so well looked after as I was at Villa Rose. Nothing was ever too much trouble. An example is when I asked if there was another hair dryer I could use as the one in the room was not very powerful. The next day I was provided with a brand new hair dryer. One of our group had a baby and the staff washed and dried some of her bibs and clothes. Maps and bus timetables were provided and verbal recommendations and directions given and always with a smile. I could not have felt more welcome. If you are looking for somewhere out of town I would 100% recommend Villa Rose.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week between 1-8 Aug for a wedding. As we were a large group of around 10, we were initially quite apprehensive about the hotel as the pool appeared small and did not think it could accommodate us comfortably. HOWEVER, we could not have asked for a better stay. The pool area was lovely, always clean and enough beds for us, the staff were so accommodating and pleasant at all times, the cleaners did an amazing job every morning and worked so hard, fresh towels and bedding regularly throughout the week and always pleasant with a smile on their face. Free transfers to and from the airport (which was super handy as cabs can be expensive). Fridge was restocked every morning with yoghurt, croissants, crackers, juice and wine and staff were always on hand to provide any extras we asked for. Child friendly and overall an amazing accommodation with a lovely atmosphere. Kyri and Maria, thanks you so much for an amazing stay! Xx
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a fantastic place to stay and excellent value for money. Kiki and her staff are just lovely and made us feel incredibly welcome, they go out of their way to look after you and there are lots of wonderful touches around the villa. The pool is perfect either after a days exploring or when you just to relax and not go anywhere. There isn’t a view, but a five minute walk up the road takes you to the caldera and within ten minutes you are in the centre of Fira. The staff, the friendliness and the value for money more than make up for any view and it’s good to be out of the hectic centre too. The fridge was stocked, then restocked with essentials, the whole villa is incredibly clean and well maintained and the staff who cleaned our room went above and beyond expectations, real care and attention was shown. A fantastic place to stay and we’d stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed 3 nights at Villa Rose and it was just what we were looking for! Our room was small, simply decorated and spotlessly clean. Kiki and Marie gave us lots of help for navigating Fira and excursion options as well as a friendly smile for the smallest of requests. The cleaning ladies were terrific, with thorough cleaning, fresh towels and decorative touches! Villa Rose provided some basic breakfast foods, yogurt, cakes, coffee and water bottles, which was much appreciated. All transfers were promptly organized and perfect. We really enjoyed the pool after lots of walking through Fira. The walk from villa Rosa to the pedestrian area is approx 3 long blocks, and 2 blocks to the bus station. (wear comfy shoes, not a smooth sidewalk!)Overall, loved our stay here!!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: having a nice place to stay does no matter so much because you must stay alive to njoy it....villa's transfer driver is an epic example of bad and dangerus man! he was so close to kill a family by braking priority rules and also attacked the other driver(next to his infant and wife)....omg! so, never again there,not even close!!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of my favourite places I have ever stayed! I cannot rate this high enough. Maria and her team run the most amazing apartments and they could not be more helpful. Maria gave us advice about places to eat, visits to make, helped us plan our trips, book ferry tickets, book taxis. The place is so clean. The staff work so hard to keep it beautiful. They clean everywhere to the highest of standards, not just individual apartments but the communal areas too. Maria leaves little thoughtful touches all over the Villa - suncream for everyone to use, a little caraf of wine in your room. The staff not only cleaned our room but would artistically fold our pyjamas. It is just the sweetest place! I would not hesitate to book it again. We found Santorini to be a very buy place and much of the accommodation extremely expensive. When we booked Villa Rose we were worried because it seemed so reasonable - we thought it might not be very good. How wrong we were. It's within walking distance of the main town but yet far enough away to escape from the crowds. It's full off character and charm and feels like a much loved and cared for business. Maria and the team work so hard for this and it really is lovely. We loved it and were so sad to leave it behind! I hope to return xx
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: -Airport transfers included (contact villa rose before arrival)-Supermarket on the road behind (check map given by hosts)-Swimming pool cleaned every day-Breakfast (croissants/greek yoghurt/large water bottle/orange juice) provided free of charge every single day-Descriptions, maps and lots of advice given upon arrival-Bus station 5 minute walk away-Bakery 2 mins walk awayWe really enjoyed our stay here. The staff were so friendly and polite and really helped us with things to do and booking our excursions. The rooms were cleaned every day and fridge replenished. The only thing is that the bathroom is slightly small and shower is slightly small - some may prefer a larger bathroom. Overall we loved our stay and would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I planned my Santorini trip so that I have 1 hotel night in Fira and 2 hotel nights in Oia. I pack light so I do not mind switching hotels. I'm glad I chose Villa Rose for my first night. The free pick-up from airport to hotel was quick - 15 minutes. Pick-up at airport is up to 8:30 PM. So best to arrange your flight to arrive before that time. Prior to arrival, the hotel sent me instructions as to how to get to the hotel on my own in case my flight is delayed. It would have been easy for taxis to find the hotel as it is along a road and near a gas station. My room was on the ground floor at the rearside of the property. This was good because as mentioned, Villa Rose is along a road and I imagine one can hear traffic noise if the room is not at the rear. I imagine my room to be ideal for people who have difficulty ascending and descending stairs. The bathroom is small though and not wheelchair-accessible.The hosts are a mother and daughter team, Maria and Kiki. I cannot say enough good things about them. They are so sweet and helpful. It's very reassuring for a first-time solo visitor to Santorini to have such welcoming hosts. Maria gave me tips on where to eat. how to walk to the main hub of Fira. There is no view of the caldera here. Following her suggestion, I had breakfast at Mylonas, a patisserie 5 mins from the hotel before walking up to the center of Fira. It only took me less than 15 minutes to reach the pedestrian walkway where you can start seeing views of the caldera. Along the way, I passed by a bus station. The hotel would be convenient for people who prefer to take buses in Santorini. My room was spotless and comfortable. There's enough outlets to plug my devices. Wifi was a bit slow. The ref was stock with yogurt, water and cake. Villa Rose is a good option for people on a light budget, do not mind the absence of caldera views, want A/C and willing to walk 15 minutes to reach the main drag of Fira. This can be also good for families with little children - they can gather around the hotel yard with a small pool after a long day of exploring Santorini.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room i had was much better than i had expected, very nicely furnished & comfortable.Balcony & a stylish bathroom.Pool is very small but still nice to have a dip to cool off.The owners are amazing & very helpful & friendly.Goodies in the fridge each day.I would definitely stay again & recommend.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most amazing place I have ever stayed - the owner was absolutely lovely who even carried my suitcases to my room. There was a free restock of breakfast items every day - chocolate croissants, greek yoghurt, apples, milk, coffee, orange juice even chocolate bar! I liked some sweets at reception so they delivered an entire bowl of them to me at the pool. Could not ask for more in a hotel. The showers are beautiful, the location is fantastic and a few minutes walk from the main road of fira. The hotel is also on the same main road as the one that goes to Oia, and only a 5min drive to Santorini airport. The pool is also great, and there is a jacuzzi. Only one watch out - the wifi is not great. BUT YOU MUST STAY HERE, BEST EXPERIENCE EVER.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last week. It was an excellent stay overall. The owner Kiki & her mum Maria is so helpful & always smiling whenever we asked any sort of question. When we initially checked in Kiki gave us a very thorough & helpful tips how to cover Santorini with a detailed map. All her suggestions are helpful & great.We were a family of 4 & we got the front room with balcony. We had 2 seperate rooms plus a dining - kitchenette. And a compact shower. Loved our apartment. All the furnishings were top notch. We had view of the sea from our room too.
