A thoughtful item - if you wash your clothes or wants to dry swimming gears they have a small airer in the balcony alongwith pegs!! This is exactly not in Fira high street. It is around 5-7mins walk there which was fine for us. They have plenty of parking in front of the property. They do provide basic breakfast items. We also borrowed beach towels whilst going to the beach which they very happily gave. They have 2 small pools. Enjoyed them too after a hot day.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say about this hotel....just perfect. All the staff are top notch, the location is great, the hotel is modern and very clean. The fridge was stocked daily with lots of tasty treats...chocolate croissants, muffins, fruit juice, water, Melba toast, honey, milk....the list goes on! The free transfers to the airport are very handy and whilst we were waiting to go to the airport we were given free ice cream! It's little things like that which separate this hotel from the norm.Yes, the road is a little noisy but it's not a big deal...you couldn't hear it when in the room.If your are looking for a well priced hotel with a little something special go here...you will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best experiences in hotel. Place is very pretty , even though it is not the best location ever, it all compensate. The atmosphere makes you feel like home, and Kiki and MAria makes sure that is the case. It was a small pool, they have all supplies you might need for your stay (and more), and everything is very clean. Excellent!!!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous hotel, modern, spotless and overall great value for money. Clean towels everyday that smelt gorgeous, clean bath mats and a spotless tidy apartment every day! Owners are lovely and can't do enough to help you! Fantastic hotel and great value for money! Only 6 minute walk into the centre and bus station 3 minutes away! Can't wait to come again!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the most amazing 4 nights at Villa Rose.I was greeted by the wonderful Lady on reception who immediately gave me a run down of the island, ideas on whether to eat and to see the best sunset. She gave me so many options! She appears to a very genuine and helpful friendly lady.I was shown my room which was very cute. Nice double bed and very modern and warm. I loved it! The bathroom was compact yet absolutely sufficient. I was advised that there are complimentary items in the fridge which will be replaced daily. There was the following:Wine, croissants, water, fruit juice, tea and coffee, cream and pots and pans in the cupboard. I was seriously amazed as Villa Rose is so affordable. One day I was talking to the lady on reception and there was a big bowl of sweets, I asked if I could take one and she obliged. When I came back that evening, there was a personalised note thanking me for my custom along with a bowl of these sweets! Such a nice personal touch. It's a great location, walking distance to Fira, however, I hire a quad bike. So much easier to get around and park. Stay here! You won't be disappointed :) Thank you for such a lovely stay.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was first class, the room, the staff, the swimming pool and spa, the breakfasts suplied to our fridge everyday, the transfers,the position this was the most spotless hotel we have everstayed in .We have no hesitation in recommending Villla Rose for the pefect holiday in Santorini.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights to attend a friends wedding and a short holiday. The place was all I could ask for, clean, very friendly and helpful staff, nice decor, they keep the fridge stocked with water, juices ect.The location is perfect, just short walk from Fira centre. You don't get a good view from your room but just 1-2 mins away is the breathtaking caldera view.I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful place and lovely hosts, they were so accommodating. Picked us up from the port, had a welcome drink and snacks ready, our room was lovely and tidy and air conditioning was a plus as it was 35deg most days! An outdoor pool with sun soaking area as well as an area to sit and relax undercover. We stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment, the fridge was stocked with goodies which was so lovely. They allowed us to leave our luggage there as our boat wasn't leaving until later and even dropped us off at port when we were ready. Very kind. Very close to town centre to get food, or do a bit of shopping. Hire a 4 wheeler and hit the road to some of the gorgeous beach settings they have around! MUST DO - Boat trip, Villa rose can organize day boat trips, i HIGHLY recommend this, we went on a boat trip the food and alcohol was all included in the cost and it was the highlight of our trip, amazing scenery, delicious food and GREAT service. Dont miss out on this you will regret it!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here while in Santorini. The place is located in a good location. You are 5 minutes walking to the Caldera as well as close to a bakery, market, etc. You are also very close to the main street in Fira. Not only is the place in a good location. The staff is absolutely wonderful. They are extremely kind and nice people and they really want you to enjoy your stay. The rooms are also nicely decorated and very clean. The place is very peaceful and we always felt relaxed. I would recommend VIlla Rose to everyone!!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The accommodation does not overlook the sea or looking impressive from the outside but, step through the gates and it then becomes fantastic. Maria the host is extremely friendly and helpful. She spent time explaining tourist ideas, location of restaraunts etc. She then took us to our room which was a Studio apartment. This comprised a good sized bedroom and bathroom with a well equiped kitchenette. There is a small balcony on one side and outside a shared patio. The room is quiet, clean and comfortable. Downstairs there is a very nice pool with table and chairs and lounges. It is a great area to relax in. Wifi is also provided.What puts this place above others is the extras provided free. The small carafe of wine, water, juice, apples and other food for breakfast. Muffins with the coffee, peanuts and soft drinks around the pool.Another bonus is the free airport shuttle. Maria could not be more generous in making the stay memorable.Villa Rose is located on the main road. There are plenty of cafes and restaraunts in easy walking distance. The city centre with its maze of alley ways crowded with shops is a 10min walk, as is the main bus station.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely loved my stay at the Villa Rose. The family who runs the hotel could not have been more lovely or helpful. My room was gorgeous and was a treat to relax in. I loved having breakfast, fruit and wine stored in my room. The location was perfect for getting to restaurants and shops in Fira. It was a bit chilly to use the pool for me in November, but it looked inviting. I highly recommend the Villa Rose.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed in this inn during 4 nights mid-November. Villa Rose is a family business and the staff was very welcoming from the get go. They picked us up free of charge at the airport. Upon arrival at the inn, Maria, the owner, gave us good advice regarding what to do on the island. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The kitchen was filled every day with local products such as Greek yoghurts or biscuits for breakfast. The location is good as it is only 15 minutes from the Caldera, with 2 supermarkets and a bakery nearby. The bus stations are also within walking distance.Overall, I cannot recommend Villa Rose enough. We had an amazing time while staying there.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The host was very friendly, she gave us very good advices about restaurant or trip planning. And even help us to bargain with the car rental. The location is not far from main area, it is good to have a swimming pool when you just want to relax. A cozy and comfortable room to stay.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelled to Santorini for family wedding with part of our family staying at Villa Rose occupying 5 rooms. Staff were brilliant and couldn't do enough for us with all rooms being spotless with fridge topped up every day with water, juice, milk, cheese etc. Free transfers to and from airport provided with them doing 2 runs for us due to size of party and with us having family who struggle with mobility they were only too happy to drive them when needed. Santorini is a stunning island with Villa Rose being a Gem, can honestly say have never stayed in a holiday hotel or apartment where the owners and staff have done more for us than at Villa Rose, would highly recommend.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I visited Santorini for the first time, and although our hotel was not at the caldera view, it's centrally located, a 5 min walk to everything you need, and the hospitality of this family run hotel is outstanding! Our room was spotless and the mini fridge full. We have never met such wonderful people and we will be going back again this summer. Kiriaki, the daughter of the owners helped us navigate the island and recommended some of the restaurants, where we enjoyed amazing food. She reserved for us, got us a car delivered to our hotel, and made our stay unforgettable. Not that Santorini is forgettable, but where u stay can make or brake a vacation. I highly recommend this hotel, it's rating on trip advisor is very accurate!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Rose was great,the place was clean!There was food in the refrigerator every day-with something extra like cake or wine.The service was superb,by the pool there was always a dry towel on the sunbed.Here we felt like part of the family.Our lastnite here they gave us a bottle of wine to enjoy.Free transport to the airport and port which is fantastic in Santorini.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay here. The room was really well decorated and perfectly clean. The shower was amazing!! The owners are the nicest most friendly people ever!! The pool is really small, just for dipping and cooling off from the sun - perfect for what we needed! I would highly recommend this hotel for couples.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights as a couple. From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't do enough. They were so helpful and even helped us book a private yacht cruise, which was amazing. The rooms were spotlessly clean, the fridge was well stocked for breakfast in bed and the pool area was quiet. The short walk from fira centre was ideal for us. Thank you Villa Rose!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is just fantastic, super clean rooms with all and more than what you need during your stay. great location in Thira with few minutes walking to the main bus station and beautiful alleys of Thira. Lovely family who runs this place are very much friendly and helpful. We stayed there for only one night but we already missed vila rose.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good value, good service, nice, clean room as well. Owner is super friendly, she gave us fresh orange juice & ice cream when we checked in. That was Amazing! Never expects that!! And also breakfast inside the fridge. Free Fruits and their local wine too! Highly recommend!!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfect 5 days, amazing location-beautiful 2 minute walk to the capital and large supermarket, restocks fridge with great breakfast food, pool was small but didn't need to be any bigger. An affordable stay, family-run being attentive to all needs required, throughly recommend to everyone.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the best part of Fira, Villa Rose is close to the Market Square and yet not too busy. All the shops and eateries are nearby. That is only the locational advantage of Villa Rose.The personal touches are the key contributors to our most pleasant of stays in any holiday rental. We were picked up at the airport. We were very throughly checked-in, ie provided with all the necessary information that will make our stay the best we could expect. From being picked up at the ferry terminal, to car-rentals, to dinner-reservations, we felt llike we had our personal conceirge. No need to worry about anything at all.The studio we had was most comfortable and well-provisioned. From toiletries to a very well-stocked refrigerator. We had juices, breakfast, fruits, mineral water and even a daily half-carafe of white Grecian wine. While we had to cook/prepare our breakfasts, it was easy-peasy, as all the necessary provisions are there. Everything!Each day, the studio was turned-over, Fresh towels, fresh stocks in the fridge and the half-carafe of wine. Even your stuff that has been thrown around would have been properly tidied. It's like having your invisible butler.We had a car arranged and we take short trips around the island. Each time we pop back into our studio, we feel right at home and taken care of.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maria and her family were INCREDIBLE. We were picked up from the port when we arrived by ferry, and when we arrived we received orange juice and butter cakes and cookies, while they prepared our room and allowed us to check-in early. Maria recommended so much to us, our entire Santorini trip was organized based on her recommendations and they were PERFECT. Maria was ready to answer any questions we had, and is really the nicest host we've ever met! Highly recommended to stay here plus the 2-bedroom apartment we booked was lovely and very comfortable, which included a fridge full of supplies free of charge! Location wise it is perfect as it is within walking distance to Fira center and the old port! Thank you for the wonderful stay Villa Rose!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying at the Villa Rose, the owners were so helpful, couldn't do enough for you! Helped us arrange day trips, full of local info. We had free transfers to and from the airport. When we were sitting by the pool we were offered drinks and they brought out nibbles. The room was a bit small but the whole place was immaculate! Clean towels and sheets every day! Nice central location and seriously comfortable beds! Would highly recommend!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at Villa Rose. The apartments are run by a very kind family, they provided us with recommendations on what to do every day. The accommodation is clean, near the city center, spacious and nicely decorated.The owner even provided airport transfer which was a pleasant (and useful!) addition to the stay.I hope you have a great time as we did while staying at Vila Rose :)
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived to Santorini by boat (hellenic Seaways) and got a car from Nomikos, a Car Rental at the harbor which makes it easier to drop off when i'm returning to the harbor for my return trip. There are alot of car rentals but this one had the cheapest prices around €30 per day. They gave me a map showing where my hotel was and attractions. Maria, hotel owner, was at the reception greeted us and showed us some really nice places to go to. Very nice lady who also runs the place. Rooms were nice, clean, fresh and cozy. We had a basket of fruit, muffins and a bottle of wine when we entered the room! Had a kitchen and a fridge and an extra sofa-bed. Breakfast was Stored for us in the fridge. Everything in the room is neat, clean and beautiful touches all around. The bathroom is spacious with plenty of fresh towels. Great place. Would add a breakfast buffet and it would be just perfect all around. Will definately stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OMG! These guys there so kind, lovely hostel, very central, you find every things you need just half a mile around.Maria and all the staff the make you feel better than in home.They pick up u and drop u even in the airport or the port.Beautiful rooms, nice, tidy and clean. Super recommended!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in villa rose and i have to say it was better than the pictures and what we expected.. its pretty beyond words.. our studio was beautiful and came with a well stocked fridge with yogurt and bakery goods..juice and fruits..Maria was really sweet and made sure we had a comfortable stay and gave us a map with all the information as to where to go etc..the only thng lacking was the wifi was extremely slow..which wasnt that much of a problem since we wr out all day..other than that this place is amazing..the main bus terminal of fira is harldy 200 mtrs.. theres cafes and restaurants at walking distamce..maria even arranged a free transfer for us till the port..her father drove us himself all the way there..a cab wldv charged 15 - 20euros for it..so yeah really satisfied and definitely coming back here again..
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 從Check in時，民宿主人Kikki就十分熱情的介紹民宿周圍的環境和Santorini的景點，對剛到Fira的我們有很大的幫助，房間裡則提供了白酒、果汁、水、點心、水果、果醬、優格等，全部免費！十分豐富而且一點都不小氣，每天房間打掃時都會再補滿，從未待過如此親切的民宿，即使是五星級飯店也未曾有這麼棒的驚喜！房間也十分乾淨且每天都會整理，空間可以攤開兩件大行李還綽綽有餘，而且即使只是在游泳池邊曬太陽也有貼心的小驚喜！Villa Rose實在太棒了! 唯一會讓我們擔心的是下次來怕訂不到房間Dear Kikki, the only thing we hope to be improved is the Wifi. Wifi signal is good in our room, but the speed is unstable. Otherwise we are very satisfied during our stay! Hope to see you again!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I have just enjoyed what can only be described as a truly magical, exceptional holiday at the beautiful Villa Rose. My mum found this hotel online for us and I am so glad she did as Maria and her family are the most kind, welcoming, genuine hosts we have ever encountered. From the moment we arrived we knew this was a special place. Maria's husband was waiting for us at the airport and when we arrived at Villa Rose Maria gave us lots of invaluable information about Santorini, the local area and hotel facilities. Our room was beautifully decorated -bright & airy with a little kitchenette and very modern bathroom. We loved the power shower! One of the nicest touches and unexpected surprises was lots of goodies in the fridge everyday including orange juice, croissants, Greek yogurts and tea/coffee etc. We couldn't believe it when we came back each evening to find a basket of treats waiting for us ranging from delicious chocolate muffins to sweets and fresh fruit. I haven't experienced this kind of thing even in 5* hotels. It was so lovely and made you feel really special. Villa rose is in a perfect location - 10 minutes walk to central Fira with plenty of shops, restaurants and a fantastic bakery very close by. The pool area looks lovely although we never used it because we were out exploring most days and the hotel features all mod cons such as air conditioning, wifi and television. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - if you want to experience authentic Greek hospitality, enjoy bright & beautifully decorated rooms in an excellent location do not hesitate to book Villa Rose - you will not regret it. We cannot wait to return! Thank you to Maria, her husband and daughter for making our stay so very special. A beautiful gem in the heart of Santorini!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shah challenges anyone to find a friendlier family than Nikos, Maria, and their ever-smiling daughter, Kiki. They will take you in like family and make sure you have the best time possible in Santorini.This is a modest family-run inn with apartments and suites located about a ten-minute walk to the start of the Thira plaza and town centre. Nikos will pick you up and drop you to the airport at any time of day and night (Shah has no idea how he does it). Just make sure you give your arrival details when making the booking. For people on a budget, this is the perfect choice to have a very clean (actually, immaculate) room with all the conveniences of truly personalized service.So why did Shah not give it his coveted five-star rating? A couple of reasons. Shah booked two rooms and although the place was relatively empty, he did not get the quality of rooms promised on the phone when the booking was made for the special occasion of his visit. One of the rooms was at the front where it gets quite noisy because of the road nearby. But that's ok because Shah can sleep through anything.It was the other room that was a problem where the shower just didn't work. Shah believes it's important to wash oneself daily, especially while working up a sweat walking around the hilly streets of this unbelievably beautiful island. Even though the plumbing could not be fixed, given the relative vacancy of the place in early May, a room change should have been offered.Having said all that, it is certainly true that this is a very warm, friendly, and well-run place. Shah would come here again for sure, and his many fans should consider this when visiting Santorini. You won't get a view, but you also won't empty your wallet.Shah says: Rent a car from any of the places nearby (or ask Kiki) and go around the island on your own. If you get lost, then get a brain scan after your return. Rentals are quite inexpensive. Visit Red Beach (for sure), the lighthouse (for sure), Akrotiri (if you have time to visit the castle there), and do not miss Oia. Thira (Fira) is very nice, but Oia (Ia) is spectacular. Walk to the Oia castle to take that iconic picture.Shah's tip: When making a reservation, ask for a room toward the back of the hotel and away from the road. Unless you like the noise of traffic. Young men on their motorcycles like to make their Greek masculinity known quite early in the morning.Complementary extra tip: Although you will find some edible things in the fridge for the morning, just walk up the road (toward the city centre) and you will find a nice little bakery on the left, just past the gas station. It's about 200 m from the hotel. It opens early. You will get great coffee and a wide assortment of thingies to cause instant hyperglycemia.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my family for three days. Maria (the host) and her family helped us with everything we need and updated the room for free to make our stay more comfortable. Amazing experience makes us feel like home!
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decided to stay away from the pricey caldera view rooms this visit to Santorini. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the apartments and how beautifully they were decorated. The service was excellent and as a woman travelling alone I felt safe and cared for. This family owned and run hotel is a gem! Will definitely stay at Villa Rose when in Santorini again.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing value, paid £50 per night for 4 nights in winter. They restock the fridge for free with breakfast foods every day. Amazing hospitality lovely family. Book here now I cannot recommend this place highly enough. 2 min walk to city center
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely short stay at this hotel. Exceptional hospitality- everything was taken care of- from our pick up and drop to breakfast and little touches here and there. Extremely clean and tidy place as well. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
12    Villa Rose
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The moment you check in you feel very welcome. I got to the hotel @ 4am and Stelios was waiting for me and let me rest in another room while mine was ready for check in. Stelios and his mom went out their way to accommodate me with everything I need it. The location is 20 min walking to Perrisa beach. Supermarket, small restaurant and coffee place are around the corner. I definitely recommend staying here. I would a 10 instead of 5 stars.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely warm welcome from Stelios when we arrived at Mandilaria Studios. The apartment was a great value place to stay when we spent a week in Santorini. The beaches and cafes of Perissa are a few minutes away by car, and Fira and other villages easily accessible from this location. Stelios gave us some good advice and information about the island without pushing trips or selling which we really appreciated. The room was a ground floor budget studio, and, to this end was basic but provided all we needed for our week. The main thing is, it was fresh and clean, with a good sized hot shower, fridge to keep the drinks chilled, ample parking and good WiFi connection too. A supermarket, with keen prices, is a two minute walk from the studios. Good for cheese and all the basics - though we did tend to eat out with so many restaurants and cafes over the island. Based on the ground floor, we could sit on the verandah facing the front garden, see a little sea and the mountain. One of the best things is the pool, which by Santorini standards, is a good size and private to the studios. We had the pool to ourselves nearly every time we swam and could dry off under the parasols and sun loungers. We would definitely recommend as a good value base for a holiday on this beautiful island.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff: was ever present and attentive to our every need. Very accommodating(we arrived late (2200ish) and were met with smile, given brief overview then taken to room. Were attending wedding and needed iron & hair dryer(one can only "pack" so much)..wasn't a problem.Room Amenities:Internet is free. AC was good. small refrigerator,TV w/a dozen channels(2 with english programming). Cleaned daily. Cooking utensils ,Hot plate & electric kettle provided. You WILL need a transformer(we found a great one on Amazon -small&inexpensive)Hotel Amenities: smaller size pool (maybe 10'x20') w/outdoor shower, WC & Bar & 14 lounge chairs(perfect for relaxing after day of sight seeing).Pool doesn't close if you keep the roar/volume down.You can rent ATVs and book some excursions here(DEFINITELY plan ahead)Location: Emporior(Car to get around would be ideal) since there are literally less that 40 taxis for an Island of 25K people(w/influx of people from 1-4 cruse ships almost daily). BEACH is about a mile away and water is crystal clear. No litter on beach. Para sailing(30euro),wave boards,Jet skiing(40euro/10mins) and plenty of places to eat/drinkWeather: Mid 60's(night)-upper 80's(day), light breeses. Few clouds. Zero rain.Local conveniences: there's a small grocery market(reasonably well stocked)maybe 50-75yards down street and fast food place(Great food) next to it.Couple of bakeries and other places to eat/shop within easy walking distance.Gas station maybe .5miles away.I'm sure you can pay more and get less but this place was great, just great for the price
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week during a recent trip to Santorini. About 2km from the sea front (15-20 mins walk) and about 500 meters from the Emporio to Perissa main road with the supermarket on the corner. Agreed not in the busiest place, but certainly a lot lower priced than many, well located and quiet. Like a good number of guests in Santorini, we hired a quad making everywhere accessible in a few minutes. The studios are very clean and equipped with fridge, kettle and two ring hob, ample crockery etc. Nice balcony to the rooms with moderate sea views. Fair sized pool which is discreet and secluded (unlike many that we saw) Hotel staff are exceptionally helpful, happy to arrange transfers (cheaper than elsewhere), trips, car hire and anything else you want. Highly recommended
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week at Mandilaria Studios with my girlfriend this summer.Everything from arranging a taxi to pick us up at the airport at 4 in the morning, to greeting us as we arrived 20-30 minutes later, and preparing us a fine breakfast, very early in the morning.As we had a small fridge and some pots and pans in our room, we used the supermarket, that was right around the corner (2 minute walk), to have some breakfast ready and a few bottles of wine.We borrowed a few wine glasses and an icetray from the owner, who was also happy to help us with anything we needed.The helped us rent a quadbike to ride around on, and took their time to explain us the good places to go and how to best navigate around the island.Overall exceptional service and a great experience to stay here.Though I usually would not want to live in the same place twice, if I travel to the same country, I would definetely choose to live at Mandilaria Studios again, next time I go to Santorini - Which I definetely will, because the experience was amazing and I could easily spend another week of my life on this island.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The complex is hidden from noisy street so you can enjoy quiet moment on the balcony or by the pool. We felt very welcomed there and the guy was always very happy to help us or provide any information we needed. We were allowed to check-out later from the room and it was very helpful for us. Rooms are nice and clean. Area around pool is small paradise. Lot of parking space by the house. I wish we could stay there longer.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here while visiting Santorini, very happy with our stay! The service was great, we were provided with pocket maps of the island and local area, and given suggestions on tourist attraction etc. when we arrived. Our split-level apartment was self-catered with a small, equipped kitchen (pots, pans, cutlery, dishes, hob, fridge), spacious with the bedroom upstairs and the living area opening onto a small but lovely balcony with a table and two chairs and a sea view. The apartment is cleaned daily with fresh linen and towels provided. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to Perivolos & Perissa beaches where there's loads of restaurants, little shops and pubs to choose from. There is a local supermarket about a 2 minute walk away which was great for us, as we prepared some meals ourselves. Opposite this supermarket, you'll find the bus stop which goes to Thira (the main city of the island) where you can get links to Oia, Akrotiri/Red Beach and the Airport/Port for about 2.30 euros pp each way. It has a relatively quiet swimming pool at the back with deck chairs, umbrellas and tables, meaning you actually have a chance of getting in some sun bathing and swimming! I would definitely recommend this accommodation to anyone thinking of visiting the island and could see myself checking in again!
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy with our stay in Mandilaria Studios. The room was clean, with a fridge and everything you need to cook. We had a terrace very sunny where we ate breakfast and it was really nice. The pool was great, with sunbelts and parasols. The service was great, people were very nice and did everything to help us. The location is very nice, 5 minutes from the beach and very quiet. We rent a car and we've been in different places such as the Red Beach, Thira in 20 minutes approximately (more to go to Oia)We strongly recomand you this hotel where we had a really good stay, we don't regret our choice !
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: lovely apartment complex. owners were very friendly and helpful - arranged airport transfers to make arrival easy and stress free. apartment was a good size with a very comfy bed, free a/c and wifi, and a lovely little balcony with table and chairs. little kitchenette had all the utensils you would need and clean bathroom. wifi signal was not great in the apartment but worked well by reception / pool area. pool area was very clean and nice. location was a little remote, 20 min walk to the beach but there was a bus. supermarket right opposite the hotel which was ideal. hire a car / quad if you want to explore the island. great stay, at a good price, cannot find fault.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed 4 nights in one of the apartments of Mandilaria Studios. The apartment is a good choice for couples. There is no breakfast and special service offered, but the owners are nice, they speak good English. They've organized airport transfer for us as well. In the backyard there're two pools, one for swimming, sunbathing and one for kids. The backyard is great for relaxation. The beach is cca. 20 minutes walk from the apartment, the nearest supermarket is 100 m far. You can easily rent a quad, that's used for short rides around the island. The room was clean and newly furnished, the balcony was nice with two chairs and a table. Worth the money, recommended.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (I and my husband) have been staying at this lovely studios for 14 nights and really didn't want to leave. The studios are clean, pool is also thoroughly cleaned frequently. The room was pretty airy, with a fully-equipped kitchenette, quiet air-conditioner. Linen and towels changed daily. The owners (all members of family running this studios) were very friendly, helpful and extremely supportive. They work tirelessly to make sure their guests are happy and nothing is too much trouble for this charming people. We arrived early in the morning (about 7 AM) and they were waiting for us! The room was completely ready! We were also given a bottle of wine, fresh home pastries. And during our holidays sometimes we received fruits, vegetables from their garden. For us location of Mandilaria studios was perfect: it’s not near cafes, restaurants, discotheques, next to Carrefur shop where we could buy fresh food for our breakfasts, lunches and dinners. We hired a car for 2 weeks and explored beautiful Santorini. Every day we visited different places of this unforgettable island. I and my husband would like to thank the owners of the Mandilaria Studios for our perfect holydays. We hope that they make a success of the studios, because they are working hard at it, and wish them luck and prosperity!
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was a real gem, a little bit out from the beach and bars but really good value. Stelios and his team were really welcoming and nothing was too much travel. I would highly recommend Mandilaria Studios to anyone going to Santorini
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Management and staff were very friendly making our stay pleasant and welcoming. Nice rooms cleaned regularly, very refreshing and clean swimming pool, in quite location but close to a supermarket and family tavern. A bit further away from the beach that I thought, but you had the chance to visit on the way the news agent, the 24-7 bakery shop and so many more. Definitely recommended. Demetris
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This sweet little hotel was very good value for the price (19 Euro for a single room, during high season). It is located away from the main Perivolos beach, but you can walk to the beach in about 20 minutes, or there is a local bus at the corner that goes right to the beach.My room was bright and cheery, and had its own kitchenette. The wifi and air conditioning both worked well. Though I didn't use the balcony, it had a cute little table and chair set, and a clothesline to hang wet swimming gear. I also didn't use the pool, but it looked very clean, and there were beach chairs, umbrellas, and nice landscaping around its perimeter.The staff members I interacted with were friendly and polite.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was really great! The rooms were really nice and we got a room with a mezzanine so it was nice and spacious, and cool! The balcony was a great size and we even ate in one night watching the the great view that we had. The bathroom was really nice, but the shower was a bit of a drip (literally). The pool is a great size and in a great spot so we got the sun all day! The owners are really nice and friendly and took us to and from the port for a small charge.HOWEVER (and this isn't really a 'but' because of the hotel) but it isn't in the best location if you wanted to be close to the main towns of Oía and Thira...which were quite a bus ride away (there wasn't much around the hotel but we were only in Santorini for 4 nights so we didn't actually venture to the main part of Perivolos)
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week in 2012 in a splitlevel studio apartment....it was brilliant. You would not find nicer ro more helpful hosts. It is a couple of km from the beach but if you have a car or bike its all good. Facilities on site are excellent, much superior to most places I have stayed on the island. The fact that you have a top supermarket a hundred metres away means that you can choose to eat in whenever you wish. I will definitely stay there again...great value for money and a very pleasant experience.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights in September 2013 and found the Studios were fine for people wanting budget accommodation and don't mind being 20 mins walk to Perissa. I had the pool to myself and Stelios opened the bar just for me and let me put my music on the pool sound system. They couldn't do enough for you-but this seems to be a Santorini trait- He even took me in his car to my next port of call in Perissa. so if you're on a strict budget this place is just what you need
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The proprietor is a very nice woman, though she speaks no English (but I spoke enough Greek to communicate with her fluently). But her husband speaks very basic English, and they collaborate with an Athens-based agent who speaks multiple languages.The rooms and pool are nice. Note that the adjacent small pool by the big pool is a kiddie pool, not a hot tub.The garden in the front is tended by the proprietors and has some local vegetables when in season. It's quite lovely. The hotel is a bit hard to find, as most hotels on the islands (due to GPS not working right, streets missing name plates, etc.). It's near a main road (hence a little noisy), but not on the main road, and there is a large sign on the hotel with its name facing that road -- be on the lookout, and you will find it... eventually.When I was there, some neighborhood kids had street races going on with their vespas/scooters/motorbikes in the afternoon, and that was very noisy, but this was probably a one-off event and only lasted a couple of hours.In general, our stay was very pleasant... high overall value, nice people, and we didn't want to be near the beach and the associated all-day-long-noise from people, bars, etc.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean and well-built studios driven by a very kind and helpful family. All rooms have nice and private balcony. Studios are located away from noisy areas in Perissa, very close to busstop and supermarket. If you want to avoid crowded areas, I strongly recommed this studio.  Walking tours can be made by fairly quiet roads and tracks to Vlycladia, Emperior and Pyrgos. Ask the host for directions or check it on google maps.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and me stayed in September 2011 in Mandilaria studios on Santorini and we had a great experience! The studio was nice and comfortable, with balcony and see view. When you book a studio you should specify whether you want a double or tween bad, because we first got a twin bed and then we had to change the room. Actually we changed for the better room at the same price, but in hot season it can be a problem. The family which owns tha place is very nice. The minus is that the road to the beach is not so nice, if you have a transport it is not a problem, but if you have to walk on the side of the street with the cars - this is not so great.In general, we enjoyned our staying and can recommend this place.
hotelName:
13    Mandilaria Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel through Booking.com. We did not know until we arrived that there were steps up to the hotel reception and EVERY room had steps to get to them. There was NO elevator. We were never made aware that the room was not accessible to those with walking difficulties..However, we did stay there but access to our room was very difficulty as I do have walking difficulties. Mathias, the owner, offered to give us our money back, but as it was peak season, and mid afternoon the chances of finding alternative rooms was low. We felt we had to stay.. In our opinion this is not a "true" hotel. There were no phones in the rooms, the bar closed at 9.00pm, there was no option to eat there except for bar snacks (which close at 9.00pm)..It would be better to describe it as a B & B .. with a snack bar. However, the rooms are lovely, the bathrooms are great, and the views are nothing less than stupendous...Mathias described the hotel to us as a quite place, but children were running around and quite noisy.. A lovely place to stay with great views and fabulous location... but Oh.. those steps..!!..
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mathios is a great host who arranged everything for us.The pickup from the ferry port was flawless.The rooms were quiet, clean, comfortable and ours were on the top floor so they were secluded.We had plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from.The delivery to the airport was great.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is by the beach and 5-10 mins walk to popular red beach. Thing i like about this hotel is the bus stop is just right in front of the hotel but it is not make crowded to the hotel. If you dont plan to rent a vehicle you would be grateful for the bus stop. The room is clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast are good. The owner (I presumed he is) is very kind and helpful. He helped explain about the island and overall question we may have. He even allowed us to check out late when there is no guests waiting for check in after us. The terrace they provide are great place to sit and read your book or even check your phone or laptop where its required internet. For me in my room has a very weak internet signal but it wont bother much as i can catch it on the terrace of my room. Overall this hotel is very nice and just for information if you take a taxi from the airport it cost us 35 euros. If not i think you can take a bus to Fira and then from Fira ask for the bus that goes to Akrotiri and it should cost you around 4 euro/ person. I m not sure about the price of the bus from airport to Fira but normal bus price is 2 euro / trip. Also if you stay here we recommend the popular restaurant name the cave of nikolas that is just less than 5 mins walk by the beach from this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't stay at this hotel during our recent visit so cannot comment on the hotel itself.However, we visited Akrotiri 3 x times over a period of 12 days and enjoyed drinks and snacks sitting on the terrace overlooking the sea.Prices for drinks and snacks were much more reasonable than Fira & Oia
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the dream Greek island hotel, a haven of peace in an island that can be too popular for its own good. The Akrotiri hotel is in the south, a family run small hotel in the Cycladic style, simple and beautiful, with a lovely view of the Aegean. Sunbeds, shaded terraces, thoughtful touches like a clothes airer on the terrace, all lift it into a much higher class than the price suggests. The location is right on the sea, with lapping waves on a tiny beach below the terraces. It's in the south of the island, which is quiet - even the small southern beaches aren't crazy. The hotel is right by a run of great tavernas on the seafront, and the taxi boats to the beaches stop right there. It is also by the bus stop that will take you to anywhere else you want to go for a few euros - and on Santorini a bus is almost a luxury coach with air-con. And you can walk to the great archaeological stie - 2 minutes up the road. The owner is the model of Greek hospitality. We really loved staying here.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there from 2-13 July 2018 and it is one of the most beautiful places we ever been. The owner is one of the best host I have encountered. From our arrival until our departure he was very respectful and helping everybody that stayed at the hotel. When in Santorini, you dont have to look much. This is the place to be. I give Mathias and his hotel A++++++++ across the board. Once you stay you do not want to go because there is so many things to do. Prices are modest and the quality of the food is superb. Looking forward to go next year God willing. Highly recommended!!!Joseph Morales
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a gem in a remote area away from crowds. It is great for relaxation and honeymooners. The area is not as crowded as the capital and yet they offer so many things. The local bus comes by every half hour to take you to the capital Fira. The Red, White and Black beach are accessible with only 10 euros. The excavation sites are also accesible with just 12 euros or 14 if you want to go to all five sites. The place is amazing.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our first experience of Santorini here. The views of the sea and boats moored are just beautiful. So quiet and peaceful here. The nearby restaurants are delightful. Very nice owner who helped us organise a rental car and gave us lots of local information. Breakfast is simple and nice and you can take it to your own patio if you want. My only recommendation is softer mattress and upgrade the shower. We would happily return here.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed this place, the view was amazing. I could see out onto the water, the air was crisp and clean. My room was amazing, I had my own little patio and it was perfectly safe sleeping with my window open at night. The wifi works pretty good. I was only steps away from several good restaurants, the bus stop and a museum. The host, Mr Mathios was the most personable, kind and helpful person. He was extremely accommodating and gave me directions to many places I wanted to go.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, you can spend much more money to stay in Santorini, but why would you? This little gem of a hotel is off the beaten tourist path and right on the water with private balconies and great views. It is also close to Red Beach, with €10 ferries to White Beach and Black Beach running all day long. Great food is a few steps away at the Cave of Nikolas.The owner, Mathios, and his family are so welcoming and will take extraordinarily effort to make sure you are comfortable and well oriented to the island.Also there is a bus stop right beside the hotel that you can use to get anywhere and back on the island for a few Euros.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Akrotiri hotel is an absolutely beautiful hotel right on the beach in Akrotiri. The location is perfect, very calm and yet with several nice restaurants along the beach. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel if you want to see the island of Santorini. The rooms are very clean, all with sea view and you can hear the waves in the night! Highly recommended!
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thankyou so much to matios and his hard working family .we stayed here for 14 nights for my 50th birthday . We did everything on our bucket list from this hotel thira .oia light house. Best views from this side of island . lovely restaurants near waters edge chilled out days in between sight seeing . hotel is so clean and pretty .next door arcological site . but in 14 days did not have time so will have to return .I never write reviews .but this hotel was worth the time  Thanks Jayne n Carl UK
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If your looking for a perfect little cozy spot to stay in Akrotiri Santorini, Akrotiri hotel is the spot. Not only is it amazingly affordable and right on the beach, it has the best location for Red sand beach and the Ancient city of Akrotiri. The owner was very friendly and helpful and made some great recommendations for dinner. The wi-fi was very good, which can obviously be very important when traveling. Would definitely stay here again..If you visit ask the owner to blow out of his conk shell!!!! hahaha
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a gem of a place. Absolutely beautiful location with a small beach attached. The snack bar is a nice place to hang for some basic refreshments and the wifi reached as far as our room (#2). The breakfast was good, with the thickest and yummiest Greek yogurt we had on our trip.We stayed in Akrotiri to be close to the archaeological site and its a great choice. There are buses every 20 mins to Fira which takes 20 mins so a great base to see the whole Island if you are without a car. From the pier 2 mins from the hotel you can take a boat for just 5 euros. It's a hop on hop off service to the red, white and black beaches.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been there for 1 week with my girlfrend. Rooms are nice and pretty. We really enjoyed our time there. You have a nice area just out of your door with table and comfortable chairs where you can be relaxed. Breakfast is absolutely amazing: they changed hot buffet food eversivo day, and breakfast location is amazing. Thanks to all the Hotel staff for your kindness. Keep working like this! Francesco&Silvia
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's nice hotel. Had sea view room. Best option to reach is using shuttle/taxi as Bus will take 1.5hrs from airport. Approx cost of shuttle 30 Euro for 2. Only problem with this location is it's exactly on opposite side of Oia(23km to be precise). Also hotel doesn't get you any special rate on rentals. Breakfast was OK. Wifi doesn't have range in rooms so thats big problem
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didn't stay at the hotel but their cafe is pretty sweet. Had a tea and ordered a waffle to accompany the breathtaking views of the ocean. Both were fantastic. There is a public bus stop right beside here where to can get to/from Fira. WiFi is offered but its flaky.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was wonderful! We were treated like family. The room was quiet with a great view (at the top of the stairs!). The location was just what we were looking for--right on the beach, near the archeological dig, convenient transportation. Excellent breakfast at the hotel and great restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely quiet traditional hotel, one of first in Santorini. So pretty - little whitewashed buildings with domed roofs, arches, steps, bougainvilia & shady terraces tumbling down hillside. Little beach at bottom - but v few people - with sunbeds / brollies, lovely clear water. Rocky / pebbly so beach shoes useful. Not posh or luxurious but clean and decent sized rooms, fab aircon. Lovely quiet little bay with several tavernas at water's edge. Good bus service to Akrotiri and Fera. Helpful friendly owner - son of man who started it. All in all a real treasuure.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed on this side of the island because it was closer to a wedding we were attending but we loved it. Beautiful view, good breakfast, and clean rooms w/ air con. Close to nice restaurants, ATV rental and the red beach. Bus runs very regularly to get you to and from Fira
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a few nights before our trip to Milos. Room was fine with air-con (included in the price) and faciilities for making tea, but not much else. Mathias and family were very obliging. Location was the best thing - next to Akrotiri excavation (well worth a visit) - but peaceful at night. A row of tavernas to choose from. Beaches are a good walk away - Red, White one way, Vlychada the other - the latter a longer walk + paddle along the beach but stunning scenery and a lovely (if a bit expensive and trendy) beach bar. Much nicer than staying in the hurly-burly of Oia and much better value. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the first hotels bult on Santorini. It has great charm and interesting multi-layered architecture. We (family of 3) enjoyed very much the huge terraces which you find different places at the hotel, all with sea view, tables and sun chairs. Rooms are not huge, but adequate, well-furnished and clean.Not all of the hotel is brand new, but you feel well and welcome here. It's family-owned and people here are very friendly and helful.It has a stony beach with free sun chairs. Close to the hotel there are ferries to the wellknown red, white and black beaches. Nice, but with lots of people as everwhere on Santorini. Also close are some very good restarants with sea view. The best is Nimeli where we ate like we were in heaven.If you go to Fira (recommended for one evening to see the specatular sunset) you have to take a cab back (approx 25 Euro) since there are no buses back in the evening.PS the adjacent archeological escavations are very interesting too
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this charming hotel which is the most convenient on the island for visiting the famous and excellently displayed excavations. The owner Matthew was kindness itself, and made my visit one to remember for comfort, views and general atmosphere of peace and calm. I am an octogenarian travelling alone, but I would recommend it to anyone. It is almost on the beach and there is a bus service to other areas of the island
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed in santorini for a bit short of a week during july. it was an absolutely amazing holiday! the time was just right enough to visit all the main sights and bigger towns.the hotel was also perfect, right on the seaside, very quiet. and you have a different taverna for dinner every night.but bring bug repellent! the mosquitos were viscious!
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only hotel in this quiet location. The hotel owner (whose father built it) showed his consideration from the start by offering me the choice of a room with a view or easy access. He was pleasant, helpful and polite throughout, offering to let me use the room later than the standard check-out time on my last day even without being asked - a very rare courtesy from hoteliers.The room was well equipped and everything worked. The fridge was particularly handy.Nothing disturbed my night's sleep other than the unaccustomed sound of waves on the rocky beach - not ideal for a pre-breakfast swim but serviceable, and in any case several sandier beaches are within a short walk. The breakfast buffet was good and on time, not always the case in Greece.The café has only a limited range, but there are several restaurants along the shore by the hotel and more options in Akrotiri village, a pleasant stroll away. I found the café handy for a beer at sunset by the sea.The Minoan ruins are close by, so it's easy to make an early start before the tourist buses pour in. I shared the ruined town with only three or four other visitors.
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in a great area near the town of Akrotiri with a great view. The hotel is right near the sea ( 1 meter from the sea ). The owners of the hotel are really nice guys, always polite, happy and ready to help you in any case. They are the nicest people I've ever seen. All the rooms are very clean and pretty, there is an air conditioner and a TV set in each room. The area where the hotel is situated are not crowded with tourists and that fact is really great. There are a lot of greek taverns on the beach near the hotel, where you can eat the freashest fish and the traditional greek cousine, one of these taverns, "The caves of Nicolaos" was awarded like the best tavern on Santorini. From the beach near the hotel you can go to Red Beach ( wich is very nice), White Beach and Black Beach ( with the beautiful black voulcanic sand) by boat for 5 euros. Near this hotel is situated "The Prehistoric town of Akrotiri", the museum, the ancient city. You can rent a car or a scooter with the help of the owner of the hotel and travel across the island.I recommend this hotel for everyone who wants to spend a great time on Santorini for a good price :)
hotelName:
14    Akrotiri Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely clean rooms, fabulous location right on the beach, only 15 minutes from the airport. Very polite & friendly staff, great breakfast included in the price as well as free safe, sun beds, beach towels & WiFi. Throughly recommend
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent a few days in Santorini and we had the pleasure to stay at Arion Bay. The place is incredible! A great view being literally facing the beach where the sun rises, a lot of tables to sit and enjoy the sun, a large pool to relax and a bar to grab a drink if you feel like it!The vibe and staff are absolutely fantastic and helpful. We couldn't have asked for a better stay! Super recommended :)
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights. Room very nice. Bed slightly uncomfortable due to being on a concrete base I think. Breakfast offering decent. Nice pool area. Would be nice to get the pool towels changed though as they really did feel grotty towards the end of the week. Also would have been nice to have use of a courtesy shower room for a quick freshen up, as we had a night flight home but when we asked the bar staff, this was not available.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strongly recommend this hotel which we chose with great care, even checking on google earth. Directly off the beach, lovely pool, spotless room and public areas, very full breakfast options included all at a very good rate - any number of hot and cold quality items. We were spoiled for choice around the hotel as Kamari is a very upmarket resort with plenty of dining options and a great base to do Fira and Oia for the sensational caldera views and sunset but also great to visit Perissa, Ancient Thera, Akrotiri and more. We hired a car, absolutely hassle-free, and easily drove everywhere and parked, using our own sat nav. I think bus tours would also be easy. Arion Bay is at the quieter end of the beach, and they offer free sunbeds and towels inside or across on their beach - but be aware the island airport is nearby. This really did not bother us at all. I think Kamari is the best beach area on Santorini.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Arion Bay in Kamari. You are right on the beach and also have an excellent pool and bar area. The rooms are a little small but when you are in such a beautiful place you don't spend that much time in the rooms anyway! The rooms were very clean and the air conditioning worked very well! Our room even had a cute little balcony/patio! The beach was very nice and the resort provides nice little chairs and umbrellas to sit under! Breakfast was very large, delicious and included in your stay! We really enjoyed getting to spend a little time on this side of the island!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We so enjoyed our week at Arion bay. We had a superior sea view room. The room was a good size and had everything we needed. Simply decorated and spotlessly clean. Our door opened on to a small area to sit outside with table and chairs then the pool. Pool, loungers, bar area, breakfast room were all spotlessly clean. Cocktail prices were really reasonable 6.50 Euro. I would also recommend lunch here if you are staying. Fairly basic offering, sandwiches, salads, pizzas etc but reasonable prices and saves having a heavy meal elsewhere. The girls who clean and make breakfasts and lunches are lovely people and really friendly. Elias and Marius on the bar are lovely too. Everybody here was so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Continental selection as well as eggs bacon and sausage. Help yourself service in a relaxed space. Location is fantastic at the quieter end of the prom. Lots of good restaurants and shops in walking distance. Our favourite restaurant was Alismira a 5 minute walk for dinner. We took a taxi to Imerovigli and walked up Fira which made for a great day. We also had a day out on an island tour with nostos travel. We would recommend the tour as very good value for money (approximately 40 Euro booked through trip advisor). The group was large and there were some issues with seating on the coach but so much cheaper than other tours available and we would not have been able to pack so much in to one day ourselves. One comment, it may be worth having an information card in each room with the WiFi password and a copy of the lunch menu as we did not realise food was available other than breakfast until day 6 and had not seen anybody else eating either. All in all Arion Bay offered amazing value for money. We would definitely like to come back to stay again.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was eating lunch at Arion Bay, on the beach and the owners children started throwing rocks at the strays dogs. Horrible to see. Vile little children. Would never eat here again and would not support a business with that attitude towards animals. Avoid this horrible hotel.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We're in the Arion Bay hotel between 07.08.17 and 11.08.17. This hotel was a "dark horse" for us, it was an additional option provided by our touristic agency because we weren't received the reservation approval from another hotel. And the Arion Bay was a correct choice - located on the Black beach in Kamari, customer-friendly stuff, clean room, Wi-Fi which working not only in the hotel, but on the beach too. Breakfast was very good. One small thing - not enough hangers and shelfs in the bathroom. And no TV in the room, but if you're coming to Santorini you don't need the TV :-).
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I visited this hotel again in May 17, we had also been in May 15 and thought it was brilliant. Our second visit was as good as the first time. We were all in the annexe part of the hotel at the Side of Kings Restaurant, it has a small pool at the front, where we had 2 rooms and it also has a jacuzzi pool at the back and further sunbeds and chairs etc and its very quiet. The rooms are specious, exceptionally clean and modern, they have a fridge, air con and a large mirror and well lit (essential for mature ladies getting ready at night!). The beds are comfortable with nice bedding. Everyone who stays there are friendly and of course Elias talks to all of his guest, he is genuinely concerned that his guests enjoy their holiday and always happy to help. We were planning a small surprise party for one of our group and he organised a local bakery to bake and deliver a cake for us, whch was absolutely delicious. There are a number of great restaurants near the hotel if you go left out of the entrance, there are many more if you go right but we found the ones to the left of a better quality for the same prices. The beach is directly in front of the hotel so you can hear the waves lapping as you sit on your balcony (if you have a sea view room). The breakfast is simple but tasty and ranges from Cereals, Fruit, Yoghurts to eggs and bacon etc.The only downside is that The Kings Restaurant next door play their music quite loud during the day (ear plugs!) but you can use their comfortable sunbeds on the beach if you buy a drink from them.I have recommended this hotel to family who are going later this year, I'm sure they will love it.Elias was waiting for some sunbeds to arrive to have on the beach but they had not turned up before we left, will just have to go back and try them out!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came most evenings during our recent holiday. Elias is the perfect host. Loads of improvements made this year. The bar has had a makeover and plans for the beach look amazing! This wonderful hotel is just across from the beach with stunning views.We didn't stay here but all the guests gather at the bar in the evening and they absolutely love it. Elias can talk to all nationalities - as proved when around the bar there were English, German and Greeks - amazing !! It's a lovely place to spend the evening and Elias and Irini are great to be around. Give it a try it's lovely
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: perfect vication !!great staffEIlias is great f... google !!good locationperfect sea shorgreat breakfastvery very cleanwe enjoy very much............. .... .... ...very recomendedgood restorants and goodatmosfir all around
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a last minute booking this was the only available hotel (5/7 – 12/7) and we were absolutely delighted with the result. The Manager, Elia, is an excellent host and is a font of information with regards to restaurants, bars etc – he will also organise booking restaurant tables and taxis too. The hotel is as good as on the beach and breakfast is taken by the pool in view of the breaking waves. Our room was basic (sea view with balcony) but kept spotlessly clean and the air conditioning was quietly efficient. The majority of guests seemed to be returnees, some for as many as the past 15 years, which speaks volumes for Elia and his team. Of an evening, the pool bar has quite a buzz about it and cocktails and shots are distributed with ease and charm. Should we return to Santorini, we would have no hesitation whatsoever in staying here again.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wisited the hotel last week and I was really impressed.Very nice rooms and excellent room keeping. The Hotelis close to the beach and all the restaurants on the beach side.Hotel owners Silias and Irini makes the stay unforgettable.Breakfeast was very good with a lot of choises of hot and cold food.I reccomend this hotel for all, both couples and families.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although we didn't stay at this hotel our daughter, son in law and 2 young children did. The location is fantastic. It's right on the beach front. Their room was superb. Lots of room, clean and very modern and had everything you would need. The pool area is fab and child friendly. Our family were really happy here. The real treat for us is the bar in the evening run by Elias. He's the perfect host and looks after all his customers as if they were friends. Tania who looks after the bar in the day is a lovely, friendly lady.Thank you Irini and Elias for looking after our family so well. See you next year.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with basic accommodations, friendly staff, good enough breakfast, has a front little pool, however the room did not have a TV and the bathroom was small, i did not have enough room to sit on the toilet straight, for example, the shower did not have a curtain or sliding door.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 3rd visit to the arion bay!!was for our wedding in august!!elias and irini are both the perfect hosts looking after everyone!behind the bar elias is a legend!everyone loves him!!the arion bay is just the pefect place to stay and our room has been done up to top standard wiv the best bathroom and shower ever!we are going back for a 4th visit nexr year as we know as always we will have the perfect holiday at the arion bay !what more can anyone ask for !cant wait till next year xx
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is directly at the beach.The room was nice and clean with airco. But best of all is the really nice, helpful, friendly owner.He stood at the bar every night mixing the best cocktails and entertaining his guests. No wonder there were a bunch of guests coming back since years.He also helped us out organising trips. The only drawback of the place is that's it a bit close to the airport and sometimes planes are coming by quite low and therefore loud. But actually in the room we had it was barely recognisable.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was small, but clean. The breakfast was very tasty and economical. Swimming Pool rescued a windy day when the sea could not go. Elias was absolutely great host and a club officer and a very good sense of humor. It is a sea view and 50 inch TV, these we pulled a joke on a daily basis. Very nice holiday and hotel.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had a fantastic time at Arion Bay... Elias is the best... it's a very nice and cozy place with Elias taking care of everything like what to visit, where to eat etc... and of course at the end of the day it was the best place to relax with some nice drinks and music.The rooms are beautiful with nice views and clean... a very nice detail in the room it was the 2 usb ports next to the normal plugs for charging the mobiles... i had with me 2 usb cables but only one usb power adapter, so those usb ports came quite handy :)The breakfast was very good and fresh... When we'll visit again Santorini definitely we're staying at Arion Bay...
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't stay at this hotel but we went for drinks every evening what a lovely friendly place.Elias the barman such a friendly man new what everyone had to drink without you even asking after your first night there.The different nationalities from German to Norwegian to Austrian and English of course ! One night we were like the Eurovision Song Contest there were so many different people there all enjoying early evening drinks with Elias.If you visit Kamari I would recommend you visit Arion Bay for drinks.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We turned up on our honeymoon, and rather than telling our travel operator they were having rooms renovated, they just booked us and hoped they would be ready. We turned up and they said they didn't have enough rooms and sent us to another hotel. My husband brought a beer and sat down to wait like he said, then took it off him without a refund and sent us away in a car to the next hotel. We ended up at Alia hotel. Stay there not here!! Rude. No way to do business. They could of called and given us notice but just didn't bother.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A group of six (mature) ladies stayed here for a week in 5 different rooms. We arrived in the evening and were immediately sorted out with our rooms. Some with sea views and others not, some refurbished and others not. Everything is kept spotlessly clean. Two of the rooms were unrefurbished and basic but they were fine and of a standard we expected in Greece. The other 3 rooms were refurbished, very modern, brilliant showers and bathrooms but could do with a bit more bedside storage. The hotel is in a brilliant spot on the sea front with lots of nice restaurants nearby. The thing that makes this hotel stand out from the crowd are the staff, they are all fabulous and will go beyond the extra mile to ensure you have a wonderful holiday. The owner, Elias speaks to all of the guests to make sure they are happy and one night when one of our party had a bad back rang his cousin and he gave her a lift to the restarant even though it wasn't very far away. We never usually go back to the same place twice but we are going to go back the Arion Bay next year. Kamari is near the airport so you do get planes flying overhead but not too many and we didn't hear any during the night. Next year we will pay extra for the refurbished rooms for all of us as they are much nicer and seem to have better sound proofing, the walls were paper thin in the basic rooms, thankfully our neighbours were mature with no children!! I would recommend ear plugs to anyone in the basic rooms. Breakfast was more than adequate with cereals, bread , jam meat, cheese, sausage slices, bacon eggs etc and a choice of teas, coffee and fruit juices. Possibly the only thing missing was a toaster! Otherwise it was perfect.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our travel agent booked this hotel and was not one her usual choices. She wanted to find something in Fira but every property she generally used was booked. We visited Fira (very convenient by public bus), and were very happy that we were at Arion Bay on the beach! The weather was very warm and so after sight seeing, it was perfect to be able to float in the beautiful blue water and take a dip in the hotel pool. Because the hotel is located near public transportation, we were able to see Fira and IA easily. We walked to the Koutsoyanopoulos Winery and took the nearby "fun train" to Ancient Thira. Also, as everyone mentions, Elias was a wonderful host. He is a very friendly, helpful manager. And although he is very busy at the bar, he always takes the time to answer any and all questions and chat ( he speaks several languages fluently).The room was small but spotlessly clean. There was a folding dryer on the patio so we were able to wash and dry our clothes conveniently. And the buffet breakfast was always fresh and delicious. We feel lucky that we ended up at Arion Bay!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in may 2014 great time. I totally enjoyed my stay here, very relaxing. Elias is a fantastic host and knows how to keep everyone happy each evening in his busy bar. The hotel team inc Nicos were fantastic and brought me an iron from home on my wedding day. If you want to chill out during the day with fantastic beach views or by the pool then this is a great place. Great Value. Breakfast is fresh, Many of the rooms have been refurbished or new and a new outdoor whirl pool was opened in the week we stayed. Top Tip if you do book here ask Elias to advise you on the best way to explore Santorini. We hired a car for 3 days and toured with his map. You will not be disapointed.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have had very nice holidays in Arion Bay. The Romanian Tourism agency which booked the rooms made an error and I have had to sleep, for a night, in another hotel. Ellias, a really kind person, tried to make up my discontentment offering me what I think is one of the best rooms in hotel, in the old building. All white, recently renewed, with funny furniture built in concrete (I think) and painted in white, large, with sea view, a nice balcony with bougainvillea flowers, it was absolutely adorable. The bathroom was correct, plenty of hot water, very comfortable. The location is good, in a quiet enough area, the breakfast was very good, and everything went more than OK.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Kamari for our Daughters wedding. We stayed at another Hotel but some of our party stayed here. They really enjoyed it. The rooms were lovely and clean and the outside breakfast area has an amazing view of the beach. The breakfasts were plentiful and everything you could hope for. The rest of our party joined the evening bar where Elias is the friendliest and most helpful host you will ever meet. The atmosphere in the evening is buzzing. We can't recommend this Hotel highly enough so if you're thinking of booking this Hotel then please don't hesitate.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from the arion bay!!!!We had the most perfect holiday. We totallyloved everything about the arion bay. Our room overlooked both the pool area and thesea.Elias and Nicko are fantastic hosts and will help you with anything and tellyou everything you need to know about the best things to see on santorini.We loved it sooo much we hope to return next year. Santorini is an amazing place to go.and staying at the Arion Bay is perfect.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
