review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed in Arion Bay for one week this summer. We were surprised that there were no reception, but Elias took care of check in at the bar, which was quite cosy. Our room was nice with a great view of the beautiful garden. The only thing we didn't like about the room was the bathroom. It was OK, but the shower was really small, and the mugs you use to put to toothbrush in was quite dirty. The breakfast was really good! It was a big breakfast with eggs, fruits, greek yoghurt, cheese, salami and much more!The cleaning ladies at the hotel were very nice as well. One of them gave us watermelon when we were waiting for our bustransfer to the aiport the last day. It was just a shame that Elias were more interested in the german guests than us.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visiting Santorini means renting a car and going every day on another beach/ place to visit. So you need a clean, all basic services hotel for a good night sleep and a breakfast. Arion Bay is perfect for this: clean rooms, peaceful hotel, decent breakfast and great service: Ilias is a true Greek - knowing all the best places on the island, good car rental company. We enjoyed our one week holiday - next time for 2 weeks!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very nice place to stay,good location right on the sea front, warm and friendly couple who run the Hotel. Good pool, nice breakfast, nice clean rooms, i would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to anyone..
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OMG , small, friendly with the awesome Ilias ..... Love this hotel, Ilias, Tanya you are awesome xxxx we will return again and again and again xxx at the end of the strip a perfect location for a quiet holiday but close enough to the bars if you change your mind!!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ... you can check out any time you like but you can never leave ! There are these special moments in life, where you find places like this hotel and you would like to stay forever. The hotel run as family business makes you feel comfortable from the very first minute. Direct access to the beach and the sea, fantastic clean pool, absolutely friendly staff taking care of every guests wishes, Elias (one of the owners) has all the perfect tipps where to travel, what to see, where to eat, where to rent all kind of vehicles - he's the one who makes the difference. Together with Tanja, who takes care of th bar during the day, they build a perfect team. And in the evening Elias takes over the Bar business at the pool site and has a smile for everyone - and of course the perfect drinks. The night starts and ends here - just like paradise. We stayed here the fourth time in a row now - as Elias promised the first time " ... you will return ! ..." and we did. English, German ... no problem. We will be back every year - because this is pure holiday !
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are here at the Arion Bay at the moment. The weather is great. Elias is on form. Especially on Monday evening !!! It was Santorini's Easter celebrations when we arrived and it fireworks and partying all day long. The Arion Bay is very friendly, in a very convenient position for restaurants beach etc. would def come back here. The service is great, breakfast buffet is lovely. Can't fault it !
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We like a few other reviewers didn't stay in the hotel but we enjoyed the bar every night Elias is with out a doubt the friendliest bar owner I have ever met.The night we arrived we told Elias we we needed to eat he went in the kitchen and came out with sandwiches which were very nice and he wouldn't take any money for them.We are off to Santorini next Tuesday (7th) and will be in the Arion bar the first night to have a drink with Elias we can't wait.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend visited santorini for a week with one plan in mind...total relaxation! And so it was. As soon as we arrived we met Elias (the hotel manager). Even if he was busy during breakfast, he acknowledged us, stopped fron what he was doing and came to greet us. I have to say that he made our stay the best holiday so far. Nothing was of any trouble for him. Such a nice guy and outspoken. Every evening we made it a point to be at the bar, and thats were we met so many nice people. Shots were Elias specialities, and made it a point that for every drink we offered him, as well as with the bill, he offered different shooters. The rooms have no tv, but that is a good thing, coz likethat, we had the opportunity to socialize more with everyone. Wifi is free and reachable from everywhere. All in all, this was one great experience of total relaxation. Great holiday. Sure you'll see us again there. Thanks!!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You have to try this one.Ok we didn't stay here went for drinks more than once an there's lots of bars to choose from - the barman was so friendly beautiful pool by the bar, there were kids swimming into the evening, lovely atomosphere, beautiful setting, cocktails spectacular !!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mum and I just came back from one of the loveliest holiday´s we ´ve ever been on. And that is also thanks to the Hotel and its staff. We have been told that Arion bay was the luxurious 3 star hotel in Kamari and It turned out to be quite true. It´s right on a beach, very nicely situated. With large pool, sunbeds, pool bar of course and wifi all over the area. The rooms aren´t perfect but they are more than satisfying for the time of your stay. The housekeeping was also decent, new towels every day, cleaning, moping the floor, anything you need and you dont have to ask for it. The owner - Elijah - is very nice, friendly and helpful, he speaks fluent English and German. What we really loved was breakfast. Anything you can think of. Bacon, eggs, sausages, cereals, fruit and vegetable salads, sweets etc. The hotel is for everyone. We were just two but there were also families with little kids (cca from 6 months and older) and it is very comfortable for older people as well. (wheelchair is not a problem, there is low-floor access). I can´t but recommend.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for a week, found the room a bit sparse but with all the necessities. The staff was very accommodating and very friendly. A very beautiful view, breakfast included and it's right on the beach, I mean come on? What else can one ask for? ;)
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although we didn't stay at this hotel as we were in another near by, we spent most of our evenings with Elias at their pool bar due to the fantastic atmosphere and friendly service. It is not often that you find someone so willing to help and always up for a laugh and a chat when staying with their competitors!!! From our own experience and from what other guests have told us the service was well above expected, with nothing being too much trouble even though we weren't staying in his hotel!! Next time we will not hesitate to stay at Arion Bay. Gracias Elias, amigo mio!!!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best vacation we have ever been! Very nice, quiet place to stay in and relax- pool and beach are within few meters. Good location for trips(we have traveled almost the whole island and met many interesting people) and also for eating. There are many restaurants on the promenade where the hotel is located. Our room was clean for all the time and tastefully furnished in typical Cyclades style. Breakfast were also great, incl.plenty of good stuff! Especially I loved their "coffee" and sweets:-)And finally the hotel manager "Ellias" and his staff were professional, friendly, helpful a good guys anyway! This is the right place to spend unforgettable vacation!!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generally speking an ok hotel. But room sucks.Plusses:LocationElias is very helpfull and friendlyMinuses: Maria from stuff is too loud without earprotectors!Mattress was too hard.Pillow too hard and highShower in room is old and messy with water all over the bathroomThe balcony doors didn't workSometimes cleaners forget to give us new towelsOnce we had to drink instant coffee. They didn't had any real coffee at 9:30 in the morningThe room is too small for two single beds.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friendly , clean but basic place ,rooms have 2 single beds linen changed on average every 3rd day bathroom very wet after taking a shower ,typical 2 star Greek hotel but in a good location ,ie not overlooking a Taverna as some on the beach are, the hosts (as said many times before) are out standing always aware of whats going on and sorting out any little niggles. anice swimming pool and next to the beach ( well, stoney sea shore) Kamari is a nice place for summer sun ,a relaxed resort ,no culture,or places to walk to but if you want to soak up the sun, have a laugh , aweek here is certainly recommended
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, nice calm place. One of best places on Kamari beach. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a wonderful holiday at the Arion Bay in Kamari. The hosts Elias and Tony were great any problems always sorted out, both have a great sense of humour in different ways really enjoyed their company.The rooms are basic but we had a gorgeous sea view with everything you need including a necessary air conditioning and fridge, slight problem with the cleaning (new cleaners this season) which was quickly sorted by Elias.Breakfasts here are very good for Greece eggs, bacon, cheese, fruit, yogurt and various breads.The bar in the evening very sociable meeting lots of different nationalities, I would not hesitate in visiting this hotel again thanks Elias and Tony.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple, good value for money B&B on the beach!This was our second visit in mid May, rather quite but loved it! [-]
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Arion Bay for the 4th time this year and would recommend this hotel to people wanting a friendly relaxing holiday.Elias and Tony are excellent hosts and one of the reasons we go back year after year. The rooms are basic but spotless as you would expect of any hotel of this class and the view from the hotel is fabulous.The breakfast which is served from 7.30 to 10.00 everyday is very good and includes cereal bacon scrambled egg cold meats cheese and fresh fruit (something for everyone)We have met lots of people who go back year after year and its nice to know when you go back there is always a friendly face at the bar .My only advice would be if you wanted lots of activities for children Kamari is probably not the place.we will look forwrd to going back next year and meeting friends old and new.And yes Tony we will look forward to the music around the pool especially Peter Grant!!
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time we have stayed at the Arion Bay and it wont be the last.Rooms are comfortable and clean and the air con works a treat.There is a small fridge in the room and a safe. Air Con and fridge are free and safe you pay for Breakfast is realy good and its lovley to sit on your own balcony and look at the sea while relaxing at breakfast there isnt a problem taking food from the breakfast area its a very laid back hotelThe pool and pool areas are always kept very clean The hotel doesnt provide entertainment in the general sense but Tony and Ilias provide more than enough entertainmentThere are plenty of restraunts close by my favourite 2 are Seaside which is right on the front and a new one Raffaelo's<sp> which is just around the cornerCant wait to go back
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well this was my 3rd trip to Santorini and I can say that this place adds that "Something Special" feeling to your vacation. As I stated here and on Virtual Tourist that this hotel answered my question about the song from the Eagles, The Hotel California, where they state "You Can Check Out Any Time You Like But You Can Never Leave". It's like when you leave part of you stays. The staff, Elias is the best bartender on the island, really makes this place much more then a place to eat and sleep. BTW, there buffet is really great as are the rooms and the location. As one person commented of hanging at Elias's bar, "He Could Make A Party Out Of A Empty Room". Not to say it's a wild place, old and young blend in nicely, it's just a pleasent group that enjoys meeting and having a good time. Though it's Arions first year, as it use to be part of the boat House Hotel, it is well know to manny as they have been coming back yr after yr.. I would just suggest to book early if you can cause with the great value and great times here it was fully booked this Sept. and will be next yr. also.
hotelName:
15    Arion Bay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at Stelios Place for over a week this June with my fiance and over a dozen other family members in the days leading up to my wedding in Santorini. Stay at Stelios Place if these things are important to you:- Excellent price (50 Eur per night for our "honeymoon suite" room - newly updated, A/C, comfortable bed and pillows, safe, refrigerator, clothesline, patio with bistro set)- A place with a pool (gorgeous pool & chairs/umbrellas/poolside patio cafe)- Amazing hospitality (Stelios, his wife, and his two daughters, plus Milo the dog, make your stay feel like it's with family)- Location (A 2 minute walk from Perissa beach & the Perissa-Perivolos beach road)- Food available at the hotel (breakfast, drinks including small bar, and light lunch fare available for purchase)- Nearby conveniences (ATMs, bus stop to Fira and other villages/sights, smoothie shop - Tutti Frutti, vehicle rentals, small market shop around the corner with water, sunscreen, some food items, etc)- Free pickup & drop-off at airport/port by Stelios himself, even at 11pm..If you want something "luxury," this is not the place for you (though I daresay in terms of comfort, cleanliness, and design of the updated rooms, it should have more stars). There is no spa, no big hotel restaurant, no gym. But, you will feel like you are part of the culture of the island - not at another Hilton plopped in the middle of anywhere. If you want to save the bulk of your traveling money for seeing the sights, taking wine tours, spending half a day sailing around the island on a catamaran, enjoying local fare, and perhaps island hopping a day or two - this IS the place to stay. (We spent more at our hotel in Crete for one night than we did for EIGHT days at Stelios!! And guess what - I enjoyed Stelios more!)If you need further convincing, read the other reviews. But genuinely - this is the place to stay in Santorini to enjoy the laidback lifestyle of the island and avoid hordes of tourists. If you visit - say hi to Stelios & the family for me!!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow what can I say we loved this place. The apartments are small and the family are so friendly and welcoming. Rooms have everything you need and the whole place is spotlessly clean. Great location just a stones throw from the beachfront and a lovely little pool area. Breakfast at the apartments is amazing and great value for money. Thanks for a lovely stay and we will definitely be back. Vicky and Neil
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios and his family could not have been any more friendly. From being met at the airport by Stelios, greeted by Katerina his daughter like we were already friends (we had emailed a couple of times) to having the whole family see us off. The hotel is beautiful and extremely clean. Food and drinks perfect, even Milo the dog provides entertainment. The pool area is exceptional. Can not wait to return.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios Place is a very clean, family-run hotel that is extremely cheap! It's a very pretty hotel with a small swimming pool, and it's very well- maintained. It has good air conditioning in the small rooms, the basic necessities and it's all extremely clean! It's run very efficiently by the husband & wife team of Stelios & Eva and their daughter Katerina. What a beautiful, hard-working family!! When we were there, the hotel was full of an extended family of all ages, attending a wedding. All around the pool they were laughing & enjoying themselves but never making too much noise! Katerina was serving drinks & snacks from the small bar.. always with a smile! Stelios place is within a short, pleasant walk to Perissa Beach with its many restaurants & shops.I don't know how they can keep their prices so low but we're so glad we got to experience this place and we truly enjoyed our short stay!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first stay at Stelios Place but our third visit to Perissa.This time we were on Santorini for our Wedding.Stelios,Eva,Katerina and everyone else who worked there were just brilliant!!They made us feel so special and so welcome.The hotel is the best we have ever stayed at in Perissa and,as other reviewers have stated,we will never stay anywhere else in future!The pool area is perfect,everyone is so happy and you are always greeted with a broad genuine smile.Our room was kept absolutely spotlessly clean by the maids who worked so hard through the day.Unbelievable value,amazingly friendly and lovely family and staff.Please ignore any bad reviews on here,personally I think they are uncalled for.....and just a quick mention to Milo....the cutest little Jack Russell in the world!!!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I saw the prices in Thira, I decided to book in Perissa by the beach. I am so grateful I did! Thira is a madhouse in the tourist months this place's Stelio's place is calm, serene, close to the beach, extra clean and the staff are so polite. I am so very grateful I decided to stay here. This is not an overinflated review. I absolutely had a five-star experience here.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed with our 10 month old daughter for a week in May. We cannot recommend this accommodation or the staff highly enough. Stelios welcomed us at the airport and also took us back for our return flight. Rooms are modern, comfortable and cleaned each day. We had a lovely balcony from which you could see the sea.The pool is a beautiful area with sunloungers, comfy seats or tables and chairs to choose from depending what you prefer.The communal kitchen was very handy for us to help cater for our daughter plus each room has a fridge.The travel cot provided was spotless and felt like our own. It was a joy to see everyone each morning. Stelios and his family made us feel so welcome, were happy to offer advise and helped with anything needed. The location was perfect for us... one street back from the beach front with all the restaurants etc or turn the opposite direction out of the accommodation and you quickly reach the main road where there are more restaurants, shops and the bus stops. Very easy for walks with the pram.We hope to return to Santorini and would not look to stay anywhere else but here.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked Stelios Place for a long weekend for my partners birthday and we weren't disappointed. Stelios picked us up from the airport and took us to the hotel. The rooms were lovely....as new in fact.. and everything was beautifully clean. Stelios, his wife and his daughter are really lovely, friendly people and made us feel so welcome. The pool is also fantastic. The hotel is literally 60 metres from the beach and could not be in a better location !......All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and I highly recommend this hotel .
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios Place was a great choice close to the beach. The rooms were large and very clean & the porch out front made it great to just relax and enjoy the fresh air. The family was very nice and welcoming. They have a nice breakfast for a same fee, a small bar and the pool was perfect. Very affordable. We stayed a couple nights and would have stayed much longer if we could have.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large, clean and comfortable rooms with friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast with a good variety of food. The staff helped us rent a car for a couple of days and provide great tips on places to see and eat on the island.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with a load of friends in 2000 when we got married on the island. Not only was Stelios place a great place to stay but Stelios himself was just a super star helping us arrange all sorts of things from suggesting a florist and some musicians to sorting a coach to take the guests to the wedding. Being a real local he knew everyone even a contact to help a mate who drunkenly fell off a balcony and broke his ankle.Basically love him and his place. Have been back since and hope to visit next year for our 20th.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios met us at the airport and introduced himself, and we had a friendly chat on the way to the Hotel. We were then introduced to his family, who are extremely friendly and very helpful. Nothing was to much for them, and they made us very welcome. The hotel is absolutely spotlit and very clean, and cleaned every day by two polite girls. The beach is moments away, as are the restaurantsForget your big fancy commercially run hotels, Stelios place is where you need to be. You cannot manufacture this kind of service and friendship as it only comes naturally to some people! Stelios' family has lots of it.When it was time to leave, there was hugs all around, and we felt like were were leaving family behind.Wonderful people, a wonderful hotel, and a wonderful holiday .Thank you so much.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing less than 5 stars is deserved for the quality of service I recieved here. On check-in I met Katalina she is very sweet and welcoming. She, her mother and father runs the hotel. The room was nice, pleasant and clean, with a quaint patio. The location is a short 2min walk from the beach, but removed enough to feel very peaceful and relaxing. Though I didn't spend much time at the pool, the pool area is very cute and nicely done. I initially only planned to stay one night but felt so relaxed and at home here that I extended my stay for a second night.I ate breakfast here each morning of bacon eggs toasts and juice made well and tasted good and afterwards her father serves a slice a yummy breakfast cake that is made by her mother.But the highlight for me was when her father offered me a ride to the port to catch the ferry. That goes above and beyond the expectations for service!! I enjoyed my stay here would reccomend this place to anyone! And if I ever return to Perissa I would choose to stay here again.Thank you all so much for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks so much to Stelios and his family. He collected us from the airport and took us to the hotel which is really lovely. Our room overlooked the pool which had wonderful padded sunbeds and beanbags-luxury! The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious served in the restaurant by the pool. Our room was comfortable and clean. It's a 2 minute walk to the beach which is pretty. The sea was warm in August and lovely and clear. There are lots of nice restaurants along the seafront.Oia was about an hours drive to see the sunset which was incredible, or get a bus from the main street. Fira was lovely too.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do you start with this phenomenal place, we got married in santorini last week and used stelios as our home for 10 days, we've been coming to Greece for the last 5 years now and this place is by far the best we've stayed in, it's a family run place and katerina cannot do more for you and really makes you feel welcome by always calling you by name as if you were there forever, these little things are hard to find in hotels, the pool area and pool is absolutely perfect with bean bag sunbeds and normal ones too, the rooms are so fresh and modern and spotless, we had a sea view from our room, price is incredible too, we're already booking our return trip for next September already and looking forward to it already, also they have pick up and drop off to the airport too which is so handy.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Stelio’s Place. The hotel was beautiful and immaculate. Stelio and his daughter, Katerina, were very friendly and helpful. They couldn’t have been nicer. The location was great - just around the corner from the beach, restaurants and shops but without the crowds of Fira and Oia. Easy to get around my bus. We highly recommend Stelio’s Place for a great stay in Santorini!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location. So so clean, serviced with clean towels and room cleaned each day. Pool area great and again grounds spotless. I have to say that stelios and his family where super friendly and couldn't do enough to help both my husband and kids. Stelios daughter was amazing and even called into our next hotel to ensure everything was in placentral and stelios drove us to the next village as we had booked up to stay in a cave house for 2 nights. We wish we could have stayed longer and would certainly go back again. Thank you to all.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly, helpful and well run hotel! Clean, well kept and comfortable rooms. Perfect relaxation spot. Super pool area! One minute from the beach and excellent restaurants! Value for money and will be staying here in the future if I visit the island again.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely LOVED Stelio’s Place. It’s super close to the beach, restaurants, etc. it’s also super quiet and just beautiful. The family that runs the place is amazing too, super friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable about all things Santorini. If we come back, we’re definitely staying here again.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at Stelio’s place for 7 days on our week away with my partner and his family. Immediate good start as we arrived fairly late at night and we got picked up from the airport which was easy and only 20 mins to the hotel. Hotel is in a brilliant location literally 2 minutes walk to the beach and main Street with tons of restaurants, bars and shops. Even though you are so close to this, the hotel was so peaceful and quiet as it’s slightly tucked away you can relax and sleep well at night. The room was fantastic, lovely balcony, plenty of space and storage, everything you need/want. Pool is lovely, plenty of comfy Sunloungers with umbrellas. Breakfast was always lovely, my favourite was Greek yoghurt, honey, muesli & fresh fruit! Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and so helpful which was lovely, also recommend and booked us onto an amazing sunset boat trip which was incredible and well worth it, Katerina also booked us a fantastic table in Thira with stunning views & great food. They were all so helpful with recommendations of places to eat and visit which is great as it was our first time in Santorini. Couldn’t have asked for a better week. Would definitely go back for another holiday.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I absolutely loved our stay at Stelios Place. The family that runs it are incredibly friendly and accommodating, they really go above and beyond for their guests! Comfortable rooms and a great pool area. Perfect location, so close to the beach, shops and restaurants. Also very close to a bus stop. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Santorini, I hope to visit again!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic stay at Stellios Place- amazing breakfast and low prices for great food- nice pool (perfect temperature)- very pretty and charming hotel with many outdoor areas to relax (hammocks and comfy sofas) -very nice and welcoming family who owns the hotel. They will do anything to help and they give very good recommendations for cruises and places to visit. Thanks for everything!- very close to the beach and restaurants- Great pickup service to and from the ferry.Overall a fantastic experience at unbeatable prices!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic family run hotel offering the absolute best in Greek hospitality.Rooms are nice and comfortable with AC (required in the Santorini heat!) andaloveky pool with a little bar which is a perfect place to relax. Location is perfect for exploring the island with the capital (Fira/Thera) just 20 mins by bus, bus stop is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Even closer to the hotel is the beach, which has hot black volcanic sand but lovely clear waters which are refreshing without being cold.Would hugely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Santorini, the quality of facilities, customer service and location is second to none.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful place, Stelios and Katerina are so friendly and helpful, offering to store our suitcases for the day when we returned to Santorini from Paros a week later and arranging our taxis as our flight was 23.30! We had a room with a balcony overlooking the pool and with sea view, spotlessly clean everywhere, comfortable bed, air conditioning, a safe, dressing table, everything for a perfect stay. Our flight was 1 hr late at 1am, Stelios was there waiting, bless him and it was free if you stay more than 3 nights. It is very well thought of with certificates of excellence displayed and is booked up early, not surprisingly.Breakfast only is served with a good choice, fresh orange juice, yummy. Book, you will be very happy.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 11 nights in early June and it has to be one of the most enjoyable holidays we’ve ever had. We returned to the UK totally relaxed and refreshed.We were collected from the airport and greeted by the family as we arrived at the apartments. The room was spotless and was cleaned every day to a very high standard. The beds were extremely comfy.The whole family - including Milo the dog are involved at the apartments lending to a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Recommendations on restaurants and places to visit provided by Katerina were spot on.The pool area is stunning with relaxing chairs and beds of a very high standard. Extremely well located for the bus into Fira and a 5 min walk to the beach and restaurants.This really is the ideal place for a fantastic couples holiday. Perfect place, perfect hosts and perfect holiday - we’ll be back!!!Helen & Gary
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for the second time in 2 years' which is out of character for us! Very clean accommodation just a a minute from the beach.The whole family and their dog very friendlyClose to shops tavernas etc.Don't miss it if you can get booked!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot praise this place enough! Right at beach and at the bus stop for Thira (frequent service at 2.4 euros about a 20 minute ride). Wonderful facility and service. Perissa beach is lovely, offering umbrellas and chaises with purchase of meals from restaurants. The fish restaurant run by fishers at far left of beach was excellent, as recommended by Katarina
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a small family run hotel, 2 minutes walk from the beach and all the restaurants. You are welcomed from the minute you’re collected from the airport, the entire family are involved in making the holiday perfect. Dad collects you at the airport, the daughters look after reception and giving advice on what Santorini has to offer, whilst mum does the cooking. All the fixtures and fittings including sun loungers etc are of the highest quality. Very friendly and relaxed; couldn’t find fault if you tried. Highly recommended. We will be back
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perefect hotel for families! We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights with our 5 months baby, it was excellent. Great, quiet and relaxing hotel, we felt very welcome. Very helpful and friendly owners of the hotel, provided everything what we needed. Only few minutes away to the beach, close to the bus stop, perfect location if you want to stay away from the crowded area of Oia or Thira. Big plus of the hotel that they provide for no extra cost transportation to and from the hotel. Definitely we will come back again.Thank you a lot for your hospitality!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect from start to finish. Stellios picked up at airport and when we arrived we were quickly shown to our spotless room. The whole hotel is super super clean and has a chilled cool feel. The room was perfect and the location is a great base for getting around exploring the island or just chilling by the beach a stone's throw away from the hotel. All the family were so helpful and kind. We stayed 3 nights but could have relaxed for a week or more here. We would definitely recommend for a stay if coming to Santorini. Thanks for the lovely stay! Ev + Eoin
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Greece. The hostel was incredible. Location was in a bit of a strange area but when you arrived it was just eye opening. They kept the hostel well cleaned and lit, and the rooms were spacious and clean! The pool was extremely clean as well! 10/10 will be back!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios place at perissa, host are very kind, and caring to my children( 12 and 9 year old)Also very helpfull when you have questions.Pickung up from the airport and brining back to the airport is included, very niceIt is a clean place( cleaning rooms every day, and clean towel every day) for me a big plusYou can buy breakfast at a good priceThere is a clean swimming pool ( for Santorini a good size) Out of season we travel in April- end of may it was very relaxing and quiet. And we loved it.(Compared to Fira that was very crowded, and noizy) Stelios place has a good size room, with a normal size fridge( compared to other hotel i seen) and a tv, shower and toilet in one room.The beds are really comfortable, and clean.You have your own privacy balcony, and we had a little few also of the beach.There is a kitchen down the stairs so you can cook yourself, and we loved it, because we did not want to eat out every single day, only pizza and fatty foods.The beach is only a few minutes walking from the beach, and that was not so tiring for the kids.Al in all a big 5 plus for meWe will keep this in mind if we come back again
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Helpful staff. Only a few minutes walk to the black beach. Transfer to and from hotel was ideal. Easy bus ride to Fira and to Oia with bus stop only a few minutes away from hotel. Only disadvantage was area was very quite during time of stay (beginning of October).
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Those who have written reviews before mine are spot on: friendly family, transfer to and from hotel, reserving the volcano cruise for me, spacious room, VERY reasonably priced, etc. But what stands out for me is the location of this very pleasant hotel. A 3-minute walk from the beach and the waterfront restaurants, snack bars and shops; a 3-minute walk to the bus stop that takes you to several interesting towns in Santorini (Fira, Ia, just to name a few); a short distance from grocery and convenience stores; a 10-minute walk to an interesting hiking trail up a hill where the archeological site of the ancient city of Thira is located. Simply ideal for those who prefer not to rent a car. My only complaint is that my room was very close to the garage and reception; as a light sleeper, I often heard noise through the walls and floor. Thanks to Stelios and his family for making my stay a most memorable one. I will recommend your hotel to all my friends here in Canada.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is bright, comfortable, well located and has the lovely pool area to relax in after spending the day at the beach or exploring the island. Our hosts could not do enough for us, they are lovely friendly people.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (a couple) booked this place nearly blindly after seeing the fantastic reviews. It lived up to the expectations.The family who runs this place is really amazing. First, Stelios himself comes to pick you up from the airport (message them in advance so he knows your time). He told us he made up to six airport trips in one day while we were there! His daughter Katarina is the sweetest person. I had a really bad cold while there and she made sure I got the right medicine from the pharmacy and kept checking up on me. They also have a cute dog named Milo who hangs out by the pool.The hotel itself is only a 2 minute walk from the beach (it appears further on maps and is listed as a 15-minute walk on competitor websites, but this is false). There are plenty of great restaurants nearby and unlike the other side of the island, Perissa never feels swamped by tour groups and you really get the laidback beach experience. It is, in our opinion, a much better place to stay than Oia or Thira. There are easy buses that can take you over to that side for a day trip. The rooms are simple but very, very clean, and what else do you really need at the beach? Simply put, for the price you get a 5-star experience. We wish we lived in Europe so we could come back here every year. It was that great.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: visited in Aug 2017, amazing hotel, rates and very clean. Amazing Katrina!we expected less because of the rate compared with other hotels.definitely will visit again. very close to the beach, few minutes walking
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't get me wrong about this review, but expected more for a "Fabulous" rating. The family that owns and runs it are Fabulous, but there are some drawbacks when it came to our room. First our room(9) has a very bad view. It is the back of a bar and an open field. The second drawback is the very small shower with the shower curtain that clings too you any way you move. If you decide to go there specify that you DO NOT want rooms either 9 or 11. Ten and 13 has a sea view from you balcony. If you have any questions contact Katerina, she has all the answers...very helpful.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing friendly family who will do anything to make your stay memorable. Can not recommend this place enough! Spotlessly clean room with daily house keeping and fresh towels. Just around the corner from Perissa beach. Good local bus service to Oia & Fira.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a family run place. Everyone is so very friendly and nothing is to much trouble for them. The room was cleaned every day and also clean towels every day. No need to take beach towels as they are provided to. The Cleanliness was top class. Only one small thing the shower was very small and the plastic curtain easily touched your skin. But that is the only thing that was on the downside. It might not bother other people and that is why I have given it 5 stars. Would go again though as it is the cleanest place we have ever stayed in.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok, so this was our 4th time in Perissa, 1st time staying at Stelios Place and I can honestly say I would not stay anywhere else. It's not that any of the previous hotels have been disappointing it's just the fact that as a family business, Stelios, Ava and Katerina go the extra mile. The hotel itself is fantastic with a stunning poolside area with more than enough tables, umbrellas and sun loungers. There are 22 rooms, we stayed in number 20 which was spacious, spotlessly clean with a lovely balcony overlooking the pool. Housekeeping visit daily to change towels, empty bins, clean floors etc. I know what you're thinking " I wouldn't expect any less " so on to the extra mile. . . . . . . Stelios personally collects you from the airport/port and also provides a return transfer on your departure date at not extra cost. Also included in the room rate is air conditioning and access to the safe located in the room. The bathroom is spacious, as is the shower which has a constant supply of hot water whatever the time of day. Katerina has a wealth of knowledge and is more than happy to recommend places to go and will also arrange excursions if required. Breakfast is optional and not included in the room rate but is well priced and cooked to order. It's worth noting that Ava cooks an excellent fried egg with a runny yoke. We booked a quad bike at Motomania and when asked where we were staying we got a €10 per day discount. They also have a stunning private villa available for rent with amazing views, please do check their website and book direct as the prices are very competitive, it's also worth paying cash in euros on arrival if you can . Finally I would like to thank everyone at Stelios place for a fantastic 7 night stay and John and I look forward to seeing you all again in 2018. Oh and give Milo (jack russel) a belly tickle from both of us.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in Perissa several times over the years, and I can honestly say that Stelios Place was the nicest hotel I've been to in the area. It's about a minutes walk to the beach, where you can find lots of restaurants and bars. Well-priced (especially compared to hotels on the other side of the island), immaculately cleaned with a great family atmosphere courtesy of Katerina, Stelios and family. We were greeted by Stelios at the airport and taken to Perissa free of charge. Our triple room was massive with a private balcony and air conditioning, with a large bathroom and wardrobe space. The room was cleaned every day and we were given fresh towels. They also have luggage storage for the day you leave and showers if you want to get cleaned up after checking out. We only stayed for a week, but wish it could have been longer!!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceeded my expectations.Stelios and his wonderful family simply can't do enough for you and have created a beautiful relaxing place to spend our holiday. Our room was large, clean and recently refurbished to a very good standard.Katrina and Ava recommend plenty of things to do and places to go.Picked us up from the port and dropping us at the airport.Super breakfast choice.Great value for money hotel.Will definitely return, can't resist the endless cake.Add to that, Santorini is definitely worth the visit.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful hotel, friendly & family run. The owners go out of their way to look after their guests including picking up from the airport. Good location a short stroll from the beach and restaurants. The only issue is due to its popularity it's difficult to find a free week to book !
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was spotless.We had a small balcony that even had a small clothesline!Small table and chairs- great to sit and very private.Beds ok not the most comfortable but it might be old age :)Everything looked new and bright. Nice room.Provided towels for the beach. I used one as a floor mat to soak up the water from the shower going everywhere. Worked a treat! Kept the floor clean and dry.And it dried super fast on the balcony.Beach is 10 steps away. Convenience shop with all you need is also 10 steps away on the main road.For the price we paid this place delivered big time!!Its basic but if you are on a budget i can highly recommend!
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect position in perissa for the beach,buses ,or hiring any type of vehicle. Nice accommodation cleaned every day by very nice staff. A well run family business who are so helpful with any request you may need. You have a great choice with different breakfast types. There are organised trips out if you wish or you can make your own way around with bus stops only a five minute walk away. plenty of choices with restaurants along the beach. Overall a very nice stay and would highly recommend.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not enough nice things to say about the hotel. Stellios kindly collected us from the airport and pointed out various views and things to do along the way to the hotel- perhaps a 15 min drive.Upon arriving you're warmly greeted by Kat who was so lovely and eager to take us straight to our rooms - no need for a formal check in. Our room is stunning and overlooks the pool and gorgeous pink blooms growing up the walls of the hotel.Breakfast in the morning is delicious too.Such a pleasant stay and would highly recommend.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Stelios Family hotel for 3 nights with 2 kids. This hotel is really well located : 2mn walk to the Perrissa beach and also 2mn walk to the bus stop. Stelios family is also very friendly : always a friendly word with a smile (nowadays it is not so common). And for sure the best money value for Santorini island. And if you stay more than 3 nights they offer a free pick-up at the port or airport. Thank you for this nice stay
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios met us at the ferry and was lovely right from the start. Really friendly. Took us to the hotel. Didn't try to push us to buy something from here, there or anywhere. The room was fantastic and clean with a lovely balcony which was great for sitting at after the kids had gone to bed. The pool was stunning and we couldn't keep the kids out of it. Stelio's place is family run with his wife and daughters. Nothing was too much trouble. So friendly. Breakfast was fresh and really tasty. Oreo chocolate milkshake was to die for according to the kids. Overall definitely 5 star and if we go back to Santorini I wouldn't stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This morning we returned to England after 2 fantastic weeks at Stelios Place. Stelios and his family provide a service so wonderful that I have not experienced anywhere else in the world. Nothing is too much trouble from the second Stelios collected myself, my husband and our 5 children from the airport.The rooms are immaculate and cleaned from top to toe each day. The family serve wonderful meals throughout the day that are very well priced and extremely generous in size. Katerina can advise you on the best places to visit and can arrange everything for you, on Sunday we spent the most amazing day sailing around the island on a catamaran.Whilst on holiday our son had a slight ear infection, the family advised us on all local doctors available, booked us an appointment and then Stelios drove us there- this demonstrates just how special Stelios Place is.On Sunday our youngest son celebrated his birthday - he was overjoyed to receive a birthday cake from the hotel and be greeted by balloons at the breakfast table!The pool area is so relaxing with plenty of sun beds and parasols to enjoy . Stelios has a communal kitchen that is available to you if you want to prepare your own snacks and on the last day of your holiday you can store your luggage in large luggage lockers and shower in bathrooms provided before leaving.If you want to go somewhere truly special and meet the most wonderful family in the world then stay at Stelios Place and you will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were really impressed by the hotel and the warm welcoming by Stelios and his family when we visited in 2014. The pool, breakfast nook, and grounds were excellent then and we were surprised that Stelios had remodeled the outside areas making them even better! What hadn't changed though was the welcome we had from Stelio's wife and daughter, Ava and Katarina. As before, they made the visit memorable. You can read what others have said about the facilities and location but the people make it special.Will be back again.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stelios place is outstanding, the family are wonderful, nothing is too much trouble for them l am well travelled, but l can honestly say this Hotel is amazing.l would highly reccomend it You are a one minute walk from Beach and great Tavernas.l have stayed here several times and l would not stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights,Stelios collected us at the airport at 0.15 hrs, he also dropped us to the port at 0600 hrs when we were ready to leave for iOS, all free of charge, brilliant service, the hotel was great,we could not find any faults at all,we would stay here again with no hesitation,rooms were comfortable,air con,fresh towels every day, right beside the beach and all the restaurants,wonderful family run hotel, see you all next yearDes & Anne
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (family with three teenage boys) spent three nights at Stelios place and we were over all very pleased and happy with everything. The situation very close to the beach is perfect, the pool nice and well cept, and the owner family charming and service oriented. We'd heard that Perivolos beach was better because less touristic and calmer. We actually enjoyed the lively atmosphere by the beach and the very calm situation of the hotel. We also appreciated the free airport transfer. We would love to come back.
hotelName:
16    Stelios Place
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one week in a basic double room. Facilities are good although the shower area was quite small but we managed. Room was cleaned every day. This hotel is owned and run by a family, who are very friendly and welcoming. They all do an amazing job at keeping guests happy. The pool area is lovely, in fact we had the pool to ourselves all week!Plenty of restaurants and tavernas near by and the beach is 5 minutes walk. There is a 24 hour bakery and mini supermarket 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Overall we were delighted with our stay and would be happy to return again in the future.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a chance based on other reviews as this is so different to the type of accommodation we usually stay in.It is just perfect - in a great location with just a short walk to the beach it is spotlessly clean both in the rooms and also the public areas. The pool is a nice relaxing spot and they serve a very reasonable breakfast should you want it.Our very comfortable room had a good size fridge and a small hot plate but you are also very close to many good tavernas and restaurants.A family run hotel where they genuinely care about their guests - nothing is too much trouble.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a find! We stayed for a week as a family for a friends wedding and the team at Aretousa Villas could not be more accommodating. They were friendly and made us feel welcome the entire stay and were very understanding of us staying with our 4 month old. The location was perfect just 5 mins from the main stretch of Perissa beach meant it was nice to relax from the busier parts and close to everything you need. The transfer from the airport to the villas and back again went smoothly and was arranged all in advance to save on any stress. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Santorini!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first ever holiday as a family with our baby. I was very impressed with the airport transfer service and reception on arrival. We felt most welcome, like long lost family. The room was quiet (until we arrived!) clean and well equipped with a kitchenette, hob and kettle. The bed was very comfortable and air conditioning included without restrictions.❄The window shutters are perfect to black out light from the room to help baby sleep. There is even a bath tub which we have never seen in any self catering places in Greece. It is also unusual to have a daily housekeeping service in Greece. (Normally every other day ot less) The housekeeping staff were very flexible during baby nap times, thank you! We have been travelling the world for many years and it is so rare to find establishments who go the extra mile to make you welcome. Thank you to the whole Aretousa family we hope to return soon.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: excellent stay made unique by the fantastic hosts, from changing our travel plans - our problem, to arranging trips, pick up and return to airport. All the family join in to make our stay just what we needed. Thank you to Despina, Jacob, Mr & Mrs Drousos & all staff for all their help in making our stay so memorable
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic service. When we needed help with car hire, boat tickets, snorkeling trips, or sightseeing to Oia to watch the amazing sunsets. This or any other questions, we just asked, and Debbie did everything to fix it. They showed us as guests a commitment and a warmth, which is just indescribably!We also liked the nice and quiet beach about 2 min walk from the apartment. And right behind the apartment there is a nice little mountain. It took about 1 hour to go up to the top, where there was a monastery that was a beautiful atmospheric space to come to. A fantastic view overlooking the entire island. We can recommend this place without a doubt.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place and a really family style hotel. Not crowded and we could almost have the swimmingpool to ourself. Easy to take local bus to fira and oia. Some of the rooms Are really nice. The beach is very close and it is a bakery very cloose by.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked for our short trip to Santorini a nice Family Studio room with 3 bed's. Already communication with Debbie was very helpful and has given us a lot information. Pick up service from port or airport are possible to book additional. The houses are painted like expected on Santurini white and blue. Check in was very smooth, a big parking area is available. In our family studio room, we got one double bed king size and an additional single bed. This room got self catering facilities and balcony got huge space to enjoy the breakfast in the morning outside. Bathroom was full equipped and sufficent for a small family. Everything was very clean, owner family was always present and able to give best assistance and we got few very helpful tips from Debbie for important places to see on the island. This is a first class accommodation and we highly reccomend it. Hope we will have the chance to come back an stay little bit longer. Thanks for all.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Aretousa Villas in May. We were very pleased with the place and the service.Our room was super clean, the bed was very comfortable. They wash the floors every day.Cleaner than some of the big hotels we've stayed at.It is close to the beach and they have a nice pool on site. They have a choice of a small or large breakfast for small charge. The family that own the place are very nice people and willing to help anytime you need them.Debby is very good at organizing day trips and everything else. We highly recommend it and would go back there next time we visit.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our two-week stay at this family-run accomodation made our holiday very good.Its location is well situated, 1 min walk to the nicest part of the beach and restaurants, as well with a bus stop close by, we could easily visit Fira and Oia.With the helpful family members we got some good information about what to do and how to visit some sites.The rooms were very clean and fresh clean towels were provided daily.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can i say ..absolute perfection with the added quality of true greek hospitality you dont get from large hotels,the whole family cannot do enough for you, one of our party sprainedd his ankle and the family gave help above and beyond.The rooms are clean,bright,and linen and towels changed daily.Perfectly situated in a quiet spot a short walk from the beach.The pool area is perfect not large but clean and inviting never busy my son and his friends enjoyed early morning and early evening dips very relaxing atmosphere..apart from this it was Yorros..Arita..(apologies for spelling)Debbie and Jacob not forgetting little Maria who made Aretousa what it is the perfect holiday destination.Its the little things that count like the wine..cake..figs..sweets that are offered with genuine hospitality.We will return without a doubt..thank you Aretousa many thanks..Margaret,Callum,James (Bond)and Phil missing you already x
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at Aretousa Villas in Santorini. The room was spacious and well equipped, with a beautiful balcony. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, towels are changed daily. Debbie and her family are extremely kind, helpful and always available. They pick you up at the airport on arrival with no extra charge, and you can arrange for a journey back to the airport on the day of departure. On request they can arrange for car renting, boat excursions, etc.Aretousa Villas are only minutes away from the black beaches; a mini market and a bakery are just around the corner, as is the bus stop. We cannot wait to come back.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Debbie and the rest of the staff are Aretousa Villas are amazing! When we first arrived, Debbie's father picked us up from the airport, and then showed us around the beautiful island. When we arrived at the villas, Debbie sat us down with a map and highlighted things to do and see based on our preferences. She was incredibly helpful and kind! The room itself was gorgeous! Very spacious, with a kitchenette, air conditioning, and plenty of outlets for our various devices. Perfect distance for the beach, but also easy to access other parts of the island. I accidentally forgot something in the hotel room. Debbie was so kind, she shipped it back to my house for me. I appreciated it so much! I highly recommend staying in Aretousa Villas, and if I ever make it back to Santorini I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in Perissa near the black sand, Aretusa villas are a great place. Home owners, the bosses are of an absolute kindness and cut themselves in four to inform you. Impeccable room, small pool in peace. Great quality for the price!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with our stay, the family works as a team and everyone is very nice and helpful. They accommodated each of our requests, they made our stay very comfortable and pleasant. They had nice recommendations of places to eat and things to see. When the father picked us up from the airport, he made an effort to show us around town before taking us to the hotel, that was helpful and very nice. The room was very clean and towels changed daily. It had a kitchenette. We enjoyed having a fridge. The location was ideal, quiet and near everything. We took the bus to Thira, but mostly stayed by the beach. Eat at Tranquila often, loved their veggie food and cocktails.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 9 nights in this hotel and it was very nice, towels were changed every day and bed sheets every 2 days. There is a peaceful, family friendly atmosphere which makes the place feel like home. The swimming pool was nice and clean. Special thanks to Debbie and her family from Zyta and Greg.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week in this small family run b & b. Immaculately clean & close to the beaches in Perissa. The family cannot do enough to ensure your stay is comfortable. Several mini markets within walking distance for self catering.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were only briefly passing through Santorini, and we have stayed in Perissa a few times, so we didn't do much exploring but we were given lots of helpful tips and information on arrival. We had No5 which is the downstairs apartment with lovely view at the rear of the chapel in the hillside and a glimpse of the church in Perissa as well. There was plenty of space, clean and very well equipped, and great air con (the best we've had actually). And the breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Quietly situated and felt very safe as well. The family owners are what make Aretousa stand out as they are so helpful, warm and welcoming - nothing is too much trouble!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place! We booked the mountain view apartment. We had a private patio in the garden with amazing views of the mountain to Ancient Thira. The hosts were very helpful, especially as I wanted to book a sunset caldera trip for my husband's birthday. They made it so easy - thank you. We only used the main bedroom and the bed was very comfy and the air con great. The swimming pool was lovely but we were busy on a short break so only got to use it once. The apartment is within walking distance to the beach and shops. Plenty of space to park a hire car and very close to the supermarket. We walked up to ancient thira twice, but a quick note, don't take the path signposted. Walk a little further and on the right hand side you will see another path that starts with a lot of loose pumice. If you follow that one, it leads to a much easier way up and cuts off about 20 mins of the journey. It took us 25 mins going up this way. Also, go early in the morning before the sun gets to that side.The only gripe we had was that when we left the apartment, the electric would go off so we could not charge any cameras/phones/etc during the day. The cooker rings were not very good and really hard to use and I ended up getting burned. A microwave and toaster would be better.Everything else was perfect!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Aretousa was wonderful, we had one of the semi-basement rooms which was basic but not lacking in anything we needed and was very spacious, bright and clean. Jacob and his wonderful parents couldnt have been more friendly and accommodating. The location is great, close to the beach, shops and restaurants but still quiet and peaceful. We will definitely be booking to come back in the future and would 100% recommend to others!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our trip to Santorini. We were picked up at the airport which was complimentary. The owner and his family run this lovely hotel. We were recommended places to eat, things to do and where we could hire a quad bike. They went over and above our expectations and were extremely welcoming. Our room was a good size and had a very comfortable mattress. We had small kitchen facilities and the bathroom was an average size. We enjoyed sitting outside on our balcony in the evenings. There was a small washing line on our balcony too. The pool was great never overcrowded and we had the use of sun beds. The wifi was great too. An excellent stay. The owners are welcoming and will help you with your needs. The rooms were clean and the cleaner did a good job each day. Excellent work! We loved it there!!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place to stay. The family were helpful and friendly. A short walk to the beachfront esplanade and shops/restaurants. The room was clean and tidy and there were no hassles. Thanks for the great time in Santorini!!!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a small typical Cycladic room on the top floor and it was lovely! Very private including a small balcony with a nice view. Our hosts gave us a very warm welcome and lots of local recommendations. Perissa Beach with its clean water, plethora of sun beds and huge range of eateries is just a short walk away, as is a mini mart.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for just under a week at Aretousa villas and really enjoyed our stay. We were picked up from the airport as we were staying over 3 nights (added bonus!) and taken straight to the villas. We had the apartment with the mountain view and couldn't fault it; it was clean, spacious and had plenty of room. There are plenty of restaurants around the corner, a mini market as well as a 24 hour bakery that is very handy. Perissa beach is only a few minutes walk away and there are plenty of moto rental places to choose from (if you don't want to take the bus you'll need some sort of transport to watch the sunset from the caldera). The family that run the villas are so friendly and accommodating, it almost felt like home!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked our flight with Easyjet and Aretousa through Booking.com. Part of the booking involved free collection from the airport. Despite being almost 3 hours late in arriving Debbie's dad met us with a smile. He then apologised as he had to wait for the Athens flight to arrive in 20 mins as more guests were arriving and there was not enough time to take us to Perissa and come back. On the drive over to Aretousa he gave us information on the island and ideas of things to do and see. On arrival we were met by his wife who immediately showed us to our studio with the formal check in being left till the next day. They had also kindly put a large bottle of water in the fridge for our late arrival. There is a 24 hour bakery minutes away should you arrive late. The aircon and safety deposit is supplied free (for those who travel to the Greek Islands with package companies this is often a chargeable extra). Our studio was a good size and nicely furnished. The lighting was very good - with bedside lights, a strip of lights above the dressing table and good lighting in bathroom in additional to normal lighting. A recurring theme in all my reviews is I don't travel light and it would have been handy to have more drawers or shelves to put things away. As it was my shoes were just laid out in a row beside my bed. Also a shelf or counter top in bathroom would have been handy. As is typical in Greece the shower consisted of a shower tray and curtain. The shower curtain does try to cling to you a bit but the bathroom will get very wet if you don't use it. It was very clean and there was always hot water although the temperature fluctuated while you use it. Our window in the bathroom opened onto stairs so we could only open it when we weren't using it. The kitchenette is very small although there is a kettle - there was a reasonable collection of pans, chopping board, bowl, bread knife etc so although we only used it for a cold breakfast and keeping water cold you could prepare a meal. I would suggest using Carrefour, Big Coop or even Lidl out near Thira as most of the mini markets didn't really cater for cooking proper meals. I loved the blue shutters on the balcony doors which opened onto a good sized covered balcony which proved invaluable with the winds. We were in room 8 and overlooking the car park and other buildings so while not an amazing view we were not overlooked. There was sometimes a lot of noise from other guests moving furniture about, clattering up stairs and banging doors etc in the night. That said we loved staying there everyday when we saw the family they would greet you with a smile and a friendly greeting - greek if you were willing to try. Debbie organised the car hire at a very good price - no point in going for a big car roads are narrow and buses squeeze past regardless and she also organised our Caldera Boat Trip for us which again was good value. At various points we were given tomatoes and prickly pears from her dad's garden in passing and then on our last day we were given a glass of Vinsanto. Very good value for money and just thinking of the family whilst I write this review is making me smile.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a wonderful little find about a minute away from the beautiful black sand beach. The rooms are airy and spacious with fantastic balconies and the proprietors are welcoming, warm and really helpful. The pool is excellent and well kept, it is clean and perfect for sunbathing if the winds are too high on the beach. The owners know everything about the island - I would certainly recommend this place to anyone. We had an amazing time and will certainly return at some point!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a family with 2 small children, we reserved an apartment with the mountain view. Because were made our booking a bit late, the apartment was not available for the entire our vacation so we reserved for the first 2 nights a family room. Sounds complicated? Not here. The owners made all the arrangements for us, everything was smoothly arranged and prepared and we just had to enjoy the stay on the island. Both rooms where very clean, actually cleaning was done on a daily basis. Despina gave us a lot of useful tips, tried to find an answer to all our questions. We felt more than welcomed here and, as they really love children, our boys felt that too. The lovely owners knows how to do this magic: we just want to go back!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Aretousa Villas is lovely place to stay. We were met at the airport by Despina's father. On arrival Despina gave us lots of information about the area and things to see and do. We were also given a glass of cold squash and some tomato cakes made by her mother. This is a family run establishment which is close to a 24hr bakery, supermarket, restaurants and beach but in a quiet area. There is a small pool with loungers, deck chairs and sun shades and the view of the mountains is amazing. Our room was a studio with small kitchen area with a fridge, 2 rings, sink and kettle. The room also had a safe, air conditioning, hair dryer, large TV and balcony with patio furniture.The whole family were very welcoming and friendly and would always have a chat when they saw us. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend had our last dinner in Greece at Tranquilo Bar in Perissa and was really pleased by the experience. The food was really good. We had the fried rice and the Caesar wrap and the service was also good. The best thing was the price and the seating area. The prices was the lowest in Perissa, a big meal for just 5€. The seating area was so cosy and really different to the other places at the beach. I would gladly recommend this place and come back.Me and my girlfriend stayed at Aretousa Villas in Perissa for five nights during our stay in July and have mostly positive feeling about the hotel. The price is really the best thing and you really need to have this in mind as the place was very cheap and much bang for the buck. When we arrived the host Debbie went through a too long check in process when she mostly talked about what we should or "must" do on Santorini and presented many boat tours and noted that we didn't call when our ferry was late which stressed us. She should have focused more on the room details. This also happened when we booked our sailing tour. She was very determined and wanted to really get involved in every part in the planning. We are quite young but would have appreciated more room for own thoughts. But this was also good sometimes during our stay when we felt taken care of. The dad that managed the free transfers was very cute and polite.We stayed in the budget room in the basement. The room was simple but very clean. On the booking it stood that the room had view which is really weird because it was the least of a view we had during our whole stay in Greece. The kitchen was equipped with a quite small amount of kitchenware. Just two of everything and not a big knife. The pool was very good and the location in Perissa excellent. The only thing that was far away was a real supermarket as the nearby market was very small.But for about 35€ per night this place is really good and I would really recommend it to budget travelers.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed 3 nights in this family run hotel. Its location is not in the crowded and busy part of the island so we could enjoy of the quietness of a small town. Very close to Perissa beach (3 min walking) and to very nice restaurants (2 min walking).Despina welcomed us and helped us on planning our visit to the Island. She recommend us few restaurants and a gorgeous bakery as well. Renting a moppet we could visit most of the best parts of Santorini. Our en-suit room was in the first floor of the main building. It had a small balcony with views to the mountain and a small kitchen with all the essential. Very clean.We truly recommend this marvelous place for its quiet location and the friendly hospitality of all the family. We definitely would go back.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B was exactly as we expected.We have done all the large All Inclusive hotels and wanted to give something to smaller businesses and to the Greek economy, rather than be in a massive hotel fighting for sunbeds.This place was the opposite, we had the small pool to ourselves for most of the 14 days we stayed there.We hired quads for touring the island and it was lovely scenery and some interesting places to visit.Debbie is the owners daughter and does all the checking in and spends time telling you all about the island and what it has to offer.Debbie's mother even gave us homemade wine and savouries, on a few occasions, while we were by the pool. what a lovely gesture.Perissa itself is a small little place, with the main road housing bars and restaurants, but we preferred the beach front area, that has a better selection of bars & restaurants.The main road is also pretty narrow and it unnerved my wife every time we had to walk down, so beware if you go there with children.The island itself is gorgeous and Perissa is a great base in which to go and explore the rest of the island.We ate in a lot of different restaurants, that in the main were great, which we will cover in separate reviews and our favourite was Scirroco, great pasta dishes, steak and pizza.Aretousa Villas even supply free wi-fi, safety deposit box and air con, there are noy many hotels/B&B's who provide all that for free in Greece.The rooms are nice and bright and the apartment we had even had flat screen TV's in the living area and in the bedroom.There is a small supermarket within a minutes's walk and it is not much further to high street or the beach.The rooms were cleaned every day and the towlels changed every day.If it's a relaxing holiday you need, in a small family run B&B, close to all amenities, then give it a try.If you want an hotel with hundreds of people and loads of on site facilities, then this is not the place for you, but if you want warm friendly owners, peace & quiet and charm, then you will love this place.Thank you Debbie, George and your lovely wife, for a great holiday.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a family owned accommodation. Its has different types of rooms but all spacious, well equipped and clean. We landed in santorini at midnight and one of the owners was there to pick us up. Our room was the family accommodation and had small working kitchen unit and a balcony to sit in. The location is walking distance from perissa beach and there are local shops nearby. The owner helped us in arranging for a car hire as it makes the stay in santorini very convenient. Parking space is ample nearby. The owners are very hospitable and friendly and always there to help you out. They even suggested some very good places to eat on the island. Definitely recommended!!!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I stayed one week in flat 4 Aretousa Villas! We had a wonderful week.
