The family who run these apartments are welcoming and cannot do enough to help your stay to be completely enjoyable. The location is about 5-10 mins walk to the beach. Very quiet but close to a corner shop and the most amazing bakery. The apartments are clean and well equipped. I would highly recommend them to anyone.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was staying in this beautiful, cozy and clean hotel with my girlfriend for 1 week and we had a great time. The hotel is managed by a Greek family and they really want your stay to be fantastic. They make you feel at home and provide you with good advices and recommendations (tavernas, boat trips, car/quad rental, ...) for your stay. We had the breakfast included and Debbie surprised us with little Greek specialities every morning and taught us some basic Greek words. The apartment and the towels were cleaned every day. The kitchen was also well equipped and had everything which we needed for cooking. All in all we really enjoyed our time and we can highly recommend to stay in the hotel.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean comfortable rooms at a good value with easy walk to black sand beaches, car rentals, restaurants and more! The owners were very warm, friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast offered too! Persissa is a more relaxed area of Santorini for those want to avoid too much tourist mayhem.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great family and staff stayed for 2 weeks in september 2015,picked up and returned to airport they could'nt do enough for you if we go to perissa next year would love to stay again,free wifi,free aircon,free safety deposit box,debbie told us how and where to go on trips out helped us get a car,rooms and towels changed every day,small but adequate pool very clean,we had a room on 1st floor with large balcony i really can't say enough for the aretousa thank's everyone
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just returned from here. The location is excellent. 5 minutes walk from beach, 5 minutes from local bakery, 3 minutes from mini market.Traditional property with light airy rooms. Our room had a covered balcony which made it great for meals. Our room had aircon (essential), fridge, cooking facilities, shower etc.This is a family run business and during our stay nothing was too much problem, we were made to feel like part of the family.the first day we received a map and tips on where to visit and where to eat. trips can also be arranged via the hotel.If we ever go back to Perissa, we would definitely stay here again.Breakfast is also available, although we chose to do our own thing, there is also a swimming pool.Simply a geat place to stay...!!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt at home, so there isn't much more to say! Very nice people, very clean rooms, wifi, close to the beach,good yogurt and vin santo (from the family vineyards) and a magnificent view to the mountain! we'll miss them, until next time!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had a wonderful 5 night stay at this hotel. The family was so hospitable during our stay, from the airport transfers, amazing daily breakfast and expert excursion tips. We felt safe and at home. We will definitely be returning someday!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel and the family that owns it! Was greeted with a friendlyEmail weeks before our arrival. We showed up and the daughter gave us a twenty minute recap of the town, events, and restaurants. From there we enjoyed three nights of bliss! Their pool is great. Best part of the trip was when they offered to take us to the airport no cost! We paid a friendly tip, but was much cheaper than a taxi would have been and it was at 6am! The only thing we had to get used to was the shower has no curtain- expect the bathroom to get wet. Loved this place- want to go back
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a perfect place to stay in.It is a family business, who are very friendly and helpful. They offer a free transportation from/to the airport or port.I stayed for 3 days. When i arrived their daughter had a map for us and explained everything about santorini she even made a plan for us.Lovation next to the beach and bus stop.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and it certainly wasn't enough, the owner picked us up for free from the airport on our very late flight into Santorini which is lovely.Upon arrival he showed us to our room, we had booked a semi basement room which doesn't sound too appealing but it was lovely. We had our own terrace and the room is only a few steps down from the ground and still has windows so the light comes in so it doesn't feel basement like at all! The room had free wifi, free air con and the owner had put a bottle of water in the fridge for us!The room was spotless and cleaned daily, bed was comfortable and couldn't fault the bathroom!The hosts were lovely and invited you to try their homemade wine with them and have a chat.We never used the pool but it looked lovely and clean, the hotel is around a 5 minute walk to the beach and is even closer to the 24hour bakery which is amazing and supermarket! Overall lovely experience, can't recommend this place enough! Will defiantly be returning!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greatest place, 5 min walking to black beach, great hosts very friendly and they answer and help for all our questions , apartment is clear, and cleaning is everyday, thanks for all)many interesting things around, oia, vulcano, and of Cose fresh food)
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great family run business with amazing location just 5 minutes to the Perissa Black Beach. I have lived there for a week which the family had kindly arranged a transfer from the airport . Debbie Is such an interesting and kind owner and made sure we are taken care of. The rooms are gorgeous and cleaned daily. Kudos to the owner and will definitely stay there again if the chance arises.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in a small double room, which was a domed room on the top floor and was actually very spacious, with our own balcony. Our room had a fridge and some cutlery/plates/bowls etc, as well as a kettle. The owners had thoughtfully put a bottle of water in our fridge for us. The apartments were very clean and our room was made up every day. The family who owned the apartments were so lovely and friendly, even inviting us to have a drink & homemade tomato keftes with them on their veranda (the tomato keftes we're delicious and much better than any I had in the restaurants!). Their daughter was very helpful and knowledgable about the island and recommended restaurants in both Perissa and Fira (as we went to Fira for a day). She was also able to arrange trips and car hire etc. The apartments are 5 mins from the beach and very close to a mini-market, bakery, bus-stop and restaurants. Nothing was too much trouble for the family and my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We would definitely stay at Aretousa Villas again and have already recommended it to some friends. Thankyou for making us feel so welcome.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a beautiful and clean accommodation run by a family. From arriving at the airport to leaving they made the stay very pleasant. They were very helpful with suggestions of where to go, what to do and what to eat that made a real difference to our stay. The location is ideal, quiet and a very short distance from the beach, restaurants and the bus stop. Couldn't recommended more, the best 'budget' accommodation I've ever stayed in.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was right on the top, with arched ceilings and my own roof top terrace. It was so beautiful and clean. Air conditioning is included as is the safety deposit. The family are wonderful and can't do enough for you. They will help you organise any trips you would like to go on. They also help with hiring a vehicle and give you lots of helpful tips and advice. The setting is so peaceful with the mountain behind. Just catch a local bus and you can go anywhere. Loved it so much. I can't wait to go again. Thank you. Xx
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great little find,about a 10 mins walk to the beach but they have their own small pool,the apartments were cool clean and fresh but what sets this place apart is the family that own it ,the dad picked us up at the airport and took us to the port,i enjoyed chating to mom in my poor Greek,and had some charming conversations with the daughter and another chance to practice my poor Greek ,just around the corner is a great bakery if you want a nice cake or snack,thanks to the whole family for making our stay so nice.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Santorini for a friend's wedding and a big group of us booked out a number of apartments. Yiorgos, Debby and the rest of the family were the most welcoming group of people you could hope to meet and should be very proud of their villas! The apartments were perfect - very clean, good facilities and kept to a very high standard. Would definitely visit again!
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very lovely people who made you feel instantly at home. Giorgios came to the airport for us, went home again as our flight was delayed ages and he was told by airport staff we had left, came back again when we phoned him, and all with a smile. And flatly refused to be paid for the transfer. Helped us to get a hire car, offered us drinks and snacks, was generally friendly and most welcoming. The room was comfortable, well equipped, very clean and everything one could want. Very handy for the beach, buses, shops. Cannot fault it.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband & I stayed for 4 nights. The owner George met us at the Port & took us back to the airport with ease. George & his wife are very warm & friendly, we were offered a glass of local wine & a chat before going out to dinner. The location is good, 5 mins walk to the beach, bars & restuarants. It is in a quiet area.The rooms are simple & clean, we had a balcony & small kitchenette, with a fridge, sink, kettle & small hob. We ate by the pool, a good breakfast for 4 euros. We would definitley stay here again, very good value.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a wonderful week here and couldn't recommend it more highly. I looked at staying in Fira or Perissa and made the right choice for us. I looked at several places to stay but preferred to have a place with a pool and without a bar so it wasn't noisy at night. They only had a ground floor mountain view apartment available and we were hesitant as prefer to be high up. Anyway, needn't have worried, the apartment was newly refurbished, spacious, immaculately clean (clean towels every day and regular bedding changes) and although the shower room was small, it had an enclosed shower cubicle which prevented the whole bathroom being flooded as can often happen in Greece! The patio just outside the bedroom gave lovely views of the little church up the mountain and the area was very quiet but in a perfect position for all you needed. 1 minute walk to a mini market, 3-4 to a 24 hour bakery and 5 mins from the beach and all the best bars/restaurants. The family were lovely, local to Santorini and very friendly but left you in peace and the dad was waiting at the airport for us on arrival and took us back at a time to suit us. We were given a drink of their wine that they make and a bottle of Santo's wine was left in our room as a present when we returned after a day out. The pool is small but perfectly suitable for swimming and plenty of sunbeds. Wifi signal really strong from our room (not that it bothers me but I know it's important for some). we had a late flight but could leave our luggage and valuables could be left in their house. They also had a loo and shower room we could use and provided towels. I'd love to return to Perissa some day, we had an amazing holiday and would stay here again without a doubt. You are best emailing them direct to book as it's slightly cheaper and you can find out what room you will have.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the place where you do fill welcomed as home. Very clean place. The owners of the villa are very friendly and give you a lot of useful information.Close to the beach and close to the bakery and stores.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was wonderful. The owners are the salt of the earth. The mother, Areti, and father, Jiorgio, and daughter, Thespina, were the best. They bent over backwards to make my stay pleasant and my two days here were the most memorable of my 10 days in Greece. The rooms were clean, the location was perfect (away from all the tourists, yet 200 yards from the black sand beach) and the rooms rates were a bargain. I highly recommend this place. Especially if you are a sucker for kindness, like me.
hotelName:
17    Aretousa Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic villas, peaceful area. We stayed 3 nights and we had great time. The villas are spacious clean and comfortable. Nice area around the pool, very relaxing. Sami is the best, extremely helpful, speaks many languages. Recommend it to anyone who likes a peaceful and relaxing time away. We will miss the breakfast.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the two bedroom villa and throughly enjoyed our stay. Sammi and his team were so helpful - from sorting out lugguage, helping us with their local knowledge and making a lovely breakfast.The villa was delightful and the pool area very relaxing. We loved the relaxed feel about the place - nothing was a hassle. We would definitely recommend contacting Sammi directly to arrange your stay as he helped us to arrange travel arrangements for several of the days activities. Lovely nearby restaurants and Oia centre was a 15 min walk from the villa. Great location.Thanks a million to Sammi.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this property! The location was ideal as it was close enough to walk to Oia (about 10-15 min walk). The room was very clean and very spacious. The host Sam and his family were lovely. They greeted you warmly everyday and chatted you up
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I honestly can write more than 200 words here. My husband and I had a blast in Santorini staying at this villa hosted by Sammy&his wife and Safa. The location, hospitality, and service was great! Miss the place, people and their kindness. I will definitely reserve this place again when I go back to Santorini. Here is what you need to know;Location: is perfect bc it’s minutes away from Oia center by walk. I saw some people complained about the hassle finding this place or walking to it, but let me tell you, get ready to experience the same all over this city. You are going to an ancient/historical place, not walking in Paris, so plz don’t complain about the road. This is basically the structure of the entire Island. Service: This place is so cozy and clean. I work at a biotech company, and I have OCD more than I need to, but I was very comfortable sleeping here because it was very clean.Hospitality: Sammy is great. He is fluent in English, Arabic, French, Greek and god knows what else :) finding places is hard in Santorini. Sammy was very approachable and helpful to help us out to visit the greatest areas. What you need to take with you: Pay for internet to use GPS, international electric plugs, hat for summer, and of course a lot of euros Thank you so much Sammy. Ben and I miss you guys a lot already ♥️
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 days in Santorini and loved Ambelia. Perfect location...Finikia is lovely with great local restaurants and shops. Only 15 mins walk from Oia which is stunning but great to be able to escape the crowds. Our "cave" was gorgeous, so stylish and very comfortable. The pool is great and the whole place is very pretty and so pea. Sammy is a great host very welcoming. Breakfast is simple but lovely. Highly recommend this place to stay...incredible value for money.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My trip to Greece was somewhat last minute since I was going in the high season. When I booked Ambelia, I was a little disappointed that I wouldn't be in the heart of Oia. However, after I arrived, I couldn't have been happier with the location. Santorini in general is a tourist island. It's beautiful, but in the high season, overrun with tourists. Finikia and Ambelia are blessfully positioned a little off the beaten path so it's quiet and peaceful. Finikia is the closest I came to seeing a traditional Grecian island village. It took me about 15 minutes to walk to Oia at a stroll. Several more minutes to walk to the end of Oia where people watch the sunset from. There is a sidewalk most of the way. The property is built into a hillside in the cave style. You cannot drive right up to the property so resort hounds that can't manage their own luggage should make other arrangements. In fact, you can't drive into the village at all. From the main parking lot, signs point you to the property if you're paying attention.The staff was fantastic and helpful without being pushy. Always said hello and goodbye. Asked if I needed anything, etc. The pool area was lovely and a good spot to watch the sunset (without 600 other people clambering over you like in Oia). The rooms were quite large and cool. You have your own terrace area (again, good for the sunset). I slept so well because if you close the shutters, no light gets in. A little too quiet for a New Yorker though so I had to turn on a fan for noise. These types of places can get a little musty when they are shut up so make sure to open the windows when you leave and it's fine. Wifi in the room was good. Cell service was not as it's basically a cave. Just have to step outside to make a call though.Ambelia is also right down the path from Krinaki Taverna which was my favorite dining experience in all of Greece. Overall, a really nice, relaxing stay in a real island village.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: me and my wife stayed at ambelia in June 2018 and really enjoyed our stay Sami the host is fantastic really helpful and full of information on best places to go .its nice and quite and easy to walk in to oiathere are some nice restaurant near the hotel. meze meze is goodavocado is very good which is in imvergoli .if you like fish there is a great place in akatori near the lighthouse. Giorgios.as forbeaches we found perissa a good one you can get a bed with umbrella a pint and a glass of wine 4euro we hired a scooter for the week and explored the island which was 120€
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were recommended this place by someone. It turned out to be an excellent choice. For the sake of a 15 minute walk into the centre of Oia it represented great value for money. To stay in the Oia itself can cost a small fortune. The bed was very comfortable. The rooms were quite basic but in a funny kind of way we quite liked it. The WiFi signal is very weak or non existent. If you need WiFi you need to go to the reception area. Sami advertises satellite? I don't quite know what he means by this. There was no TV in the room and the radio didn't work. Anyway these were only minor irritations. The place was very spacious. Hot water etc was fine. Overall we liked this place. It's main draw for us was the position very close to Oia at an affordable cost. The owner Sami was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was basic but OK. We would recommend this place. There is also a bar/restaurant close by for a last beer on the way back at night. Thanks again Sami and also to the fella who recommended this place. Very pleased overall. We stayed for two nights from the 21st to the 23rd of May before moving onto Naxos
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location – a 15-minute walk from Oia in a pedestrian-only part of town, with the ocean almost always in view. You really don’t feel like you’re staying as close to major tourist attractions as you are. The rooms are simple and clean; you really feel like you could be staying in one of the local homes. You have a view of the ocean; Oia is in walking-distance; and Fira is no more than a 20-minute drive. Sammy is a fun guy with a great sense of humor. He was always available for anything big or small, from making breakfast, to helping us arrange excursions, to simply getting us a taxi to the airport on our way home. If you stay here, you absolutely must go to the only restaurant in town, Krinaki, featured on Andrew Zimmern’s show. Anything with lamb in it is delicious, and the view is beautiful – day or night.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful time at ambelia traditional villas in Finikia. Its just about a 10 or maximum 12 min walk to central Oia. The owner Sam was one of the friendliest people i met on my trip to greece. He helped us with everything we needed and also dropped us to the airport in his own car. The room was very nice and cozy and we loved the view. Complete unobstructed sea view. We just sat in the courtyard of the room with a bottle of wine on both the afternoons we stayed here. The place was so quiet and relaxing we dint wanna leave. The breakfast too was pretty good and the homemade strawberry jam was delicious. I have only dropped 1 star from an otherwise 5 star rating is because the day we reached here we had to walk with our heavy bags on quite a flight of stairs to get to this place which was the biggest drawback. But when we checked out sam made sure he had somebody to help with our luggage. I have absolutely no complaints at all and would recommend everyone to stay here with no worries at all.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were picked up by Sammy from the bus station and stepped into this really cool, traditional and spotlessly clean villa. Very spacious with the most comfortable beds and pillows yet experienced in 3 weeks of travelling the Greek Islands. Less than 10 minute walk into Oia and 2 minutes to some quality restaurants in Finikia such as Meze Meze.The pool was a welcome relief after the 11k walk from Fira to Oia. Breakfast on the terrace was superb with plenty of choice. Sammy is the most charming and delightful host and nothing was too much trouble for him. His recommendations fir restaurants was spot onWould definitely recommend.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our week long stay in this charming hotel. Minutes from Oia with a sea view. Short walk to bus stop stop and store. I liked this hotel because it was away from the touristy Oia downtown so we would avoid the traffic but you could walk into Oia within 15 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy Oia but you want to stay away from the crowds, get more hotel space and be surrounded by locals. Sammy the manager and his family made us feel welcome and they were very helpful. There is a bit of a walk to get to the hotel from the road but we enjoyed the scenery and the quaint path.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay in a 2 bedroomed apartment at Ambelia.Sammy arranged our pick up at the airport which meant we did not have to find our way through the narrow cobbled streets late at night. We loved everything about our stay. Location: in the small village of Finikia which has a few bars and restaurants yet only a 5-10 minute mostly flat walk into the centre of Oia. Quiet and outside the hustle, bustle and traffic of Oia. Position on the hillside overlooking the bay made for fabulous views. Taxi can only get as close as the car park then you have to walk down the narrow streets (traffic-free). We were helped with our luggage at arrival and departure so this was no problem.Apartment:Large, spacious, freshly decorated, well-equipped and with very comfortable beds. There is even a cafetiere for fresh coffee. Built into the hillside so the bedrooms and bathrooms are within the cave which was quite unique. Plenty of hot water and good shower power. Towels and sheets were clean, fresh and good quality. Big front terrace with table and chairs with fantastic views out to sea. Only issue was that bedrooms had interior windows without curtains so lacked a bit of privacy for 2 couples sharing. We hung towels over then which was fine. Facilities: Lovely pool, lots of space to lie around pool but also covered areas. Breakfast served in covered areas beside pool. Reasonable choice of breads , cereal and even a toaster! Delicious greek yogurt and home made jams. Omelettes available made to order for no extra charge.Would stay again without hesitation due to uniqueness of accommodation and hospitality of Sammy,
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a charming Ambelia at ,traditional village Finikia,we enjoy 4 days holiday at may,some day we come back:Oia is so beautyfull and Finikia is good place to stay,its very originally,AMBELIA is great small hotel,thank you Sami! Henna and Niina:)
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our traditional villa here was amazing, newly renovated for the peak season. Fully air conditioned although you won't need it as it's so cool inside regardless of external temperatures. We had a few lights internally and externally that didn't work but nothing to detract from the sea views and spacious accommodation. Breakfast was decent too!Sami the manager was brilliant, very accommodating and would answer anything you needed, even found us a place to watch the United game in town! Always very welcoming and we had some interesting conversations during our stay. Definitely recommend these villas for the price and quiet location, as well as being within 10 min walk of the main town and shops being just on the main road.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice little spot. A good ten minute walk from the main town but well worth the savings because you stay in a cave house, have a pool for the hot hot afternoons, and a wonderful breakfast and staff. We stayed for three nights and had the hotel arrange for shuttles to and from the port. Even when we missed our return shuttle, Sammy drove us in his personal car for the same rate. So sweet!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful, calm, comfortable, clean, magnificent view both day and night and amazing breakfast !There isn't enough words to describe Ambelia ! Me, my little brother and my mother had a very pleasant stay, If you are planing your stay in Oia, this is the place to be !
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reaching ambelia was a bit of an effort for me but once we entered our apartment we forgot the walk.The apartment is very nice with a nice bathroom and good shower.Breakfast is decent and the host Sammy makes the best ham and cheese omelette.My Daughter wanted cold coffee and Sammy made a very good one .Sammy is great help and whatever flaws this place has he covers it with his friendly nature and being helpful.the pool needs its filtration working as the water is not good for swimming.they operate the filtration just in the morning which is not right.No wifi in rooms only at pool area.Location is good.Just ten minute walk to Oia .for the price it's a great place to stay.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Place is nice but not very easy...it's 10-15 minutes far from oia and there are a lot of stairs to do. If you don't have good legs maybe this is not the right place but, in santorini the most part of the hotel are innthe same situation,We' ve been only 2 days but we stayed fine. They are very kind and at our arrival and departure they took our leggages (very heavy) so i say service is very ok
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Popped here for a couple of extra days in Santorini after leaving Dana villas.Wanted a traditional village no frills and out of the way without being to far of beaten track. If you want this then I can recommend Ambelia. First impressions was not overwhelming, but settle in and the quite tones of nothing hits you fast. In fact the birds become the noisiest thing there. It was so pleasant and ideal to chill. Local restaurants are great and costs less than those in commercial / tourist locations. Your well earned Buck goes further here.This is a traditional village, do not expect all the trappings you get from a large tourist location, I hope this place stays like it is, by being traditional it works.Rooms basic but very clean, in fact spotless. Breakfast all home made produce. A sun trap and sunsets are wonderful.If you want quite and solitude for a couple of days to chill, perfect.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was really lovely, clean, spacious, had very friendly staff and beautiful views!The breakfast that was provided was really good, normally I tend to always eat out when on holiday but this breakfast was too good to miss.The rooms were really comfy and clean, there were fresh towels everyday and the bed had been done up for you... not something you would expect in a villa. There were plates, glasses, cutlery and crockery provided so you could make your own meals. The bathroom was really nice, spacious and clean with a powerful shower.They offered parking and it was a very short distance from Oia! Good restaurants close by and a very calm environment.All in all an incredible place and if I do visit Santorini again, I will definitely stay here! Really recommend this place!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Ambelia. We were met by the Pocket Rocket Donny (not sure of spelling sorry) who amazed us by carrying both of our +20kg suitcases at once along the most quaint (and trecherous) path to our room. Sammi (again..spelling..sorry) is a seriously good host, welcoming, knowledgeable of the area and good for an honest conversation of all things from the weather to life, economy and everything in between that you might want to know. Nothing seemed too much trouble for anyone, a smile and an awesome omlette every morning from the team greated us at the pool for breakfast. We had unit 2, a split level sea view villa and it was perfect....clean, spacious and had everything we needed for a total relax. The beds were the most comfortable Ive slept in in paid accommodation. Also, we liked the location which was a 15 minute walk to downtown Oia, close enough for everything including restaurants and shopping of any sort but far enough away to be out of the mayhem of Central Oia. There is a local bus stop just 10 mins walk from the villas which will take you over the whole island. All in all, loved our stay here and would not hesitate to recommend or return if ever we came back to Santorini. Thanks loads Sammi and team :-)
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is great if you want to be close enough to Oia to walk in but far enough away to be quiet, thanks to Sami who runs the complex for the great breakfasts and friendly welcome, the Greek yoghurt with the sour cherries was very nice.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ups: Owner and staff are very friendly and helpful. My room was cleaned daily and towels were changed every day as well. Room is very traditional cave style and very spacious. Although decoration of the room is very simple, that made me feel more authentic local style and reminded me of my grandma's house in a island in my country. Another plus. As it is bit away from Oia, you don't bump with crowds.Downs: Well, for me it was ups but the property is bit far away from Oia centre so if you don't have transportation it can be tough to walk under strong sunlight in summer.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our time at Ambelia Villas was nothing more than average. Staying in a cave villa is really nice and the villa we had at Ambelia was very spacious. However the total experience was nothing to write home about and when taking the cost into account (we booked through hotels.com and paid EUR2,399.00 for 3 days) it was actually below average. Our hosts were helpful and gracious and made a good breakfast each morning. However, this breakfast was no different to what one gets at any other B&B/hotel and actually lacked fresh fruit. On arrival in our room I immediately noticed that the towels were just stacked on a window sill, the baby cot was full of pillows and blankets and not ready to receive a guest, there was grit in the toilet basin from the cracking plaster on the ceiling and when I opened the kitchen cupboard a door knob came off. The following day our bed was pulled straight but the second bed was untouched/not made and the dishes were not washed (there wasn't much even). We asked for it to be taken care of and the next day the beds were made, towels were neatly rolled on the beds and dishes were washed. Finally, I had a crawling baby and the rough cement floors were very hard and sore on his knees. On this trip we stayed in 4 places on different islands and had no problems anywhere else. Also, we stayed in a cave villa in Oia and that place was cheaper, more modern and had a private jacuzzi. There are much better options.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything! Fantastic stay here. Sami, Sisi (excuse the spelling), their super cute twin boys and their staff are great. Everyone is so helpful, friendly & knowledgeable, everything is super clean, fresh towels every day, great views, gorgeous pool and lovely breakfasts. We also met some great fellow guests from lots of different places. Great value for money. Will definitely go back.This is not a criticism & wasn't a problem for us, but please be aware that if you're elderly or unsteady on your feet, access to the villas may be challenging as there are quite a few steep steps and cobbled paths to negotiate. Teenagers beware - there is no TV!! :)
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me, the missis and our 15 year old sleeping machine stayed here for two nights last weekend. We arrived on the Blue Star and we jumped on the small bus which the accommodation arranged for 25 Euro (good value for 3 people as taxi was considerably more). Arrived at the villas about 45 minutes later with a bunch of Kiwis who managed to get their bags carried down to their rooms by the staff!We had villa no.5 which had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and was situated about 20 metres from the bar/pool area. The villa was enormous! You walk in to a lounge area which is about 14ft x 26ft, and there is a small kitchen to one side. We had a super king size bed in our bedroom and our son had a small double. Both bathrooms were spacious and the showers were fantastic for Greece as there was a boiler rather than the usual sun powered bucket of water usually found on the top of Greek apartments!The breakfast was served up in the bar which is next to the pool and there was enough food and variety to keep me going for most of the day (even enough for our 15 year old as he needs to eat at least 5 times per day).I have to mention the people who run the place. Sammy (please excuse the spelling) was the guy running the villas with his wife (apologies for not remembering your name). They couldn't do enough for you, whether it was sorting out a taxi, doing your laundry (bloody Kiwis again!), directions, advice or fixing the bathroom shower-head. I also think the twin boys crawling around without a care in the world really adds to the atmosphere! To walk to the centre of Oia takes 15 minutes. It takes 10 minutes to the start of the pedestrianised area. The walk from the villas is a little up hill and uneven to start, but once you are past the car-park it levels out.Great place, great value and lovely people.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ambelia far exceeded our expectations.The facilities and rooms are modern with fresh decor, the rooms are spacious and each comes with a private patio which is great for sitting out of an evening.Plenty of variety at breakfast and the food is good. The couple who run this place (Sami & his wife) are what really sets it apart though. They remember each guest by name and instantly makes one feel at home. Well done Ambelia ... We will definitely be back!!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Ambelia Traditional Villas from 2nd to 9th June incluisve, as a couple going to a friends wedding. The flight out was delayed and for that and various other reasons we arrived at Ambelia close to midnight. The villas manager (Sammi) met us at the local car park which is a close as you can get by transport as the routes around this area are narrow passage-ways suitable for walking and donkeys only! It's a 5-minute walk from this car park to the villas.The decoration was immaculate and the rooms spotless. Bedding and towels clean and fresh, being changed everyday. There was a small CD/radio music unit and hairdrier provided, and ample sockets around to plug chargers in. Don't recall seeing a TV in our rooms, but in such a beautiful place who would stay in and watch TV!!Our accommodation consisted of a private patio area to the front, leading into the main 'living' area with soffa/bed base and cushions with low table and floor cusions. There was an air-con unit but we never used it. Off this was the bathroom with open shower (yes, it can spray around a bit but it is effectively a 'wet room'. This bathrom had the loo and handbasin with mirror over. Hot water was via an electric heater which Sammi showed how to switch on 15 minutes before having a shower.Off the main room is also a kitchenette with two-ring electric hob, normal under counter fridge with freezer compartment, toaster and electric kettle, sink and waste bin. Cuttlery and plates, cups, glasses, pans, frying pan etc. provided. As was washinh-up liquid and cleaning cloth. A small window leeds to the front for ventilation/sunlight.The bedroom extended off the main living area and had door/windows to separate off if required. This had a large soft bed, side tables with lamps, recess with sheleves for storeage and door way to 'walk-in' type wardrobe hanging area with rail and shelves behind.The main front door had windows either side with internal shutters to keep out the light and insect gauze to keep out the bugs.Breakfast is served under cover by the side of the pool area. The usual tea, coffee, with cheese, ham and bread (toaster there too) plus olive pesto, sun-dried tomatoes, capers, Greek yoghurt, tomatoes and olives. Omlettes or fried eggs to order. Some cereals and traditional biscuits also available. The juice was from concentrate and too sugary for me but that is the only criticism.The pool area has loungers and umbrellas, towels are provided.There were two wi-fi units - one in the breakfast area and one outside the accommodation rooms (which are at a lower level) so unless you were right at the back of the accommodation there's always a signal.Sammi was very helpful with what types of tours or places to visit and helped by 'phoning up to book for us. He also walked up with us to local quad/car/scooter hire to make sure we were well looked after.There is a restaurant (Krinaki) just 3 minutes walk away with good food at good prices, although Ambelia were just setting up other meal facilities.It's a 15 minute walk to Oia and I cannot see how anyone could claim it's longer.Overal, superb accommodtion, convenient and with very very helpful and friendly manager and staff. Thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3d2n. This is very quiet and relaxing place. Room doesn't have wifi coverage and keeping u quiet and away from work. Boss and staff are friendly, nice and helpful. Beautiful pool with sea view. It takes about 15 mins to talk to the oia town and the square. I wld recommend to those budget travellers!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely cave style accommodation just on the edge of Oia. Fabulous manager who even did our washing for us. Big cave, full kitchen, sitting room and bedroom. Very serviceable bathroom. Fresh omelet made for breakfast. No WIFI in room but accessible in the pool/breakfast area. A bit of a walk into Oia but no problem. We thought we were getting caldera views but our seaviews were of the opposite side. No problem though as there are plenty of opportunities for good views while touri g the island. Great value for money considering the prices un Oia.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owner Sammy was extremely helpful and could not do enough for us. The villas, which are very clean and well equipped, are ideally situated away from the hussle of Oia but about a 15 minute walk away making it easy to walk in and watch the sunset over dinner. Every day breakfast was provided with home made goods. Very nice and sociable. Would recommend this place.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little spot of paradise away from tourists (5 mn walk from oia). Spectacular view, very calm, home made breakfast and very cosy and beautiful rooms. Thank you very much Samy, your family & friends for your kindness and help ! See you next time for sure !! Julie & constance
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week with sammy (and the family) ad everything was fantastic.From the home-made cakes and jams for breakfast to the beautiful well kept villas, the place was a joy.A quick 10 minute walk through some winding village paths takes you to the main strip but keeps you away from the noise.Would recommend to anyone!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely decorated villa, with very comfortable and clean rooms. Wonderful breakfasts near the pool. Hosts are extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, with excellent suggestions to cafes/restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights after staying in Kamari beach. We wanted a cliff side getaway, and Finikia is the perfect spot to get the cliffside experience but away from touristy Oia. The location was great - Finikia is a must see, traditional settlement with a cozy coffee shop off the beaten path, and an amazing authentic restaurant called Krinaki. Also a very walkable distance to Oia - or a short scooter ride away. The hosts were great - I enjoyed chatting with them and they were very helpful, offering a map and tips on where to eat. Our room was the very bottom room - so our view was just out to a bunch of shrubs. It was spacious and visually very appealing. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was amazing. Unfortunately, what makes us give this hotel a poor rating was the overwhelming odour of mildew and must that hit you when you entered the room. Our friend who came to visit us in our room even noticed it. Our noses were so stuffed after being in the room for a few minutes that it was hard to sleep, and I just wanted to leave the room.The use of an aircleaner and dehumidifier might help this. We also found it quite buggy - we killed 7 spiders behind the bed before we went to sleep......The breakfast was nothing special. Just some cereal, toast (that they toast for you), and yogurt. The common area was very nice, but the hosts and their son use it as their living area as well, which we found odd when we were sitting outside in the evenings. Next time, we will stay elsewhere due to the smell of mold.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was perfect for our 3-day stay on Santorini. It is not in Oia, but in the neighboring town of Finikia, with beautiful views to the side opposite from the caldera. Our two-bedroom apartment was clean and spacious, just right for our family of four. The hosts were very friendly and helpful, making sure our days were relaxing and fun, they always had some great recommendations about what to do and where to go. Breakfast was homemade and filling. It would not be an easy walk into the center of Oia, so you better rent a car or a quad. Be prepared to climb some steps, but that is the norm for Santorini in general. Wifi only works in the common area near the pool.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing place with fantastic hosts, then this place is perfect for you! If you're looking for something right in the middle of one of the towns with bustling night-life, this isn't it.. We loved everything about our stay at Ambelia. We loved the rooms, the breakfast, the view and especially the hosts. In terms of other European hotels that we stayed in, the rooms here were HUGE! We had a sitting area as well as our bedroom. There is even a small kitchenette. To top it all off, the price is VERY reasonable. I would definitely go back--hopefully for more than 2 nights this time!!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Ambelia for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed this place! It is a stylish and beautiful small hotel with nice view to the Aegean sea. Our cave house was amazing, huge with all the comforts we needed. There some steps to get to the villas but we discovered from the first day that you have to climb stairs everywhere in Santorini unless you stay in a hotel on the road. The breakfast was delicious, authentic homemade greek tastes. The staff was great that gives personal attention to every guest. Finikia is the ideal spot to relax, not far away from Oia’s town. We read some reviews about the location that it’s far away from Oia and you should to walk a lot, but our opinion is that travelers should to read the information more carefully because they say on their website and on Booking.com page that Ambelia is located in Finikia, 800 meters from Oia and we can tell u that Finikia is a very beautiful and traditional village, not crowded and very close to Oia’s town. We also stayed for two nights on the cliff side in Fira, the view was amazing but our room was small and many steps also to climb. So after that, we realized that you pay much money only for the view (that it’s really gorgeous), and I say that, for those people who complain about this, they don't realise what Santorini is all about. We hope to come back soon and stay at Ambelia’s hotel. There is a nice (it’s new) swimming pool in the hotel that you can relax and watch also the sunset from there. Thanks guys for all.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there only for one night, but it was our best night in Santorini! The room was huge with a fabulous view and the breakfast was great! The staff was the highlight! Everything was perfect ! The village is calm and peaceful and only around 15minutes walk to center of oia! And the price is not too expensive, especially for us the students! All in all, great experience and we highly recommend it !
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ci Ci (I hope that is the correct spelling) and Sammie our hosts at Ambelia were simply one of the highlights of our stay. Anything we needed to know about where to eat, places to see and things to do on Santorini were great as opposed to places that were recommended in broachers. That knowledge is priceless to tourist like ourselves. Have very fond memories of a genuine Greek experience and will never forget their genuine friendliness.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: our cave house was beautiful, spacious and clean with king size bed-very comfortable. Nice view from our veranda to other cyclades islands. The location - Finikia is a beautiful village, 800 meters far away from Oia as they advertise on their site. The staff was extremely helpful, frinedly and informative. We will miss the welcoming real homemade breakfast. We definitely recommend the Ambelia hotel!!!! A cozy swimming pool will be open this month or the next one.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were picked up at the ferry terminal by a transfer that the hotel had arranged for us. They were in time and polite enough. When they dropped us off at the hotel, we walked down the 5 minute walk down the cobbled steps to arrive at the villa where Sammy was waiting for us with a huge smile and a friendly hello. After a long day of travel that is exactly what we needed.He showed us to our villa, which was a cute little 'cave' type house. Everything was lovely, from the comfy double bed, the well equipped kitchen, the huge shower and even the general amenities needed, such as the hair dryer to keep the girlfriend happy!Once we had settled in, we decided we wanted to rent a quad bike, to which Sammy jumped at the opportunity to help us, he took us down to a local quad bike rental in his car, a short two or three minute drive, where we rented the quad the duration of our time there.This helpfulness from Sammy continued throughout the whole stay. On our third day it our anniversary, and I had asked Sammy to arrange something special for us, so he went to the capital of the island, a good 15 minute drive, to pickup some specific flowers for the girlfreind, and while we were out, arranged them in our villa nicely.The next great thing about ambelia was the breakfasts... Oh the breakfasts! I had heard off some reviews before we arrived that the breakfast was disappointing, and that it consisted just of bread. These are wrong! Sammy was constantly bringing us fresh juices, toast, and continental breakfast, and when we thought that was amazing, he asked us if we would like anything else, a omelette, a toastie, I slice of fresh homemade cake made from wife's recipe. All in all, this was a perfect stay at ambelia traditional villas. The location is slightly out of town, but only about a ten minute walk, 15 max! But the price, the decor and ambience, and Sammy more than make up for the little walk. Thank you Sammy for making our stay here absolutely perfect!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an amazing time, the property owners were so hospitable and couldnt do enough for us, and prepared great breakfast for us every morning and Cici even made a cake especially for my dad. Apartments clean and spacious, and in a relaxed atmosphere, couldnt ask for more.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed in one of the family cave rooms for 7 nights. We absolutely loved it! Our rooms are clean & spacious. Cleaner always comes in and change our bed sheets and clean our rooms everyday. Couldn't ask for anything more! Where our accommodation is located is about 15 minutes walk from Oia. We actually didn't mind the walk as it gave us the opportunity to see the surroundings first hand otherwise wouldn't be able to if via car. Our host have been exceptionally wonderful and made our stay very comfortable! Lovely couple! They were happy to do our washing for free! Breakfast was superb!We used public transport to get around the island. How easy it was to get around and it was cheap too. The bus stop is only 5 minutes away. We would definitely come back again. We can't wait until when they have installed a swimming pool by next year!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay in Ambelia very much!!! The hotel is a small oasis!!! Our cave villas was really spacious, clean with tastefully decoration and great view to the Aegean sea. The breakfast is unique with homemade cakes, omelets and jams!!!! (many choices /the best breakfast ever that we had so far)!!!! The hotel is located in the traditional village of Finikia, an easy walk to OIA (15 min. walk). But what makes the place so special is its hosts. The charming couple who run the hotel is just amazing!!! They are kind, extremely helpful, informative and full of suggestions!!! Thanks for everything, we shall definitely be back again!!!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay in Ambelia. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel very welcome. The cave villa was very spacious and very cool with everything we needed for our 8 night stay. The bed was large and nice and comfortable and the villa was spotlessly clean. Towels were changed daily and the owners offered to do any washing we had free of charge.The breakfast area was lovely and there was something for everyone. The homemade jams/marmalade were beautiful, as were the cakes. We had breakfast at our villa on a few occasions too. We had freshly made omelette every morning too. Ambelia is located in a traditional Greek village which we loved, there is a taverna in the village and it's very peaceful away from the hustle and bustle of Oia, but within easy walking distance taking 10mins. If you want to view the sunset from it's best vantage point it's about a 20 mins walk. This was not a problem for us and actually very enjoyable after dinner in Oia.We would definitely recommend Ambelia, it was great value for money and we received a genuinely warm and friendly reception from the couple who manage the villas. They recommended many places for us to eat and visit and were happy to make reservations/book taxi to airport for us. Nothing was too much trouble. Thank you for making our stay in Santorini truly memorable.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Ambelia for our first leg of our stay (3 nights) in Santorini before meeting friends in Fira. It was hard to know what to expect when we booked this online as this is our first time in Greece. I wish we could have spent our whole stay in Santorini at Ambelia but the place was not available when our friends arrived. This place is beautiful and for us, it was way more than what we had expected. We had spent time in Athens and Mykonos already and has been staying in small quarters (there were three if us) so our 2 room suite was heavenly. I liked our view of the northeast. We didn't mind the short walk into Oia and did this walk several times a day. This was not at all a problem for us. We preferred and loved how peaceful it was here and that it was away from the hussle and bustle of Oia. The couple who run Ambelia are truly wonderful, extremely hospitable and are the kindest people ever. They gave us lots of tips, drove us to the dock for a boat excursion, and even did our laundry for no extra charge. The breakfast meal had something for everyone's taste. The managers have many great recommendations. A highlight for us was the walk down and back up the stairs to Amoudi; we swam in the bay to the left of the restaurants as recommended by the managers. It was truly amazing and I am so glad we found out about this; make sure to bring water shoes. And swim and explore the little uninhabited island at the bay. I can see why so many travellers love Ambelia and gave it high ratings. And for the not so great reviews, I agree: if you don't like to walk, do stairs or be in a more secluded part of Santorini, this is NOT the place for you. But for us, we would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose to stay here as it was slightly cheaper than the places closer in to the main part of Oia, but still only about 700 metres or something right into the centre of things. We were greeted by the friendly onsite manager who even carried our bags for us down to our apartment/cave room. The room was really large with a little kitchen and was very clean. It had a private outdoor sort of area with nice views out over the ocean. As with most Santorini accommodation, there were lots of stairs, but if you aren't prepared to tackle stairs I would recommend avoiding Santorini altogether! There were lots of little convenience stores close by, and a cute little restaurant that did both take away and dine in. We were able to call up and order our food and then go to get it and eat it out on our little patio overlooking the ocean. The only downside was that we didn't have wifi in our room, but we were able to access free wifi in the communal area where we were served delicious and generous breakfasts home cooked by our hosts, so this made up for any reason for us to be upset!! They also did our washing for us (we were weary for a few months of travel so this was so so so so appreciated!).I loved this place, and I loved our friendly hosts who provided us with just about everything that we could want. I would recommend it to anyone!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ambelia is a beautiful hotel and would definitely recommend it and stay there again! Our villas was very clean, with well-appointed living room, kitchen and bathroom. Unforgettable mattress, terrific view, exceptional service. the hosts are attentive, informative and friendly. The breakfast was delicious with excellent health options like homemade marmalade and omelets. Finikia is a traditional and peaceful village, with unique natural beauty, just the right distance from Oia's town (a nice walk -10 min). Nothing to complain, excellent value for money.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ambelia’s villas is comfortable and has a great view on the Aegean Sea . Everything about this hotel is exceptional, from the very clean and spacious villas to the excellent service, to the great value. Finikia is a small beautiful village with very impressive cave houses, just 10 minutes walk from Oia’s bustle! The real attraction to this place is the wonderful, helpful couple, who run the hotel and is so lovely and make you feel so at home. Nothing was too much trouble, friendly welcome with drinks, car hire arranged for us, great breakfast, (amazing array of homemade cakes), full of suggestions! Anything you need doing they attend to straight away, and always with a smile. Stop looking – book this hotel now!I'd highly recommend to everybody, thanks guys for everything- we hope to see you in the future again!!!! A big kiss to your lovely son!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed in this family-run business for 4 nights, and only wish we could have stayed longer! The place is quiet and less than 15 min walk from Oia. The villas with the amazing view on Cyclades islands, the service, the breakfast, the hospitality / everything is excellent and perfect with all the comforts you need – and really well worth it. The staff are very kind and helpful - friendly and funny also, they arranged everything for us (rent a car, day trip to the volcano, recommendations of restaurants and sights to visit – don’t miss ammoudi bay!!!). They were ready all the time to do anything they could for us. * highlights: 1 the traditional taverna near to the hotel (Krinaki)2 the rich breakfast with homemade cakes and local delicatessies! So overall, you will not be disappointed if you stay at this wonderful hotel.
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 5 days and it was fantastic! The location was perfect as well being so close to Oia’s town (only a short walk away). It’s situated in Finikia village (about 10-15 minutes walk from Oia’s center). Finikia is a very beautiful and peaceful village, is the traditional setting of Oia full of cave houses which are very impressive. Our cave house in Ambelia was fantastic and had a great sea view - full equipped - very clean with a real king size bed and unforgettable mattress!!! The breakfast buffet was just lovely with a lovely variety of homemade and local delicacies. The couple who run the hotel was very friendly and accommodating, Thanks to both of you guys Vasillis – Sissy and the relaxing time we had in Ambelia. Ideal for couples wanting a quiet and stylish break! Highly recommend a stay here!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall an excellent place to stay in Santorini. We stayed for couple of days in June and we were so glad to be there. The Villas are so spacious, perfectly clean and we had amazing sunset view every evening from our terrace. Vasilis and his wife Sisi are taking the best care of their guests. They made us warm welcome even it was very early in the morning. We also got great recommendations about renting a car, local restaurants and nicest beaches. The location is superb, It is just 10 minutes walk to the center of Oia village. There is a great vineyard and beautiful beach in walking distance as well. It's a traditional and relaxing place with friendly atmosphere. Thank to Vasilis and Sisi for their sincere hospitality and for making our stay really special and memorable.If we go to Santorini we will definitely stay again!
hotelName:
18    Ambelia Traditional Villas
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had the most relax moments at thisbeautiful hotel . calm just right next to the beach . amazing pool everything is clean and calm . the rooms are fully equipped (small kitchen ). the breakfast around the swimming pool is the ideal way to start your day . i will definitelly go back next year
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and our 21 year old daughter stayed several nights in May, 2019. The hospitality was wonderful. Breakfast was perfect. We had not been to Santorini since our honeymoon 25 years ago. We were pleased to see that once you leave the main tourist areas, the old charm still exists. We hiked up to the church on the hill. The hillside was in full bloom with wild flowers. The scent of blooming thyme was incredible. I would certainly return to Samson's Village is I make it back to the island.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is within 3 minutes ish from the beach , and if you've hired a car parking is easy. Staff here are very friendly and helpful. The hotel has 21 rooms which are well appointed and comfy. Great pool and lounge chairs to sun yourself and a bar if you want to give the beach a miss. Only small worry for Same One is that they have no proper kitchen , and so provide snacks and breakfast from their cramped bar ... so eating out on the seafront , and all over Santorini has been a great experience. Plenty of eateries here at Perissa across the long beautiful seafront , including even a really great indian restaurant.We both would like to come back to Samsons again.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have visited this place and I can say that it is well maintained, reasonably priced and staff is always there to help you. It is to remember that it is not a 5 star hotel however the hosts make every effort to make your stay pleasant. Pool area is nice and it is not far from beach. Shops and restaurants are nearby.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in August while attending a wedding, the staff were the highlight, they were friendly, courteous, helpful and efficient in all aspects of their work. As well it should be said what a lovely complex, well kept rooms were of a great size and spotlessly clean. Our only criticism, which note don't stop us giving 5 stars would be that a slightly larger bathroom would be preferable, however everything worked well. Highly recommended, try it out.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the gorgeous Samson’s Village for a week in August, with the aim of a relaxing holiday whilst still having time to explore the sites and scenery of the beautiful island. Having landed in Santorini at 1am local time it was 2am by the time we arrived from the airport via a pre arranged transfer with the hotel. The driver met us at the airport and was very friendly, carrying our bags and giving us a descriptive tour of the island whilst driving us to Samson’s. As it was late when we arrived at the hotel he provided us with the pre arranged key card and showed us to our room. The room was beautiful, clean and traditionally decorated. Had a small kitchen with a hob, fridge, kettle and enough utensils to make a basic meal. The bathroom was a little on the small size but that’s probably traditional but nothing that wasn’t usable or practical. The next morning we visited reception where we met Helen who was very polite, and more than happy to assist us in getting the most out of our visit. She provided us with useful information about the hotel and local restaurant offers, places to visit locally in Perissa as well as locations for shops, the bus stop in addition to timings for the buses and different options of getting about the island. Helen also provided us with various trips and excursions available to do whilst on the island in addition to car hire options. Any further questions we had or if we wanted anything organising she was more than happy to do it all for us and go that extra mile to ensure we had a great stay. All the staff were so helpful and welcoming and made our stay one of the best we’ve experienced whilst holidaying across many parts of Europe. Minas who runs the bar (also does a lot of other jobs at the hotel if you ask him too) was great, providing us with entertainment, humour and all round great customer service. Nothing was ever too much for him or Helen who both go above and beyond to ensure you have the best stay possible and are a credit to Samson’s.Samson’s Village is in an ideal location, just a minutes walk from the Black Beach and the bars and restaurants that run along its front. Helen provided us with a card for 10% off at Apollo and Acropolis restaurants which we used which is a nice touch. Helen organised a boat trip for us, as well as car hire fir a day which we used to explore the island, in particular Oia and Pyrgos, where we watched the sunset over the island. With our return flight home in the early hours and check out at 12:30pm, we still made the most of our last day on the island and decided on spending it relaxing by the pool with a few of the other guest we’d made friends with during our stay, not to mention Minas and Helen who we shared drinks with by the pool before our transfer home. Early checkout from our room didn’t affect us as Helen, Minas and owner Joan happily let us use the bathroom facilities at reception to freshen ourselves up before our onward journey. Samson’s is a small hotel that is quaint, picturesque yet full of character with great customer service. We had a fantastic time and highly recommend staying at Samson’s Village - we will definitely come back! Seb & AliceXX
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a 2 week stay at Samsons. It’s a gorgeous place to stay, so clean and picturesque and all the staff are so helpful and we were made to feel so welcome they are all a credit to Samsons. It is an ideal location, just a minutes walk from the beach and bars and restaurants. We were given a card by Samsons for 10% off at Apollo and acropolis and we used these two places regularly as the service and food there was fantastic.Helen organised a boat trip for us and advised us about places to go and we had a fantastic time.I can highly recommend this place and we will be back x
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in this hotel 2 weeks whit my wife and my child 3 years old . Hotel staff were very friendly and ready to satisfy any desire. Every day you found the rom clean and new towels , we were happy to meet Milos (the boy at the bar), Heleny (receptionist) and Ianis (manager), these people made our stay very pleasant. The breakfast is very good and you can choice of a smaller or bigger, smaller 8€ , bigger 10€ ( very good prices). The swimming pool was clean every day , nice traditional Greek-style rooms, the location of the hotel it’s near the beach and restaurants ( 5 min). I truly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed at Samson Villas in Perissa, Santorini for 5 nights from 4th July 2018.We choose Perissa based on recommendations from friends, we choose well.Samson Villas was selected on pictures, location and amenities.It's about 25-30 mins from the airport, we had room 4. It was like a 2 bed studio, no door between rooms but separate. Making a big difference to the sleeping, flow and vibe of the holiday. Excellent AC, worked a treat, fridge, wardrobe, safe, hairdryer (wall mounted), shower, products, thick clean towels daily. The beds were supremely comfortable and the pillow was good quality, not a wafer!The pool is set at the rear of this establishment, so no roadside peepers. Bar open from 8.30 to 11.30pm, snack drinks usual suspects, tasty and fresh.Minas at the bar is understated, but attentive and keeps the area surpervised and clean. Sunbeds and towels, which can be taken to the beach, which is 5 mins away.The design of each villa appears different, but the classic blue and white is very authentic and tasteful..Housekeeping is high quality, on site, visible and helpful. Check in & out smooth and easy, also you can use the pool and facilities without charge, there's a shower room in the Reception area that you can use before your onwards journey.1st time in Santorini and Samson villas, will definitely be back, and I highly recommend this establishment. Its an excellent base for your holiday and the caring team of Helen, Minas and John provide a calm vibe and happy surroundings even better.:))
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in June with lots of family and friends for a wedding in Santorini. We were made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. Our room was lovely with a typical Greek feel. Good selection of drinks and snacks from the pool bar. We will be back again.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at Samsons Village as part of a wedding party.I booked a room that slept 4 people although only 2 of us occupied the room.The location of Samson's village at Perissa beach is very good. A 2 minute walk to the beach and an abundance of restaurants.The room was fine. To accommodate 4 people the layout of the room includes a mezzanine floor with a double bed and 2 single beds at ground level. With 2 adults it was fine, with 4 adults in the room I expect it may feel a bit of a squeeze. The room also provided a good sized balcony front and backThe hotel has a modest size pool and a pool bar.The best part of the hotel and the highlight for the group was the staff. The staff were very friendly, accommodating and went above and beyond to meet our needs and if they are reading this I would like to express on behalf of the group our thanks for looking after us so well.I would have no hesitation in recommending Samson's village
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to Greece & very happy we decided to stay at Samsons Village.We stayed 8 nights.Very friendly management & staff especially Helen in reception.we had booked an economy studio which was excellent value for money,There is no balcony in economy but plenty of space with a small terrace with 2 chairs. The king size bed is huge & very comfortable,There is also good air conditioning.A small kitchen area & a good size fridge. A television but no international channels. The bathroom is small but one problem the floor is always very wet.There is also a safe in the studio.plenty of wardrobe space for 2 people,There is a great pool with comfortable sunloungers.There is a poolside bar serving drinks coffees etc.You can take breakfast around the pool area but it’s disappointing.. €6 is good value but the quality is not good.There are some great bakery’s in the area and I am surprised Samsons don’t get nice fresh bread, rolls baguettes etc rather than supermarket sliced bread.Samsons is located less then 2 minutes from the beach with plenty of restaurants & sunloungers on the beach.The sea was warm enough to swim in.A visit to Ola to see the sunset is a must and Samsons can arrange transport.So to sum up a lovely holiday & we would hope to return to Samsons next year
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Samson's Village for eight nights for our honeymoon. It's a lovely layout and looks just like the pictures. Our room was lovely and clean and an alright size. We had a kitchenette and table, bathroom and bedroom. In the corridor was plenty of wardrobe space with a safe too. We also had a balcony area with table and chairs. Our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and the whole hotel area and pool was kept lovely and clean.The staff were all so helpful and nice. This made a big difference with our stay! It was the perfect location too. Just around the corner from the beach and loads of nice restaurants nearby. We much preferred the Perissa area as it didn't have all the cruse ships like the other towns. There is also a bus stop at the end of the road to Fira and a small village supermarket.There were only two small things - a tea towel in the kitchen would have been really handy to wash our dishes, as we ended up using one of the hand towels! Also there was not always a staff member around the pool, so were sometimes waiting to see someone to ask for a drink. However we did go at the start of May and this was before the season fully started.Overall such a lovely place and we would definitely come back!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I had a fantastic 10 night stay at Samson's Village. Our children are 10 and 7 and enjoyed the pool which was never too busy despite being high season. The staff - Yannis, Marinos and Konstantina - were very helpful and friendly. A special thanks to Marinos who worked so hard and was so lovely to chat to. The housekeeping staff were also fantastic and the accommodation was cleaned daily and it was spotless. The hotel is only 2 minutes from the beach and 5 minutes from the waterpark which our children appreciated. It has a very chilled out feel to it which has been a welcome change from previous all-inclusive holidays and there are loads of beautiful restaurants to choose from nearby. Once again, thanks to everyone at Samson's and we would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having booked Samson’s Village on the internet we were hopeful that it would live up to expectations as you can never really be sure about a place until you get there. Samson’s Village surpassed expectations. It is a beautiful set of self-catering apartments maintained to very high standards. It was nicely decorated and well laid out. The complex is perfectly located a couple of minutes walk from the beach in one direction and a couple of minutes from the main street in the other. The young people who run the place, John, Konstantina and Marinos, are lovely and go out of their way to make sure every guest has the best stay they can have. They are always friendly, happy and very helpful. The rooms were very well maintained, cleaned every day and fresh, fluffy towels changed daily. Other touches which made the apartments stand out were things like liquid hand soap in the bathroom and washing up liquid in the kitchen. The apartments were all very well equipped and we even had a brand new toastie maker in ours as well as a new halogen hob! Unusually for these types of apartments the air conditioning and safe were included in the price which was nice and the free wifi was very good too. The pool area was quite small but very nice, always clean and they provided large towels for use round the pool and on the sun loungers. The rooms vary in style and size and as we were a large party I saw several different rooms, all of them very nice. The first room we had (35) was lovely. It was on the second floor so there were quite a few steps up to it which might be a problem for some people. It had a large balcony at the front with views of the mountains as well as a private sun deck at the back. It was quite spacious with a double bed and a single. The only problem for us was that the double bed was on a mezzanine floor up some steep, open stairs. Whilst it looked nice it wasn’t suitable for us because of the steep stairs (wife has a dodgy knee). Without any fuss Konstantina changed us to another room (12) which was just as nice but on the first floor and the whole apartment was on one level.
