The lowest level rooms don’t have balconies or a view as they are below ground level but are cheaper because of this. Having stayed in many different self-catering apartments in various Greek islands I can honestly say that Samson’s were the best and I would definitely recommend them to anyone. This was a very special holiday as it involved 48 relatives and friends all getting together for the wedding of my youngest niece. Having been to Santorini before we chose Perissa as the resort to stay because it is very flat and everything is close together making it most suitable for my mum in her wheelchair. We had 14 nights at the beginning of June and wish we could have stayed longer. Many thanks to John, Konstantina and Marino for helping to make this the best holiday ever for all our extended family.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family run hotel. Located near a great beach, with restaurants and bars close by. Short drive to the city centre. Great for families. The girl behind the reception was lovely. Our room was great. Loved our stay here.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I do not do reviews very often but this hotel definitely deserves an excellent review!! We (my husband and myself) were welcomed at the airport and driven to the hotel by the hotel owner Giannis (John) who is such a humble, kind and pleasant man. Check in was quick and efficient. Our first impression of the hotel was that we needed to take pictures of this very pretty setting immediately! We stayed 15 nights and could have stayed a lot longer! We just loved being there for many reasons: All the staff were excellent at what they did and service could not have been better. The hotel surroundings were beautiful, the room was spacious and kept clean by the efficient staff, the kitchen facilities were adequate, the pool area was 1st class, quiet and relaxing. We did have a problem with confirmation of our British Airways flight but Konstantina was so helpful in fixing that issue. She even messaged us to see if we had managed to get on the 'plane and reached our next destination and to make sure that we were safe (That was the week of the London disaster). A very pleasant, efficient lady who is a valuable staff member and a credit to the hotel. Marinos was another staff member who made a big impression on us for his very pleasant manner, efficiency and again his humility won our hearts. He took us back to the airport and he enlightened us re some of the history of the Island and Greece.In summary, this is one of the best hotels we have every stayed in and we have stayed in many over the years! Hats off to the wonderful staff! We would definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The young lady at check in was amazing! She was a one woman show from check in to making our drinks and even our cheeseburger! I enjoyed our stay and loved learning about local cultural through our daily chats :) I will definitely be back in the future! She got our 4 wheeler/quad/ATV booked and delivered to the hotel! Easily walkable to all the beach bars and restaurants and there is a bus stop right off the main road...you don't have to go all the way to the end of the line. I will definitely be back to Santorini and I will always choose Samson's Village to stay!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and we will definitely go back .Arrived at the airport and we were picked up by the hotel shuttle service , no hassle.. lovely guy ( manager of the hotel ) drove us to the hotel .... smooth and quick check in by the very lovely Constantina who throughout our stay was extremely kind and helpful , in fact all the staff are lovely Our room was immaculate and perfectThe pool was amazing and the cocktails fab too ! Walking distance 5 mins to beach , restaurants , shops , bars One word ..... perfect
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apart from the beauty of the mesmerizing island, the beautifully designed hotel along with a very friendly and accommodating staff made our stay comprising of four families a perfect one to be remembered for a very long time.The hotel was very close to the beach. Restaurants, shopping center and getting to the public transport was a few minutes walk. The rooms were well maintained.The staff, in particular, needs to be mentioned for their services and they were doing all necessary to make our stay very comfortable. They also did arrangements for our transfer from and to the airport, arranging tours with the tour operators and were always forthcoming to help us out in whatever manner they could.Thank you, Giannis, Konstantina, and Marinos for your excellent service and making our stay a special one.In case of visiting Santorini again, Samson's village would be our first choice :-)
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well our Santorini stay was rather short but we were very fortunate that the staff at Samson's Village were very accomodating! First, the check in was easy and fast. Our room is the one right in front of the pool that they are using for their main image. The room was great, spacious and very clean. The pool was nice and we relaxed in it a few times. The walk to the beach was only a few minutes and it put your right at a spot that had tons of restaraunts, gelato joints and Gyros! There is a GREAT gyro place down the plaka! Then, the main road in to Perissa is another quick walk and right at the end is a market that we shopped at for wine, beer and some veggies. What topped it off though was leaving. We had a 00:45 flight to Rome. The staff let us keep our stuff in the main lobby, let us use their restroom to bathe and clean up and helped arrange a pick up for us to the airport. We left Samson's around 10:30. When, not if, we go back we will be staying here!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is lovely. Very traditionally Greek and very pretty.The staff are friendly, always willing to help with anything you need. Give advice on good nightlife, restaurants etc in the area.Great location with a very short walk to the beach and bars and restaurants!Rooms were cleaned daily but don't leave anything you want out! The cleaner has a habit of chucking things out that aren't finished! She also hosed our windows down and filled the room with water, wetting suitcases etc.I would stay here again though if I ever return to santorini, it really is a lovely hotel.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely place to stay and the staff are most helpful and attentive, but make sure that you get a room above ground level because the basement rooms are a bit gloomy and don't get any fresh air. It is very close to the beach without being on the main thoroughfare & it is very reasonably priced.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice family hotel, walking distance to the beach. The rooms were ok, the toilet a little old would benefit from some refurbishing. The breakfast a little disappointing (cakes and croissants quite artificial). The service was excellent. Overall good quality-price.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a minutes walk from Perissa Beach this was a real find! Very comfortable, clean accommodation. Lovely views from all windows. Owners very helpful and friendly.Lovely to just relax around the pool or stroll down to sea front for evening meal. Lots of really good places to eat. Would come here again if visiting Santorini.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, with comfortable mattress. We stayed in room #12, it had a bedroom and a separate kitchen. The only semi-negative, it is the bathroom. The shower is very small, but manageable. The staff was great and helpful. It is not on the beach, but only 1 minute walk. Book your transfer with them, cheaper and very convenient.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything. Perfect. Amazing. It was our honeymoon, and they were super!!! Everything we need, every question...they helped. Thank you guys. Thank you for all! :)All the best. We will be back for sure!Joao and Sara , from Portugal!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cute village, located in a strategic position in Perissa, 2 mins walk from the beautiful black beach and close to lots of restaurants and tavernas. From the moment when we stepped in, the staff, especially Maria, was absolutely amazing, giving us any kind of advice and information we requested.The room itself was a bit small but well equipped, providing us everything we needed for our stay. The day when we checked out we were given the possibility to use to swimming pool as much as we wanted and also to take a shower, which was a great help.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most amazing staff, helped out in every way possible even the day AFTER I had left the hotel, I would come back here in a heart beat - small shower but do you really need a shower with the beach a 100 metres away or when the hotel has a big pool and day beds which has its own outdoor shower to wash off the salt?
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ...said my wife, when she arrived at 6am. The rest of the family had arrived the day before, but that's what happens when you lose your passport: you end up on the 2am flight from Rome arriving Thira at 5am.But it was worth it. Samson's is a special place. Most people seem to stay for a few nights but we were there for 15. Everything was about perfect; the pool was literally half a dozen steps away from our room, it was mostly empty, and there was hardly any fighting for sun loungers. Some new arrivals tried to reserve loungers for the whole day, including during extended lunches. But I found you could just wait for half an hour, then move their stuff. When (if) they come back many hours later, just deny all knowledge of anything. However, it might be useful if the management put up a notice saying "sun loungers cannot be reserved" in 5 languages, as this might help prevent antisocial behaviour.Anyway, that's a small quibble. The staff were incredibly helpful, especially John, the owner. When one of our kids was ill and had to go to the doctor at 10pm, John not only drove us there but on to the hospital afterwards. He only went home at 2am when we insisted on it - otherwise he would have stayed all night. I have never come across this level of helpfulness in a hotel. Part of it may be just the Greek character, but most of it was simply John. Many, many thanks.We were in room 13. Ideally placed for the pool and the wifi, but it only had a two-person terrace for 4 people. We mentioned this to Anna in reception, and she insisted that we should just use the bar tables just outside the room instead. As the bar area was almost deserted most evenings, we effectively had our own large poolside terrace.So, one of the best holiday hotels I've stayed in - especially for the price.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to perissa beach, this hotel is a very warm and cozy feel... clean rooms and great service... loved my stay there and would consider when i go again!! The staff gets a special mention as they were very helpful and friendly... Value for money hotel.....
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a must stay, if you visit Perissa. A very friendly hotel with great service served by Anna and John. Nice pool and just a minute from the beach with good food and bar's. The bus goes from the main road just few minutes away.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 6 nights. The hotel is really beautiful with blue decorations and flower blossoms. Right next to the beach and restaurants. Staff are very welcoming and will always be there to help and give good advice. Would definitely recommend Samsons Village.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about Samson's village was exactly what we had hoped for after seeing all the positive reviews online. The staff were so helpful and friendly, going out of their way to help us plan trips, make restaurant bookings and always had time to answer questions. We felt so welcomed from the moment we were fetched from the Ferry until we were dropped at the airport. The pool area was an oasis of calm and relaxation - we ordered cocktails from the friendly barmen and tanned or soaked in the lovely water. Our room was compact but we were expecting that. Very comfortable bed!! Bathroom was clean and had everything we needed. Again they have used space wisely so it is a little compact, but how much time do you spend inside? Not much with all that Mediterranean sun and sea calling you outside! The little kitchenette was a real bonus and the table and chairs outside our room were nice for having a drink.We did take a peek into a few other units and they all varied in size and layout so it really depends which one you get. I think we had unit 12.The location of the Hotel is excellent. Just two tiny little streets away from Perissa main beach - with lots of restaurants and sunbeds. I fell in love with this place, so relaxing! If you enjoy swimming - bring swimming goggles as you could swim for miles along Perissa beach! Also only 3min walk from a mini-market where we stocked up on snacks and drinks a few times. There was a bus that could take you to Fira and from there to all over the island. We took the bus a few times and once or twice took taxi's.Thanks to all at Samson's Village for making this such an amazing holiday for us!!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We're coming to the end of our stay in santorini and we have had a wonderful time. Firstly, the hotel is brilliant-welcome is second to none (try to remember to book your transfer directly with the hotel for €15 each way). Rooms are fairly basic but more than adequate. Main things are that the beds are nice and comfy and facilities clean. Kitchenette area has 2 hot plates. The shower areas are quite small and compact but wasn't a major problem for the 2 of us as we pretty much only used the room to sleep in and ate out most days.The main feature of the hotel is the pool area which is so so peaceful. The sun loungers are exceptionally comfortable and the area is a total sun trap. It really is perfect. The complex is very small which adds to the tranquility but the pool area is more than adequate. Pool temperature was perfect too! Jon (hotel owner) told us to make ourselves at home and enjoy the use of the pool area/furniture as much as we liked. Nobody from the hotel hassles you for meals/gifts/information, you are just left alone to enjoy your holiday. Anna (manager) and (Jon) amongst other staff are always on hand to answer any questions/provide assistance/recommendations/dinner reservations. They have a fantastic team of people working here.Location was amazing-30 second walk to main strip in perissa where we ate out most nights. We travelled to Oia which was stunning but I'm glad we stayed where we were and made the visit there as it seemed inundated with tourists/very busy. Prices on island are generally higher in oia too. Our favourite lunch was the gigantic salads at 'tranquilo' (only buy one between 2) and we also enjoyed the gyros from 'grandma's recipe''Noxa' was our favourite place for dinner. Most of the other eateries are fairly similar.Overall loved the holiday and we're pretty certain we want to come back again next year!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous place! Staff are extremely helpful and friendly. I had a lovely birthday celebration in Thira, which the staff at Samsons village arranged on our behalf. The rooms are very clean and in an ideal place for the beach and to access other parts of the island. Spent 6 days there before moving on to Crete... Highly recommend for anyone planning a trip to Perissa
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second trip to Santorini, this time I stayed at Samsons village after reading trip advisor reviews and it does not disappoint. I stayed for 4 days where I was meeting friends for a reunion holiday. I emailed the hotel before to ask for transfers to and from the airport which was £15 each way. They were so friendly on arrival and nothing is too much to do. My room was no. 5 up on the top floor and it had a balcony view of the pool, was clean, spacious, has aircon and love the little kitchenette. The hotel is less than 2 mins walk from Perissa beach which is the best for a bit of pool and beach time. The pool is clean, & had a lovely little bar with cocktails and snacks. This is a family run hotel and it's really nice atmosphere. Anna at reception is just lovely, & helped sort us out a table in Oia to watch the sunset and transport back that evening which was brilliant and not too expensive. There is a supermarket on the beach front and one on the main Street 2 mins walk which is perfect to grab essentials like water and snacks. The bus stop to Fira is also 2 mins walk away and may not always be reliable but safer than driving yourself round those busy streets. Perissa beach is great with lots of bars and restaurants for breakfast and dinner. If you buy a drink or eat at one you can use the sunbeds for free... The only little improvement to the hotel I would say is the bathroom had a feint damp smell and the shower curtain just needs to be a little bit longer to stop water going all over the floor. But otherwise this place is a gem and I would recommend to anyone who wants a friendly homely place to stay. I will definitely be staying here again when I visit the beautiful Santorini :)
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to the beach and the main strip of restaurants and shops in Perissa (2 minute walk). The room was cleaned daily and we were provided with clean bed sheets and towels daily too. Yiannis was very helpful and friendly, always willing to chat. TV showing Premier League football by the swimming pool was a bonus. The complex looks very nice from the outside with the classic Santorini theme of whitewashed walls and blue doors, gates, windows. As it is a small island we didn't feel like we were missing out on anything by not booking in Fira, however, having a rental car is ideal as we were able to explore the entire island. There was plenty of parking space outside Samson's, something you will struggle with if you stay in Fira. Overall very happy with Samson's. Good value for money, i.e you get what you pay for.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Samson's Village has a very relaxing warm and friendly atmosphere were the staff go the extra mile to make sure you have a fabulous stay. We were collected free of charge from the airport by John who introduced us to the island and took us on an informative tour back to the hotel. Our apartment was kept beautifully clean everyday by the staff who always greeted us with a smile. Hoping to go back again this year if they can accommodate us for 3 weeks?
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These apartments are on a small complex.with a lovely pool. Our room was small,clean and comfortable,and has everything you need for a self catering holiday.You are close to the beach and Restaurants.Panos and John who run Samsons was very helpful.They also do free airport transfers if needed. We traveled 17th 24 th October and found its the end of season and there wasn't much open.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Samson's Village for our lovely 6night stay!Our little studio was well equipped, quiet, and just right for the two of us. It had a decent sized fridge with kettle sink and two jobs as well as a small supply of crockery and cutlery for your grub. Table and chairs in the kitchenette but weather was so good we used the balcony mainly.Bed was a decent size and the balcony is accessed off the bedroom.Bathroom compact but shower was lovely and warm with good pressure. The complex was well looked after, safe and very clean with friendly efficient staff. Whilst we didn't have breakfast (supermarkets very near so brought food) or use the pool or bar area but it all looked very attractive and never over-busy.Location is spot on! On a quiet street 2minutes walk from the beach front with a huge variety of restaurants, shops and amenities stretching across the beautiful black sands of Perissa beach.We hired a car but the bus stops for the local bus towards Fira etc. were in easy walking distance up on the main road.***Navigation Tip: to find Samson's Village - off the main Perissa Road heading from Fira/Airport with the sea on your right ... look for Dorian's Pub and the yellow painted dive shop - there's a small turning between them on the right. Pass a few hotels on your right then take next road right following a sign for Mama's Food. The hotel is on your left with right parking outside it!***We got lost a few times on our first arrival and there are signs to Samson's Village but not at eye-line and the locals aren't feat with their directions!We were really thrilled with the great value for money and the quality of service we got from the guys at Samson's Village we were sorry to come to the end of our stay.Things to do : Hike from Perissa to Kamari over the Mesa Vouno (the big mountain to the left as you face the sea) well signposted and some good instructions online at santorini-walksBoat cruise including Volcano Palea Kameni, thermal springs at Nea Kameni and time in Thirassia. Bus picked us up from the info office in Perissa took us to the harbour and dropped us back as we didn't get off for the sunset in Oia but did it independently.Walk from Fira to Oia...STUNNING walk suitable for most fitness levels with amazing views the whole way. Easy bus ride back to Fira after.Visit Fira and Oia towns.Oia sunset, would recommend getting there early as it does get busy and bagging a spot in the old castle ruins at the far end : great views of both sides of Oia and the sunset over the caldera.Lots of great signposted walks e.g. Akrotiri to Red Beach, Perissa to Pyrgos/Profitas Illias (monastery up on the hill behind Samson's)Eat well! Perissa : Huge salads for 2 at Tranquilo, pasta at Pergola, souvlaki at Volcano, great value mixed grill for 2 at Apollon and chilled ambiance/sport on tv/great value drinks at Sellada. All up to 5mins walk from Samson's Village!Enjoy!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great guidance by the very kind host. As we did not want to stay in the 'sugarly romantic'ioa, we choose Samsons in perissa. Helped us wonderful by pick up and drop off in the middle of the night and to rent the car.Most beautiful is the black beach as backyard, colours of the sky are amazing and changes every hour at sunset like an oil painting! Lovely place with a nice pool, qiut but if you are in for a drink it is just around the corner. Easy to reach the other towns on the island as well from this point.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great location, as only a short walk from Perissa beach, one of the nicest beaches on the island. You can easily wander to shops, restaurants and bars, but at the same time Samsons village is quiet and peaceful, so you get the best if both. This is a family run business and the staff are friendly and helpful.The accomodation is beautiful on the outside with a lovely courtyard and very clean pool. On the inside it is simple, bright and kept clean, we even got clean towels every day. The bed was comfortable and there was generous storage and hanging space for clothes-always a plus! There is a supermarket a ten minute walk away which is well stocked with a great combination of local produce and well known brands from around the world, so we stocked up our kitchen on arrival.I recommend a boat trip to the volcano, hot springs, thirassia island and Oiia village for the sunset. We also hired a quad bike and headed into Fira and explored the island, which was great fun (of course car hire is available locally too if you dont fancy a quad bike.) The staff at samsons can book trips for you, or you can visit a local agent.We highly enjoyed our time in Santorini and were perfectly happy with our choice of accomodation. This is not luxury accomodation, but very pleasant self-catered accomodation and if that's what you are looking for I highly recommend Samsons village.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a find, saw Samsons Village whilst staying in Perissa in 2014 & decided to book independently for 2015. Pannos & John are superstars & one of them is always around if you need anything. Our room was downstairs but was huge, a king size bed, full kitchen that we never used, fridge freezer, kettle & even a sandwich toaster, clean sheets & towels everyday, safe, air con. It has the feel of a little village, next time we stay we will pay a little more & get a top room with balcony.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been here 12 days. We have been three times in Santorini, but Samson's Village is the best we have never seen in Thira Island. The staff it's always at your disposal, great workers and very laughty people, we meet Yiannis and Pano and we are so happy of their job and friendship. Great position at 2 minutes walking from Perissa beach, restaurants, supermarket, rent a car and rent a moto and main street. The room are cleaned every day and there is a good kitchen corner in the room. A beutiful pool from 0,60 cm to 3 metres high. If you need relax, you can found it at Samson's Village. At a very good price/quality. Transfer from and to the airport with comfortable cars. We are very very happy for all and we'll sure recommend and return (we hope) in Samson's Village.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Samson's Village for 7 nights, we really did have a great time and enjoyed our stay. We chose Samson's based on the very good reviews and we were certainly not disappointed. Very pretty, well maintained grounds with the traditional Santorini blue and white colours and lovely pink flowers around the grounds. Pool was well kept and very clean, I wanted to take a plunge when I came back from the beach as it was nice and relaxing. Studio apartment was not big but a good size for 2 people. The room had air conditioning which was one of our key requirements as it gets very warm in Greece. The room also had cooking facilities, pot, pan, cutlery, dishes and bowls, as well as a kettle and fridge with small freezer section. Also, a lovely balcony to relax. The location is superb. 3 mins walk to Piressa beach which is the best beach on the island and around 5-10mins walk to the main shops (minimarkets etc), bars and car/quads/bikes hire which we used. We were greeted by John on arrival, who is a really nice guy and very welcoming. He will help you with any requests that you may have about places to go and suppliers to use. Free transfers were included which was an added bonus. If you are looking for very good accommodation at some of the best prices in Santorini I would not hesitate but to recommend this place. Book direct and you may get a better price!!! I hope this helps you decide.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Man, you got to try this! A wonderful place, great rooms and the guys at the bar are lovely. Many cats there, if you like them. The kitchen in the room was very utile and full of facilities. Surely i will come back here, John is the MAn!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with two 16 year old girls and my elderly parents we certainly made a good choice booking to stay at Samson's Village.A lovely place to stay in a great location. John and Panos could not do enough for us. The rooms were well equipped and very clean with air conditioning and free wi-fi.The pool was the perfect temperature and always exceptionally clean.Just a few minutes walk to the beach where you could get a nice spot with free sun beds and umbrellas plus free wifi if you purchased your refreshments from one of the beach front restaurants (Apollon highly recommend).Peaceful and relaxing but within easy reach of the large selection of restaurants and local supermarkets. A visit to Santos Winery and the Sunset cruise made our stay even more enjoyable.We will definitely be returning.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - just afew minutes from Perissa beach.Yannis was super friendly and really helpful - picked us up from the airport and also took us to Imerovigli.Lots of noise from the pool area at night so difficult to sleep.We had a room for 4 - was cramped but quite cosy.All the cutlery was dirty though - cleaners are rude and will enter your room even if you are in the shower - so be warned!WiFi was intermittent.Pool was great and nice to have a pool bar.Breakfast was basic - you would be better off going around the corner and having a great breakfast near the beach for the same price.All in all - lovely looking place - beautiful cats! Great price.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff including the four kittens were very friendly and the place was close to the beach (3 mins walk)The rooms were on the small side and the place could have been cleaner especially the shower area.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay in if you ever want to visit Perissa in Santorini island! Kind staff & very clean hotel. Close to the black volcane beach with almost no sales people trying to sell you cheap watches, sunglasses and so on.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came across Samson's Village on the internet while looking for a budget getaway with friends. I'm so glad I picked it! It was not only a good deal, but the staff is really personable and look after all of your needs! They go out of their way to accommodate all of your requests and love to interact with guests offering advice. The place itself is basic (it's not a posh hotel) but is very clean, beautiful, comfortable, well taken care of, newly renovated, Wi-Fi everywhere in the property works great, and it has all of the basics plus more. Overall, we really got more than what we expected and thanks to the staff we had a WONDERFUL first visit in Santorini. We can't wait to go back to Samson's Villas!
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We could not have picked a better place!!! Next time I go to Santorini I would definitely stay there again! The attention was amazing! Panos and Yannis will treat you with so much care and attention to make you feel at home. That is a very important asset in the hospitality industry, from giving you information to even a ride to Fira if they have a chance. They take you to the airport for free and let you use a spare bedroom if you need to freshen up arriving before check in time. Rooms are very clean and the pool and common areas are lovely. Cons: no toiletries in the bathrooms and no printer or business computer to check your reservations. Restaurants, supermarkets, ATM, beach bars and souvenir stores within walking distance. Not sure if the hotel was entitled to beach space though but other than that it was a great, pleasant stay.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Samson b&b was amazing! Definitely a place that I would go back to. We stayed in Perissa because we like the beach. Pros: loved Panos and John who made sure that we have everything that we need. You don't see that kind of hospitality in big named hotels. I loved that they took care of all our concerns. They took us to the airport for free and they made sure everything was comfortable. If something broke, they fixed it. Beds were comfy. It has a full kitchen, hair dryer. Also, they helped us with a couple tours. Panos answered all our questions about santorini Cons: the showers could use a bit more space, maybe take out the curtains and replace with glass. Could do away with the breakfast. There are restaurants within a 5 min walk from the hotel that serves omelettes while overlooking the sea.Buy toiletries because they don't have it. There is a supermarket, an ATM and a laundry establishment that's close by.
hotelName:
19    Samson's Village
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The magnificence of the setting is only matched by the unparalleled level of service. The hotel manager, George, was so concerned when we had a seating issue at an off premises restaurant that he personally arrived at the restaurant and spoke with the manager. The following evening George provided us with a magnificent view of the sunset while enjoying cocktails on the deck. The only warning is the terrain as the hotel is built into a cliff so there are steep steps with uneven stones. Wear comfortable shoes.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful staff and property. Just outside the heart of Oia...a short 6 minute walk to beginning of center pedestrian zone, so you get dropped at Lobby entrance or they have free parking if you are driving. All hassle free.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Oia Suites as the last stop on our honeymoon trip and it did not disappoint. It's a boutique hotel - only 8 rooms - that's about a 15 minute walk to the main area of Oia. So if you're looking to be right in the middle of all the craziness, this place is not for you, but if you want a relaxing oasis, then you've found the place. We really enjoyed being close to all the restaurants and shops, but being in more of a quiet, relaxing location. The walk to town is also really enjoyable because it's along the water and then through some of the cliffside white buildings. The staff here is so incredible and accommodating. We came to know them a bit over our 5 days there and have nothing but good things to say. They deliver breakfast every morning to your balcony so it's a nice private way to start out each day. The cleaning woman even did some cute towel art in our room. :-)If you're looking for a romantic vacation with incredible views, this is the spot!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and was extremely happy with our choice. There is so much peace and quiet you have in your room, balcony with total privacy from hot tub, and by the pool. Very clean and super nice staff willing to help with anything you need.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing experience at Oia Suites. Since we first got to the hotel, the welcome provided by Jenny was amazing. Our Suite had a breathtaking caldera view and the breakfast was delicious every day. They are super focused on making your stay enjoyable and approach their clients will a lot of professionalism. Armand and Heleni were great too.We would go back again and stay with you. Special thanks to Jenny for making our stay the best one.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I came here on vacation in October and we were very pleased with our stay. Maria was very accommodating. Short walk to the town of Oia. Beautiful view and nice rooms. Would definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelling with a friend , we experienced the best hospitality on our whole Europe trip here. Sofia couldn't do enough for us and was super friendly and efficient. The site was superbly placed with excellent views and a quite area, with a 10 minute easy picturesque walk into Oia Central. It wash great to have a clothes washing service included. WOUld love to go back!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oia Suites was simply amazing for many reasons. Whether its the location which was near a bus stop so you can easily go to Fira and extremely easy access to the Oia downtown area with all the restaurants and of course the amazing Oia sunset from the castle. But the best part for us, being on our honeymoon was the amazing customer service. From reserving the room with Mrs. Eva to the welcoming and service upon arrival by Sofia and Maria. They all make sure that every part of your visit and trip count. They provided help with restaurant recommendations as well as help with the reservations of the restaurant and any other tour etc. Also A VERY important thing to note, is that they deal with very organized and safe tours. Its not just a random company. Honestly, an AMAZING trip to Santorini and a great reason for that was Oia Suites.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a serene beautiful experience in Santorini look no further than Oia Suites. You will be pampered by Sofia, Maria and Armando. You feel most welcomed by them and they become like family. We stayed in a spacious double room suite with our adult daughters and felt like we were in our own private little villa. Breakfast of your choice is brought to your very own outdoor patio and this is how you start your wonderful day. The Cliff side view is amazing, a true Santorini experience. The main center in Oia with all its magnificent restaurants and shops is a short walk away. There are a variety of wonderful restaurants with magnificent sunset views right across the road from this hotel. We all loved this beautiful place and will be back!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at Oia suites for our honeymoon for 9 nights. Oia itself is absolutely stunning and definitely worth a visit and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to stay!Located 10 mins outside Oia, the hotel offers the perfect mix of a peaceful spot for a relaxing stay but a convenient distance to eat out/explore Oia and the rest of Santorini. The rooms were beautiful, excellent pool facilities, lovely breakfast delivered each morning and amazing staff who make the whole stay!Thank you for a great honeymoon and we hope to visit again soon!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow...Sofia, Maria and of course Armando are absolutely amazing. They went above and beyond at all times to make sure we had the best time at Oia Suites. I have never in my life had hotel staff, come out of the office and greet us every time we came back to the hotel it was like they were welcoming us back home every time. Armando made sure we always had ICE cold water by the pool and wine! I have never had this type of service even at all inclusive 5-star resorts.The breakfast was very good every morning, you can pick what you want and it is delivered RIGHT to your front terrace at the time you want. They even include a daily Oia Suites newsletter to read with your breakfast :)Our room was very neat and clean and had 2 air conditioner units to ensure the living room area and bedroom were nice and cool during the summer. It was ~30 degrees everyday we were in Santorini and the room was always very cool. I LOVED IT!!!The location was perfect as well, it is a short walk to the centre of Oia, but once you are there you realize how noisy and crowded it is. We were so very happy to come back to our QUITE and relaxing room. It truly is an oasis nestled in the hills of Oia. The only issue was the wireless signal was not reliable. I generally used my cell phone data and shared it to my iPad while at the hotel as the Wifi signal would often drop. Sofia did warn us the wireless signal may not be that strong, and I appreciate that she let us know.We loved Oia Suites so much we have already recommended other friends come here for a vacation/honeymoon, and we are thinking about when we would like to come back in the future.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just got back from a wonderful 3 days at oia suitesWe were there on honeymoon and were treated like absolute royalty..The place is fantastic.. Rooms clean and modern with kettle fridge etc and the views of the caldera to die for.. You can't see the actual sunset from the room but it doesn't matterThe hotel is a 15 minute walk to the centre of oia and not overlooked at allThe staff are fantastic especially Maria, Sofía and arman.. They bring u drinks round the pool.. Breakfast in the mornings and always have a smile on their faces and a story to tell.. It's one of the places we have been toThank you
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view from this hotel was worth the price alone. We loved that it wasn’t in the center of oia so we could enjoy some peace and quiet. Oia was only a short 10 minute walk from the hotel. A nice walking path was there for us to use. Maria and CLara were both so helpful and had an answer to all our questions. My favorite part? The breakfast! So delicious! The staff even packed us sandwiches and snacks for our very early departure. The staff also booked transfers to and from the port and airport with a very reliable company. We loved the junior suite. WiFi was good. And the maids left towel art on our beds everyday! Amazing!!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel from the many options available on Santorini based on reviews, price and location. Oia is a must see part of Santorini but can be very busy, crowded and noisy. Oia Suites is located about a 15 minute walk into the town, on the clifftop path. You get the caldera view, the 'cave house' architecture and the Santorini stay experience without the price tag and the crowds that come with staying in the heart of Oia.This property is a small hotel managed and run by around 5 staff who take pride in anticipating and attending to your every need. From George who looks after the pool area and brings you drinks to Sofia and Maria who share front of house and bring your breakfast, they are all just lovely. The room cleaners also are awesome with a surprise awaiting you with flower petals on your bed or towel sculptures each day.Our room was No 1 with gorgeous views across the caldera. A spacious sitting room with small fridge and a bedroom with a very comfortable bed and cute 'cave' bathroom completed the accommodation. All areas were clean and touches like the extendable washing line to hang wet bathers were appreciated.The pool area was located on the lower level, with a steep stairway down to it and the clifftop path. This should be taken into consideration for those who have mobility issues, however most of Santorini accommodation has this limitation. We spent many mornings lazing around the pool - thanks to George ever vigilant to our arrival providing umbrella and drink service as required :).Breakfast is provided daily and is adequate. The staff are able to assist with booking tours, rental cars etc. We walked everywhere, including the 11km cliff and mountain climb into Fira. The local bus service is also good. There are many good restaurants available in Oia and we also enjoyed meals in the tavern across the road from Oia Suites. We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel - we prefer smaller more personal properties and this one ticked all the boxes for us. Thanks to all of the staff - you made our week here just beautiful.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have booked 5 nights at this amazing accommodation - Maria & Sophia are the perfect hosts - if you are considering staying in Santorini - look no further - book this hotel!!! Suites are spotlessly clean, comfortable with the most beautiful views About 10 minute casual walk from the center of Oia but quiet. The pool is stunning; Maria & Sofia are very attentive. Maria has suggested a couple of restaurants and have made bookings for us. Great restaurants and we have enjoyed good nights out. We are well travelled but this is the first time ever I have given10 out of 10! Book & enjoy!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, I want to thank Maria and Sophia who made our stay so very special. Always with a smile each one of them greeted us warmly every time they saw us. They laughed with us and shared many suggestions. In short, they were the perfect hosts! As for the hotel, it was the perfect place for us. It was a 20 minute walk into town so we didn't have the congestion and the noise of Oia. I am a 70 year-old man and I found the walk to Oia be a good workout, but very doable. Let's start with the breakfast. It is basically how you design it. On arrival, you are given a sheet listing 20 or so items available for breakfast. You indicate next to each item how many of those you would like to have for breakfast the next morning. If you want four slices of bacon, you put a 4 in the box next to bacon. If you want one cup of coffee , you put a 1 in the coffee box. It may sound a little complicated, but it really isn't and it works well. Breakfast is served each morning on your patio at the time you select. The breakfast foods were excellent. The rooms were wonderful. We had a Superior Suite with Hot Tub and Caldera View and it was fabulous! The bed was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was also roomy. The showers were amazing, with a both a rain shower head and hand held shower head at each end of the shower. Wifi was free and very strong. The staff responded immediately to any request. We love the Oia Suites and I would highly recommend staying here!!!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oia Suites was one of our most favourite hotels we have ever stayed in. Everything was just perfect the minute we walked in. Everything so pristine, clean and well made. All staff were wonderful and friendly, it was so easy to talk to them and nothing was too much trouble. We had to check out very early on our last day due to a boat trip so they arranged for breakfast to come a little earlier than their usual start time so we could have a chance to enjoy it without rushing too much.I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Oia Suites to anyone travelling to santorini!! I’d even recommend to anyone not going to santorini...
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days and we couldn't have chosen a better hotel in Santorini. Right from the welcome to the rooms, the service and the divine views of the ocean, everything seemed tailor-made and perfect.We had asked for the transfer (a paid extra) from the airport to the hotel since we would be arriving past midnight, and the driver was waiting for us at the airport. We had the junior suite with hot tub & ocean view and the room (pictures attached) was spotless and well set-up for us, with a welcoming bottle of champagne (Gancia Brut, pretty good). Every day, the housekeeping staff made towel art for us with the new towels and it was absolutely adorable. Kostas (apologies if I'm misspelling his name) and the ladies did an absolutely fantastic job, many thanks to them.The breakfast, laid out at the table outside at the time of our request, was good but the view we had while eating made it great. We didn't use the pool but it looked spectacular and I'm sure it would have been amazing to use it. The bathrooms were cleaned up superbly every day before we returned from our excursions around the island. We had rented a car and Oia itself is little more than a 5-min drive away. There's a supermarket at walking distance (5-10 mins, you can buy snacks, alcohol and other necessities) and the slightly expensive but good Lefkes restaurant is really close by and stays open till 11 PM or so. The Internet in the rooms is good enough. The TV has about 4-5 channels in English and two of these are news channels, so prepare to watch the same things over & over again if you want to stay in the room and watch TV. But then, if you're in Santorini, why would you do that?Now for the reception staff. Maria, who's been working here for a while, and Sofia, who started recently, made sure our trip was a delight. They were friendly, helpful and sharp and never let standards drop. They made calls when we needed help with something and set things right quickly. A large part of the stay at the hotel being great is due to them. Thanks for upholding the image of Greek hospitality!In sum, it was excellent staying at Oia Suites. Good location, relaxing, great views and superlative service.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel it is about a 10 - 15 min walk to reach Oia, it is a quiet location with good sea views of the volcano, you can see the sunset from the hotel.We used the coastal footpath to avoid all the traffic on the road as there is no pavement.The staff in the hotel were all very friendly and could not do enough to help you, they made our holiday for us really, it had a nice family feel.There is no restaurant or bar on the premises, breakfast was served to your room in the morning.There are tea making facilities and a small mini bar in your room, there is a vineyard close by, it is in walking distance, but a steep climb back up afterwards, there is also a restaurant just across the road.There is a swimming pool and sauna on site.We walked into Oia each evening for something to eat. Fantastic hotel, and i would recommend it to friends and family.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After travelling for 6 weeks, 4 nights at Oia Suites was just what we needed to end our holiday. We felt thoroughly spoilt by the staff who made sure we always had everything we needed. They were polite and helpful and always had a smile. The view of the calderra is beautiful and could be enjoyed from our verandah or from the sun lounges at the pool. Being a 15 minute walk into town is a bonus- it is less busy and much quieter. Breakfast each morning was served exactly when we ordered it and we could have had as little or as much as we wanted. A huge thanks to Maria, Faye, Kostas and the lovely ladies who cooked breakfast and cleaned our room, you gave us a perfect end to our holiday!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I went there on our honeymoon and it was absolutely perfect. The suite was incredible, the staff very nice and welcoming and the best part of all: the terrace with the jacuzzi and the magical views of the sea. We spent there 2 nights and they were the most beautiful ones in all our honeymoon. Have breakfast in the terrace, with the sea in front of you is indescribable. The swimming pool is also very nice, but in April it was a little bit too cold for us!If I could I would go there every year!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous views of Oia in Santorini. White boutique style cave hotel. The private hot tub overlooking the bay was a bonus. Friendly and polite service plus greeted with a hardback book of the area which was our welcome gift souvenir. Worth coming for a special occasion. Pricey so might be worth a couple of nights then going to a different part of the island.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived in Santorini from Paros as the final stop on our honeymoon. We arrived into the port and had arranged with the hotel for a pick up, who was there waiting for us when we arrived. Transfers to the port and airport are 35E and take about 30 minutes.On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by Kostis and Marialou who gave us an overview of the island which was very helpful. We were blown away by our room which was by far the nicest of the three hotels we'd stayed in on our honeymoon. We had the room with the jacuzzi on the balcony and it was lovely, with a stunning view of the caldera.The hotel is very quiet and you will always get a bed around the pool. The highlight was breakfast being delivered to your room - you could order as much as you like and it was delicious. The breakfasts are made by the fabulous cleaner Aurelia who is absolutely lovely - please pass on how good we think she is! Kostis comes round when you're sunbathing to bring you ice cold water to your bed and, sometimes, a very welcome glass of wine. Kostis is the smiliest, most polite man you'll ever meet and he works so hard to make sure you're having a good stay. The hotel is about 10 mins walk to the start of Oia, but the views are stunning so it's never a chore. It's an easy walk too either along the road or the coastal path. After visiting Paros and Mykonos, we felt most safe walking along the road here as it was well lit and there is a foot path.Overall we would not hesitate to come back here. The rooms are beautiful, the views stunning and the staff are an asset to the company. Thank you for a lovely holiday!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I booked Oia Suites for our honeymoon based on the online hotel pictures and reviews. What we found out when we arrived, however, was that what we reviewed did not fully capture the beauty of this place and the helpful staff. When we arrived, we were greeted by Maria and then by the amazing view of the Caldera. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Oia's Main Street. The hotel was close enough to head "downtown" for a lunch or dinner or a gelato, but far enough away to get away from all the busyness. The staff was wonderful. We were served breakfast, which is complimentary, every morning in our room or on our patio. The front desk was so helpful in planning our activities and also arranging transport to and from our ferry. (Tip: if you email them your itinerary they can arrange for your transportation to the suites when you arrive). Whenever my wife or I had a question about the island we would always go to the front desk and they would always have an answer. This place made our honeymoon so memorable and we are so thankful to Oia Suites for making it so. I recommend staying in the deluxe suites if you can.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It will be hard to describe this magical holiday. We were referred to Oia Suites by an Aussie traveller and he was right.Ideally located just outside of the town Oia directly opposite the coolest Tavern you might find. That's another review. The buses stop just outside - BUT be warned they can be crowded. They are the cheapest way to move around tho. €1.8 to Oia - 10min€2.4 to Thira (Fira) - 30minThe view of the Caldera once we climbed to the top of hill is simply stunning. The pictures say it all. We had a superior suite with tub. WOW.Air Cond - greatDecor of the room - stunningBed - Fantastic - Big and ComfyThe staff are just what you want on this type of property. DiscreetQuiteNothing is an issueInformativeMaria leads the team and is just amazing. Kostis is the handyman - cleaner - breakfast delivery person. Aurelia the maid is just charmingThe rooms are done thoroughly and her art work is much appreciated. As a TEAM they are fantastic. Thank you for making us feel safe - welcomed and thoroughly delighted. Will be back.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic stay at Oia Suites in Santorini. We stayed in a room with a private spa and view over the pool and the Caldera. It is fairly pricey in high season but it was a once in a lifetime experience to have a view of the Caldera. The hotel is a little outside of town, but the walking track is right in front of the hotel and you have access via a gate - it's about a 10 minute walk to the centre of Oia and then you can take the 11km walk to Fira (apparently beautiful). Highlight for us was everytime we went out to the pool, the lovely team brought a glass of wine to us!!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So where to start... Maria and Maroulia couldn't do enough for you and helped arrange taxis and any trips we wanted to do. Brilliant customer service, really friendly and helpful.Breakfast was delivered to your balcony every morning in accordance to what you ordered the day before, very nice. Aurelia would make some beautiful creations each day after cleaning the rooms.The room was amazing, great showers, bed and the hot tub was brilliant. Lovely balcony overlooking the pool.The views from the suites are breathtaking and we enjoyed some peaceful relaxation by the pool. Kostis would always be on hand should you want a drink brought to your loungers.As we were on our honeymoon we were hoping for a relaxing luxurious stay never to be forgotten and that is exactly what we got.To all of the hotel staff mentioned above we can not thank you enough for making our trip so special.Chris and Charlotte x
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here in June for three days and it was amazing , the Manager and staff could not do enough for us .They organised the taxis to and from the ferries which were on time and stress free and when we arrived our room was ready . The rooms were well appointed and had amazing views from our private balcony . The pool and gardens were well taken care of and the views from all angles were exceptional . The best part was the early morning breakfast which was the best we had on our entire trip. They organised our dinner reservations with ease . Overall the staff were brillaint and could not do more for us and we will certainly return to this well appointed and managed hotel in the quiter part of Oia
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 2-night stay, and we enjoyed it a lot. The staff was helpful, the breakfast amazing.The rooms are big and the bathrooms too. We had a private jacuzzi and stunning Caldera view.Only cons is that the hotel is a bit of a walk from Oia center.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located at Finikia, which is about 10-15 min walk to Oia. The staff is friendly & helpful. Very peaceful environment with awesome view.As we had to check out earlier than the breakfast time, they delivered some cold supplies the night before to our room. Overall i enjoyed my stay at Oia Suites Hotel.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Staffs are very warm n friendly... Maria welcome us with cheerful smile the minute we arrived. Checked in was easy n Maria gave us a lot of tips. Very helpful. Room was big n cosy. Living room with small pantry. Breakfast was great. We had it on the balcony. U can wash n hang yr clothes outside the verandah. Hangers are provided. Swimming pool is clean. U can swim n enjoy the sea view. It took us abt 15 mins walk to oia on the hiking path..but dont worry... the view of the caldera along the way is really amazing! The hiking path to oia is just directly behind the swimming pool. If u decide to take the hiking path during night time, pls bring a torch. No lightings.U can opt to walk on the main road to oia but be careful as the road is quite narrow.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MARIA was expecting us the moment we arrived at the hotel & offered us some cold orange juice. Check in was easy. She showed us to our room & explained everything we needed to know especially how to get to Oia on foot.We had booked directly with Oia Suites a "Suite with Sea View" & I truly think we got the one with the best direct view of the sea from our private patio, although slightly obstructed by the big balcony. If you can afford it, you may want to check out the Junior Suite & above categories because they are situated down the stairs & may offer better unobstructed views.The furnishings/colours were new, really nice & cosy, beds/pillows super comfy. There was a wall mounted foldable clothes drying rack right at the patio. Make sure you peg your clothes, the winds are strong here! Only 3 channels on the TV though.There was no kitchenette, but there were a kettle, coffee/tea/sugar, cups & a fully stocked mini fridge. It's not stated anywhere but do check with the staff, because the 1st big bottle of drinking water in the fridge is free.If I had to nitpick, it'll be the flooring/walls of the bathroom - too slippery when wet & takes very long to dry up. Also, no shower curtains...Breakfast was of high quality but portions on the small side. Make sure you indicate more pieces if you require bigger portions. When we had to check out earlier than the breakfast time of 8.30am, MAROULIA delivered some cold supplies the night before to our room. Super helpful & kind girl! She really aims to give the best service to guests!Oia Suites is in Finikia, a 15-20min walk to Oia. If the weather is fine, it's a pleasant stroll along the caldera (the same hiking path from Fira). If you choose the main road, be mindful of vehicles as the roads get narrow at some parts.During off season, there were hardly any restaurants open nearby. You'd hav to walk to Oia for food & groceries.Overall, really happy with our stay here!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights at Oia Suites. Fantastic service starting from the moment we drove up to the drive way and all the way till we checked out. We stayed in one of the suites and it was spacious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast on the balcony was a nice touch. The pool had a fantastic view of the caldera. Couldn't ask for more.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed at Oia Suites in October as a birthday present from my wife. The place is just stunning, very close to Oia; just a short walk. This is a very small hotel, really charming and with spectacular views over the caldera and the sunset. We had one of the nicest rooms, which I believe are number 6, 7 and 8. The suites are very nicely decorated.But what makes this place so special is definitely the service. From the moment we arrived, Effie and Elina were really helpful and friendly.The breakfast is taken to your room every morning; make sure you ask when filling the form as each element is one item, so if you want sausages, make sure you write how many.I had an amazing time and we were really lucky as the weather was beautiful despite being the end of the season.We had the swimming pool for ourselves and there are plenty of tabernas and charming restaurants around the hotel.I totally recommend this hotel for a romantic break or for a long holiday.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in Oia Suites was nothing short of perfect. We arrived at about 9am following a very early morning flight only to find that we had been upgraded from the superior to the deluxe suite, our room was already ready for us and we were served breakfast. The views from the hotel are superb and the pool is amazing. From what we have seen there are not too many hotels in Oia with such a large pool. The distance from Oia is perfect - an easy walk but you are away from the people and traffic of Oia. The hotel is so quiet and peaceful and the other guests have been the same. Please do not bring kids here or stay here if you are planning on having loud drinks on your balcony! All of the restaurant recommendations from the hotel staff have been spot on as well.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was beautiful and very clean. Staff were so helpful and kind. The location was perfect. A short walk into the township to many lovely shops and eateries. A fabulous restaurant just across the road if you don't want to walk to far.I can't fault this place!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous suite with breath taking views of the caldera.The villa is spacious and very clean.The staff are all wonderful and very helpful.Effie welcomed us in the evening and explained many new things as we had visited Oia before.Breakfast is well prepared and offered on your terrace. A little walk into Oia but worth it.Would highly recommend Oia suites.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here in August and every moment was perfect. From arrival they were amazing, taking through the island and what was on offer. Our suite was beautiful and extremely clean, with the added bonus of an amazing view over the caldera. The touch of having dinner served on your balcony every morning is great and makes you feel even more at home. The walk into Oia takes around 10mins and the walk in has such amazing views you can't really complain! Would highly recommend Oia suites and we would love to return one day.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 10 days here in July. Only 8 rooms. Beautiful views from our terrace. Room was lovely - everything we needed. The most relaxing holiday we have ever had. No getting up early to get a sun bed. . Swimming pool area clean and quiet. Breakfast served promptly and was lovely. Great having a hot tub on the terrace! The staff could not have been nicer - so helpful and friendly and always with a smile - they went out of their way to make our stay so pleasurable. Definitely recommend the day trip catamaran trip with BBQ on board - not cheap but worth every penny. I would rate this hotel more than 10 out of 10 if that was possible. Make sure you book a room overlooking the Caldera though as a couple of the rooms didn't and I would have been very disappointed. Go for a Superior room. We will be back!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW Absolutely amazing place HIGHLY RECOMMEND. First of all the hotel arranged for us to get picked up at the port. The driver was awesome and told us all about the island and what to eat, drink, and see. --Great outsource from Oia Suites. As soon as we arrived they greeted us with cold water and smiles. Gave us a sheet with a bunch of foods and drinks to select for breakfast! Explained to us the island and how it worked for 15 minutes! Took us to our room and we were breath taken. Amazing view, the pictures looked exactly like the room and the view. No photoshop! That was awesome to see. Anyways we stayed two nights and three days. Everywhere we needed to go they showed us the way on the map. Any restaurant we wanted to go( with their amazing recommendation) they booked for us. They told us where to eat and swim! Great recommendations once again. Fast track to our engagement. I asked Anna to help me with the room presentation. Many of you might think "why on the balcony" well.. Because it was romantic as hell and the view is killer. They put down colourful rose pedals, candles everywhere and a fantastic red wine! We were blown away with the customers service. -- Hard to find that in Greece just so you know. We give them 100000 out of 10. Not a complainant anywhere. We are super picky too. Room was so clean, every day. Every morning they cleaned the hot tub. GO HERE NO WHERE ELSE. ROOM NUMBER 8 was more privet then the most. Thank you Anna from Oia Suites. You and the staff were amazing!!! We might come back for our honey moon! Joanna and Dean Vozikas.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oia Suites is a perfect place to stay. Everything was great from the incredible breakfast each day to the pool to the hot tub. Anna and Eleni handled anything you asked of them and would make dinner reservations and get you a table right on the edge overlooking the water. Fresh towels everyday that were nice and thick unlike most of the places in Europe I have stayed in. Air conditioning worked great, it's only a 10 minute walk in to town and you are away from the crowds which you will see once you are in town. Perfect Perfect Perfect. Don't bother staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment our driver greeted us at the airport terminal, to sitting on our balcony right now enjoying the beautiful views of the caldera, this establishment has gone above and beyond our expectations. The staff is very attentive, and can almost anticipate your every thought or question before you can ask. Note that I did not use the word "concern", as you will have nothing to worry about during your stay.Breakfast served every morning to our personal balcony has been delicious. There is a wide variety of options to chose from, leaving you very satisfied. Want something altered slightly? Just say the word and they take care of it.As mentioned before, the views of the caldera and volcano are stunning. Watching the cruise ships in the sea below has become my new favorite quiet activity.The pool is crystal clear and the perfect temperature for the heat Santorini brings.There are very limited rooms at this establishment, leaving your privacy intact. We have been here for a few days now and have never felt impeded on by other guests or staff. A welcome concept to our honeymoon. Everything is meticulously cared for and very clean. The office staff has been very willing to set up excursions around the island (boating, snorkeling, dinner reservations, etc.), leaving us to just sit back and relax.My wife and I could not be more impressed. We will definitely be staying here for any future trips to Santorini!Cheers!Jason N
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an absolutely beautiful hotel and only a 15 min stroll into Oia, which had a lovely choice of bars and restaurants. The staff at Oia suites were so accommodating and even bought us breakfast early as we had to head off to view a number of wedding venues early in the morning. It was such a shame it was only a quick visit but we found the wedding venue of our dreams and have even recommended Oia suites for our guests on our wedding website. Thank you for a lovely trip at such an exciting time for us!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's perfect. Sure, the suites are a 10 minute walk from Oia along the caldera path, but who wants to pay a premium to stay in the hustle bustle with tourists peering down into your $500/night terrace all day long? The view is spectacular, the rooms are huge and modern and well appointed, breakfast is amazing (delivered on the terrace with a private view), the pool is fantastic, and the staff is awesome.Marianna was our primary host, and she was great. She gave us so much useful info about Santorini, fantastic recommendations, arranged everything for us, and was superbly professional. We'll be back for sure.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Marianna is a credit to this place. She is a fantastic hostess that goes that extra mile to ensure that your every need is met. We had a junior suite and would highly recommend it. The location is great if you want to be close to Oia but do not want to be right in Oia. It is a 10 minute walk to the town and the sea views are breathtaking. Very quiet and romantic. Lovely villeroy and bosch modern shower and bathroom. Immaculately presented.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Views to die for overlooking the caldera. 15 mins walk from centre of oia but I think that is ideal. Oia gets very busy especially at rush hour (7pm) when all the cruise ship coaches pile in so everyone can do the sunset thing (they are beautiful....That is the sunsets not the selfie stick wielding coachers). We had Junior suite which is on upper level which was lovely and with own hot tub but a little lacking in privacy outside as faces onto path to the pool so would recommend digging deep and choosing a deluxe suite if you do want a bit more privacy. We did however have drapes we could pull over a bit to protect from evening sun /for privacy. Cleaning team are amazing and rooms were scrubbed and spotless every day. Staff lovely and friendly and helpful whenever asked. Breakfast on balcony every day was lovely relaxed way to start the day. And they didn't mind how much you ordered so other half often ordered extra toastie or fruit to snack on later. Fridge facilities were ample to stash all your drinks etc that you get at shop (there is no bar or facilities on site for food /drink but that's is a small supermarket 5 mins walk away) . General atmosphere was of relaxed calm, very limited number of rooms (think about 8/10 in all) so quiet, loads of room around pool, often had to selves. Could have done with a few more coat hangers as we had 4 each for a week and this place is so clearly high end it was silly annoyance that could be easily addressed. Santorin Moy restaurant directly opposite is actually fine for When you can't be bothered to go into oia. Music is hilarious and food fine. Overall place is beautifully quiet so I'd say definitely not for families with kids or those hoping to meet and spend time with other guests (re weren't so it was perfect)! Would recommend wholeheartedly.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 6 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Views are fantastic and it is only a short walk into Oia. Breakfast on the patio every morning was great and nothing was too much bother for the staff. All the staff were friendly and marianne was really helpful with local information. Would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were glad to be moving away from Fira town (not the hotel, the actual town itself) and both excited to be moving to Oia.Arrived at the hotel via the pre arranged transfer, checkin was smooth, gave us a great description of the hotel & town and we moved to the pool as the room wasn't ready.Rooms are brilliant and we stayed in 2 different types. 1st room was a suite with a hot tub over looking the sea, WOW! Stunning modern decor inside, the view was breath taking and the hot tub was a nice extra. We then moved to a sea view suite, nice and comfortable but could do with an update inside as looked a little dated.Breakfast was great being served to your balcony every morning.Pool area was quiet and always free sun beds with a lovely breeze coming in from the sea.Location- 10-15 min walk in to the town, either down the back of the Hotel (wouldn't suggest this way if you're not steady on your feet or at night) or down the road in front of the hotel. The hotel provides a torch for the evenings.In front of the hotel there is a lovely Greek restaurant. For some reason the hotel don't recommend visiting but we went twice. Very reasonably priced, all "home cooked" Greek food & live music from 845!Overall great visit and would return to Oia Suites
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. It was beautiful. Breakfast every morning delivered on time to your room was delicious. The views were spectacular. We enjoyed swimming in the pool and the short walk into Oia (they even give you a torch to help guide you back!) We were given a lovely bottle of sparkling wine and our room was decorated with candles and petals ahead of our arrival. Thank you Marianna for your recommendations and advice during our stay. It was very memorable!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here from 19-22 September and it was beautiful at oia suites. Anna and Elina were so very kind and helpful, always a smile on their faces!! Oia suites isn't in the centre of oia but not far away at all, we never had to taxi or bus to oia town as we just walked 15-20 mins, and got beautiful views on the way! We stayed in room 3, with an outdoor jetted tub which was really lovely and warm as the pool was cooler to swim in (my husband had a swim on the hot day and enjoyed!)Wifi was good and we were served breakfast daily on our little porch outside :) really great atmosphere and peaceful as it is away from all the tourists in oia town. Would highly recommend staying at oia suites!! :)
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights after our wedding in Santorini. Our room was beautiful and the view from our outdoor Jacuzzi over the caldera was incredible. Watching the sunset from there with a bottle of champagne will certainly go down in the memory books! The location is good, just outside of the hustle and bustle of Oia. Breakfast being delivered to your balcony every morning was a great touch. My one and only gripe came to when we checked out. As with all my other travel plans, I had booked Oia Suites through booking.com. Despite having stated in the booking we would be paying cash, it was only when we came to check out and settle up our bill we were told our credit card had been charged. Very frustrating as I never use my credit card and had to then sort out changing back our currency (which we obviously lost money on) to then pay off my bill. Not a huge problem - but meant we left our stay on a bit of a bad note and with some stress we could have done without it.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I really love this hotel. The room is really lovely and fully equipped. (My room also has an outdoor jacuzzi) Our breakfast is served in private balcony with an amazing panoramic view. This hotel is not located at the center if Oia (around 15 mins walk) but it's not the problem for us coz that made this place serene & romantic. Also. the hotel is not on the cliff then easy for baggage carrying.
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here only for two nights...we wish we had longer. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Very quiet and exclusive as there are only 6 rooms. One negative is that upon inspection I found some hairs on the mattress cover, which I asked the housekeeper to change, and she did so. Other than that, breakfast was lovely - it is so cute that it's delivered to your door! Wifi is strong (that is important to us!) and the staff are so friendly.
