She gave us a mini history lesson on santorini and recommended places to go/things to see. It's only a 10 minute walk to oia along the path at the front of the hotel... Amazing views. It's nicer being that "little bit" further out as the hotels situated directly in Oia have no privacy - and lots of stairs! Would definitely recommend this hotel. Just be careful - it can be very slippy! Especially when the hot tub has been used. We suggested to the hotel that they purchase bath maths to place in and around the sweet as the floors can become hazardous ! Other than that...lovely :-)
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a beautiful hotel!! Views were absolutely spectacular, pool is clean, quiet and relaxing and rooms were unreal. We stayed in room 6 and it was amazing. Multi-level room with huge balcony overlooking the caldera with private hot tub. Rooms were extremely clean, bed was so comfortable and bathroom had a large 2-person shower. Such a perfect honeymoo spot, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Anna & Elena were so welcoming and helpful. Gave us great recommendations of what to do & where to eat in Oia. There is also a great restaurant across the street with live Greek music and amazing food. One of our best nights in Oia was spent there. You cannot go wrong with this hotel!!
hotelName:
20    Oia Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I went for our honeymoon and it was perfect. The view is amazing. The rooms are modern and clean. The morning breakfast served in our Villa was pretty good. Georgia is a super attentive host and Aries always went out of his way to help us with our luggage and pool drinks. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Cave Suite for three nights this May. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Very tasty breakfast is served just outside of your room every morning. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I came here for our honeymoon and we enjoyed our stay here. The room was spacious and clean. We had a beautiful view of the Aegan Sea and the Calderas. The breakfast was superb and their staffs were very helpful. I love this hotel :)
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here in Sept 2018 for our honeymoon and loved the hotel! We booked the Kima Villa which overlooked the Aegean Sea. There was a pool too that was right outside of our room which added a nice touch to our stay. Adrianna was very helpful during our check in and whenever we needed any assistance and it was amazing of Aris to carry both our luggage’s down the stairs to our room and up when we checked out (no idea how does he do that). The interior of the room was well decorated, properly lit and also had candles that we lighted up at night to provide that cosy ambience. Breakfast was served right at the poolside and it was so good. We had scrambled eggs, feta cheese, bacon, variety of pastries, yogurt and coffee. Overall, we loved this hotel and wished we could stay longer! Thank you for making our honeymoon even great!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the most amazing holiday at Kima Suites! The location and views were breath-taking, the accommodation was perfect and the staff outstanding! Georgia and Adriana on reception were extremely helpful , efficient and friendly. Mrs Adriana kept the rooms immaculate and Aris was always so cheerful and kind even when he was carrying my extremely heavy cases down all those steps! Thanks to you all for making our holiday so perfect!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel is excellent. The staff is great! The guy that carries the luggage is fantastic (sorry I cant remember his name)… The breakfast was delicious!! They charge 40 euros to pick you up from the airport (highly recommended). The pool was nice! the rooms are clean. Very good and affordable restaurants nearby as well as a small market. They provide 1 free bottle of water and a small bottle of wine on your arrival day. Location was excellent and hotel feels very private!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kima Villa is absolutely beautiful. It has the same stunning view of the caldera as many more expensive hotels and its boutique size and perfect location make is a really great pick. We were a group of 4 girls who had all sorts of issues including delayed and cancelled flights - the staff helped us out with everything and were a friendly welcome to our Greek island holiday. Definitely recommend getting the hotel to book airport transfers - no more expensive than a standard taxi but much easier as there were long queues. Ate at Black Rock Restaurant - if you're looking for fine dining and a fabulous setting, go here.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 2 couples. Stayed there in their cave suite. It was just perfect. Great staff especially Georgia was very kind, helpful and her suggestions for the places to visit, eat and drink were just spot on! The breakfast was homey and unique everyday so you didn’t feel that you’re eating hotel breakfast day in and day out. You could stay all day in the hotel and not get bored or tired. I strongly recommend staying at their place.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was amazing and the customer service could have not been better. Georgia and Ari were amazing everyday and assist and helped through our stay. It is only a 3 star hotel but definitely felt like a 5 in a lot of aspects. Two only comments that I can add is that the breakfast is continental and could have been better fo how much you are paying a night specially when it is brought to the room because they don’t have room to have an area for breakfast. They don’t have that many rooms so cook to order or maybe have some eggs and ham would have been perfect. A hot breakfast will have made this place the best one. Second to add is that we paid for the private pool (jacuzzi) and it is not inside the room, is it not a private balcony as I thought, you have to walk through the balcony and next to the pool to go inside the room, so technically anyone can walk to it. I would have liked to have my own private in my balcony, I would not have paid extra for it because the pool of the villa is next to the stairs that take you to the room. Besides those two comments I will definitely come back. Amazing Caldera view...
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon. It was beautiful! The location is perfect. It's at the start of the main street in Oia and is close to everything. Georgia was so helpful - anything you needed, she was more than willing to help (along with the other staff members). The room was comfortable and clean and you can't beat the view. Definitely recommend staying here!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the best stay ever! The place is located in a perfect place, in the midfle of Oia but down the stairs from the main path so its quiet. The view is beatiful!The rooms are perfect, every little detail is take care of.. The jacuzy is clean and hot. Nice fresh breakfast served on the balcony..Don't think twice..
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a hidden gem of a hotel in the middle of Oia. We booked the Superior Cave Suite and loved having our own private jacuzzi. We were also just a few steps away from the public pool. All rooms are fairly close together and I would see where some would have no privacy at all (especially the ones right next to the pool), so we were glad we booked the cave suite. The staff was wonderful and super helpful! They carried our bags up and down the steps when we checked in and checked out and that is a task! Tons of lot of steps! They would set up our breakfast every morning on our balcony, so we could dine with a view. THAT VIEW! What can I say, it was stunning! We also loved having a refrigerator in our room, and already stocked! The prices aren't bad either. There is a little general store up the steps on the main path that sells snacks, fruit and beverages. I believe they are open until 10 or 11pm. Very convenient! I miss this place already. We will definitely visit again and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a romantic, relaxing setting. A+ all around!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved Kima Villa. The villa staff were so friendly and attentive. The rooms were very comfortable and amazing views day & night of the caldera. Great local breakfast each morning on our balcony. Highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I were lucky enough to stay at Kima Villa for 5 days. The staff was excellent. The rooms are beautiful. If we needed anything from a coffee first thing in the morning or a late evening dinner reservation they were there to assist. The view from the pool is breathtaking. The breakfast served every morning was different which I found to be a nice touch. Overall you will not go wrong in staying at this beautiful hotel.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 8 days for our honeymoon. We booked a superior cave suite. We had our own pool and area to relax in which was lovely. Breakfast is delivered with a smile and is yummy with pastries, fruit, juice, tea and coffee, cheese etc. Whilst the room we were in wasn't 100% private from guests, all the villas at Kima are more private than many other locations in that they are off the main pathways and there are no public passing by. The service is excellent with daily room service and evening candles. We even asked for a room fan so that we could turn off the air conditioning and they went out and bought one for us. The staff and excellent and made our stay really enjoyable. thank you.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot recommend Kima Villa enough. Starting with the service - we arranged a taxi to collect us from the port to the hotel through Kima Villa beforehand. It was €40 each way which we thought was expensive, but couldn't be bothered with the hassle of a bus or negotiating with transfers at the busy port. It took about 40 minutes from port to hotel. When we arrived near the hotel, Aris (I think that was his name) met us and took our luggage - he insisted on taking all 3 bags down to the steep steps. We had a very warm welcome arrival from Georgia and Aris. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (it was about 11:30am and check in wasn't until much later) so Georgia made us drinks whilst explaining all the top sites of santorini. The room was ready shortly after we arrived and it was simply amazing. We were in a double deluxe room on the same level as the swimming pool. We were worried before we went that we wouldn't have a balcony facing out to see as the website said 'all suites have balconies' and we didn't book a suite. Whilst it wasn't a balcony exactly we had table and chairs in front of our room that looked out over the sea and pool, it was perfect. The room itself was beautiful, lovely decor, really cool climate, comfy bed, nice and dark at night. The bathroom was lovely too, with luxurious shampoo etc, white robes and slippers. There was a fridge and tea making facilities in each room, and we were given a small bottle of cava and plate of fruit on arrival which was a nice touch. The pool was perfect to cool down in after the santorini heat and the views were to die for. Aris and Saffa (not sure if that is her name!) kept the place immaculate, always so clean and well looked after and they were always very friendly, and couldn't do enough for us. The location was great - a steep climb to the top and there was a shop, restaurants etc. About 10 minutes walk to the sunset which was good as it meant it wasn't as busy at Kima Villas as it is further down the path. Breakfast was €15 each per day, which again wasn't cheap but each day it was different, tasty and fresh and I loved that you simply had to call them in the morning when you wanted breakfast and that brought it to your 'balcony'. Although it's not cheap to stay here, having looked at many, many options in Oia, I think the service, quality of the rooms and pool / location meant that overall it was good value in a very expensive destination! Would 100% recommend.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first time I've been compelled to write a review - who has time, right?! The staff at Kima (Aris, Georgia, Saba) were hands down the friendliest and most accommodating folks I've come across in my extensive travels. When we arrived, after 20+ hours of travel, we were immediately greeted with refreshments and accommodations. As we were checking in the staff learned we were actually on our honeymoon and went above and beyond to quickly get together the most beautiful champagne and fruit spread! I was shocked they were able to pull something like that off in less than five minutes! Our room (deluxe double) was perfect for us. It had plenty of room for our luggage and activities. It was very hot while we were in Santorini and this was the only hotel (we hopped around a bit) we stayed in where the AC kept the room really cold and we actually had to turn the temperature up - it was an amazing problem to have :)The property has a limited number of rooms in comparison to other hotels, which allows for a much more personable experience. We met several other guests that we will likely stay in touch with for years to come! This was the only hotel that we actually spent more time at and around the pool vs. adventuring / exploring the island. It was extremely peaceful with beautiful views of yachts and boats coming into the port. We really enjoyed the breakfast, which was included with the stay - other places nickel and dimed us for a lackluster buffet. Georgianna would bring us fresh breakfast to our outdoor patio each morning, all we had to do was phone and tell her what time. We really liked this, as we didn't want to run around looking for a viable breakfast option each morning. Breakfast was usually a spread of fruit, breads, and a different "main dish" each morning. It included the best fresh orange juice I've had in years, as well as coffee and tea. Lastly, the staff really went above and beyond when I had a laundry emergency and the staff stayed late that evening (for FREE) to make sure my clothes were clean, as the closest spot to do laundry was in Fira. Keep in mind this is after working very hard, long hours. I've never had that level of service in the U.S. (I know we normally have laundry service but I can buy new clothes at that rate!). They arranged excellent transportation and restaurant recommendations (we wanted the hole in the wall, local places... not tourist traps!).Definitely give Kima a look when you come to visit Santorini /Oia!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great week in this hotel. I highly recommend this place and if ever be back in Oia we will stay there. The location was perfect with not too many steps to reach the main road..The staff were very fraindly and went out of their way to help and assist us with anything we needed. the room was amazing with fantastic view and good breakfast which was served on our balcony. it was always clean.The pool was beautiful looking over the "Kaldera". Do yourself a faver and stay there..
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was at a decent location for Oia. Most of the hotels in the region have amazing views, and Kima Villa had its share too. However, that is all it had to offer. Service staff was almost rude, and never smiled through our stay. Rooms were clean and renovated, but very average, looking worse than in pictures. We also had fleas in our room.They have a small pool, but there was no shade around the pool. No umbrellas were provided, while every other hotel we could see had shades around the pool. Hotel website clearly shows umbrellas near pool, and when we asked about it, they said they used to have it, but have removed them now. We couldn't use the pool for long due to that.Breakfast was a major letdown..one day they just had cheese and bread, and the other day we were served plain omelette with no veggies. We decided to stay out of the hotel as much as we can, and regretted paying up so much for a hotel like this.On day of departure, we asked the staff to book us a private transfer to the port. We were confirmed a pickup time, but at time of departure, the lady told us that we have to share the cab with another couple, who will make a stop at airport before us. On confronting her that we paid for a private transfer, she gave a lame excuse that our car broke down on the way. She asked us to pay in cash for the 'private' cab, so she could keep her cut I guess. At that point we had no other option as we would have missed our ferry, and she took full advantage of that. I would rather recommend staying at Fira, and coming to Oia for a daytrip. Oia had much better vibe in my opinion, and wasn't run amok with tourists.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were fortunate to stay in Oia for 3 nights at this beautiful hotel. The cave suite was amazing. Great room with awesome views. We also had a private pool which was great. Breakfast was served every morning on our balcony which was awesome. The staff here is also great. I highly recommend this place
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The choice of hotel is fundamental to a successful stay in Santorini. We were fortunate to find KINA SUITES in Oia. We were warmly welcomeOur stay was well organize from the start : taxi reservation to the hotel, advices to visit the town and choose restaurants, treats (fruits, drinks, sweets ...)The rooms with an amazing view on the caldeira are spacious and comfortable. And last but not least, the hotel is very good value for money.We also enjoyed the quietness of the site.Thanks to Georgia, Ari and the staff for their kindness.Ariane
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love everything in this hotel! Kindly staff, the breakfast( every day they offer a diferent one!! And always with delicious regional goodies!! )The view is fantastic, the hotel, swiming pool and bedrooms have a free view of everything! Our room has a jacuzzi with free view and hot water all the time!! Was very close to the main street and there was a lot of restaurants and a mini market close to the hotel too. There is not many steps to get to the hotel because its near of the main street, they carry your luggage and can call a transfer to anywhere if you need it.It was the most wonderful hotel that I have ever been in my life. I could only say that little things make all diference and that is why I love this hotel!!! Thank you all for making my stay wonderful.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, the good news. The view was spectacular. The homemade fig jam at breakfast was delicious. Staff was friendly and sweet, but some of the issues noted in what we didn't like made it seem like they weren't paying attention to some details. Watching Ari carry 3 loaded suitcases at a time on the staircase from the main street was impressive. And he came very early our last morning to carry our suitcases back up the stairs so we could get to the airport for an early flight. It was a relief to know that we had the pool available to dunk in to and refresh ourselves at the end of the day. So there were numerous things that made this an inviting place to stay.However, one out of 3 beds were unmade the first night with no available sheets to be found. The breakfast was not as sumptuous as in other places we stayed, but certainly adequate, although they did not remember after our 2nd day that we wanted no meat served. We noticed our neighbors would get hard-boiled eggs and fruit, while we would get either/or each morning. No effort was made to obtain something for a small breakfast the day before we left for our very early morning departure to the airport on our last morning, even though we asked 2 days in advance. If I were able, I would mark the "overall rating of property" and "service" rating each at 3.5, rather than 3 or 4. Wifi was inconsistent, but not unusual for Greece. We were in villa #1 which was designed for 3-4 people but felt smaller than we had expected for the cost and was a bit dank when we first arrived. The AC took care of the dankness, but initially it did not feel as welcoming as it might have.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff, Sophia, Ari, and a second lady whose name escapes me, couldn't have been nicer to us. The hotel has a most beautiful view, and comfortable rooms. We got to stay in two different rooms during our stay and they were both very comfortable. Ari who wears many hats, was most hospitable, carrying our 50 lb. suitcases down the steep walkway to reception with ease. He also carried them out when we left. They bring breakfast to your room each day, and have wonderful recommendations for eating out. Kima Villa lives in our memories of the gorgeous Santorini.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I had booked this hotel and had read the reviews on TripAdvisor. We spent quite a bit of money and understood that the cost was for the view as the location of the hotel is phenomenal. When we first arrived, the room we got was not what we expected, very old and dated and felt a bit unkept. Unfortunately for us, the entire villa is small so we could not move to another room. We felt a bit ripped off for what we paid, granted the views were amazing. Aside from the room, we must say though that the service was great. They helped us book our excursions and Ari was amazing - carrying all of our bags up and down those stairs. I think if they updated their rooms a bit, this property would be a five start rating on TripAdvisor.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Kima Villa for 3 nights last week (July 2016) with my boyfriend. We ended up our trip in Santorini in this hotel and surely that was the best one we could wish for! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They made us feel very comfortable and made sure we were happy any time there. Saba, the housekeeper, is a very very sweet and kind woman who proved us that they are still people passionated by their jobs. Everyone there is smily, efficient, nice... I aslo spent my birthday there and they made sure I would have the best birthday. My day was full of surprises thanks to them all and my boyfriend. I had a wonderful day. We stayed in the junior suite which is gorgeous!! From the inside first but also and surely with the terrasse with the private jaccuzi. Everything is clean, the view is outstanding, the place is very calm and most of all, very private (which is not the case of all properties in Oia because of the architecture). The breakfast included is nice, and changes everyday. I highly recommend this place to any couple who wish to have the best of Santorini. I will hopefully go back myself someday.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed at kima villa for 1 night in a superior room with a jacuzzi, and we were not dissapointed. The room was clean and tidy and exactly what we expected, the views from our room were just unbelievable. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic, nothing will beat eating breakfast looking at the amazing views. The pool and jacuzzi were spotless the only little niggle I would have was how cold the jacuzzi was, it was hard to get into until the sun had warmed it up a little.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wish I could give this villa 5*. It has an amazing location/view and a staff to boot. We had the family suite, while the room was spacious enough the bathroom was dated and small and in great need of better ventilation. Once we used it a smell would ensue and just continue through the night until the next morning when the cleaning lady would tidy up. We would return and no smell. We stayed for 3 nights, kept the bathroom door closed and the exhaust fan on while we slept. At the price point of $350, certainly Kima Villas can make this better. Santorini does not seem to suffer from the economic woes of greece. On the other side, the staff were great. Always smiling and helpful. especially Aris. Breakfast outside of our room overlooking the water was something out of a book. You cannnot believe the beauty until you are there. My sons loved the pool but I had to caution them to be quiet as most the guest were couples just sunbathing. Location also was excellent. Just at the beginning edge of town, about 1/4 down on the cliff egde, so means steps!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Kima villas in early June 2016 and found it rather pleasant. Being in the heart of Oia, villas in the summer are notoriously expensive and having booked only last minute, we picked Kima based on the reviews here on TA. I would say this is more like a B&B with a wicked view from its infinity pool, definitely not luxurious nor the most private but pleasant enough especially if you're out and exploring Oia most the day. We got the junior suite with a private jacuzzi which was worth the money especially when the pool was crowded with no deck chairs available. I honestly think most of the the villas in Oia would more or less be the same in terms of room and view.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No service here. No help.Were there in honey moon with my wife and we were very much desapointed.We were left alone to reach the place with our big suitcases... Long way down !The room was dirty.Swimming pool was dirty.Breakfast was not good. My wife was sick...My advice, go somewhere else !
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Kima was a 4 night break from a busy work schedule - and it was perfect! The room was clean, comfortable and spacious and the simple breakfast delivered to us each morning was a wonderful way to start the day. Kima, while being in the centre of Oia is perfectly hidden from the curious eyes of wandering tourists but still maintains a spectacular uninterrupted view of the caldera....something we took full advantage of when snoozing on the sunbeds and cooling off in the pool. It was difficult to drag ourselves away from this luxury! To make our stay even better and one I'll continue to recommend, Tasos and his team truly made us feel at home.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second visit to Kima Villas, having stayed there last year. We love the place and this year lived up to all expectations....The welcome we received from Tasos, Saba and Aris was like meeting with old friends, and we immediately felt at home.We chose to stay in the Superior Cave, which has been completely renovated and provided us with superb views of the Caldera and parts of Oia town. This also gave us a private balcony and jacuzzi which were very well utilised.Tasos as always provided us with the names of restaurants and we would heartily recommend Melitini's, Kastro and Pelakanos, the latter of which gives fantastic views of the fantastic sunsets which grace Santorini. If you are wandering around Oia, then you could do far worse than stop off at Meteor Bar for a cocktail or fresh juice, whilst listening to some jazz!!Kima Villas is a wonderful little hotel, the team are courteous and are proud of their work place, the area is kept spotless by the tireless work of Saba and Aris, and we just love the place......
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Book this hotel. Now. Actually, don't book it, just in case I want your room instead! Haha. But seriously, book it. The location is incredible. Oia is the place to stay- far away from the cruise ship tourists. The streets are made of marble, and the hotel is very close to lots of excellent restaurants and shopping. View is TO. DIE. FOR. Amazing. Stunning. I heard a lot of people mentioning that the pool was small, but honestly, it's just the right size. You can't have a huge pool on a cliffside, and this one is far from small. The view from inside the pool is amazing. I spent hours just lounging in and around the pool. Ask Tasos to bring you some wine!The bed was hard, but that's okay. I also liked being in a cave room, although the wifi didn't really work inside my room. But it worked well outside by the pool. The rooms are super quiet which was great. The shower in our room was dated but I honestly didn't care. Breakfast wasn't worth the 20 euros unless you're not wanting to trek up and down the stairs. The stair. Oh, the stairs. It was 70 VERY LARGE steps down (and back up) to the villas. It definitely made us plan our outings wisely. The one time we forgot sunscreen and had to go back for it was enough to make us more cautious the next time. But, I'm not in the best physical shape and I could tackle them by stopping to catch my breath halfway up. Make sure to tip the guy who brings your suitcases up and down! Tasos was amazing and incredibly helpful. We booked our excursions through him as well as reservations for dinner and everything went off without a hitch every time. It was seriously flawless. He was able to accommodate our needs perfectly. I definitely recommend this hotel. Just make sure to leave plenty of time to relax by the pool!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Kimas Villas with husband and 2 teenager daughters aged 18 and 14 for a week on mid August. A very relaxed family holiday with lots of bonding!! Very scenic and the pool is a bonus (just for dipping after climbing up and down the 265 steps in Ammoudioy bay) Tasos was very helpful and have done above and beyond! His staff (lady who cleans the room is very sweet and Mr muscle man - gosh carrying those suitcases) Thank you Kima Villa!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked in advance and was so happy that I found this gem of a property. The views are to die for and the inside features were outstanding and quality built. Tasos was the best manager/host since he was so available to assist me on the transport, breakfast, sunset sailboat catamaran booking (which was amazing) and so much more! There is a coffee heater, full mini bar and the shower and bathroom was fully equipped with all the comforts of home including a blowdryer and great smelling bath products. I could not leave the suite just loving the views and how you felt to wake up to these views of heaven. The pool was great and cliffside so you could wade and just look out to the sea. The private jacuzzi in my room was perfect too! The proximity of the hotel to the front of the OIA walkway is perfect. You do not have to go very far or you do not have to walk so far down to the hotel...but do not worry they had a man waiting for me at the top to bring my bags down. Make your booking now and go to OIA and tell Tasos that KIMA is the best hotel there!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I vacationed for the first time in Greece. We struggled with Fira vs Oia,and which hotel to book. After we landed in Santorini,and was wisked away from the airport to Kyma Villas,we were immediately impressed and happy with our decision. Tasos and his staff handled EVERYTHING! From carrying our bags up and down stairs,to making dinner reservations,to the awesome breakfast each morning,to printing boarding passes,etc! The views from our Junior Suite was fantastic! To see my wife's smile each morning was worth the trip. The hotel was clean and very affordable. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 5 night stay at Kima Villa was everything I was hoping it to be! Actually , it surpassed all of my expectations!!! The location in Oia was great (60 steps down = 60 steps up) which was quite doable for me...the facilities and the pool were superb!! The staff was excellent! A huge thank you to Saba, Tasos & Aris for making my stay so enjoyable.!! Also, I want to recognize the taxi driver for Kima, Marcos for waiting for me at the port when my 9pm ferry from Milos did not arrive until 1:30am!! Bravo Marcos!!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a full-on 4 weeks of touring in Europe, we treated ourselves to 3 nights on Santorini. We didn't think that Oia was going to be affordable (it certainly wasn't 10 years ago), but we found Kima Villas that were great value for money and in a fantastic location right on the cliff. And we were not disappointed! It was wonderful. The views were breathtaking, the atmosphere intimate and welcoming. Tasos and his small team were really helpful and friendly. So it isn't a luxurious resort, but it is charming, clean, has a lovely little pool, a great breakfast on your terrace and is in an ideal spot. We loved our time there and would go back in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent an amazing 4 days in Oia at Kima Villas and we had the most blissful experience. We stayed in the Superior Cave Suite, which is very spacious with private balcony and secluded jacuzzi (not heated) and the most stunning views I have ever seen. The staff (Tasos, Aris and Saba) were so accommodating, hardworking and friendly, I cannot tell you how pleasant our experience was with this staff. The daily breakfast was simple, but tasty and served on our balcony! The newly renovated Superior Cave Suite is sleek, modern, clean, roomy and met all of our needs, except the bed mattress is uncomfortable/rock hard. The hotel is situated in a very quiet location with excellent access to the local market, restaurants and shops. There are a lot of steps so beware if you have any mobility issues as it's a hike but not a problem for us, and in fact we welcomed it after a lot of delicious meals and wine! Also the staff carries your luggage so no worries there. :) Amazing value and truly stunning location for the money! You will not be sorry booking this Suite, even if the bed is hard, everything else is ethereal! Thank you Kima for a dream vacation!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a blissful week in Oia and must say that I found this hotel and it's wonderful staff to be near perfect! Junior suites with the private balcony and jacuzzi were perfectly situated to offer privacy and some of the finest views on the planet. The staff (Tasos, Aris and Saba) were some of the warmest, most accommodating people I've ever met, all this in the face of serious Greek economic upheaval! As a former Four Seasons alumn, I can tell you that I have met many hotel employees......hire for attitude, and you can train for the rest! Tasos (hotel manager) sent us to some amazing restaurants (Floga and Meletini were our favorites!!) The daily breakfast was simple, but amazing! The newly renovated Junior suites are sleek and very comfortable, and the hotel was situated in a very quiet (by Santorini standards) location with excellent access to restaurants and shops. My only criticism is that at 6'2 (and built like a linebacker) the mattress was a bit uncomfortable for my large frame, but I still managed to sleep more than at home, and returned well rested and recharged.Thank you Kima for a wonderful vacation!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Friendly staffs with a high quality of living, with private balcony. A very peaceful location! Best place ever!!!!! The manager helped us to book restaurant and preparing cake for a birthday event, it was a fantastic trip!!!
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't recommend this place enough! We stayed for 3 nights and loved our stay here. The rooms are nothing flash but that view; wow. Great infinity pool and comfy deck chairs. Our host was very friendly and helpful; actually all the staff were fantastic there. Very warm and welcoming. I loved the cute breakfast served to us, everyday it was slightly different but always tasty! Oia is such a beautiful place, loved the town. Oh and those stairs leading dish to our villa were crazy! Great leg work out, hehe. Will definitely come back if we ever get the chance. Thank you Kima Villa for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four of us stayed here last August for 4 days. 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We had the best room in the place with the most amazing balcony. The pool was nice just to cool off and the service and friendliness of the staff was good and having breakfast on your balcony everyday was amazing. The steep steps would be difficult for the immobile to access the villa up and down all the time. The Wifi wasn't that great for the kids and even though the villa was nice and quaint, it was very compact with all four of us in there. The bathroom was tiny and just a shower and we had to hold the shower which was a pain! We enjoyed the whole of Oia and this was our fifth time to Santorini so we know it well. The villas were pleasant and the view was to die for!! Well worth a stay for the view, but you won't see the sunset directly from your balcony, but a walk away you will.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had always wanted to visit Santorini, but only got round to it this summer...wow, why haven't we been before!!! The hotel is wonderful, the staff; Tasos, Saba and Aris are exceptional and made the holiday as relaxed as we could have wished.The views are spectacular, overlooking the Caldera, and the walk into town every night was like being on a movie set - I've never taken so many photgraphs!! And then there's the sunsets, it just keeps getting better....The Villa itself is spotless and has a lovely infinity pool, where you can simply watch the world go by and unwind...very very relaxing. Breakfasts are served on your balcony and the greek yoghurt and black cherries are delicious!That good, we have already booked again for this coming year.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is breathtaking... The breakfast is great the sunset is just 10 minutes walk away, the staff exceptional. Oia is the heart of santorini and definitely you can feel the pulse in kima villas...
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of Kima Villa is perfect. It is on the edge of the cliff over looking the sea. The views are like a postcard. To get to the Villa you must walk down stairs which is your daily exercise. Your bags will be carried down when you enter and up when you leave. The two things that make it amazing are the pool and the local market right up the stairs from the villa. You will not want to leave the pool. The only thing is that you must wake up early to save seats around the pool because there is not enough for everyone who stays in the villa. We used the market everyday too. We would go for snacks and drinks to bring back to the pool. The villa does not have a bar, which is not necessary. The manage was awesome. He helped us with anything we needed and so friendly. All the staff were friendly and helpful!The rooms are simple and clean. They have a refrigerator and kitchenette with all the necessary things provided you would need. Many times we would again go to the market or bakery and eat lunch right outside our room. You can get a continental breakfast serviced on the table outside your door every morning for 10 euros per person. We had a room on the second floor which was nice because it was more private then the rooms right around the pool.Overall an amazing experience. The heart of Oia with all the restaurants and shops are steps away.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I shared a room with my sister and I was a little disappointed with our room when we first arrived. It only has queen bed which cannot be separated. The rooms are quite basic, with a small kitchen (we never used except to make a cuppa) with a small table, bench seat and couple of chairs. The furniture and room decor is dated but clean. However in all honesty, we didn't spend much time in the the room so it was acceptable. Service was a bit hit and miss. We asked for ice and got about 10 cubes with the message theres no more which is fine, just dont expect service of an upmarket hotel. The swimming pool was a good size for the small hotel (I think there were 9 rooms). Its crystal clear blue water was amazing and we loved just hanging there and staring out watching the cruise ships go by. Obviously Its the location and views are what you are paying for. I initially thought it was quite expensive but we were on a tight budget. I would expect all accommodation in Oia to be very, very expensive with good reason. This hotel is an good option for anyone on a budget.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experiences with Kyma Villas was flawless with both the view and service exceptional. Being surrounded by such a magnificent view leaves you feeling like you're in a movie. It's hard to believe it is real.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very satisfied with our room, the pool and the exceptional service. Not a bad word to say. Excellent value and excellent location. We had the room with our own private patio overlooking the caldera.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay so much in Santorini and the number one reason was Kima Villa. The location is perfect! The staff are so friendly and helpful. We truly hope to return one day and will only stay at Kima Villa
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this beautiful hotel the previous week . The staff was excellent , nice and gentle and help us with everything. The view was stunning and the breakfast delicious !! Is not far from the centre of Oia and around there are several shops restaurant and taverns. Thank you guys for everything . I am definitely recommend this place
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view was beautiful and the pool area was really nice. I agree that the bed was not comfortable, and our shower had no holder, so you had to hold it. Both of these were disappointing for the price, especially as these are obviously items where feedback that has been given many times before but nothing done about it. Generally good though, mainly for the view and the closeness to town.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't recommend this place enough. Our room for 4 people was spacious and had a small kitchenette. The pool is small, but perfect for relaxing. The breakfasts were quite generous and delicious. Tasos the owner was friendly without being overbearing. The price was towards the cheaper end of similar properties, but I didn't feel I really lacked for anything.The hotel was hard to find with Google Maps not very helpful. There is a small sign to the hotel by a staircase near the beginning of the pedestrian street. There is a small market at the top of the staircase.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oia is one of the most beautiful places on earth and the location of Kima villa is excellent, giving you the opportunity to admire the view while swimming in its -small- pool. The rooms are spacious and clean and the hotel manager helpful and with a sense of humour.The hotel is near the central pedestrian walk, but you have to climb some stairs to get there, so it might not be a good idea for older people; on the other hand, you do get help with your luggage. Breakfast is standard for all and you don't get to choose, but the view and tranquility make up for that.Overall, it was a pleasant and relaxing trip and Oia is highly recommended for couples and young families.
hotelName:
21    Kima Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife have just come back from a one weeks stay at the Anamnesis Hotel. We had a great time and as people have mentioned it's great location (situated away from the hustle and bustle at the top of the cliff) staff are friendly and the hotels clean and tidy. The breakfast is nice, however a little samey and repetitive especially if you're staying for a week.The pool is a nice place to kick back and relax and gets a good amount of sun throughout the day - there are only 8 sunbeds though so if you get a few family's there early doors you're in trouble getting a lounger. We were lucky though and pretty much had the pool to ourselves most days.We had a room with a hot tub facing the sea which was brilliant, great place to have a few cans whilst the wife dried her hair (which takes a good hour)I would recommend staying in this hotel
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my husband stayed here for 5 days, the location is perfect just a short walk from the centre and with parking just a short walk down the road! The room was spacious, spotless and we had fresh towels everyday.The pool area although a little small we never struggled for a bed. Breakfast was good with a range of options and staff super helpful! I would definitely stay again should we return to santorini!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Anamnesis City Spa Hotel for 5 nights after our wedding and we were very happy with our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they helped us book our transport and offered various recommendations for us. The room was clean and tidy and we had a fantastic view on our balcony. Breakfast was great, there were plenty of options. Overall we had a great stay and would highly recommend it if you’re looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Thira. Thank you for a great stay. Chloe Osborne- Bournemouth, United Kingdom.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The deluxe double room room was a little small but it was very clean. We only stayed for two nights and our Jacuzzi wasn't working twice. The first time we called and the girl fixed it within about 5 mins, but the second night we called and the girl said she needed to get a guy to fix it, but by then it would have been too late so we couldn't use it. The next morning we went back to our room and there was a man out cleaning/fixing the Jacuzzi so I wouldn't recommend paying extra for the Jacuzzi based on this. The location is perfect. You get a nice sunrise view and its about a 2 min walk into the town. The breakfast has a great variety I have a few allergies and they were accommodating. The receptionists and hotel staff were all very friendly too :) The pool area is lovely and clean.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful hotel the staff we so helpful, a short walk from the center and a tranquil calm after the hussle & bussle of Fira. Our room (14) was spotless & stunning, with the view & Jacuzzi it was perfect. Air conditioning in both rooms & a small fridge.Breakfast was great with a variety of cold & hot options. Highly recommend
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful boutique hotel just few steps from centre of Fira, bus station, mini market and shops. Delicious breakfast, friendly stuff, everything is clean and our room also had nice view. Definitely great choice!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff, especially Fani and Maria, really make this place shine. Our room was quiet, modern and smelled fresh & clean. Although the standard room was a bit tight for us and our 2 large suitcases, we had a sea view (off in the distance). The hotel is located on a street with some traffic, so coming into Anamnesis is like entering a relaxing oasis. You can walk 5-10 minutes to find lots of places to eat and Fira's touristy shopping area. Breakfast offered a wonderful variety for such a small hotel. You get some traffic noise while at the swimming pool, but taking a swim is a wonderful way to beat the heat and relax on a lounger. A special thanks to the staff who really provide some top-notch service to their guests.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and I can easily say that it is one of the best hospitality I received from Fany - Front Office Manager and one stop solution for all the queries...this is small and cozy hotel with very comfortable rooms. Hotel is in the heart of the Fira city, capital of Santorini..Must visit.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found the hotel and location very good, easy access from airport and no walking .Fira /Oia trail is 5 min walk away, nice restaurants and cafes close by. Nice pool, spacious room, good breakfast & very helpful front desk ! Wish had more than just a day .Great hotel for short stay.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very handy to shopping centre, about 5-10 min walk up small hill. Bus terminal is about the same distance. There is also a little minimart right accross road from hotel and is very cheap for drinks.Hotel has a nice swimming pool with sun loungers and a table and chairs. Clean towels are available by reception.We were in room 1 near the breakfast room.We had a nice view and could watch all the donkeys file past early each morning on their way to work with the tourists. Room was spacious and the large bed was very comfortable. Good shower with plenty of water pressure. A wee bit of road noise at night but not really a problem.Breakfast was good, all we needed. Not the variety that big hotels have
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Anamnesis Spa for 3 nights in October. The location is very good - only a 5 min walk to the shops and bus stop. If you have a car there is a free car park 100 meters from the hotel, or if you are lucky you can find a car parks at the front of the hotel.The staff are very friendly and welcoming and offered suggestions of things to do around the island. We had a very large room with small balcony opening out to the pool area. The bathroom was a good size but the water temperature seemed to turn hot and warm throughout my shower.One negative point is that the walls were very thin. There were a group of girls in the room next door and they had returned to the hotel past midnight on the first night we stayed. They were talking loudly and it woke me up. My husband had to get out of bed and ask the front desk to do something about the noise. Thankfully the staff member was understanding that it was very late and made a phone call to the group. The hotel is in a quiet area, but there were some dogs in the neighbouring properties and a few stray dogs around the area and at night we could hear them barking at times during the night.Breakfast is very basic and not too much not food selection. Would have liked to have seen some fresh fruit salad on offer.I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I wouldn't call it luxury, but it was very comfortable and the price was quite reasonable.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night since we were off to Ios but the staff made us feel like we were part of them. Mmm they gave us one two spots to go when we had no clue where to go. Room was clean and nice and they were wearing a smile all the time. Excellent :) Close distance from bus stop and the centre, like 5 min walk !! Recommended.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maria greeted us upon arrival and was super friendly. She got us set up in our room which I believe is the one in their photo. It was modern, clean and perfect with a nice bathroom. The terrace was large with great views of the water and open landscape. The jacuzzi was a nice touch. The beds were comfortable and the room quiet. Breakfast downstairs in a light filled room was amazing. Many choices and all you wish for. We were only 3 days in Santorini but wished we had more. It was Maria's name day the day we left and she gave us treats. Very sweet person. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for only one night but we were truly satisfied.The girl in the reception was great! She had long darkbrown hair and made sure that our visit was great. We had to check out at 11 (the same day that we were traveling back to Sweden) but our transfer to the airport wasn't supposed to pick us up until 8 that evening. We were able to keep our luggage there and had access to the pool and showers all day. The room was fresh and cost, the ac sounded a bit more than usual, but we didn't really mind. Pool area was small but fresh and perfect for that hotel. 5 minutes walk to Oía to se the beautiful sunset and views. Good restaurants near the hotel that our receptionist recommended. Supernice visit! Thank you.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for several nights during a stay on Santorini with my wife. The location of this hotel is excellent; only a couple of hundred meetings from the local bus station and main centre of Thira, and therefore walking distance to restaurants and the amazing views of the Caldera. We stayed in a triple room where there was a small single 'sofa style' bed in a small living area downstairs, with a small double bed upstairs in the dome room. The bathroom looks recently renovated; however, the shower was terrible! It constantly fluctuated between boiling hot and cold water, with little consistency in water temperature. It made showering unpleasant after a long day exploring the sights of the island. The other major disappointment was the location of the double bed upstairs. First, the staircase to the upper level is at about 110 degrees so steep on the ascent and decent; this made coming down during the middle of the night to use the bathroom difficult and almost dangerous. If you have bees knees you might want to ask to avoid such a room. Second, being situated upstairs meant that it was like a sauna up there! With no air conditioning - only a fan that blew around hot air - it made for sweaty sleeping each night. Finally, the bed was rock hard and therefore difficulty to sleep on. A nice shower and bed are my two main priorities for hotel accommodation so it missed the mark majorly on these features. In saying that, the two ladies at reception were super friendly and helpful in helping us navigate the island, etc. The buffet breakfast was ok too, with a range of savoury (eg, eggs, bacon, cold meats) and sweets (eg, croissants, local pastries). Overall, worth it for the location but terrible for the room features.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I honestly don't know how anyone could have anything negative to say about this hotel- especially for the price! My husband and I had the luxury of staying here for two nights during our stay in Fira, Santorini. I'll review the room, breakfast, staff, and location in that order:Room: We stayed in a standard King bed room. It was perfect for two people, with a small balcony included. The plus to this room was the ample bathroom, and the fact that I got the see the most beautiful SUNRISE from our tiny balcony! I know Santorini is known for its sunsets, but have you seen the sunrise? WOW!Breakfast: Breakfast was buffet-style with your staples available- breads, cereals, pastries, juice, coffee, sausages, bacon, and eggs to order. We left each morning satiated.Staff: the ladies working the front desk as well as the cleaning staff were so accommodating. We received help with our port-to-hotel transfer, and were accommodated for our late check out. There is a gentlemen who sits at the front desk at night so safety is clearly important.Location: This hotel is situated walking distance to everything you could possibly need. 5 minute walk to Fira center, 10 minute walk to the start trail from Fira to Oia, and 5 minute walk to the local bus station which provides transportation to the new Port, Oia, and other parts of Santorini. If I ever visit Santorini again, I would love to stay here again!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very enjoyable stay here - the hotel is modern and well kept. The location is perfect, only a 5 minute stroll into Fira centre. The staff are excellent - our driver for our transfer didn't show up due to our ferry being delayed by over an hour so the hotel refunded us the money from our alternative arrangement. Would highly recommend this as a pool is necessary if travelling in the summer months.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little B&B. Had an amazing room with jetted tub on balcony on top floor, with sun loungers and towels. (As in previous reviews the hot tub is not hot,it's warm but when the weather hot you don't need it that warm)Such an amazing view. Very private not overlooked. Each day we would sit in jacuzzi and look at that view. View is of sunrise. Breakfast very filling. Owner very informative and help us book transport and excursions. Hotel was quiet the week we were there. Room had a lovely big bathroom . In room fridge with kettle, coffee maker, sandwich press. If you need anything extra like coffee mugs or bottle opener, all you have to do is ask. In room safe which is key lock. We got hotel to arrange airport transport €20 per couple. We had room 13 would definitely book this room again. You can see donkeys walk past in morning and evening. Only 5min walk to main square. We bought a hiking map to explore the island by foot and by ATV. We booked via Expedia so flight were with easy jet from Gatwick. When we left santorini I was glad we didn't have hold bags and with a travel agent. as they make you que up outside for ages. We just walk straight to security. Very small airport, one shop and little food stand.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was lovely, and had a small balcony with view of the sea. Kettle and coffee maker provided and they will give you tea and milk. Breakfast was provided and a good variety. The staff were eager to help you with anything you needed. In the morning and evenings you could hear and see the donkeys going back to their home.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a large room with a balcony overlooking the aegean sea (not the caldera side) but this meant a beautiful sunrise if you can wake up for it.The location is Great - only minutes from the centre of Fira.The staff are so helpful and friendly - There is one member of staff who seems to do everything in the morning credit to her she kept everything running. Nothing was too much for herThe Wifi is intermittent and only works in the reception area which is a real shame.Also I would have liked some tea and coffee in the room with the kettle
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in very late at night and the staff Maria was all ready to welcome us. Room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good. All staff were friendly and helpful. It is a easy 5min walk to Fira centre with shopping and restaurants. The only problem we encountered was the wifi in the room. We could not use the wifi at all. Could only connect at the lobby or breakfast room.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First thing great little hotel 5 mins from main square. Fira is beautiful. So much to see and do. Staff - Great more then great!! All the ladies were so helpful friendly always happy. Breakfast - was good loads of choices loved the fruity tea one of my favourite so that was a bonus. We was group of 3 and we all loved it defiantly would come back here again next year. Thank you so much.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an absolutely lovely stay! The staff went above and beyond to completely cater to the guests and are extremely friendy! We didnt bump into one person who wasnt extremely enthusiastic and welcoming! They are there to help with anything you need big or small! We ended up having an issue with a Ferry Company cancelling a Ferry we had booked to Crete without any previous warning...which could have potentially been very stressful, however,  the lady at the Front Desk offered to help us out and was able to sort everything out for us with the Ferry Company in Greek which was a huge stress reliever as we did not have to deal with it ourselves or waste precious holiday time! You can book a variety of wonderful excursions for a good price at the reception! We would definitely recommend their Thirasia Island/Volcano/Hotsprings Day tour for a mere €26. They will also, book taxis, hire cars, print flight and ferry tickets, lend extra towels, provide chargers and converters...anything you need!The breakfast was fantastic! Lots of very healthy and local options! Greek Yogurt with Honey and Walnuts, lots of delicious pastries, meats, fruits, etc. to choose from! You will not go hungry! If you open the door in the breakfast room in the morning you can watch the donkeys get herded by in groups! Excellent!The resort is a comfortable 5 minute walk off the main strip which means it is very quiet and peaceful but still right beside all the action! You can get a beautiful view of the sea from your room but it is not the classic caldera view....but well worth it for the solitude. The only thing I was a bit disappointed with was that our private Hot Tub on the balcony was luke warm at 34/35 degrees... not hot. I can see how this would be perfect during the summer...but as we stayed in off season so we wished it was able to get hotter so we couldve made better use of it as the outdoor space is spectacular. The room itself was massive and everything else was beyond what we expected so we really cant complain!One of the best holidays I have ever been on! Thank you to all the staff for being so wonderful!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked into the hotel late and were given an upgrade to a superior double with an outdoor jacuzzi. We had a view of fields and a church from the balcony. But sadly, we didn't have time to use the jacuzzi or hotel pool during our stay.Breakfast at the hotel was good. But they stop serving breakfast on time so give yourself enough time to make a plate.I like that the hotel was away from the main part of town and away from the noise. But still a short walk away.We definitely would come back and spend more time enjoying the hotel and spa.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a superior suite. It was a beautiful room, Sunrise over the sea, jacuzzi and modern room! I couldn't fault one thing. It's a perfect location too. The staff were very informative and we're amazing! Pretty reasonably priced too!!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in September for 5 nights. It's was a beautiful holiday for us in Fira. This hotel is very near the main bus station and very close to Fira City. Room was clean and large. Breakfast was ok. Staff was helpful and there was free wifi.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night prior to our flight back to UK. Had a Junior Suite with jacuzzi. Room seemed smaller than photos on web site but was immaculate. It felt brand new and finished to a high standard, particularly for Greece. Loved it. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were polite and very helpful. Will definitely be staying again here next year.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect. The blond woman with glasses (forgot her name) at the front desk is exceptional. The hotel is clean and the location is about 1 block away walking distance from the main area of Fira.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a rule, you cannot go wrong with Santorini, I suppose this can be said for many of the Greek Islands, so how then does one distinguish one hotel from the other, when everything on this island is basked in calm and serenity?. This review will not provide the answer to that, but it can shed light on the Anamnesis City Spa Hotel. The Anamnesis is smack dab in the middle of city centre Fira; it is close to the high street but still cocooned in its own time zone, so the activity of the city never really crashes in; with balconies looking the gentle calm of the far off Aegean. The staff are friendly and eager to help, as are the rooms, which cozy and neat will remind you more of an inn than a hotel- but that is the takeaway, Santorini doesn't do grandeur or spectacle, they leave that to the island itself, and once you come to this realization, you are able to allow the Island wash over you. I spent three nights in May 2016, for a total of 255 EUR, half board and room. I will have very fond memories of this time, and that is in no small part due to the warm reception and the lasting memories of the Anamnesis. Sadly i didn't have time to use all their facilities, like the spa, but when next I find myself in Santorini, I will be making myself their guest again, and that for me is the biggest endorsement I can give any hotel.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a total surprise and joy. We arrived by foot on a busy road just along from the bus station. We found the hotel next to the kerb, so thought it would be noisy, it wasn’t. It was an oasis of calm when we entered. The receptionist welcomed us and went through the islands highlight with us, always helpful. She then advised we had breakfast included and they had even given us a free upgrade! Awesome!We had a gorgeous room with a massive balcony looking over the coast, they even apologised it wasn’t over the caldera. The caldera side of Thira is very windy so we didn’t mind a bit. We felt safe and secure, with a safe in the room and privacy from the street.Then joy of joy we got a jacuzzi all of our own, clean, warm and for our exclusive use. Breakfast was lovely, with a large choice of fresh fruit, bread, meat cheese etc. Handy little shop across the street, bike hire up the road. Short walk to the bars and restaurants.The pool was small but clean and pleasant to swim in. We asked about restaurants and were given a great recommendation too. We didn’t have time to use the steam room or treatments but can’t say enough good things about this little hotel.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 6 nights with a friend in June 2016 and cannot fault this small, but personal place.It's in a good location (approx 10mins walk into the square) and I loved how small the hotel is, in regards to how many rooms it has. The facilities were spotless and the staff were so friendly and helpful. On my birthday, they left a bottle of wine and a lovely note for me. Also they printed off maps without being asked and were very knowledgable about the island.If you can get a room with a terrace and hot tub, then I think it's worth the extra money. In terms of service, I think this is the best place I have stayed in and would come again. Thanks to all at the hotel!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel, staff couldn't have been more helpful! Room was clean & comfortable with a nice private terrace. Pool is small but fine for the size of hotel. Perfect location for shops, restaurants, pubs & clubs. Breakfast had a nice selection on offer. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location,5-10 minutes walk, from Fira bus station.We booked 2 rooms. Our room number is #1 and #12. Everything in room #1 seemed to be perfected, having private Jacuzzi in the terrace, clean room, clean bathroom, and very strong wifi signal. The point is you are not able to use Jacuzzi in the night, cause there's no electric supply until 8.30am of the next day.For room #12 the room is spacious, ok bathroom and a bit smell of humidity. Also there's no in house phone given the reason that it's not yet finished. Air conditioning in this room did not work well and it was really hot. Once told Hotel staff she just knodded her and do nothing, so this problem couldn't be solved. Breakfast was very cheap/poor quality, for example ham. Staff did not provided adequate food, but if new guests came more amount of food would be put in line.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights with my fiancé in July. It's small and really nice a new looking hotel. Stayed on the upper floor suite with the outdoor jacuzzi which had a huge Terrance with a hammock and lounge chairs. The hotel comes with free wifi and breakfast. It's about 5 min walk to Calder or fira square. Fira is my opinion the best town in Santorini, it's in the center of anything you wanna do on this beautiful island. If I ever return I would 100% stay at this hotel.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my boyfriend stayed here in June this year , the hotel itslef was really modern as it has just been refurbished and is in a great location literally a couple of minutes walk to the caldera. There was enough to eat at breakfast but it was quite simple The swimming pool was lovely and would of been relaxing however there was a lot of road noise as it is next to a very busy road leading into fira centre with numerous quads, mopeds and vehicles. The room we stayed in was a jacuzzi room , before we arrived at the hotel I emailed them 3 times asking if we could have the room with the larger balcony as this and sunloungers on and the other one was a lot smaller. I finally got a response stating that the room we would recieve would have sunloungers, however when we arrived we where given the room with the smaller balcony and the jacuzzi was In full view of the main road. The lady did offer to put sunloungers on the balcony however it would have been to much of a squeeze with them on there. The jacuzzi itself was always full of debris, bugs and was freezing so we couldn't use it until on our 5th day when they decided to clean it and turn the temperature up, however they failed to mention not to use it for a couple of hours as there was bleach in there which ruined my boyfriends shorts, they did clean it agin the next day and told us not to get in straight away but it was to late by then. when we were checking out of the hotel they also charged us 50 euro as I had got makeup on one of the bedsheets only a little bit but they couldn't get it out , there was also marks on some of the towels which again they said they couldn't get out (this was the bleach from the jacuzzi ) I was extremely unhappy with this as we had already payed a lot for a jacuzzi room however they weren't interested. Overall the hotel was ok , but make sure you use your own towels or don't get any marks on theirs !
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really great value hotel. Small and friendly. In quieter area of Fira. Looks to have been recently refurbished ti a very high standard. Pool area is small, but very pleasant. We stayed in a triple room, all rooms have A/C, a safety deposit box and are decorated to a high standard of finish. All round great hotel. Oh yeah, breakfast is good as well. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic stay in the Anamnesis Hotel.The staff and owners could not have been more helpful. We were there to attend a family wedding and the hotel was the perfect location, just a few minutes from the town so easy to meet up with everyone. The rooms and bathrooms were really nice, very clean and modern. Breakfast was basic but very nice and again staff always willing to get you anything you required. The pool was soo clean and a lovely size. There was also a small shop just opposite the hotel which came in very handy! Thanks all for a great stay, I will definitely be back :)
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent 4 nights at Anamnesis City Spa.The perfect location, walking distance to Fira but away from all the noise. The staff were always friendly and helpful and we had wonderful undisturbed sleep every night! The breakfasts are the best as they say and the pool is the perfect delight to come "home" to after a day of exploring Santorini.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights. This hotel is in a fantastic location but note the road it is on is busy and difficult to walk down due to the oncoming traffic. That said, we did not experience any noise from the road. Our room however was just off reception so you can hear the activity in reception, phone, guests etc. This did not really bother us, nor did it affect our stay. The room itself was all blue, and had a very calming feel to it. We had our own balcony with a sea view. The breakfast was good and varied. The location of the hotel is perfect, just far enough out of the city centre to be quiet, but only 7 mins walk from the bus station and main shopping streets. The staff were great and very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay here.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On May 5 ,2015 we sailed to Santorini by SuperJet an EasyJet Ferry. The hotel is modern, clean, great value for money. Room was modern, and clean. Free WiFi. Staff in hotel are genuine friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice, selection of meats, cheeses, fruits and sweet pastries, but every day the same. Close to Fira center. If you want to get a public bus to other places on the island as Oia, Imerovogil, or Kamari , station is 5 minutes away and tickets ate reasonably priced €1.60 -€2.20 single journey depending on destination.Irini, at the front desk is friendly and helpful. If we go again to Santorini, will stay there
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place to stay, the staff were helpful and pleasant, booking trips for us and providing information about the local area. The hotel was close to the town centre but far enough away to be very peaceful in the evenings. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited this hotel by the end of 2014.I must admit that santorini has many good hotels but this one is one of the top-hotels!After the recent renovation that is still taking place (at some of the hotels' rooms), this hotel has become even better.Everything is extremely clean, breakfast is almost perfect and the staff is willing to help you while always smiling.As for the owners, who I had the chance to meet, I only have one thing to say: Great people!!! Great professionals!!
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a life saver. I wasn't at all fond of Fira (or Oia, for what it's worth) and staying just outside of the main part of the city was wonderful. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Fira Square and is absolutely lovely. The hotel staff are wonderful and really added to the trip. The rooms were very nice, and very clean. Our patio was excellent. The breakfast was very good and the pool is great. The hotel has plenty of areas for lounging around and relaxing. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the beds were a lot more firm than I would have liked them to be. Also, it is not a spa hotel. I booked thinking I might want to get a massage there and they don't offer any kinds of spa services.I would highly recommend Anamnesis and I would probably stay there again if I had any interest in returning to Santorini (which I don't).One tip: Despite being on a busy street, this hotel was difficult to find. No one seemed to know where it is and there are no street signs in Fira so the address wasn't helpful. My suggestion is to look on a map before you go because no one will be able to help you find the place.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: after not having found any accommodation on the spot, tour agency contacted anamnesis who offered a different room for two nights - thanks for that!! it's new (still a few little things missing ;-) ), well decorated with quality furniture and furnishings, nice pool, good breakfast and kind service.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful place to stay. The ambience of this little gem is outstanding. Adding to our pleasure was how friendly and helpful the staff was.The position was great. If you have ever dragged suitcases along cobblestoned streets, you will love a hotel that opens up to a street with cars and busses. Not easy to find in Fira. I'll have that any day over a stunning ocean view.Best choice from airport is a shuttle, which will take you to the door. Local bus is very cheap. Taxi to Ferry was reasonable. Hotel booked it for us.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
