review_body: This cute little hotel couldn't have been more perfect for our trip to Greece! After a month in Rhodes and Athens, my boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in Santorini. We pulled up to Anamnesis and were wow-ed by the clean, beautiful hotel in comparison to others on the island. Our room looked just like the pictures (which can be a risk at other places we have found) and the free breakfast is AWESOME! Cheers for unlimited Greek Yogurt!As a surprise we were told a breakfast we had been upgraded to the jacuzzi suite for free!!! A huge room with a living room, an enormous view, and total privacy awaited us! Instead of going out to dinner we were more than happy staying in with olives, meat, wine and figs from the local mini mart (the shop keeper let us sample EVERYTHING). On top of everything the staff was really lovely. We asked a million questions and got a million answers on how to get to the bus, where to get dinner, where to walk, where to tour, and we're always met with wonderful options, great prices, and enthusiasm.Long story short... If I was staying in Santorini again... I would stay here in 5 seconds flat.
hotelName:
22    Anamnesis City Spa Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this place for our honeymoon.Very nice, new and clean place, very helpful staff. Great service for helping you book rental and/or excursions and trips. Short walk to the cost and beach, We had an amazing time.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for a few nights to totally chill out after uni exams. We had a wonderful stay! All the staff were amazing, especially the chef who catered for my daughters intolerances and came up with some wonderful breakfasts that were served on our terrace at a time that suited us! Nothing seemed too much trouble, we didn't want to leave!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To the Orabel Team,Firstly, thank you so much for the most amazing 10 days at your hotel.From the minute we arrived to the minute we left everything was perfect and nothing was ever too much to ask! We didn’t know what to expect from booking a boutique hotel after only ever staying at big hotels, but now after staying at the Orabel suites we felt like part of the family as they treated us as one of their own.Special mention to Jannis, Spiros, Sofia and Thalia who made our stay extra special by always going that extra mile. The bar tender Spiros always puts a smile on your face and is the best cocktail maker on the island! Jannis and Sofia always there to help with any questions and make your stay the best it can be, by recommending the best restaurants and activities to do in Santorini. Finally, Thalia the chef makes the most incredible hotel breakfast you will ever have, all the ingredients are grown within the hotel garden and taste extremely fresh! Her homemade cheesecake, cakes and pancakes are delicious!Honestly, this hotel is the best hotel we’ve ever stayed in. We will 100% be back in the future otherwise we’d miss the team too much! We can promise that if you book this hotel you won’t regret it! Thank you once again for giving us the most amazing holiday. Love Ellie & Sean x
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just spent 7 nights at Orabel Suites in the South of Santorini staying in the ground floor suite called Nykritori.The hotel is set back from the 6km stretch of black sand beach in Perivolos, around a 3 or 4 minute walk with a mini mart on the way.The hotel has 11 suites in total all of which face out to a spectacular and luxurious pool and bar setting with the first floor rooms having a sea view.Spyros (apologies if misspelt) manages the bar and pool area in the afternoon and evenings and he really made our stay feel special. Everything from cocktail making, advice on the island, to interesting polite conversations at the bar, he really does everything and anything to make your stay here even more enjoyable, a real asset to this hotel.Upon arrival the owner jannis was just as accommotading and gave us lots of friendly advice about where to go during our stay, nothing is too much trouble and the whole team were incredibly friendly and genuine. Our room was very spacious and luxirious with a king sized bed, wardrobe, cupboard, chest of draws, two chairs, a couch, a beautiful shower room, tv, air conditioning, in room fridge, sink and coffee machine with mugs and cups provided.The team provide you with maps and all the information you need to get the most from your stay. Outside there is a generous seating area and extra large stone/ceramic hot tub/jacuzzi.Everything inside and out is made from high quality materials and the whole hotel has a high premium feel to it, fully deserving of 5 star status.On our first day we were met by the Head chef who asked us what we like to eat. Breakfast is then delivered to your room or in the pool area when each morning you call jannis and specify what you'd like to drink with breakfast shortly delivered afterwards. You can call for your breakfast any time i think between 9am and 3pm. Breakfast is 3 courses everyday and includes bread, jams, yoghurt, cereal, orange juice and water. Then you are delivered a hot meal by the head chef which is different everyday and can be tailored to your liking. It's then finished with a cold dessert such as fresh cheese cake. A lot of the food is made with fresh ingredients grown on site. This was so personal and a key selling point for this hotel and is all included.Location wise you have a strip of varying restaurants along the beach, it is close to lots of attractions such as red beach, faros lighthouse, pyros Town and other various spots for sightseeing, food and drink. The capital fira is around 30 minutes drive a way and the popular oiya is around 40 minutes drive away. The hotel is a 20 minute drive from the airport. Perivolos is one of the quieter and perhaps more couple focused locations on the island but everything is a short drive away, renting a car is highly recommended as there is so much to see. Driving from one end of the island to the other only takes around 45 minutes.Weather in early June was very hot from early morning to late afternoon, some days it can be windy but this is welcome in the heat. I'd say during the 7 days it probably averaged around 30 degrees Celsius.Drinks whilst only slightly on the expensive side were always served with nibbles and a smile from Spyros. A bottle of beer is 5 euros and a cocktail is 12 euros. There are more premium options for drinks in the 15 - 20 euros range. We did buy drinks from the supermarket, around 4 euros for 6 cans of beer and the staff did not seem to mind us drinking our own drinks in our room and outside area but perhaps a little rude to sit up at the pool with your own bottle of wine so we avoided doing so and kept our own drinks to our room area.There is no restaurant but you can order snacks such as a burger up to 5pm each day. The burger and all of the food is excellent and not too expensive. I could go on and on about the hotel but would like to end by saying thank you to Jannis and his team you all really do make this beautiful hotel something special and we will be back!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortably the best boutique hotel i have visited. We stayed for 11 nights and left incredibly relaxed due to the phenomenal pool area, rooms with a Jacuzzi, staff and three course breakfast every morning. The professionalism of the staff was exemplary and all done with a genuine desire to ensure you have a great experience. We are very very likely to return in future.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you think of the perfect hotel, this is what comes to mind. The room - perfect (Master Suite). Staff - perfect. Food - perfect. This is probably one the top 5 hotels I’ve stayed at in my life. When I come back to Santorini, and I will, I will stay here.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing journey in this hotel! We felt like part of the family.All the staff was so adorable and welcoming. Special thanks to our host Jannis, Thalia (the wonderfull Chief) and Spyros (thanks for the amazing cocktails!). The room and facilities were perfect (pool, hot tub...) and the breakfast a delight (homemade products).The location in the South of the island is perfect for a quiet stay, just 5’ by walk to go to the great Perissa black sand Beach.Everything was just perfect, do not hesitate to chill out in this lovely place!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights at the Orabel and we had a delight to discover new menu for the breakfast everyday ! The staff prepared with care homemade bread and cake. The hotel is very clean and the pool is nice.Our suite was spacious and we enjoyed sunbathing at our private balcony in the hot hub.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear John,RiaI would like to thank you again for your outstanding hospitality!!My first time at Orabel Suites was 2018.I remember leaving the hotel..making a promise to my self to come back!I did so this year!When i first step into the hotel all those great memories from last year started to come back again one after the other..But immediately you made me feel like there was always space to make new ones!The room this time was the Honeymoon Suite (2nd floor )and i have to admit that was a very pleasant surprise because i had no idea about the variety of design in every single room!!This year my colours have been black and white with touch of elegance of ofcourse..The indoor jacuzzi ready and the new memories started to built into my mind after the first minute i walked into the room!We arrived a little early that day..but Thalia was ready to prepare for us her delicious breakfast !!I was anxious though about the bar..The new coctail list has been literaly great and Spiros has been always ready to make the next coctail according our taste!One of the things i also adore in this hotel is how they pay attention to the detail of cleaning.Is a "must" if you want to make a good name..But above all is a "must" when you believe in that and you make it happen.!!With 100% success!!!Around the hotel and near by the beach(5 minutes walking ) the most of the restaurants and bars have been opened for the season so..whenever we felt to be for a few moments among people ..we went..for a while, cause always returned to our little paradise..Cant wait to go back!!!Dear John ! Dear Ria!THANK YOU!!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for 6 days in April. The hotel was absolutely incredible. Amazing breakfast every day, which you could have at any time during the day. Having our own hot tub was a high for us. All the staff (particularly Iannis, Spirios at the bar & Sofia from reception) were lovely warm people always more than willing to help in any way possible.We visited Oia for a day and Santo Wines (as recommended by Hotel staff) and had a great time at both. The hotel is a 7 minute walk to the beach down 1 road (although there’s no street lighting). At the beach there’s plenty of lovely restaurants. The hotel were always happy to book taxis for us but recommend hiring a car as it’s cheaper overall.We are hoping to return next year.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I LOVED this place so much. Never wanted to leave. Firstly, the rooms were amazing, so clean and beautiful.Secondly, the chef was so accommodating, she met with us and asked us what we liked and didn't like so she could make us a breakfast we liked, and everything she made was great!Thirdly, the staff were FANTASTIC - cannot emphasize this enough. Magda is an absolute legend and made our stay fun and enjoyable. She anticipated our every need and worked tirelessly to ensure our stay was the best it could be. She made us feel like family - we love her!Fourthly - Haris...words cannot describe his ability to make us the perfect drink, for each moment. We never ordered anything specifically, we just asked him for a drink and he whipped us up something great every time. If we could take the staff with us wherever we go in future it would be the best - unfortunately we can't - but we can't wait to come back and stay here
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Orabel Suites at the start of October. Even before we arrived, they got in contact to arrange transportation to their hotel and it all ran so smoothly!On arrival, they kindly upgraded us to the honeymoon suite (which was AMAZING!).They cater to all of your needs and make your stay very comfortable.Pool area: so nicely laid out, great sun beds and the bar service is amazing, bringing drinks over.Room: fantastic, the terrace was amazing and so relaxing to eat breakfast on there. The bed was really comfy and the indoor jacuzzi was perfect!Food: We ate the breakfast on our balcony and the effort that goes into the breakfast is amazing and they change the hot dish daily which keeps the breakfast exciting. We ate at the pool once (Greek salad and club sandwich) both delicious and reasonably priced. I also have a nut allergy, which Janis made a note of at the start of the holiday and they were very careful with all my meals which put me at ease and never felt worried!Local area/excurcions: when we arrived Janis explained where we should go on the map and how to get there, which was really useful and we then felt we knew exactly where we wanted to go! He also organised car hire for us which was so easy as they dropped the car off at the hotel and could even drop the car off at the airport when we left - how convenient!Overall, one of the most amazing hotels I’ve stayed in. I will definitely be visiting again and for longer!! The hotel building is amazing and so beautiful, love the attention to detail. Every single one of the staff that work there are lovely and really made my holiday!Thanks for a great end to my holiday - wonderful hotel.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our honeymoon in October and had the most amazing time. The hotel is very intimate which means the service you receive is fantastic. From breakfast, to the quality of room, to the cocktails in the bar, everything was to the highest standard. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Santorini to stay at Orabel!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent one week here on our honeymoon and we can’t say enough good things about Orabel. Breakfast to your room or poolside every morning and so much food!! Pool is stunning. Everything is spotlessly clean. The staff is so friendly and helpful and make sure that you are having a fantastic time. Magda is so lovely and helped us with booking an ATV one day and exploring a few small towns close by. Bar tender and chef are the kindest people and the food and drinks are delicious! Lots of really great places to eat in a 5-10 min walk to the beach front. We didn’t end up renting a car and we were fine walking to dinner, taking the bus to Oia one day and also ATV one day to Exo Gonia. It is in a quiet area so be ready to relax!! Would highly recommend doing a catamaran cruise one day as well. Thank you so much Orabel for the best honeymoon ever!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a week with my husband and had the most fabulous holiday here. We have stayed in a lot of nice places and hotels and this experience has topped them all! It’s the first time I’ve not wanted to go home! The hotel and suites are beautiful. It is spotlessly clean and immaculate. The suites are a home from home and have everything you need and are extremely comfortable. The people running the hotel are the most friendly, lovely, helpful people you will ever come across. They will go to the ends of the earth to help you and will get you anything you desire. When you want breakfast you call reception and within minutes a tray arrives with an array of drink and food. Shortly after this the chef arrives and brings you a cooked item and a dessert! The food was delicious and we found that it kept us going all day! You could call up for breakfast even late into the afternoon! The hotel is located about 5/10 minutes walk from the beach. There are bars and restaurants all along the beach and the service and food there was also excellent. There is a mini supermarket just a few minutes walk away that has a very good selection of things and not expensive. You have a fridge and kitchen area in your suite to store things you may buy and tea and coffee making facilities. The hotel is situated in a quieter part of Santorini but after having a day out to Thira and Oia we couldn’t wait to get back to this little oasis of calm and tranquility. I recommend this hotel highly and can’t wait to come back here.....
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Orabel suites for a week and it was relaxing from start to finish. The welcome we received when we arrived well after midnight was exceptional, with the host even making us sandwiches. Orabel suites have around 10 suites, all looking out onto the pool and with lovely private verandas with private hot tubs. The atmosphere of the whole place is always really peaceful and serene, and staff were excellent. You can have your breakfast served any time you want, just from calling from your room, and we had ours on our veranda each morning. Everywhere in the hotel is spotlessly clean and you are made to feel as though you can ask for anything you need. The beach is a 5 minute walk, and the hotel reserves you sunbeds in a really nice area on the beach free of charge. A wonderful stay and I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for somewhere relaxing and exclusive.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How can I start this comment... ? THANK YOU for everything, the rooms, the breakfasts, the pool, our private jacuzzi, your smile, your jokes, your cocktails, everything was more than clean and beautiful. We will never forget our amazing time in Santorini !!!!!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Orabel Suites for our anniversary. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with amazing, friendly service by everyone on the staff. Magda stayed late to accommodate our late flight and show us to our room. She even made us a snack when we asked where we could get food nearby at such a late hour! Thalia is Orabel's amazing cook who makes breakfast pretty much all day -- you just call reception when you're ready for it to be served and she or Peter will bring it to you with a smile! Xaris is the pool bartender; he makes great welcome drinks and also gave us some delicious restaurant recommendations. Koula and Nikoletta prepared our room beautifully each day and made sure we were comfortable. Ioannis, the owner, has curated a wonderful staff that is always happy to help and serve you in any way. The hotel itself is so peaceful and quiet. The only sounds we heard were the pool water running and friendly "hellos." Each room has its own outdoor patio space with a personal hot tub, which was a great way to relax at the end of the day. The rooms themselves were squeaky clean and well designed. We had a fabulous time here and hope to be back again!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we first arrived we were greeted by Magda who made us feel right at home. Unlike most hotels where you check-in, stay, then check-out with hardly a word to the staff, here they treat you like an honored guest. Magda gave us a run-down of the island, some great places to eat and where we could rent an ATV. The hotel also has a deal with one of the restaurants on Perivolos beach so guests at Orabel Suites can use their beach equipment free of charge.The breakfast is excellent and they deliver it to your room or by the pool. The drinks are outstanding. The A/C gets nice and cold, the default temperature of the hot tub is just warm enough to feel relaxing without overwhelming you since Santorini does get pretty hot. The hotel is close to the beach and a bit of a walk away from a bus stop, but easy to get there by ATV. There's no other buildings nearby it so you're at your own quiet, relaxing slice of heaven. I could sit all day by the pool drinking there.A bit costly, but for the room you get, and the best hotel service I have ever had, it is well worth it and I intend to come back here in the future.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply superb - outstanding in all aspects - EVERYTHING including staff are wonderful Food delicious and organic. Breakfast is cooked and served on request ( we sleep late and tend to eat after noon) . Nothing is to much trouble for them. The chef genuinely is proud of what she cooks and takes great pride in telling you of what she serves. Everything about Orabel Suites is exceptional with the service prior to the trip also exceeding expectations - with Jannis booking a full Resturant itinerary for my 14 night stay ( some say I’m OCD , I just say I like to be organised). Nevertheless no need to go through it again as their recommendations are fabulous too , whether it be fine dinning or easy food Definitely will only stay with Orabel again when we revisit later in the year
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Santorini has beautiful cities but they can be quite busy during summer months. Orabel is a hidden gem in between al this madness. It offers pure luxury, relaxation, quality and coziness. Just a 5 min walk from the upscale perivolos beach and 15 min by car/scooter if you want to go out in the evening.. but It’s a great place to stay with the an even better staff. Literally nothing is an issue for them and they get things done! Already looking forward to come back!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Master suite with my family. The room was really beautiful and everything was on point! Just like in the pictures. When we first came it was really late(restaurantes closed etc.) , but the receptionist was really kind and she ordered us some food and drinks.Breakfast was really nice, every day something different.Rooms were cleaned every day really well! In one point i tried to find some dust from the room, i didn't find any :D Hotel area was so clean, beautiful, and realxing.. Luxury. Big thanks to our receptionist, because she helped us to find the hiking paths, restaurants and everything on our trip. On my birthday she and the cook even suprised me with a birthday cake:) Big thanks to whole staff! I really had amazing time! If you are looking for easy going, beautiful, luxury hotel near to the beach with great service-this is your place! Worth every penny <3
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! This hotel is beautiful, with amazing hospitality- Yannis and his team can not do enough to help you. It's very personal and make you feel welcome from the second you arrive. The rooms are amazing, clean, spacious and breakfast is made freshly for you and on order when you want it. We enjoyed every single minute. Thank you from Nicola & Gary
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our honeymoon in May and wow, what an incredible hotel. Our room was comfortable and clean, the staff could not have been more helpful and those breakfasts were delicious. Do not let the fact this hotel is not in Oia or Fira put you off, in fact this added to the experience for us. We got to enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of the hotel and simply rented a car to go off an explore. Would highly recommend this hotel, we did not want to leave at the end of our holiday. Thank you to everyone who works here for making our honeymoon so special!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, wow, wow ! The photos with the Tripadvisor reviews speak for themselves. This place is stunning : amazing views of the pool, hills and sea beyond. Rooms are spaciously huge, immaculate and very comfortable. We had a great nights sleep every night during our four nights here as the location is peaceful and quiet. We went for an hour's walk every morning before breakfast as the beach and the little road that runs along side it with restaurants is only a short distance away. Breakfast itself was delicious with something different every day. You can eat it down at the poolside or on your own little balcony and at whatever time you want - even well into the afternoon - how many places offer that level of service !!! Considering the prices that some of the other hotels and accommodation providers on the island charge, this place is such good value and yet nothing and I mean nothing is compromised. Yes, it is not in Oia or Fira where I originally was trying to book but to be totally honest, that was not an issue and for two reasons and this next bit is really important : we hired a car which meant that we could be in Fira in about 20 minutes and Oia about 40 minutes not to mention all the other little hidden gems that we were able to get to. If you are going in the height of the season though then those times may take longer due to the sheer number of tourists on the island and the traffic problems that this entails - I can only imagine that nightmare ! The second reason is the 'goldfish' syndrome. If you book somewhere in Fira or Oia and pay a hefty price for the privilidge, then don't expect total relaxation and privacy as you are stared at and overlooked by the number of people trekking and wandering about. Not only are there the tourists who are staying on the island but imagine 8 cruise boats in with around an average of two thousand people each, constantly wandering up and down past you all the time whilst you try to sunbathe and have some quiet, 'me time'. This won't happen at the Orabel Suites !!! You can have the best of both worlds here - peace, quiet and privacy and still be in midst of it all in less than an hour. This island is beautiful and nothing is too far away so do yourself a favour and book here - you won't regret it - enjoy !
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The suites and surrounding are 5 stars level in a calm and chilly atmosphere. Here every detail matter. Ioannis and his team make the impossible to service you with a natural friendship-class, because they all love human being! You will never forget this incredible hosting experience. Special thanks to Ioannis (managing director) for his friendship, to Thalia (breakfast cooked with love to surprise you every morning with a new attention) , to Haris for his kindness (after few discussions he will understand who you are to customize a cocktail corresponding to your personality !!) If you are looking for making your holidays an unforgettable moment with human touch that's the place to go . We will definitely come back and keep connected ! THANKS you ORABEL TEAM.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wish I could give Orabel more stars! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, really close to the beach and the rooms are newly done with top-end facilities. But the absolute best thing about Orabel is the service from all the staff - they all made sure my family and I had an amazing and unforgettable time. Magda from reception is simply the happiest and kindest host, always looking after us. Thalia, the chef, surprises you with special breakfasts every day and she puts so much love into them! She made a dessert which my mum loved and she then gave her the recepy and translate it in our language for ease and left it in our room - details like this stay with you for ever. And Harry from the bar was amazing too, giving us advice from the island and other places in Greece. I hope I can come back soon!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect if every sense, returned home less than 24hrs ago and already missing the joys of the Orabel suites, the place is superbly clean with no detail overlooked, a massive thank you to each one of the Orabel family for making our 5 nights stay so perfect, from the advice given to the friendly smiles each day you was perfect, I'd certainly recommend this place of tranquillity to anybody wanting to be well looked after whilst unwinding the daily stresses of life, Thank you all so much and hope to return in the future xx
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in April. Just a short distance away from the beach and restaurants. The place is beautiful and peaceful and the staff are attentive to the guests needs. The staff were welcoming and knowledgable giving us all the information we needed about the area on arrival, with complimentary drinks.They gave us information on hiring a car, atv, motorbikes and the bus information. They also informed us were we could get free sun beds by the beach and recommended some places to eat. The room were very spacious and clean with air conditioning and heating great for all weathers. Jacuzzi outside with privacy curtains. Breakfast was good with great healthy options and incredibly filling served on the patio every morning. The pool is great with sun beds all around and a bar. We had an amazing time and would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay in a peaceful paradise.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can only repeat what has been said many times already and I would highly recommend Orabel Suites. We chose Orabel Suites after reading the good reviews and we were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and the entire place is spotlessly clean. We wanted a relaxed break which is what we got here. Breakfast is great and the rooms are spacious, each with their own private terrace with hot tub. We visited 22-29 October, which meant that a lot of the more local restaurants had closed for Winter already. We hired a car for our entire visit which I would recommend if going at this time of year, there are plenty of restaurants open still in Fira and Oia.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm actually unsure where to start.....our room was unbelievable and immaculately clean as was yhe whole hotel. All of the Orabel Team were so friendly and couldn't do enough for us.We went there for a week of chill and rest and that is exactly what we got.Breakfast was a delight every morning, Christina's brownies were amazing!!!We were there from 14th - 21st October and the only slight downside was that the area is already closing for the winter and without a bit of walk, getting a taxi or hiring a car there were only 2 restaurants to eat at nearby.We hired a car a few days into the holiday which was all arranged for us by the team which was great and toured the island, definitely the way to go.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 2 nights in Orabel suites for our first day in Santorini. The place is perfect on almost every aspect. Friendly staff, nice rooms and jacuzzis, good beds, good breakfast and cheap for Santorini and the quality you will get. I will just recommend the place to people who are renting a car, because it is a bit far from the main point of interest of Santorini (Oia & Fira).
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Orabel Suites - where do I start! If you want luxurious, peaceful, tranquil surroundings, this is the place to come! I knew it would be amazing based on the fantastic reviews but to experience this amazing place for yourself is unreal. We had 6 fantastic nights here with a delicious, massive breakfast each morning. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble to make your stay amazing. It has a luxury, exclusive, premium feel to it and part of why we enjoyed our trip to beautiful Santorini so much was because of Orabel. The shower is fantastic and we had a hot tub in our room! Don't consider staying anywhere other than Orabel if you want a fantastic holiday!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To describe Orabel as a B&B would be a travesty. You are part of a family where nothing is too much trouble. Themis's welcome and subsequent service, Ella's constant smile and giggle and Christine's breakfasts and chat around the bar. I do not wish to omit Stella and her team who are so friendly, efficient and charming. All in all it's a wonderful place to stay (and get a brownie take-away), that made us feel so at home and special. Jannis is credited far too much in other reviews, it is not only him, he has a fantastic philosophy and built a team to deliver it. A great stay, wish it had been longer. Thank You Team Orabel
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When u first walk in u can realise that this place is magic and u won't regret ur booking... A place with amazing modern design but with total respect to the traditional design rules of the island... The facilities and how the stuff treat u are adjusted to the Greek hospitality.... Many congratulations to the stuff to the owners to everybody who contributed on this so we can enjoy a relaxing and at the same time really advanced facilities for our holidays... hope see u again in the near future. Much appreciation.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The fact that we are here yet again should tell everyone everything they need to know.We absolutely adore this place, but, more importantly, the people.Jannis, Christina, Ela, Themis, Ria, Vassos and Nikos, they could not be more welcoming.It is people that make a place, not the other way around. You could have the greatest place in the world but run by uncaring people and it would merit 3 stars or less. The Orabel Suites is a beautiful oasis run by beautiful people.We will keep coming here and writing reviews as long as is humanly possible to do so.We are the first couple to stay here three times and, no doubt, we will be the first to stay here four times!I cannot fault it in any way...why would I want to?I have seen a couple 4* reviews and when you read them you really have to wonder why they gave less than 5*. I find that to be really annoying! :-)
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here has compelled me to write my first ever hotel trip review! I am fortunate enough to travel frequently and this hotel is as close to perfection as I have experienced. They have just got it so right! We stayed at two other top quality hotels on this Greece holiday but Orabel Suites won hands down. It's hard to put your finger on what stands this above the rest - but I'll try! It is just simply in a different league of experience: exceptionally personal, respectful, helpful and attentive service from Yannis and his small devoted team - compared to other hotels, this factor alone was tangible and made such a difference; incredible architecture, interior/exterior design and romantic lighting; the personal breakfast deliveries to your room/balcony, not to mention the top quality breakfast itself; the beautiful room with mezzanine sleeping area and private hot tub on the balcony complete with privacy curtains; the relaxing pool and bar area; or the general peace and tranquility of the hotel. Thanks for a wonderful stay!Gareth and Rhiannon
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stumbled upon Orabel Suites whilst looking through Trip Advisor last year. At that time there were approximately 70 reviews, all of which were outstanding. Could it really be that good ? "Yes it could and more". Together with my wife and two daughters we decided to book the Master Suite for 14 days, and we are so happy that we did. Orabel Suites is absolutely beautiful. It is so peaceful and relaxing. From the moment you arrive to the sad time you have to leave, nothing is to much trouble for the very attentive staff. Jannis, the Manager, provides a first class service and goes out of his way to ensure you having an enjoyable relaxing holiday. Any information that you require concerning places to visit, restaurants to eat at, car hire, boat trips, sun beds at the nearby beach etc he will arrange for you. Jannis is a plastic surgeon by profession. One day my daughter developed an ear infection. Straight away Jannis was off to the local pharmacy and purchased ear drops. He refused to accept any payment for the medication. The infection soon cleared up. Now that is providing a first class customer service !! So much has been written about the breakfast Christina serves, it has to be seen to be believed. If there is something you particularly require for breakfast, Christina will do her best to ensure you receive this. The Master Suite is beautiful, with two double bedrooms, one of which is en-suite, and an indoor jacuzzi. The domestic staff, who are so friendly, ensure your room remains spotlessly clean throughout your stay. The pool area is very quiet as most people are either off to the beach or touring the island.The beach and restaurants are a 5 minute walk away. I would recommend you take a small hand torch when walking to the restaurants at night as there are no street lights or pavements. The walk is perfectly safe, but a torch would help. There are lots of restaurants to visit. We liked, The Seaside (which is one of the more expensive ones but very good), Popeye and 41, but there are so many to try. In Fira there is a restaurant called Argo which is very good. It does get busy, so I recommend you ask Jannis to make you a reservation. We did visit a restaurant called Rosemary in Prygos. We took a taxi to Prygos (20 euro each way) and walked the steps to the top to the restaurant to see the beautiful sunset. The view is fantastic, however the food was disappointing as it was all cold. We hired a car for two days and toured the whole island. It is very easy to find your way around from the map. There are a lot of quad bikes on the road. We had a very relaxing and enjoyable time at Orabel Suites which is a beautiful boutique development. Would we go back YES !!. Would we recommend it - YES, WITHOUT DOUBT !!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I haven't been on holiday for 8 years and have always wanted to go to Santorini...so I did lots of research and booked this place purely on the amazing reviews. The welcome by the lovely Yannis was wonderful he made you feel so welcome. The gorgeous breakfast ever morning was bought up to our terrace and was delicious. Just a short walk away was the beach and many tavernas and we ate out every night. It was so lovely and quiet here we came back quite early each night and drank wine on the terrace and was so peaceful. The staff are amazing and the pillows were the best I've ever laid on! The shower was so powerful it was amazing. All the staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough for you. We recommend going to the local Boutari vineyard where they sell one of the best rose I have ever tasted for only 7 euros! Also you must visit a lovely restaurant called Rosemary in Pyrgos for lovely food on their terrace it is 86 steps upwards but so worth it as saw the most beautiful sunset ever there.We enjoyed staying here so much we will definitely be back again. The only thing I would improve is the temperature of the pool as was quite cold but bearable. Efharisto Yannis you have a wonderful magical place we loved staying with you and see you again.Nick and Tasha
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay. A great little boutique hotel with a very friendly host and great staff. The rooms are spacious and provide everything you need to relax and recharge. Everything is very clean and well maintained making you feel like at home. Looks like each room comes with hot tub/jacuzzi which is perfect to enjoy a bottle of wine in the evening. They offer home made breakfast (so delicious) either delivered to your terrace/balcony or can set it up next to the pool. The little oasis is slightly set back from the beach in the country side but yet well connected to reach the beach (Perivolos beach) in just 5-10min walking distance or other beautiful place like the Red Beach or Pyrgos in 15min by scooter. Besides all the popular place (Fira, Oia etc) I can highly recommend to plan a visit for a nice and dinner to Pyrgos. We actually arrived there a bit late and it was already dark but still had a nice walk through the village before having a wonderful dinner on beautiful little roof terrace overlooking the southern part of Santorini. Its a beautiful property, with a create atmosphere runned by lovely people. Can highly recommend to stay at Orabel Suites
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Giannis has created a quaint yet polished little paradise, 5 minutes walk away from the nicest beach on the island. His personal service before you arrive is excellent, sorting anything you require such as transfers etc.His secret weapons are Thamis and Xristina! Thamis is more concierge than receptionist offers excellent advice on the island, books anything you need from transport to reservations and fixing any problems with your room. Xristina is you head chef every morning with her delicious bespoke breakfast, your cocktail / drinks maker in the afternoon evening whilst keeping the area picturesque. She also sorts any food and drink requirements outside kitchen and bar hours.My only complaint being the pool shutting early to maintain the calm quiet that makes this place so special, which is fixed by the personal hottub our room had!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have pulled out all of the most beautiful poetic versus to try and some up this piece of paradise on earth but find myself still unable to find anything that can do this amazing place justice, so i will just tell you of my time here. To begin, my wife and i arrived at around 8am(transfers just worked out that way) we knew our room was not due to be ready until around 12:00pm. Was that a problem? absolutely not! We were given the warmest welcome by Ioannis the managing Director who by definition is a true gentleman and scholar ( you WILL say the same thing after just 2 minutes of speaking with him) this amazing man started off by introducing the suites and there amazing services, followed by asking my wife and i about ourselves....what we liked to ea,t where we might like to go and see, dietary requirements and so on so forth, now this is the MD of he place, i knew right from there this was going to be a very special place ( my wife and i are restauranteurs so by definition highly critical and observant) He then explained that the room would be ready shortly but while we waited were more than welcome to use the facilities whilst a very special breakfast was being catered just for us(the wife and i decided to lounge on the super queen size pool bed which is heaven by the way... then came the most amazing breakfast i have ever had cooked by Christina the most amazing woman also. Now to our suite, what can i say, Luxury, boutique are just 2, our private hot tub blew my mind... My time at the Orabel Suites was something i will never forget, from start to finish my wife and i were made to feel like we had honestly died and gone to heaven. I thank you Ioannis you have done n amazing job and i honestly feel that i stayed with family in the most amazing location and accommodation...not just any family...the perfect one....I tip my hat to you sir...and i will be back every year hopefully more than once. WELL DONE the balance you have is humbling and a pleasure to have had the honour to experience. to rate you guys in stars means i would have to collect every one of them in this solar system.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great boutique property.Only 11 rooms so you get a very personal welcome and treatment and also as a result the pool area is never busy.Far enough away from the busier parts to be incredibly peaceful, but only 5 minutes walk. Plus the very very good 41 restaurant is only 5 minutes sayIf we are fortunate enough to return to Santorini then would definitely return.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Orabel Suites were absolute heaven. This was our first time in Santorini and we were so glad we chose to stay here. The suites are designed beautifully, are modern and very tidy. We stayed in a two bedroom suite which included a private spa inside. The pool area is fantastic and very relaxing. The service from Yannis and Christina was 10/10 the entire time we stayed, with lots of recommendations of activities to do and Christina cooked us a delicious, fresh, healthy breakfast every morning. It is a quick walk down to Perivolos beach with restaurants and it is easy enough to get a taxi into more touristy areas such as Oia. At Orabel, you definitely feel as though you are in your own little paradise. I would definitely come back here and cannot recommend this place enough!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a find. This place was beautiful. Clean, tidy and run by very friendly people that went out of our way to see that we had a good relaxing stay.Only a 20 min drive from the airport and with a short walk to the beach where there were lots of places to eat and drink, it was also perfectly placed.Would recommend hiring a car to see the rest of the island. Taxis are expensive.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a beautiful place to spend a weeks holiday.There is something quite magical about Orabel Suites, from the tranquil setting to the wonderful staff, who cannot do enough to make your stay special. The accommodation (we stayed in the Master Suite as we were 2 couples) is stunning and everything is spotless, as is the pool, seating area and gardens. Christina cooks breakfast as and when you want it and lays it out either in your room, on the terrace or by the pool. I wouldnt hesitate to recommend Orabel Suites for a relaxing break. There are plenty of restaurants and bars a short walk away, and Perivolos is much quieter than its neighbour, Perissa.A huge thank you to Yannis and all the staff for all they do to ensure their guests have the best holiday possible.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I could live at the Orabel Suites for the rest of my life, I'd die a happy man! My wife and I went to Santorini (I've left a full review of Santorini on Expedia) and stayed at Orabel. First and foremost it's beauty is striking. The grounds are stunning and the pool area is just magnificent. We stayed in the Honeymoon Suite with the indoor Jacuzzi, a really good idea if you're quite private as we are. The room was beautifully modern, with all bits and bobs that you need. The jacuzzi was amazing, although make sure you tell reception to turn up the temperature if its a little too cool for you as it was for us. The staff are just the best! Yannis the owner is a top bloke, he'll go out of his way to assist you in any way that he can. Themis at reception in the evenings was just as lovely as Yannis and would also do what she could to help. To prove what I mean, Yannis brought us a bag from home so we could take it out with us one day, and Themis leant us her 2 pin USB plug. Now what hotel staff do that for you? The all inclusive breakfast's were just the best! Christine the chef made us something different everyday and she took into account that we were Muslim and our other dietary restrictions. Just trust me, those breakfasts will live with you forever. Insofar as location is concerned, Orabel is a 5 minute walk from Perivolos beach (literally 5 minutes down an almost straight road), but yet is far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be a private sanctuary. As Santorini Island is about 15-20 miles long, we got a car for a few days and a quad bike for a few days (only get a quad bike if you can handle a cold breeze whilst you're on it!) and we toured the whole island. Please do not think that Orabel isn't for you because its at Perivolos, which is the opposite side of the island from the beautiful Oia. Santorini is so small that you can get from one side of it to the other in an hour or two. I cannot recommend Orabel highly enough - we stayed there for 10 nights and its an experience I will never forget. Go and stay there - you won't regret it - and you'll thank me for this review when you get back!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You wouldn't think it possible, but we were absolutely blown away when we were here in September last year and although we thought the gardens and planting needed time to develop, we didn't think that there was much that could be improved.We were wrong.We said when we left here we would return... I've said that before and haven't followed through. This time was very different.We kept in touch with Jannis by email all through the winter, booked for May and again for this coming September. We also wanted to be sure that Christina would still be here... when we arrived it was truly a joyous moment with huge hugs all round. It was like coming back to special family! It's hard to put a finger on it, but I haven't stopped smiling since I got off the plane.We will return here again and again... that's a promise that you can take to the bank.Small things have been improved, but it wouldn't be possible to make big improvements because it would have had to have been a long way from perfect last year. It wasn't.This time we have friends who have joined us, we have more friends coming here in June and nobody will be disappointed, in spite of the tremendous praise we've already heaped upon Jannis and Christina.Add to the mix, Ria, Themis and Ela and you have something very special indeed.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having recently stayed at The Orabel Suites for our ten night holiday in Santorini ,We can only agree with the excellent previous reviews.The apartment was first class as was the amazing breakfasts ,being slightly different each day.The excellent staff were tentative, extremely helpful and friendly.Many thanks to Jannis and his fantastic team, who made our holiday so special.Jon and Mich R
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Orabel suites. The setting is amazing, you have a jacuzzi on your front porch with a view to both the pool and the sea (if you stay in the top rooms), it's always clean and the staff are the nicest people you'll ever meet, especially Cristina who cooks a glourious breakfast and delicious pies (gotta have a taste of her apple pie!!!) They are always available to answer for any question and give you all the information you need to have a good time in Santorini! The hotel is located in a quiet area and close to Perivolos beach (best beach in Santorini) and if you want to go further, Iannis can arrange either taxi or car/scooter/quad renting that will come directly to the hotel. This for us was very helpful because we got to see every bit of the island on a quad! They can even arrange transfer from the airport/port if you are interested. We had a really good time and will most likely come back with friends!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: +The rooms are of a traditional style but with modern decor. +The rooms are beautiful and elegant, +Each room has its own private jakuzzi sit in at any time.+Breakfast is delicius , varied each day.+The pool and bar area are wonderfully and perfect area to sit and relax.+The location is great as its set back a little from the beach of Perivolos so its very quite and private.+Staff. Every single member of staff has been fantastic throughout our whole stay.+No kids allowed+++++RECOMMENDED
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This August I chose Orabel Suites for my holidays.i found it on the Internet and I when I got there,I couldn't believe it's beauty. It's the perfect getaway to relax and enjoy.the stuff was very polite and kind,always smiling and the service excellent! Each room is different and really can't say which one is more beautiful.its a small paradise,just a walk from the beach but isolated from all the noise.i highly recommend it to all the couples out there! I know I will visit it again for sure!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Orabel Suites was the best Holiday experience I have ever had in my life!Starting from the room itself, the suite we had paid was the master suite, with 2 separate bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, jacuzzi, living area and a great patio looking at the pool side.The cleanliness was excellent. The furniture and the general ambience reveals that the people who own the place, want to offer their guests, the best experience.The gardens, the pool and all surroundings make you feel like you are in paradise.Breakfast is served either in you room, at the balcony or by the pool and except of being rich and tasty, it was different every day. Products from their garden, fresh juice , pastrys, honey, yogurt and little surprises!!!Staff was great and made you feel like home and of course welcome.Owners , Yiannis and Ria and the kindest people on the island.The pool bar was open until 23:00 and Yiannis' cocktails were the best choice.Although there is no restaurant in house, a huge variety of restaurants and beach bars are around the corner and on top of that, you can make your order to the reception and everything will be brought to you in your suite. In 800m you find yourself next to Perivolos beach (black beach) were there is nothing you look for and you cannot find it.Owners have also arranged free use of the sun beds and umbrellas by the best beach bar of the island. Only thing you have to do is to inform the hotel and they arrange it for you. Worth mentioning that other visitors have to pay minimum € 20 to use them.The best choice for those who seek for luxury, relaxation, quiet and value for money!We will be back for sure and not just once !Thank you guys!!!
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I booked Orabel Suites for a week in October 2016. We stumbled across the hotel by chance as a cheap deal appeared for flights + accommodation and after a quick google of the hotel decided it was worth the risk (since these cheap deals aren't always as luxurious as they sound) - my word are we glad we did!Our flights to Santorini were overnight and so we arrived at Orabel Suites shortly after 6am. We were worried that, given check-in wasn't until 2pm, we would be left waiting sleepily by the pool or wandering the streets until we would be able to check into our room in the afternoon. To our surprise, having booked a transfer from the airport in advance (the hotel provides this service for €45 each way) the taxi driver, a friend of the hotel owner, showed us to our room (carrying our luggage) and assured us we would not be disturbed until we were ready to go and check in, allowing us to catch up on some much needed sleep.This theme of friendly, accommodating service continued throughout the week. Chris (the hotel manager), Christina (the chef) and Eddie (the barman) were all amongst the most courteous and helpful staff I have ever come across in my travels. Every effort was made to make our stay enjoyable at every turn, from giving us a lighter with 'santorini' on as a gift on our first day (Christina said she had two so wanted us to have one), to making us sandwiches for our flight home (since they didn't want us to miss breakfast) our holiday was made all the more relaxing and enjoyable by such a warm and friendly home for the week.The room itself was spacious, clean and well equipped. Soap, shampoo, shower gel etc are all complimentary and the layout makes the room feel like your own flat for the week, with the bedroom on an elevated level. Add to this the hot tub and sofa on the balcony from which you can lie and watch the sun set over the mountain and the value for money becomes outstanding. Only a short walk away (5 mins) in the beach where there are plenty of options for cafes, bars and restaurants all the way along to Parissa. If you would like to venture further afield and explore the island cars can be rented from reception. We hired a Fiat 500 convertible for a day which cost €55 (from 10am one morning to 10am the following day) but cheaper options are available. The car is simply dropped off at the hotel for you at your requested time and picked up again when you are finished - very convenient. Our stay included free breakfast each morning which, from past experience, we expected to be a buffet. How wrong we were. The Orabel Suites breakfast is something that must be seen to be believed (see attached pictures). A quick phone call down to Chris at reception and breakfast is brought up to you on your balcony within 10 minutes for you to enjoy in the sunshine. Laid out on the table for you, the breakfast is vast. Yoghurt with honey and granola, breads with jam and honey, cereal, orange juice and your choice of tea or coffee. On top of this, each day there is a different 'main', usually either a hollowed out bread loaf with shakshuka-style fried egg, peppers and feta cheese inside, or an omelette. On top of all of that some days also included Christina's homemade cake (we had her strawberry cake which was fantastic). Needless to say, lunch was not always necessary, especially if we had a late breakfast. Other enjoyable points to note are the soft, un-intrusive music softly playing by the pool, the waterfall into the pool that lights up beautifully after dark and the bar from which the owner Yanis made us some stunning cocktails (as gin fans the Hendricks Crush was delicious).All in all Orabel Suites could not come more highly recommended from a young couple who enjoyed a fantastic romantic break away in Santorini.
hotelName:
23    Orabel Suites Santorini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location about 15 minute walk from the main city center. Pro: Room was cleaned and towels replenished daily. Good breakfast in a restaurant nearby. Irini was very helpful and available via whatsapp to provide recommendations. Con: cost for transfer to and from ports/airport. TV has maybe 5 channels that work, most of which is not in English. Noticed lots of bugs in the room. No hotel pool.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed here for 6 nights at the beginning of June on our honeymoon and we can’t recommend the Thirea Suites highly enough. Staff were lovely and very helpful when my wife’s suitcase was delayed. The real highlight is the breakfast on the balcony every morning. Views are spectacular and the breakfast was great.The cave room and balcony area were very private which can be hard to find in Oia. Great location, would recommend Passagio closeby for a good aperol spritz after the climb of the steps!!Overall the whole place was so peaceful and serene. Perfect place for relaxing and admiring the caldera. 10/10.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location wise is excellent, near to shops and restaurants. Room is big and overlooking the sea. Staffs are very helpful and proactive, especially on food recommendation. Wouldn’t want to be elsewhere when in Santorini.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rest of the reviews have said it all, but even then our experience at Thirea Suites had exceeded all expectations - highly recommend their in-room breakfast (sitting on our terrace every morning with a delicious spread and sweeping caldera views was a definite highlight- we stayed 6 nights and every breakfast had some variation!); heated tubs were amazing especially as it can be chilly with strong winds April time; the staff of course, every one of them were so welcoming and went above and beyond; the cave room itself was so comfy and tastefully decorated; location was perfect- private yet convenient (at least 2 minimarts in close proximity). Can't wait to come back already!!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the most amazing views at this hotel. The proprietress upgraded us without telling us and we had a superb time here. The breakfast near our spa with the views all around was exquisite. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. nearly everyone comes here for the sunset and there are many honeymooners who came over for their photo shoots.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just came back from spending a week here in September. Amazing views overlooking the Caldara. Walk to restaurants and shops. Walking distance to two different grocery stores. Walk to bus stop at the bottom of hill. Eleftheria was very helpful getting taxis and recommending things to do and see. She was very prompt at solving small issues that came up during the week. We stayed in the studios which are quiet and just far enough away from the crowds of day trippers from the cruise ships. If choosing a studio get the one that has the private balcony the others are a shared balcony. The sunsets are amazing! Would definitely stay here again. Also, take comfortable shoes there are a lot of steps.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Thirea for our honeymoon. It was so breathtaking we didn’t want to leave. The views from the room is unbelievable and we spent most of our time on the terrace soaking up the sun or chilling in the jacuzzi. Very friendly service and the breakfast each morning was delicious. The location is also excellent for walking around Oia and very close to the hiking trail to Fira. We loved this place and can’t wait to return!!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My favourite bit of our honeymoon. We arrived late at night due to late arrival of our ferry - our transfer was there waiting for us and he was so friendly!When we got to the hotel Eleftheria was also there to greet us and our bags were swiftly taken down the many steps to our gorgeous room!I can’t fault anything, the room was huge and stunning with the worlds best view over the caldera. We spent so much of our time in Santorini enjoying a drink and the view from the jet tub. Best thing ever!Breakfast was also fabulous, served right on your balcony by the most beautiful and friendly lady. I loved her! I loved the hotel and I can’t wait to get back here! I highly recommend!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You know when you’re dreaming a special place where to find yourself and live moments you’ll never forget...that’s the place. Be aware that will give you addiction to the silence , the caldera view ( expecially during night when all is spleeping and you are facing that majesty ) . Rooms are awesome and give you the confidence to be at your own home. Room service is perfect as the breakfast in-room serviced.Best place ever in Oia so far.Hope to be once more.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LocationThirea suites is located at the start of the Main Street and just by the town square. It’s a few minutes from a bus stop (and about 10 minutes walk to the main bus terminal and taxi rank). Probably 15-20 minutes to main spot for Oia sunset. It’s down a fairly long path made of some trickier and steep steps but the views are well worth itThere are 2 local supermarkets to get your essentials and an abundance of cafes restaurants and shops The main road is well paved but can get busy in evenings with everyone vying to see the infamous sunset and whilst I have seen people in flip flops I’m glad I had more sensible sandals The room We stayed in suite 6. The views were phenomenal. We had a jet tub outside on our terrace.Room was enormous with kitchen, lounge area, king sized bed and a massive bathroom. Air con is standard.We loved staying in a cave. It was so tranquil but the service was impeccable. Daily room service as you would find in a hotel but without the intrusion of other guests. We hardly even heard our neighbours. You need to switch hot water on about 30 minutes beforehand. Also remember like all places in Greece you cannot dispose of tissue in the toilets but must do so in bins provided Plenty of towels, bath robe, toiletries were provided and changed daily. Iron, hair dryer, safe, fridge and even a bottle of water to get you started were also found in the room. Tea making facilities with basic kitchen utensils are provided too.BreakfastServed between 8 and 10 each morning. You need to call reception about 15-30 minutes beforehand and they will bring this to your terrace There were slight variations each day but consisted mainly of freshly squeezed orange juice, breads, yoghurt, fruits and cooked egg. Amenities They arranged hotel transfer (non private) for €30 for 2 of us each wayCheck in is after 2pm and check out after 12pm but they can store your luggage if you have a later flight (which we did)They will help you carry your luggage up and down the path which was a god send because sometimes it was hard enough getting our selves up those steps. You can order in food and also arrange for on site massages and beauty treatments.The pool is not heated but you don’t really need it in the heat. It’s has jets which need to be turned on at regular intervals. Was amazing sipping a glass of wine and admiring the views from tub. Adequate shade and sun in terrace for those who want to top up their ran and those who want to escape the sweltering heat Handy extendable dying rack for your we clothes on terrace tool as well as deck checks and seating/table
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved our stay here. Waking up and looking out to open seas made our trip to Santorini all the better. The staff was more than helpful and friendly. They even made reservations for us at restaurants and for a sunset cruise, we didn’t even have to ask. It was quiet, romantic and truly picturesque. This hotel exceeded every expectation I had. If I ever make it back to Santorini, I wouldn’t stay anywhere else!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our honeymoon at the end of July, beginning of August. We couldn't have wished for a better place to stay. The rooms, views and staff are fantastic. The hotel sort you out a transfer from the airport which saves so much hassle. From the moment we met the transfer man we didn't touch our case again until we were back at the airport going home! The man at the hotel impressively carries both heavy suitcases down steps and back up on your return. Our flight was delayed but this wasn't a problem for the hotel we still got a warm welcome and the next day the lady from reception went out of her way to say hello and welcome us to the hotel. All the staff are amazingly kind and respectful. I miss our delicious breakfasts on the terrace everyday! The views are incredible, like no other. The rooms are luxurious and private. Having your own private hot tub over looking the ocean is a perfect way to while away the evenings with a glass or two. We booked a sailing trip and wine tour through the reception and both were fantastic when one tour was booked up she rang a different contact to ensure we could do the trip we wanted. On the day we were celebrating it being exactly a week married the hotel brought us cheese, olives and wine which was a lovely thoughtful gesture. The hotel is perfectly located in Oia. You just walk up the steps and you are in town with high end shops, restaurants etc. The local bus is right outside too making it easy to visit other towns.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay in Thiera Suites ! We came to celebrate our anniversary and it completely exceeded all our expectations . Firstly , they are located at the entrance of magical town of Oia , where you are met by the lovely lady who manages the place and a porter to take your suitcases down . There are steps , quite a few of them but it all adds to the charm of the place . We were lucky to be given suite 4 , which was the most private of them all with its own entrance and a massive terrace with hot tub overlooking the sea below . Words can’t describe how beautiful it is !!! And then the room itself , so elegant and spacious , with everything you might need ( fridge , coffee machine , kettle , cutlery allprovided ) during your stay . We were also given a small bottle of prosseco on arrival , which was lovely ! The bathroom was amazing ! It is huge , with great shower / jacuzzi bath combo . This was , in our opinion, without the doubt the best place to stay in Oia because of its private location . There is a very expensive hotel in town called ‘ Secret Santorini’ which is located on the main thoroughfare in Oia , but for us this was the only place that can call itself ‘secret Santorini ‘ because you are blessed to have your own oasis just outside of all the hustle and bustle in Oia town . We can’t recommend this place highly enough , if we come back to Santorini this would be the only place we would ever consider staying in ! Thank you Thiera Suites for making our anniversary even more special !
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After rushing around Europe for a couple of weeks, we settled into our cave home at Thirea Suites for 12 days. The expansive terrace complete with an incredible view and hot tub/plunge pool, the spacious bed,sitting and bathroom all so pretty and convenient and the wonderful staff (Pothiti serving lovely breakfasts daily, the sweet and accommodating Zoe, Lenny who can easily carry so many suitcases at once down and up all those stairs and Elifthera who runs the place and is extremely helpful any way she can)....all of this made for an incredible stay in Oia. We just loved our return to Santorini after 8 years with the intent to just ‘live’ there. And we did and highly recommend Thirea Suites.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Do not know how I will start this review as the whole package gets a big 10 for us in all respectsA great place in one of the most beautiful places in Oia. A very warm reception by Eleftheria the owner. We arrived very early in the morning and were immediately assigned a room and were able to choose. The rooms are tastefully furnished and equipped with all amenities. Clean towels twice a day all existing care products. Delicious bottle of wine. Chapeau. This lady knows how it belongs. In the morning a delicious, very extensive breakfast served on your terrace what does a person want more. The staff is very competent and very sweet. This place is heaven on earth. Thank you so much that we were allowed to stay at this place.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, everything was just amazing.We stayed in the suites and we have our own Jacuzzi. Breakfast was served in our private area just beside the pool. Room and bathroom huge, with an another Jacuzzi plus shower. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Thirea Suites & Studios‬ in our honeymoon, we had a great time, lovely view, great breakfast, Although the weather was a little bit cold but Jacuzzi water was warm.. very specious suit, they helped us with our language
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights and just thought it was amazing. Staff are so attentive and cater to your every need. Private jacuzzi on the terrace where breakfast is served to you every day when you request it. Waking up to the most spectacular views of the Caldera is really a sight to behold!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was an awesome room in Oia, a little away from town so we enjoyed quiet night, just 5 minutes of walking from main town, our room has jacuzzi that tops our experience in Oia. Best room we had in Santorini!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The suites are built right on the cliff side and have amazing views. They feel very private and make you feel like you are the only one there! They give you everything you need to prepare a great breakfast. The distance to shops and restaurants was great! You could walk to everything. My husband and I stayed here during our 4th anniversary and couldn't of had a better time. I would love to go back! It was blissful. There are lots of steps to get to and from your room so if you are traveling with someone elderly this may be a problem but is to be expected with a cliff side room.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels i've ever stayed. Very nice and clean and most of their rooms comes with breathtaking views of the Bay.. Does not have swimming pool though but you will get the cave like room feel and it is about 7-10mins walk to the main attractions in Oia. They have a few types of room and some comes with a hot tub/jacuzzi in the room. a bit on the pricey side though. Rooms comes with self service breakfast (food are supplied in your fridge.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We utilized TripAdvisor support to choose our lodging in Oia and we were not disappointed. The manager, Eleftheria, is a dream and could not have been more helpful; prior to arrival, at arrival, during our stay and as we departed. The location is perfect, close to the center of activity, but far enough for quiet. The studio room we reserved was wonderful with an amazing view of the sea and volcano also of course the sunrise and sunset. I can still feel the sun and warm breezes. The little patio on the top of the steps is also a lovely very place to 'chill'.The steps are are part of the charm and 'challenge'.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: BUYER BEWARE: this place is actually two separate locations. One is "Thirea Suites" and the other is "Thirea Studios". Each location is much different than the other - as shown on the website. This review is for "Thirea Studios". I unknowingly booked this studio via Expedia, expecting a suite... because on Expedia it was represented as a "Traditional Apartment". As you can imagine, I was disappointed that my studio was not as elaborate as the pictures on the website. Very average B&B with basic services and housekeeping. If you want a luxurious place to stay with very good service, this is not the place. Not all studios within Thirea Studios are equal, some are much smaller than others. Mine did not have a jacuzzi and I suspect that there are more than one that do not have a jacuzzi. The location is great, it is in the cliffside amongst all the other cave houses/cave hotels. The view is amazing. It is close to a market and a few restaurants. The host is good, but not great. There was a miscommunication during my departure and I had no help carrying several heavy suitcases up all the stairs. This was extremely tiring and unpleasant.. I was soaked in sweat because of this.... and had to bear with my sweat drenched clothes for my flight home to the USA. You have to flip a switch in the circuit breaker to heat up the water for 20 mins before showering. Hot water only lasted for 45 seconds before the rest of the shower was lukewarm or slightly cold for the remainder of the shower. Breakfast ingredients are provided (yogurt, fresh fruit on some days, cold cuts/luncheon meat, bread, water). Housekeeping standards were very sproad'ic. Some days housekeeping would forget certain types of towels, napkins, an extra roll of toilet paper, breakfast ingredients, etc. If all you are concerned with is the location with respects to Oia (10-15 minute walk), it is a great location in the cliff side, the cave house feel is very authentic, and a great view of the caldera - this is a very affordable option. For everything else, expect the average as this is definitely nothing more than a B&B.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything we are looking for and more, from arranging transfer from Port to hotel, waiting for us to walk us to our Cave room, we just felt so welcome. The room is wonderful, comfortable and nearly 360 degree great view. Sitting on our balcony in the morning and evening is memorable!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived until we left we were totally in love with this place.The rooms are generous and well designed and the owner here simply cannot do enough for you to make your stay memorable.Our room was well equipped and had a fantastic patio area that caught the sun all day long. The bathroom was beautiful and the indoor hot tub was beautifully warmed and had amazing windows that opened and overlooked the bay below. We stayed in the tub for well over an hour enjoying a glass of prosecco enjoying the view. The property is ideally located, you can be in Oia in a few minutes and there's a local shop and bus stop within a minutes walk. If you're going to OIA you must stay here!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
