Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'll caveat this review with our stay falling on the tail end of a 28 night European trip that was non stop everyday for over three weeks with my mum. Travelled out. Tired. Patience tested and ready for the trip to be over. We arrived and were welcomed by the most stunning view of the Caldera, clean (huge!) suite room, the loveliest and obliging host, Eleftheria, and our muscle man porter (. The location could not be better. The service could not be better. The ambience could not be better. I am definitely returning to this accommodation. I love the self sufficiency offered by the apartment. Fridge stocked daily with breakfast foods and water - all inclusive. Eleftheria also gifted us a local wine half way through our stay. We love all this place has to offer. It has been a delight. Coming to Oia? Thirea Suites and Studios. Stay nowhere else.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just left Thirea Suites in Santorini and we are very sad to go. We stayed here on our honeymoon and our suite was just perfect. Clean, new and modern while very charming it "feels" very Santorini. We had a stunning view of the Caldera and a tub on our balcony which we really enjoyed. Breakfast was served there each morning and it was delicious. Eleftheria is the best. She attended to every detail and took care of us beyond our expectations. Even ensuring we had a private transfer by Mercedes after we enjoyed the sunset sailing tour (which I highly recommend). Situated right next door to the much more expensive Canaves Oia (I looked into it and wanted to stay there originally but not for 3x the price), this little gem is a treasure and we are so glad we stayed here while in Santorini. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have seen quite a few rooms and booked elsewhere which was a little crowded so booked a room for us here View is amazing clean big room spa on balcony amazingI will be back Can't fault this place staff super friendly and very private
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breathtaking view, beautifully comfortable and quiet room; and friendly, incredibly helpful staff. Eleftheria was especially wonderful and accommodating, with plenty of good suggestions. Our stay in Oía was absolutely perfect and I wouldn't have changed a thing!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came here for my honeymoon. I booked the place without any advance. When I came on the first day the staff greeted us with smiles. No advance asked for and no deposit. Extremely hospitable, polite and quick service. The private jacuzzi was the icing on the cake. The view is absolutely gorgeous no doubt. Thirea is an expensive place to stay but so totally worth the price. Thank you for making my honeymoon special. What I live about this place Private Kitchen with crockery and eatables refilled Everyday Clean place Amazing view Private jacuzzi Soft bed with sofa and table Private balcony
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in Thirea suites & Studios for two nights and had an amazing time there. The rooms are big, spacious and clean with amazing views.The breakfast arrangement was great as well. We loved everything about it.The owners of the hotels also provide the personalized service which is great. They will try to help you as much as they can. As we had arrived early that made sure that we get our room as soon as possible.If I come back again, I will stay here only.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hosts met us on the main road and lead us to the room, it is difficult to find the hotel otherwise as it is on the cliff. Location is great. I didn't like the dark-grey bathrooms. There's indoor Jacuzzi in studios and Out-door jacuzzi in suits. Breakfast wasn't that great. They have kept some stuff in the fridge and you make your own breakfast. Its walkable distance to OIA, and the rooms have great view. The umbrella on the balcony didn't open. We called the front desk and they said they will send someone, and they never did. We sat in the burning sun for a while and couldn't use the balcony much during the day.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Thirea Suites. It is not an exaggeration to say it was my favorite place I have stayed on any vacation anywhere in the world.The room was beautiful, built in the classic cave style which kept it cool without needing constant air conditioning. The balcony offered a private and expansive view of the caldera. We sat outside every morning as we ate our breakfast of yogurt, granola, and cake that was provided in the small kitchenette for our convenience. We also sat outside for a sunset drinking wine we had purchased from of the wineries on Santorini. The stairs down to the room are uneven and steep. This is common for Oia, so be sure to accept their offer of a porter to carry your bags up and down! There was free parking available nearby, but there is no need to drive around Oia. Thirea Suites is perfectly located for walking through the town.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had an excellent stay in Thirea studio. The private indoor Jacuzzi which has awesome view of Caldera was beautiful. The room was so clean and staff was so kind. We definitely want to go back and stay in Thirea. Thanks Eleftheria we had great time.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived early to the hotel and we were accommodated in the vacant adjacent room for us to rest a bit and clean ourselves. It is rather not typical hotel accommodation since there is no reception besides of the personalized assistance/instructions from the hotel owner who was also helpful. The fridge contained the food for breakfast. Our room was nice, clean and directly facing the ocean which has a stunning view. Besides, toiletries needed are all in the the bathroom
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I honestly read all the reviews before booking my stay and it looked like a great hotel, when i arrived the staff was nice. when i asked what time is breakfast they told me you make your own breakfast we put bread ham, cheese and juice with yogurt in your fridge. Nothing like what it showed in the pictures. I payed close to $300 a night to make my own breakfast and sleep in a room that the AC did not work the first night.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an oasis in Oia. The suite is excellent, the staff fantastic, the views magnificent and the breakfast to die for. Tia and her team went out of their way to make sure or stay was memorable, nothing was ever too much trouble, I'm extremely glad they carried out bags up the many steps.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at a standard suite and the view is simply amazing! We could sit at the balcony for hours to enjoy the blue sea and caldera for hours. The suite interior and amenities were very nice. Eleftheria, the host of the property was super attentive and helpful. As the property is adults only and located some steps down from the main road, we were able to enjoy tranquility and privacy. We loved everything about the property and had a wonderful time. We also recommend a sunset cruise which will take you around island and allow you to have a better view of the island and swim, and, of course have some great photos,
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here in July of this year and 2 months later I am still dreaming about this place. It is honestly worth every penny and wish we would have stayed here at least another night. This was by far the most memorable stay at a hotel that I have ever experienced. The customer service is amazing as well. We contacted the front desk upon our arrival and they met with us to assist us with our luggage. This suite is carved into the cliff side so it takes some time to get down to the suites. As we walked down to our suite our jaws dropped because the view was absolutely breathtaking. Everything about the suite was simply beautiful. The most amazing part was in the morning opening the doors and shutters and waking up to that view. Breakfast was served on the balcony in the morning which was set up so beautifully and was absolutely delicious. When we left again we were assisted with our luggage, such amazing customer service! The man who assisted us with our luggage even offered to take my husband on his scooter to the car so we wouldn't have to walk our luggage! I've described this suite as best as I can but in all honesty words cannot even describe this amazing stay/experience at Thirea Suites. I give this hotel 6 stars out of 5!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is AMAZING - better than expected! Location: The location is a bit hard to find initially, but that's only because it's right in the cliff. Easily solved by calling the hotel - they met us where we were dropped off and helped with the luggage. Other than that, being right in Oia was the best - super convenient! The View: From the room out to the caldera was better than we dreamed it would be. It was like a dream every morning. The only down side is you don't get a sunset view - but we easily walked over to see the sunset views. Still gorgeous! The Room: Very spacious, very clean. We were beyond impressed with the condition of the room! The bed was very comfortable, and robes and slippers were provided. We didn't have a pool on our balcony but some units did and it looked fab :) Be prepared to walk many stairs to get up to the main road though. Breakfast: Was served right on our balcony, overlooking the water (the best way to enjoy breakfast imho). An assortment of breads/ muffins and fruits, plus some eggs, ham/cheese, and yogurt with granola. Always fresh squeezed orange juice and coffee. An amazing way to start the day! Overall: 10/10, would stay again. So lux and charming :)
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review covers the Suites as the Studios are located on a separate property, but not far away. There are three suites to choose from and due to demand, it is not always possible to get the best suite(s). However, all three suites are beautiful with only one out of three not having an outdoor hot tub. Our stay had to be split between the suite without a tub and one with a tub, but at the end of the day, the entire stay was equally comfortable and enjoyable. The tubs are warm, so are not necessarily the answer to a quick cool down in the hot August weather, so instead you are able to use the swimming pool at a nearby hotel at a modest charge. It would appear that a swimming pool on this property is planned for the future, which will be cool. There are not many properties in Oia that actually offer a pool.The suites are ideally located, being slightly off the beaten tourist path, which means that there is more privacy. There are not too many stairs that need to be negotiated every day to get to the property and the property is on the edge of the cliff meaning that nothing is in front to block the magnificent views over the caldera. Each suite is of the typical cave construction type and has a beautifully appointed interior with every comfort that you may wish for. The property is immaculate and very well cared for.The couple that manage the property are extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast that is served on your balcony every morning is excellent and can only be described as an abundance of food. We stayed for 6 nights, and every breakfast was different, which is not something you usually see at a property such as this.Oia has become a relatively expensive destination, so when you consider the level of accommodation you are getting here when compared to the other upmarket properties in Oia, the price represents good value.Highly recommended
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I in the Studio room for a short, but enjoyable 2 nights. Comfortably cozy, romantic and private I would highly recommend to stay at any of the rooms available. With an amazing staff ready to support you for any of your needs they did a fantastic job to accommodate us to the fullest. They did not let us down and actually surpassed our expectations. If you have the opportunity to stay here don't think about it - just book it!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel! From the moment we stepped out of the transfer the hotel arranged for us, they greeted us and carried our luggage down the steps to this beautiful suite. There was a bottle of wine waiting for us and some snacks. We had a private hot tub on our patio overlooking the sea that was the perfect temperature - not too hot or cold. The breakfast served on our patio in the morning was delicious and we loved eating on the patio and enjoying the beautiful view. It was even more beautiful than we could have ever imagined. The suite is very private but just a few steps from downtown Oia with all the shops and restaurants. We thought it was the perfect location and were so glad we stayed in Oia and not the other cities in Santorini. Can't wait to go back one day!!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I were there on 9/3/2015. The suites are just outstanding. This is a small "hotel" (just about 5 suites), very private, with outstanding views of the Caldera. We got suite 3, which is great, the hot tub is very private despite to be outside of the room. The couple who handle the suites are very nice people, pleasant and helpful. She brought our breakfast to the suite, it was excellent, including fresh fruits and pastries. I highly recommend the Thirea suites.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent the last part of our honeymoon here and we loved every minute of it! This hotel located in Oia offered superb views of the Aegean Sea. The service was exceptional with the owner coming to greet us when we arrived and delicious Greek breakfast each morning. We definitely want to stay here again!
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, reasonably priced, service is excellent, breakfast is simple and plenty, and is served at your balcony. ( the sea and the caldera view is simply amazing! ) The porter helped us with luggages both checkin and checkout, it really helped us as it could be a bit challenging to lift suitcases up and down all the stairs.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in Thirea Suites and Studios in early July 2015. Since the studios section was newly done, we did not have any reviews to fall back upon during our bookings. But as we wanted to stay on in Oia and most hotels were booked by then we took a chance with this place...and we dint regret a bit. First, when in Santorini please stay in Oia only. Trust me on this. Although the hotels in Oia are expensive, than other locations in Santorini, it is totally worth. So we arrived in Santorini and from our travel from port to the Fira (town) we wondered why this island is said to be one of the most beautiful islands in Greece, until we reached Oia and we got he answer. Serene, Beatiful, Amazing.Out stay in Oia was made much more plesant by our stay in Thirea Studios. The room has a small balcony overlooking the sea with amazing view of caldera. Room was average size, not too small not too spacios. Acceptable. The bathroom had a mid-sized jaccuzzi, with privacy but at the same time facing the sea. We were super happy.The location of the hotel was also good. Not in heart of Oia but very much there. Walking distance to the sun-set point, shopping area, amazing restaurants. But since Oia is at the corner of the Santorini island, the travel to other locations is via Fira town which would be little time consuming. I would still stay in Oia for it beauty.The only thing missing during our stay was the breakfast spread for the price we were paying (300 Euros a night). The hotel doesnt have a dining area and hence the breakfast is served in a basket in your balcony. For veggies like us it is mainly flakes, fruits, bread and some puffs. We were not happy with same, although the disppointment was overcome by the view from the balcony.The hospitality by Thirea was very good. We were not able to make card payments since the banking in Greece was not operating due to the crisis issues. So our payments to the hotel was after nearly 3-4 weeks of our stay, still they were quite cordial. Would definitely come back here. As said earlier, if I come back to Santorini, I will stay only in Oia.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thirea suites is highly recommended, our accommodation was the main reason we had excellent time in oia. The suites owner Eleftheria is such an amazing host, with such an amazing taste. Rooms are spacious, clean, brand new. Breakfast is served in the room and is freshly prepared!Suites' got a private balcony with an amazing view. Our friends were booked in a nearby hotel and wanted desperately to move to thirea but unfortunately they were fully booked.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing! Perfection!!!! Best place ever! Can't beat the location. Very romantic. Market around the corner. Staff is wonderful. Very private yet close to all great restaurants etc. Exactly what we wanted. Incredible location for sunset.
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thirea suites have three rooms and I booked the one with the hot tub and it was absolutely amazing!I got to Oia around 8am and Elefheria was very kind to arrange check in at that time. Sotiris came right to the Oia Main Street to help take the luggage down in the scorching heat...The hotel is on the Main Street but also gives a sense of privacy as it's located at the bottom of the slopes.The walk down is about 2 mins and once you are in your room, the privacy and view is absolutely breath taking.Elefheria was kind enough to serve breakfast the morning I arrived - although it was not part of the rate for that day, it costed an extra €10 -- the breakfast was great and healthy - had egg white, fresh fruits, juice fresh bread and amazing Greek yogurt. The breakfast is about the same everyday.On the first day, the water in the hot tub wasn't really that hot- so Sotoris was kind enough to regulate the temperature and it was absolutely perfect thereafter. There is no pool on the property and only two rooms have a hot tubThe room was absolutely stunning with the bed facing the sea. The bathroom has a jacuzzi tub and a lovely open shower. The balcony is small and cute too. The room is equipped with a small kitchenette and has the basic utensils.Santorini is a must visit to experience how beautiful the place really is.During the month of August, it's worth noting that it gets really hot and staying indoor and enjoying the hot tub and view is blissful .. I would leave around 1830 hours to head up to the Main Street to watch the magical sunset as the weather was perfect. It's a great vibe at that time too.Highly recommend staying at Thirea SuitesThe staff are extremely warm and friendly. Every moment during the stay was magical
hotelName:
24    Thirea Suites & Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unbelievable! I couldn’t stop ahing and ohing when I walked up the stairs and entered our Vinsanto room. Yota the owner has 3 rooms she rents out and we stayed in both the Vinsanto and the Nykteri. We liked the Vinsanto because it’s even bigger (whole 1st floor) and it has places to lounge in the front and the back so at any time of the day you will have sunshine. Even though it’s higher and you will have a bit more wind up there is still was not to cold to use the pool. But Nykteri is equally beautiful. Both houses are really big and have 2 sleeping rooms so for 2 persons it felt like luxury. Both houses are beautifully designed and you have front view over the sea and side view over de vineyards. There are loungeareas wherever you look, it has a kitchen and you can even decide that Yota will cook you a meal. She is very friendly, and also very quick to respond to any question you might have. As we spend the last two nights of our stay in Santorini here we decided to enjoy our time at the house instead over driving around on the island, we just loved it.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have had a wonderful week with my boyfriend, the villa was incredible and very peaceful, yet still a close walk to Oia which was lovely! Yota was an amazing host with her fellow companion, blackie! We will definitely be back soon!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: YES we came to Oia with our 2 year old, and we couldn't be happier to pick Vino Houses as our home for 3 nights. Yota, the owner and host of the property is the nicest and most understanding lady! She was so accommodating to all our request (mostly kid related) and was super nice to our son. First thing he did every morning was go over to the reception and say hello to Yota and her dog :) As soon as we arrived, we were welcomed by Yota and were given a brief but thorough description of the island and places of interest. Yota recommended places to eat and places to visit for our stay and provided a map of the island. She was there every day and was very accessible when we were out. The place itself was perfect for us. Close enough to the town of Oia, but far enough from the crowds. We had parking right on the property and there was plenty of fenced off areas for our toddler to run around and explore. If you plan to explore the beaches, I highly recommend renting a car. The beach walking distance to the property can be choppy and not kid friendly as Kamari and some of the southern beaches. We stayed in the Nykteri house and everything was perfect and just as pictured! I would highly recommend the Nykteri house with anyone traveling with kids as it seems to be the most private one of the 3 and doesn't involve any stairs. Yota had a baby cot set up for us with all the appropriate linens. Towels and sheets were not changed everyday but if we requested clean ones, we had them right away. Breakfast was delicious with good variety. Get the omelette!!! Overall, you will not get a nicer place for the price in Santorini! Vino Houses exceeded all our expectations!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the rooms are amazingly styled and decorated in the best taste. Wonderful amenities, fabulous location, but the best part was our host, Yota. Her warmth and eagerness to help us with our visit exceeded all expectations. I would highly recommend staying at Vino Houses and would definitely stay there again if I return to Santorini.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Athiri Villa for a few nights at the end of August had a wonderful experience. Yota was a great hostess - she welcomed us warmly but also went above and beyond in helping book dinner reservations for us, a boat tour for the day, and all of the taxis we needed to get around. Our villa was extremely spacious, very clean, and very comfortable. The AC worked well and the stay comes with a really generous spread of breakfast every morning (made to order, huge, fresh breakfast with food from the garden). The location of the property is great - it's about a 10 minute walk up an uphill path to a small village called Finikia, where we had an incredible dinner at Lefkes (we walked up there at night and found the place easily). It's about a 30 minute walk (with some uphill terrain) to the main part of Oia town, but especially in the height of summer when Oia is so crowded, we were so happy to be kind of removed from all that in this peaceful quiet space.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dream vacationWe had a wonderful stay in vino houses. The hostess was so sweet and friendly. She gave us the best tips for a fanastic stay. The house itself was beautifully decorated and nicely situated. Not in the hustle and bustle of Oia, where it can sometimes be too touristy. We rented ATVs to get around, this is advisable. We would like to thank the hostess Yota again for her hospitality.We hope to be able to go back someday. You will not find a better stay in Santorini.Family Van Roy
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in the Athiri villa. The villa was impeccably decorated, luxurious and we absolutely loved the outdoor pool. It was so lovely to come back to Vino Houses after a busy day sightseeing in the more crowded areas of Santorini. The location is great for those who would like to be able to walk to a local beach, winery and relax in the peace and quiet. The nearby village Finikia is also great for tavernas and getting a glimpse of the more traditional way of life on the island. Thank you so much to our host Yota who was so kind and helped us with anything we needed. The breakfast was also amazing and full of fresh and healthy ingredients (many of which were homegrown). We hope to visit this lovely slice of paradise again one day!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The villa is beautiful inside and out, classic minimalistic and clean. There is a couch bed, a personal jacuzzi pool, and a table and chairs at the front of the villa as well as 2 sun loungers, basically everything you need. There is another additional cushioned seating area at the back of the villa. The villa and bathrooms were very clean and were cleaned daily by a very friendly cleaner. The breakfast was lovely and you could select on arrival what you wanted to have, and choose as many items as you like. The tomatoes and cumbers where picked fresh from the vineyard. The owner Yota is very friendly and helpful she will go out of her way to help or arrange anything you want to do. She gave us the information on every part of the island as well as places to eat, places to visit and boat trips etc. She was happy to book our reservations and taxis whenever needed and was always around to speak to. She recommended the vineyard/restaurant which was a five-minute walk from the villa and was gorgeous. She also arranged our quad bike and it arrived the same day. The villa is situated in Finikia and is a little drive from Oia (a very popular area and sunset spot), it is also possible to drive to Fira/Thera from the villa where there are shops, lots of restaurants and nightlife. Overall the villa was amazing and I really recommend it to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in Santorini.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot rate this wonderful place highly enough. Our welcome was warm and friendly. Jota our host was fantastic, nothing was too much trouble. She advised us of the best places to visit, eat swim. Booked taxis and restaurants, getting us the very best tables from which to view the glorious sunset. If you are looking for a comfortable house in a beautiful, peaceful, tranquil setting then this is the place for you. A 30 minute walk or a 5 minute taxi will get you to the lovely town of Oia. Simply not to be missed. Thankyou Yota for welcoming us to your home we can’t wait to return . Jan, Worcester
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the time of booking this holiday the host of Vino Houses could not have been more helpful. Vino Houses rest just outside of Oia and are an excellent base to explore Santorini.On arrival Yota, the owner explained the island to us and organised transport into Oia, a Sunset Cruise, restaurants nothing was too much trouble. If you are planning to travel to Santorini make this your first choice to stay, I guarantee you will not be disappointed. We asked for a restaurant in Oia to watch the Sunset ( which are spectacular in Santorini) Yota booked a table at a restaurant called Ochre we had the best table overlooking the sea and witnessed the best sunset of the holiday, this was provided as part of the service and always with a smile. I will definitely be returning to Santorini and would nt choose anywhere else to stay.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent 12 nights island hopping around Greece and 3 nights in Santorini was our final leg. We really struggled when booking accommodation in Santorini as couldn’t justify how expensive it was for fairly average accommodation on the island (rose petals spread across bedding just doesn’t do it for us). The second we found Vino Houses we knew it was perfect for us and we weren’t left disappointed! We are so glad we opted to stay just outside of Oia and not in the main town, it is unbearable and that was in June I cannot bear to think what it would be like later in the season. Yota is the perfect host - always informative and quick to respond to any query via email from the second you book right through until your stay. She helped by making dinner reservations for us, gave advice of what we should do to maximise our time on the island and ordered an ATV to be delivered when we arrived. We had many chats with Yota and thoroughly enjoyed her company - it’s lovely to see someone take such pride in what they do. You pick your breakfast items when you arrive and they are delivered to your terrace at your chosen time each morning. Produce is fresh from the garden and everything was very tasty. We stayed in Athiri and it was beautiful - big and bright with two big double bedrooms. The beds were so comfortable, we slept so well there. The best feature is probably the amazing terrace featuring a huge hot tub that overlooks the vineyards out to the sea. We loved everything about our room but I’m sure the other two rooms were just as impressive! It was about 10 minutes to drive into Oia and approximately 30 minutes to other main towns but we would choose Vino Houses over anywhere else we saw in Santorini! Thank you Yota for making our time here so special.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is no wonder that this place has such great reviews. The owner and host Yota couldn't be more passionate about what she does day in and day out. She strives for perfection and to create a memorable stay in Santorini. The place is meticulously designed giving it a fresh modern but welcome feel making you instantly feel like you are staying at a home away from home. The villa is located in a quiet field area just next to a pedestrian path leading to the beatiful villages Oia and Finikia just a short walking distance away.The breakfast was delicious abundant and very healthy consisting of boiled eggs, bread, bacon, cheese, greek yogurt honey and fresh fruit which was what we chose from a very long list Yota herself provided on arrival. The first day we decided to spend some quality time at our villa and opted to order dinner from Yota. It was delicious highly recommend it. One of the best meals we had in Santorini. Keep up the good work! Cannot wait for our next visit!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, where do I begin?! I wanted to wait until the end of my trip to review after staying at numerous different hotels in Santorini and Mykonos. First and foremost, Yota — the manager/owner of Vino House had amazing communication with me from the moment I booked, until the very last minute of me leaving Vino Houses. You can tell her heart is in this place and it’s not just a job to her. She is detailed and everything was immaculate. She’ll tell you everything you need to know and she’ll do whatever she can to assist you. If I emailed her with an issue or I needed something, she was knocking on our door within minutes! She’s A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!I stayed in the beautiful Athiri villa of Vino Houses with a friend of mine. It was my pre-wedding trip with girlfriends, before the big “I Do”. It looks exactly like the pictures or even better in real life, honestly. It’s off the beaten path and south of the famous village of Oia. It’s secluded, where all you hear are birds chirping and the sea as your view. It was so peaceful staying there. There is a pedestrian walkway almost right next to Vino Houses, where you can walk into town and to the main st. of Oia; it’s about a 15 min walk. It was nice that Oia was close enough to walk to, so we could catch the sunset but to be able to come back to Vino Houses to just relax and be away from all the hustle and bustle was priceless.The Athiri villa itself was so stunning. You’d never get that space and size for the price it is being offered at for something in the main area of Oia. It was like having your own little house. We had a 2 bedroom, with living and dining space. Plus, the amazing patio with our own personal pool with jets. Every morning they served us the most amazing breakfast on the patio, so you can just take in the sun and view of the sea. It’s also walking distance to Domaine Sigalas.I am still daydreaming of my time there. I’d recommend anyone and everyone to stay there. It was definitely the highlight of my trip. The service that Yota provides you is such high quality. She makes you feel like family and that you’re coming home to visit. Thank you for everything, Yota!With love,Linda & Jen
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yota is the perfect host you can find. The villa itself is tastefully decorated and the bed is so, so comfortable. Hot tub was a treat! If you are renting a car in Santorini, we definite recommend this place!! Quiet and away from the bustling city in Oia, but close enough to get to wherever you need. Yota also prepared an amazing pie for us to bring with us to the airport as we would miss the breakfast in the morning! Thank you so much for everything Yota. Ben & Samantha
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is pretty good! The staffs are nice and the view is nice, except the location is much far away from the Oia center. My friend and I had a great moment there. I will come back to this hotel one day.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is run by lovely family providing super B service.That includes lovely breakfast served outside our room with a view of Santorini Landscape.Apartment we have been provided to us (2 adults and 1 child) contains two spacious bed rooms each of them with separate conditioning systems and king size beds. Also that includes kitchen/dinning room and Jacuzzi outside room.Hotel is located very close to Oia, but I was driving a car even it took just few minutes to get there.In general it is very good price and quality ratio, I believe I'd stay if I have a chance to visit Oia again.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice Hotel. Beautiful furnished, clean, a very helpful and friendly host. Quiet and lots of privacy. Good breakfast. Nice view of the ocean. We had great days! We would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Vino Houses was great felt like home that we forgot that we needed to check out at 12. Every thing was just perfect above all Yota the owner is one amazing person the very best that made our holiday so perfect. Yota thank you so much for your hospitality and your recommendation of wonderful restaurants, sight seeing and the walks in the morning, also the education of Santorini. We love you and please come and visit us when you are in London
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Vino Houses offer the best of Santorini away from the crowds and tourists. The villas are spacious, well maintained and Yota is an exceptional host, making sure you have nothing to worry about. The entire experience felt very authentic and relaxing. From eating our home cooked breakfast on the porch each morning to relaxing by the jacuzzi and walking minutes to a nearby winery for lunch and a wine tasting, Vino Houses offers a different experience than most of Santorini's hotels. Although it is set back from the main towns, it is still very easy to get around - only about a 20 minute walk to Oia or a short trip on an ATV or scooter. Look into staying here if you are looking for a relaxing and authentic time in Santorini.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay here was perfection. The villas are gorgeous and incredibly spacious and Giota took the best care of us. I loved our terrace with the jacuzzi and the lounge chairs and eating our delicious home cooked breakfast outside every day. The area is so incredibly relaxing -- separated from the crowds and insanity of Oia but close enough to walk into town. Giota is such a lovely human -- she is warm and caring and it makes your stay that much more enjoyable. She helped us plan adventures, book cars when needed and find amazing places to eat and even found a place for my iPhone screen repair when I shattered my screen. I was initially worried that we were too far from Oia, but it is the perfect location. It was nice to be a bit separated from all of that and there is a really lovely village super close to Vino Houses that is a very short walk and fun to explore and good restaurants. There is also a lovely winery across the street that serves a full food menu! Cannot recommend this place enough -- I would definitely come back!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay with Giota as our hostess. A wonderful retreat after a day of adventure into our beautiful scenic, quiet villa. From the spa on the terrace overlooking a vineyard to a full freshly made breakfast can be expected.Highly recommend this villa to anyone but to those especially wanting the most of Santorini!
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: "Vino Houses" is not a place for tourists looking for the cliche' of Santorini but a gem for travelers seeking to discover the real island. Yota is just a perfect host who will advise you on how to live the island in the way you are looking for.the houses are stylish, brand new, clean with a lovely jacuzzi. the homemade breakfast is served on your terrace... more than raccomended, just perfect
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have come to Vino Houses for three weeks and are so glad we chose this for our time in Santorini.Yota has been the perfect host - from when we booked, the communication has been amazing and she has made sure we have everything we need for the ideal, relaxing break.This has all the facilities of a hotel with the space and seclusion of a villa. The place looks exactly like the photos - modern, beautifully done with everything you might need. There is an amazing array of items for breakfast (including fruit and salad freshly picked).Yota is here at all times to help book mopeds, taxis etc. She even made us dinner on our first night as we arrived late (the best food we have had so far!)It is a three minute walk to a lovely vineyard restaurant and only ten minutes into Oia. There are restaurants (English speaking) who deliver to the villa too and this is made very easy with the Greek mobile phone you get with the villa.You really get the feeling that nothing is too much trouble for Yota and that is what makes this beautiful place so special. She runs the villas with so much love.We will be returning and would 100% recommend Vino Houses to anyone looking to stay in Santorini.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great location at santorini island I would like to extend my thanks and appreciation to vino houses management and staff for the outstanding manner and hospitality I have experienced during my stay at your villa , I felt like my second home. It is an unique place in one of the best locations ... It also has one of the best SPA in greec… Love the restaurant , foods are perfect staff are kind…  The decoration tried to expose the new age style… Great option for weekend runaways.Also i loved the fact that every villa has it own service . Very beautiful with high end linens and towelsGood job guysKeep it up
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As we are a family of 4 persons, it is difficult to find a place with two real different bedrooms. Vino Houses offered us a villa with two different bedrooms with king, dreamless beds, with bathrobes for all of us, slippers, white soft towels. They had even different specific towels for the hot tub. Hot tub was big enough for all of us together. The breakfast was enormous and was served from a professional lady.Vino Houses is our fist priority again soon.
hotelName:
25    Vino Houses
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend this hotel, from the moment we got out of the transfer from the airport we was absolutely amazed from start to finish. The view is unbelievable from the hotel, and the pool is helpful for those hot afternoons :) the location is also perfect, as it’s in walking distance to Thira, also round the corner from a supermarket, and various other necessities. The service was brilliant, the staff are all so helpful, very kind and friendly. A special mention to Roula, I feel that she made our stay that little bit more welcoming, as she would always go out of her way to offer help/ advise or just a friendly chat. I would rate this hotel 10 stars if I could, would definitely recommend to stay here.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always leave good reviews and mention the positives where applicable, but on this occasion felt compelled to leave an appropriate review down to our disappointment with the stay.We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon as our flight was the day after our previous accommodation and they were full. In hindsight we wished we had picked somewhere else. When we arrived at 11am to drop our bags off we were told to wait and someone from reception would be with us in 10 mins. Over 30 minutes later and we were still waiting. We called the numbers a couple of times but no answer and were again told that someone would be with us shortly.Eventually the girl on reception appeared and gave us check in details, they stored our bags and told us to come back at 2pm. No apology, she couldn’t have seemed less interested. I asked as it was our last night on honeymoon and that we had sat wasting our last day, waiting for staff to arrive, if they had any possible upgrades available could they let me know when we came to check in.On returning to check in we were told the manager wanted €100 extra for the upgrade to the suite and nothing else was available.Had the staffs attitude and service been pleasant, I would usually have happily paid this, however the clear lack of care and poor attitude meant I didn’t want to give the property any more money than we had already paid. Personally for me, if I knew a customer was unhappy with the customer service and on a special holiday I would want to rectify it, but this hotel clearly doesn’t work like that. Following on from the above, our stay just went further downhill. The bathroom has rusted screws and smelled damp, one of the lights didn’t work, and the toiletries provided were dirty. (Pics attached) The bed was the hardest bed I’ve ever slept in at a hotel. We also found the location really noisy. At 12.30am I had to go onto our balcony and ask the guests above if they minded keeping the noise down. You could also hear other groups nearby shouting and being rowdy well past 1am. Although not the hotels fault, the location was far too noisy for us. We were thankful that we had only booked here for a night! Breakfast was really really average to other places we’ve experienced. Packet croissants and cake, with some over processed meat and cheese. For our nearly 2 weeks on the island, all food we have had has been great, there is just no need to provide a cheap breakfast. We headed elsewhere to get some good food. Furthermore to when we arrived - After tipping the porter to carry our bags for us, we had to carry them ourselves to the reception so they could be stored securely. Otherwise they would have been left in the entrance of the hotel for passing guests to see. Positives - the bed has some cool lights underneath that give the room a bit of atmosphere.There’s a nice ginger cat nearby. The hospitality and friendliness of everyone we have met in Santorini has been wonderful, sadly I cannot say the same for here and we would not return or recommend.It left a really sour taste on our last day on our honeymoon in Santorini which was a real shame.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want to preface this review by saying this was a really nice and friendly place in a great location that tries to do very well...however...we stayed in the Nefele Suite, which, for its price, was a beautiful place but was not worth It. Many broken amenities in the suite, the “hot tub” is not hot at all just mediocrely warm (which for an indoor pool kind of defeats the purpose of the entire thing), and there are random holes in the flooring that are simply not repaired. It’s a beautiful room and is still stunning, but for the price of the suite, I would suggest finding another place. If they can fix up some details that would make things a lot better.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is on the top of Imerovigli and it has several terraces with a beautiful view. We had the "Superior Double Room" with our own terrace. It was very clean and we felt very happy.The breakfast was really good.Best was the service/team! Very friendly and at the beginning we got all information to Satorini and a list with very good advises for nice restaurants.A special thank you to Roula!We already plan our next visit and next time maybe some more days.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four fabulous after 60. We stayed for 6 nights. The views are spectacular! Also great location to a bus stop, grocery store, pharmacy, restaurants, and hiking. Our apartment was spotless and the staff pleasant and accommodating. Breakfast, included, I think was typically Greek: heard boiled eggs, pastries, fruit, ham and cheese, coffee or tea, and a very tasty Greek yogurt. Lots of good food! The area is not as touristy as Thira or Oia, which we loved.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As the name says, you feel a lot like home. The view is unique, prices are decent for the area and service is very good. Doesn't have 24 hours reception, but this is not a problem, since you can arrange anything you need in advance.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stunning Views! I would recommend everyone headed to Santorini to check out Nefeli Homes. Catarina and Amanda were excellent hosts and accommodated our needs perfectly. The views were unbelievable - you can see the open sea with cruise ships below. We stayed in 2 different rooms. THey have it all - Swimming pool overlooking the cliff, open air Jacuzzi, fantastic, sexy rooms with floor lighting. Breakfast was wonderful - thanks to the staff who were ever so helpful. The staff also booked our shuttle and other stuff at great rates. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights as part of our island hopping honeymoon.Ok arrival, Amanda provided us with lots of information about the best restaurants to eat in and which to be careful about as some charge tourists more than on their menus, so watch out for that.Our room was fantastic, we stayed in room 6, it was quite small, but I guess they all are as the hotel is literally built on the side of the volcanic edge, but the views from our balcony were stunning and every morning we woke up we were wowed again and again.Breakfast was plentiful, bought to us each day on a large tray. Room was cleaned daily, new towels daily and room was cleaned to a spotless condition.Towels available for pool and lounging, we never had trouble finding somewhere to lay in the sun, I think most people go out exploring which we did, but enjoyed sitting on the top terrace enjoying the sunshine and the view. Amanda also recommended a boat cruise with ‘blue cruisers’ there is a separate review, this was a fantastic trip, semi private, 5 course meal, there was only 8 of us on the cruise and although more expensive than others, this was semi private and not one of the larger boat tours with blaring music we saw. We worth the money.We are flying out from Santorini airport and have seen some horrendous reviews about the airport, so we’ll wait and see what that’s like, but would recommend a ferry to another island, maybe Crete and flying from there, which we have done many times, or flying from Athens instead of from here.Only recommendation to the hotel would be the use of plastic glasses around the terraces and pool as we were worried about breaking glasses with people walking about.All in all though a great place to stay, absolutely wonderful views of the volcano and sea, lovely restaurants all around, Anogi was our favourite and went there a few times and very reasonable prices. Lovely helpful staff at the hotel, couldn’t recommend enough for anyone staying in Santorini.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nefeli Homes is a charming hotel in Imerovigli. You need to climb quite a few steps to reach the hotel as it is situated an a cliff overlooking the sea. We had booked a 1 bedroom apartment which had a double bed in the bedroom and 2 single beds in the dining room and a hot tub on the balcony overlooking the sea. The single beds can be used as a seating as well. The apartment doesn't have a cupboard for clothes which was very inconvenient. A few hangers are available. The dining room had a music system so that was an additional bonus. The extremely strange part of the apartment was that the kitchenette was part of the bathroom!! There was a door to the kitchenette and past it was the bathroom. Very strange and unsettling!! The shower area is extremely tiny. The balcony had a hot tub and 2 chairs facing the sea. What a fab ulous view. Another strange thing was that our neighbour had to walk through our balcony to leave their apartment. So in other words we had no privacy. The apts on the lower level had no privacy as tourists use the path in front to walk past as it is a public path. Breakfast is very limited which could be an issue if you spend more than a couple of days here. Breakfast is a fixed menu and the items are brought to your table. The bus stop, pharmacy and grocery store are a stone's throw away.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nefeli Homes was awesome and the price compared to Oia and Fira was great. I think the area of Imerovigli is great being between two busier towns but still great views. You don’t have a direct view of the sunset (although you have a great view of the island) but it is a short walk to a great view point with less of a crowd then Oia. The hot tub was great too after a day of wandering around the island. The hotel is also a short walk to the bus that goes between Oia and Fira
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at Nefeli and were extremely impressed by everything the hotel had to offer. It is located right in the heart of Imerovigli, and within walking distance (20mins) to Thira. The staff are all extremely friendly and Amanda in particular, did everything to ensure we had a memorable stay. The room (Cave Senior Double with Hot Tub) was exactly as pictured/advertised on the website. And the breakfast each morning was great - it’s served on the main terrace which has spectacular views out to the ocean. We can highly recommend Nefeli - it was superb.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancé and I spent 6 days in the grand view maisonnette and we had an amazing time.We felt like we had the best room in the hotel with an amazing private balcony and hot tub. The view from the entire hotel is just breath taking. We had emailed the hotel before our arrival to organise for someone to pick us up from the ferry. This was flawless and 25 euros (other people told us they paid 35 euros when they took their own taxi) Check in/check out was really quick.Amanda and Alex are absolutely amazing.Both of them go out of their way to help us.Amanda also helped us to book our hotel in Athens and gave us many recommendations for restaurants and activities. We also booked ATV through the hotel and it was really easy.It is an easy walk to Fira and there are yummy restaurants around.The bed was very comfortable and there were many sitting areas in the room and on the balcony which made it really enjoyable.  We would definitely recommend the hotel and this specific room. The pool is also very nice when it gets hot (not all hotels have one) and the terrace was so nice that we saw a couple people come in from other hotels to try and relax on the private terrace!Overall great stay, thanks Amanda and Alex, for making this an unforgettable week!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well, no word would be enough to describe Amanda, the hotel receptionist. She goes out of her way to do whatever she can and ensure your stay in Santorini is the best one ever! Alex is also very polite and friendly.. The hotel coudnt be better located... Easy walk to everywhere in thira and right on the trail to Oia. The room. Is comfortable, clean, bright anos very spacious. Will certainly go back!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped at Nefeli Homes for 2 nights (20th-22nd September) and could not have asked for a better experience. The view is simply breathtaking and the hotel is spotless. With only 10 rooms, it gives a relaxed feel and is spacious compared to the number of guests. The pool area is stunning with an amazing view.The staff, Amanda and Alex were amazing, extremely friendly and always on hand to help or answer queries. They really could not of done any more to improve the stay and we were even given an upgrade to the honeymoon suite which was out of this world. A cave suite with 3 rooms including an indoor pool and private balcony.. I have never seen a room like it! Alex even provided our breakfast for our last morning the night before, in the fridge so we could get up and watch the sunrise with breakfast by the pool before our early transfer (also arranged by the hotel).The photos really don't do this place justice! Thank you for our stay and we hope to return in the future!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't begin to tell you how amazing this hotel is. I've provided pictures but the pics don't do the view or the hotel justice. I booked the cave room and stayed for 4 nights. The view of the caldera here is absolutely breathtaking and the service from Amanda and Alex (and Alex's mom, housekeeping) is unparalleled. The pool is small but perfect sized for the hotel and is a great way to cool off during hot (late) summer days.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed at this beautiful place. The place has an old, antique feel. The amazing views on all angles from this place is breathtaking. Amanda (receptionist) and Alex (all around guy) were both amazing and helpful. Amanda is very knowledgeable with the area and accurate information for everything, even for a last minute taxi request. She made our stay very convenient and memorable. I will definitely recommend this place to see and experience the magical place of Santorini. Here to share some pictures of the great view abs and room.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nefeli Homes was a wonderful place to stay! Amanda, who managed the hotel, was very accommodating. She helped us with anything we needed. She made phone calls, arranged excursions, arranged a rental ATV, and recommended restaurants. She was so personable and friendly. Alex was also extremely helpful. He was always preparing the coffee and breakfast each morning. He helped with luggage and making arrangements for restaurants. One night he put breakfast in our refrigerator so that when we left early for our excursion we would have something to eat. We stayed in the Grand View Maisonette apartment. It was the best! View was spectacular on our balcony and from the bedroom windows! It was very spacious and comfortable. I would highly recommend Nefeli Homes and the Grand View Maisonette!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 4 nights and our conclusion was that we're glade we chose this hotel for the following reasons:Location (25 mins walking to Fira downtown)1 of the best views of the caldera The staff is extremely friendlyThey sent us a pick up from the port for 25 euros and the driver was very nice as wellI think if I came back again to santorini I will definitely choose the same hotel.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing views, great friendly staff, very clean.I would recommend for families.Our room was right next to the swimming pool (room 6) and it was a bit noisy with all the kids swimming at the pool.It was also right next to the reception and and the people coming in and leaving would keep you awake with luggage wheels making noise constantly (this is the only reason I gave 4⭐️ and not 5⭐️)Breakfast was great and Alexi was a great guy always there to help and recommend good places to visit or dine.I will definitely visit again Nefeli Homes
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Nefeli Homes in the Senior room with Private hot tub. Everything was great. The views were incredible, but you can get that in most places in Imerovigli. Amanda at the front desk was incredible. She helped with food recs, booking excursions, and anything else we might need. She was very nice and always willing to go above and beyond. My only slight complain would be the shower pressure and head wasn't the best, but it was a minor inconvenience, and when inside the cave rooms the wifi is slow and spotty. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone I know going to Santorini.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just come back from my visit from Santorini, Nefeli Homes - and OMG! I have been wanting to goto Santorini for over around 2 years now, and I have never been so happy that I have visited. I am already wanting to go back as I have completely fallen in love with this stunning island. The place is just unreal. The hotel is extremely clean, the staff are great and the views are something else. If you're wanting to visit Santorini that offers an excellent service and views - this is your place!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mom and I couldn't have asked for a more perfect and relaxing stay here at Nefeli Homes. We stayed in the Senior Cave which was just lovely, hot tub and all which we enjoyed on the cool evenings. The pool was small but perfect to take a dip and cool off from the hot sun and enjoy the views of the caldera and volcano. The very best part was the host Adamantia!! She was so wonderful in helping us make our stay in Santorini perfect! She booked us in on our sunset cruise and found us exactly what we wanted. She scheduled all our transportation around the island and even helped me to top up my data on my phone. She was amazing and made us feel so comfortable and at home with nothing to worry about! I highly recommend anyone to stay here
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 2 nights at Nefeli Hotel. It is a beautiful place, amazing attention from Amanda and Alessandro. Amazing Breakfast, rooms, service, information, location, etc. Totally recommended if you want to go to a nice place and feel like home with the most beautiful view. I will come back to this place!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got to the hotel. Costumer service 5*, everyone's so nice, amazing costumer sevuce by the lady on the reception and the guy at the "bar/coffee" tjat makes the breakfast.Amazing cleaning by the cleaning lady evrry morning, thank you so much for making the room look like new everyday!!This place doesn't have restaurant, but follow their reccomendations and you'll be more than happy, no doubth!Rent a car its gonna be easier with them, as booking an excursion! Best conditions and view on the city!! Thank you so much, we're definetly coming back!!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in my live i have see a spectacular view from my hotel from my balcony soo Nefeli Home is a great place and very very new evrything it was new and clean they have olso a nice swimming pool and ohh jacuzzi i love that jacuzzi in my room so evrything it was soo great we have a very nice holiday in santorini thank you to Manoli and Katerina they make ouer vacation more eazy see you next time .
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived early at Nefeli Homes and upon arrival were welcomed with the most breath taking view and some coffee and pound cake while we waited for our room to be serviced. Antonia was very helpful with providing us with suggestions of tours we could book, car rentals, and four-wheelers without being pushy (We did the catamaran sunset tour and one-day four wheeler rental, which I recommend). The room we were in was recently renovated and just what we needed for our vacation. A queen size bed, small refrigerator, and a bathroom with a tub. I will say do not plan on watching much TV there because most channels are in Greek, but we didn't travel to Santorini to watch TV, so it was not a big deal. Also Wifi in the cave rooms is not the best, but if you pop outside you are able to have a stronger connection, with an amazing view!Each morning we woke up, took in the view, and ate breakfast (when we woke up in time), which was delicious. With the bargain we received for our nightly rate, we did not have breakfast included, but it was okay because we would sleep in and grab lunch from the Souvlaki spot right off the road for only 2.50 Euro, which was equally delicious. If you are contemplating like I was on whether you should stay in Fira or not, believe me Imerovigli is where you want to be. It is a 20 minute walk on a walking path down to Fira, which we ventured to and from for dinner one night. You feel completely safe and do not have to worry about getting run over by cars. Fira is busy with tourists and people trying to get you to buy things or eat at their restaurants. Each morning we woke up in Imerovigli and stepped outside it was peaceful and you were able to enjoy your surroundings. I almost rented a car, but cancelled last minute and I made the right decision. You do not need a car. The public bus is reliable and runs every 15 mins for less than 2 euro per person. We even used the bus to get to Fira and transfer to the other side of the island to visit Santos Winery, which I highly recommend. All in all, I would stay at Nefeli Homes again in a heartbeat, it was everything I imagined my stay in Santorini would be like.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The family room we booked is huge. the breakfast served on outdoor deck was very good and more than what you could eat. location is good, right on main walking path, close to bus stop. compare with other hotels on island, it may be average at best but we felt we got our money worth. complaints: (1)swimming pool is too small and my teenage son refused to get in because "it is embarrassing".(2) I emailed our flight info and the hotel confirmed airport pick-up. after we landed, nobody showed up until we called, then they send a driver but we waited more than half hr at airport.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My number one recommendation would be to have the hotel pick you up at the airport. We did not and we had a terrible time finding the hotel. Our taxi dropped us off at the main street at about 2130 and we wandered in the dark for at least 30-40 minutes. No one in the area seemed to know anything about its location. Fortunately once we located it- everything was smooth sailing. The hotel is very nice and the location is perfect. They even have a nice convenient store within a very short walk. The room was a little musty, but it is a traditional cave house in the middle of summer so that was no huge deal but it was noticeable. The air condition worked but it wasn't the best. The wifi was also touch and go in our room, but on most of the patios and decks it worked well. Breakfast was plentiful and very good. View was perfect and ambience was unreal. Staff was also very friendly and very willing to help with any needs including ATV rental etc.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have spent a week here, one of the most relaxing of times. Views to die for, that change daily with all of the cruise ships that visit. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The place is being cleaned constantly. Breakfasts are great, just right.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for only 3 nights which we wish we stayed longer.The view from the hotel would have to be the best view in Santorini! The staff were wonderful, they organised everything for us to do throughout the day, which made our holiday stress free.. the hotel is a short 15 minute walk from fira which is the centre (the scenery makes it feel like 5 minutes) The rooms were cleaned everyday and they were beautiful! If you come to Santorini this defiantly is the place to stay! We will be back!!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, breathtaking view of Santorini and the Caldera.. and they let us check in early.Walking distance to a restaurant that has some pretty good food and a supermarket. If you want to have more restaurant/shops selection go to Fira for day or nighttime its easy to get there by bus. Sunsets here are amazing, i would say just as nice as in Oia.Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Nefeli Homes last year on our belated honeymoon. I wanted to stay in a traditional cave like room that you can only find in Santorini. Wow! The room we had was huge, it included a living room area. The way each cave like room was placed you had total privacy; we even had a balcony area. The view is like none other anywhere. It was awe-inspiring; our hotel was built right into the cliff. Breakfast was served on the terrace overlooking the Aegean Sea and the caldera. . .it was the best home made Greek yogurt we had in our entire time in Greece! To stay in a hotel in Santorini with a view like this would cost a fortune (like in Oia), but Nefeli Homes had the best view at a very reasonable price. It's a family run hotel which we also liked. The only negative aspect would be the pool which was miniscule but you don't go to Santorini for a pool; and the rooms are dark. But you are in a cave after all. And there are a TON of stairs . . up . .down . .just to get around Nefeli Homes, but that just adds to the quirky charm of the place. The owners were very accommodating and friendly; they picked us up at the ferry and let us leave our bags in the office for the entire day after check out before we left Santorini on our last day. AND drove us back to the ferry at midnight! Nefeli Homes also was within walking distance to Fira. My husband and I visited Oia but we actually liked Imerovigli better! Oia was very crowded with the cruise ship people spilling all over the place and felt very touristy; Imerovigli was not like that at all. We also liked it better than Fira . .. which was nice but also very crowded and young. We've done the up-all-night-dancing-and-drinking scene when we were a little younger. Overall, we'd loved our stay at Nefeli Homes and we'd go back the next time we visit Santorini!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic view on the caldera, one of the best views you'll find in Santorini. Enjoyable relaxed time spend there. Owners were very kind, they arranged free pickup from the port and to the airport. Not very far from the town, 15 minutes to Fira by foot the bus stop is across the street
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed one week at the grand view MAISONETTE No 5 and we enjoyed every minute here. This apartment with two stories gives enough room for 2 to 3 people and the private balcony has one of the best views around. Free Wifi was fast, a big fridge in the room keep your drinks cool and the greek breakfast was every morning served with a smile on the terrace with unobstructed caldera view. The rooms were perfect cleaned every day by a friendly lady as the whole area was very well maintained. Of course you have to keep in mind where you are staying. Space is limited, the rooms are small and you should not be much taller then about 180 cm in this room. The pool is more for a refereshing dip and not for swimming, and other rooms here are more cave-style, that means only one front windows and a darker feeling. But when you are in Santorini, you should not waste your time in the room. Resnt a car, there are a lot of beaches and greek tavernes as well as some nice wineries to discover and not to forget the sunset view down into the caldera.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Keep looking - there are plenty of other places in Santorini that offer a view, without the mouldy, damp, dark, outdated, small, chemical smelling rooms. Pay a bit extra and stay somewhere you can actually enjoy!- The photos and information Nefeli Homes provide are completely misleading! - Pool area is TINY and the pool itself is dirty, and large majority is knee deep.- No management present onsite, only for check-ins.- No information or map provided on the island or area when you check-in. - Looking at where they serve their breakfast, I would not eat here.- They charge your credit card before you arrive.- The room we were located was underneath the pool, with tiny windows, right next to the public walkway, stunk of strong smelling chemicals and had an air conditioning unit full of mould.- Within ten minutes of being in the room my partner and I were feeling very nauseous. We informed the manager and asked if we could please move to a different room and she told us that we could not as the hotel was fully booked. Since they could not offer us another room for tonight, we then asked if we could get a refund so we could stay in other accommodation. She rang her manager who informed us that a refund was not possible.Eveidently it became obvious that there was no way we could stay in the room for 2 nights with the smell making us feel ill and we decided to stay elsewhere.Given these circumstances we thought there could have been a refund given.When we were waiting for our ride to leave, management went down there to assess the room, and the manager acknowledged the smell and condition of the room yet still wouldn't refund a cent.It is completely unacceptable to offer a room of this standard to guests, regardless of the price, however given that we were paying 114€ per night, this was not cheap so we were definitely not expecting a room of this extremely poor standard. We notified booking.com of the situation and they liaised with Nefeli Homes on our behalf but Nefeli Homes still refused to refund us anything. Frankly, this is appalling and we have never experienced customer service like it!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did not know what to expect when we reached these. A none too impressive facade welcomed us. But once we were inside we were welcomed warmly and we had a lovely three day stay at the place. A walk of 100 meters takes you down to the beach which is studded with eateries. The first place as you hit the beach gives you a discount if you are staying at Nefeli Homes. (i forget the name of the place. The rooms are cozy and spacious. with a dressing area. We took a poolside room. The place serves breakfast at less than 10 Euros. The breakfast is good. We took a pool side room and there is a small place to sit outside with two chairs (for smokers). The pool bar is adequate, though nothing great. The pool is small but good. There are regular buses to Mikonos bus station. The tickets can be bought at the small store opposite the gate of Nefeli Homes.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oh My Goodness. The views and hotel suite were so much more than we imagined. We had the honeymoon suite and it was so spacious (giant, actually)and well equipped. We cooked a wonderful dinner in the room. Had a romantic jacuzzi in the giant bathroom ( truly back in the cave and it echoed!). The jacuzzi took a long time to fill up so prepare in advance. Breakfast with REAL Greek yogurt was wonderful and Ana was helpful with reservations to any restaurants. She served us olives and wine upon arrival! Everything was better than expected and we loved the area. It was quiet but close to everything. Make sure you hike the trail from Oia to Fira.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are currently staying here with the family and couldn't wait to write a review.Would highly recommend for both couples and family to stay here the view is incredible and we love overlooking the entire island from our suite. It is situated on top of the cliff and is truly amazing. The suites are quite spacious and beautifully decorated. Breakfast served daily with a smile on the top balcony. The lady in charge Anna is absolutely lovely and a pleasure to deal with. Thank you Anna to you and your family we will never forget our magical memories spent here.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a family owned property. The couple know how to represent the greek hospitality by being attentive and smiling. They are proud of their property and they try our best to make the guests experience memorable and unique. The views are stunning and the rooms very clean. Well done guys!!!Kostas & Naomi
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is always hard to find accommodations in Europe for a family with kids since most require you getting two rooms. In Nefeli we had a room with one queen bed and two twin beds which worked great for us. The room had some character, overall we were content with our choice. Imerovigli is no Oia, there is no promenade with shopping but it has great views, good food and warm people.If you want luxury stay at Honeymoon Petra Villas instead.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and celebrated a wedding on the terrace. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The view is absolutely breathtaking. The rooms were fantastic, we had the majority of them reserved for guests. The breakfast was very nice and they served wherever you wanted it. Pool was a nice refresher from the heat. One consideration is the location, you won't see the sunset from this area. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in early June 2015 and had a wonderful time. The view from the rooftop terrace is breathtaking. Breakfast is delicious. Anna was very welcoming and helpful. We rented an ATV and she arranged everything and we had a great time exploring the island. I would definitely stay here again but would want a room higher up, as we were in room 1 and it was chilly at night. And they gave us a ride back to the airport!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group stayed at four of the available rooms for seven nights. Manolis came to pick us up at the port and right then and there we knew this was going to be a great vacation. This is a family business and they were so warm and hospitable, we instantly loved them. The rooms are all different and very quaint, the place is beautiful. Anna arranged our outings and was spot on recommending places to eat and things to do, we all had an AMAZING time much in thanks to her. We all found the breakfast to be plentiful and delicious, that IS the best yogurt in the world, I miss it so much now!The only reason I did not give it five stars is because the beds were not very comfortable but to tell you the truth if I was to go back to Santorini I would definitely stay there again because of the great service we received!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we were picked up from the port, our luggage carried to our room, the friendly welcome then the breathtaking views each day has been paradise. Breakfast up on the top balcony overlooking the caldera is worth getting up for. Only a short stroll to restaurants and another walk along the cliff path between the hotels to the town on Thira. Bus stop only around the corner to take you into Thira as well. Supermarkets nearby. Different levels of steps to rooms but in groups so quite manageable. Even with a sore knee it was no problem. Our age group is mid 60's. Thank you for a truly memorable experience and wonderful hospitality. We stayed in a cave room. Wow.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
