review_body: the hotel looks gorgeous on website but our room was dark, furnished with lots of odd dining room chairs when a settee would have been more comfortable. Only 1 bathroom light worked and the ceiling in the shower was leaking, presumably from room above. Manager advised of this. Staff were stretched, location and breakfast good. Only advised of hotel pickup/drop off on day before we left, should have known this when making our booking.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have no words for this hotel .. THE STAFF AND Anna is very helpful and very friendly. BREAKFAST EVERY DAY AND WAS DIFFERENT. There was everything in the disks. THE INTERNET WAS FREE AND EVERYWHERE caught. The view was AMAZING FROM THIS HOTEL recommended HOLIDAYS.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small boutique hotel tucked into ImerovigliBreathtaking view... Excellent caretaker Ms Anna... Checks into every detail and comfort... Simple wholesome breakfastEnjoyed every minute of our stayRooms small, yet equipped with all basic items fr hair dryer to stove/ fridge/ safe/ electric kettle... Most peaceful and relaxing holiday. Good location close to bus stop
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can fully agree with all positive reviews below. This place is awesome! The view is one of the best, which we've seen on Santorini - Imerovigli is located much higher than other cities (villages), so the views are really spectacular. Plus it's much less busy here, than in Fira of Firostefani, which makes it a perfect place to relax. Nefeli Homes is located in the centre of Imerovigli, so it's close to everything - to local markets, bus stop (main road), to restaurants and ATM. We also walked to Firostefani and Fira from there (very nice walk). Accomodation offers free airport pickup/dropoff, which is very nice gesture. Breakfast were also very tasty, and you can enjoy them eating on the terrace with gorgeus view. We stayed in Grand View Maisonette, which had 2 floors and its own balcony - we really loved this room! It was very comfortable and spotless clean. The only small disadvantage was poor wifi, but as I read reviews of other hotels, this is quite common in Santorini, so what can one do :) Overall we had perfect stay and would definitely come back again!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is delightful. It is located in a quiet village that is near to the main road, so best of both worlds. It's about 30 minutes walk to the capital Fira and there is also a local bus stop. There are some lovely restaurants within 5 minutes walk - Anogi and Bella Thira are worth a visit - and a couple of supermarkets, coffee places and a pharmacy.The staff are wonderful (Anna in particular) and the breakfast is very tasty. The rooms were cleaned only once we'd left for the day. It was a wonderful stay and no problem was too big or small for Anna. Our room was next to reception and on occasion, we listened to an incredibly patient Anna dealing with what we felt were unfounded complaints.All in all, great stay, good value, brilliant location.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would highly recommend this hotel! We had a lovely room (more like an apartment) for our family of 4. The small pool was just perfect. The views were incredible. The breakfast was served on the outside terrace under umbrellas. Their driver was very helpful in getting us to our departing sailboat at the opposite side of the island. This is perfect for a short stay on Santorini.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a gem. Fantastic location. Helpful, friendly staff. Impeccable daily maid service, spotless. Good honest simple breakfast, plenty of it. Unbelievable value for money. Close to good restaurants and walking distance to Fira.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Maisonette 5 and had a charming place- kitchen & bath downstairs with a lovely dbl bed & twin up staircase. Views from wood shuttered windows were awesome. Had a balcony that overlooked Caldera path & views of the Caldera. Fun to sit & drink wine, watch people walk by & boats/ferries come in.Nice pool with sparkling iridescent blue tiles. Very refreshing as it is not heated. Small store nearby so purchased things for breakfast as our rate did not include breakfast. Great location and can walk to Fira. Close to local bus stop, too to take bus to Oia.Free pci up/shuttle from airport /port is a big plus!Def would return. Felt like we had our own home!
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing views and nice rooms. Pool area is nothing short of fabulous. Our room was small but everything else made up for it. Especially the price which was much lower than everything else compatible in the area. We will stay here of we come back. Friendly staff and free transfers. One of the best hotels for the price I have ever stayed in.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is not often thta you get a jewel like this where the marketing pics actually looks like the place you're staying in. Breathtaking views of the caldeira, the surrounding area, centrally located and an awesome pool.
hotelName:
26    Nefeli Homes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent a week in Phevos Villa. Nice relaxing hotel with good pool area, all very clean and tidy in a great location a short walk from bars and the beach. Rooms are very small with a sink and fridge and just enough room for a toaster and kettle so if you're thinking of preparing and eating meals in the room think again. However there is adequate room on the terrace outside with a table and chairs.All in all a nice clean and tranquil family run hotel that I wouldnt hesitate in booking g again.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Here now and this place is clean, comfortable and everyone is friendly. Beds and towels changed daily, George the owner always available nothing is a problem. Very quiet around the villas. Would definitely recommend
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Late review, we stayed in 2018..Absolutely loved this place. Rooms are very very basic but your in Santorini surely you only need a room to shower and sleep in and they are more than adequate for that.Rooms were cleaned daily and the lady who cleans them deserves massive credit.Pool and pool areas were Fantastic. cleaned regulary Owners George and his wife were brilliant, George is a lovely Fella and has a liking for winding you up.Santorini is a beautiful island best greek island in our opinion.Would i return ???? in a heartbeat id be back. loved it so much
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, cleanliness was above average, and young lady from Albania who worked there was amazing and the young lady who cleans she is a star ,every day everything was clean bed was hard but comfy slept really well ,pillows little hard ,only negative was no plug near mirror to do yr hair ,and room was basic but so clean not quite as described by Thomas Cook ,pool area fantastic and lovely private balcony was a treat to come home late at night to sit out on beautiful would visit again
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 5 days last week at this villa, the owner Giorgos it was very kind and available at any moment. Every room is in a single house, the rooms are not connected with each other, with a balcony and a beautiful view. The place was super clean and silent. Every day they will clean the room and change the towels. And there is a beautiful swimming pool with a bar. Great location, just a few minutes walking to the beach. About 200 mts away there is a bakery open 24 hours, with all fresh and delicious pastries done every day. If you go in the morning you'll see the people making the pastries. And in the corner there is a small supermarket open until late. I will highly recommend this Villa, and If I ever go back to Santorini I will have no doubt to reserve here again.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, STAY AWAY. Don't risk your happy holiday on staying in this really average place. I have stayed in many places including the poorest villages in Romania, and still regret spending this much on this place. Did it for yourself, or even for me. Pros:Air conditioningPoolCons:Ants on floorHard beds, box spring trash that hurtsSalty water with no signs to not drinkNo Wi-Fi in roomsGot moved from one room to another halfway through stay because owner made mistake. No compensation or anythingLocation is poor, not much aroundWe try to do many cities on a budget, as you can see in my account I've done a few, but Santorini is NOT one that you get a good experience in. I wish I was told I'd leave less happy than I arrived if I stayed here. NB: I'm not a fussy snob, just really disappointed in this place and professionalism.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 10/10 for value, location, customer service and cleanliness. The pool was lovely, great size, bigger than expected (can usually be fooled by hotel photos), very clean, plenty of sunbeds, and a reasonably priced bar besides it. The family who run the place were lovely. Very friendly and spoke good English. The beach is just a stones throw away with a strip full of bars, restaurants and shops. The room is basic, but if you've travelled to Santorini to spend your holiday locked inside your room, maybe this isn't the place for you. There is a locker and fridge inside too. Clean towels and bed linen too, with spacious balconies with tables and chairs. Would recommend, especially due to the price and great pool as santorini is expensive.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here 7th August 2018 with my fourteen year old daughter for one week and it was ok, but feel it could have been a more enjoyable time but for a few small improvements. I want to say at this point that I am not one to moan usually because you’re not staying for very long so just get on with it. Santorini itself is lovely although we found it to be very windy in Perissa, not just a gentle breeze but almost gale force at times which spoilt it a bit for me, also Santorini Airport is just too small. We queued for ages outside on our departure then queued again at the departure gate because there was no room. About the property: The pool was lovely, nice and warm most days, lots of sun beds always available. The owner of Phevos does provide snacks although there was no menu so you had to ask for what was available, and he seemed to open up the bar for short periods and then disappear for ages so you had to pick your moment to get a snack or a beer. Also none of our doors would shut properly without really shunting them! I was told by the owner about getting sun cream on the white towels, and he moaned about it but when you have a shower that only emits water from a couple of holes then maybe I still had some cream still on me?!! I just think that the place was let down by poor maintenance for whatever reason. We still had a lovely time in Santorini so our holiday wasn’t ruined, just wanted to point out these small annoyances. The food on the seafront and the service was exceptional and we had some lovely meals. Please visit the Chinese restaurant on the main road as the people there were fantastic and food was delicious, we kept going back there! Overall the place was still ok. I wouldn’t return to the island mainly because of the awful airport experience which is a shame because it is very beautiful.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner visited Phevos Villas from 26/7 - 02/8. Upon arrival we were slightly unsure of the place with it being a little more basic than we anticipated however we soon realised that we had chosen one of the best hotels in the resort.It was very clean with rooms being cleaned every day with fresh sheets and towels. The pool area was lovely - although not overly big it was one of the biggest in the resort ! We paid €49 for air con for the week which seemed steep but it was a godsend ! We had late night flights and check out was 11.30am but there is a courtesy room to keep cases and get a shower.George the owner seemed to have quite a hard exterior but once we got talking to him he seemed like a lovely guy. There aren’t any pavements in Perissa so just be aware that you have to walk at the side of the road. We tackled this by finding the shortest route down to the beach front and mainly used the bars and restaurants down there (about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel). If you plan on visiting Fira and/or Oia then I’d recommend getting the local bus down by the magic bus bar on the beach front (this is the first pick up so you should definitely get seats) It’s €2.40 per person to Fira then from Fira onto Oia a further €1.80. Buses are air conditioned and run every 20minutes from early morning until late at night.Hotel was full of really lovely down to earth guests and it has such a friendly atmosphere. Would recommend if you want to go and just relax.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have visited Santorini many times and after our fifth stay at Phevos can honestly say it’s the best budget accommodation we have had on the island. Clean rooms - thanks to George’s lovely and very hard working cleaner- and beautiful relaxing pool area. Thank you George, Anna and Jacob for another wonderful stay - see you next year! X
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived back from 2 weeks at phevos villas last week firstly the apartments are in a prime location close enough to the beach returaunts and bars . The rooms are very basic normal traditional greek however the cleanliness is outstanding and on a parr with any 5 star providing clean fresh fluffy towels every day . George the owner is very busy as he has just opened a new hotel in Perissa close to the beach however he always had time for us and is a very approachable host . Due to George being so busy the pool bar wasn’t always open throughout the day however there is no problem taking your own drinks and snacks to the pool . We was originally in room 5 which is a very small room with not much of a balcony therefore we moved to room 10 on our second week which was much more spacious and had a nicer bigger balcony. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at phevos and would recommend it to anyone looking for a affordable holiday in Santorini .
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled with friends to Santorini and were impressed with the Phevos Villas. The studio room for 2 ovelooked the pool it was quite small but functional. The rooms are kept very clean . Don't expect to be able to cook a 3 course meal as in all Greek self catering there is minimal facilities ie toaster kettle and one portable hob.There is a nice pool area with plenty of sunbeds. There is a small bar where we had a couple of drinks before we went out in the evening where we had a chat with the owners.There is a safe and air con if required for a fee. It's a few minutes walk to the bakery where we bought rolls and cakes for lunch. There are.numerous restaurants and bars on the main road and beach road which is 5 to 10 minute walk. We caught the local bus to Fira which was 2.40 and it was another 1.80 to Oia which is a really pretty place to visitI would definitely recommend this accommodation for it's quiet location and only a short walk to restaurants/beach and also for it's cleanliness .
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back form a week at Phevos Villas, they are very well located a short walk out of 'town' so are therefore in a reasonably quite area of Perrisa . The pool is a good size and has plenty of comfortable sun beds although they were very little used the week we stayed. George and his wife Hannah aided by their cleaner do a good job of keeping the place clean. The rooms are small but have everything you want including a nice firm mattress on the bed!!! As you would expect on a very small island the tap water is filtered sea water so is an absolute no no for making tea cleaning teeth etc.There is air con and a room safe at a small charge per week which is advisable as there are only ten policemen on the whole island. Couldn't believe the lovely white towels are changed every day and the bed sheets at least twice in our week, well done George but is that really necessary ? Talking about George he is very amiable and friendly if you care to take the time to chat to him and Anna. All in all in was a perfect place to stay on this beautiful and picturess island.Enjoy your stay but be prepared for an awful departure from the smallest and chaotic airport on your return.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and me stayed there for a week this September.The hotel was grear,spotless,rooms are cleaned every day and towels were changed everyday..Pool is amazing,clean with loads of sunbeds..everything was great,Giorgios are very kind and helpful..we definetely come back in a few years!Thank you for everything..
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second time here and still as amazing as the first, georgios, Anna and Jacob who run it are such welcome hosts. The rooms are basic but comfortable, the pool area is amazing one of the best we've been to. Fantastic with children. The pool bar offers a variety of drinks and bar snacks which are lovely. Will definitely be coming again.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is little more I can add to the positive comments made so far except to endorse them wholeheartedly. 4 of us just had a fantastic holiday on Santorini based in Perissa at Phevos Villa. Quiet location, very clean and functional rooms which were cleaned every day and new sheets and towels provided. George was pretty much around most of the time and always happy to assist and fix any problems ( our door lock did not like letting the key be removed after locking ) or help with local area queries.We will return and look forward to it.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this quiet hotel in May 2016 and stayed for a week. We enjoyed the holiday so much we have returned in September for two weeks. This small family run hotel is clean and close to the beech. Each of the self catering rooms have, air conditioning, a small stove for cooking (perfect for preparing light meals), utensils, a fridge and terrace. There is plenty of room round the pool and a bar for drinks or you can buy your own from the local supermarket. The rooms are cleaned every day with fresh towels provided. Perissa has a long beech with countless bars and restaurants offering good value meals. So if you are looking for a peaceful base in which to explore this wonderful island, then you need to look no further and Giorgos, the owner, is friendly and always on hand if you need him. We have met people here who return every year and say they still have not fully explored the island
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just arrived back from these apartments after a lovely weeks holiday. The apartments were nice, small but ideal for how long we were in them and cleaned everyday to a high standard. However cannot be said for the owner, although he wasn't horrible, a nice Greek shake of the hand to welcome you and a smile upon arrival would not have gone amiss, not the typical Greek welcome we are accustomed to. Asked if they did breakfast and was told 'no there was only me and he only had a toaster, very difficult when on your own' was his answer! Air con is 6 euro a day so not sure how the previous reviewer got his thrown in? Based on this I would recommend the location and apartments if they had a new owner as it could be a little gold mine, but he appears not to be interested and can associate with other comments how he may pick and choose who he chats to? Sorry will not be returning to these apartments.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a family 2 adults and 2 children for a week. The hotel is located just a 10 minute stroll from the main centre of perissa with all the shops, bars and restaurants and also the beach. 5 min walk to the nearest local shop and 24 hour bakery (don't miss visiting the bakery as all the foods are great).Our room was small and basic as you expect in Greece with a separate patio area for sitting outside. The room had aircon which was great and not too noisy. It also had a free safe. It had a small kitchen area with full size fridge wth a small freezer compartment, a kettle, a toaster and a plug in 1 ring electric hob. Also provided were plates, cutlery, pots and pans etc for those who want to make up small meals. A nice touch was that washing up liquid a brush and tea towel were also provided. Bathroom was your basic, shower and sink with soap provided also. Could have done with some storage space in here for toiletries with there being 4 of us and a few more towel rails or hooks.The room was clean and well maintained and the cleaner visited daily and made beds and provided clean towels. The beds are very comfy. A great point abouth these apartments are that there are only a few so the pool area is not too busy. We found plenty of spare sun beds at any time of the day and this was in August - they are also very comfy. You get the sun all day around the pool and there are sun brolleys if needed. The pool here is great and a really good size compared to a lot of the hotels. It also has a good shallow end so is perfect for children. There's a pool bar which serves drinks and snacks all day at reasonable prices. Also free wifi around the pool area which is a bonus. You will see a few cats around the area but they keep themseves to themselves unless you call them over.This is a nice quiet accomodation where you really can relax and enjoy your time. And it's not too far from Perissa centre. I would recommend and would also stay again.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we have been back from Phevos Villas for a week.Our room was basic, but spotless and we had a terrace facing the pool. There are free safes, hairdryer, TV kettle and fridge, The bathroom is small and the shower is quite basic, but it does the job. The pool is cleaned every morning by George and there are plenty of sunbeds, which are lovely and comfortable. I cannot fault the hotel or the staff in any way. George and Anna are busy owners and work very hard ensuring that things are run as smoothly as possible.They both speak English and their son who helps out also speaks good English. The cleaner, who was there most of the day and again we must say was very nice and always ready with a smile.The villas are in great location, with a shop and english is understood and spoken and the YUMMY 24hr bakery 5 minutes walk away.their croissants and ring sugar doughnuts are to die for. We used to buy a baguette (a tip here....the large are the same price as the small ones, so hubby and I shared). There is a wide selection of baguettes to choose from. Cakes, Freshly squeezed fruit juice again yummy. The beach and restaurants are a little further, all in all about 10 minute walk.We ate at a few of the restaurants facing the beach, Aqua was an excellent restaurant with value for money, and friendly staff. Most times we were given a complimentary homemade sweet! :)The local buses are good value for money (not always on time :) but this is Greece). We paid 2.40 euro to go to Thira which takes about 25minutes. The conductors/drivers are friendly and helpful.We will go back here.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Phevos Villas was recommended to me and what a great recommendation. The hosts, Giorgos and Anna are welcoming and friendly and happy to assist throughout your stay. We stayed in room 18 which was lovely. The rooms are basic but comfortable and come with a small kitchen area complete with kettle and basic crockery. I would suggest that breakfast and snacks are doable but not for cooking a full meal. Giorgos or one of the family is around from early morning until midnight and will happily provide coffee and a snack (Greek salad toast etc.), ice creams are also on sale as well as soft beverages and alcohol. The pool area is great, there were plenty of sun-beds and the pool was lovely. Every day a cleaner came in and changed the towels, bathroom mat, made the bed etc. Giorgos knows the local area well and can advise on things to do; he has a wealth of knowledge. Phevos Villas is a short walk (literally 5 minutes) to Perissa beach where there are loads of restaurants, with something to suit all tastes. Personally we used Scirocco and Gyros Place on several occassions as the food was great and they were not along the ocean view route. As the old adage goes, we found that at several places on the sea front you were paying for the views, as it was certainly not for the quality of the food or service (also only one place seemed to serve fresh fish, the rest was all frozen!) It is just a 5 minute walk from the bus stops where you can get air-conditioned coaches to all the major attractions across the island (some require 2 journeys, changing at Thira). The buses are regular, cheap and easy to use. Having travelled across the island we thought this was a great place to stay, less expensive than Oia, less touristy than Thira, but easy to get everywhere.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Looking to the pictures and the information in this hotel's web site I though it would be a very nice experience, specially because of the "hospitality" they mention every time in their description, but I was wrong. A kid received us when we arrived to the hotel and he just gave us the key of our room. When we asked him about maps or any information he just told us to buy one in the mini market. Also, there was no shampoo or even soap in the shower. WiFi only works at the pool. To finish, the hotel was full of cats and in our last night we couldn't sleep hearing the horrible noises of two cats procreating besides our door. I don't recommend it.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Phevos villas is a small family run business. Rooms are not the biggest,but they are clean and functional. Cleaned every day , towels changed every day.we were there in June and the room was very hot. I can imagine they would be unbearable in the height off the summer. There is aircon . I think 6euro a day. We had a room by the pool not great late at night if you had gone to bed and there were people drinking at the bar. A tad noisy.Location is good 10 min stroll to the beach. Wonderful 24 hr bakery at the bottom of the road. 5 min walk. Lots of restaurants to choose from all within walking distance.George the host makes a wonderful Greek salad . Very helpful if you need anything.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked Santorini as we had never been there before and this resort and Hotel seemed to tick all the boxes. We requested a quiet room which we we're given and had no complaints, except it was one of the smaller rooms but quite adequate. We visited at the end of August for 14 days. I have taken a while to review this hotel as when I returned two guests we met while we there had written their reviews one very positive one not so good, and they had covered most of the points, I wanted to make. So I will try and be as realistic as I can. This accommodation was in a great location 10 minutes stroll from the resort and beach, the rooms are cleaned and towels and linen replaced daily. The pool area is as good as some 5* boutique hotels I have stayed at, with plenty of good quality sun lounges and a great size pool. I have to agree with others they could make more of the bar and food offer, but George is a lovely man, but maybe not as outgoing as most Greek hotel owners. But as we ate out every night, (except for BBQ night which only happened because some guests had requested they hadn't done one the first week) and only stayed at the pool the first couple of days that so it didn't bother us to much. Although it would have been nice to have a nightcap at the bar when returning, but that wasn't the case, that is my only negative, So expect usual Greek basic rooms with toaster, kettle, TV, A/C (6 euro per night) and shower curtain, Wifi worked on our patio which was upper floor. To finish we loved our return to Greece, Santorini and the Phevos was also great. I would recommend the Phevos to anybody
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got back from Phevos Villas in Santorini just over a week ago, had a wonderful time and thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. I have never been to Greece before so wasn't sure what to expect but we were made to feel very welcome, I loved the pool (yes that was me fellow guests doing many lengths of the pool every day but I had to earn my baclavas)Our room was lovely and clean with fresh towels every day, cooking facilities weren't great but adequate and lets face it who wants to cook on holiday, George the owner made us feel very welcome, made the most amazing Greek salads and even gave us some of his home grown pomegranate seeds which were lovely. Had a wonderful relaxing time but also managed to explore the Island, visiting Fira and taking a boat trip around the island, swimming in the hot springs and watching the sun set at Oia, all very magical. Thank you Santorini and thank you George and your family for making my first visit to Greece very memorable.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from the Phevos hotel and although we enjoyed the holiday the hotel wasn't as good as we'd hoped. We'd paid just over £900 for a week there and though the pool area was clean, pool bar service good and plenty of sunbeds, the room was tiny. There literally wasn't anywhere to put our cases! The cooking facilities were poor and when you opened the cupboard door it smelt of damp. The shower was tiny and Wi-Fi is only around the pool, On the plus side, the rep visits the hotel every day, and the surroundings were quiet. Phevos is a lovely hotel to look at and location is ok. The maid was very good and our room was cleaned and we had fresh towels every day.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Greek people are known for their hospitality, love of family and embracing life with relish while remaining grounded and pragmatic. Anna and George epitomise these qualities and this is reflected in their mini "resort".They built this bite-size slice of the country themselves and fill every inch of the place with their warm, welcoming and dedicated personalities.Phevos is a fabulously quirky boutique oasis that focuses on the priorities required to enjoy this the most spectacular Greek island at your leisure. The owners deserve the overwhelmingly positive feedback they work so hard to encourage and as for the one or two detractors, by all means feel free to pay many multiples of the cost of your stay by booking infinity pool luxury in Oia next time. But please don't insult these lovely people by demanding five star luxuries when paying the extremely reasonable rates George charges for an awful lot of added value.Highlights:- very friendly which encourages a family feel- stylishly designed yet intimate accommodation- great pool and bar facilities- legendary barbeque- hugely helpful owners who will do everything to make your holiday a success- close to all amenities including the beach, restaurants, fabulous bakeries, bars and commuting points- 30 mins max from the very many attractions the island has to offer- striking setting- relaxing environmentThe epitome of Greece.Top tip - book direct and fly with Easy Jet, daily.Reserve a room by the pool for the best of all worlds.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Phevos - 6euro a night air con so 84euro in total. We booked for our honeymoon. The owner - George very friendly. Basic rooms quite small but adequate for what you use it for - getting ready and sleeping! Bed and pillows so comfortable. The shower does water the whole floor and is a very small square in the corner, the water is not very powerful. The pool is huge, sunbeds are luxurious. They take in stray dogs so they do come and go round by the pool. There are cats and dogs around that at times drink out of the pool but they don't really keep coming over to you unless you make a fuss of them; which a lot of holidaymakers were keen to do! There are a pile of books you can read/swap by the pool. Pool is open 9-20:00 daily and is so warm (weather is 30 degrees or above daily) in August. It is long with deep and shallow ends - jacuzzi jets down the shallow end. A perfect length for real swimming too. The cleaner is very good - swaps all towels and sheets everyday, mops the floor, empties your bins. The washing line was just outside the door over the trees. No balcony but plastic chairs and table outside near your front door. Some people did have a back and a front door but we only had one. It did get busy in the middle of the holiday but we managed to get a sun lounger. A lot of children/families there which considering Santorini is quite expensive to stay I can see why they stayed at Phevos - it is good value for money. Great location - only a 5 mins or 10 mins very slow walk down to the beach which has lots of restaurants to try. A shop 2 mins walk away and a larger supermarket and 24 hour bakery 10-15 mins walk away.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely Hotel/Villa, great hosts, George and Anna. The rooms were more than adequate, very clean with clean linen and towels every day. The pool was lovely, plenty of sun loungers. Just a great holiday and would go back there for sure
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I read Caroline's review whilst sat by the pool at the Phevos and started to wonder if she stayed in the same place as I was in.Then I read the last remark about Mythos being a local beer. Hmm, brewed on the mainland by a carlsberg company, available all over Greece and it's on sale in Tesco in the UK and Dan Murphy in Australia.Like many, we have visited a great many Greek Islands over the past few decades staying in studios about the same level as this one. But this accommodation exceeded all our expectations. We arrived late at night and shown our room. What a surprise!An electric kettle and a small coffee pan, a good selection of cooking utensils, two electric cooking plates, one large and one small. Also a toaster!A tea towel (changed daily), washing up liquid and scourer A good fridge with a good freezing compartment and an ice cube tray, took a couple of hours to make ice, about the same as at home.In the bathroom were two rolls of toilet paper (replenished as needed) and soap in a soap dispenser over the sink. A shower curtain as well as sink plugs for both bathroom and kitchen sinks.A bath mat changed daily and two good fluffy towels each. Also a reasonable shower attachment with a good hook to hang it from, not just it by hand.Piping hot water is available 24hours a day, not just in the afternoon.A double bed, made with sheets and bedspread neatly folded for use if you wish, this is, after all, a self catering studio, not an hotel.The towels and sheets were changed daily, every day.A wall mounted TV with working remote, and a wall safe with key provided at no extra charge. And a hairdryer!Yes my mattress was firm, but that suited us, soft mattresses give me back ache.Whilst we have seen all these items in Greek studios over the years this the first time they have all been together in this sort of price range.Outside a good size patio with table and chairs, a good washing line and good pegs.Not as private as some, but more private than many, and why would I want total privacy if I stayed here?The pool area was spacious with plenty of good sun loungers and the pool was clean. This is a credit to George as the red Sahara dust that often settles thickly overnight is hard work to get off the bottom of the pool. Much easier sweeping it off the patios!No George is not on site all the time, although he and Anna live next door. He is a full time school teacher, has a small vineyard and a smallholding as well. Life in Greece at present is very difficult, especially when tour operators are cutting their room rates to owners as well.There was invariably a family member on site all the time. Perhaps in the small office at the side?As I say this week exceeded my expectations and my only disappointment was that I did not need any of the items I carry out from home with me when going to the islands, there were all there already!The Phevos is what it is - a good holiday studio on a Greek island, not an Abu Dhabi hotel.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a weeks stay 23-30 June, room and grounds very clean, yes the rooms are basic but it has all you need, we had room 10 which was great. Pool area and bar is fantastic as is the Saturday night BBQ lots of delicious food! Used the courtesy room on day of departure which is a fantastic addition it meant we could stay by the pool all day and shower before our flight home. In a good location, quiet but still close to beach, restaurants, shop, bakery. Would recommended for a value for money holiday in perissa.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we have been to perissa, the first time to get married and this time with our 17 month old daughter. We chose phevos as the pool area is fabulous, with comfy sun lounges and a little shelf at one edge of the pool, perfect for our daughter to stand and walk along. Giorgos and anna are just wonderful hosts, and brilliant with our daughter. They are not over baring like some however approachable. The rooms are basic but very clean, typically Greek and for vale you can not complain. We had room number 2 which has an enclosed ground floor balcony, again prefect for our daughter.One little warning is there are animals about and if you have a real dislike of animals it wouldn't be for you. I would like to add the animals are very friendly and not overbearing though. Enjoyed so much already booked for next year!!!
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yea the villas are basic but you are on holiday in Santorini, you aren't planning on cooking 4 course meals yourself. The rooms are clean, you have everything you need and the beach is literally 5 mins walk away. As the villas aren't in the centre of the resort they are very quiet and relaxed. The bar serves Mythos and home made wine ( highly recommended) plus all the usual concoctions any Brit holiday maker could want. The menu is limited but everything is tasty. Perissa itself is lovely, lots of very good restaurant on the front. Our favourite was the Acropolis, the lamb was to die for! Would definately stay here again
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Phevos is as you should expect from a Greek self catering studio complex - basic, comfortable but minimalistic. Room 16 is one of the runts of the 18 litter. It has no balcony of its own as most of the others and is a little out on a limb with only morning sunlight. The self catering facilities are very limited but who cooks? The maid service is excellent with clean sheets and towels daily.The pool and pool area are very attractive and well maintained with the obligatory bar ( not always manned). Mine hostess generally more obliging than mine host. Most Greeks are usually more customer oriented.All in all just about what I expected for the bargain price.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a week at Phevos, our regret is that we didn't book for two weeks. We had no idea what to expect prior to our arrival and had read many of the reviews before booking.Holidays and their experiences are entirely subjective. My comments relate therefore only to my and my wife's experience. I can appreciate that Phevos is a little like marmite you'll either love it or hate it depending on what you expect. We loved it. If you require a 4 or 5 star hotel don't bother as you'll be disappointed but if you are happy with basic accommodation with all that you are likely to need for basic self catering then you will not be disappointed.Rooms are basic but very clean. Whoever does the DIY reminds me of my lack of skills in this area, nothing is really square but this for me added to the charm. Rooms are cleaned floors washed daily with a change of towels tea towels and sheets. Considering the price we paid there was nothing that we lacked except perhaps for a blanket on our first night which was quite chilly.You are given the key to the room and left to your devices but this is not a problem we are after all adults, if there are any issues then Georgios and Anna are always available..There is a table and chairs outside of each room for Al fresco for breakfast and plenty of room round the pool and bar area.Anna looks after a number of dogs whom I suspect are strays but these are no problem at all (no more than 3/4 at any one time). They do not bother you and are very docile and are happy for you to stroke them should you wish. If you don't like dogs this may not be a place for you.We found that we were only in our room for sleeping spending most time out and about round the island or round the pool/bar.Georgios and Anna are very approachable but do not intrude upon guests unless you engage them in conversation. We found them, to be very approachable and friendly. Georgios makes his own wine which is well worth tasting. Georgios and Anna also do a weekly barbecue (if sufficient people are interested) which we found to be superb with Annna preparing local salads and side dishes.Phevos is well situated for Perissa only 5 minutes from the beach and less to the bakery. Perissa has all that you require re day to day supplies, although dining out is so reasonable that we only ate in once. There is a lovely walk (uphill) of about an hour to ancient Thira. The site is well worth a visit.Buses run reasonably regularly from Perissa to Fira and from Fira which acts as a hub to most other places on this most beautiful island.All in all we loved the place, yes you can see areas that could be improved but as a clean relaxing but basic venue We honestly could not complain. Still you can always always pay twice as much if not more for that 4 or 5 star experience. We will be booking again but next time for 2 weeks.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accommodation - Rooms - Studios (2) consists of small kitchenette, sleeping area, bathroom and balcony or terrace. The rooms contain tv, hairdryer, dressing table with mirror (not full length), Small coffee table. Wardrobe with two drawers and internal shelf. Dressing table also has drawers.safe box with key, bedside tables and lamps, french doors to balcony or terrace and door shutters to block out all light. The kitchenette contains kettle, toaster, two plug in electric hobs (one is very small for a coffee pot and the other is large enough for a pan) Fridge with ice compartment, sink, and inside the cupboards you will find large lidded pot or saucepan, frying pan, collander, utensils, bread knife, cutlery inc. Bottle opener/corkscrew, chopping board, mugs, cups and saucers, two soda glasses (No wine glasses), pasta bowls, dinner plates, side plates. They do also provide washing up liquid, handsoap and tea towels and washing up sponges. The rooms do come with an air conditioning unit however it comes at a charge of 6 euros per night. Studio for three is exactly same but has 3 beds and if only two of you in there it makes ideal day sofa.Facilities - pool side bar/snack bar serving a limited menu of snacks; greek salad, cheese and ham toastie or omelette. Usually open all day until sometime between 11pm-12 midnight. There are plenty of chairs and tables. There of course is a pool which is fairly large and 2.5 metres deep at deep end. It is unheated (freezing) however . Location - Phevos Villas are in a very good location. Approx 500 metres to the beach and about 100 metres to the nearest convenience store. It is also ideally located for Ancient Thira, the pathway to which is literally about 100 metres further up from the accommodation. This accommodation is close enough to the town for access but away from it enough to have peace and quiet. There are supermarkets and a 24 hour bakery within 5 - 10 minutes walk, however I thoroughly recommend a second 24 bakery located further away called 'Santa Irini' Bakery located about 20 - 25 minutes walk along the 'Main Road', which also happens to be next to a big supermarket named 'Coops'. There is a much greater selection in these stores.Staff - Owned and run by a husband and wife team of whom are very picky and choosy who they are nice to. We found them to be unwilling, unhelpful, miserable and unprofessional. Never seen such unwelcoming and unhappy looking people.Food - pool side bar/snack bar serving a limited menu of snacks; greek salad, cheese and ham toastie or omelette.This accommodation does look very pretty from the outside but inside is not so good…here are a few negatives.Negatives - The Phevos Villas does not have a reception area. On arrival we stood around by the entrance until out name was called by the owner, George. There was no 'Welcome' or 'Hello'. Just a stern calling out of our surnames, then one by one we were lead to our room and keys shoved into our hand and that was it. If you had issues during the week you literally had to search the area for George, although some of the time you will find him sat at the bar watching his guests around the pool…slightly uncomfortable. Generally there appears to be an avoidance of maintenance issues. You will see when you arrive. The rooms are poorly maintained such as loose light fittings, loose wiring, dangerous appliances (i.e. kettles that heat the handle up as they go), sharp nails sticking out of the floor ready to impale your foot, broken fixtures and fittings etc etc. Also a note regarding housekeeping. Be prepared to make your own beds every day and hang up your own towels and put down your own bathmats. The housekeeper on a daily basis will strip your beds and then dump sheets and towels on your unmade bed and then leave you to do the rest! I have stayed in some dodgy accommodation before but have never experienced this before. Patio furniture wasn't cleaned prior to our arrival so we had to clean it before sitting down as it was covered in about a cm of grime and dirt.Very important note regarding the rooms - the walls and ceilings are PAPER THIN. You can literally hear absolutely everything in the room above or next door. SO if you like any peace and quiet avoid this hotel at all costs. All the rooms are pretty much the same. I did discover however that room number 10 doesn't have any upstairs neighbours and has a private balcony so is a good one for 'some' peace and quiet.On the subject of balconies and terraces - each rooms has their own outdoor patio chairs and table. HOWEVER, the layout is a weird one. The windows of other peoples rooms open out onto other peoples terrace or balcony. So you never really have complete privacy as you always have someones window opening out into your space. In one particular room there was a terrace that no fewer than four other rooms windows opened out onto - can you imagine the noise? Regarding the beds - WARNING - They are like CONCRETE SLABS. They were so bad I considered buying a lilo to sleep on so I didn't wake up in desperate pain each day. The beds were so hard I woke up with bruises all over my body pretty much every day. So if you do decide to stay here - bring your own bed!!Tips - This accommodation is a very basic accommodation and is a good location and provides basic needs but if you want accommodation with any standards then choose an alternative.The walk to Ancient Thira is worth the effort for the views from the top. But do wear decent walking shoes. It is very rocky/loose terrain. Also try one of the local beers 'Mythos'.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were initaly put in room 12, small for two people. Complained and were moved to room 13 and from what we saw was probably the best room. Animal lovers, lots of dogs visited but wern't a problem. Nice pool, reasonable price for beer water and cheese & ham toasties ! Best maid service ever, thankyou. Get George to give you a pay rise !! Thanks George, Anna & Jacob.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say about George and Anna they are FABULOUS. The apartments are so clean well equipped and looked after. The pool is George's joy superb- such lovely hospitality nothing is too much trouble. U must try George's wine and sun dried tomatoes and Anna s cooking is a joy. See u on 23 June next year ❤️❤️
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Phevos for 2 weeks (August 2014) with Thompson!Georgio & Anna were very friendly, with heaps of assistance for trips, taxis and did a superb line in Greek Salad, not to mention the sumptuous barbecue on a Saturday evening.We had 8 in our group 5 adults and three youngsters, who staying the excellent pool for as long as they possibly could... Daily.The rooms were basic and clean, with minimal catering facilities, but a very useful fridge. The hair dryer was good, but we did not try the air con (for which there is a daily charge) there is maid service daily and of a good quality. However the one drag was the place looked dated, it needs a bit of a makeover, which hopefully will happen when the current Thompson contract expires.If we decide to go back to Santorini, Phevos will be at the top of the list to revisit
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying in Phevos Villa early July and couldn't recommend it more as a base to explore a beautiful island. Staying as a group of four 21 year old girls we wanted a relaxing holiday on a picturesque Greek island after finishing University, Phevos Villa provided a basic yet very clean and welcoming style. Rooms were spotlessly cleaned everyday of our stay (towels also changed daily). Although hiring a car, therefore not always staying within the hotel area in the daytime, we found the pool area to be relaxing and clean, with the occasional visit from the hotel's furry friends. We didn't particularly mingle with the owners however we found George to be very helpful if needed.Perissa is a lovely beach location with a variety of restaurants and bars. I strongly recommend visiting the wonderful towns of Thira and Oia, Oia being a personal favourite for the views of Santorini's famous sunsets!
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only good thing is that it is 10 minutes walking from the beach of Perissa.After that:- It is mainly a hotel that host tour operator groups. It is not very appealing.- They asked to pay the room the day before that we were leaving.- The room was not very clean. - There was not curtain in the shower so this was terrible. - There was a dog around the swimming pool area, lying down on the hammocks and drinking from the swimming pool.- The tap water in this area is awful.I will not stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Phevos for 2 weeks in July. I don't usually submit reviews but feel that I have to complement Phevos.The rooms are "typically Greek" The service is amazing-rooms cleaned and fresh bedding and towells every day(including Sunday). George the owner runs the bar with help of his son(Jacob you make a brilliant omelette!) and is always happy to help with any problems. We were invited to join the Family's meal on the last evening which was lovely. Thank you so much George Anna and Jacob.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely recommend Phevos Villa! The rooms are small but clean and they are cleaned daily with fresh towels and sheets. Our room had a safe, hair dryer, fridge, and kitchen utensils. there was also a small table right outside in a little personal courtyard which was excellent for eating dinner in the evening. The pool area is lovely and relaxing and the bar is reasonably priced. George and Anna take good care of you! Definitely try one of George's poolside barbecues as they are excellent!It's only a short walk to the beach, shops, restaurants and bus stop and has a small shop and a lovely bakery right near the hotel.There is also a lovely poolside view of the mountain where you can climb, drive or take a donkey ride to visit the ruins of Ancient Thera. If we ever go back to Santorini we will be staying here again!
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Phevos villas are a superb location...george and anna are always helpful and the maid service is the best i have ever had in the 15 plus years i have been going to the greek islands...perissa has lovely front with excellent chill out bars and restuaraunts.something for everyone highly recommend cyclades at the bottom of the hill excellent food and great staff also gods kitchen....ignore the negative reviews about the phevos they are uncalled and unwarranted comments you book your holiday here trust me you not be disappointed it will leave you wanting to return....just returned from two fantastic weeks in july so go people book for next year and enjoy.Thomas and sharon..birmingham
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Phevos Villas June/July for two weeks. Recent reviews are pretty accurate - the good ones anyway. We also found the rooms very clean if a little compact. This was a return visit to Santorini after 7 years and it hasn't changed at all. The hotel has a lovely pool but there is a short walk (about 10 mins) to the beach where most sunbeds are free if you use their attached taverna. Rob walked up the hill most mornings but I only climbed to Ancient Thira ruins after hiring a car (the road takes you so far up on the Kamari side). Go up the hill to the ruins or church etc. in the morning when the church is still in the shade and take plenty of water and a hat - you can always hitch a ride on a pony! Beware that it gets quite breezy and so disguises the sun's power. We hire a car from Stavros for £25 a day. Hope to return one day. Thanks George and your lovely family :)
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 weeks here in June it was our first time in santorini and booked through thomson but this was a great choice the rooms were more than adequate by Greek standards and extremely clean they were a pleasure to stay in, the pool area was perfect and well used by all guests, the phevos is in a nice area of perissa with only a 5 min walk to the beach and 2 mins from the local supermarket for all essentials, George was a very good host and did everything to make our stay enjoyable I cannot praise it enough and will go back to parissa and phevos
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two weeks, it was pure relaxation. Very quiet at night. George and Anna were very hospitable, great bbq nights. I would recommend this accommodation if you are looking for clean and basic appartments and are not expecting five stars. We would definitely return, the walks are very good too, up the mountain and down the other side to Kamari. Thank you for your hospitality we had a fantastic time.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice quiet location, 10 min's to Perissa front where there are plenty of restaurants & bars.Rooms are very basic & only one electric ring and just a few item of crockery, but they are kept spotlessly clean by the hardest working chambermaid we have encountered.The appartments are all different in that some have a very nice terrace / balcony area, sadly we drew the short straw, room 16 having no real outside space so if you had wanted to cook you really had no where to eat other than a table & chairs on the walkway.The pool area is very nice with plenty of sunbeds along with a lovely view of the mountain.The local bakery is fabulous & there is a co-op supermarket 20min's walk away.Local buses are a good way to get around & are both reliable & good value, you can see all of the major attractions by using them.Parts of Perissa are a little run down but then again many Greek islands have areas that are, Perissa certainly has a very relaxed feel & at no time did you feel threatened or un safe.Would we stay at Phevos again ?, yes but not in room 16 !!.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reading other reviews we agree that the accommodation is a bit basic, but everything you need is there and it is very clean. The pool area is lovely, and again very clean. Each room has its own outside area, ideal for breakfast. Someone mentioned the size of the sheets, and as a restless sleeper I'd have preferred larger sheets.We didn't find Perissa "run down" at all, handy to get buses to Fira, Akatori, and trips to Oia, and the boat trip on the Caldera was lovely. Had some lovely meals in the restaurants of Perissa.We lost a key to a case, and Giorgos was very helpful .We loved Santorini, lovely scenery, lovely sunsets.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time staying here at Phevos over 5 years and 9th time visiting Santorini. Phevos is great, great location especially, brilliant views of the mountain. George and Anna are very frendly, the accomodation is typically Greek i.e. basic but in my opinion I go on holiday to explore not to sit in my room however, it has to be clean! Phevos is most certainly clean. Highly recommend these apartments and have done numerous times.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in these apartments for 3 days with some friends. The location is good, 5-10 minutes to the beach. The apartment has a room with a basic kitchen in the same space and a small bathroom. The common areas were well maintained. There was a bar where you could eat, although the menu was very simple. I recommend trying the Greek salad made with tomatoes from the owner’s garden. The owners helped us a lot with tourist information and recommendations of places to visit and guided excursions, and they also managed our transfer from/to the port. We felt that it was a family hotel, but it’s the perfect place to relax and move around the island.If I come back to Santorini I will be staying at Phevos for sure!
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit late entering our review as we stayed in July Found George and Anna great hosts with lovely apartments very clean ,Maria cleaned every day we will be staying again in the future , don't believe the bad reviews about George people only get back what they put out my wife cant wait to try Anna's lamb again if you holiday in Perissa stay at Phevos villas you wont regret it
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've read quite a few reviews which wax lyrical about how friendly George is however all I can say is that his happy pills must have run out by the end of the season as we found him a real misery.Admittedly a faulty lock resulted in being locked in the room the first morning which required the attendance of a locksmith (complete with hammer) but all Georgie boy did was huff and puff and complain about the price of electricity from that point on.Anyway on the positive side # the rooms are basic but very clean (cleaned every day by the brilliant maid).# the pool area and pool are small but comfortable and clean.# the location is ideal for the beach and restaurants.Regarding the resort and island# the island definitely has the wow factor regarding dramatic views.# there are plenty of good bars and restaurants.# the food is fabulous.# the locals are absolutely fantastic (except Georgie boy obviously).Will we go back - to Santorini definitely - to Phevos villas (not unless George starts taking the happy pills) - by the way George if you read this unfortunately we all need to pay tax mate - get on with it!!
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Phevos 3rd to 17th September,as said before there was problems with the wedding party but we had a lovely time George and his wife are so friendly we loved it thereplease disregard bad review after all Trip adviser had Perissa voted the 5th best island in the world.We will be going back it is a volcanic island so in September after a hot summer not so much flora and fauna but some of the views are stunning.
hotelName:
27    Phevos Villa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the 3rd time we have stayed at Prekas and we love this place so much we decided to get married on the island and we put 15 of our guests into there rooms.Mr Prekas was most helpful in organising what I wanted and I'm most thankful to him for his time with organising the rooms for us.As usual it was perfect and everyone had a great time!For money and location you simply won't bear it the views are to die for and All I can is read my previous reviews the place is fantastic value.Trust me try it.Thank you Prekas for a great time.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in May (2019) and I had the most relaxing experience. Receptionists are very accomodating. Nektarios was very helpful.It's a traditional Greek house turned apartment. The ceiling in our apartment is a bit low, so not convenient for my husband who is 1.86 cm tall :). The swimming pool has a great view overlooking the caldera but pitty the water was still cold.The location is perfect and the apartment balcony has a perfect sunset view, better than Oia which is too crowded. There is a bus stop few meters from the hotel that goes to Oia.There is also a supermarket closeby.Overall, we enjoyed our stay and I can highly recommend this apartment.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments are perched on a hill on the main little street in Imerovigli, very close to restaurants, a market, with gorgeous views from the balconies and streets. The staff are most helpful and friendly, and knowledgeable. We stayed in the family apartment, 4 of us, which was spacious and comfortable, with 2 large bedrooms and ample room in the rooms, as well as a large patio area with tables and chairs, with the gorgeous view of the Aegean. My only two issues: The bathroom shower is very small, with no curtain, so gets pretty wet in there. And the one bedroom has a case of shelves, but would have liked to have a few hooks on the walls to hang things up, but the walls are the whitewashed plaster, so maybe that is not possible. The breakfast is more than enough, egg, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee, tea, big baked goods basket. Can walk to Fira from here, or get the public bus. Would stay again!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet, Unobstructed View. Clean Rooms. some rooms are private balcony. some are shared balcony. Prompt response to our queries before travel. Would go there again. Let us do early check in. over all great experience
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment for 2 friends travelling was absolutely superb! Quite a few steps but a porter carried our luggage both ways. An airport transfer was also organised by the apartment. It was private and yet close to the walking path and only 20 minutes to Fira. No need to go to Oia to see the sunset, a beautiful one was had on our balcony. High recommendation for this place - well worth the extra money to stay overlooking the caldera if you can afford it. Quiet and yet, good restaurants close by. 10/10
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best price for a stay on the caldera!. Big balcony with stunning views of the sea and island, Traditional type apartment room with extra bed, pillows and blankets. The apartment is spacious and has everything you need for preparing food, drink and snacks. Quiet lcoation is a definite plus. One thing that was a minor detail, is that I felt that the bathroom needed a little bit of updating. Everything in the bathroom is there and is functional, such as good hot water, workable taps etc. That is just my opinion. My husband said that the bathroom is fine. Of course he is a man and I'm a woman and like certain things to be a certain way. Overall, the hotel has friendly staff and good customer service and is close by to local restuarants, cafe and mini market. I would highly recommend Prekas Apartments for a pleasant stay in Imerovigli.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable apartments, friendly staff and the best views on the island: our fifth stay at Prekas (first was nearly 20 years ago) and the view over the caldera is as beautiful as ever. The apartments have the views, while being away from the noise of Thira. They are on the walking track from Thira to Oia, so either direction (or out into the Skaros headland) is a nice, if hot, walk - and makes cooking off in the pool afterwards all the better. Room is comfortable, with full kitchen, do good if you want to self cater or just get takeaway meals from one of the local restaurants to enjoy on your deck.Looking forward to our next visit, for whenever we can next find time to get to Santorini
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 5 (including three adult children ages 22, 21, 18) had the most wonderful time at the Prekas Apartment. The location is perfect--since it's a little bit away from the main towns, it's quieter and not as densely populated, but also easily walkable to Imerovigli and Fira. We loved getting croissants, cheese, and fruit from the little convenience store in town for breakfast and eating on our private terrace, taking in the view. We were lucky enough to have an apartment right on one of the pools, so it felt like our own private pool--without the price! However, what really set Prekas was the service of the staff, especially Svetlana. Svetlana gave us dinning recommendations, making the reservations for us, often getting us a discount. That would've been enough, but she did even more. 24 hours before our arrival, we decided to renew our vows for our 25th wedding anniversary. Svetlana got us in contact with a wedding planner and helped decorate our terrace for the small ceremony, taking pictures of us throughout. It was an incredibly special moment that wouldn't have been possible without Svetlana's care. We can't wait to come back in the future!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Passing by santorini for 2 days, I have je chance to stay in this wonderful place.Great. Welcome by the staff who explained everything about the hotel.My room was perfect , with a jacuzzi, confortable bed, etc The private terrace is such a beautiful place to enjoy the sunsetI will do everything to be back soon
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has the best view in Santorini (one of the bests I've ever seen in my life). You can have breakfast (best greek yogurt and greek coffee) looking to the caldera and all the traditional greek houses in the mountain. The hotel staff were very kind and friendly, the hotel adminsitrator told us about the transportation, points of interest, beaches and some of the best restaurants in the island. He also help us book a catamaran tour. The pool is small but has an amazing view to the caldera as well. There are plenty of stairs but it's OK if you like to walk. The only weak spot was the room we booked, it was fine and confortable but could be renewed, the bathroom was kind of small. However we had such a great experience in our stay I would recommend this hotel 100%
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a magical place to stay. We stayed in the Captain’s Suite, right at the top of the apartments. We had two terraces, one of which was for our exclusive use. The views are amazing and the sunsets are spectacular. It’s a quieter place to stay, but not too far from Oia and Fira. It’s a bit of a walk from the drop-off point, but someone will be waiting for you to bring your bags down to the apartments and there will be someone to take your bags back up at the end of your stay. The staff were all very helpful and obliging. The pool is set at the bottom of the apartments so it’s a bit of a climb back up if you’re not fit!! Breakfast can be ordered or there is a mini mart not too far away where you can purchase your own items if preferred. There is also a very good restaurant near the drop-off area. If you want an up-market restaurant within walking distance, I suggest you check out the Throubi Restaurant. All in all, it was definitely a holiday to remember.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here again for the 2nd time and cannot fault it for the cost. The amazing views from all balconies are some of the best in the island and that saves fighting the cross at sunset in Oia. The staff are helpful, the rooms are basic but spotless and the self contained nature of the rooms means you can enjoy take away with wine, or cook up your own breakfast. They even have a coffee percolator.The pool is small but clean and private from passing traffic. It but must be one of the closest pools to the water and seems to almost hover over the cliff.We loved our early morning 8km walk along the spine of the island to Oia. Took the bus back as Imerovigli is well serviced by bus as well as mini marts and restaurants.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bottom line up front: Absolutely amazing experience. Wouldn't recommend anywhere else.-Hospitality: All of their staff were super friendly and helpful throughout our stay, but perhaps the best example I can give is this. We checked out of our room at noon on the day of our departure flight, but the flight wasn't until midnight. We spent some time in the nearby towns and shops, but there was only so much we could do and had spent all of our money since we were leaving. When we went back to re-confirm our airport shuttle, they also saw we were wiped out and without hesitation gave us water, watched our luggage, and allowed us to sit in the shade for hours for our shuttle even though we'd already checked out.-View, location, etc: Fantastic view of both the caldera and evening sunsets. At the edge of Imerovigli, so it is nice and secluded, yet not out of the reach by any means. We stayed at the superior studio room and loved it, but all of their rooms had great views and balconies.-Catch/Cons: The following two "cons" are simply my own estimations as to why this impeccable gem was within a price I could afford.1. You must throw away toilet paper instead of flushing it (old sewage system). This issue is true all over Santorini, but the high-end hotels pump their sewage periodically so that their patrons don't have to make this small adjustment.2. The shower was small, but unless you're 7' tall or weigh 300 lbs you'll be fine. Plus, there's the pool they chlorinate daily.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The white-washed Prekas apartments, like the lava that formed the walls of the Caldera, flows down the hill suspended above the glittering blue waters below providing panoramic views of the caldera and surrounding islands. The staff are magnificent, friendly, helpful and informative. My wife’s luggage did not arrive on her flight and owner Nektarios and his manager Lefteris were on to it for us calling the airport and reassuring us that the bag would turn up soon – and 24 h later it did. It’s the little things like this and such as the complimentary glasses of cold wine we were provided on arrival and during our stay that make for a wonderful and memorable travel experience. The location of the apartments in Imerovigli is perfect being about 2 km from Fira and situated on the walk that circumscribes the Caldera from Fira to Oia. This location is far enough away from the overrun tourist towns of Fira and Oia such that it is peaceful and quiet. We spent our 4 nights in a standard apartment which was quite basic but comfortable, quiet and clean and had a spectacular view of the Caldera and the magnificent sunset! We were very happy with our 4 days at the Prekas apartments, the price was reasonable when compared with other similar establishments and we would certainly go back should we find ourselves fortunate enough to visit Santorini in the future.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful views, clean, friendly staff and breakfast was good and plenty! For a 7 day stay or longer the downside not enough storage, lack of Sunbeds. Suggestion would be to have reclining chairs as patio furniture!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing view ,perfect location (Between Fira and Oia) .Sun set view is amazing.Owner of Prekas apartment MR.Nektar is really helpful .I was travelling from Rome to Santorini ,just texted him for arranging a Taxi from Airport and he promptly replied and made the arrangements .Receptionist Svetlana is really helpful and knowledge .Svetlana suggested some good restaurants along with other information.Room was ok with well equipped Kitchen however there is a room for improvement .Room charge is bit on higher side however I have no regrets as My over all experience was satisfactory .
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The amount of money that I paid for a room in Prekas Apartments was absolutely overpriced for our room/the accommodation. We came from Mykonos before visiting Santorini where we paid half of the price with a much nicer room/modern accommodations, free airport transfers, free breakfast and staff available until midnight. there were ants crawling all over the floor (if you looked down quickly you could spot 6/7 at one moment.) there were dead/live roaches on the walls/floor. The extra comforter provided was stained. The shower curtain had brown stains. The shower itself was worse than showers I’ve used in hostels. I would not stay here agan nor would I recommend it. Prekas also denied me any sort of refund for the unsatisfactory stay.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay here at Prekas apartments. Appreciated the welcome drink, and a very friendly and helpful reception from Nico who told us lots about the island. Andreas carried our bags down the many steps and also showed us where to park which was great.The view from all the rooms is amazing, we had the superior studio which is right over the pool which was very quiet and felt like our own most of the time! Beautiful views over the caldera, short walk to restaurants, and 25 mins into Fira. Right on the coastal path so perfect location. On leaving we realised our car had a flat battery, Nico made some calls and within 5 minutes his friend arrived with a charger and we were off to the airport on time. Amazing service! Thank you so much. Would recommend, and hope to return!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel or about the concierge Niko. As everyone else has said, the views are second to none. We could barely bring ourselves to leave our room while we were there because the views from our terrace were so breathtaking. In addition, the setting was so peaceful - very quiet and private. And Niko went above and beyond in helping us arrange everything we needed for our romantic holiday - he gave us wonderful recommendations for activities, made dinner reservations for us, helped our coordinate airport transport, etc. We cannot wait to plan our next visit - this was one of my favorite places in the world!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We returned to Prekas after staying here in June 2016 this time we visited in September a lovely time of the year to visit Santorini.Our stay this time was 3 nights and we enjoyed just as much as our previous visit the views will blow you away and the value for money cannot be beaten.We did the hike into Oia took around 3 hours lots of stopping for pics and water but a must do if you have the time.We will return again one day as I truly don't think you can ever get bored with the views from Prekas.Can't recommend this place enougth just book it and see!.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the captain's suite in these apartments and really enjoyed it; the views are spectacular and the rooms are basic (apart from the superb bathroom with spa bath) yet classy and comfortable. The receptionist was really nice and offered us a lot of help, while we also were given a bottle of wine upon our arrival. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Impossible to speak highly enough about these apartments, the staff and the owner. Communication with Mr Prekas was exceptional from the outset. A very kind and thoughtful man. All the staff, from Niko in reception, Andreas and Maria were wonderful. We stayed in The Captain's Suite which surely has one of the best views on the island. Breakfast on the balcony was the best we found and certainly the best value. Sadly we had to leave early for a family emergency. Rarely have I found hotel staff, or owners, more considerate or understanding and we are immensely grateful to them.
