We will return t this beautiful island to complete our holiday and will definitely stay at Prekas again.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough good things about the Prekas apartments!They really have you a feeling that they genuinely liked having you stay there. Nico at the front desk was best concierge I've ever met. He was enthusiastic and professional. He gave us great recommendations for lunch and dinner and treated us like V.I.P.'s.The apartments are pretty nice except for the shower. It wasn't top notch. Other than that everything is great.The view is just gorgeous. I think it would be tough to find better.The pool area doesn't have a lot of seating but it's clean and modern.The hotel venue itself is very clean. You can see Andreas is working very hard to keep it that way.The maid service was spot on and she brought us out breakfast twice.Speaking of breakfast, it was pretty good. I wasn't a huge fan of the OJ but the yogurt was good quality. There wasn't anything they served that was too processed.Overall, the Prekas apartments exemplified the meaning of hospitality. It's a great value and views are incredible!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just spent a week at Prekas Apartments and it has been lovely. I'd chosen to book because of the excellent reviews and they are all absolutely correct! We had room 6 which is one of the smaller rooms, but it had a glorious view over the caldera and we spent many evenings snacking on cheese and wine on our shared balcony. The pool area is good - the pool itself is lovely and deep, and really refreshing in the summer heat. It can get a little crowded but only because some other guests insist on claiming the sunbeds with the best view early in the morning and then not using them for hours! However this is not a flaw of the hotel themselves who were warm and welcoming from the outset, and we still always managed to get a space by the pool, spending many lazy afternoons there.the hotel also provide pool/beach towels which was great and a real help.Before arrival I was emailing Chryssa on reception (who we understand has now left) about dinner options in Imerovigli for a special birthday meal for my boyfriend and her recommendation of Mezzo was perfect; we had an incredible meal with a perfect view - one to remember! Staff were similarly helpful when we asked them to make us dinner reservations at Anogi, as well booking us airport transfers. A huge thank you to Andreas for meeting us on arrival at the top of the hill & carrying our bags up and down the stairs -wonderful service exemplified again.Despite being self catered apartments, the maid service everyday was great, especially when she washed up our plates! We can't thank her enough for this as those tiny things made our holiday so much more enjoyable. A couple of things to be aware of:1) you will need to provide your own water - the tap water we understand isn't suitable for drinking. There are lots of supermarkets and a little mini supermarket just up the hill from Prekas and it's about 1 Euro for a large bottle.2) brings your own toiletries; they provide some soap but that is all.All in all, we loved our stay here and hope to come back someday... fantastic value for money with a view that is shared by many of the more expensive hotels nearby.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived til checkout our stay at Prekas apartments was exceptional. We were assisted with our luggage down the stairs and welcomed with complimentary drinks. Our room was clean and comfortable with a kitchenette for cooking which was very handy. We had a shared balcony that had the most incredible view of the ocean and the beautiful sunrise and sunset. The pool was medium sized and hangs off the edge of the caldera! The lady at reception was so kind and welcoming, she recommended great restaurants to eat at which are so close to the hotel and helped us numerous times with bus routes from the nearby bus stops. I cannot recommend this place enough: great value for money and fantastic amenities and service!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When researching hotels on Santorini, it became apparent that a "caldera view" hotel (hotel on the side of the rim of an old volcano) was desirable in that it allowed the spectacular views to be appreciated most conveniently. As a result, "caldera view" were priced at a premium. After having stayed in a caldera view hotel (Prekas) I can say that the convenient view is very nice and worth it if you can afford it, but that there are so many opportunities to enjoy the caldera view away from the hotel that you could still enjoy the full Santorini caldera experience without being in a caldera view hotel. So dont feel like you are missing anything if you choose a less expensive option.We booked almost a year out. Prekas was on the lower price end of caldera view hotels, but it was still over $250 per night. It seemed to strike a balance between the lowest cost possible and an authentic Greek looking caldera view hotel that met the minimum comfort standards. We started a disadvantage because we were looking for a family room for 4, but Prekas did have a large room/suite that fit 4 very comfortably. The room was large and had two private rooms within it, which was great. It also had a kitchenette with a stove and refrigerator in it, which were nice to have. Overall, the room was very spacious.The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Chrissie, behind the front desk, was very helpful and nice. The guy who helped with the luggage was also very helpful. And you will definitely need his help. The hotel rooms are spread up and down the side of a steep hill, and the only vehicle access is from a parking lot that is well above the hotel. there is a "long way" to the hotel which involves a more gradually sloping walkway with some steps in it. Getting luggage up this will still require some serious lifting and struggle. There is also the "short cut" which involves going around a locked gate and down a long flight of steep stairs (some with big gaps in them) with a little bare mountain path thrown in (all unlit at night). If you have problems with stairs, this is not for you. Dont even think about carrying your luggage on the short cut. Some of the rooms require using even more steep staircases. There is a guy who will transport all of your luggage at the hotel though, so all you have to do is walk. The hotel itself is in the beautiful, whitewashed Greek style and blends in with the adjoining buildings and is very picturesque. The views are spectacular and equal to any on the island, with a clear view of the sunset. The Imerovigli location is fine and seemed better to me than the Fira location because it was much more quiet and peaceful, but other people may prefer the convenience and activity of Fira. There were plenty of dining options available in the area (Prekas does not have a restaurant), although generally they were not as convenient as what Fira can offer. The closest options would be near the parking lot (where a convenience store is also located), and more options are available in the nearby town (where there are also bigger supermarkets), which is in fairly easy walking distance, although it is an uphill walk going there. The hotel has a small pool. One thing that was not clear from the website concerns the views. Our room was directly above the reception area. It is in the website photos, and shows two separate bedrooms withing the main room, although I cant remember the number. In our area, there were about three rooms clustered around one caldera/sunset viewing area, which made things a little awkward. There was no clear delineation as to which room had which viewing area, so there was the potential for conflicts between rooms over the best viewing area. We never had any conflicts and were able to use the best area, but it was definitely not in complete privacy from our neighbors. I understand that some rooms may have private viewing areas.On the negative side, the room was uncomfortably damp and humid inside it (apparently due to the cave-like construction), although it did have an air conditioner and a couple of humidity reduction devices in the room. This was not unbearable and the room did not seem moldy, but if you are sensitive to this, you should know. No one in our party complained about it. Another negative was the bathroom. It was tiny and the shower did not have any shower curtain and was extremely small and cramped. By the time you showered the whole room was wet. Toilet paper could not be flushed in the toilet, as is apparently true in most of Greece.Overall, I would give the room and hotel a good/better than average rating, largely based on the big space and the great view, although you should remember that for Santorini, this may be considered to be more of a budget hotel. It is a true caldera view hotel, and if that is your top priority, then this will fit the bill at one of the better prices, although it may not have all of the comforts that you would expect for an equally priced hotel that was not on the caldera. I would return.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a very great place to stay! Imerovigli is between Fira and Oia and is a much lest congested area so it is more peaceful! This hotel/apartment complex literally hangs off the side of the caldera! Each room has a little terrace area with a table and two chairs to sit and enjoy the sunset! It has a little kitchenette and free wifi as well! Not much in the way of toiletries, so take your own, but the VIEW makes this SO worth it! The taxi or shuttle bus will drop you off at the parking area and you will take the stone path down and then dogleg back down again to reach it, so be prepared for a little bit of a hike! There are some shortcut stairs to the left of the path, but they are pretty treacherous, so I would advise only going up them and only in daylight!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great view! Super clean and beautiful apartment! Best attention ever! Great pool!! Love everything about this place!!!! Hermosos departamentos!!! La vista es perfecta! La piscina fantástica! Súper limpio!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Astonishing Caldera view! Our family had a wonderful stay in Prekas Apartments! The owner and the stuff are very polite, gifted with "Greek hospitality"The price/value ratio can not be beaten by nearby hotels & resorts. Thank you, hope to see you again soon!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Must stay! the view from these apartments is breath taking! and the staff so amazing and hospitable. our apartment was extremely spacious including a full kitchen and computer. Breakfast is a must!. The pool is a little small, but that was not an issue as we were exploring the gorgeous island that is Santorini. I would also recommend hiring a car/bike as it is a bit of a hike into town which includes a lot of stairs.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is AMAZING. I could stare outside all day...great spot to watch the sunset. The staff were super helpful and friendly. The apartment was beautiful, authentic and clean. There is absolutely no complaints with this place. I would go back in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments are built into the side of the mountain. They are adequate apartments, spacious, small kitchen area, dining table, sofa, bathroom with shower, all in order, but the balcony gets it for interest. There you can sit and eat either what you make yourself, what you bring in with you or breakfast which you can order and it will be brought to your table. There you can enjoy the amazing clear view in the morning, the warm summer sun of the afternoon or the amazing beautiful sunset of the evening. The staff are amazingly helpful, and know all about the island. They become your friends in just a few days! Rooms are cleaned completely every day and you are very well cared for. The way to the hotel is a little walk and some stairs, but the staff carry your luggage and really it is not so bad and well worth it when you arrive.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place overlooking the famous caldera and a super friendly staff. We got upgraded to captain suite with a jacuzzi and our stay was marvelous. The studio room is too small and fits more to singles than doubles but it still has the same terrace with a great view.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful location, breath-taking view!Admiration for the absolute professionalism in the precise organization of our trip from the booking through room selection till execution of the airport transfers helping with luggages even in the early dawn hours, as well as for the very friendly and informative service from the reception desk manager Chryssa and her colleagues. Protection against mosquitos on windless nights preferable.László and Ágnes, from Budapest
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a lovely hotel. Such great views. So nice staff. Such lovely sunsets. Great pool. Terrific value for money. No better place to stay in Santorini. We'll definitely be back. Eating places nearby. Short bus ride to Oia. Walking distance to Firostefani and Fira. Free WiFi. But breakfast is ordinary. Suggest eating out
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I apologize in advance; this review is long overdue. I rented 8 of the 9 rooms at beautiful Prekas Apartments this past May when my daughter celebrated her nuptials. We live in Texas and the groom was from Australia. We had guests and family converging on the beautiful village of Imerovigili from all corners of the globe. First off, let me say this it is not an easy task to try and book an entire hotel 6 months before your arrival date. After many failed attempts to contact other properties, I struck gold when I reached out to Nektarios, the owner of Prekas apartments. Mr. Prekas communicated with me very promptly via email and I was able to quickly book all rooms. Of course when we got very close to arrival, many of our guests needed to make adjustments to their reservations. It was quite complex but Mr. Prekas was both patient and efficient in accommodating all the changes. The property itself is quite spectacular and as I anticipated, it became the main meeting spot for our wedding party of 40. We shared many meals and happy times during the week on the balcony of over the office. We even performed the wedding rehearsal on the roof of one of the rooms! I have to confess that we were a bit loud and made quite a mess on a few occasions. Thomas, who not only carried all our bags down the 200 or so steps from the parking area, also cleaned up after us with nothing but a nod and a kind word. Lastly, I have to personally thank Chryssa, she is not only one of the nicest most genuine people I have ever met, but she was an integral part of making our week at Prekas a dream. Chryssa helped us rent scooters and 4 wheelers, helped with transportation and ordering food in from the best spots! Each room at Prekas is a unique gem and matched the exact needs of all of our quests. The location is just perfect. It is a way from the bustle and crowds of Thira, but just a short walk or 4 wheeler ride away to the action. We had many young people in our group and they partied the nights away in Thira and always came back to the rest and relaxation of the Prekas Apartments. If I could give it 10 stars I would. Cheers to a great job! We will be back....without the other 38 people!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed a week at Prekas Apartments,and I've literally had the best holiday in my life here where everything surpassed all my expectations!Nektarios the owner,and the staff Chryssa,Anna and Petros were all so helpful and attentive to my every needs.The sunsets from Imerovigli is the best on the island as it occupies the highest ground,and is situated between the towns of Oia and Fira.The one thing to note though on the caldera side of Santorini is that the paths lining the cliffs are thick cobblestone paths;so bring some hiking shoes,because if you try to undertake the walks here with moccasins or flip-flops,you'll feel the thick cobblestones right through the soles.Prekas Apartments is a good location in that one can visit nearby Oia on one side,or Fira on the other side (also Amoudi Bay ia memerising ).The walk from Imerovigli where Prekas apartments are located to Fira takes about 20 minutes;and it so worth doing this walk(both day and during night time) due to the endless photo opportunities that present themselves...breathtaking views.The hike from Imerovigli to Oia takes between 2 to 3 hours on loose dirt/rocky paths up steep inclines and hills.Though i did it in 1 hour and 50 minutes being very fit.If you'll miss your gym routines whilst holidaying here,going on this hike in the hot sun is a perfect alternative;and the challenge of the walk is thoroughly satisfying .Whilst in Oia,don't miss going to the world famous Atlantis Book Shop (why the name Atlantis you say?that's because Plato's myth of Atlantis is based on the Minoan Civilization right here in Santorini.If you want achingly beautiful views,serenity,relaxation and brilliant service,you can't go past Prekas Apartments.A big thank you to Nektarios,Chryssa,Anna and Petros,i will be making this hotel the hotel that i will stay each time i come back to Santorini! Also,as a poet,writer and artist for varying magazines,this spot has fueled my creativity,so if you're a Bohemian,this is the island for you.Regards, Nikos
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Prekas for four nights as a treat and finishing up our 5 week holiday in Greece. Wow what a way to finish. I was not sure what to expect as there are views and there are views. Prekas apartments has complete, unobstructed views of the Caldera, Every Room! it is in a privileged location where there are no hotels under, no power lines and every balcony has a view. This hotel is well thought out, keeping in mind aesthetics, for instance every apartment has their own drying rack for towels tucked away in the corner out of sight so you don't see cloths being dried on people's balconies. This makes for a much prettier backdrop when relaxing by the pool, or sipping a local wine watching the sun set. Breakfast was amazing, and i would recommend eating at the hotel, as there are not many places in the immediate location (Imorevigli) When we wanted breakfast we would call reception and they would prepare and deliver it on our balcony. Completely relaxed and delicious, with plenty of variety. Rooms were cleaned daily as well as any food/ mess we may have left our on our balcony. What i would have to say was the stand out was the service, both reception and the porter were amazing. The porter carried two large suitcases and one overnight bag all by him self up and down the steep narrow stairs to our room with no effort at all, the guy is amazing. He certainly went above and beyond what was expected from him. Anything we asked the reception was no trouble at all, from organising taxis/transfers, to organising a load of washing. The pool was at the lowest level of the hotel with views of the Caldera. The pool itself was large enough, however there is only room for 6 lounge chairs and can get full quickly. This was not a problem for us as we explored the island and did not spend that much time at the pool, however if you plan to just sit at the pool all day, you may have problems.All in all this was an amazing experience in Santorini.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three delightful nights here. Our little balcony had the best view on the island, and it was very quiet. Chryssa and the staff were helpful and friendly. I'd recommend reserving a van through her to meet you at the port or airport because the apartment is not easy to find. And you will probably be glad of help with your bag, even if it's a carry-on, on the cobblestone path. Definitely hope to stay there again.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at Prekas Apartments for two seasons in a row and I will always stay here whenever I visit Santorini! The Staff and ownership are simply amazing and unmatched. We arrived at nearly 7am and we're still able to check in early. I contacted them before my arrival and just can I tell you customer service!!! Amazing!I really enjoy the location and the views are the best on the island, seriously!! It is so quiet and quaint. The pool is like having a private resort. The walk to Fira town is about 15 to 20 minutes and gives you such an amazing view of the island there and back! If you want a high quality stay with not paying a arm and a leg for the same experience stay at Prekas Apartments!!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked Prekas thanks to all the TA reviews and they matched the service, view and the overall feel perfectly. I had booked a cab to pick us from the airport through Prekas which was very handy. The pool was away from the street which was much better than the other pools we saw on the street. The main bus stop & the supermarket shops are not too far away. Just a 5-10 minutes walk away. Our room was very spacious (with a well maintained kitchenette), had a spectacular Caldera & Pool view, was quite close to the pool and was maintained perfectly.The lady who serviced the rooms and the guy who moved our luggage were both very courteous and always had a smile! The sunset view from our room was way too awesome and for us much better than the crowded & over-rated Oia sunset view. We had a spacious balcony with a table & 2 chairs; we enjoyed our breakfast and evening coffee everyday there! I am really happy I made the decision to stay at Prekas for our 4 days in Santorini. We had a peaceful. comfortable and brilliant stay. Highly recommended. GO FOR IT!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose Prekas for our honeymoon stay in Santorini in September. For our room we choose the Captain's Suite. While a little more pricey this recently renovated room is lovely and well worth it. It also includes an in unit jacuzzi and a private balcony at the highest level with a gorgeous view of the island (see pic). The views from Prekas were fantastic. The receptionist/day-to-day manager Chryssa was great providing us with a basic overview of the island on our first day with maps and suggestions. She also assisted us in booking a catamaran trip, which was one of the highlights of our stay. Breakfast was also provided quickly to the room or to the private balcony upon request and room service was excellent. While a little chilly (it was September) the pool was also great and was actually pretty refreshing after laying out in the sun for a while. Prekas is a little far (~30-45 mins) from Fira and a good hike from Oia but we preferred the quiet and the great views in Imerovigli and there are plenty of restaurants and a market close by. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would definitely choose Prekas again!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to Prekas in June and absolutely loved it. The most stunning view from a balcony virtually anywhere in the world. The rooms were basic but who wants to stay in your room?! And value for money was brilliant compared to other places next door! The staff were friendly - nothing was too much bother. If you want to see the sunset in Santorini from your balcony with a glass in your hand for a sensible amount of money then look no further. Very pleased with our stay.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can i say! totally brilliant.We booked with Prekas for our honeymoon and immediately Mr Prekas e mailed us and offered to collect our luggage from our respective hotels ( we stayed apart the night before) so that it was waiting for us when we arrived. He also arranged to collect us from our reception at the end of the evening. No charge for any of this so thankyou Mr Prekas. When we arrived he personally escorted us from the vehicle down to the apartments. You have two choices when going down to the apartments, one is to take the slightly rough steps (these are greek authority owned so no fault of Mr Prekas) these are quite steep but we took them anyway while he shone his torch for us. Alternatively you can take the longer route which is only a minute or so longer but less steep and in better condition. We booked the best room which was the captains suite and it was fantastic with its own private terrace at the top of the apartments. The view is simply amazing :) Our room was immaculate and the cave bathroom with Jacuzzi was lovely. The level of service was also impeccable, breakfast was huge and served every day Immediately upon ordering (within 5 minutes as they make it fresh) The maid was brilliant and kept everything super clean each day. To give an example one day I was sitting out on the terrace and the sun was baking down on the patio and i saw a small patch of flaking paint. This didnt concern me as it was hardly anything at all. I went inside and when i came back out two guys were there scraping the patio and then they repainted the entire patio which baked dry in ten minutes in the hot sun and it looked perfect again. At other hotels they would of left it as a winter job. I also saw the man coming round and re painting all the plant pots white and any slight change of colour on the walls to keep it all perfect. Just quality of service and most appreciated. Chryssa on reception was fantastic also. One night we ordered a food delivery and Mr Prekas ordered it for me and because he did not like the fact they were charging too much for beers gave me some free of charge! We spent nine nights here and i could of spent months it was that good. Also the pool is unique and kind of hangs off the caldera and is the only one like it in Imerovigli.It was super quiet and relaxing and has amazing views also.Thankyou Mr Prekas or should i say Nektarios, we will defintiely be back more than once :)
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so glad we stayed at Prekas. It is an oasis of calm amidst the turist fan fair that Thira/Imeroglivi have become without compromising an excellent view of the caldera. Really, there's no need to go anywhere else for a beautiful sunset: every room has a gorgeous and obstructed view straight into the sunset. Definitely better in real life than in pictures. And the service is excellent too: discrete and attentive.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can I be back there right now please? This spot is seriously heavenly. The views, the views, oh the views. The views from the pool lounge were so good I was giggling with relish thinking how lucky I was. Our room was one of the smaller ones (standard double--there were only a couple left when we booked!) but it was comfortable and clean and the window opened up to the white stucco and royal blue VIEW! Someday I will go back and bring friends and family to this special place and stay at Prekas again. Chryssa at the front desk was especially helpful and kind, and would help us in calling to make us dinner reservations and all sorts of things. The location is great--you can walk into the small town of Imerovigli and there are a few restaurants walking distance, but we rented an ATV (recommend to see the island easily!) and cruised into Fira and Oia for dinner. It's nice going back to the quieter town though at night--so peaceful. STAY HERE!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed for 4 nights in a traditional apartment with a large balcony overlooking the amazing view. The staff were very helpful and friendly attentive to all your needs. the location was perfect and easy to get to Fira, plenty of resturants near by. the area was relaxing and quite, I would recommend this wonderful place to anyone.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for four nights in July. It was perfect, we were right by the pool and our balcony offered and incredible view of the sunset. The staff are all incredibly helpful and friendly, I would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Preka's for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. We stayed in the small studio, which has a bed slightly smaller than a double bed, but it was perfect for us. We were paying a fraction of the price for the prime piece of real estate the hotel is located on! The views are incredible from the balconies of the hotel as and the pool area, although small, was perfect to relax around after a busy day. Preka's is located in a quiet area in Imerovigli, which we much preferred to the hustle and bustle of Oia & Fira. I've read a few reviews of complaints regarding privacy of the hotel, however wherever you stay in Santorini, you are bound to have tourists walking around your hotel and past your balcony as they are all pretty much built on top and around each other on the edge of the cliff! It is inevitable there will be people around your hotel! However, at Preka's in Imerovigli, it is so quiet compared to the Oia & Fira, there barely is anyone walking along the footpath, even in the peak holiday season of July! So disregard the negative reviews and book here if you're looking for great value, great views of the Caldera and a quiet relaxing holiday.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: me and my friend visited santorini last june 2015. stayed here in prekas and our vacation was absolutely perfect. the room they gave us has a balcony where we can eat our breakfast overlooking the caldera,definitely the best place to stay.i will highly recommend this place, and thay have the best hotel receptionist named chryssa. she is accomodating,helpful and lovely.. also the cleaners there.staying here is totally perfect for us.the place is quite and relaxing.worth the money and your time.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect from when we arrived until we departed. The location in our opinion is the best along the stretch of coast, it is slightly away from Fira but easy to get to and easy to visit the other towns by foot, quad bike or car. Plenty of parking, we would recommend hiring some transport, such as a quad bike (only 30 euro/day) and driving around the coast and to the wineries. Absolutely amazing for sunset - completely unobstructed view. Staff were incredibly accommodating, nothing was too much trouble and very friendly. Even provided an assistant at 5am to help move or bags to the transport. The room was spotless and serviced every day and has simple facilities for making some food or drinks if you wish - e.g. we put together a platter of food for lunch and mixed some drinks to enjoy on the balcony with the beautiful view. Made our trip to Santorini very special.Only criticism, and it was absolutely no issue for us, is that the inner decor is a tiny bit dated in appearance. Some people may not like this if they are more familiar with decor in upmarket hotels, or looking for a luxury experience (eg. on a honeymoon/wedding) Nevertheless, while dated in appearance it is all in excellent condition and extremely clean. The outside appearance of the buildings and the balconies and pool area is immaculate and very well presented.You will not regret booking this accommodation if you are looking for outstanding value!
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel. Though it was definitely a budget option in expensive Santorini it never felt like one. The service was exceptional, especially Chryssa in reception. The view from our room was spectacular and we just loved the pool. Most of the time it seemed like our own private pool since our terrace sat directly over it. We went into Oia for sunset one night but preferred the private sunset view from our terrace every other night. Imerovigli is a great base for exploring all of Santorini though I'd definitely recommend renting a quad bike to get out and explore the island on your own schedule versus taking the local buses (even though the buses are a fine option for getting around). We were there on our honeymoon and we will definitely be back.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two nights in Prekas Appartments in the end of May. Location, location, location! Perfectly situated on the Caldera, and four times cheaper than most of the neighboring accommodation. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms, though a little outdated and old fashioned. Beware not to book room number one unless you are traveling solo or very small, and don't mind not having a view from the room.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are very appreciate about the service of the hotel.It has a perfect seaview and we can see the sunset everyday.The room is clean and the kitchen has many Cooking utensils.Every time I ask the about the sightseeing information, the staff can give me so much useful advice.
hotelName:
28    Prekas Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments in November thinking that Santorini must be the place where we will spend our honeymoon. Much before the wedding we were already thinking about this trip as being a perfect source of relaxation, silence and rest. After we got married in the end of June, it came to the time to meet our expectation. I will never forget the times when we were traveling in Santorini with our rented car and my husband was continually repeating: Villa Maria was the perfect choice. Akrotiri is definitely the best option where to stay as we needed silence and time for ourselves. Located in the right place, Villa Maria amazed us with an incredible kind host, rich breakfast, breathtaking view, clean room and a swimming pool that you see only in movies.In general, the photos from the website do not show the reality as they are taken only to sell. But it was our first time when Villa Maria showed us the contrary! All the photos we were delighted with in the website much before to arrive there, are exactly as the reality!!!!!!!! I will always be in loved with Santorini! And not because I have spent my honeymoon there. But because Villa Maria, made my honeymoon memorable. Thank you, Maria!Elena & Diogo
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view from the pool and the breakfast area is unbelievable, right across the bay to Thera and Oia.The hotel is wonderfully quiet, both because it's down its own short road all on its own and because it's in a peaceful part of the island.The hospitality is fabulous, very warm, helpful and welcoming. Never a problem to help out with taxis, car hire or any other questions.Rooms are a reasonable size, fairly basic with a very comfortable bed. Other space space to use like the pool and breakfast room with its outdoor area make up for any lack of space in the room.A few restaurants and shop are 15 minutes' walk away making it a great place to stay.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view from our room was undeniably amazing, however we felt as though the hotel was trading off the view and trying to run things on the cheap. Think the lidl loo roll and naff breakfast gave me that impression. The hotel most definitely needs some TLC. Above the bed, there was a space with loose electrical wires hanging and I can only presume that a strip light should have been there and not been replaced with a new light.Also the balcony was shabby and hadn't been painted for a long time and is rather different from the pics on the website. The breakfast was mediocre at best, cheap muesli with cornflakes added and hardly any fruit in it. Also leftover foods were put out from the day before if not eaten. For instance there some sort of lattice flan that was put out and a day later it was put out again and cut into smaller pieces to eke it out, rather disappointing and a bit on the stale side. We paid around £120 per night not the most expensive on the island but still not to be sniffed at and for this price I would expect a higher standard.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A quiet, beautiful location away from the buzz of Thira and Oia. We had room 2 which had a large balcony and met our needs. Cleaners came in daily and the room was always spotless. We ate breakfast outside and the view was spectacular and so peaceful. Breakfast was good, with fresh fruit, bread and pastries daily, they also catered for my gluten free needs which I was extremely grateful for. I would highly recommend.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best place on the whole island - it feels completely removed from the hustle and bustle of Fira and Oia. Fantastic view, gorgeous room or rather her a whole little house, lovely, warm, inviting Maria, great breakfast, worthy of a 4-star hotel, served in the lovliest setting. Swimming pool to die for. Peace and quiet. Thank you so much! We had a wonderful time. Tip: it's good to rent a car for the entire stay - it's very affordable and really, really helpful to get around Santorini.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a family apartment and the area was spacious, clean with a nice bathroom. Kitchen is simple with a portable hot plate. The girls who run the place are fantastic, very attentive, polite and helpful and they assisted us on many occasions. Must say the mattresses were very average and far too firm, but otherwise the rooms were lovely. Whilst Akrotiri is a while away from Fira and Oia, this is reflected in the price per night and in my view the apartments were very good value for money. The girls will happily arrange any transport you need, including paid transfers to and from the port/airport and/or explain the various bus routes to you. The breakfast was very good and a great way to start the day.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a short walk from Akrotiki, these apartments feel totally secluded from the bustle of Oia and Fira. The apartment location may not be for everyone but we loved it.The pool is stunning, set in the cliffs with beautiful views over the sea. Breakfast was excellent - great quality and lots of choice. Apartment was clean and tranquil - good, working AC!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am traveling solo in Greece and the staff here at Villa Maria welcomed me like I was part of their family. The place is absolutely beautiful! I could lay in bed and view the caldera thru my window. The breakfast buffet was out of this world! It's hard to decide what to eat because there are do many good choices. I really appreciate the effort the staff put into helping me retrieve my lost luggage! They went above and beyond to help me when I was in need. I was very blessed to stay in such a lovely place with such loving staff!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is amazing! It's so peaceful and calm, away from the busy towns which was perfect for us. We had a standard double room and it was gorgeous - with an astounding view and a lovely terrace which we enjoyed in the evenings whilst enjoying a glass of the complimentary bottle of wine.The staff were attentive and helpful and nothing was a problem. They even accommodated some difficult dietary requirements at breakfast for us (including mum picking berries from the garden for us!) and the breakfast was fabulous - with the astounding view as well! The pool setting is breathtaking and wasn't overly busy eventhough it's shared with another set of apartments. Note we would recommend you get your own transport though - we hired a scooter which was arranged by the hotel. Half hour to Oia (worth the visit!) & 15mins to Fira.We would highly recommend this hotel and we can't wait to return! Thank you for a fabulous and memorable end to our stay in Greece.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been dreaming about this place since we visited there two years ago. It is a stunning location with wonderful views from the balcony over the caldera towards Fira, The staff were extremely attentive and helpful. We were greeted in our room by chilled white wine on arrival, which doesn't hurt.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying here-location is great, amazing views, lovely clean rooms and very spacious. We hired a car for the week which has helped to get around. The place is owned by really lovely people-all in all a brilliant place to stay,would very highly recommend!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hospitality in a quiet and beautiful place, everything was perfect. The room was clean. we loved the place and the breakfast was great! swimming pool with great view also. we will visit villa maria again for sure!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the best accommodation during our week Santorini. We stayed 5-7 august. The three ladies took care of us so well. Assisted with car rental, restaurant bookings, hike routes, tips for Athens. We felt at home. Everything was done with care. Very nice rooms, delicious breakfast prepared with love by Vanissa. Perfect tips. Akrotiri is a bit more far away from all entertainment but definitely worth a visit because of this family and Vanissa. Greetings from room Nr.5 :-)
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have spent 7 days in Santorini at Hotel Villa Maria Rooms.The hotel is perfect: nice and clean rooms, charming and helpful staff that guarantee a nice stance.Maria and Dionisia have been excellent proffesionals and Vassia and Giulia have been very helpful and charming.We not only recomend this hotel, that is very good placed, but hope to enjoy it again.Thank you Maria, Dionisia, Vassia and Giulia, for doing our holidays even better.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every year me and my mother visit Santorini and I decided to make a change in our accomodation and for the first time we stay in Akrotiri at Villa Maria and it was the best change with the best view and friendly staffThanks
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had heard that Santorini was busy, but we were still surprised to find the main towns of Fira and Oia as crowded as they were in early June. This made our stay at Villa Maria a welcome respite from the congestion of the other towns on the Caldera edge. The hotel is located the Caldera, but is south of the main towns and therefore quieter with much less busy roads. The view is indescribably beautiful; long-range sea views from the patio of the room and even longer range from the pool. The room is absolutely beautiful and spotlessly clean and pristine white with comfortable beds.The breakfast is generous and substantial and the young woman presiding over it is unfailingly friendly, smiley (and patient with our feeble attempts at Greek.) Maria was immensely helpful, friendly and welcoming beginning with our booking and continuing throughout our stay. She arranged our scooter rental for us so it was delivered to the hotel and was otherwise extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations.We loved staying in Akrotiri and would avoid the north of the island altogether on subsequent trips. A beautiful hotel!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a family of four with the family room. You'll need a car to reach these gorgeous, well cared for appartments (about 10 mins from the port). We had the caldera view, worth the extra with stunning views. Everything about the place was simple elegance with lovely, friendly staff and a delicious breakfast! Thank you all x
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Maria was an absolute joy to stay at and we would've extended our stay if we could. Maria and Dionisia were beautiful people and always so friendly. They helped with every question we had, both prior to the holiday over email and when we were there and wanting to find the best things to do. On check-in they talked us through the island on a map and marked loads of recommendations for restaurants, must-see places and sunset spots which set us up for the whole week. The room we had was bliss and we had plenty of space! So clean, neat and authentically Greek in style with a stunning view. The beds were made daily and it was lovely to come home to at the end of every day.The complex is secluded, quiet and safe and we'd rented a car so we found it very easy with the map the girls had given us, to find our way about the island. Despite the popular belief that Oia has the best sunset views on Santorini, we made sure we saw it from somewhere different every night of our holiday and by far the best was from the Akrotiri lighthouse at the very tip of the island. It's a really short drive away from the hotel and not to be missed. The hotel makes a great base to come back to for an active family or couple, or equally the pool with sun loungers and umbrellas is amazing if you want to stay close by! The views are incredible!! The pool took our breath away a bit with cold but we found that was common on the island and it's really refreshing after laying in the sun.We would definitely stay here again on a future visit to Santorini, note : the breakfast is sooo tasty and you couldn't ask for a better view to eat in front of! On check-out we had to leave very quickly and hadn't pre-warned the girls that we'd be missing the food. They bent over backwards to send us away with what we'd have missed and it was just a perfect example of how thoughtful and kind they are as hotel owners. See photos.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My parents and I have just returned from a week's stay at Villa Maria and we were very sad to leave! Beautiful views, pleasantly quiet location, and run by a sweet family that made us feel right at home. Our room was well equipped, with plenty of space for the three of us. The location was perfect and just what we needed for our little getaway.Upon arrival, we were given information and recommendations on where to eat/what to do during our stay. One of my worries was my vegan diet, but I was happily provided with soya milk and plenty of options.If you want a quiet, stress-free holiday then this is the place for you; I seriously cannot fault it. The girls go above and beyond to ensure you have an enjoyable stay, and that is definitely what my family and I had!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: a wonderful little family business, with the best service you can imagine, both over the phone wile planning your trip and also in person. the place looks even better then the pictures! and can be the most romantic getaway or -as we had it- a wonderful family vocation. our daughters still talk about it , 8 month after...
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the junior suite, which offers a wonderful caldera view. The room is rather small, but lovely decorated and very cozy. Villa Maria is a very quiet and truly relaxing place. The pool is also great with an incredible view. We had a rental car to explore the island and go to dinner. Breakfast is delicious and includes homemade pies (spanakopita and bougatsa me crema - the best we have ever had in Greece). The hosts and staff are very friendly and helpful. We particularly loved about this place that it was well designed and cozy but still felt authentically Greek. We would not stay anywhere else on Santorini!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This summer was for my and my girflriend the best summer ever just because this place exist. It is the best place for lovers out from the crowds. Great views, perfect breakfasts, and 100% services. Just go there a let this place to shock you :)
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a woderful vacation in this hotel / family room / caldera view. The hotel owner was very polite and friendly and we will never forget the way she helped us an the other customers. I liked very much the breakfast and I have nothing bad to say. Offcourse it was not a hotel like the newest hotels feg. in Imerovigli, but we really liked the place veryvery much :)
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A simply wonderful experience. The views are amazing. The hospitality was over the top A family owned business where we were welcomed after midnight after a long ferry ride by Maria, a tall bottle of water and a bottle of wonderful Santorini wine. The linens are pure white with Agean Blue accents. The breakfast is wonderfully simple and hit the spot. Take a trip down the trail to the private beach. It's worth the trip. Crystal clear refreshing waters. Wifi was excellent.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt the special attitude of Villa Maria owners and hosts for the first time right after booking a room there. Very helpful e-mail containing some information on the hotel, how to get there and the island overall was received within an hour or so after booking was made. All the questions asked further on were addressed promptly. Villa Maria is situated away from hustle and bustle of Thira and Oia not far from little town of Akrotiri in a place of truly amazing beauty right on caldera's brim. Bright white houses with deep blue shutters and doors naturally complements the landscape. Hotel's territory is not very big, but tenderly decorated and consists of a main house with reception, lobby and five small rooms, a number of villas, pool area and a parking.Pool is not big and two persons can hardly swim there simultaneously, but if people want just to relax in water it would be suitable for 4 or 5 persons. The water at the pool in the end of June was a bit cold, otherwise the place is excellent: located above the rest of the territory deck with amazing view. There are several umbrellas and sun loungers around it and we have never seen that all of them are occupied altogether. Reception area is also a very nice serene place where daily's breakfast (rather basic, but products of good quality) is also served. Guests may enjoy a book (there is a small book shelf with travel guides and some English literature there), ask for some water, tea or coffee when the lobby is opened (until 2 p.m. and after 5 p.m.) or relax at the hammock.The room we booked had no kitchen and was really small and all-white, but very, I would say enormously cozy! There is an A/C inside, but we never switched it on, since it was always comfortably cool there. Take into mind that there is no working desk at the room, the only table is located outside on a small terrace with two chairs and ashtray. The terraces of small rooms are not isolated from the rest territory. Bed is very good and bathroom with shower absolutely clean. The hotel provides guests with bath and pool towels that are changed every three days.Finally, a couple of words about Dionisia, a hotel owner and manager, who makes this magic come true. Upon arrival our room was not ready yet and we haven't got a rented car yet, and Dionisia took us to Akrotiri to have a lunch by her own car. She helped us with arranging wine tours and scuba-diving sessions, with printing out boarding passes and recommendations on best restaurants around. Nothing was a problem to her and we'd like to sincerely thank Dionisia once again for the wonderful stay at the island.Btw, try complement wine that will wait for you at the room, I bet you'd love it!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I fell in love with Villa Maria as soon as I saw it. It's simple, unpretentious and run by a family who don't try to be too chic or clever, and offer Greece as it used to be. Whitewashed, clean and spacious rooms, fantastic views of the sea and caldera, masses of flowers everywhere and a gorgeous pool overlooking it all. Oh, and fabulous breakfasts with warm home-cooked sweet and savoury pastries. Incidentally, I see that we had the family room that earned this place its only poor rating - and it was peaceful and idyllic! He must have been crazy, so please don't take any notice of his review. There really is nothing to dislike about it and in fact it offered a lot of privacy. And a special thank you to Dionisia who was so kind and helpful from the moment I booked via their website and had a bottle of Santorini wine waiting for us when we arrived on my husband's birthday. Thank you!Villa Maria is the sort of place where stresses melt away. Just lovely.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I spent 3 nights at Villa Maria rooms and Apartments in September 2014. This hotel is charming with a breathtaking view of the Caldera, a pretty garden and a cute little church. The rooms are quaint, comfortable and very clean. The owner is the sweetest person you can find, she could not do enough to please us. The hotel is located in Akrotiri, better to rent a car or a quad to go around Santorini Island. We were sad to leave this beautiful place.Montreal, Québec, Canada
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent one week at Villa Maria on Santorini Island and loved every minute of it. Maria the owner was the perfect manager, attentive, helpful and knowledgeable of the local area including where to eat, beaches and local beauty spots. We stayed in the junior Suite with Caldera View. It was amazing, rivaling any hotel room in upmarket Oia. The room was immaculate, typical Cyclades Island style in the colours of blue and white with the most beautiful large private balcony for relaxing, watching the cruise ships come and go and having your own little private party under the stars! There's also a great pool with spectacular views for those lazy days as well. We thoroughly recommend this place and will definitely return if we come back to Santorini! Thank you Maria.Allan and Iuri September 26th 2014
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do I start! I stayed here for 10 days in July with my boyfriend, it was our first holiday together so we wanted it to be special. I got a bit worried after reading scary reviews about other places to stay on santorini that when you arrived, they had no record of your booking and you ended up staying at the grotty sister hotel! However, this was not the case with villa maria. It was really easy to find after we hired a car at the airport and drove around the island for a bit. The hotel is situated on a cliff and after driving down a windy drive we found it! It was the most beautiful place I've ever seen and I've done my fair bit of travelling. The reception is bright and clean and I loved the stark white and blue colour scheme. Maria (the owner) recommended a few local places to eat after we had settled in. The room was beautiful and spotless, don't think the pictures that you see on the website are too good to be true... It's even better in real life!! You will need to hire a car or a quad bike to get around the island but it's easy enough to navigate around and Oia (the most picturesque part of the island) is only about 30 minutes away and you can hire a quad from a local shop about 5 minutes walk into Akrotiri. This is a beautiful place to stay and is a really quiet area to come back to after a day at the beach or being a tourist! Don't hesitate to book... You won't be disappointed!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite honestly Villa Maria surprised us enormously. The nightly rates are very reasonable and the entire place is immaculate. The service from Dionisia is 10/10 and there is a very warm sense of 'feeling at home' as soon as you arrive. For a base to explore the South of the island, Villa Maria is perfect. Renting a car/ATV is advisable and you can be sure to look forward to returning after your night out. The pool area is really special with awesome views. The showers are hot and luxurious. The beds extremely comfortable. The balcony just right. We will certainly be recommending the Villas to everyone and with the addition of breakfast/food as of next year, this place will become even more special. Thank you so much for your hospitality, it was a truly memorable 3 nights.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ... Stunning ! Junior suite (room 1) had the most amazing view. Rooms were very modern , had a lovely bathroom and a fantastic balcony Very minimal rooms with one slight negative - no storage only 1 hanging rail... No drawers or cupboard space so unfortunately you will have to live out of a suitcase ! Swimming pool was a lovely size for the caldera.. Dionisia - the granddaughter who managed the hotel , fantastic lady and very helpful. The rooms were kept spotlessly clean. Would definitely return. Thank you Villa Maria.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at the wonderful Villa Maria whilst holidaying through the Greek Islands.As a travel agent I can comfortably say that this is one of the best properties that I have stayed at. The hospitality of the staff at this boutique resort is unbeatable, during one night where me and my fellow guests decided to stay the wonderful host Dionisia offered up a bottle of her own wine, the following night she even joined us for some Greek wine. Experiences and hospitality like this can't be bought.Just some general infromation for prospective guests this property is located on the south of the island further away from the main town however upon check in just ask Dionisia to assist you with car hire (it will be brought to the hotel for you all at a reasonable price)The pool has stunning Caldera views and I assure you won't be disappointed staying here.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room has a rustic charm. It was very clean and perfect for our needs. We had a family room with a kitchenette. Dionisia and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They even provided fresh eggs from their hens for our breakfast! If you're looking for a peaceful location with amazing views then choose villa maria!
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous place to spend the second half of our week on Thira. Villa Maria is a very special place. We had a full on Caldera view from our room and balcony. Everything was crisp, fresh white and cleaned everyday. Hot plate, fridge and sink in kitchen area, table and chairs in the kitchen and on the balcony. We travelled with our 13yr old and the room had plenty of room for the twin beds for her too. Dionisia and her team made us so welcome. The pool view is wonderful too. Lovely walk into the village of Akrotiri. We walked to the archaelogical site and down to Caldera beach too. Great taverna Remezzo here. Take a torch for night returns! We and been walking everywhere in Fira etc so were used to the steps and slopes by the time we got here! Maria Taverna in village good too.
hotelName:
29    Villa Maria Rooms & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my daughter (17) have just had 12 days at the Villa Maria, lovely spot on cliff top, with fabulous views from pool. Apartment very clean, welcoming family, would highly recommend Akrotiri quiet, which is what we wanted, getting around easy, so could visit noisier resorts when we wanted toMany thanks to Maria, her Aunt and grandma for making us so comfortable, and supplying eggs and sweet tomatoes for our breakfasts !We will be backLiz
